After ~10mins, the baffled representative determined: - Nothing was actually 'shipped' on 1/29 (CD or download); - It didn't make sense to have a download product to be in Backorder (he laughed, <insert your own electron joke here>); - I still need to wait for the credit card to be charged first, then refunded 2-4 weeks later. I gave up at that point. Will try HR Block.

title: TurboTax Deluxe 2014 -- the most successful and cost effective advertising campaign ever for H&R Block's tax software!
content: Like many others, I've been using TurboTax for years and the Deluxe product has always contained all the functionality I needed. But not this year. No longer does the Deluxe product support schedules C-F. Not so "Deluxe" if you ask me. After using TurboTax for more than 20 years, I'll be using H&R Block this year and I've already purchased my copy. I'm sure glad I read the reviews on Amazon before making my purchase. What really gets me is not that I'd have to pay more for the TurboTax product suitable for my needs. I understand inflation and the need to raise prices. No, I'm offended by the way that TurboTax crippled the product I've always used and hid this fact deep in the product details. Buy the product you've always purchased and Surprise! you'll need to spend more $$ to upgrade to the product you really need. After the initial spend, many customers will decide it's easier to pay more than to start over with another product, and I suspect that Intuit was counting on this technique which amounts to "dirty pool". The company's "defense" for this marketing decision is riddled with weasel words and so is the CEO's so-called apology. Didn't your mother teach you that when you apologize you need to *mean it*, too? Now they're insulting those who purchased the Deluxe product and paid to upgrade, by offering a $25 refund after filling out a bunch of paperwork. Really? You couldn't just give a free upgrade via download to your loyal customers? We've been loyal to you, why not be loyal to us? Enough already. I won't be considering TurboTax again. TurboTax Deluxe 2014 -- the most successful and cost effective advertising campaign ever for H&R Block's tax software!

title: this is what customer loyalty means to intuit
content: Wow, intuit is taking some plays out of comcast's book this year!! If you like paying twice as much for the same software as you have for past years, you'll love this! Since this is what customer loyalty means to intuit, they are done seeing any of my money.

title: I am sad that this product decided to push me away this ...
content: Since I have only used turbotax to file my returns for as long as I can remember, I am sad that this product decided to push me away this year. Fortunately I have found another option that is cheaper and provides the features I need so I can file my taxes. I found H & R Block deluxe, it does import last years turbotax return, so this was an easy transition. The H & R Block interface is fine and seems to be asking the same questions Turbotax always did. I'm not sure why I didn't shop alternatives sooner, but thank you Turbotax for getting me off my lazy behind - you saved me money again this year!

title: Removing Schedule D, which is required for anyone with ...
content: Removing Schedule D, which is required for anyone with capital gains - either stocks & bonds, or real property - is unacceptable! Schedule D is a BASIC form that I would think most middle-income and up filers need. Lastly, Schedule E is required for many ETFs, ETNs or LLPs that are held in many equity accounts. Both are critical. I think their statement that only 2-4% of users at Deluxe level need Shed D's and E's is disingenuous! The word 'DELUXE' should be removed from the product description!

title: Products should improve, not degrade, year over year. My opinion is described here and with my wallet.
content: After many years of using Turbo tax I have switched to another tax software company. Products should improve, not degrade, year over year. If consistency was the driver for the change in function, Bob M. should have brought the non-desktop versions up to the functionality of the desktop version and not degrade the desktop version. All that I can see, everywhere I look, is that the price increase was used for blitz style advertising telling me turbo tax is number one. My opinion is described here and with my wallet.

title: What a joke they want $35 to fill out a ...
content: What a joke they want $35 to fill out a simple form related to my HSA. I understand the product doesn't support extra schedules for business owners and other complex issues but I'm just a working slob trying to file my taxes. All the negative media coverage is right. Stay away.

title: stay away
content: Absolutely terrible experience using this software. First time user, I normally read reviews on products before purchasing, I guess I should have listened to the 2000+ people who gave 1 star before me. Terrible layout, did not feel like deductions were well organized and seemed to be lacking many features from previous versions. Also, I was hit with over $50 in fees when trying to file my taxes. After over an hour of trying to find a resolution I gave up. Could not get in touch with turbo tax customer service. Ended up not filing, immediately uninstalled software and will be going with a more reputable tax software. Would never recommend this product to anyone.

title: Customer since 2002, now looking for new tax software
content: You know I really used to like TurboTax and Intuit's other products. I thought they were high quality, professional, and trustworthy. I mean after all, I'm using their products for my money management and taxes, and if they are trustworthy, then I just don't feel comfortable using them. I know businesses need to make a profit, and I'm sure Intuit is no exception, but they also need to provide an honest deal to the customer. I feel I've have been betrayed. What I experienced was low level bait and switch. Buy this product to do your taxes only to find out there are hidden fees to complete the process you already started. Well you got me this time.. I hope you enjoy my hard earned money, and it pays for your bonuses, but next year I'll go somewhere else. I'm sorry, I lost all trust for all of Intuit's products. I plan on buying a new computer this year, and will not upgrade my Quicken software either. 1 star, because it did the job and you and your software engineers earned that and no more than 1 star because your business team lost my trust.

title: Bad "Form", Intuit
content: Imagine my surprise when I received an email stating that Turbo Tax Deluxe 2014 is not providing several forms, such as, schedule C and D. Thankfully, I did not open the box and will return it immediately. My investment for Schedule D does not justify paying $30 more. Where did it say on the cover of the box that the deluxe version would no longer contain these schedules? I have been a loyal user for 25+ years. The $25 coupon for the upgrade that Intuit is giving out will not buy back my loyalty.

title: TurboTax deliberately dumbed down this software
content: TurboTax deliberately dumbed down this software, and if you have ANY rental income, the program makes you purchase the Premier version of the product or it will not complete your taxes. This is very bad customer service.

title: Apology Not Accepted. UPDATE - FREE UPGRADE
content: *** UPDATE 1-28-2015 *** For those who would like to allow Intuit to make it right for this year, I found success with the following: 1 - Call their customer service number at 800-445-1875 (8 AM to 8 PM EST) 2 - Do NOT opt to be called back. Stay on the line. When I chose to be called back, the call was returned by an affiliated CPA who could do nothing for me other than the $25 rebate. 3 - Reference the Forbes article by Janet Novack wherein TurboTax VP Bob Meighan "assured Forbes that every agent at that number has 'discretion to do what's necessary' to keep a customer - meaning, he said, they will give customers a free upgrade if they demand it". 4 - You will need to have TurboTax Deluxe for 2014 installed as they need the serial number and will walk you though the upgrade while you have the program open, and your tax return started. 5 - I had already installed TT Deluxe for last year, before learning about the killing of features, but had it boxed and in the car to take back to the store where purchased. The above worked and I received a free upgrade to the version which I needed to continue my taxes. We will see what Intuit does going forward, but it provides an option for today, for those who feel inclined to give them a chance to make good. Good luck! -- Original Review -- Dear Mr. Goodarzi, Like millions of others, I received your email on 1/23/2015. Because I had not started my taxes, I was unaware of Intuit's deceptions until I read the email. I suspect there are many who have yet to learn of your serendipitous price gouge. I have had a few days to think about it, and I am angrier now than when I read the email. That is because the explanations are so hollow. 1 - No one is confused by portions of the software which they do not use. Your interview process guides them to only the parts which they need - correct? 2 - For nearly 25 years, without fail, I have purchased TurboTax Deluxe. Yes, the price has gone up, however I understand inflation. 3 - In that the capabilities of Deluxe have been reduced, shouldn't there have been a price REDUCTION? 4 - You can spin it any way you want, but the heart of the matter is you INTENTIONALLY REMOVED ESSENTIAL FORMS from Deluxe, FORCING ME TO PURCHASE A SIGNIFICANTLY MORE COSTLY PRODUCT! 5 - If you were serious about the $25 rebate mentioned in the email, why not just allow me to order the product which I now need, and credit the $25? If I have to file an extension (the case for the past 3 years), I cannot claim this rebate. It is a rebate designed for breakage - hoping that many people will forget or not quality. 6 - Even if I do manage to meet the terms and receive the rebate, next year I will be paying close to $100 for the Turbo Tax software which I need, not the $60 from last year (both plus your add-ons). Unfortunately, your apology is nothing but politics. MY FATHER TAUGHT ME THAT I HAVE A POWERFUL VOICE IN THE WAY I SPEND MY MONEY. No more of it will be coming to Intuit. Even if the other options are more costly, I am casting my vote by returning my Turbo Tax software, and accepting H&R Block's free offer to the disenfranchised Turbo Tax users. That is how you will know that I am truly angered by your deceptions and hollow spin of an explanation.

title: Rip-Off and Be Careful with Personal Info (SSN)
content: I've been using TT Deluxe for a lot of years. As many here, I have investments, take deductions and run a small Sch. C business. Suddenly I have to upgrade to Personal & Small Business at double the cost! This might have been my last purchase of TT! And for the rebate I have to put my SSN on a website and give that to you . . . No Thanks!! My personal security is worth more than $25, which is why I still file paper forms. I'll be checking out HR Block's offering or TaxAct instead.

title: I'm done with buying TurboTax after many many years. ...
content: I'm done with buying TurboTax after many many years. Their elimination of capabilities in their Basic product, and their increased cost, sealed the deal. I now use H&R Block software, which by the way, imported all my previous TurboTax data.

title: TurboTax Deluxe 2014 trashed by greed, Do not buy!
content: I started using TurboTax when it first came out and it was a DOS (Disk Operating System) program. I was pleased by it's forms being like my doing IRS tax forms and as such was an easy transition. Later it became a Windows program and went to the Interviewer Q and A format. I started using Quicken so that I could click on the Import function screen of TurboTax which I loved because it made it easy to do my taxes each day through out the year. Last year someone decided to take that "Import" feature out of TurboTax program Interview screens and hide it in the Windows "File" tab. It took me two days of emails and phone calls to find how to get Intuit's two main programs to share data. WHAT A DUMB MOVE. Now I find that someone decided to remove A, C, D and E forms from TurboTax Deluxe so that they make all of their loyal customers buy the next higher priced version of TurboTax. EVEN DUMBER MOVE. I am leaving TurboTax this year and going to H & R Block programs as they seem to want me more than Intuit does. So long Intuit you were the best for most of my life but you have lost me due to your greed.

title: There's More Than Just Missing Features
content: I cannot recommend TurboTax any more. This year for 2014 returns, there were inexcusable issues that I had to deal with. First, TurboTax Deluxe no longer provides schedule Dâs required for capital gains from mutual funds. So this required updating to TurboTax Premier. But . . . . Second, after upgrading to TurboTax Premier, TurboTax Premir would not download the California State software. It kept thinking it was already downloaded. Third, so I called customer service. After waiting 15 minutes I was finally connected. The person helping me kept putting me on hold while she âresearchedâ the problem. She would suggest using another browser, etc. After too much time, I asked to be elevated to someone that could help. This could not be done she insisted. I asked for a supervisor. She claimed there was none. Finally the call disconnected. One and a half hours. Fourth, I found the solution after hunting around on the internet. Seems that TurboTax forgets where some files are located and becomes senseless. This is known to Intuit but why haven't they fixed it or notified users or their customer service?

title: Can't Do My Taxes with This Product
content: The product doesn't allow me to do my taxes. I've felt for several years that Intuit has morphed from a company that makes money by serving its customers' needs, into a company that makes money by milking its customers for as much as it can get. Why else do they force you to upgrade Quicken every 3 years? Now, they're trying to force customers to upgrade Turbo Tax. If they lose Turbo Tax and Quicken customers, it's their own fault.

title: Screwed their longtime customers just to make an extra buck. They just lost this one.
content: I purchased this as I do every year to file my taxes. Due to Turbo Tax's bait and switch tactic of trying to screw their customers this year, I have not yet filed because 1 form that I need to claim stock income is no longer available on this version. Turbo Tax has sent me multiple emails apologizing and attempting to explain their attempt to screw their long time customers. The most recent one promised a free upgrade to the version that carries all the forms previously available on Deluxe. The free upgrade was supposed to be available on 2/7. Just updated my software and tried the upload the 'free' upgrade. They are still trying to charge me $30 + tax. Tried calling, the wait time is 4 hours! Screw you Turbo Tax, I'm going to H & R block.

title: I Should Have Listened....
content: I should have listened to the reviews. I purchased this software to do my taxes as I have done for the last 11 years, not worrying about the schedules issue because I don't need them. I was disappointed because the price, even with the Prime member reduction was almost twice that of H and R Blocks software and THEN to top it off, they charged me $19.99 to file my state taxes. The corporate greed is astounding. Next year I will not be back to TurboTax.

title: I am a customer who would like to pay reasonable amount of money for a reasonable ...
content: I have been using TurboTax for the past 8 years, first as a student and now as a full-time employee. Over the past 8 years, I have seen my filing fee increase from ~$20 up to $60 just last year. I am a customer who would like to pay reasonable amount of money for a reasonable service. I decided to not use TurboTax to file my tax returns this year simply because I do not see any added benefit of using the software.

title: Too little, too late for me
content: So i read this morning (USA Today) Intuit is throwing 2013 customers who purchased their product a bone, an olive branch. Sorry Intuit, too little, too late. Keep your $25.00 . it's not the money issue only, it's the outright deception. If the buying public hadn't brought this to public attention, little would have materialized.TurboTax General Manager Sasan Goodarzi, it's too little, too late. The news release quoting you as saying "We messed up" should have read "We got caught". Deception has its pentalities. I'll have a small degree of satisfaction when your bottom line is impacted. Obviously your latest intent is to do damage control in order to ward off further public outcry. I wonder.....

title: fraud
content: Turbo tax is way to expensive and it really isn't a very good program. I have always used it so I kept using it but no more. After their complete FRAUD this year with not including the basic ability to enter a 1099 form I will never use this garbage again.

title: Turbo tax may think customers are too dumb to choose another way of doing taxes and will ...
content: price stays the same, and features just keep decreasing. I switched to TaxAct last year when turbo tax got rid of the online scheduleD forms, and will be sticking with TaxAct again this year. Turbo tax may think customers are too dumb to choose another way of doing taxes and will pay up year after year, but there are lots of great alternatives out there!

title: 26-year soon-to-be-former user
content: I call BS on "We did explore many options. The one we chose affected the fewest number of customers." -- no, either leaving it alone, as it was, or adding schedule C&D to the other variants would have affected less people (as in no one but Intuit itself). I have used TurboTax since (gasp) 1988, if I recall correctly. I still have my turbotax files online back to 1991 (23 years ago...) I even had to file Schedule K's and do income averaging back then - and it did it. How many people above the working poor and some twenty-somethings have *no* investments? If someone has investments, or sells *anything* for a gain/loss, they pretty much *have* to file Schedule D (or C) (and Deluxe won't work for that unless they made no trades, and got nothing but straight dividends). I'm sure the mass of people filing 1040-EZs don't need it, but they weren't the one who bought Deluxe in the past either. I've had to file Schedule D every year for 27 years with Turbotax (and once or twice C when I did a side contract for someone). I got blindsided by my wife purchasing it early before I had a chance to look at the Amazon page; we assumed Deluxe was Deluxe, not Deluxe-minus. Yes, I could call your customer service, and get upgraded, because I happened to see a news article and went here to read what was up. (I would have gotten *really* pissed if I'd done more than enter my basic family info and deep in preparing found "you can't do that, would you like to upgrade?") But why would I do that, when it's obvious that *next* year no such "solution" will be available, and it will be pay up $$$$ or pound sand? Might as well deal with the mental pain of switching products (after 26 years!) now and get it over with. I should have seen the writing on the wall when it became clear that my old Quicken would no longer function (at all) unless I bought an upgrade. I declined at the time, and simply let it expire in 2007. My wife forced me to give it a try again this year. It's amazing how unchanged it is -- which is not exactly a good thing 8 years later! And Mint, while pretty, can't handle all sorts of basic things Quicken can. The real travesty was that I'm sure they knew people would be blindsided, and could have changed the names (fully - no Basic/Deluxe/Premier, and make it much more prominent that people with *any* investments or *any* self-employed income need to re-evaluate which they get) - but they cynically decided they could weather the bad publicity. That was a dumb, dumb move. You had a lifelong devoted customer who told *everyone* to use Turbotax. No longer.

title: I've been using Turbo Tax Deluxe for over 10 years ...
content: I've been using Turbo Tax Deluxe for over 10 years. In the middle of doing my taxes for 2014, I found I would need to upgrade a level because I had sold some mutual fund shares and Intuit was no longer including the needed form in the Deluxe version. For an additional $32.69 I was upgraded and able to complete my taxes. After receiving many complaints, Intuit is going to offer the upgrade for free and is offering a $25 refund to those who had to pay. Last Friday I spent 40 minutes on hold trying to at least get the $25 refund -- finally hung up. Intuit, you just lost a long time customer.....

title: Warning--Deluxe is not what it has always been
content: Intuit has downgraded Deluxe without publicizing that in advance or on the packaging. They're offering a $25 credit for people to upgrade to Premier (which costs $30 more) or Home & Business (which costs $40 more)--though you only get the credit after you have fully filed your taxes with the more expensive version. For years, Deluxe has supported Schedules C and D (small businesses and investments), but this year one needs Premier for investments, Home & Business for any sole proprietorships. In contrast, H&R Block--whose Deluxe product is completely compatible with Intuit's former versions of Deluxe (i.e., handling Schedules C and D) and very comparable in how the software functions (I've used both TT and H&RB over the years)--understands the super faux pax Intuit has made and is offering a free copy of their Deluxe via their website to anyone who purchased TT Deluxe but needs the more expensive version now. Update 2.2.15 Intuit keeps getting worse and worse and worse. I won't repeat all the ridiculous choices the company has made out of greed, apparently, this year. Anyone can read the 2000+ negative reviews to find out about those. But I'd at least hope Intuit support was reasonable at this point after their fiasco. But no. Most recently, today I called to inquire about the free upgrade to Home & Business I am due per their VP. Some people have said they've received a long email from Intuit, and since I have not (though I am a decades-long TT customer), I called about it. Well, first off, it's no longer possible to even sit on hold a ridiculously long time. After a long series of prompts, the voice message says they'll call back, trying just once. After that one try, of course I have to re-go through the entire process. I've gone through it over 1/2 dozen times today and only once have talked to a live person. That rep assured me he'd walk me through downloading the proper H&B version (at no charge). Well, he failed. The serial number he claimed I should see on the screen he told me to go to was not there, period. I ended up having to leave for a while. He said no, he couldn't call me back later, I'd have to go through the entire process again. Meantime, he seems to have sent me a link supposedly to the H&B version. But it just takes me to a page that tells me I can download the software for free (of course that's ridiculous, as it means the user will be charged when they try to file--that's one of Intuit's many games). When I click the link for downloads, it shows me just Basic and Deluxe--not the H&B promised to me by the phone rep and by the follow up email. After Intuit's disasters this year, I have NO intention of filing my taxes with TT this year. I already have my free copy of H&R Block Deluxe and will file with that. But I want to compare the two to see if they do come out identical for my complex taxes or not. I also want to see if Intuit ever stops digging itself deeper and deeper into the ground this year. I'm not holding my breath about that. I sure wish Amazon had a ZERO stars option. Better yet, how about a negative 10 stars option? 4/1/2015 Update Well, TurboTax did restore the full functionality for this year and promises to return Deluxe to the product of old for next year. And as much as I hate to admit it, TT is a much smoother product than H&R Block for people with complex taxes, at least in my experience this year. I've used both H&R Block and TurboTax over the years. This year, I did my taxes using both products, to compare them. H&R Block failed miserably. TT has a much more robust, easy to use interview capability; H&RB's interview missed some significant Schedule C figures I need to enter still; and worst of all (along with some other less significant failures by H&RB Deluxe this year), H&RB refuses to download Fidelity data though I have absolutely confirmed the correct user name and password and that the Fidelity site is up and running just fine. Note Fidelity is an extremely large financial firm, so for H&RB to claim they download from the site then fail is a major failure. Also even if it did work, H&RB apparently requires one to download from the financial firms separately for 1099-Divs, 1099-Ints, 1099-Bs, 1099-Rs, etc. It puts the prompts for importing within the interviews of each of those forms' sections, not all together as TT did. So while I cannot forgive Intuit for its attempted money grab earlier this year (thus am leaving the one star as just one star), their product at least this year--now that it's returned to its old functionality--outshines H&RB at least in my experience, with complex taxes.

title: I have used Turbo Tax Deluxe for years and have always been quite happy. This year I bought Turbo Tax Deluxe as ...
content: Last year I could submit my (insignificant) ESPP stock sales with Turbo Tax Deluxe. I have used Turbo Tax Deluxe for years and have always been quite happy. This year I bought Turbo Tax Deluxe as per usual and was shocked when I was told that I have to upgrade to Premier to handle my minor stock sales. The upgrade to Premier is offered at the bargain price of $30 seems like a steep addition to the $40 I paid for Deluxe. BOO!!!! Turbo Tax!!! I am now a TaxAct / H&R Block customer.

title: Unbelievable! After using TurboTax annually since the 1980's, ...
content: Unbelievable! After using TurboTax annually since the 1980's, I will be trying H&R Block's tax software. Thanks for the alerts from the hundreds of unhappy former TT customers!

title: Why Turbo Tax why?
content: Dear, Turbo Tax Like many of your customers I have been a loyal Turbo Tax user for many years. My first time using Turbo Tax was over 20 years ago, when my father bought me the software and in his elegant way of speaking said to me, "Here you go knuckle head, use this." I'll have to interpret what he meant to say which is. "Hello my favorite son with the oddly shaped head. I have been using Turbo Tax to do my own taxes and I thought I would pass on my great knowledge to you so I have purchased you your first copy of Turbo Tax. Since that day I have been using turbo tax every year. I used it when I went to college, when I got married, when I had my first child. Turbo tax was there when I bought my first home and then every time I went up a tax bracket. I have used it for do my taxes through all my life changes and it has served me well. When tax time comes around and people complain about doing their taxes, just like my father I would say to them, " Use Turbo Tax it's easier than you think to do your own taxes." I have been your biggest cheerleaders and fans. I have told numerous family and friends how much I like turbo tax. Most of them now use Turbo Tax faithfully. To think of it, most use turbo tax except for a brother-in-law that uses H&R block. No one can convince him that Turbo Tax is better and he tries to make everyone switch to H&R block. Now unfortunately, I think he is right and I hate it when he is right. I can no longer recommend Turbo tax. I know you have to make a profit and I think everyone can appreciate that, but with your new tactics your simple going to lose your faithful customers base. Pease do the right thing and Instead of nickel and dimming your loyal customers, provide your customers with the product that they thought they were buying in the first place and refund those that had to pay extra. I don't think I need to clarify the issue. If you need further clarification please see the multitude of negative reviews on the internet, especially the ones on the biggest online sellers, Amazon. Once again , If you want to keep me and your other faithful customers, I urge you to do the right thing so at the very least I can tell my brother in law where to shove it.

title: Beware the Decepticons !
content: Let me first say, I have been a user of Turbo Tax Deluxe for well over a decade. The work I do and investments I make require it. It was back in early December of 2014 that I began to hear rumblings of discontent with the TTD package. So, I decided to wait till tax season to see if Intuit (INTU) was going to make the world right in this matter. Well, it sort of did with a rebate for early purchasers of TTD though it is still a crippled product. But what this says to me is that this rebate is but a one time occurrence and thus, you will pay more next year for the features you will require. Their email to me apologizing for this "misunderstanding" is disingenuous at best. Last Friday, I purchased HR Block Deluxe. It has all the features that TTD once had for less cost. The installation and data migration* from TTD 2013 went flawlessly. Here it is Monday and my returns are ready for filing. Totally painless. Back in FY 2014, I suspected that there would be legions of taxpayers like me who would bail on TT so I did the prudent thing and sold off INTU from my portfolio (at a profit). Indeed, analysts are now forecasting forward revenue growth of -28% for INTU in 2015. The irony of this is, I will be reporting this capital gain on the sale of INTU using HR Block Deluxe tax software. LOL ! * I find it interesting that data migration from TT to competitive tax packages is quite easy. Then I thought, if I was a INTU executive and wanted to stymie this capability of my competitors, what would I do ? I would use proprietary encryption on saved data such that competitive tax packages could no longer migrate tax data from TT. Viola ! A captive audience. Now, they wouldn't do that, would they ? Think about that if you plan to continue using TT.

title: Another loyal TT user bites the dust!
content: After using TT for 10+ years I'm done...I read the reviews beforehand and thought I'd still give Intuit the benefit of the doubt, maybe I could still get by with using deluxe since I'm pretty bland-I'm 27 years old, married with no children, I don't have investments, I don't own my own business, I don't own my own home, I don't have any rental properties, all I needed was to be able to deduct my vehicle mileage and misc. work expenses. So I get all the way through filling out the forms and when I go to click the e-file button that's when I'm told that I need to upgrade to premier...wtf! According to the little graph you show on your website and the back of the package I should've been golden. Not only that but they didn't even tell me what was causing me to need to upgrade. Sure, they're offering a $25 back but what they're not telling you-the "upgrade" still costs you $30 plus tax and you get the $25 AFTER you file...wtf! I don't want the money back AFTER I file I want that money back BEFORE I even bothered to try out your product this year! Way to go Intuit...you pissed off another one!

title: not ntrustworthy
content: Intuit is worst company ever. They store your private info and they are not transparent what they do with it. They are also forcing you to switch to online version by deactivating support to the desktop versions. And the online versions suck so far. they're one of the disloyal companies out there.

title: Switched to H&R Block this year and won't look back.
content: Dear Turbo Tax, I have been a faithful customer for at least the last 15 years, but your actions to increase revenue in this manner are reprehensible. This move has convinced me that a viable competitor in this market is absolutely necessary to ensure that there is a significant, negative financial impact when there is such disregard for the customer. Needless to say, I purchased H&R Block Deluxe this year and recommend that others do so as well. It was easy to download and uploaded my Turbo Tax return from the prior year without any problem. It is also just as easy to use as the Turbo Tax product, so don't worry about spending any extra time switching to H&R Block.

title: As a TT Deluxe user since the mid-90's, I ...
content: As a TT Deluxe user since the mid-90's, I will be shopping the competition this year. I need Schedule D for one mutual fund transaction for 2014 and the additional $30 for Premier is just not worth it.

title: Returns Rejected for Bogus Reason
content: I got an email from the TurboTax General Manager saying the same thing as the VP posted here, acknowledging what I had already discovered, that TurboTax is so bad this year that now I have to replace it with a different version and start over. I have done my taxes with TurboTax Deluxe for the past 7 years without a problem; this year with the new âDeductions and Homeowners Deluxeâ nothing but problems. I finally got through it and did both Federal and State (Maryland) e-File only to have them rejected because on the 16 Forms W2-G I hand poked in âthe Federal Identification Numbers (EIN) did not match the IRS database.â Well, thatâs just WRONG. All of the Federal Identification Numbers (EIN) are exactly CORRECT, and they are the exact same W2-G EINs that the IRS accepted for e-File without hesitation on my 2010, 2011, 2012, and 2013 returns, all done on TurboTax Deluxe. So I can only conclude that there is nothing whatsoever wrong with those EINs matching the IRS database, rather it is one more glitch in TurboTax that by its own admission is so hosed it has to be replaced. Is there any way to submit it again once it's been rejected?

title: Worst...tax...software...ever (at least back to 1995)
content: I wish 0 stars was an option. Or negative stars. TurboTax is hands down the worst tax preparation software I've ever used, and I've been doing my own taxes (as well as for others occasionally) since 1995. Their "help" is also a joke, comprised of a user forum. That's it. You can't get assistance from Intuit or report bugs to them as far as I've been able to determine. For what it's worth, my qualifications for making the above statements are that I used to be a CPA and for many years since leaving the accounting field have been an IT professional.

title: TurboTax You're Fired!
content: I've been a TurboTax user for at least a decade. I even put up with their disastrous foray into only letting you use the software on one computer with annoying DRM without being too upset, but this year is beyond the pale. They've pulled out even basic support, which was limited but sufficient for my needs in their past versions and put it into only the highest levels of the software which cost way more and group simple things like a dividend being paid into software I'd need if I had a small business. I mean I make so little on a very meager investment the upgrade costs the better amount of my earnings. I've had it with them pulling things out, seeing if there's outrage, and what they can get away with. We returned the copy of TurboTax we'd purchased and I'm going to give HR Block's TaxCut a try this year. Guess what, if it works out I'm going to keep using it! If not, maybe I go back to TurboTax, but only if I can't find another one that will work. Stupid, stupid, stupid decision Turbotax. I bet the people at your competitors are going to send you some nice Christmas gifts next year for gaining them extra repeat customers.

title: DOUBLE BAIT AND SWITCH!!!!!
content: DOUBLE BAIT AND SWITCH!!! I have been using TurboTax Deluxe for at least 15 years filing both Schedule C (business income) and Schedule D (capital gains) without any problem. After purchasing the same product this year, I just learned that the Deluxe version no longer can be used to file Schedules C and D. A January 17, 2015 article in the Wall Street Journal described the situation and quoted a TurboTax representative as saying that customers could call 800-445-1875 and "we will work with them on a case-by-case basis." So I called and after a long wait, they called back. The representative was very nice and offered a refund or a free upgrade to the Premier version. I took the upgrade but it took a great deal of hold time to get the system worked out. After completing the upgrade, I noted that the Premier version does not allow filing a Schedule C. I need the Home & Business version. So, I feel I have been double bait and switched. First from Deluxe and now the Premier version. The Wall Street Journal article says that the HR Block Deluxe version allows users to file Schedules C and D. And people who purchased TurboTax Deluxe can get a free download of the HR Block by emailing SwitchToBlock@hrblock.com and providing a proof of purchase for the TurboTax product. I have written them to get the free download. Shame on TurboTax and Intuit.

title: so I went to amazon to purchase/download TaxtTurbo Delux 2014 and found it had HORRIBLE reviews. I'm Like WHAT
content: I've been using TurboTax since 2009 and we're in that usual tax month, so I went to amazon to purchase/download TurboTax Delux 2014 and found it had HORRIBLE reviews. I'm Like WHAT?? After reading the reviews it took away certain features that you were able to do in prior years. They took away Schedule C,E, F without telling the consumer. So if customers bought the software and start doing their taxes it tells them to upgrade for $30 more (If you're using Schedule C,E,F). These features does not affect me at all, BUT not telling their customers...is HORRIBLE customer service!!!! I decided not go with them this year for that reason. What else they might take away next year?? "I don't know"! because, they don't tell us! This year I went with TaxAct, it was a little adjustment because I was so used to TurboTax, but TaxAct has a feature you can import your previous TurboTax files into their software. At first it did not import. After 5 minutes of trying to import the file, it turns out the TurboTax document file name was the issue. My file name has spaces and other characters type words, so I renamed it to TEST and it imported in nicely. I think I'm going to stick with TaxAct (Unless they pull a fast one like TurboTax did) for years to come. These type of software's you don't change often...especially Tax Software's, because we the people don't like changes. TurboTax lost another customer.

title: Hate it when a company takes loyal customers for granted
content: Turbo tax made a big mistake by no longer supporting the same schedules in their Deluxe version that I have used for years, and just expecting that loyal customers will gladly give them another $30. I am one of many that will look into the H&R block software this year for the first time, as I hear they will give me a free copy by providing a copy of my Turbo Tax2014 deluxe software. Hate it when a company takes loyal customers for granted. Email switchtoblock@hrblock.com include your name, copy of receipt , email address and your pc operating system.

title: Downgraded Deluxe
content: Thank you all for the posts regarding the downgraded Deluxe version of Turbo Tax. Having used this product for more years than I care to count, it is clearly time to move on. Too bad intuit, another long time user is going away.

title: No K-1 Data
content: Cannot even enter Schedule K-1 data. This is not listed on the page as having been removed, like the Schedule C, D, & E. So, if you just have an investment in a partnership or LLC that issues K-1's, you now have to pay double to get Premier.

title: Fortunately I Read the WSJ Article in Yesterday's Paper Before Ordering this Bait & Switch Product
content: I have faithfully used TurboTax Deluxe for over a decade and have been very satisfied. Tonight I planned to order TurboTax Deluxe from Amazon. Fortunately I saw a Wall Street Journal article in yesterday's (Sunday) paper about changes to TurboTax. The Deluxe version no longer electronically files Schedule C or Schedule D. I need both and am so disappointed I plan to look at H&R Block.

title: FOOL ME ONCE TURBO TAX, SHAME ON YOU....
content: Sorry the rating system does not allow a negative five star rating. DO NOT BUY THIS EXPECTING THE SAME PRODUCT FROM EARLIER YEARS. And this will be a surprise as you are in the middle of return preparation and you encounter familiar schedules that say Do Not File. I'm done here!

title: Very,Very sneaky........Don't buy
content: Been using Turbo Tax since 1988. I was shocked this year when a window popped up saying I needed a $30.00 upgrade in order to do schedule D. I hate the nickel and dime thing that intuit has resorted to. Very sneaky. Will pay for the upgrade this year but switching to H&R Block next year. You piss people off enough they will switch. I did this with GM years ago and never went back.

title: Does not deliver what is promised
content: Garbage. I didn't find out until after I was almost finished that it had me overpay state taxes last year significantly. It explains nothing. The pages aren't even formatted correctly. I had a promotion for free federal and state preparation (yes the deluxe version) and it just refused to give it to me upon checkout. New alternatives are coming out and hopefully this is dead soon.

title: Bye Bye TurboTax. Hello H&R Block.
content: I was (past tense intended) a long-time TurboTax user. It was the only tax software I ever tried or used for over fifteen years. Last year was the first time I ever actively traded stocks. I knew TurboTax Deluxe had the ability to handle stock sales and was all set to buy it when I noticed the overwhelmingly poor reviews. After reading quite a few of them I realized Intuit was trying to rip me and many others off by forcing me to upgrade to a program that cost $30 more then Deluxe. Sorry, Intuit, I'm not that gullible. So I spent five minutes reading up on H&R Block and Tax Act and ended up downloading H&R Block Deluxe for a grand total of $34.27. It transferred my TurboTax info from last year without a hitch and I'm off to the races. I haven't got to the investment section yet but don't expect any problems. As for Bob, the Intuit VP of Marketing, I have read your many and feeble defenses as to why Intuit made the changes it did. Malarkey and balderdash, every word of it. I especially chuckled at your debatable claim only around 4% of TurboTax users would have to upgrade. Even if true, let's do some calculations. Last year Intuit sold what, around 20,000,000 copies of TurboTax? 4% of 20,000,000 is 800,000 people. 800,000 people paying $30 more for your little sham game equals $24,000,000. $24,000,000 of potential profit for reducing functionality and scamming your customers? Not the smartest move you ever made.

title: Very poor software product!
content: This product is completely unusable in the "interview" mode of tax information entry. Every time I tried to used that method of data entry, it would freeze up and I would have to re-boot my computer. I have given up on this package and purchased one from a different company which has worked very well. I have used TurboTax in the past but will not buy it again...unfortunately, I don't see any way to get a refund from Amazon for this purchase.

title: Screwed by Deluxe
content: Like many other reviewers, I too got stuck by buying Deluxe only to find I needed Premier because I sold a few shares of stock last year. I always used TurboTax Basic in the past. I have used other tax preparation software in the late '90s. I think I'll try them again next year. TurboTax has revealed what it thinks about its customers.

title: Leaving Turbo Tax for H&R Block This Year
content: Wow - I got online today to order the Turbo Tax Deluxe for 2014 and saw all the bad reviews. I have the same issues and need Schedules C&D as well. I am certainly not printing and mailing forms nor am I suddenly paying double for a product that goes way beyond my modest needs. Time to break the automatic Turbo Tax choice and check out the other options. Glad to hear that H&R Block accepts the TT upfile from previous years.

title: I've used TurboTax Deluxe for 10 years to do my ...
content: I've used TurboTax Deluxe for 10 years to do my taxes, and they've lost my business forever. Changing the pricing scheme in such a ludicrous way and having the audacity to say it was to make things more equal and balanced and simple, rather than just to squeeze us for more money, is unforgivable. I hope you saved some of the money I've given you over the years, Intuit, because you'll never see another penny from me again.

title: Just stopped in to say after 20+ years of being ...
content: Just stopped in to say after 20+ years of being a Quicken and TurboxTax customer (going back to the DOS versions) I am done with this company. If you are going to remove the schedules I need from TurboTax Deluxe in order to try and squeeze more money out of me I am going to find another vendor. That goes for Quicken as well. Quicken 2014 is my final version.

title: Iv'e been ripped off... Twice
content: Iv'e used this product for 20 years and now they pull this. In fact, I've always used Basic as it had 1040 and Sch C, D, E ... etc. I've had many investments, rental properties over the years and Basic was just fine... and I don't e-file as I ALWAYS owe money. So this year I'm at Fry's and grab Basic. Get it home and it says EZ and 1040A only. wtf. So I go to the Intuit website and take a quick look at the product comparison and see the Deluxe is now the version with 1040. So without reading any of the finer details I order Deluxe on Amazon because I ASSUME they just moved the old Basic up to Deluxe which is bad enough IMO. Now I'm finding out that Deluxe doesn't even have the most basic of Schedules. Are you kidding me? How can any business executive be foolish enough to think you can make such a massive overhaul (a.k.a. price increase) without a mass exodus in a firestorm of criticism? I see Intuit is offering a free upgrade to help soften the blow of their colossal corporate blunder but I may pass on that and give HR Block a try.

title: Can't File CA State Tax Via Paper!!!
content: I've been using TurboTax for at least 8 years now. It's always been more than sufficient for what I need, until this year. For starters, if you have a question, good luck finding a number, or an e-mail that you can reach them on. I've read some of the reviews here concerning Forms C and D, not really sure if I had to use those before, as I did everything within the software. But as the problem specifically pertaining to me, is that I never liked the $20 fee to file my state tax. Remember when we had to fork money for the Federal filing to until they got sued? Anyways, I've always filed my state tax via paper as it's cheaper for me to print and mail it with tracking number. So, I was trying to file my CA state tax this year, and I can't. Because it has the words "DO NOT FILE NOT FORM NOT FINAL" written all over it. That is even with going through the filling section and reviewing it several times to make sure everything was good to go. Hopefully, they read this and let me know how to file via paper...

title: Intuit Customer Service is non-existent!!
content: This is NOT a review about the pricing between the Deluxe and the Premier, but rather the customer service at Intuit. This is my third year using TurboTax to file my returns, and I've never had any issues in the past. This year, after trying to E-file my Illinois return, I was given an error. The TurboTax prompt suggested that I call the Intuit customer service line to pay the $20 fee over the phone. I spent the next hour on the phone with Intuit as they searched for my account (again I've been a TurboTax customer for three years running - how can you have 'lost' my account information?!?!?!). Finally, the Customer Service rep got permission from her manager to bill my credit card on the new account she had just created. Since I'd spent an hour of my life on the phone, I requested that she waive the $20 fee. Again, on hold for another 10 minutes. I was told that the fee would be waived, but that the code would come from a follow-up call from the manager. It's been two days, and I still haven't heard from the manager or anyone else in the Intuit Customer Service Department. Unbelievable. I'll never buy another product from Intuit.

title: Their efforts to combat bad ratings is also once again too little and too ...
content: Intuit's history of messing with TurboTax to the detriment of users is continuing. And, again, it is done in a sneaky manner. Their efforts to combat bad ratings is also once again too little and too late. It is clear that only their massive advertising and paying cooperative other companies is keeping them in business. Their product is not bad but the company keeps trying to squeeze more out of the users in underhanded ways.

title: Worst business decision since "new Coke". I'm done.
content: Here's the deal. Turbotax has always had multiple versions depending on your complexity of taxes. However: you were still able to use any version of the software - you just had to do some things manually in the less robust versions. Now comes the updated "deluxe" version. As far as I can tell, you cannot use it if you bought or sold 1 penny stock. Do you understand. You cannot use turbo tax deluxe IF YOU WANT TO ADHERE TO THE U.S TAX CODE. 20 year user. I'm done.

title: 16 years in a row. Until now. Keep your upgrade and have a nice life.
content: So here's the deal Intuit. You can offer people the free upgrade to premium this year, but most of us have already switched over to an alternative. Especially in my case with rentals and a small business where premium isn't even enough. Having been a TurboTax customer from 1998-2013, 16 years straight, I have seen price increases from Intuit before. I stayed loyal since Deluxe did everything I need for the myraid of tax issues I have had over the years and at around 40 bucks it was still a reasonable price. To cover all my needs which include Sch C, D, and E, I would have to pay at least 80 this year. Double. H&R block will do all that and state for 20. If you were paying attention, you would have noticed that consumer software has been decreasing in price. It's not even called software anymore thanks to the 'app' revolution. Now that I have used the competitor and they have filled my needs, all they have to do to keep me for the next 15 years is provide a consistently useful service at a fair price. Just like you used to do. Good bye and good riddance.

title: Epic Fail Intuit!
content: Shame on Intuit for the bait and switch this year! I've always been a loyal TT user. I bought the same deluxe I've always used - I have a little bit of stock and sold some this year, but have no investment properties (if I did, I'd probably not be doing my own taxes...). Imagine my surprise to find out I needed to upgrade to premiere for my one little stock sale. Apparently everyone was buying deluxe and they weren't selling enough of the twice the price premiere! There was a big article in my local paper about this epic fail on the part of Intuit. It said that if you provide H&R Block proof of purchase of TT, they will provide their software for free. Worth a try to me. And for full disclosure, I bought my TT from a big box store, not on Amazon.

title: using turbo tax since 2002, suddenly in the middle ...
content: using turbo tax since 2002, suddenly in the middle of my preparation i was "forced to buy a $30 upgrade" ore else I can't file my taxes completely. sorry turbo tax, you remind me of a sleazy car salesman. I will be moving on to something else next year.

title: Congrats Intuit! You've earned my first review!
content: Congrats Intuit! You've earned my first review! Just found out you decided to start charging a lot more for my taxes. Thanks for that! But I have some bad news for you... The price of gold just went up too, so all I could afford to give you this time was one gold star. I'm sure you'll understand. Regard, Former lifelong customer

title: TurboTax, you have a gut to call this a deluxe?
content: I have been using TurboTax Deluxe for decades. As I was about to buy it again, one star rating caught my eyes, and found the unethical practice of TT. I probably would have bought it again if TT just raised the price for the same feature. I felt betrayed. Thanks other reviewer for the warning and suggestion for alternatives.

title: Ripoff from Turbo tax, they got it totally wrong
content: I am using TT since long time it worked perfectly this time as many. Mau have already highlighted issue that they have removed forms from delux and forcing people to goto their Premier product. They wanted money ask for may be 10-15 extra for delux but cant break product and give false justifications of syncing softwares etc. Key is they have not removed the form they have capped it to $100 that means they are giving out false reasons i dont like that atall. States are 40 dollars to downloand file is extra 20 pr something so states are even more costly than whole software, just doesnt addup. I understand they want to make money but if u ask for credit card 4 times at different stages it just annoying. There are better products available now

title: Stupid Greedy Jerks
content: Reading all the reviews, I was ready to not buy this software. The CEO assured me that the issue was resolved. So, I bought this with the understanding that I could now get the upgrade needed to get the forms I need. However, Intuit is "not able to process my request at this time." Stupid greedy jerks. I've used their software for many years. Part of what I feel like I am paying for is to not have to worry about filling out my tax - knowing that someone else is handling the details. That trust is totally gone now. Whoever thought up the idea of splitting the software should be fired. The person who approved the idea should be fired. The CEO should be fired too. They broke the trust.

title: TOTAL RIP!!!!
content: I've got Turbo Tax records going back more than 15 years. TTax Deluxe. Who do you think you are Intuit ..... JC Penny?? Change your "business model", kiss lots of loyal users goodbye. Hopefully you end up with the same vacant shelve Penny's has. You screwed me this year, on the Deluxe version, but I'm not buying the upgrade. Looks like H&R Block is the new go to.

title: I have used TT for years and years but just ...
content: I have used TT for years and years but just discovered that I have to "upgrade" to get the same functionality I had last year. This will go down as Intuit's "New Coke" moment. I'm going elsewhere and will not be back!

title: Switch to HR Block was seamless
content: I'm a long-time Turbo Tax user, but I'm fed up with Intuit/Turbo Tax's price gouging tactics so this year, I switched to HR Block's software. it is a lot cheaper and it does exactly the same thing as Turbo Tax. It even imported last year's Turbo Tax file so there was no re-initializing all of my tax data and personal information I entered in past years. I would say that HR Block's software is even a bit easier to use than Turbo Tax was. I'll stick with HR Block from now on. Good bye Turbo Tax, and good riddance.

title: Taxpayers can easily import last year's tax return directly from TurboTax for ...
content: Don't be forced to upgrade. H&R Block is offering free tax software to unsatisfied TurboTax users; To claim the free H&R Block Deluxe + State software, taxpayers should email SwitchToBlock@hrblock.com and include their name, address, phone number, the type of operating system they use (Windows/Mac), and proof of purchase (a photo or scan of their store receipt or the email showing their download code). The taxpayer will then receive an email for one free download of H&R Block Deluxe + State. Taxpayers can easily import last year's tax return directly from TurboTax for free. source :http://www.marketwatch.com/story/hr-block-offers-free-software-to-turbotax-users-2015-01-12

title: I am amazed with the arrogance of Intuit VP's answers on this ...
content: I am amazed with the arrogance of Intuit VP's answers on this products deficiencies compared to last year. I've also been a faithful turbotax user. I used it because I want to file electronically. I don't want to file using paper but that is his solution or pay extra and upgrade to Premier. I will be using H&R Block Tax Software Deluxe + State 2014 for my tax preparation this year. It is not only cheaper but it supports the schedules Intuit doesn't in the deluxe version. Whomever made the decision to make these dumb changes should be fired.

title: Turbo Tax is ransom software company.
content: I was thinking of switching to Turbo tax this year after a few years of using H&R Block tax software. But after reading all the negative comments regard to how Turbo Tax bait and switch you into paying extra for features it promises to provide, I will NOT buy Turbo Tax. Imagine tax time is the most stressful time of year, short of a tax audit. And then you get smacked with an unscrupulous company demanding more ransom money. This is not a company to be trusted.

title: Just wanted to add that I've called TurboTax to get the "free" upgrade so I'm good this year
content: I'm sure I don't have to repeat any of the 2000+ 1-star comments already posted. Just wanted to add that I've called TurboTax to get the "free" upgrade so I'm good this year. I've also submitted my receipt and copy TTax front cover to H&R Block as required and got my H&R Block software. I'm still going to do everything on TTax this year. But once I'm done, I'll import into H&R Block to see the difference, such as refund, error checking, etc. and I'll definitely migrate to H&R next year. So bye-bye TTax. You stabbed me on the back. At least I can take my money and run.

title: BUYER BEWARE IF YOU SOLD YOUR HOME IN 2014
content: Buyer beware ... if you sold your home in 2014, TurboTax Deluxe doesn't handle this situation and you will be asked to upgrade to Premier for another $30. So, instead of paying an extra $20 from Amazon to buy Premier in the first place, Intuit wants you to pay another $30. The issue is the potential for capital gains, which Deluxe can't handle. In reality, most homes are sold at a loss, like mine, therefore there are no capital gains. This is a giant RIPOFF. There is nothing clearly documented on the TurboTax site, or the Amazon site, that specifically discusses this, even though selling a home is one of the most common things a taxpayer does. I've been using TurboTax for a couple of decades ... this will be the LAST time.

title: One Star
content: Weasels. Even the offer to "make it right" is complicated. Bye Turbo tax.

title: No more Schedule C!
content: Do NOT buy this for a business return! I have used the Deluxe software for years to file returns for our business. This year I downloaded the same program and imported last years return but when I tried to enter our business information it would not allow me to continue unless I paid them another $40 to upgrade to their business version. NO THANK YOU! I have purchased H&R Block's Premium tax software for under $40 and will not be buying Turbo Tax again. You lost another loyal customer Turbo Tax!

title: VERY UNHAPPY
content: This will be the last year I use Turbo Tax. I have been a loyal customer for as long as I can remember (over 20 years) and I resent being scammed with the latest version of Turbo Tax Deluxe. I have always used Deluxe for my taxes, but I found out that for 2014 taxes Schedules D & E are not supported in Deluxe this year. You must purchase the Premier edition to get what you used to get in Deluxe (another $20.00). Good bye Turbo Tax - Hello H&R Block.

title: Intuit has abused customer loyalty
content: TurboTax Deluxe was changed this year and no longer offers schedule D. Intuit took advantage of my loyalty to them by making this change year-over-year. I did not anticipate this and now am stuck with software that i can not return and can not use. Do not purchase this product unless you read all of their fine print.

title: I am very disappointed at the removal of some of the previous functionality ...
content: I want to thank Fox News for pointing me here before I purchased TurboTax this year. I am very disappointed at the removal of some of the previous functionality from TurboTax Deluxe. This was guaranteed income for Intuit every year from me any many other people. Way back when TurboTax first came out, I actually enjoyed doing my taxes. They had those little videos with the man and the women that would help explain the tax laws. That was pretty neat. TurboTax began slowly going down hill after that. Now we have expensive software that is infested with up-sells throughout the entire tax preparation process. Looks like I am going to bite the bullet and make the switch to H&R Block Deluxe this year. One thing that convinced me to switch was H&R Block's offer for free software if you purchased TurboTax Deluxe and are not happy with what happened. Had I purchased TurboTax Deluxe before I had seen the news clip on Fox and the comments on Amazon, I would have purchased H&R Block's software even with the free offer because they are thinking about the consumer!

title: Absolute Nightmare!
content: Aside from all the reduction in services available using the Deluxe version (which I understand have been fixed), there is a major issue within the software that prevents the completed file (after you get to the review section) from actually finalizing/reaching the print or filing screens. So now I have completely finished my taxes but cannot print or file them!! And forget about trying to actually contact Intuit to ask how to fix this software issue (and that's after spending countless tries uninstalling/reinstalling/repairing/trying to start new file). There are hour-long or more wait times and NO OTHER WAY TO CONTACT THEM. I have used TurboTax for at least 7 years and I have spent more time trying to complete my taxes (all of this time spent trying to resolve software issues) this year than I have in all the other years combined. I do not recommend this product unless you have tons of time to waste.

title: Less painful than I thought it would be
content: After 20 years of being a loyal Intuit customer, I took the time to switch to H&R Block for my taxes this year. Less painful than I thought it would be. Everything imported fine from last year's TT. I did this mostly because I am a 25-year Silicon Valley engineer/entrepreneur and I view this not as clever marketing, but as totally deceptive and fleecing the customer. I've also been forced to upgrade Quicken 4 times in the past 15 years. I will look for an alternative this time if they force me to upgrade Quicken Deluxe 2014 before I am ready. In this day and age of powerful social networking, it is risky for a company to engage in these kinds of deceptive practices as the degree of separation between the company, its customers, and its Board Members is usually pretty low, especially in Silicon Valley.

title: "Team" phone number not a help
content: And......... the Turbo Tax "team" phone number that is suggested by the manufacturer is not a help. Person who answered my call had no interest in discussing my problem (consultants do have expenses contrary to comment by Turbo VP, so simple schedule C in Deluxe doesn't work) and indicated her only job was to respond to technical glitches with software and process refunds.

title: TurboTax is telling me to move on. So, reluctantly, after 20 years, I'm moving on.
content: TurboTax user for 20 years. Clearly TurboTax is telling me it's time to move on. $50 was limit of what I was willing to pay. When my pay is only going up 2 percent a year, when someone tries to slip a 30-40 percent price increase in, they clearly don't want you as a customer. I don't take it personally. Nothing to be done but choose the best of the competing products. Updating Jan. 28. Just filed our taxes with TaxAct online, $20 for federal and state -- includes efiling for both. It's not quite as slick an interface as TurboTax, and the online software is a little slower, but it works. I'm not paying $50 for TurboTax, let alone $100 or whatever they wanted to charge this year. Intuit just got too greedy. It is just not the time to do big price increases in this economy.

title: I Switched to HR block.
content: I probably don't use all the features that turbotax took away, and now probably put back.. But i didn't want to take the risk so i just went with HR block.. I had been using turbotax for the last 5 years or so. HR block seems to work just as well and I was able to transfer last years turbo tax into HR block. Im not a brand loyal person, i just want the best deal. sorry turbotax.

title: I am gone
content: Undear Intuit: No late act of contrition will cover for the blatant intention of gouging your formerly loyal customers. That was amateurish! Risk such a franchise for a fistful of dollars. And the worst sin: you should never provide a customer with the the justification to try greener pastures at you competitor's. And you did! I was able to get the full H&R Block Premium and Business for less than what you want to charge for your crippled Deluxe product. You just broke the most basic business commandment: provide your customers with good value. You spend years building a loyal franchise, and you destroy that in just one stroke. Farewell. I do hope my schedule D for next year shows a tidy profit from shorting your stock.

title: There are alternatives to being treated poorly
content: You can read lots of eloquent complaints about TurboTax and their recent price increase here. AAII, a fairly prestigious subscription service for investors, recently had a major article about TurboTax. The senior editor related his experience of using H&R Block software after 17+ years of TurboTax. He commented that the H&R Block import was flawless and the software was as good as TurboTax. Letâs face it, this is tax software and not rocket science. I sold my Amazon purchased version of TurboTax on eBay and got the H&R Block equivalent for much less money. If you can put up with a different UI (user interface) and a small learning curve, my advice would be to not buy and buy the H&R Block product.

title: Biting the hand that feeds you=TurboTax
content: I was shocked but paid the upgrade price to Premier last year--I was a captive audience. I'm not savvy with taxes or software, but I have used TurboTax since early 90's. I have real estate I am depreciating which carries over each year and uncertain how to switch over to something new. I always purchase through my investment website. I dread having to figure yet something else out. (It's probably not that hard). Like I say, I'm not savvy, but taking away forms that were working to start with because gosh darn they can't figure out how to keep them in Delux (leave things alone) doesn't sound honest to me. Shame on you TurboTax for gouging your loyal customers.

title: Don't buy this useless software
content: Ridiculous that Schedule D has been removed. I wish I had noticed this before I bought the Deluxe version. Unless these forms are offered as a free update I will be buying my tax software from someone else next year! Total scum bag move to take stuff out but not change the product name.

title: Missing Schedules makes product useless.
content: I have stuck with TurboTax for years even though some of my co-workers have recommended other products. But now that they have stripped the schedules most helpful to me out of Deluxe and put it into Premier+ I will certainly be shopping around. If H&R Block has a Deluxe product, which they do, that contains these schedules then why in the world would I pay the extra 20 or 30 dollars to stick with TurboTax? I am sure I'm not alone in my disgust with TT for doing this. Do they think middle class Americans don't need Sched D or the others? Doesn't make sense and seems like a real PR nightmare. I only found out from an email I just received. I can't wait until others find out. What a dumb decision! Makes one scratch their head. I would NOT recommend this product any longer.

title: You've got to be kidding me!
content: Pretty simple stuff. Charging for an UPGRADE for a basic tax form is LUDICROUS. I've been using TurboTax for 20+ years and this is the first time Intuit has every let me down. Intuit is taking heavy hits on the Wall St Journal, as here for this decision. I would hope "Bob - the VP" or whoever, will re-evaluate this decision or they can kiss me good bye. From what I've read there are THOUSANDS of users who will be switching the H&R Block as a result of this nonsense. Please consider me one of them, unless you change for the 2015 Tax Year and beyond. Let's see what the stock does ..... should be interesting. Hope you are shorting it.

title: Nickel and dimed
content: As a user of this since it became software, the gouging will make me look for any kind of an alternative. $40 for a âFeatureâ that has always been a part of it the program stings. Next thing keyboards will cost extra for a spacebar key.

title: Intuit = Stupid
content: Not sure what business strategy they are using, but constantly, intentionally, pissing off your customers was never a recommended practice in any business class I took. I think I've purchased my last Intuit product. Today (27 Jan 15)...I just kind of stumbled upon this article which completely blew my mind, since Bob clearly indicated something else: Intuit (INTU), the company that makes TurboTax, maintains a database containing users' Social Security numbers, names and other personal data -- even for customers using the desktop version of the software who save their files on their own hard drives. The existence of the database was revealed to users when Intuit set up a website for customers to ask for their $25 refunds from the software price increase. The site requires users to enter their Social Security numbers to get their $25 refunds. That indicates that personal tax data is, indeed, being stored by Intuit. The fact that Intuit is keeping personal data -- even on customers using the desktop version of the software -- is a bit of a surprise to some. Many taxpayers using the desktop version of the popular tax-preparation software thought they were keeping their personal information stored on their PCs -- not on Intuit's servers. [...] So...Bob. You said you couldn't verify past users unless they called (this reply is posted on Amazon) for you to verify users when I suggested simply putting last years disc or using last years Tax Return as verification of a prior purchase could be used. You said Intuit couldn't do that. In fact, you said it would be illegal. Now, it appears you would have known who your past customers were because, if this article is accurate (not saying it is....asking the question).....you already had the information. Either you were less than forthcoming, or as you said...it would be illegal to use past tax returns to do such. Then I see this on my homepage today. I'd like to see an OFFICIAL Intuit response to this either via major news networks, and/or in this forum. Why are you guys holding on to our personal information?

title: Former loyal TurboTax user, never again! Switching to HR Block
content: Former turbo tax user for years, never again will return after this, I will be switching to HR Block's software. Even though the new changes mostly do not affect me, I was so disgusted that a company would try to gouge their loyal customers in this manner, and then give the standard canned corporate weasel word reply, that I refuse to reward this greedy behavior. Have informed my family (all former loyal turbo tax users) and they will be also switching to HR Block. goodbye intuit, you did it to yourself... I hope you look at your sales numbers at the end of the year and remember all of these people you basically gave the finger too with your fake, bogus replies and justifications.

title: Intuit Needs to Read These Reviews!
content: Intuit should read these reviews. Or maybe they just don't want to hear it. Over 2,000 one-star reviews and less than 200 good reviews. Try TaxACT. Just Google it for their website. You can try it free...or use the free version. Yes "FREE". You can get it here on Amazon too. And it includes free electronic filing. I've been using the Deluxe version ($12.99 download) for 5 years and like it very much. I used TurboTax until it started getting very expensive and dropping features. I started using it when it was DOS. My son recommended TaxACT and I tried it. It just gets better each year. Hope this helps.

title: I abhor deceptve greed.Be upfront about it!
content: I've used TurboTax from the very beginning, installing with floppy discs. When I purchased TT Deluxe 2014 from Costo, I had NO inkling that I needed to comb the back of the package with a fine tooth comb to learn that omissions were made for this year, requiring me to buy an upgraded version. As I've done in the last 10 years and more, I'd snatch up the TT Deluxe version without even bothering to read the contents of the product because I was counting on the Deluxe version to have the schedules C, D, & E that I use and the product always produced until now! I bought this product without looking it over first...my fault. You can bet I won't be doing that again!

title: ... all for their honest comments this year - the worst is no Sch D - it has nothing to ...
content: Thanks to all for their honest comments this year - the worst is no Sch D - it has nothing to do with rentals or small business. After 20 years of TurboTax, I'll be switching to something else for 2014. I'll still use TurboTax for the C Corp - it's still okay.

title: Don't Waste YourMoney on This Dumbed-Down Product - the Triumph of Vile Marketing over Reason and Virtue
content: Intuit in their wisdom dumbed down their "Turbotax Deluxe" product this year, forcing customers who are self-employed or have investment income to "upgrade" to Turbotax "Premier" or some higher superlative. Here's a message to the Marketing brain trust at Intuit: It probably seemed like a good idea at the Strategy session to profit from a substantial chunk of your more affluent customers by forcing them to pay more than double what they paid in the prior year. And even, guaranteed to make max bonus! I mean, what could go wrong? Well - I guess they figure they don't need the semi-retired or the retired, who are frequently self-employed, have investment income, or both. And, perhaps like me, who would rather not take the time to switch software, who are loyal long-term customers. I've used Turbotax since 1995, every year, four or five returns, and I'm reasonably satisfied with the substantial accuracy of the product. However, I refuse to pay more than double for the same software as I used last year. And there is an alternative: H&R Block's "Deluxe" downloadable product. Check it out. I've downloaded it and transferred last year's data without issue. Have not yet evaluated the software's calclulational performance. Will update as time permits. These short-timers in the corporate world are a true wrecking crew. Unbelievable.

title: disgusted by Intuit's shabby business practices and going to H&R Block after decades as an automatic renewal customer
content: totally disgusted, critical features REMOVED without announcement, now suddenly only available for an added charge, though occasionally frustrated I have been using TurboTax for more than 20 years, cancelled automatic renewal, going to H&R Block -- VERY SHABBY Intuit -- VERY SHABBY

title: Turbo Tax needs to suffer for screwing it's loyal customers.
content: Goodbye, Turbo Tax. You can't screw your customers and expect them to keep doing business with you. Read all the other similar opinins. H&R Block is cheaper, includes those things you held for ransom, and works fine.

title: Sneaky TurboTax Online tactic forces you to upgrade from Basic to Deluxe
content: I actually didn't purchase this product. I use TurboTax online basic every year, and much like the complaints here, I was forced to upgrade to Deluxe when I logged in this year, although I have zero need for it. There are no options to switch back to basic (free) service, and it tells you to contact a customer service agent to return to basic. Three calls, and three times the agents have no idea what to do, and are completely unable to return my account back to basic status. This sneaky tactic won't fly with me, and after using TurboTax for more than 10 years, I'm finally backing out and going with something else.

title: Turbo Tax has come out and offered a rebate of ...
content: Turbo Tax has come out and offered a rebate of sorts to soften the dollar impact. Forget it , It caused me a lot of pain last year to account for a disposed of capital asset. You are either a class act or a clown act and after being a customer for 10 years or more, I think TT just need to buy the big shoes.

title: Bait and switch.
content: Can someone say bait and switch? What next Intuit? Will you eliminate some features in Quicken then charge more to get them? TurboTax has removed investment and schedule C features from Deluxe version so you have to upgrade to Premiere to get them. Time for a change.

title: Looks like next year
content: I have used TurboTax for years. Imagine my surprise when I start plugging in my tax information only to discover that I now have to upgrade to a different version of TurboTax for an additional $40. Not at all what I was expecting. Looks like next year, I'll be going elsewhere to do my taxes.

title: What was once the standard, is now a ripoff. DON'T BUY IT!
content: I have been using this tax software since it was called "Macintax" in 1989. Now that Intuit has started gouging the customers by deflating the deluxe version's capabilities, this ends. I will return UNOPENED the copy my wife bought on Saturday. Bad move Intuit.

title: Turbo Tax has done a disgusting bait and switch with their product this year
content: Turbo Tax has done a disgusting bait and switch with their product this year. Note they still call it by the same name TT Deluxe but inside they have stripped out part of the product and yet fcharge you the standard price. They give you all sorts of double speak when you question them about the change, but it all adds up to the customer getting screwed by deception. What a way to treat a customer who has used their product for twenty years. I'm through with this trickery. Forbes magazine has an article (see below) that says H&R block is offering a free download of their deluxe version with all the standard forms by sending them an e-mail with with a copy of the TT purchase receipt and your name and e-mail address. [...]

title: so glad I noticed the rating and took the time to ...
