content: Wow, so glad I noticed the rating and took the time to read the reviews. I too have been using Turbo Tax Deluxe for many years. I did try Tax Cut one year and it wasn't as good, so I tossed it and went back to Turbo Tax. I don't like getting ripped off either so I am switching to H & R Block. I can always count on Amazon reviews to steer me in the right direction. UPDATE: Received the H&R Block software and was very disappointed. All data did not transfer over, print was way too small and I found a flaw in the programing. I have since learned that H&R Block was originally Tax Cut! I purchased the Turbo Tax Premier on Amazon for about $53.00 and I'm never switching again.

title: Zero Stars - Appologize only after users complain - Time to change software!
content: I have a very basic schedule C filed honestly every year. instead of their surprise pay me more for a simple form, I just used the form view, last years forms and IRS instructions to prepare this years schedule C. Yes, a lot more time and effort. Totally, unanticipated - thanks for nothing TurboTax. I get nothing from your so called rebate. Luckily I had a work around. I pity the people who couldn't figure that out. Turbo Tax had them over the coals. Oh well, so much for company loyalty. After this year it is time to switch. There are competitors waiting for our business. Former Turbo Tax users unite and show them who is in charge next year with our check books! Competition here we come - show us why we should change to your software! ZERO Stars!

title: I absolutely don't like Intuit's tactics and attitude about the bait and switch
content: I am a Turbo Tax user of about 6 years and even though I don't need the schedules users are upset about, I am going to join the boycott. I absolutely don't like Intuit's tactics and attitude about the bait and switch. They are banking on people that don't need those schedules to still purchase the scaled down product. Well, even though it does not affect me this year, what about next year? Then TT takes more functionality out of the product - and something I do need. So consumers need to band together and fight these tactics by purchasing another product. I just purchased HR Block 2014 for about $18 cheaper than TT Deluxe with it's limited functionality. Edited 1-9-2015 Just saw this article on the internet by forbes: this is straight from the article. I do not know if it is true or not but it looks like if you purchased TT 2014 Deluxe and are not happy with it - you can contact HR block and get a free version of their deluxe software...but you do have to provide some information and a copy of the TT receipt. So instead of getting the TT 2014 free upgrade - just move over to HR Block. The tt free upgrade is most likely only going to be for one year - then you'll have the same issue with your 2015 returns. Here is a portion of the article: Block is offering dissatisfied TurboTax customers a free download of its Deluxe software, which normally sells for $44.95 and still allows E-filing of Schedules D and C. Gene King, Block's director of communications, says TurboTax purchasers should send an email to SwitchToBlock@hrblock.com containing their name, email and phone number; whether they use a Windows or MAC operating system; and a scan of their store receipt for TurboTax or a copy of the email showing their TurboTax download code. In return, they'll be sent a link good for one free download of H&R Block Deluxe + State. (Data you've entered in last year's or this year's version of TurboTax should be transferable.) *** I do not work for or have any affiliation with HR Block - just tired of companies taking customers for granted. ***

title: Thanks for Everyone's Reviews
content: Thanks to everyone for taking the time to write your reviews on Turbo Tax Deluxe to alert everyone of the major customer-screwing changes Intuit made to their product. I'm another person who has purchased a copy of TT Deluxe every year without thinking much about it (and was on Amazon today to do just that again!). But this year, your reviews led me to doing my research first, and I have decided to make the switch to H&R Block's software. Instead of giving Intuit my money and then getting the free offer from H&R Block if Turbo Tax does not work for me, I'm just buying H&R Block and skipping TT completely, likely for good! I appreciate H&R Block's offer to actually help people out for free if they are let down by Intuit, so will spend my money with them instead.

title: Bye-Bye Intuit. Sad and aggravated as my 20-years with turbotax is over.
content: Thanks for flagging Intuit's bait and switch. What they didn't realize is that longtime customers like me, who have used their product for 20 years just plug and play each year. I used premier for 10 years ago due to a rental property and for the last 10 have used deluxe for investments. I was about to pull the trigger on 2014, when I read all this. Now, instead of just buying their software, I'm so pissed I spent the last hour reviewing other software, including H&R Block. It seems people are having good luck with it, including importing. I'm nervous about it, and don't want to learn new software, BUT, intuit has blown 20 years of loyalty in just a couple of weeks. Your exec team should be fired.....

title: No more Turbotax for me; Need schedules C, D and E
content: I have been buying and using Turbotax for some 20 years. All of a sudden, the fullsize 'car' you have been leasing every year is now being reduced to a Yugo - and without telling you up front. Wow, if Turbotax thought they were going to sucker everybody into buying an upgrade after discovering that the version they have been using been using for 20 years no longer supports the same functionality, they are sadly mistaken. The executives can make up whatever BS they want to rationalize it, but we really know what's going on. Do not purchase.

title: Intuit is still playing games
content: I purchased this product elsewhere but am in the same boat as everyone else. I wanted to note that as of 2/2/2015 Bob Meighan's (VP, TurboTax) statement here on amazon that the automatic free upgrades from inside the installed product will commence on February 7 appears nowhere else on the web, including intuit's own website, and that his rebuttal comment on amazon that "We will be communicating this to customers in the coming days." is not happening. At the very minimum, there should be an indication on the intuit home page and their turbotax home page as to the status of this free upgrade. But no such status exists there or anywhere else as of 2/2/2015 except his statement here on amazon. Thus the great bulk of TT Deluxe customers are still completely in the dark about the supposed free upgrade that is coming. Additionally, on the turbotax homepage, which includes purchase and download functions for the different versions, they claim they've reduced the prices by $25.00, EXCEPT these versions DO NOT include the state taxes AND it costs and extra $37.00 if you want the state taxes, something that has ALSO been included in the boxed versions for several years. Thus there is no price drop at all, but actually a price INCREASE! Clearly intuit has still learned nothing at all from this fiasco regarding treating their long time and loyal customers with integrity, and continues to play bait and switch games.

title: Good Bye to customer abuse
content: I have used TT every year since it was introduced. Thank you to all those who took the time to give feedback. Like most have said, it ain't so much the money as it is the attitude and lame self centered explanations. Bought H&R yesterday instead. Looks good so far.

title: Dont like all the extras they try to sell making it ...
content: Simple tax form. Charge was suppose to be 39.95. Instead charged 60.35. Dont like all the extras they try to sell making it harder to navigate. Only reason i used it was because of health care changes. Ill never use again. Id give no stars, but dont have that...

title: Intuit's Brand-Destroying, Boneheaded Money Grab
content: Longtime user, first time hater. The degraded deluxe is a crass money grab that would and should fail spectacularly. A few years from now there will be a Harvard Business School case study featuring Intuit's move as among the greatest brand-destroying bungles in recent business history. Hope the short terms profits were worth it (if there even are any). Silly silly Intuit. And for all those thinking they are wedded to Turbotax because you've used it for years, the H&R Block program (which is cheaper and very similar to Turbotax) will automatically upload any data you need from previous Turbotax returns. It walks you through your return just like Turbotax. See ya Turbotax.

title: A very disappointed long-term TurboTax customer
content: If I could give this zero stars, I would. I have been a loyal TurboTax customer for many, many years. Offering a crippled version and trying to sell me something more expensive in order to have the functionality I used to have is totally unacceptable. Today I got an email from "Sasan Goodarzi and the TurboTax Team, General Manager, Intuit TurboTax" that was sent to everyone on their mailing list giving a non-apology apology. Their offer to make things right is to give a $25 refund, but with several strings attached, including actually filing 2013 and 2014 with TurboTax, and to apply for this $25 before 11:59 PM PST April 20, 2015. Several problems with this "offer": 1. I prepare my taxes with TurboTax as a way of communicating essential information to my accountant, who then uses his own software to file the actual returns. I find this handy to do and it has worked for me. 2. I almost never file by the deadline - I almost always obtain an extension. I am sure others do the same. 3. $25 does not equate to spending what is needed to get the uncrippled version suitable for my needs. Moreover, it is a bother to have to do this. My solution: 1. I actually bought the product from Costco - I will now return it. 2. I will look at alternatives, including just creating a spreadsheet of information for my accountant and leave it at that. Apparently H&R Block is offering a free download of their federal/state software for those who have purchased TurboTax.

title: Previously loyal customer who is now looking forward to a change
content: Like so many reviews here, I have been a loyal customer for 15+ years. Faithfully buying TurboTax year after year. I guess I should thank Intuit for changing up my routine and introducing me to H&R Block. This will be the first year that I try a different tax product. I find myself really hoping that I like the H&R block software so that I can put TT behind me. This sort of low consideration for their user base is not new to Intuit. I also get very annoyed when existing functionality in Quicken gets turned off (ie download transactions) when the product reaches a certain age. As consumers, the most powerful weapon we have is to vote with our wallet.

title: I wish there were some way to give a zero ...
content: I wish there were some way to give a zero star rating. I have been a customer for over 10 years but will not buy it again! A 50% jump in price is just too much, considering I need to buy the more expensive product to get what I have always gotten.

title: I've used turbotax since the 1990's and I was satisfied with their product
content: I've used turbotax since the 1990's and I was satisfied with their product. I choose not to use turbotax, at least for the foreseeable future. No apology or rebate will change my mind. My trust in this company no longer exists.....

title: Not worth the risk..
content: I've used TurboTax for easily over a decade, and I'm sad to see that Intuit has crippled what was a very nice product. 2014 was a very busy year with all sorts of changes and new events in my life, and I don't see why I would risk purchasing this so-called "Deluxe" package when a very well might need schedules that are no longer available (and yes, being available to print and mail means no longer available for all practical purposes). I can't find any justification for purchasing such a cripled product when H&R offers all that I need for a better price. It appears that H&R Block has a chance to win over many angered customers this year, and is already doing so.

title: Just like everybody else
content: Just like everybody else, the changes to Deluxe are unacceptable. I've used TT for about 20 years. I need support for Schedule C, D, and E, and no longer have that with the 2014 Deluxe version. My wife bought a $106 printer for her home business. Since it's more than a $100 expense I'm supposed to know to buy Home and Business instead of Premier? Really? I predict this will be fixed next year, and the Product Manager for TT will be looking for a new job. If not, I will seriously look at an alternative.

title: "Deluxe" has been Neutered
content: Wow, not even investment features. It really takes nerve to call this "Deluxe". Intuit has neutered this product in a bid to force thousands of loyal customers to pay significantly more for the next level product. It's a good lesson on how important it is to keep one's options open. I hope everyone will seek alternative options. I'd hate for this kind of deceitful greed to pay off for Intuit. I also feel bad for all of those people who will buy Deluxe not knowing it's been downgraded.

title: Turbotax apology too late for me!
content: After seeing the reviews and ire about the changes, I didn't even bother with Turbotax this year after many mostly happy past experiences. We'll see how my new H & R Block program works soon. I'm looking forward to something new.

title: The Intuit management is the best sales team ever, - For H&R Block and TaxAct.
content: I hope the genius's at Intuit enjoy their big fat bonus's this year because it will be their last. For 15 yrs I've used TT Deluxe and now when I get ready to enter my schedules, boom, must purchase MORE SW. When you screw over your customer base in such an underhanded method, not only do you piss people off now, you piss them off forever. Even if they did fix this,(which I doubt) just the thought of a company so brazenly ruining their own business proves a couple of things. It's a very poorly managed company and bad SW/products are sure to follow. After reviewing other tax SW, I have purchased the TaxAct Deluxe Version. BuBye TT............

title: Phew! I didn't buy it!
content: I am VERY glad I started noticing the low ratings on the Turbo Tax software and checked them out! I also have been a TT customer for 10+ years. The last couple years I noticed the product had started getting more pricey, but used it anyway because I was comfortable with it. However, after seeing all these reviews about them not including certain schedules this year that use to be there, I took a leap out of my comfort zone and bought the H&R block product instead. I am hoping for a good experience with them. Not going to be a good tax year for you Turbo Tax if you keep screwing your customers like this....

title: H&R Block product may not be as good but Intuit's handling of this will make me their ...
content: Longtime turbotax user but this will be my last time ever. Unfortunately I already bought the deluxe product before knowing about the changes made as discussed in other reviews, Turbotax's response that they wanted consistency fails to address the fact that they could have adjusted the pricing as well, but chose to deceive customers into thinking the product was as it had been in prior years. I have registered and provided my e-mail many times over the years, and yet nothing was received from Intuit as a heads up to the changes. H&R Block product may not be as good but Intuit's handling of this will make me their customer.

title: turbotax rip-off
content: Intuit has changed their product pricing structure in order to squeeze more money out of their customers. I can no longer use TT deluxe because it does not support the schedules that it used to support. The pricing of this product has inflated over the years that I have used it. This latest move by Intuit is the last straw for me, I am going to do my taxes manually from now on, and file hard copy. I have rated it 1 star. I would rather rate it zero stars, but the interface is not making it easy to do that.

title: Last year of buying TurboTax, you got me this ...
content: Last year of buying TurboTax, you got me this year, as I had to return the Deluxe version and buy the Premier version because of schedule D. I thought you could be trusted, but no, you had to sneak this in. Former loyal customer.

title: Good Riddance!
content: I've used TurboTax for over 10 years but just switched to H&R Block on principle. Not only did Intuit spit in our faces with their shameless bait & switch, their "apology"/refund offer was insulting and unacceptable. Guess what Intuit? You need us more than we need you and I'll NEVER go back because I refuse to support any business that treats me as you did. I'll also encourage any of my family and friends who haven't already dumped you to do so ASAP. Good riddance!

title: Lost another lifelong customer.....
content: I was at Sams Club picking up TurboTax Deluxe (I already had it in my hand and walking to the cash register), just like I have done every year since I can remember. Another customer walked by and made a comment that I might want to reconsider. I thought he was crazy or at least he didn't know what he was talking about, I have used it for many years and even do my children's taxes every year. Just to be safe, I but it back and went home straight to my computer. I STILL COULD NOT BELIEVE IT. After reading all the reviews here on Amazon I finally convinced myself that they had violated my trust. As soon as I finish this review, I will return to Sam's to see if they sell H&R Block. I never really paid any attention as to what others there were to chose from as I was a life-long, extremely loyal, TurboTax user. That ended today! I wish them well as they try and force their loyal user base into into paying twice as much for the features as the Deluxe plus the other stuff they no not need. I guess if they charge twice as much for the same functionality and lose half their customers, they break even. Time will tell as people vote with their wallets. I vote "no".

title: If I could give this zero stars I would. ...
content: If I could give this zero stars I would. I've been a loyal customer for years and years. I read all the negative posts here, but after reading the update from the VP saying that we would be able to upgrade to Premier at no cost on the 7th, I went ahead and purchased. Well, today is the 7th and when I try to upgrade it still tries to get me to enter credit card info so they can charge me. They lied. I gave you guys a second chance because of past products, but never again. DO NOT BUY this product.

title: More money Less Forms....buy Turbo Tax Deluxe than get free upgraded software from H&R Block.
content: Thanks for selling me the same software I've used for 11 years but REMOVED the (2) forms i need to do my taxes. Thank goodness a google search and reading the reviews here (I should have do that first) H&R Block came to my rescue. Although their software is new to me, at least it was FREE and included the forms I need. Maybe they will have me as a paying customer next year if you don't fix the issue you created for me this year. But since I won't have the neat Turbo Tax import feature next year maybe you lost me for good!

title: Coca Cola also once thought New Coke was a good idea
content: I've been a TT user since it came on 3.5" floppies. This marketing fiasco reminds me of the New Coke days - for those of you not old enough to remember, Coca Cola once thought it was a good idea to replace something everyone loved with something nobody loved. Like most companies, such a pricing decision cannot be made without an impact/ benefit analysis. It is clear that after the numbers were crunched, TT product management decided alienating what they call a "small segment" of their customer base was an acceptable risk to justify this pricing / packaging change. It is also clear that their statement of "listening to our customers" is not the complete truth, it's more like "listening to our customers (depending which segment they reside in)". TT could take a page out of Amazon's playbook where customer loyalty is a key factor in their business decisions. I cannot state how many times Amazon has gone out of their way to resolve my issues by doing what was best to keep me as a loyal customer, even if Amazon lost some revenue as a result. Even with their recent offers of rebates / free upgrades, I remain unconvinced if TT is serious about adopting a culture of truly putting customers first.

title: It looks to me like the latest one is to add back the 2013 ...
content: Oh my what a mess. TT continues to come up with ways to "fix" their repackaging nightmare. It looks to me like the latest one is to add back the 2013 Deluxe features back into the 2014 Deluxe software, but still charge the Premier price for the 2014 Deluxe software. So ultimately they are getting the customers to pay the increased fee like they wanted in the first place. Incredible. Good bye TT, hello H&R. Way cheaper and it imports old TT files. Very sad that TT is treating their customers like this.

title: like many others have been a long time TurboTax user
content: I, like many others have been a long time TurboTax user. I got my entire family hooked on it over a decade ago. I am returning the copy I just purchased and making the switch to TaxAct. And to be honest, the email attempt from Intuit's TurboTax General Manager indicating "we made a mistake..." is almost as annoying to me as their claimed "mistake". They attempted to take advantage of their loyal user base by doing this (as changing tax software comes at a significant time/effort cost), and now that reviews and other public forums have called them out quite appropriately. And now they are trying to act like they're good corporate citizens, which is rather insulting. It's as if someone who got caught trying to steal a candy bar all of a sudden saying, "... sorry I made a mistake". All he really means is, I'm sorry we got caught and so publicly called out and humiliated for it. And if social media and other avenues didn't exist, believe me the "apology for a mistake" would never have come out. TurboTax dominates this market and they should have stuck with their initial business model. They got greedy and tried to take advantage of their user base. For that, goodbye TurboTax, I am no longer one of your faithful users....

title: Intuit failed to do the Math: Greedy Management + Stupid Decision to Cripple Software = Lost Customers
content: Thank you to all who posted reviews. I've used TurboTax as long as I can remember. The screenshot I've attached to this seems to have disappeared but when you get to the investment income section it forces you to make a decision on upgrading. So you have a choice - you can pay an extra $30 bucks to upgrade, you can beg Turbotax to give you the premiere version or you can return the software and switch to H&R block or another competitor for less than the cost of the upgrade by itself. Incredibly stupid management decisions should never be rewarded and I should not have to beg for an upgrade. Plus the spin on this "consistency" thing is laughable (they said they did this to be consistent across their platforms...really!). Inuit obviously thinks their customer base is highly gullible. This "deluxe" software is being returned and H&R Block is getting my money this year... and probably next year and probably the year after that.

title: Using Intuit since 1992, time to say goodbye.
content: Used TurboTax since the 90's. Over 4 different small (and I mean small) businesses. Investments, rentals, etc. Lived and loved it. Now for the 2014 year I have a meager $100 of investment and small business income I will have to file for ,after closing down some things in Jan last year. TT wants to charge $50+ more to do so. I have never had a reason to change in the past, despite TT being a little more than competitors. Now they have made the choice easy. Goodbye Intuit. Signed Customer since 1992.

title: Finally pushed far enough to make the switch
content: Each year I buy turbotax and each year I think it is of questionable value for what it costs. But I look at the options and decide to go with it for another year. And I usually buy the newer Quicken at the same time. This year I came out to Amazon to once again buy Turbotax, but after looking at what is happening, I decided this year I would finally make the switch. I bought the H&R Block product, downloaded and installed, and imported my last year's TT file. So far everything is looking good. Been using TT since the mid-90's but not anymore.

title: TurboTax versions now more complicated than the actual taxes...
content: I cannot count the number of years I have used TurboTax, simply because it knows what I need every year without entering a lot of data and asking a lot of questions. Frankly, I'm reviewing this without having bought 2014 because I can't figure out what I need from the way-too-many-versions list. The changes, explanations, and counter-explanations are to the point that I don't even know what's true now vs. yesterday vs. rumor. My dad has always used TaxCut, and I think this is the year to give it a try. #majorfail

title: The negative reviews have helped free market choice. Thanks to all.
content: All the negative reviews have been vindicated. I went from a 6 years TurboTax users to my first year buying Tax Act. Take that chumps! Thank you to all the negative reviewers about deluxe and schedules not being included. I went elsewhere thanks to you. Viva la free market competition! Oh yea...and what are the odds I'll go back to TurboTax next year after figuring out the learning curve this year for Tax Act...ha ha, nil.

title: SwitchToBlock@hrblock
content: According to H&R Block, many of the federal forms and schedules that are no longer included in TurboTax Basic or Deluxe are still included in H&R Block software at no additional charge. To take advantage of the promotion, the company advises customers to send an email to SwitchToBlock@hrblock.com and include the following information: â¢Name, address, and phone number â¢Type of operating system in use (Windows/Mac) â¢A photo, scan, or email showing proof of TurboTax Basic or Deluxe purchase

title: Avoid TurboTax and switch to a different product if you can
content: With the crippling and removing of important forms for e-filing in TurboTax Deluxe, like Schedules C, D, and E, I am rating this one star. I use to use this product but I can't anymore. Avoid TurboTax if you can and go with a better product that doesn't try to gouge you with surprise upgrade fees when you are doing your taxes. If you are able to easily move from TurboTax, than take advantage of that and switch now before you get locked in and it becomes more complicated to switch. And don't forget that Intuit has lobbied Congress in the past to kill any chance of simplified IRS tax filing. You can probably guess why they would not want people to quickly and easily be able to file their taxes without their software. Search Google for "Intuit lobbying congress against simple filing" and "Corruption Is Why You Can't Do Your Taxes in Five Minutes" for more info.

title: Dear One Star Reviewers...
content: Dear One Star Reviewers, Thank you for taking the time to post your one star reviews. I have been using TurboTax for many, many years. This is the first year I will opt for H&R Block and will persuade all my friends and family to make the switch as well. Consumer Reports is reporting options for the disgruntled TurboTax users at the following link: http://www.consumerreports.org/cro/news/2015/01/what-to-do-if-you-re-affected-by-turbotax-changes/index.htm Attention Bob Meighan: I would like to address your comments to the reviews with...Really? What kind of fools do you take us for? There is only so much we customers will take before you lose our loyalty and respect. For the last several years, I have noticed an increasing amount of shenanigans with your TurboTax product. This is the last straw for me. Just stop the commenting. The correct course of action is to just raise the prices on your products. Don't force customers to upgrade in order to get the features they were expecting and had used in previous versions.

title: Fine, so I filled out my tax return and ...
content: Used the online edition and expected to be charged after the fact, since they didn't charge me before. $30 some odd dollars for Deluxe. Fine, so I filled out my tax return and went to file. Suddenly Tubotax has decided I'm no longer paying $30 some odd dollars, but instead they want to charge me almost $80. In the past, Turbotax used to let you know when a form you were filling out would mean an upgrade - early on. Now, they seem to allow you to fill it out, and don't tell you until you are about to file that OOPS - you need to upgrade. That will cost you triple what you thought you were going to pay. Turbotax, you're new ways suck. You are driving away customers. All we ask is for you to be up front and honest with us. I want to know early on if I will need to upgrade to a more expensive edition. NOT after I just spent 2-3 hrs of my valuable time inputting everything. I also don't appreciate the fact that Deluxe no longer handles all the types of schedules they did last year. That seems like a bait and switch to your loyal customers. Decide Turbotax. You want to screw your customers and end up with less customers, losing the ones you have had for years? Or do you want to be customer friendly and keep your loyal customer base?

title: Guess it's time for a change.......
content: I just want to thank all those who have posted a review as this really helps me make an informed decision for preparing my US Taxes for 2014. I have been using TurboTax since the very early Chipsoft days and been extremely loyal ever since. Every year I would just grab it off the shelf at Costco or order it from Amazon without even looking at the box cover. It's been a great product and served all my needs "up-to-now". I was about to order it at Amazon and was vastly surprised at all the massive negative reviews. So I started reading - WOW - I am glad I did. A big thanks to Amazon for allowing individuals to post. I need the missing schedules and I will not pay 2x more for them as they have always been included in the past product. I hope that the power of the Internet will convince TurboTax that they made a big mistake and are losing customers. I will start to research other options. Best of luck to all of you in your filing this year and thanks again.....

title: Intuit is like a rotten banana - past its prime.
content: I am also a long standing user. I have records going back to 97 on my Quicken program. I am giving up on the Intuit Quicken and TurboTax. Ease of use is gone. Quality gone. Value of product nowhere near the price they expect. Please Bob M. no canned format reply. Reading a half dozen canned responses actually makes me think less of Intuit. Just accept you have lost market share due to a fair quality product with a stellar quality product price.

title: Looks like only a "small portion" of customers were dissatisfied with ...
content: Looks like only a "small portion" of customers were dissatisfied with the price increase from the forced upgrade, lol. I am switching to H & R after many years with TT. I believe you have an integrity problem, and back pedaling doesn't fix the extortion attempt. A very applicable quote from Sam Walton "There is only one boss. The customer. And he can fire everybody in the company from the chairman on down, simply by spending his money somewhere else."

title: First they stop including long-standing features while acting like they made "upgrades" to the software
content: Intuit really outdid themselves in their sketchiness. First they stop including long-standing features while acting like they made "upgrades" to the software. Next, they try to blow off complaints. Third, they try to offer a refund that doesn't actually cover the cost of the upgrade, even when they know exactly how much people paid for them. (Case in point: I paid about $33 to Intuit, directly to them through their website, so saying $25 is the average upgrade cost is hardly honest). Lastly.. after people complain even more, they offer a free upgrade. Note that it's only after people complained and they realized they were going to lose business. At this point,their apology doesn't mean anything, since you know they'll just be eyeing another way to gouge you in the future. Luckily, I took up H&R Block's offer to get their free software, so I look forward to comparing it for this year's return, and saying bye bye to Intuit next year. Good job Intuit. It doesn't take much "Intuit-ion" to realize that giving the middle finger to your loyal, trusting customers is a poor way to keep them coming back.

title: Shameful, surprising repackaging for so many of us!
content: I'd give TurboTax Deluxe 0 stars if it was possible--strictly with regard to the unfortunate surprising switch this year regarding schedule D. I've utilized TurboTax Deluxe for well over a decade and have recommended it to everyone who would listen, including my own mother-who has filed with Deluxe and the high dollar "TT Business" for the past 2 years. I suppose this year we will both begrudgingly be switching to H&R Block, since the Intuit decision was made to pull the rug out from under so many users without just admitting they were forcing a revenue stream into their coffers. I'm guessing from the outpouring of disgust via Amazon feedback many long term customers such as myself are indeed going elsewhere, so perhaps that Intuit income stream will not be so lucrative! There's still time to reverse your course of action Bob---surely you can understand the pain at our end....many will not be forced to Premium for more $$!

title: Turbotax: it's been a great 15 years.
content: Adding my voice to the chorus. Been using TurboTax almost since I started filing taxes: buying TurboTax has become a February ritual. Apparently Intuit thinks there aren't good competing products out there. I've done the research. There are. Sorry I have to go, but I'll bit the bullet this year and switch to something else. Also will start looking into alternatives to Quicken, since Intuit seems to want to cash out on their customers' loyalty.

title: I'm a long time user and my company uses Intuit ...
content: I'm a long time user and my company uses Intuit payroll services. After reading the many valid and alarming negative reviews, I'll be trying another program this year. It's a scary thought due to the fact that I have only used TurboTax for 15+ years! Has anyone else switched to H&R? How was it? Thanks to all loyal Amazon customers for the reviews.

title: 15 year customer gone.
content: I really appreciate the 1 star reviews this year. I was about to place my annual order for Turbo Tax Deluxe. I have been using turbo tax for about 15 years and although I was never 100% satisfied it at least got the job done. I felt "stuck" because it imported my taxes from previous years, and with the investments we have and the mortgage and daycare, etc. this software did a good enough job that I just accepted the annual $50 + $20 to e-file. It is a rip-off having to re-purchase software every damn year for a 1 use scenario, but I guess our government is more to blame for that. It is just a cost I accepted with a small dose of anger each year but what can you do? It is what it is. And then, I saw all of the 1 star reviews this year. I really rely upon and trust amazon reviews. If this many people are angry, then something is definitely wrong. Learning that deluxe no longer allows schedules C, D, etc. is a deal breaker for me. Big time. And learning that HR Block will import last year's tax form easily and is cheaper to boot is great news. So... I'm actually happy. I finally have a great reason to switch from Turbo Tax to a cheaper alternative. I'm SO GLAD that everyone voiced their opinion. You guys saved me so much time and hassle figuring this out for myself. Taxes suck enough as it is, if Intuit decided to make it harder this year then screw them. I'm switching. 15 year customer. Gone. Fire whoever made this decision.

title: Goodbye 17-year TurboTax customer, Hello H&R Block 2014 - ????
content: I would consider Intuit's handling of its software pricing changes the worst move of the year if it weren't for the Seahawks' play calling. (Just sayin) Bottom line: Used TurboTax every year since 1997, Deluxe as far back as I can recall but at least 10+ years. Putrid attempt by Sasan Goodarzi to "make it up" to their loyal customers by offering an after-tax-submission $25 rebate off their $74.99 purchase price of Premier. Instead of taking this *fantastic* one-time offer, I purchased H&R Block Deluxe for a whopping $34.34 from Amazon - free shipping. Installed in less than 10 minutes, including the download and installation of an update. Was able to use both Schedule C and Schedule D (included in the Deluxe version - amazing!). The software is easy to navigate and, just as TurboTax previously did, helped me select the most advantageous education deduction. Helped both my kids do their taxes and took advantage of the free e-file for all 3 returns (up to 5 free with the Deluxe edition). Intuit will have to step it up. I doubt I am the only parent helping to steer the next generation of consumers away from unscrupulous businesses.

title: Like every other company-customer loyalty is a thing of the past.
content: I will never use these jerks again. I have used them since the early 90's. They have gotten greedy and followed Netflix's lead. They (Netflix) lost a lot of customers when they jacked prices and gouged customers. They have, however, survived and, in a way, thrived unfortunately. The public needs to take a stand when this crap happens. When we turn a blind eye to these actions we encourage them. I bought their software every year-never a thought. Now, they have taken the low road seeking not customer loyalty but profit. Their brain trust has determined that after losing a certain percent of customers, they will make - no, exceed previous profits. We, the public, just hand it over to them on a silver platter. I know they must make a profit for shareholders but at what cost? I for one will not use them again. Even if they reverse this next year. Burn me once shame on you but burn me twice, shame on me!

title: Bait and Switch Not Appreciated
content: I have enjoyed using Turbotax Deluxe for 6 years and was expecting this year to be the same. However, as most of you now know, they decided to use the old "bait and switch" on us. I am not going to pay an extra $30 for the same features as were available in year's past. I think H and R block has a solution and once I switch, there will be no going back to turbotax. What a crappy way to handle customers. Did they really think we would just pay and stay?

title: goodbye
content: You blew it, InTuit! I used Deluxe for 15 years and when I was told I have to upgrade for an additional $30 (but then we'll give you a gift of $25 'cause we're really sorry) that did it. This was so poorly managed. Accounting software requires some trust and that is gone. I returned this thing and I'll try H&RB. I just got the e-mail saying you want to win me back next year, but that is going to be very difficult.

title: Goodbye old friend, hello H&R Block Deluxe + State
content: After using TurboTax for about 20 years and never once thinking of using a different software provider, I just made a seamless change to H&R Block Deluxe + State after realizing the bait and switch TurboTax pulled on customers this year (pulling the stock investment forms from Deluxe and moving them to Premium). Paid about 30 claims total for the H&R Block software, which was about half of what i would have paid for TurboTax. My download of H&R Block Deluxe + State transferred my electronic data from the prior year TurboTax file flawlessly and you know what, H&R Block Deluxe is just as easy to use and understand as TurboTax (with the added bonus of H&R Block Deluxe not trying to constantly upsell me on audit review services, etc.). My H&R Block Deluxe download comes with one state for free and 5 free Federal e-files. Perfect! I honestly never thought about switching because i never had a reason to. Now that I've switched to H&R Block and found it so easy to use and so much better priced, I will be sticking with H&R Block so long as they don't ever pull a bone-headed TurboTax-type bait and switch.

title: I am shocked and disappointed with Inuit's changes to their tax products for tax ...
content: I have previously used TurboTax for my tax returns for over 10 years. I am shocked and disappointed with Inuit's changes to their tax products for tax year 2014. I don't mind a small price increase, but intentionally crippling a product that previously met my needs and forcing customers to move up to higher priced products is very poor customer treatment. They must be thinking that there will be a small percentage of customers who complain and leave but that they will more than make up for the defections with a huge price increase paid by others. As Intuit's marketing VP suggested, I called Intuit to see how they would "work with customers" in my situation. They offered a one-time price reduction if you purchase the 2014 software directly from them, but made it clear that in future years, there would be no change or price concession. I am so disappointed with Intuit that I will not use TurboTax for 2014. I will only consider TurboTax in future years if there are enough people who respond like me and this causes them to re-evaluate their practices and customer treatment in future years. If you ask me, somebody should lose his or her job over their ill-advised changes for 2014.

title: This product is useless to me
content: This product is useless to me! Please do not buy this piece of garbage software! Intuit has become VERY greedy and has removed schedules D, C, E, F that used to be available even for versions below Deluxe version. This is pure corporate greed! If I could give this a zero star, I would! For more information read http://www.latimes.com/business/hiltzik/la-fi-mh-intuits-catastrophic-turbotax-20150118-column.html.

title: Long-Standing Customer Betrayed and Mad As Hell
content: Another Loyal Customer GONE!! I am a sole proprietor (self-employed writer) who's used TurboTax Deluxe plus State edition for as long as I can remember to file my annual return, which always includes a Sched C as I take the home office deduction. But some genius at Intuit decided this year that Schedule C would only be included in the Small Business edition, which costs twice as much. Did they really think all us small business/sole proprietor types wouldn't notice, or care, that we're being gouged for another $40 over last year?!?! Dear Intuit marketing geniuses: Either restore Schedule C (and D, for those who use it) or you'll lose your customer base to H&R Block. POSTSCRIPT: I called Intuit to register my dissatisfaction. The first person who answered the phone had no idea what "Schedule C" was, so I asked to speak with someone who had a clue. This second person offered "on a one-time basis" to sell me Home & Business, for download, for 49.99. So if you are an existing Intuit customer, and don't want to switch to H&R Block, give Intuit a call and ask for this deal.

title: H&R Block thanks Intuit
content: Intuit, you blew it. You are creating a windfall for your primary competitor, H&R Block. I have used TurboTax since the 90's, but due to the changes you have made, I am walking to H&R Block. Do not ever take customer loyalty for granted. You can build it for 20 years but lose it in five minutes. You have.

title: Greed + technical incompetence = failure
content: As many others, I have to upgrade from Deluxe as it no longer supports the schedules I need. To add injury to insult, it also crashed my PC while I was doing my return. Effectively doubling the price from 2013 and crashing my computer is not a winning formula for customer retention. After some 25 years as a yearly Turbo Tax user, some 10+ years as a Quick Books and Quicken user, and as Intuit's POS owner and Beta Tester I draw the line here and now. The TT 2014 version is going back for a refund, to be replaced by a competing product at half the price and double functionality. Quicken will not be far behind, the moment the support stops this April - the only way I know to stop Intuit's email and snail mail nagging to upgrade, again and again. I can fix my computer myself - can you? I can do my taxes and accounting without Intuit - can you?

title: Fool me once, shame on you. Fool me twice, shame on me
content: I too have been a loyal customer for the past 20 years. I just purchased the TurboTax from BJ's last night and download to my laptop with regret now. I didn't know the change TurboTax make this year until I heard the news from the radio this morning. So this will be my last year using TurboTax. As the old saying "Fool me once, shame on you. Fool me twice, shame on me"

title: A calculation by Intuit that was a huge miscalculation! How did the management buy this dumb idea?
content: For years I have been using TTAX, even from the very first year when it was called Chipsoft. The program was a lifesavor and worked well and was improved over the years. Intuit then bought the product from Chipsoft and they did OK with it for years. The product became more bloated and slower and also some great features were added. Unfortunately over the years it become more expensive and HR Block taht used be very inferior product also caught up and surpassed TTAX in my opinion and grabbed increasingly bigger share of the market by better and smarter packaging their products and features. You can buy their Home and business that includes their Deluxe home version that has all the schedules for most people including small businesses and then a separate Business version that can handle Partnership, LLC and Corporations and often time can bought on sale here at Amazon for less than $50. Intuit as a company calculated that they could quietly remove the features that made their Deluxe version a very good package for most people, hoping people then would be forced to upgrade so that they could even make more money. As it turned out that calculation turned out to be a huge miscalculation and they lost goodwill and loyalty of thousand or perhaps millions. I am shaking my head and wonder who was the genius behind all this gross stupidity or miscalculation. Intuit used to be a great company that was creative and agile and had a superb customer service. Their success and perhaps change of leadership has blinded them as often is the case. They have alienated their customer with arrogance and stupidity combined and had the gull to write to many customers explaining their rationale and why this was a great thing to streamline and differentiate product and they further aggravated their customers by only taking responsibility for not communicating these wonderful changes. Let's call spade, spade. They gutted a great prodcut and made it almost the same as the free version and kep the name and logo the same as ever and then wrote us and told us that a great accomplishment. They do get some credit, to finally realizing the error of their ways and after the mass exodu, huge revolt in their customer base and loss of much sales, they did what they should have done immediately. As of Feb. 7, whne you buy the deluxe you will automatically get upgraded to the Premier or Home and business for free and they have apologized and promised not to do it again and for next year the Deluxe version will be the same robust program as always with the form s and schedules previously available and supported and hopefully, the same price point. In my opinion, they will need something more dramatic, like free state efiling included or other things to regain their customers. I am so amazed how a bunch of smart businessmen and managers could concoct stupid ideas and have it to be approved through all channels in these large companies. Now, suddenly, the VP wakes up and apologizes and acknowledges their mistakes and offering a concrete solution. I already bought HR Block Home and Business from Amazon at a great price and stayed away from TTAX.

title: ... all obvious that this does not cover stock sales like previous years
content: It's not at all obvious that this does not cover stock sales like previous years. With a name like deluxe, I would expect it to handle stock sales, since it is common. I think it's bad enough with confusing wizards and bugs, additional fees to e-file state taxes, but needing a surprise upgrade without much warning is awful.

title: Warning: No longer same product
content: Will not order this year due to missing forms. Should be called Basic. Thank goodness I noticed the reviews before I clicked. Ordering H&R Block Deluxe instead. Turbotax was always a ripoff, but they just got too greedy to tolerate.

title: I have been Turbo Tax user for over 10 years ...
content: I have been Turbo Tax user for over 10 years. Sadly, their greed has caught up with them by not including schedules C, D and E in the Deluxe Version. What is disturbing to me is that these have always been a part of the deluxe version. I now have to do an upgrade to complete my taxes at an additional $40. Last year for Turbo Tax for me. Check out H&R Block premium version for the same price as TurboTax Deluxe. It covers all the above schedules.

title: Nothing short of extortion!
content: I was a loyal customer of TurboTax for decades now, and was using Deluxe version for filing income tax returns which included a single rental property. For 2014, the Deluxe version no longer provides Schedule E (for rental income), and tries to extort additional $30 for an upgrade to the Premium version. That's on the top of $50 I already paid, and additional $20 was willing to pay for the State e-filing. I consider this extortion! Famous gangster, Tony Soprano, would be proud of you, Intuit! Update on Jan. 2, 2015. After blowing my steam during my first write-up, I contacted Amazon and requested a refund for TurboTax Deluxe. To the credit of Amazon, they immediately emailed me a printable UPS label. So, I'm returning TurboTax Deluxe and buying HR Block's Premium at $31.99 which has Schedule D for stocks and Schedule E for rentals. Farewell, TurboTax!

title: What were they thinking?
content: It's hard to believe that Turbo Tax would not include Schedule D in their "deluxe" program. I've learned my lesson, unless they change it back next year I'll need to find a different program to do my taxes with as I'm not going to buy premium.

title: Stop do your research before purchasing
content: Think twice before making this purchase. There have been changes in the software that will result in you paying $30 in 2014 than you paid to prepare your return in 2014. I would go with H&R Block. Check out the article in the Wall Street Journal. http://www.wsj.com/articles/turbotax-provokes-revolt-1421427613

title: Upselling Scam from the Vampires at Intuit
content: I just heard on the news and read reports on the ridiculous, and sneaky changes that Intuit made on TurboTax. The unopened copy of TT Deluxe I purchased at Costco will be returned this week, and I'll go back to Tax Cut after many years with TT. I will not call your Customer Service to beg for a "free upgrade", if I wanted smoke blown up my butt I would sit at home with a pack of cigarettes and a length of garden hose... not on the phone with you. Good luck with your consistency across product lines and I hope you fire the vampire leadership of the company who made this extremely stupid decision, and not the employees at the bottom who probably railed against it. I will also be posting the Forbes article to Facebook and Twitter, and will warn anyone I know not to waste their money on this upselling scam.

title: A Stupid Marketing Strategy To Get More Profits
content: Like many others here - Intuit squeezed me when the schedule D support was moved out of the Deluxe edition for 2014 version. Wish I would have read these reviews before I bought the product. I had been a satisfied Turbo Tax user for many years. No more Turbo for me. Other reviews here have covered the issue in detail. I simply add my concurrence to their negative reviews.

title: Ripoff!
content: I buy the same cereal all the time. I don't read the ingredients list every time because it has always been the same as I bought before. NOT SO with Turbo Tax Deluxe! I read on Google News after I had ordered it that they screwed it up. I am NOT happy! I'm looking at H&R Block for compatibility issues, and I plan to switch. I don't like being ripped off!

title: Intuit Fiasco
content: I have been using TurboTax Deluxe since 2009 or before. Since retirement in 2010, I have been working on a consulting basis and also have typical stock transactions most years. Since I am very familiar with the product I purchased Deluxe again this year. Surprise! The functionality has been gutted. Won't work for me. Product should have had a warning label: "Caution, this product is not as good as last year and functionality has been significantly diminished." Called customer service and was promised free upgrade. After 20 minutes of screwing around trying to set up a download of the upgrade, the customer service rep had to put me on hold to talk to an Apple guy. After 10 minutes of holding I decided that it wasn't worth it. All I wanted is the ability to use the forms not all of the fluff that goes with the upgrades. Why would you screw with established customers? This is one of those incredibly stupid decisions that gets executives fired.

title: You've Got a Friend (at H&R Block)
content: I would like to thank the Amazon community for bringing this issue to life. This would have been my 20th year using TurboTax, but the vigorous reviews on this product coupled with confusing responses from the company convinced me it was time to move on. So, I downloaded H&R Block Premium from Amazon and I am happy to report it is very easy and very satisfying to use. For those of you looking for a quality replacement to TT, the H&R product is excellent, especially when one considers the under $40 price tag. All the schedules you want are fully supported without tricks, gimmicks, or embedded sales pitches to buy more expensive software. I do two state returns with my federal, and this program handled it flawlessly.

title: The arrogant and callous way the company treats its customers shows that the company does not understand that tax preparation so
content: I was a loyal Turbo Tax and Quicken user but from now on will stay away from Intuit products. The arrogant and callous way the company treats its customers shows that the company does not understand that tax preparation software is a commodity product and there are good alternatives out there. Purchased H&R Block Software recently. It is cheaper and works as well.

title: I would like to show my appreciation to the customers who have ...
content: I would like to show my appreciation to the customers who have reviewed the 2014 Turbo Tax deluxe product here, because I have been thinking that T.Tax has been getting too much money while giving less and less each year. Even with the Amazon Prime 10% offer, I just can't give in to the Turbo Tax extortion anymore. They duped me last year when I had to upgrade to Premier, which you don't find out until after you've purchased that you will have to do, after you're already invested. I almost dumped them then in protest, and started to pop extra to start over with H&R, but didn't. Now, enough is enough. I've been a loyal Turbo Tax customer since 1995. 2014 begins a new era for me in tax preparation software. H&R Block seems to offer the value that meets customer expectations for their base products. I understand that there is a point where they have to require a different model for customers. But Turbo Tax used to be rational about the forms and schedules one might need in their Deluxe product. I think they have abandoned a lot more customers than they realize. And now this one is abandoning them. It's their right to do what they feel they must and it's my right to walk away from their products. Just understand, it's because they have stripped the quality and level of appreciation that I expect and deserve. As long as I can find what I expect elsewhere, Turbo Tax will not get my business back because they have basically said that they don't care about whatever category they have me in as much as they do others. So be it. Apparently, H&R Block thinks my expectations are completely reasonable.

title: Was just about to order 2014 TT Deluxe. User ...
content: Was just about to order 2014 TT Deluxe. User since 1994, but not today. Thanks to all you reviewers, as the low review stopped me from ordering and alerted me to the deficiencies. I'll probably switch to HR Block, or go old school and fill out the forms myself.

title: Just like all the other negative comments.............
content: There is not much that I can add to all of the other negative reviews. I've used Turbo Tax Deluxe for several years and found it a valuable tax tool. Now I cannot express my disappointment with Intuit for not only jacking the price, but eliminating several of the key features of the Deluxe version. And then talking to us like we're all card carrying members of the Moron Nation. I'll be looking at competitive products to see if they can fill the void this year. Worst case will be if I have to purchase the Premium package this year and have a year to figure out how to dump Intuit by next year. I can't picture what Intuit can do now to remedy this major snafu and recover its previously loyal customers.

title: Goodbye TurboTax. Hello H&R Block
content: I have been using TurboTax since at least 1996. After the scam that they just pulled, forcing you to purchase a more expensive version of their product, I have switched to H&R Block software. While Intuit claims that they will return the disabled schedules to their Deluxe version next year, I have had enough. They have lost me as a customer.

title: No trust in the Intuit brand
content: I used TT Deluxe for over 10 years and just found out that Schedule D is missing when I wanted to enter. This is so sad that a company/product I trusted for years with my Tax return can betray the trust for additional $30. "Trust" is essential to the Intuit brand and I just can't believe the management at Intuit want to destroy their brand like that.

title: migration easy so far
content: Im switching too. 15 years and would have even paid the $44. But the truth is the "offer" for free upgrade is a one time deal (unless they completely fail). might as well vote with my feet to force a change, if there is going to be one, and might as well be this year to try a new package. went with TaxCut. migration easy so far.

title: Disappointed at Intuit price gouging.
content: like many others. I cannot believe TurboTax has forced people to upgrade. I've been a user of TurboTax for about two decades now. Since I graduated College in 1995. I plan on switching over to the other competitor company starting with the letter H.

title: Avoid like the plague
content: Avoid like the plague! Intuit disrespects its once loyal customers by charging you $40 more for schedules C, D and E that it included in past editions. If you can't innovate and provide more value for customers, Intuit, you shouldn't be surprised when they leave you in droves.

title: No way to raise prices.
content: As a long time user of TurboTax Deluxe, I purchased the 2014 version assuming it would produce the same forms as in previous years. I noted the rather convoluted 2014 âbrandingâ change (Deductions and Homeowners), but naively assumed the same core functionality as it was subtitled Deluxe. To my surprise and consternation, imbedded in the âfine print,â was the deletion of significant needed functionality and forms. Infuriating! I have never had a software vendor raise prices by disabling functionality in order to force an upgrade. I was tempted to purchase an alternate tax program, but to avoid relearning a new application this close to tax time, I dutifully returned Deluxe and purchased Premier (Investments and Rental Property). Intuit got their extra money, but I come away from this experience with deep reservations about the integrity of the company and, obviously, wonder what surprises are in store for us next year.

title: Turbotax Deluxe has changed - be VERY careful.
content: Thank goodness for social media. After being a TT user for many years I now learn that the Deluxe edition can no longer handle my schedule D investment reporting. I need to buy the Premier edition. The cost differential will force me to consider other options.

title: Just lost a long-time customer
content: I'm a self-employed consultant, and have used turbotax deluxe every year for around ten years now. In spite of some annoying interface changes over the years, and in spite of having to pay full-price for basically the same program every year, it's been worth it because of how much easier it is to do my taxes, especially Schedules C and D which I find too complicated to deal with manually. After reading the condescending and disingenuous email I received from them, about how great their new product design is even though it basically doubles my cost (as I'd now need the Home and Business version to replace what they dropped from Deluxe - note it still has sched. C but it's limited to a ridiculous $100 of expenses, while D is totally gone), and about how us customers just don't quite get why the changes are so great so they'll throw us a $25 bone (plus extra hassle to get it) to help us adjust to the new ways, I've decided to completely ditch the software out of general principle and try a competitor's offering. If the managers at turbotax had simply been honest, and either charged a few bucks more for Deluxe, or changed the name from Deluxe to Basic (and Basic down to Primitive or whatever), then I would have gone along just to keep my system the same as I've done for ten years. But this whole sneaky and confusing and greedy change affecting hordes of long-time customers like me, has completely turned me off to the company.

title: Really...?
content: It would have been so nice to be able to continue to use the tax software I was comfortable with. Hopefully the switch (H&R Block 2014 Tax Solutions) will be as painless as some of the reviewers have suggested. Sad, but I will use the new year as a chance to embrace change.

title: Another loyal customer goes elsewhere!
content: Since the beginning of time I have loyally bought TT Dlx and was about to mindlessly buy it again this year when I noticed overwhelming negative reviews. I thought, huh, what's so bad???. Thank God I read them. Turbo Tax and "Bob M, VP" you have LOST me too! No Sched D??. Sure, use forms mode and "mail it in"...YGBSM! Intuit, you have tried to scam the masses without fairly advertising how you significantly downgraded the product. I agree with one reviewer: you should call it "Deluxe Light" or maybe "Deluxe NOT!". You have lost my trust. I just ordered H & R Block's Deluxe for $26.99, includes all that TT Premier includes AND imports my turbo tax files from 2013. Later Bob M, VP Turbo Tax, much later.

title: Terrible program!!!! Do not waste your time!!
content: I need a thumbs down emoticon!!!! All city forms have a watermark that says "Do not File"" Form not Finalized". Paid $60 for this worthless program....and just paid $130 for a CPA to do our taxes!!! Bull crap!!!! This long time turbo tax user is done!!! One star because they don't give a zero star option.

title: I would like to thank all the reviewers that brought to my ...
content: Regarding the changes made to Turbotax for 2014, I would like to thank all the reviewers that brought to my attention the game that Intuit was playing on their loyal customers...like me. I bought the H&R Block Deluxe software this year as it has been very easy to use, I would recommend it.

title: Will Never Use Intuit Products Again - No Tolerance for Bait & Switch
content: I have used TurboTax and Quicken for my financial needs since the age of floppy discs, well over a decade. The one tactic I will never tolerate is bait and switch. My 2013 taxes are the last to be filed with TurboTax. Intuit has permanently lost my business, and the reasons why will be shared widely within the IT community. Sorry to see Intuit stooping so low, thinking consumers would tolerate such a move.

title: If you have a business don't buy it.
content: No 1040 schedules C, D, or E. I've been a TurboTax user from day one of e-filing but switched this year to H&R Block software which offered a free Federal and State e-file return with all schedules at no additional cost with proof of my TurboTax purchase. In my case the alternative was to use TuboTax and either manually fill out my own unsupported 1040 Schedules and file with the IRS via mail or pay an additional 30 USD. Neither was a option for me. Intuit's greed and positioning/baiting the customer (me) into this situation the CEO of Intuit Brad Smith should be ousted when a comparison of year-to-year sales is tabulated between tax years 2014, 2015, and 2016. I'm sure Intuit will see a drop because the only way you teach companies a practical lesson is to not buy their products or services. Unbelievable how some companies can hurt themselves. Good time for Microsoft to re-enter the tax software game.

title: Bait and switch
content: If you've mowed your neighbor's lawn for $20, sold a single share of Wal-Mart stock, or rented a spare room to an old college friend, this version can no longer help you. The appropriate 1040 schedules were removed because Intuit wants you to pay $90 for the next version up. What a ripoff.

title: Never again...
content: I've used TurboTax for the last 13 years. I even dealt with their DRM nonsense. Now, I'm done. I'll never buy another Intuit product again. I got H&R Block's software for $22.49 that does everything last year's TurboTax Deluxe did. How is that price gouge working out for you, Intuit?

title: I have been a satisfied customer for 18 years
content: DO NOT PURCHASE THIS SOFTWARE!!! OK. I did not read the reviews before purchasing TT 2014; why would I? I have been a satisfied customer for 18 years. Surprise! This years crippled Deluxe product version is no longer able to complete my taxes, and I was required to upgrade to nearly double the cost. I did not pay. I did call support and complain. The cost increase was justified "for consistency". Really? While I was offered a free upgrade this year, that does not address the corporate greed behind the change. I can not support a company that openly acts like this toward loyal customers. When Netflix did the same thing, I votes the same way and never looked back. I have returned the software for a refund. I voted with my wallet. Good luck, Intuit. I am currently evaluating H&R Block & Tax-Act.

title: TT stinks
content: Have you read the story in USA today? [...] The weasel worded "apology" from the TT GM gave the usual "we're sorry that you screwed up" answer. Now here's the real truth if he had the courage to say it: "You see, you people did not read the fine print well enough - you're so well, obtuse. We thought we'd be able to force you fools that's been buying our TT Deluxe for 20 years to pay us another $30 or so for the same package you bought last year by forcing you to "upgrade" (i.e. stay the same) to Premier. That would have been $30 profit clear and free above since the cost to us was the same. I thought I'd look like a profit guru and would collect millions in bonuses. I thought we could slip this by you." Now, here's the rest of what he should have said in his "apology": " I thought you'd lay down and buy it - I was a fool. You people were not as gullible as I thought. Now me and my company have egg on our face and have to spend millions in a campaign to get you to forgive us, just to get the money flowing back at the SAME LEVEL AS LAST YEAR. So, I may have actually cost my company money but hopefully some of you sheeple will still just lay down the extra $$ and buy Premier anyway, so we will at least be at a wash and not lose all of my planned profits. I'm hoping the board of trustees at my company see me eeking out a small extra profit - please some of you - just buy the Premier and don't ask for the rebate! "Further, I'm begging you not to switch to any other tax software. If our sales #s actually go down and TaxCut's go up, I'm toast. "The next time we want to increase the price, we'll simply increase the price! The board is already told us that NEXT YEAR, Deluxe is Deluxe!"

title: Quicken & TT are both fantastic examples of why competition is needed
content: Intuit has always been soulless. Quicken & TT are both fantastic examples of why competition is needed. It's sad that the Justice Department goes after Microsoft and Google for antitrust practices - but never says a word about the outright gouging by Intuit. Where is the consumer protection!?

title: Stunned by Intuit's idiocy
content: Thank you all for giving me a heads up. I am stunned learning about Intuit's marketing blunder....on par with Coca Cola's introduction of New Coke. I have been with Intuit/Turbo Tax since their first offering and it looks as though H&R Block is going to get many new customers in 2015. And this negative response is only the tip of the iceberg given the majority of Intuit's customer's don't know yet about the change. And to Bob Meighan, I say good luck keeping your job after the financial fallout.

title: Sorry, Intuit!
content: I have used TT Deluxe for many years but not this one. Just got email from Intuit re their screw-up on TT Deluxe. Too late! I already bought H&R Block Deluxe. Unless I have problems with the Block software I don't see myself going back to TT. Some "mistakes" are not forgive.

title: BAMBOOZLED - the new "Deluxe" version vastly different from prior years. Useless for Schedule C filers.
content: BAMBOOZLED. TurboTax, add me to the list of former customers. I've been a loyal customer for so many years I can't even remember how long, and I've been a staunch ambassador for your product. You now have basically DOUBLED the price of your software for anyone who uses a Schedule C, without really making it clear to customers that the software will not function for Sch C AT ALL without a paid upgrade. No opportunity to override and forge ahead without TurboTax assistance. Just a dead stop in the middle of tax preps. I wish I'd read the reviews before purchasing, but I, like many, have trusted TurboTax in the past and felt like I could continue to order the same product level I have in the past, without the need to read reviews. I knew your product and was comfortable with it. More importantly, I knew your reputation. Clearly, I was wrong. What I see now is a shady attempt to squeeze more money from your loyal and new customers. Epic Fail. You'll note the chart provided on Amazon lists Sch C on the Deluxe features (with a caveat of "limited"), so the response that you are now providing the countless customers who are posting negative reviews with the same complaints amounts to nothing but lame excuses. So here's my review: Deceptive. Greedy. Unforgiveable. Inexcusable. Useless. The good news for unsatisfied customers is that H&R Block is providing free comparable software ($44.95 value) to the irate TurboTax customers who feel deceived by Intuit's latest move. Get details here: http://www.msn.com/en-us/money/personalfinance/irate-turbotax-users-can-get-free-upgrades-or-jump-ship/ar-AA7Y2U9 The story is being picked up by numerous financial and software publications and shared across the web, and will undoubtedly lead to a massive loss to TurboTax, not only this year but permanently. Greed is not good. Goodbye, TurboTax. Hello, H&R Block. Signed, another former TurboTax customer. P.S. How's that greedy bait and switch working out for you?

title: H&R Block, here I come
content: Was just about to purchase the download version when I saw all of the negative reviews. Thanks everybody for taking the time to write the reviews and rate the product 1 star. It really grabs a person's attention when they scroll down and see 1400 out the total 1600 reviews are 1 star. Purchased H&R Block instead. Bob, I guess you guys still haven't gotten the memo yet: You're screwed. You ticked off a lot more people than you anticipated with these deceitful practices. And don't try to claim that you guys weren't trying to be deceitful. It was a scheme to try and extort more money from people who already paid for the product - expecting the same functionality as last year; and it totally backfired right in your faces. I just wish there was a decent alternative for Quicken RPM also.

title: Tricky move by Intuit.
content: Disillusion with Intuit on the decision to take out Schedules C, D, E from the Deluxe version. I purchased the deluxe version and when I listed the type of return I needed I got the message that I could not do that type of return with Deluxe version: Give me another $30 and you can continue with the return. My answer is: I will download the H&R Block software for $27 and I will get out of the TTax trap. H&R Block software seems to be very good, from what I read on their reviews by other people that have made the jump already, with 5 e-files free, one State and other help. No more Intuit!

title: Move over Edsel and New Coke, we have a new contender for top marketing blunder
content: Intuit, you have now gone into the marketing history books. Move over "The Edsel" and "New Coke", make room for Turbotax Deluxe 2014. This will be a case study in marketing blunders at business schools for years to come.

title: A disappointed long time TurboTax user who has even met Bob Meighan
content: I guess I am one of the legions of long time TurboTax users totally upset by the requirement to upgrade to Premier just to file a schedule D. I have used TurboTax continuously since 1992 when it was made by Chip Soft. I have even met Bob Meighan, the VP who has fielded all the negative comments. (Or at least I am pretty sure I did at a TurboTax Inner Circle meeting in Washington DC a few years ago). My disillusionment began when TurboTax dumped the Inner Circle.I guess Intuit figured out they knew their customers' preferences without the Inner Circle. Judging by the low ratings, this looks like a mistake. I think Intuit simply found a segment of the population that could afford to pay more and they decided to milk it. After all, with Quicken, Mint, and TurboTax who knows more about personal financial habits than Intuit? Who is this segment? We are older, have some investments, beginning retirement, and probably made some capital gains. We also don't understand multiple platforms (heck, one is enough to master). Further, while we pay tens of thousands in taxes, give thousands to charity, we still like to get a bargain by purchasing TurboTax at Amazon or Costco. This would not surprise any behavioral economist. Not surprisingly, this segment also includes the real long time, loyal, consistent TurboTax users. I would not have minded it a bit if the price went up $5 or so for all the versions, but the idea of a forced switch of products after 20 years is a low blow. What I find most incredible is the alienation of long standing customers. Most businesses value customer loyalty more than anything. Can you imagine having millions of customers returning each year.and now handing them off to the competitor. H&R Block is reacting aggressively to get TurboTax customers, and it doesn't seem to upset Intuit. One day someone will write a great business school case study on this. I personally am still undecided what to buy. I have never had this indecision in the last 20 years!

title: Can't believe how stupid this company is
content: Can't believe how stupid this company is. 20+years of loyalty by millions of customers just totally trashed by upgrade scam. Then to apologize and attempt to rip us off again by rebating less than the upgrade cost???! Gonna cost them millions in lost customers including me. Try a new CEO!!

title: Disgusted
content: Is it possible to give 0 stars? I'm disgusted with Intuit for removing functionality that we've grown to depend on. This is little more than contrived market manipulation in order to prop up Intuit's sagging margins. Sadly, Intuit used to innovate - now they manipulate. I've emailed them, and explained that in one week I begin my tax preparations. If I don't have a suitable answer by then, I'll move to another product permanently. How's that change working out for you, Bob?

title: TaxAct & H&R Block Deluxe Tax program are both as easy to complete taxes as TurboTax
content: February 18, 2015 Update: YIPPEE, today my 2014 tax return preparation is completed, was done easily at home on my PC, and was COMPLETELY FREE using TaxAct. Today I finished my 2014 tax return on my PC using the FREE downloadable TaxAct program, eFiled my Federal return for FREE with TaxAct, and my return was approved by the IRS within a couple of minutes. I have to thank TurboTax again for the 2014 TurboTax Deluxe debacle, as my eyes were opened, and I tried alternative tax prep programs for the first time in over 30 years of loyally using TurboTax to file my taxes. I discovered the tax refund amounts were identical as with TurboTax, and that completing my taxes with TaxAct were just as easy as with TurboTax. I will NEVER USE TurboTax again, and still have the convenience of doing my taxes at home on my PC, and eFiling with TaxAct for FREE. As a long time user of TurboTax since the 1980s, and a long time user of Quicken, I have been a loyal customer of Intuit. This year all of that has changed. While I purchase many items from Amazon and am an Amazon Prime customer, I usually buy my TurboTax from Costco, since it is so close to where we live, and I did so again this year. I was outraged when I installed TurboTax Deluxe and got the message that I needed to upgrade to TurboTax Premier. Even though I had opened and installed TurboTax Deluxe, I took it back to Costco and got a refund no questions asked. I then purchased TurboTax Premier, and was very disappointed in the greedy corporate ripoff to get more revenue by crippling their software. The more I thought about it, the madder I got. Intuit has done something similar with their Quicken products by requiring the purchase of a new Quicken version every few years to maintain the ability to download stock updates using Quicken. This move to cripple TurboTax Deluxe was the straw that broke the camel's back. I took advantage of H&R Block's free tax program for purchasers of TurboTax Deluxe and downloaded their free H&R Block Deluxe Program. I also downloaded and installed TaxAct software for free.
