I then entered my tax data in TurboTax Premier, the free H&R Block Deluxe Program, as well as in TaxAct. Both the H&R Block Deluxe and TaxAct were able to import TurboTax previous year's tax data, offered Taxpayer interview questions, and were every bit as easy to complete ones' taxes as TurboTax was. Since H&R Block is way cheaper, and TaxAct offers a completely free tax program, supporting all tax forms as well as including a free Federal eFiling, and TaxAct State eFiling only costing about $12.00, or a Deluxe TaxAct Package for about $20.00 including both Federal eFiling and State Efiling, I have switched to TaxAct for my eFiling. So even if I were to be able to continue using TurboTax Deluxe as in previous years, it still costs almost twice as much as other Tax Preparation software programs such as H&R Block, and TaxAct. Since I live in Texas and don't need a State tax eFiling, the cost of me doing my tax returns with TaxAct is now COMPLETELY FREE. Also, I took my opened TurboTax Premier program back to Costco, and got a full refund on TurboTax, no questions asked. Good Bye forever Intuit. Also,if one is an Android user, and possibly an iPhone user, anMoney offers a great financial app for tablets, smart phones, etc, that offers much the same capability as Quicken Mobile. So because of Intuit's greed over wanting to bait and switch customers with TurboTax Deluxe this year, they not only are losing me as a customer this year, but forever, I know many others are not only dumping TurboTax but also dumping Quicken and Quicken Mobile for cheaper more versatile financial software like anMoney.So Intuit is facing a double whammie over their corporate greed, losing both Quicken and TurboTax loyal customers of 20 -30 years. I hope Intuit enjoys their short lived attempt to get more money from their loyal customers, as it seems to have backfired and many customers saying goodbye to Intuit for good. 01/30/15 Update: I forgot to mention in my initial review that in addition to all 3 tax prep programs (TurboTax Deluxe & TurboTax Premier, H&R Block Tax, and TaxAct free version) being equally easy to use, for my 2014 Federal tax return data, the CALCULATED TAX AMOUNT & REFUND AMOUNTS WERE IDENTICAL in each of the tax prep programs that I entered my tax data to compare the programs calculation capabilities and accuracy. With identical tax calculations across all of the 3 most popular tax prep programs, it makes no sense for me to continue to use TurboTax and pay twice as much or more for getting the same results with the same ease of data entry with alternative manufacturer's tax prep programs. Also, when I returned my TurboTax programs to Costco for a refund, I apologized for any inconvenience, and was informed that all of the TurboTax programs that were refunded were being sent back to TurboTax so Costco doesn't lose money with unusable TurboTax returned tax programs, which was good to know since Costco should not be penalized over TurboTax's corporate greed costing them unusable inventory problems. 01/31/15 Update: Since TurboTax saw fit to try and do such a money grab on its long time loyal customers of Intuit products, specifically requiring expensive upgrades to file ones taxes via eFiling if their tax situation used certain forms, I thought it might be of interest to see just how much the powers that be at Intuit are paid. So I did some research, and went to this web site, http://www1.salary.com/Brad-D-Smith-Salary-Bonus-Stock-Options-for-INTUIT-INC.html , salary.com, which shows that As President and Chief Executive Officer at INTUIT INC, Brad D. Smith made $16,548,469 in total compensation for 2014. Also the above website shows that As Senior Vice President and General Manager, Consumer Tax Group at INTUIT INC, Sasan K. Goodarzi made $5,639,023 in total compensation in 2014. Everyone can draw their own conclusions about such executive salaries, but such salaries have to come from somewhere, namely on the backs of customers that purchase Intuit products, that I don't intend to use in the future after 30 plus years as a loyal TurboTax user. Thanks to TurboTax this year, for opening my eyes and motivating me to explore alternative Tax Programs from other corporations that work as well as TurboTax, and financial programs that cost less and do the job just as well as Quicken does. Thanks again, TurboTax, and GOODBYE FOREVER

title: Like so many others
content: Like so many others, I'm glad I read the reviews before just buying another TurboTax Deluxe like I've done for many years. Not even the Premier version will do what I did with last year's Deluxe version- I'd have to go all the way to Home & Business. Yes, I know I can buy the Premier version this year and call the 800 number for a "free" upgrade to Home & Business, but I want to join the others in sending TT a loud message- YOU'RE LOSING LOYAL CUSTOMERS WITH THIS YEAR'S CHANGES. I'm going to give H&R Block a try. To paraphrase Humphrey Bogart, "H&R, I think this is the beginning of a beautiful friendship".

title: I'm switching back to H&R Block!
content: Been using Turbo Tax for years without too many issues. But I need that schedule D for some minor investments. And no way am I paying over $30 for the upgraded product just to have the privilege of having that form. Huge marketing mistake, you don't keep the same Deluxe name and take away functionality. So H&R Block, here I come (I've also used TaxCut i.e. HR Block for many years in the past with no issues, so since H&R will read Turbo Tax files, it's a no-brainer).

title: "Deficient" not "Deluxe"
content: In the spirit of truth in labeling, this product should be renamed from "Deluxe" to "Deficient." Schedules C, D, E, F, k-1 are no longer supported in step-by-step data entry mode or for e-filing. Many long-time users report switching to H&R Block Tax Software Deluxe, which supports these Schedules and imports data from prior year TurboTax files--all at a lower price. In response to pervasive customer dissatisfaction, Intuit temporarily provided free upgrades from Deluxe to Premier version. This offer, in effect an unannounced recall, was made to customers who complained to Intuit. For more info contact Bob Meighan, VP TurboTax, at TurboTax_Advocate@intuit.com or call 800-445-1875. UPDATES: 1. Intuit is offering a $25 refund to customers who used TurboTax Deluxe to e-file a return for tax year 2013 and also used Premier or Home & Business to e-file for tax year 2014. After e-filing the 2014 return, customers can submit online refund applications at www dot turbotax dot com slash 25back. The application for refund must be submitted by April 20th. 2. Intuit president and CEO Brad Smith announced that Intuit will restore the deleted functions in TurboTax Deluxe 2015. To paraphrase Winston Churchill, you can always count on them to do the right thing - after they've tried everything else!

title: Well, I owe a big thank you to everyone ...
content: Well, I owe a big thank you to everyone that has taken the time to post! After almost two decades of using and loving Turbo Tax I have heeded your warnings and have switched to H&R. Thankfully, I made the jump before buying TT again, so I am ahead of the game. Thank you, everyone, and goodbye TT!

title: Shame on you Intuit!
content: I have been a long time Turbo Tax customer, for over 15 years. I too have finally become totally disgusted with the way this company is treating customers. Removing the schedule D capability is beyond my belief. I have switched over to HR Block software and will give it a chance this year. If I have too, I will pay to go in and have HR Block do my taxes, before I spend another dollar on any of this companies products. Inuit has screwed up one too many times and this is the final straw. Shame on you Intuit!

title: Time to switch to H&R Block
content: I have used TT deluxe for well over 20 years. I'm very frustrated how they dumbed down the deluxe version this year and force us to upgrade to premier for additional $30. Deluxe will not handle Sch C or D. This is absurd to offer a "deluxe" package that won't handle a basic Sch C or D. Setting aside the lost "deluxe" feature, had I known Premier was required, it would have been cheaper to buy Premier initially. I was not aware of the change, so now I'm stuck paying the penalty upgrade. Fortunately, H&R block is offering a FREE download to those that have already purchased TT Deluxe. TT's decision lost a loyal customer. I'm now with HRB !!!

title: Forced to upgrade for Schedule C and 1099 DIV filers this year!
content: I've been a TurboTax Deluxe user for many years but they changed the software this year and will no longer allow you to enter Schedule C or Dividend income without upgrading to higher levels of the software. I called and they said they would upgrade it for free this year but I would have to pay the higher prices next year. I just tried H&R Block Deluxe and it works just like this product used to work.

title: I will return both and switch to competitor products for good. I know it will be pain for first ...
content: This is called cheating. Apple took similar I-can-do-aything-and-get-away-with-it approach in early 90's because their PC products were so popular. They almost got to bankruptcy before being bailed out by Microsoft. I have been loyal user of Intuit TurboTax and Quicken products for last 20 years. I have noticed that they have been incrementally raising prices every year, sometime by reducing/eliminating discounts. This is the final nail in the coffin for them from my perspective. I have purchased both the products for current year but have not opened them. I will return both and switch to competitor products for good. I know it will be pain for first time but I will take it because I am fundamentally opposed to such business practices. I do not buy Apple products for their anti-consumer practices.

title: Switching tax software is like switching banks
content: Switching tax software is like switching banks - you hardly ever change as you are familiar with the current setup, it works, but every now and then you contemplate something better as service degrades. Thank goodness I stumbled across a news article about the TurboTax 2014 policy change. I was directed to the review site here and was shocked to read the arrogance of Intuit in their price increase. And to think I almost bought two copies this year - one for me and my daughter. Well, after 15 years of using TurboTax, I'm leaving and never coming back. Capitalism at it's best - vote with your wallet and in this case "online feet".

title: Kudos to the Amazon Forum... Good-bye to Intuit
content: Kudos to the Amazon Forum... Good-bye to Intuit I was ready to buy Turbo Tax again this year.. having used it since it's inception. When I noticed the low rating, I read a few of the reviews. Like many others, I was incensed by the feature reduction that was accompanied by a price increase. The "justification" written by the VP from Intuit only compounded my negative feelings. I applaud the folks that submitted early reviews that saved me from making an unwise decision. Loyalty to a product works in both directions.. from the consumers AND the providers. I think Intuit made a very poor business decision as far as retaining their customer base. I'm sure most people in business would agree that retaining a customer should be easier that getting a new one. While the impact to Intuit may not be fully seen this year, I have a feeling there will be many more disappointed users moving to a different product next year.

title: Too late. Already bought a competitor because of the ...
content: Too late. Already bought a competitor because of the price hike, then saw the news of Intuit's "mistake" that forces a pricey upgrade for investors. I thought Intuit - the premier accounting resource - was too astute for this to be a mistake.

title: Am I ever glad that I took the time to scan the reviews ...
content: Wow! Am I ever glad that I took the time to scan the reviews before effortlessly downloading TurboTax 2014 as I have done for the past 20 years. Can't remember a company trying to rape its customers as callously as Intuit is trying to do. No way am I going to put myself through the anger and torture of buying a once valued product only to be bitten in the butt by it. Thanks to all customers who actually purchased the product, were swindled, and then spent the time to warn the rest of us. And for your wasted $ I am sorry. But in the end you will win because Intuit will lose its loyal customer base. In this day and age of instant reviews and social networking a company that tries to gouge its customers just can't get away with it anymore. H&R Block here I come. You lose my $40 Intuit.

title: Another one bites the dust...
content: After years of faithful service, TurboTax is now forcing me to jump ship. My tax circumstances have not changed, nor are they more complicated than previous years, so why should I have to add $40 to my tax preparation fees for one small, rather minor stream of income that just happens to have costs associated with it? I could continue with TT and just decide to forego the possible reduction in my tax bill, or I could decide to take up H&R block on their offer of a free copy of their Deluxe version, which will allow me to do all that I need to do. As any right-minded person would do, I am taking the H&R route. It will be interesting to see whether the loss of customers like me from TT will be compensated for by the increase in revenue from those who elect to stay and pay the extra fees. An addendum: Intuit announced that beginning today (1/23), it will issue $25 refunds to "customers forced to buy the most expensive version of the company's software this year after buying the less-costly Deluxe version last year" ([...]). Yippee, now I only have to pay an extra $15 for the same functionality as last year's version, or I still move to H&R. It's an easy decision - why would I pay more for less?

title: Deceptive, greedy, corporate crooks.
content: Deceptive, greedy, corporate crooks. I have been a loyal TT customer for more years than I can remember. A fair increase in price is understandable, but what TT has done is disgusting. They have removed previously available option in Deluxe and made them part of Premier and essentially claims we're the stupid ones for not reading the fine print. It doesn't matter what the print reads. How the heck can you remove a steering wheel from a car and tell me I must pay more if I want a car with the steering wheel? This is some corporate finance strategist drawing up more ways to make money, while ripping off loyal customers. For the first time in many, many years, I'm looking elsewhere to file my taxes and I hope you will make a statement by doing the same. Do the extra work now, and you'll be happy later. Stay with TT and you are sure to get screwed over time and again.

title: I was very disappointed to learn
content: I was very disappointed to learn, after I purchased the 2014 version, that the schedules for investments were eliminated and i would need to purchase the more expensive Premier version to obtain that capability. During a telephone call with a Turbotax representative I was offered a free download for the Premier version.This experience definitely encourages me to investigate features and price of other tax software in the future. Turbotax states that the change was made to make online and retail-purchased versions the same. Seems that a customer focused company would have made the online version identical to the retail-purchased version and maximize customer satisfaction, rather than implement a change that attempted to maximize profits.

title: AFTER TEN YEARS - NEVER AGAIN!
content: I have been a faithful user of Turbo Tax for as long as they have been around. But NEVER AGAIN will I use them! I bought the "Deluxe" version. Why not? All versions in the past allowed you to fill in the forms as you needed. I had a basic return plus a fairly simple Schedule C. I did not need them to "walk me through" the questions about self-employment income and expenses. But it was a little harder to find the Schedule C form and supporting documents this year, but I did, and filled them out as needed. But today, when I went to complete and submit my "Free" E-File" I was told that my return "Contained forms which were unsupported by this version of Turbo Tax". Bullcrap! Of course they then wanted me to upgrade for another $40 (oh, thanks, you have been forced to send all of your angry defrauded customers a "cash refund" of $25 - it would be sent after I file - hah - no doubt a coupon for next year!). Well - I had discarded my packaging with the serial number on it after the program loaded well without problems! So I was not even allowed to fall for this extortion! So - now I have to print my files and mail them - and to add insult to injury my wife is out of town and so I will have to wait a week for her signature on the paper returns. I really, really like to file as early as possible to avoid ID theft scammers from beating me to it. This is crap, and I will never, ever buy a product from them again.

title: Not as advertised!
content: The cost to upgrade from Deluxe to Home and Business was 42.30. I will only get $25. of that back, and those who buy the software now will get the upgrade for free. I guess that is my punishment for planning ahead. I was a loyal Turbotax customer, but not any more.

title: Thanks for wasting my time, Intuit!
content: I need one line of Schedule D. I'm not buying. And what does this word "Deluxe" mean? I read most of the reviews. Bob Meighan, VP TurboTax, appears to have found steady work. Thanks for wasting my time, Intuit!

title: I purchased Turbotax Deluxe yesterday just like I've done for many years in the past
content: I purchased Turbotax Deluxe yesterday just like I've done for many years in the past. After arriving home from work, I downloaded and installed the software to start my taxes. To my extreme shock, I realized that although Intuit kept the same name of the program, it removed some mandatory forms which for the first time prevented me from doing my taxes. Yes, I've gotten used to Intuit's attempted up-selling in the past, which has always been benign. This time however is different. In a panic, I purchased the $30 upgrade for Premier. Yes, I read Intuit's explanation, which basically says: Yes, you've been ordering a Big Mac for the past 10 years, but your bad for not reading the ingredients which states that the patty is now sold separate! What makes me feel that Intuit's intentions are NOT IN GOOD FAITH is the WEASEL WORDING it uses to describe the changes: "We've made some changes this year to give you the best possible experience...". This wording sounds like an upgrade to me. EXACTLY WHERE IN THAT STATEMENT does it EXPLICITY SAY that the product has actually been GUTTED??? The money is one thing, but nobody likes to BE RIPPED OFF. I acted in good faith by purchasing this product faithfully just like I've done for almost 20 years. I don't think my expectations were out of line since the product title was exactly the same and lacked any disclaimers. Picking my pockets with INTENTIONAL CONFUSION is the thanks I get for my loyalty. I'll be using H&R Block from now on with pleasure. It's cheaper and gets the job done.

title: H&R Block Offers Free Software to TurboTax Users
content: For those of you who are sick of Intuits never ending money grab from loyal costumers, BLOCK WILL LET YOU SWITCH FOR FREE! To claim the Block offer, taxpayers must email SwitchToBlock@hrblock.com and include their name, address, phone number, the type of operating system (Windows or Mac) and proof of TurboTax purchase. The proof can be a photo, scan of the store receipt or the email showing their download code. Block will then send the taxpayer an email for one free download of its federal and state filing product.

title: More money, for less functionality?! No thanks!
content: Jan 2nd. Start of the new year. Time to purchase my Turbo Tax Deluxe as I've done every year. What caught my eye was the low review score. Every year, turbotax has excellent 4+ stars. So as it turns out, one would need to upgrade to Premier or Home and Business to utilized Sch C, D, and E. Furthermore, one cannot Efile with these Schedules unless purchasing an upgrade. The reviews and the VP have stated that they will offer a free upgrade this year. I am not looking for a one year fix. I think I will give H&R a try this year.

title: Don't encourage this deceptive behavior. Send a clear message ...
content: Don't encourage this deceptive behavior. Send a clear message by not purchasing any Intuit products. It's a free market and you can charge whatever the market will allow but when you're sneaky and deceptive about it, well........ HR Block here I come.

title: I'm glad I i saw this
content: Thank you to all who posted their one star reviews about the change in TT Deluxe. I have been using TT Deluxe for many years and usually just go onto Amazon and purchase it. Saw all the 1 star ratings, and after reading about the underhanded and deceitful tactics of Intuit, I'm glad I i saw this. I would have started my taxes and then been forced into paying more for an upgrade, all for something that was ALWAYS available in the Deluxe product. Big thumbs down to TT for not making this clear. Changed to HR Block. Will never go back. Now, if only there was a viable alternative to Quicken.

title: Add me to the list
content: Add me to the list of previously loyal customers looking elsewhere this year for tax software. I have been using TT Deluxe for as long as I can remember. I'm a home owner, have 1 or 2 stock trades each year, and share ownership of a rental property that requires a couple entries on a schedule e. Not an overly complicated return but I certainly need the schedules that have been part of the Deluxe package in the past. I'm just glad I saw these reviews(read everyone of them) prior to purchasing as I'm sure I would have made the same mistake many have made....saw "Deluxe" and purchased. If your going to strip that much functionality from a product then you can't keep the same name. When you buy the same product year after year you really don't expect to have to read through a bunch of marketing garbage to figure out what your getting. I'm glad to hear that H&R Deluxe will import my old returns as that's where I'm headed. Loyal customer lost. P.S. Also notified my sister and sister in law, both accountants who have used Turbo Tax every year too. I expect them to be changing as well.

title: Booo ....
content: Aside from a few horrifying glitches along the way and the fact that the field for total stock transactions still only allows for a $10,000,000 max. total (after all of these years), I've been a mostly happy customer for about twenty years. The software has handled "most" stuff and the interview style is useful for doing taxes in semi-brain dead mode. If they wanted to "bring everything into sync", they should have done it in the customer's favor and with a clear and upfront announcement, instead of bungling the change so badly. This has opened the door for me to somewhat reluctantly take H&R Block up on its free tax software offer, assuming it handles Schedule D, stock transaction imports, Limited Partnerships and auto-filing with no problems. I'll do the taxes a little earlier then normal in case I run into problems; if I do, my fallback position is to try and get the free upgrade from Turbotax and redo the taxes with that. For the future though, I'll be looking for a TT replacement, whether it be H&R or something else. Edit: Not changing my review but received this in my email, from TT: "Because you are a loyal TurboTax Advantage member, if while preparing your return, your tax situation requires any of the forms listed above, you will automatically be upgraded for free into the product that's right for you." None-the-less, will be experimenting with TAXact first ......

title: I appreciate all the great reviews and insights from other former TT users
content: I first became impressed with TT when a client brought a return into the tax office I worked in. I used TT myself the past few years but couldn't get anyone at TT to care that there were some programming glitches (one of which would have cost me an $8K credit I was due) and that I was charged $30 for an upgrade that wasn't necessary, and that when I tried to access the free professional tax help with questions I only got some generic "off-the-script" answer that was little to no help at all. This year I may use TaxAct or H&R Block. I appreciate all the great reviews and insights from other former TT users.

title: INTUIT SQUEEZING THEIR CUSTOMERS AGAIN
content: Have been a TT user for almost 20 years. Not the first time a foolish marketing decision was made. Am frustrated that Intuit doesn't recognize the importance of customer satisfaction and this change to the Deluxe version and the resultant feedback seems to bear that out. I am seriously considering an alternative. I don't like being held hostage. There are viable alternatives at a lower price point.

title: Another fee to complicate my life...
content: For over 20 years I have used Turbo Tax and for many of those years I have sworn it would be my last. I have found Intuit to be very intrusive and annoying with their marketing. It seems like they always tried to email me offers to purchase their product for more than I could buy it at Costco. Additionally, taxes are something I don't like to think about all year so I do not want them sending me offers and emails all year. I have been aware of free services for several years but did not make the change out of convenience and fear of change. On-the-other-hand, I almost had a heart attack last night after I had spent considerable time doing my taxes and I received a message that the program I was using was no longer capable of doing my very simple tax return. They were charging me 30 dollars more to upgrade to a new version. Certainly they didn't tell me that when I paid my annual 50 dollars for the same product I had always used. Once again they were trying to gouge me. Every year I felt it was a little excessive when they charged me 25-30 dollars extra to download another state's form so I could do my mother's taxes. I thought it a little excessive when I paid around 25 dollars each to file my state return and my mother's. This year's added fee was just too much. In the entire tax year (2014) I only traded one stock, one time. I bought 100 shares at a certain price and I sold 100 shares at a certain price. Not rocket science. I know when I bought it, what price I paid for it, and when I sold it. They seriously want to charge me 30 dollars for that simplistic transaction? The truth is the 30 dollars is not an issue. The issue is that they want me to download and install an entire new program for this one tiny transaction, knowing full well that if I download it I will spend an additional hour or two answering even more stupid, unrelated questions about my financial planning and investing that I have no desire or need to answer. There are years when I have had very complex tax returns and there are years like this year where they are amazingly simple. I have one income, one mortgage, no interest income, very little investment income, and very few deductions. I should be able to do this return on a cocktail napkin, but with Turbo Tax it is a very long arduous task of downloading specific versions and asking a million questions that have nothing to do with me as an individual. And now they want to make it even more detailed and complicated? TaxAct is free, as far as I know, and an article I found on Google ranked it as the second most popular tax program. Articles I read also said HR Block is offering their program free to anyone who switches from Turbo Tax. I guess it is time to make the change. I refuse to pay them 30 dollars to complicate my life. They should be paying me for the distress they have already caused me. I hate returning things, but I feel I will be going back to Costco and telling them the program did not work and asking for my money back.

title: It should be a good year for H&R Block!
content: This should be a good year for H&R Block and Lassers! Goodbye TurboTax. Intuit? Screwit! I've used TT Deluxe every year since the mid-90's as a useful check against my own spreadsheet versions, and to do my e-filing. TT should make it right with ALL their customers -- not just this-time-only sucker deals for people who call in. Next year there are not likely to be any "special" deals; it will be "we warned you last year"! If this is the kind of reward Intuit gives its long-time customers, I'm out of here.

title: 20 year user - NO MORE!!!
content: I've used Turbo Tax for 20 years or so and, while I didn't like the annual price increase, recommended it to all of my friends because it was relatively easy to use and handled everything I need. They have crippled "Deluxe" to make it unusable without paying for "upgrades." I hear the H&R Block will give me a free copy of their uncrippled deluxe version and people say it is just as easy to use. Goodbye Turbo Tax. P.S. Intuit needs to fire whatever marketing genius came up with this idea.

title: TT Deluse NO LONGER allows reporting of any stock/mutual fund/etc sales, must buy more expensive Premier...AVOID
content: TurboTax Deluxe 2014 does NOT allow reporting of any stock/mutual fund/etc sales. Must pay for significantly higher Premier version. After using Turbotax for 20+ years, I have switched to H&R Taxcut. Imported was easy, everything was picked up, carryover etc. I for one, will never go back to TT.

title: Loss of features/ forms
content: I'm discouraged that turbo tax is playing games with customer needs. Selling products at inflated prices with holes in usability. I refuse to play games, I vote with my dollar. I will most likely return my 2014 edition and start trying another software this year. Turbo tax has been forcing customers to buy a higher level version than they need for years. It has gotten out of hand this year.

title: I also would like to thank all Amazon reviewers for sounding the alarm
content: TurboTax...after over a decade as a loyal customer, I must respond with a firm "see ya later"! When a company removes functionality from a product without "clearly" notifying their customers...they will usually face wrath! I also would like to thank all Amazon reviewers for sounding the alarm, because I am one those customers who would have brought TT Deluxe without even thinking if it were not for you!

title: Bait and Switch.
content: After years of using TurboTax Delux, the function set has been reduced so that it no longer performs my normal set of transactions (Schedule D, particularly). Didn't realize it until halfway through entry when I was hi-jacked to upgrade for an additional fee, Looking at all alternatives, including going back to manual entry. I ditched Quicken 2014 over similar concerns. I'm done with Intuit.

title: Amazon users - thanks for the reviews! You changed my mind
content: Long time Turbo Tax user, and I was just about to click "buy" again for this year. The low rating on Deluxe prompted me to read the reviews. I'm glad I did. So long Turbo Tax. It's been great but I now see it is time to switch to H&R Block. I can't wait to alert all of my friends about this prime example of a marketing/revenue generation plan gone really bad. Intuit - maybe I'll see you again someday, but I'm not sure. This example of how you operate will make me think twice about any Intuit product for a very, very long time.

title: DO NOT BUY!
content: BEWARE! What a waste of time. Unable to file my return as you will be required to upgrade for a fee if you need to file schedules C or D. I have used TurboTax for years and switching to a new vendor this year.

title: Pure greed - worthless product
content: Thank all the reviewers for alerting everyone to Intuit's greed this year. Also, thanks for the helpful advice as to using H & R Block as a better alternative. Bye - bye Turbo Tax. I will not be upgrading to Premier or buying any more of your products. Thanks also to the Turbo Tax VP for convincing me to boycott your products. Your responses make one think that you work for a competitor of Intuit. You can't be serious.

title: Good by Turbo Tax and am really disappointed in Amazon ...
content: Buyers beware of this download version. In addition to all the other negative reviews of TT, let me add that I found it impossible to use this software. I have spent hours following Amazon's trouble shooting tips to no avail. I have downloaded TT in prior years with absolutely no problems. If your goal is to do your taxes quickly and not spend hours solving software issues find another product. Good by Turbo Tax and am really disappointed in Amazon regarding this product.

title: Don't let them gouge you!
content: Like everyone else I think I am also done with turbo tax. I was a long time user of turbo tax, late 80's I think. I truly do not understand the greed of these companies, I dropped Netflix when they did something similar and I am dropping turbo tax for the same reason. Done with them!

title: TT lost a loyal customer
content: I have been a very loyal TT customer for over 20 years. Most years I buy 2 copies of the Deluxe version. With the informative reviews of this year's Deluxe product, I investigated the H&R Block Premier edition and found out it had everything the TT Deluxe used to have, along with a State return and 5 federal electronic filings. You can also import last year's returns from Quicken or Turbo Tax. I purchased this product for $41 and am very pleased!

title: New name should be TurboCharge!
content: After numerous years as a satisfied customer...NO LONGER! The change in TruboTax business model to essentially take key, common schedules and split them to different levels requires the user to pay substantially more! The new name of this should be called TurboCharge!

title: Find any alternative to an Intuit product!
content: I have used Turbo Tax for years, hating Intuit each year because they bought out a little Iowa company that made fine tax software that sold for about 1/3 of the Intuit price. It is the American way: buy the competition, gouge the customer. They purchased Mint.com as well -- ending forever my use of that site. If you can find a usable substitute for any Intuit product I recommend that you do so! The company's recent "explanation" of changes to the Deluxe version is typical of their corporate culture: contempt for the customer, arrogance and a deep, abiding desire to achieve monopoly for their product lines.

title: In the past the standard Turbo Tax included the K1 ...
content: In the past the standard Turbo Tax included the K1 form. Now, you have to buy the 80.00 version for one form. Now, I own a piece of software I cannot use. I will NOT buy TurboTax again. TurboTax is getting greedy.

title: HUGE downgrade this tax year
content: Been using TurboTax Deluxe for 15+ years now, pretty much all of my years after college. Bought this version last week only to now find out that it's basically worthless without a $30 upsell charge to the Premier to file Schedule D or E. Intuit is losing yet another long and loyal customer to shady practices. Pro: used to be great Con: useless without $30 upselling fee

title: Switching to H&R Block Software after 10+ Years
content: I agree with the other reviewers, the 2014 changes are nothing more than a money making scam. I have used turbotax for as long as I can remember. I purchased Deluxe every year and it met my tax needs very nicely. It is of no use to me now that they have removed the schedule C and D functionality. I called the 800 number posted many times here by the turbotax vp. They simply told me I would need to purchase the premier version for $89.99. I am definitely switching to H&R Block software. As one other reviewer stated, I'm sure there will be a lot of outraged customers who purchase the software not knowing about the change and get stuck in the middle of their return. Bad move turbotax - Don't expect people to stick with you just because "That's what they have always used."

title: Read the (really bad) news BEFORE you buy!
content: All the big news services are reporting on this abysmal situation. Read before you buy. I'm not the only one who just said "bye-bye" to Intuit. After 20 years of getting gouged on progressively worse software for increasingly expensive Quicken, QuickBooks, and TurboTax, this year, H&R Block gets my business. FORBES *** Intuit's TurboTax Missteps An Opportunity For H&R Block *** NBC *** Consumers Slam Changes in Intuitâs TurboTax Deluxe *** CBS *** Hidden TurboTax charges have users screaming *** NEW YORK TIMES *** Users Say TurboTax Deluxe Is Less Deluxe Than It Used to Be *** USA TODAY *** TurboTax has bad news for investors *** WALL STREET JOURNAL *** TurboTaxâs Increased Cost Has Some Users Fuming ***

title: Another 10+ year turbo tax user making a switch
content: it's situations like this when you learn about a company, and intuit fails on all counts between the stealthy price increase and worse the disingenuous explanations. Fortunately others are responding to this in a consumer friendly way which is how it should be and the good news is past turbo tax info can be imported. I have instinctively used turbo tax for over ten years and while the actual price increase isn't much in the scheme of things, the way intuit handled it makes this previously loyal client go to other options. (h and r block)

title: How do I get a refund?
content: Been a very loyal Turbo Tax customer for so many years. Defended them while others left. This year as I'm getting ready to do my taxes, I am being prompted that I need to "upgrade" to the more expensive version. Everyone says to switch to H&R Block. I hate to believe it, but I think that might be the best option after all of these years. I want my money back.

title: Booooo!
content: I read the reviews and bought it anyway... why oh why oh why did I do that??? This version is a huge disappointment, a total headache, and completely ambiguous instructions, guaranteed to give the user fits, sleepless nights, and hours upon hours of frustration. It's not intuitive at all.

title: It is not the money, it is the arrogant contempt for their customers
content: I am a long time Quicken user (25ish years), and began transitioning back to TurboTax two years ago when I no longer needed a CPA. Deluxe has worked fine for me both years. Anyway, we all know the reason for the one star. TaxACT it is, and after tax season I will start to work on getting out from under Quicken.

title: TurboTax manages to totally alienate customer of 20+ years
content: I have used TurboTax for over 20 years - since before Intuit bought it. I was pretty much a blindly loyal customer that was too lazy to even try something different as long as I could get a decent price (although almost always higher) on an adequate product with which I was familiar. But the 2014 changes (Sch D for me) are just too much. For years, I bought Deluxe directly from TT. Every year they would reward my loyalty by sending me a repeat customer offer of an amazing $5 or sometimes even $10 off. I would then waste an hour or so digging around on their site to find a considerably better price offered to the general public. So so arrogant. As a retiree and a buy and hold investor, I really have a pretty simple return. I did have one stock sale last year which requires doing a Form 8949 and a Sch D. I see my options as: 1. Using Deluxe, doing the 8949 and D manually, and adjusting the 1040 accordingly. This would probably preclude e-filling, too. 2. Pony up another $25-$30 for Premium despite the fact that Deluxe is already more expensive than several competing products that will handle my return. 3. Take my loyal, lazy self on an adventurous leap to the competition. OK, it's #3. Goodbye TurboTax. Hello, H & R Block.

title: No Schedule C - Time to move to H&R Block Tax Cut
content: Sorry, I'm another user of TurboTax Deluxe for easily 15 years. If it doesn't fully support Schedule C any longer I need to switch as well. They have been slowly eroding the capability of this product in order to push people into more expensive versions of the software... this is the straw that broke this camel's back. The thing is that once people switch, they will tend to stay with a product for a while. I've stayed with TurboTax because I'm familiar with it and it imports last year's information. Once I switch to Tax Cut I will stay with that product for the same reasons.

title: The worest cheater in business
content: Intuit is the world largest CHEATER in its TurboTax Deluxe 2014 by forcing users like me, who have bought TurboTax Deluxe version every year for the last several DECADES to file their tax return with capital gain/loss. I can't even have state tax return in the 2014 TurboTax Deluxe and Intuit has the BALL to ask us to pay $39 to get state tax return program. One thing is for sure in our 2015 tax return, BYE BYE BYE BYE TURBOTAX!!!!!!!!!!!

title: One more voice
content: I can only add my voice to the others. My tax needs are mostly basic, but I do need Schedule D, and I like to Efile. I've loved TurboTax Deluxe and used it for years. But thanks to informative reviews here, basically confirmed by TT VP Bob Meighan and by the TT website, it appears my choices are to upgrade to Premier (currently about $90) or to switch to a new product. Somewhat nervously, I purchased and downloaded H&R Block's Deluxe program. While it may not have quite as smooth and readable an interface as TT, it gives me a tax program that will go where I need it to--that's all I ask. Maybe next year TT will be the better product--it isn't now.

title: Another "New Coke" fiasco
content: Did Intuit not learn anything from the 1985 New Coke fiasco? http://www.nbcnews.com/id/7209828/ns/us_news/t/it-seemed-good-idea-time/#.VMe9ty4o670 Update 1/30/2015 I am glad that Intuit finally came to their senses but for me it's too little too late. I have already switched to H & R Block.

title: ... Tax customer since forever and my tax return is pretty basic. After reading the reviews this year knowing ...
content: I have been a loyal Turbo Tax customer since forever and my tax return is pretty basic. After reading the reviews this year knowing I will be forced to go to Premier simply because I have to file Schedule C and it is the only way to do so with their product electronically, I will be switching to another product and not looking back. The frustration of having to convert and go to another product is not something I look forward to but since Intuit's forced my hand I will deal. Once converted I see no reason to ever return; I totally understand having to upgrade to a more complex product if my tax situation changed, but it hasn't, and if Turbo Tax can't do it at a comparable cost as their competitors consumers will go elsewhere. Too bad, Turbo Tax had me every year and I never would have shopped around had it not been for the change.

title: Looks like Intuit is no longer able to innovate so they're ...
content: I've used TurboTax Deluxe for close to a decade, having to check the product matrix to see that it still supports the same features I've been accustomed to for years wouldn't even cross my mind. I've been developing software for 15 years and we routinely promote advanced features down to our lower editions and come up with new compelling features for users to buy our advanced editions. Looks like Intuit is no longer able to innovate so they're resorting to gouging their existing customer base. So now I have to spend significantly more just to record a few stock sales. I understand I could waste my precious time calling support and they may offer an olive branch but what about next year? Time to look at alternatives. Bye Felicia!

title: Sucks big time. Turbo Tax just cost themselves a 20 year loyal customer.
content: Shame, shame TurboTax. I've been a loyal, enthusiastic customer for over 20 years. But you've lost me now. I just received this year's copy of TurboTax Deluxe only to find out the version is but a shadow of its former self. And is no longer sufficient for my needs. What lunatic in your company made the marketing decision to put out a bare bones version of TurboTax DELUXE ? Fire him/her immediately! Now I have to return the Deluxe version I just bought and purchase your much more expensive Premier version to do the same tasks I've always done with the Deluxe version? Screw that!!!! This bait and switch tactic just doesn't cut it with me. Admit you made a mistake and restore the features that made your product invaluable, trusted and customer friendly. But don't call this new product "Deluxe" when it is now just a stripped down version of its previous glory. Sorry, TurboTax, but I'm going to try out your competition this year. Make these changes and you'll win me back as a loyal customer. But until then you'll find me doing business with one of your competitors. So long old friend. I'll miss you. But you're no longer the friend I need in my life.

title: Beware- if you need Schedule C, most of you are about to get royally screwed
content: Same bug, different bite as the last review . Because of time pressures this year, I'll go ahead and pay Intuit's ransom for the ability to handle my marginally-over-their-limit Schedule C, although it's more a hobby than a bona fide business. Website at which this is "fully disclosed" (cough) says "we've made some changes this year to give you the best possible experience for your tax needs." Should read "we've made some changes this year to gouge the (expletive deleted) out of you because we think we can." Enjoy the extra $$$ this year, Intuit... come 2015, I'll be on different software altogether and, while you're laughing at how the changes you've made are screwing longtime loyal customers, I'll be chuckling at the notion of your never getting another dime of mine in future years, preparing to make the change. Great way to take a sector-leading title and drive it into the ground.

title: A former TurboTax Deluxe user
content: I will be switching to H&R Block's software. I do not need the forms Intuit removed but I am switching anyway because if this is how they treat their customers and I have been one for 20+ years, I do not want to be one anymore. Also I am not impressed with their solution, they are helping people out this year by giving them a rebate that they have to file for after they do their taxes, but this does not help them next year or any year after, big deal! This is how I see it: So in order to file my taxes, I will 1) have to do my taxes with Turbo Tax deluxe, 2) If needed I will have to spend more of my money to upgrade in order to finish doing my taxes. 3) You will then refund me $25.00 after I fill out a form and wait for the rebate, what 4 to 6 weeks? Or I can move to H&R's software that is comparable to Turbo's Deluxe, pay less for it to start with and not have to upgrade to finish doing my taxes, plus no rebate to have to apply for and then have to wait for. Does not seem like a hard decision to me. Good luck with selling everyone on your fix. It will be interesting to see how many user's you loose this year and next. A former TurboTax user.

title: But they should call this "Turbotax Super Basic" rather than "Deluxe
content: This product is a total rip off. I have been using Turbotax for 10 years to do my taxes, and I typically do a combination of salaried and contract work. Which means that I usually have business expenses that I need to write off. This year, when I was entering my tax information, I found out that they had removed all ability from this product to enter business expenses (I'm certain that I have done this in the past with the same product). The only solution was to upgrade to TurboTax Home and Business to the tune of another $40. This is ridiculous, but I didn't really have any choice because I was already most of the way through entering my information. If you have an extremely simple tax situation, this might be ok. But they should call this "Turbotax Super Basic" rather than "Deluxe." I've been using Turbotax for so long because I know the interface pretty well by now, but this kind of stuff makes me want to try another product.

title: Looking for alternatives to all Intuit products
content: I almost downloaded the 2014 version of TurboTax but decided to check out the issues, as I do every year. Once I saw how Intuit decided to treat its most loyal customers, I have decided to look for alternatives such as the H&R Block software which appears to have all the functionality I need (schedule D, SE) at half the price. I have also been a loyal Quicken user, but I am scouting for alternatives there as well. Recommendations, anyone?

title: Nice Schedule D you got there. It'd be a shame if something happened to it.
content: Ya know, I'm not exactly a high-roller "Wolf of Wall Street" stock trader. Maybe I buy/sell a holding a two a year, but now I need the Premier version for the Schedule D? No thanks - and don't bother with the "contact our sales team to address your price concerns" response. I've already read it in other people reviews - not buying it (literally). Not sure what you guys over at Intuit are thinking with this gouge tactic. It's not like your competitors can't import your file format or anything.

title: Older Operating System? You're Out of Luck!
content: I have bought Turbo Tax for a number of years now to do my taxes on my Mac. When the 2014 software came out, I happily paid my money and downloaded the software, only to discover that it requires OS 10.7 (soon to be 10.7.5). Since I am running 10.6.8, I'm out of luck, and won't be able to transfer my information from last year. To top it off, the seller (not Amazon) was rude and accused me of wanting free software. Hardly. I asked if there was software for older operating systems, got no answer. As it stands, I'm going to have to go somewhere else to get my tax software. Intuit dropped the ball on this one - a lot of us keep our older computers, and that should be kept in mind.

title: I hate being taken advantage of and taken for granted !
content: I've been a loyal Turbo Tax Deluxe user since 1999. I've loved the product and always spoken highly of it and recommended it to dozens of people over the years. That being said, I hate being taken advantage of and/or having my continued business taken for granted by any company. Turbo Tax has every right to do whatever they choose with their products, but I also have ever right (and intention) to do whatever I wish to with my future tax software purchasing decsions. I thought I had found a "partner" in Turbo Tax Deluxe, but aparantly this isn't a "partnership" with equal respect. Reading the letter of "apology" from Turbo Tax reads like corporate double speak. They are addressing only part of the issue and their reasoning for making the changes is absolutely ludicrous. To eliminate confusion for our customers we take features away from a product that's had their features for many years and make you pay more for an upgraded product ???? Really....you did all that so I (your long time customer) wouldn't be confused ??? Wow....how generous of you ! How does eliminating long time features in existing product reduce my confusion ? You literally can't make this stuff up, but yet it happens ! I found out about this change just days before intending to purchase my Turbo Tax Deluxe product and went ahead and purchased the Premiere version that I will now need. I did this in spite of my anger at this company. I'm not one to make snap decisions when I was literally ready to start my taxes. You can be sure however that in the coming year, I'll be exploring other options, whether it be another company's software product, or some other avenue of filing my taxes. I just wish more corporations understood that it takes years to build up brand loyalty and trust, but it can be destroyed in minutes by a stupid, ill thought out decsion in a boardroom filled with people who either have no clue how the consumer world works, or else are so arrogent that they don't care and think we'll just suck it up and take it......wrong in my case. Can't promise yet, but my guess is that I won't be a Turbo Tax customer next year ! It's been a good run of 16 years, and I thank you for that, but I will not suffer silently and reward you for your ill thought out "screw the customer" move.

title: Intuit did me a favor
content: The way I see it, Intuit did me a favor. Iâve used TTax since 1999. I grumbled about the price increases but I was used to the interface and it did the right calcs so inertia kept me coming back each year. This year the TTax changes affect me (Sched D) so I took the opportunity to try HR Block. Itâs not as glitzy as TTax and it has some quirks importing from TTax but ultimately it works and has the functionality I need and is significantly less expensive than TTax. So thanks, Intuit, for motivating me to overcome my TTax inertia and explore alternatives. Unfortunately for you, my inertia is now settling on HR Block for next year and beyond so youâve lost me as a TTax customer. But donât worry, I still use Quicken. For nowâ¦

title: Please read the update that M in SC posted - very slimy practices
content: We have been buying TurboTax for around 20 years now, very faithful customers, part of the "flat desktop sales." We bought this version then read the reviews and did NOT open the package. Now that I read "M in SC"'s update - EVERYONE go read that update - there is NO WAY I am staying with TurboTax. Consumer Reports recommends H&R Block and also offer TaxAct as an option. Do NOT let Intuit gouge you!

title: it's not a great product but was good enough
content: What a pain that Turbo Tax has decided to destroy their market base by screwing it's users. I've used Turbo Tax for 10 years, it's not a great product but was good enough. But now that they've made it that I can't use Schedule C in Deluxe (unless I buy the upgraded version) I will go ahead and spend the extra time converting and move to another product. Why do companies such as Intuit do such stupid things and shoot themselves in the foot?

title: I have been a happy TurboTax user for over a decade
content: I have been a happy TurboTax user for over a decade, but I am really unhappy with them now. After I bought the Deluxe version I found out they eliminated the ability to file the forms required for stock transactions. In the past you could upgrade to Premier to make it easier to fill these out, but for those like me who only have a few transactions and have no problem with the form, we could fill it out ourselves in Deluxe. Now Intuit has decided to force us to pay more for the Premier, and rather than fess up that they just want to squeeze more money out of customers, they offer a lame excuse of produce consistency. It is bad enough that they are taking away functionality of the product to squeeze more money out of customers, but to lie about the reason brings the companies integrity into question. I will be returning my copy and buying either H&R Block or TaxAct instead. Shame one Intuit!

title: Intuit is storing your tax ID number on their servers even if you are using the desktop version of TurboTax! Boycot Intuit!
content: They've decontented the product and now they're storing our SSN's in their database. Hate to see them stoop so low. They've "fixed" the idiot price increase move for now. I'm stuck with this because I purchased it in early January. I'll see how it handles my return after all of the bugs are fixed and they solve the fraudulent state income filing issue that's barred them from filing in a few states. Update 29Jan2015: http://americasmarkets.usatoday.com/2015/01/27/turbotaxs-database-knows-your-secrets/ I bought this years version in early January before this unfortunate piece of news hit the wires. Yesterday I received an email from "Susan Goodarzi, General Manager, Intuit TurboTax" telling me this - - "We are giving $25 back if you purchased TurboTax Deluxe desktop software (CD or download) and filed your 2013 tax return and have to upgrade to TurboTax Premier or Home & Business to file your 2014 return. This will help you move to the right desktop product, while reducing the immediate and unexpected financial impact. After completing and filing your return this year, request your $25 here." Kind of late for that notice. I've already purchased TT Deluxe and they want to offer me a $25 refund to buy the version I need?? What about the money I've already spent? I guess I'll try to call them and see what they'll do since I see that someone else was already successful doing that. Since they already have my SSN in their database, the goose has been cooked and I might as well go ahead and eat. Really disappointed. I wonder if they have a copy of my Quicken data in case my hard drive crashes? I can just call them up and have them send me a copy of it?? Update 6Feb15: looks like tomorrow I can update to a version that I can do a schedule C on. On a bad note, Intuit had to shut down their state income tax filing servers because of a security breach. Until further notice you can't file your state income tax returns until they resolve the fraudulent activity. I'll give them a pat on the back for seeing the obvious and rectifying their idiot marketing move to line their pockets big time. I guess the CEO saw what Intuit was having to pay E&Y to do his tax return and figured a doubling of the price was great idea. This will be a case study at HBS in the same light as New Coke's disastrous flop. Marketing professors are salivating. http://americasmarkets.usatoday.com/2015/02/02/turbotax-sets-date-for-free-upgrade/ Intuit is still being big brother with their information storage.

title: Purchased the Deluxe edition, same as last year. ...
content: Purchased the Deluxe edition, same as last year. My mistake & Intuit's greed, upon receipt I learn that it no longer supported Schedule D. I sold 2 stocks & would need to complete Scedule D. Didn't matter, Intuit determined that I should not complete the form, unless by hand, & external to the software.

title: Intuit removed basic functionality in order to charge you more
content: As a long time TurboTax customer, I'm really disappointed to learn that Intuit has crippled this so-called "deluxe" offering to no longer allow for Schedule C and D filing support. So any American with an investment account or side business is out of luck. Of course Intuit is happy to "fix" this problem by charging you even more money to "upgrade" to support these basic features. If Intuit really wants to charge more, they should do it honestly and raise the price. Don't trick people into buying this product only to find out about the additional hidden fees later!

title: WATCH OUT! You may not be able to file your state electronically, but you won't know until AFTER you pay the $34.99!
content: I was baited into paying the additional filing fee for my state taxes, on the premise that it would mean "Get your money faster! File both returns electronically at the same time," which was the message after I entered all my data. I paid them my money to do just that--file the state, too, only to THEN have the software inform me, after my money was taken, that the state return cannot be filed electronically, because my state return includes a schedule that TurboTax can't file electronically (Schedule CS/Edvest College Savings Plan). I went back, unchecked the Form/Schedule that was preventing the electronic filing, but the software is still factoring the data entered anyway and won't just "forget it." It won't allow anything but paper filing of my state return. Lured into paying more for electronic filing, and then don't allow me to file electronically. I'm so angry. If TurboTax had told me it couldn't file electronically BEFORE I was charged, I would have opted to just use my state's direct, free efile option, instead of getting robbed of $34.99 and having to wait weeks longer to get my state refund.

title: ZERO STARS - ZERO STARS - ZERO STARS
content: What a joke - the company gouges customers and then backpedals after the outcry! I for one will NEVER buy another TT product again, and I hope the company's bottom line suffers. Shame on Intuit, shame on the 'geniuses' who come up with more and more ingenious ways to stick it to customers. And then not even have the guts to call it what it is - GREED. H&R Block customer for life!!!

title: Bad Decision by Intuit
content: Bad decision Intuit! I have used Turbo Tax Deluxe for more than 30 years. I am not a small business owner, but I do need Schedule D and I want to be able to file both Federal and State returns electronically. I do not want to pay more than twice as much for this capability. I'll be looking at other products. I would say that whoever made this decision is in some big trouble.

title: H& R Block offering free download of its software to frustrated TT users wanting to switch
content: I also share the frustration of other TT longtime users and was wondering what I could use as an alternative. I appreciate the comments of people sharing their experiences using H&R Block's software, and I have decided that is the way I am going to go. I just found a Forbes article which reports that H&R Block will give a free download of its Deluxe + State software to TT users making the switch. You need to send an email to SwitchToBlock@hrblock.com and include the following information: name, address and phone number; type of operating system (Windows/Mac); and a photo, scan, or email showing proof of TT Basic or Deluxe purchase. H&R Block will send a link for one free download.

title: Add Intuit to the list of New Coke idiots....
content: I'll chime in here too. Can't remember how long I've been using TurboTax to do mine and family members taxes. Now they are degrading the deluxe to match online etc. Why not make online match the established deluxe. Well, they can make more off of the customers. They will try to appease us with a $25 refund this year....but gotcha going further on down the line. The only way to deal with these New Coke idiots is to hit them where it hurts. If they don't fix this issue then next year I won't be using TurboTax. I wouldn't be using it this year except like many others had already made the purchase before learning of these changes by Intuit. PS: Got my inadequate response from Intuit today....It'll be H&R next year. Just got all the forms in the latest update.

title: Another long time customer gone to the competition
content: Glad I read the reviews BEFORE purchasing. Even with Prime membership the price is too high when compared to alternatives. Sorry TurboTax, you've lost another long time customer. You don't have a corner on this market, and I will NOT be purchasing your product this year. In addition, you insult our intelligence with your explanation of why the product has been changed. We all get it.

title: Dump these folks and try H&R Block at 1/3 of the price.
content: I did not like TT jacking up the price, and leaving out the critical investment forms and NOT TELLING PEOPLE ABOUT THAT BEFORE THEY STARTED THEIR RETURNS. Even worse was the BS letter that the CEO sent out saying 'we hear you' and we will give you money off (our usually sky high prices!) so we can try and keep you. I am getting the H&R Block tax preparation software. I simply will not give my money to businesses who demonstrate a lack of concern for their customers, who feel that customers are fools to be fleeced, and who conceal their intent to squeeze their customer base for every dollar they can. My advice, check out the great prices on H&R Block software. It will get your info from your last year's return, no problem. I hope TT goes out of business. We don't need companies like this one.

title: Switched to H&R Software and Happy
content: To all those debating whether to move on from Turbo Tax because of the price gouging and deception surrounding the removal of key features from TT Deluxe, do it and don't hesitate. I bought the HR Block Premium Version (on CD) for under $35. I installed it yesterday and did a initial cut of my tax return. The GUI is different from TT but the process and content is so similar that the transition to HR Block software has really been effortless and transparent. The HR Block software found the file on my computer and loaded my TT file from 2013 as advertised. I had been a TT user for 10 years since 2005 but they will never get me back. It appears that they have now reduced the TT Premium version (which has the missing Deluxe content) to about $55 but it is still more than $20 higher than the comparable HR Block software with the same 5 federal efiles and one state return and schedules C & D functionality. Intuit really screwed up and now that I am over the fear of making the switch (again, something you shouldn't fear) I am done with them.

title: I was lucky I didn't open my copy and put ...
content: I was lucky I didn't open my copy and put it on my computer before I found out what wasn't supported this year. I took advantage of H&R Block's free download to replace Turbo Tax. Turbo tax has lost a long time customer and H&R Block has gained one,

title: 20 years with turbotax. Looking into other options.
content: Just came on line to purchase turbotax deluxe like I've done for about 20 years. We really surprised to see all the 1 star ratings and thought maybe there was an early season software glitch or something. Instead, it looks like there has been a huge hike in price to get the same functionality I had last year. I see I can spend extra time and buy deluxe and then call customer service for a free upgrade. Seems like a lot of extra work and then what happens next year? Maybe it's time to switch. I see the H&R software listed for only $27 today. Would have preferred to just buy turbotax like I do every year, but now I have to spend extra time researching and either switching or go through extra hoops to get a decent price and stay w/ tt.

title: Time for a Change
content: To all the reviewers of this tax preparation software: THANK YOU!! I am switching to H&R Block. I don't have a terribly complex tax situation, but I do need Schedule E and K-1. Like others, I've been using TurboTax Deluxe for more years than I can remember simply because that's what I did the year before. Now, thanks to the greedy folks at TurboTax and all you reviewers (especially the person who noted that their 2013 data ported into the H&R Block software), I'm ready for a change!! BTW TurboTax - your lousy $25 rebate AFTER I get done filing isn't worth it. You want my business? Then don't whiz on my leg and tell me it's raining.

title: Greed is an ugly thing. Time to move on
content: Never again will I use your product. This was not a case of poor communication but clearly a deliberate attempt increase your profits in a way that is unacceptable to me and obviously many others. Looks like your customers are not as clueless as you predicted. I hope its a very costly miscalculation on your part, you deserve it. On a more positive note, I bet H&R Block is having a GREAT year! I truly hope people stick to their guns and find other methods to get their Taxes done. I was tempted to leave my bad review but still order their product because I can be a bit lazy at times. Not this time. I will be downloading H&R Blocks deluxe upon completing this review. I guess they can still import all my tax data stored locally from previous years.

title: Another heretofore "Satisfied" long term customer bites the dust.
content: So long been good to know ya, so long been good to know ya, I guess I'll be driftin along to HR. LIke so many others I've been a Turbo Tax user since 88. This last sneak nickel and diming is the last straw. I tried to use tech support and got some godawful indian accented script kiddie where I had to have him repeat 3 times each sentence to understand what he was saying. This corporation's greed has become untenable. I'm almost ready to give up on quicken if they start these shennagans with that program

title: ... of this product for many years and I have loved it. However
content: I have used the same version (TurboTax Deluxe) of this product for many years and I have loved it. However, this year I purchased it again to do the exact same thing I have been doing all of these years, and it pops up and tells me I have to purchase an additional product costing $40 plus more dollars. Intuit dropped functionality without warning me. They are requiring an expensive add-on to do what I have done for years. I feel cheated. Had they warned me it would be different, but they didn't, so I most likely will never use it again after this year.

title: Reduced functionality is adding conistency...
content: Started working on 2014 taxes and realized Intuit had removed the K-1 forms from TurboTax Deluxe and want me to upgrade to TurboTax Premiere for the same functionality I have used for the past 15 years. I then read their explanation that it was to add consistency across their product line. It would seem adding this functionality to the products that did not have it would be adding consistency. This is just trying to take more of my money. I have used TurboTax because it was familiar, but this has motivated me to look at other tax software solutions. I will probably re evaluate Quicken next.

title: More cost with a poorer product = product return
content: Bought this elsewhere so I could have a hard copy. I have been using deluxe for years to and it has always handled my occasional stock sale. I don't need to be walked through investments nor can I even import cost basis as my stocks predate basis availability. I will look into returning this to the seller and going with HR Block.

title: Been using TT for at least 15 years. Now ...
content: Been using TT for at least 15 years. Now I have to migrate from Deluxe to Premier for one form - ridiculous! Will not this year. Note to Intuit - you never take your customers for granted. Sick and tired of these corporations thinking we're idiots. We have options, I intend to use another brand of software, going forward.

title: TurboTax is dead to me...
content: Glad I read these reviews. I have used TurboTax forever, but based on the info here I guess last year was the end of a long relationship. I will try H&R Blocks software. And Bob, nobody wants to call you to work thru their particular case or situation. We want reasonably priced software that has full functionality. Goodbye TurboTax.

title: I loved it, now I loathe it
content: I loved it, now I loathe it. Not only are schedules taken out, the price continually sky rockets year after year while its competitors remain fairly the same. It amazes me how a company can offer less and expect its customers to pay more. Every year I looked forward to doing my taxes because I knew Turbo Tax made it worry free. Now I have to start all over with a new company, or several until I can find one that isn't trying to shake me down for every penny and offer me next to nothing. Unfortunately, all the other reviews are correct. Turbo Tax and I are done. Thanks and goodbye. One more thing; keep raising your prices and keep taking features out of your software and see how many customers you have left!

title: Bad. Bad
content: Shame on Intuit! Greed, it seems, is alive and well in this software company. Let the buyer beware: Intuit is "dissing" its loyal customers who for years have purchased the Deluxe version of TurboTax for home use. I venture to guess that most middle-income households need to file a Schedule D with their 1040s, and all previous Deluxe versions of TTax have always accommodated this...but not this year! Intuit surprises you in the 2014 version. So do not buy the Deluxe version expecting things to be as before. You will get to the point in the program where you want to enter any gains or losses from stocks, bonds, mutual funds, etc. then the 2014 Deluxe program abruptly informs you that you must upgrade to the "Premiere" version to have this capability. You can upgrade the program online. This will cost you an additional $30! Bad. Bad. Bad!

title: Like others, I bought the deluxe version for years
content: Like others, I bought the deluxe version for years. Now, I have to pay an extra $30 to upgrade to the premier versions. It is a slimy trick to get back the capabilities in the deluxe version for many years.

title: If the IRS can gouge you, why can't we?!
content: I have used TurboTax for nearly my entire adult life. Now they want me to pay an extra $40 for the ability to fill out the investment income portion. Something that was always previously included in the cheaper version of TurboTax (and is still available in other tax software). This isn't some "high income elite feature". Investment income is something that presumably nearly everyone should have some of by a certain point in their life. I'm getting tired of every service and product gouging me a bit here and a bit there. Same price, less product at the grocery store. More hidden fees on services. Lots of DRM and stripped features on tax software. Unacceptable.

title: When the food companies quietly shrunk the quanity in the ...
content: When the food companies quietly shrunk the quanity in the same box at the same price I went generic. Now that turbo is doing the same thing, less product same name and box I decieded it was time to try HR Block...I ordered it yesterday.

title: Over past few years it seemed to me like Intuit was putting a minimum effort it to get ...
content: I am actually not reviewing, as for the first time in at least 15 years I will not use Turbo Tax. Over past few years it seemed to me like Intuit was putting a minimum effort it to get TT out the door. It got "fatter" (slower), less intuitive, and I saw nothing that set it aside from the others packages in the top 5. When they jacked the price up this year and reduced the features, I moved on, I bought H&R Block. Paid 40% of TT's price for the same features. I've already done my 2014 taxes and H&RB seems ok to me. I don't see anything innovative (not sure what I expected there, to be honest), but it is easy to use and a lot less expensive.

title: After 20+ years being a TurboTax customer I returned the ...
content: After 20+ years being a TurboTax customer I returned the 2014 software and purchased H&R Block. Now to get me back as a customer TurboTax is going to have to give me the 2015 software for FREE and put back the features they took out of TurboTax Deluxe. If not, I'm not coming back. Understand now, Intuit ?

title: Can't handle estimated taxes correctly
content: I am retired and withdraw from my IRA as needed so my taxable income is very irregular. Up until 2013 as long as I paid estimated taxes by the end of the year, regardless of how distributed over the year, TurboTax was happy. In 2013 I had some large end-of-the-year expenses so a large withdrawal from my IRA. I paid a 4th quarter estimated tax payment accordingly. But TurboTax Delux made me pay interest to the IRS because it thought I should have made the payment over the four quarters of 2013. How the hell am I supposed to do that when the withdrawal was at the END of 2013. Given that TurboTax is the most expensive tax preparation software, I would expect it to be the best. It isn't! I'm going with much cheaper software. Even if it makes me pay interest, my savings on tax prep software will cover it.

title: Looks like a bait and switch deal to me
content: If you have a health savings account, forget Turbo Tax free edition. They force you to upgrade in order to put in accurate information. Same if you pay alimony. Looks like a bait and switch deal to me.

title: Very disappointed in this product
content: Very disappointed in this product. It no longer supports Schedule D. The first time through the process, the software asked me to update to Premium for $25. I backed up and tried it again thinking I had done something wrong. The second time through the process, the upgrade fee was $30. Update: I called Intuit and they were very nice and offered a free upgrade right away.

title: Switching to H&R Block
content: I've used TurboTax Deluxe for years, mainly for the ability to handle stock transactions. Since they are now trying to force me to buy the Premium version I'm switching to H&R Block. I think they got a little too greedy.

title: Adios Intuit
content: I've used turbotax for over a decade. With the price increase and being a resident of Minnesota, it's at least made the decision of hiring a CPA next year a no-brainer. The most frustrating aspect of all of this is a TOTAL lack of communication from the company regarding my state not accepting these returns. There is nothing at all on the website regarding refunds or if/when we can expect the state to accept our returns. The local paper ran a story about 90+ minute wait times on the phone line to attempt to get an answer. Even though it wasn't the cheapest, I've always used this software because it was reliable and easy to use. This year it is neither, and I will never purchase an Intuit product again. I realize that problems occur, but the company has been utterly reprehensible in its response.

title: Switched to H&R Block.
content: After using TurboTax for 10 years, I've decided to give H&R Block software a try. Even though TurboTax claims that they will upgrade me for free to the next level, I have no intentions of supporting business practices such as this. Corporate America needs to wake up.

title: Exit. Stage Left.
content: Wow! What a coporate tragedy. I have been a loyal Turbo-Tax Deluxe customer since 1993. I never thought I'd be leaving Turbo-Tax. So sad. Good-bye... Thank you Turbo-Tax customers for your reliable feedback over these many years. For those that remain keep the public informed. Recommendations to Intuit. 1. Remove your evil/greedy CEO from his/her leadership role. 2. Improve Turbo-Tax Deluxe 2013, instead of beheading Turbo-Tax Deluxe 2014. 3. Improve Turbo-Tax Deluxe 2015 to retain and enhance features available

title: Cannot trust Intuit-TurboTax, bait and switch to force me to upgrade to premier - Going back to using H&R block software.
content: I moved in 2014, Sold and purchased a new home. Spent a few hours working on my taxes in Turbo Tax only to find out that they stripped the Deluxe version of many forms that I needed, Essentially getting the message " Sorry, If you want to take those deductions you'll need to fork out another $30 to upgrade to Premier" - That would put the price of the software at $80 total + the cost of E filing. This coupled with the recent facts that Intuit secretly takes pulls your private information down to its servers without your knowledge, It seems that the company has decided it can do what its wants - thus giving the middle finger to consumers in more ways than one. I will be returning the software tomorrow for a full refund and going back to H&R block software.

title: TurboTax reduced the functionality so I am changing vendors
content: I have used TurboTax for over 20 years. It worked and I was familiar with it (including many of its bugs), so it seemed like an easy choice to stay.
