Now I feel taken advantage of by Intuit's decision to significantly increase price for the same functionality. I realized that my "brand loyalty" has been misplaced. Since they have decided to make a change, I have too. I have switched over to H&R Block this year. Since my taxes aren't done yet it is too early to render a full verdict, but the much lower price for the "original TurboTax Deluxe" functionality, the same guarantee and apparently a better customer support structure all suggest that a change is overdue. It was interesting to see Intuit taking "full responsibility" for the change. Based on my experience and apparently the experience of a large number of TurboTax users that have commented, they may be taking responsibility for a large drop in their customer base and lots of unhappy people who have been buying TurboTax Deluxe on auto-pilot for many years and now won't be able to complete their taxes without a required upgrade at the last minute. They won't be back next year...like me.

title: Intuit Snubs Customer Base for Unjustified Proifits
content: After 20 plus years of TurboTax use, I just purchased and installed H&R Block Delux. It imported my 2013 TT files flawlessly. Intuit, you made a serious business blunder by decreasing features and significantly increasing your price this year. You have lost one more long-time customer. I doubt I will go back to TT in the coming years in view of Intuit's "tricky", "bait-and-switch" tactics evident this year.

title: Beware - Deluxe no longer includes Schedule D - Intuit trying to push people to Premier
content: I have been a long-time user of TurboTax and a fan of Intuit for many years. I purchased the Deluxe version from Amazon this year as I have done for the last several; however, I just got done writing Intuit and requesting a refund. Some genius at Intuit has decided to try and drive more revenue by removing essential forms (i.e. Schedule D) from the Deluxe version and thereby force users who need that functionality to upgrade to Premier. Rather than actually innovate (what their founder Scott Cook preaches and what made Intuit the dominant provider in areas like tax preparation software, personal financial management, and small business accounting), they have decided it is just easier to try and milk more from captive customers. Migrating to another solution is a pain, but I am willing to do this out of principle. Maybe whatever additional revenue they generate from this scheme will be greater than the lifetime value of a customer like me that they lose, but it also speaks to the state of their ability to continue to add value through innovative products. I realize that tax preparation software may not be "cutting edge", but surely they can find ways to offer new and innovative products that would drive revenue rather than try and nickle and dime us. Update post "offer" from Intuit: Not sure what Intuit is thinking, but this offer is not remotely close to what they need to do. Aside from the bs explanation that continues to fan the flames (hello to Intuit - this is not a communication issue. Your explanation about keeping the online and desktop version consistent is not fooling anyone. You could have left the forms in the online version to keep them consistent, but everyone knows this was a ploy to push people to spend more on the Premier version), the offer is silly. If I used Deluxe last year and if I was stupid enough to buy Premier, I can wait until I file my taxes and apply for a $25 rebate that will come 6-8 weeks after that. This is Intuit trying to pacify at as little a cost as possible with the hope that they will be able to push people to Premier next year with less push back. They should have offered a rebate to everyone who purchased Premier this year regardless of whether they did so because Deluxe lacked the schedules. How do the people who a long-term premier users feel about not being eligible for this huge $25 rebate? Additionally, the trust is now broken so customers have no faith that Intuit will not try to scam them next year or the year after. These are customers who were like an annuity to Intuit. As long as the product continued to function, we would continue to purchase it year after year. This stunt has pissed off a large number of loyal customers. I am sure Mr. Cook is happy about having Intuit compared to New Coke and Netflix in the history of stupid decisions. I am sure someone thought there would be some unhappy customers, but enough people would blindly pay the additional amount that revenue would grow faster and the GM would be a hero. Not sure if one or more people take a hit for this, but I guess it will depend on the ultimate outcome. Everyone will be happy if revenue grows and the stock price increases; however, the Board should act if this causes a loss of market share or a miss on revenue by removing those responsible.

title: Never again!
content: We sold our home for a loss and moved out of state this year. I checked the list of "changes" they made to their software and didn't see anything that appeared to apply to me. I decided to stick with Turbo Tax because I was comfortable with it. I was soon informed that I would need to upgrade. I would have bought the H and R Block had they been honest. I won't be in this situation again next year, but it's too late. You have lost me as a customer. It's called DEDUCTIONS AND HOMEOWNERS!!!! Selling is sometimes part of home ownership!!! I won't do business with companies that are out to scam their once loyal customers.

title: Extreme Disappointment
content: I'll be honest - I did not purchase the software this year. I've been a TT user since 1998, and was ready to purchase the 2014 version. However, when I saw that the "Deluxe" version does not support many Schedule C issues or any Schedule D, both of which I need, I was immensely disappointed. I don't understand how they can continue to call it "Deluxe." Admittedly the software in past years was easy to use (although very bloated for some reason - a resource hog), but this price gouge is so disappointing that I can't help but give a 1 star review to throw my voice into the sea of unhappiness out there. Hopefully TT will change this policy of stripping features next year, but it will be too late for me. I'm switching to H&R Block software and will likely stay there.

title: Done with Deluxe
content: The 2013 version had 1,265 reviews, averaging 4 of 5 stars with 14% giving it one star. The 2014 version so far has 240 reviews, averaging 2 of 5 stars, with 70% giving it one star. That's a huge problem for Intuit since many reviewers would have given it zero stars if they could. Intuit's desire for "consistent product functionality across [platforms]" sounds a lot like Microsoft's Windows 8, which was supposed to give an identical experience across platforms (desktop, laptop, tablet and phone). That worked so well that after a minor update in Windows 8.1, the upcoming version of Windows will be version 10, as Microsoft tries to get consumers to forget about Windows 8. Intuit needs to rename and rebrand "deluxe." I've used Turbo Tax Deluxe for so long I can't remember when I used anything else, but I'm done with "deluxe." Maybe I'll return, maybe not. That depends on how Intuit--and their competitors--respond to this software fiasco.

title: Bye
content: Intuit forced me, a loyal 10-year Turbotax user, to switch to TaxAct. Fortunately, I found that the transition was pretty seamless and the product is much cheaper. As long as TaxAct doesn't pull an Intuit, I can't imagine I will ever use Turbotax again.

title: Really stupid move by Intuit !!!
content: I was a loyal Turbo Tax user for more than 10 years. But now with TurboTax's recent change that forces me to pay 50% more just to handle the sale of stocks and capital gains calculations, I'll be switching to a competitor's software. Really stupid move by Intuit !!!

title: really bad idea (perhaps you've gotten that impression by the other ...
content: I would give this product ZERO stars, if possible - and that's coming from a very long-time and dedicated user of TurboTax (AND an active CPA). You know, I realize that you guys need to protect your bottom line - but carving out the basic schedules for C, D and E and up charging people to use them was a really, really, really bad idea (perhaps you've gotten that impression by the other reviews as well?). This comes on the heels of Intuit notifying me that their Quicken 2012 product (which I bought ONLY TWO YEARS AGO) is losing much of it's important functionality - and yes, of course, I will have to REPURCHASE this software to keep my 2-yr old program working correctly. I'm well aware of the need of companies like yours, Intuit, to create on-going revenue streams - but usually when they're this aggressive, there aren't many alternatives. Well guess what - that's just not the case with your products. Just FYI - if you've already purchased TurboTax (and are now kicking yourself for being a loyal customer, and being flogged at the register this year), HR Block will now give you a FREE download of their software, without all of these games. Provide your receipt at the HR Block website - you'll be good to go. That's where I'm heading. See ya, TurboTax - you were really great to work with. Too bad it didn't last.

title: If it is not about the money then lower the price of the Deluxe version
content: To suggest this change (removing functionality) is about solving a problem for 10 million customers is disingenuous. It is about the money. Bob, if it is not about the money then lower the price of the Deluxe version (since you removed a great deal of functionality) and lower the price of the Premier to what the Deluxe used to be. Then your claim that you have not raised the price would ring true. To say you have not raised the price is like the coffee makers keeping the same price and lowering the amount from 16 oz to 11 oz per can. Same can size, same price, less product. This is what you have done. This IS a price increase.

title: Serious Downgrade From Last Year-can't do schedules C, D or E with Deluxe-DON'T BUY or UPGRADE at double price
content: After nearly 15 years of using Turbo Tax Deluxe, I am now forced by the money grubbers at Intuit to either pay double for Home and Business version in order to use the features that were standard in Deluxe, OR download a free version of H and R Block by emailing : SwitchToBlock@hrblock.com. I've never used H and R Block before, but I don't think I want Intuit to get another dime from me until they mend their ways. They tried a stupid stunt like this before by trying to charge extra for extra returns filed on the same computer. They caved on that one and kept me as a customer for a few years. Funny, they didn't learn their lesson that time. Seasoned Taxpayer

title: Unfathomable Greed
content: I'm self-employed and have investment income, but my income is still below the poverty line. Why do I have to pay so much extra just to use a couple more forms? Intuit must think all self-employed people and investors are rich and willing to pay through their noses for software that isn't crippled beyond use. I guess I shouldn't be surprised to see this from a company known for lobbying for complex tax rules to keep its products in demand. It's disgusting. I just read that H&R Block is offering its software for free to unhappy TurboTax users. Google SwitchToBlock@hrblock.com for details. Thanks, H&R Block!

title: After using TurboTax Deluxe for over 12 years, I ...
content: After using TurboTax Deluxe for over 12 years, I bought it again thinking that it would have the same functionality as before. What a surprise to find out that it didn't support of the schedules that I needed to do my taxes. Whomever is doing the strategic planning for their product needs to be put in a different position in their company. I will be looking at other options for doing my taxes in the future. Wake up TurboTax!!! After contacting TurboTax Customer Service and complaining, they offered me a free upgrade to the Premier version without me even having to ask for it. I noticed on their website that they have lowered their prices for their software.

title: Bought Deluxe yesterday at another retailer where I will be ...
content: Bought Deluxe yesterday at another retailer where I will be returning it. Recall that this is the same company that a few years ago installed a root kit (a type of malware) on your PC to protect and limit their software. The outrage at that time forced them to backtrack but, as is often the case with root kits, removing it completely was much more difficult than installing it.I had hoped Intuit had learned from that fiasco. Guess not. I gave them one do-over. No more. Time to move on to a competitor.

title: Good bye Intuit ...
content: Two decades of happy of being a satisfied customer ends with Sasan Goodarzi's comment "We messed up." Calling customer service was disappointed and ineffective. No need to go into all the details and issues but as a LOYAL customer for two decades it troubles me that to do the same thing I was always able to do now would cost effectively twice what it did before ... is unacceptable. I bought your software for all these years because it was easy to use, effective and I could depend on it. Now I can't ... I will now give H&R Block a chance to win my business loyalty for the next decade. Whoever decided this "new" business model was a good idea .... I hope it works out for you ... you've just lost my parents, my four siblings, my son and daughter as well as me. Really a shame ...

title: WARNING- WARNING!
content: This is NOT last years version of turbotax you bought. This is a brand new version of Turbotax! Yeah- great! Wait. Not so great. In fact, it sucks. No schedule D or E. Why didn't they include those simple/easy forms you ask? Because that was a filthy, underhanded, unscrupulous way of extracting money from your wallet. You must purchase the 'upgrade' for $30.00 additional dollars. Guess what? You can't get your money back from Amazon after downloading this, so now what? Your screwed. If your reading this before purchasing: smart move! Check out HR Block, Taxact, and numerous other software companies out there with integrity and ethics.leave Turbotax alone, where they belong.

title: TurboTax loses a long-term customer
content: I have used Turbo Tax for the past two decades. Corporate greed now requires that I go elsewhere for software. Why should I pay $30 more for Premier when Deluxe always contained the one page Schedule E I needed to do my return. I'd rather use paper forms than pay another $30 for one page. Thanks Turbo Tax. I also do not appreciate the email you sent me that required a full page of reading, that said nothing other than to spin an asinine decision on your part, and failed to truly take account of your customer's needs. Good bye.

title: I can't believe that I get halfway into doing my ...
content: I can't believe that I get halfway into doing my 2014 taxes, and find that Intuit has stripped the features from the Deluxe edition that allow me to file tax forms related to my stock investments! Now I have to pay a big upgrade fee just to finish my taxes. What a sleazy--and sneaky--thing to do, Intuit! I've been a loyal customer of TurboTax since the late 1990s--but no more. It's too late to change my 2014 TurboTax work, but next year, I'm moving on to a more reputable tax software provider. Goodby TurboTax!

title: Turbotax banned in Minnesota
content: This just in - 8:15 PM - Minnesota Dept of Revenue has stopped accepting TurboTax returns, due to the high possibility of fraud. Not much info on this yet, but be advised.

title: Deja vu of 2013 Web version
content: I've been using TurboTax desktop for my sole proprietor business since the days it was owned by ChipSoft. Last year, my hard drive crashed shortly before the IRS deadline and I had to resort to the Web based version. That was a disaster. I started off using the deluxe version, as I had always done before. Only when I got to the business section did they tell me I had to upgrade. I tried some work-arounds, like filling out schedule C manually, but it didn't work. And then, when I did upgrade, all the data I had already entered disappeared. At this point, I called TurboTax and got a very nice rep who apologized very sincerely for the problem. She filed a request to the technical team to restore my data, and then, as compensation for my troubles, came me a code that she said I could use when I actually filed that would allow me to pay only the cost of the Deluxe version, regardless of whether or not I used the features of the upgrade. Sounded good to me. But that's not the way it worked out. Although a little bit of what I had previously entered (basically the personal information that doesn't routinely change from year to year) was restored, none of the 2013-specific data I entered was restored and I had to enter it all again. To top that, when I it was time to pay, there was no opportunity to use the discount code the rep gave me. I was very attentive going through the screens, and if there was any way to use it, it was very well hidden. But the lesson I thought I had learned from last year was not to use the Web version. This year, I naively assumed that the desktop version was going to be fine and I went ahead and bought the Deluxe desktop, only to find that Intuit was going through the same bait and switch routine with it this year. I give up on Intuit. They clearly have lost their way.

title: I guess its time to kick bad habits.
content: I've been a loyal Turbotax customer for 11 years, but no more. They've removed the interview questions for schedule C, D & E, to make an extra 30 dollars. I should have known since Intuit was spent 11.5 million lobbying against easier and simpler tax returns. There's plenty of tax software out there that's more than capable of doing the job. HR Block is one that comes to mind for a fraction of the price. I only stayed with Turbotax out of habit. I guess its time to kick bad habits.

title: So long Intuit.
content: I have been a loyal Turbotax customer for over a decade, but after seeing what Intuit thinks of its customers (masses to be exploited) and how it treats its customers (sneaky and deceitful), I decided I no longer wanted to be an Intuit customer. I have purchased H&R Block Tax software. I was able to import last year's Turbotax data into H&R Block Tax ,so it turns out that switching software was faster and less work than I was expecting. Not to mention less cost. So long Intuit!

title: I would give it less than one star if possible ...
content: I would give it less than one star if possible. I have been using TurboTax Deluxe for a very long time. But now that Schdule D is no longer supported I will look elsewhere. TurboTax blew it big time.

title: So glad I read the reviews before automatically re-ordering
content: Have used turbotax deluxe for our taxes, including a rental property, for about 20 years. Now the schedules I need, that used to be in Deluxe, are gone. And from what I glean from the reviews, the Premier is also inadequate. Well, at least H&R Block's software is cheaper.

title: I have used turbo tax for many years and loved it. I was aware of the issues discussed ...
content: I have used turbo tax for many years and loved it. I was aware of the issues discussed here so I tried to use Turbo Tax on fidelitiy's web site and the turbo tax software handled my Roth IRA withdrawal incorrectly. I tried to contact their online support but no one contacted me. Since I can not access the forms I decided to give up on Turbo Tax and purchase H&R block. I want to thank the many amazon users who took time to post about these issues so at least I did not waste my money purchasing this software.

title: TurboTax Deluxe has been great for many years
content: TurboTax Deluxe has been great for many years, I have used it for at least 15 years. But since the program can no longer do Schedule D, it can't be considered to be "Deluxe". Like many users I do not run a business but do invest. There could be some justification for abandoning business users. But it seems to me that leaving out investors (Schedule D) is a huge mistake which will drive away many long-time users and customers. So after many years I also have to abandon the program and use H&R Block! Rudi Freysinger

title: After 15 years of using Turbotax, this release has caused me to switch to HR Block
content: With new releases, who takes away features rather than adding to remain competitive? Intuit Turbotax apparently. After 15 years of using TurboTax, I too will be switching to H&R Block. Turbotax has always found small ways to gouge you (extra charge for state e-file, hidden fees, etc...), but I always sucked it up and just kept using them out of convenience. After reading the reviews, it looks like Intuit has taking gouging to a new level, by actually taking out the Deluxe features but still calling it 'Deluxe'. So incredibly dishonest and unethical. Their strategy is to prey on the uneducated who will buy Deluxe thinking its the same as it has been in past years. Then when in the middle of their returns, when features they need aren't there, Intuit will require them to upgrade within the app (charging significantly more for the upgrade than if they would have bought the higher version originally). So sneaky, shady, and unethical. I will be switching over to HR Block Deluxe, and encouraging all my extended family and friends to do the same. HR Block Deluxe is getting almost 5 star ratings on Amazon, and even imports your 2013 return from Turbotax (making for an easy transition). I also now feel HR Block is a more transparent and reputable company. Turbotax is preying on the ignorant, removing features to nickel and dime people in to last minute add ons. With HR Block, at least what you see is what you get. Due to Turbotax getting greedy, and taking features away (instead of adding), I'm finally making the switch to HR Block. Now that I've switched, I'll never go back and can just utilize HR Block every year going forward. Thanks Turbotax for getting so bad that you forced me to open my mind and find something so much better.

title: Intuit neuters "Deluxe" TurboTax edition!
content: Okay, in the middle of doing my return, and find that in order to deal with my minor investment capital gains and losses stuff that I've been doing for years with TurboTax Deluxe, and before using regular TurboTax, I would have to pay $30 for an upgrade. Well, I called Intuit and waited on hold for more than an hour (silly me), and was given a free upgrade to Premiere. Okay, that's a really round-about, not customer-oriented way to do this, and cost a LOT of customer goodwill, at least my goodwill for sure. The free upgrade should have been available online for free, or via the program if you try to use the investment capital gains section of the return. That would have saved me the frustration of having to spend over an hour of my life waiting on their pleasure. I only do taxes once a year, but it's trying enough without having the company that I pay for tax software working against me. And, this may go without saying, but if Intuit continues to exclude investment capital gains/losses from the Deluxe edition next year, I'll be taking my tax return business elsewhere. Won't be forgetting this one by next tax time, that's for sure.

title: A Bicycle Without Wheels
content: I just got off the phone with Turbo Tax customer support. As a long time user, I couldn't believe they would take out Schedule D functionality from a product they have sold for DECADES. Their answer might as well have been "I'm sorry.....You want wheels with that bicycle? You will need to pay us double for that upgrade to our product....." I don't like change, but I'm switching to H&R Block. These guys are a piece of work, not deserving of one star.

title: FREE Upgrade to TurboTax Premier>>> Call Intuit @1-800-445-1875
content: Purchased the Deluxe version which I have used for over a decade only to find out that access to Schedule D used for stocks requires upgrade to Premier.

title: Intuit sneaky price increase
content: Just returned my copy of TT Deluxe 2014. Been a user for over 15 years. Removing schedules C, D, and E without notification is underhanded. If Intuit had posted a price increase, I would have considered it as would most of their customers. But to strip out functionality and basically double the cost to retrieve those lost features is unforgivable. My advice to Intuit - Be upfront with your customers. Trust is essential to maintain a healthy and growing business.

title: Went from OK to BAD
content: Unhappy about the changes - read the other 1 star reviews and you'll know why. Also, after you pay for the software, they make you pay $19.99 to file your state return! It really is highway robbery. There should be at least one free state return file with your purchase. Don't think I'll be buying this software again next year.

title: WTF - TurboTax is now worthless - Look elsewhere!!!
content: I am shocked about how bad Turbo tax has become! After using it for many years I'm looking elsewhere. The price has gone up year after year and now the "Deluxe" version has removed forms essential to me that I can upgrade (pay even more) to get. In the meantime TurboTax is useless to me. Hopefully one of the automatic updates will fix this scam by including the missing forms.

title: Adios Turbo Tax...
content: Well, I'm heart sick. I'm not sure that a piece of software should merit this much attachment, but I find the whole tax process overwhelming, and foe years Turbo Tax was a benevolent interface between an incomprehensible tax code and my really limited ability to navigate it. So I've been a user since their early first days for the Mac. (Was it "Macintax"?) But I'm headed over to try the H&R Block product. And as Intuit must intuit by now, if it works, I and many others will stay with them out of the same inertia that kept me with Intuit all these years...in spite of the feeling that over the past few years they had evolved from something protective to something far more exploitative and predatory. The poised and slick responses of Intuit's vice president here only serve to reinforce my queasy decision to leave Turbo Tax behind. "Gee, give me a call and let me see if I can help you find the right product." I need a schedule C. And until I use the product I don't know if my deductions will go over the arbitrary (and preposterously low) limit they've set. I suspect they will. So I guess I'll pick my productnwithout Bob's help... Someone at Intuit is responsible for driving the predatory stance of the company and this software suite forward. Writing this review is a pain, but I'm taking the time to do it in hopes that Turbo Tax loses many more customers than myself; that individuals responsible get fired, and that the company (maybe even others) concludes that untrammeled greed and disrespect for one's consumer base is bad business.

title: Verified NON-Purchase. Bye-Bye TurboTax!
content: I have been a satisfied TurboTax customer for more than 20 years. No more. Intuit picked the wrong way to generate dollars. Being unable to file basic taxes with the Deluxe version is idiotic and wrong; it is a monstrous violation of customers' expectations. It is deflating years of goodwill and brand equity.This will be a business school case study on the destruction of a brand. Congrats.

title: Turbo Tax's Bad Pricing Strategy!
content: Went straight to H&R Block Basic after reading the reviews here.No problem importing last years TT files,5 free Fed filings,all for under $15. This will go down with "New Coke" as one of the worst business decisions I've ever seen.What did Intuit do,hire former Bear Stearns and Lehmen Bros. management for their new pricing strategy?.If I was Intuit,I would think about scrapping the name Turbo Tax or go to H&R Block and beg for a merger next year.

title: Filing taxes is painful enough....
content: Filing taxes is painful enough, yet TurboTax wants to make this process even more painful by removing features from a product that I have used for years. As a loyal and long time customer of TurboTax, I am extremely disappointed to learn that I will not be able to file my taxes unless I purchase their more expensive Premier software. Why would I pay more for TurboTax Premier when I can file for less with H&R Block. I won't pay more, and that's why I am saying "bye, bye, bye" to TurboTax. Thanks to everyone for the warning.

title: I went to Intuit by following their lame excuse page on my email about how sorry they ...
content: Halfway through doing my tax return this year I discovered I could not complete it unless I upgraded to Premier. The reason was I had dividends and gain/losses to report and Deluxe does not allow this functionality. It was totally confusing with half my data in and no way to go on. I went to Intuit by following their lame excuse page on my email about how sorry they were and they charged my credit card another $32 plus tax to download the software upgrade to allow me to continue. Once upgraded to Premier I was able to continue my return. I understand Intuit will refund me $25 but it seems there is a catch. Apparently they only give you the refund if you have file 'electronically' last year (2013). I used TurboTax Deluxe last year but I used a paper return because I needed to complete two more forms which were not part of TurboTax Deluxe. So now I have no idea what they are going to do. I may look at the H&R Block tax return software next year. I am not happy with Intuit.

title: No more Turbo-Tax
content: Well after reading all those reviews that pertain to me I will not be purchasing Turbo-tax this year. I have been using this product since before Intuit bought it. I Think I will try H&R Block software even if it has a price difference. It makes me sad though. It may be time for H&R block to purchase a company that has an accounting program and compete with Intuits Quicken as well.

title: I have been a Turbo Tax user since 2000. ...
content: I have been a Turbo Tax user since 2000. I am very frustrated about the lose of critical features in TurboTax Deluxe. No Schedules C, D, or E. or e-filing if you use these. I think when you have a product you have used for many years, to have the company remove features you have used and still charge the same price, if ridiculous. I would encourage potential customers to choose a product from another company. I know next year I will be looking somewhere else.

title: Shame on you TurboTax
content: I have been using Turbotax for many, many years. I bought my Deluxe copy, as usual, but without perusing the fine print or features table. I didn't think I needed too. I have always used this version to prepare all of my taxes. This year, to my surprise, they degraded the features on the Deluxe version significantly. I paid $59.95 (before they dropped the price) and now I find that I will need to spend another $30 to get the features I thought I was getting in the first place. I refuse to petition Bob from TurboTax for a free upgrade as others here have done. I shouldn't need to do this. That is beneath my dignity. I am tempted to abandon TT entirely and go with something else. I've used this version for several weeks already, but only found about the loss of features by reading the comments here. That is how sneakily it was done. OK, Turbotax, very clever. You fooled me this time. But let's see how many customers you will lose because of this tawdry stunt.

title: Would give minus 1 star if I could
content: Add me to the growing number of previous TurboTax users appalled by the omission of Schedule D from the Deluxe package. Selling a stock or mutual fund is not an unusual event. To force people into Premier version to complete these forms is ridiculous. Most people probably won't find out about this change until they start their taxes in mid February. I expect the howls of protest for this forced upgrade will make the Super Bowl crowd seem quiet. I am using H&R Block Deluxe software this year. Goodbye TurboTax. Vote with your feet and leave these greedy Intuit people wondering why everyone is avoiding their product

title: Try a TurboTax alternative
content: I cannot express how angry I am. I like many other users, have used TurboTax for many years. This year, in November I purchased the 2014 deluxe version. No one likes being screwed and that is what intuit has done by eliminating essential forms of a common tax return without warning. They could have at least informed the public prior to the product's release.. But oh no, that may have hurt their sales. Well I cannot say strongly enough that this is absolutely the last product I will ever buy from them. I certainly will not "upgrade" to to the "premier" version. Instead I invested in H&R Block's tax preparation software, and aside from a few glitches, it so far seems to be doing the job. When my last financial institution releases my data and I can download it, i will have finished my taxes for 2014. Goodbye Intuit!

title: Good bye Turbo Tax
content: TurboTax - I'm changing to H&R Block. The last time I changed was when you tried to impose a $9 fee for printing extra returns. Now you are at it again by eliminating a key component to the program. After many years as a customer, albeit one year I left because of the printing issue, I am now changing over to H&R. I will request a refund for the product - Good bye!

title: Time to change tax software.
content: I have been using turbo tax for many years to prepare my taxes. They know that it is easier to keep using the software year after year so you can easily transfer your data from the previous year. This is how they screw loyal customers by taking away something we alway had in the package to squeeze more money from us. You have just lost a loyal customer. Time to use a company that appreciates their customers.

title: Which product to purchase or switch to H&R Block?
content: Well it turns out I need to upgrade to Premier for $30 since I sold my home. That wasn't clear on the product details as the Deluxe notes "Homeowners" which to me would include appropriate forms needed incase you sell your home. So now with the upgrade its costing me more than just purchasing the premier product outright which I would have done if I had known. Looking into H&R block for next year.

title: Intuit sinks to new low!
content: I completely agree with all other reviews. I wish I had read the reviews before ordering this year. But for 10+ years Turbo Tax has always included the required forms needed for filing... Like Schedule C.... until this year. LAST YEAR I WILL PURCHASE an Intuit product!

title: I'm annoyed enough to considering switching over to H&R blocks software
content: Been using Turbo Tax around 25 years and schedule D has always been included in the Deluxe version. What's up with discontinuing this and letting customers know in a little footnote. This is a major strip down. I only found this out when using TT today and they send you to an upgrade option and want another $30. I'm annoyed enough to considering switching over to H&R blocks software. TT should admit there mistake and imediately allow for the upgrade free.

title: loyal customers shafted for profit - I will be seeking other means to complete my taxes in the future
content: i have been using turbo tax since my first job at 16. I've always qualified for 1040z basic or freedom edition because i have been a full time student employed part time. Well, imagine my surprise when this year attempting to complete my taxes after my w-2 arrived, I was asked to upgrade to deluxe and then home because I added one deduction beyond being single, I added education credits. Well, I ended up paying over a hundred dollars to complete my taxes this year. One part time w-2 and education deduction and I was made to upgrade to deluxe and pay this crazy amount. I might as well have gone to get my taxes done elsewhere. Imagine my surprise that your offer of 25 dollars back is reserved solely for previous year deluxe users. well, we are all upset at the changes that have been made. I was sent an email that said i would be able to file my federal and state at no charge... halfway through i got the upgrade prompt. i went through and re did my taxes three times before i realized that it was not an incorrect action on my part, but a change in your program. Customers should be made aware of these changes to give them a better choice at opting for better options. These changes do not only affect the top tiered users, but also those with smaller incomes, made to think that they have to follow your prompts in order to pay more.

title: Terrible Treatment of a Long-Time Customer
content: So, I just paid $30 for an upgrade to Premier that I find out half-way through the process that I need to finalize my taxes. And I applied for a $25 refund that's supposed to make me feel better. But, I find out by reading the Amazon reviews that if I had waited until February 7 to do my taxes, no upgrade would have been required. Somehow, I seem to have lost $5 (plus taxes) because I did my taxes early. Intuit, you really screwed this up!!

title: After so many years with TurboTax I really hate to switch
content: Well, as many already said, this product doesn't do nearly what it did last year. There is nothing 'deluxe' about it now except for the price. I bought mine at a local store, and will need to drive back to make a return. After so many years with TurboTax I really hate to switch, but it sounds like HR Block will import last years TT return just fine, so I'll probably give it a try.

title: This year is even worse. Good job
content: Can't believe TurboTax thought it could slide these changes through without some kind of backlash. Deluxe always had all the forms I need until last year when I had some quirky investment issue and was forced to "upgrade" to Premier to finish my taxes. This year is even worse. Good job, TT--you've lost a twenty year customer.

title: Big Mistake, Huge. Waiting for TT Deluxe "Classic"
content: At least 7 years running have been using TT Deluxe, but not for 2014. Schedule D is critical to us. Wasn't happy that Intuit likes to charge MORE to their loyal customers who accept their mailer version - always get it on my own from Amazon and I appreciate everybody's reviews here to guide me on this decision.

title: After many years of using Turbo-Tax for what I consider ...
content: After many years of using Turbo-Tax for what I consider a relatively simple return, they are now forcing us to buy something extra. I already purchased the deluxe edition at Costco and downloaded it so I would be ready to start my taxes at the end of January. Didn't even read (ignorant of me) the package, just picked it up and bought it, as I have done many years before. I'll be looking for a new software package next year, and it won't be TURBO-TAX.

title: Bad change. I'm not happy.
content: I'm very unhappy with the change in features of the versions. I've used TT since before the year 2000 and always been happy. While I've appreciated the personal replies by Intuit's representative and the offer of a free upgrade for returning customers, the product itself deserves a 1 star rating.

title: BEWARE!
content: BEWARE if you filed your 2013 tax return with Turbo Tax 13 Deluxe and later downloaded their upgrade. Six months after e-filing I needed information from my 2013 return and TurboTax automatically asked if I wanted to update the program. I allowed it to update and it changed my return completely. Instead of a refund it now states I owe the IRS over $2500. Finally found the error in the supporting section of schedule C. I suspect Intuit changed their program to the new format so Deluxe no longer supports Schedule C and Investment information. I downloaded Turbo Tax 2014 Deluxe and sure enough Intuit did a real job on all of us who have used their Deluxe programs for years. I have since manually entered my supporting info on my 2013 return from my hard copy so it will not make an error when or if I download the info to another tax program. I am not proceeding with Intuits TurboTax Deluxe this year. After this mess I am not confident in their future products and will search for something better.

title: Waste of my time!!!
content: Wish I could give it zero stars... why didn't the product description show that this year there is a brand new "feature" in that the schedules are not included in this product? Basically, you can't do your taxes if you need schedules C, D, E... what a waste! Time to find another product that won't try to screw me...

title: Seems like a scam to me
content: So frustrating. I'm using the online turbotax software. I completely finished everything, and am ready to file. Suddenly, it's shown that there will be an extra $35/state filing. I tried to cancel the state filing, but it says I can't because I've already made payments (which I have NOT). Now, I'm trying to reach customer service, and I've been on hold for over 6 hours. Seems like a scam to me.

title: Intuit, you blew it really bad. Even your mea culpa is pathetic
content: I have been using TT since the 1980's. For the last several years I've been using the Basic version and e-filing, using Sch. D and the 1040. But when I went to the local store to buy this year, it was apparent I couldn't use Basic anymore, so I bought Deluxe. But before opening it, I suspected a problem with filing Sch. D and googled. And I find this firestorm of complaints over TT doing a bait and switch. Seems I can't use Deluxe either. I've already paid $10 more, now they want another $30. So I waited, knowing Intuit would have to fix their screw up. And now that I've seen it, all I can say is "You've got to be kidding me". They expect me to load this crap, pay their bait-and-switch extortion, file, then apply for a refund? Bull. If they were thinking at all, they would have simply provided the forms to Deluxe users through update. Instead, they make people jump through more hoops. Unbelievable. My purchase remains unopened, and back to the store it will go, where I'll buy H&R's Deluxe, which only costs $25. Goodbye to TT after nearly 30 years of use. Such a shame!

title: We had always used Turbotax Deluxe but not anymore .
content: I purchased this through newegg and it is a complete joke on explaniing lump sum distribution for social security lump sum distributions from previous year and 3rd party insurance disabilty. ,.It was very frustrating and feel like we wasted 75.00 as we will just take it all to a tax service now.

title: Not Turbo this year
content: Had been a Turbo Tax user and was ready to buy. Good thing I waited and found out about the Turbo Tax deception since I would have bought the Deluxe and been cheated. Went to HR Block alternative and will see how well it goes - disc should be arriving tomorrow. Message to Turbo Tax - we appreciate value, consistency and trust. You've lost mine with this version switch scheme.

title: Disappointed with Turbo Tax/Intuit
content: I have had problems for the last 2 years with TT State, and didn't find out until 1/2 way through 2014. I heard about the business info being removed. I already switched to H&R Block last week. They have the state worksheets available that I couldn't get from TT. I had to contact my state and get an instruction booklet for the forms, file amended returns and mail the forms in. I have had problems with Cust Serv in the past. I'm still appealing the returns with my state for 12 & 13. I won't go back. I must admit that I had a PC that deleted Intuit's Quicken while it was in the process of dying. I had a MAC I needed to switch to. The Cust Serv staff at that time (3-4 years ago) gave me the MAC version of Quicken, that isn't user friendly like the PC version, but it does what I need it to.

title: DO NOT BUY - Worthless and neutered compared to last year's version
content: Worthless and neutered compared to last year's version. Have fun paying an extra 40 bucks for the stuff they removed from the previous version, all in a lame attempt to suck a little more money out of your wallet. Shame on you, TurboTax, you lost me as a customer forever. DO NOT BUY THIS.

title: Intuit: If you had been a little less greedy, you could probably have had my business until I stopped paying taxes.
content: TurboTax was the first electronic tax preparation software I ever used; it was an elegant solution to a real headache, and I wholeheartedly recommended it to friends and colleagues. If you've read the other reviews on this site, you already know why I am taking the trouble to write this negative review: what used to cost me $30 would cost me $90 this year (as I have investment income, and I used to be able to make do with the "Basic" downloadable version). I am not romantic about corporations: Intuit doesn't owe me anything---they're in the game to make money. Even so, there seems to me to be something exploitive about a 200% price increase for a major part of Intuit's TT demographic. As Intuit is aware, people become accustomed to software and there is hassle involved in porting everything to a competitor's system; I suppose that's what they are banking on. Intuit: I resent the time I am now going to have to waste to figure out competitor's software. If you had been a little less greedy, you could probably have had my business until I stopped paying taxes.

title: you MAY notice a little message that says "* Important Offer Details and Disclosures" and if you're sharp enough and you have re
content: Wow. Same price and far less funtionality? Wow. I just purchased H&R Block. It will import all of my TT returns. I had been using TT for the past 17 years. I just read the reviews here. And people think Google and the U.S. government are evil?? Intuit has them beat by a long shot. To all of you who wrote a negative review: I agree with your sentiment and Intuit should be ashamed of themselves. If you read the very first bullet point in the product description, it says "TurboTax has changed this year. Use the product comparison chart to find the right TurboTax software for your tax situation." That was a red flag for me. But for the life of me I couldn't find ANYTHING on the Amazon pages that described what the changes were. ZERO. So I went directly to the TurboTax website and I spent almost 10 minutes and still couldn't find anything that described exactly what has changed. Oh sure, there are asterisks all over the place referring you to footnotes that don't describe anything about the changes. But all you can find in the footnotes is just the typical "we'll back you up guarantee" stuff. If you look hard enough there is a tiny tiny little "i" next to some of the product features but check out the photo I uploaded. If you hover over the "i" all it says is the same thing the general product description said: "make sure to choose the right product.." Again, NOTHING about what had changed. Ugh. And oh, if you scroll down a bunch and you look even harder, you MAY notice a little message that says "* Important Offer Details and Disclosures" and if you're sharp enough and you have really good dexterity you may notice a little down arrow next to it and you may be able to click on it but guess what? All it displays is a general list of the "benefits" from using TurboTax. Wow. Wow. How far TurboTax has fallen. Well, I have my H&R Block software (less expensive too) and I'm on my way. Hey Bob Meighan Mr. VP at TurboTax: I wouldn't have your people sitting by the phone hoping M in SC calls you. Seriously Bob? You couldn't leave off your "VP" title from your comments?? Do you really feel the need to be that pretentious? Hmmm....folks....something tells me Bob had a big hand in removing the functionality from TT Deluxe.

title: Bye, Intuit
content: I've used TurboTax for many years, but this latest move by Intuit is the straw that broke the camel's back. I'll not accept this intentionally dumbed down program; the farce that is Quicken for Mac already exceeded my limit of tolerance for restricted functionality. I've just switched to H&R Block software. Intuit, you've lost another long time customer.

title: Deceptive and Poor Policy Decision
content: Lost another customer Intuit! Deceptive and unusable as I need Sch C but do not need your interview process to prepare it. I like others will not be coming back and we will not be gouged. Will purchase different software from now on. Too bad, I have been using your product and referring it to others since 1989. You obviously do not care about us so we will reciprocate. Bye

title: Shame on you, Intuit Turbo tax.
content: Shame on you, Intuit Turbotax. I have been a loyal customer of Intuit Turbo tax for over 10 years. They make a solid product. Imagine how I felt when I found that the Deluxe version will no longer file my forms! No warning that what worked last year doesn't work this year. It wont even submit schedule D if I fill it out manually with no help from the software. Simply put, I felt betrayed and disrespected as a customer. I returned Turbo tax and am happy to spend less and get more from HR Block. I only hope that Intuit learns how to treat their customers better.

title: Switching to H&R Block software, it's compatible with my old TT returns.
content: Based on all the complaints, I just switched to H&R Block. They are actually offering a free switch even to folks that already bought Turbo Tax. I've been a TT user for over 10 years, and in my opinion, the company leadership seems to be more interested in raising revenues by new pricing schemes than in offering new innovations/products. I've been using Delux, usually buying from Costco. Pretty lame not include all the Schedule D (stocks) in Delux anymore, requiring spending more. As I say, I don't mind paying for better software that does more stuff, but this seems to be a way to take advantage of the cash-cow of returning customers. HRBlock s/w can import from TT, but even if they couldn't, i'll make the switch and maybe Intuit will "make the switch" of the VP or CEO who came up with the analysis that said the changes in 2014 TT would get them more money. The thing is, lost market share is the real risk here for Intuit. Can't get that back Mr. senior VP.

title: Low and behold I decided to install TurboTax on my ...
content: Low and behold I decided to install TurboTax on my PC today(January21, 2015) and start entering information to get a first read on my tax situation. I got about half way through and TurboTax now wants an additional $30.00 to upgrade from Deluxe to Premier so I can enter some stock sale information. This was one of those classic 'got cha' moments.

title: Keep your "rebate". I'd rather switch; and I ...
content: Keep your "rebate". I'd rather switch; and I did. This business model turns me off.

title: Life long TurboTax user. Just switched to HR Block ...
content: Life long TurboTax user. Just switched to HR Block! Intuit marketing can't be very bright!

title: Turbo Tax will go down for this greedy move!
content: It is outrageous that Turbo Tax has altered their product with the false explanation that they had to do so. We know why they did thisâ¦.greed, pure and simple!! I will not purchase this product anymore, even though I've been a using turbo tax for over 15 years. Nice going turbo tax. I hope that you go under!

title: Intuit Greed
content: I first heard of the Deluxe version changes in an e mail this evening from Intuit. What a joke. I purchased my deluxe version 2 weeks ago and am 1/2 way through my input. The lousy $25.00 rebate does me no good when I paid for deluxe and now need to shell out $60.00 or more for premier addition. They need to offer these schedules as a free download. I finally realized that annual updates to Quicken were a waste of money, now Intuit is going to gouge me on Turbo Tax? I don't think this the kind of company that care to deal with. GREED KILLS BUSINESS.

title: TurboTax You BLEW IT!!!!
content: As a loyal customer from day 1, I was shocked as everyone else, to hear that TurboTax underhandedly crippled this product. Every company strides to improve their product each year to retain their customer base but not TurboTax, they sneakily removed the electronic support for Investments & Rental Properties. Honestly, how can you remove categories, keep the exact same product name and then have the nerve to charge the same price!!! Do you think we are a bunch of nitwits??? Unless you make a public announcement that you goofed-up and will restore the same features that you had from previous years and will continue for future years, then you LOST another loyal customer. You must realize once you force us to try another product (i.e. H&R Block) we are NOT coming back. TurboTax WAS king of tax software and now companies like H&R Block sees the discontent and are now offering free downloads to their software knowing once you try us, you're here to stay. The entire TurboTax executive board needs to be FIRED!!!

title: morons
content: They screwed the pooch on this move. typical I suppose. buh bye turbotax. hello H&R Block

title: very disappointed with TurboTax making the changes this year and not ...
content: very disappointed with TurboTax making the changes this year and not notifying people much earlier than waiting till they have already purchased their product and downloaded it and unable to return it I will be finding a different way of filing my taxes

title: Time to switch
content: Turbo Tax made a huge mistake by taking functionality away... H&R and Tax Act are way cheaper, we are switching this year. That's it for the loyalty we had all this years. This is really upsetting, unfortunately didn't read the reviews on time, but I am returning the product.

title: Not happy!
content: I am one of those unsuspecting customers that buys the Deluxe version of TT at Costco as soon as it goes on sale with rebate. I did the same thing this year. I installed the program and downloaded the previous year tax return with no problems, just as expected. What I did not expect, was that when I went to enter my K-1 income (I am self-employed, that's the only income I have), I was greeted with an invitation to upgrade to TT Premier! Say what???!!! So I picked up the phone and called TT customer support for explanation. I was given a line about how it's a better product now than before, how it's streamlined across different platforms, etc. I told the lady that I am not happy about not being able to complete my tax return, and she immediately offered to make me happy by upgrading to Premier version at no cost. That is why I rated this product 2 stars - one for being deceptive to begin with, and one for CS effort to fix the problem. I am tempted to tell my local Costco store to place a sign above the Deluxe version that it's not the same product as in years past. I would also recommend to Intuit (and/or Amazon) to place warning on their site just below the name of the product: DO NOT BUY THIS VERSION IF YOU HAVE K-1 INCOME. THIS FEATURE HAS BEEN REMOVED IN 2014 VERSION. PLEASE PURCHASE PREMIER VERSION INSTEAD. Finally, I want to state clearly for everyone reading that I do not object to companies changing prices/features/products. It's a free market, do what you want. Just be upfront about it! I will be thinking really hard this time next year whether to purchase TT Premier to complete my personal taxes, or whether to give competitor a try. I have been using TT ever since it came out, and money is really not a big problem, it's the deception that leaves bad taste in my mouth.

title: nice attempt at "spin" by Intuit saying they were trying ...
content: I was a 10 yr. TurboTax Deluxe customer until they eliminated Sch.D investments this year and attempted to move these customers to the much higher priced Premium product; I read the USA Today and Kiplinger articles on the change; nice attempt at "spin" by Intuit saying they were trying to make the Deluxe product the same as the Online version; Hey Intuit....why not make the "Online" version the same as the previous Deluxe version??...going to H&R Block

title: but find new tax software like HRBLOCK deluxe
content: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT. Stick with quicken, but find new tax software like HRBLOCK deluxe. this is NOT THE SAME AS ITS BEEN FOR YEARS, its missing basic investment forms, and missing forms on each level that it used to have. THIS IS NOT THE SAME AS BEFORE. DUMP DUMP DUMP, dont order this product

title: Not going to be a sucker for this price increase.
content: A loyal Turbo Tax filer since product was first offered on diskette; I can see the boxes for the four most recent years. Raising prices while cutting functionality on download versions that have near $0 incremental cost of goods is shameful. They have email addresses for all of their users and could have proactively communicated the new strategy and pricing during 2014. Instead, like thieves in the night, they hoped to sneak the change thru catching customers in the midst of filing and stuck with already purchased software and entered data. The amazing part is did they not think the aggrieved customers wouldn't remember next year even if they pay the ransom this year. FYI, don't be afraid of trying other mainstream software tax products. They read prior Turbo Tax files for importing data much like programs can read Excel files.

title: Decade long Turbo Tax Customer - No More
content: My brother sent a text informing me that Turbo Tax had changed the deluxe this year. Unbelievable is all I can say. They had a life long customer in me. I never gave it a second thought on what I'd be using for taxes each year. They took a great product, broke it into pieces, and ruined it. I really don't see what makes this a "deluxe" tax software if it doesn't do simple stock transactions. I don't care why they thought they had to do it. The reality of their decision is I'll be finding the same functionality of the old deluxe in a competitor product at a cheaper price. Nicely done Intuit, you just drove away what would have been two life long customer's in my brother and my myself.

title: Brilliant Marketing
content: So, I just purchased the Deluxe edition....for more money than last year....and now I find out it does LESS? Apparently Intuit has graduated from the Netflix School of Marketing. "We love our customers so much we're going to stick it to them hard....we'll make more money, my bonus will go through the roof, and the stockholders will love me." There is simply no reason for this. I used to highly recommend TT to everyone...and I literally mean everyone...as the absolute best tax prep out there. Guess I'll be investigating other options. I hear your competitors are offering some very enticing deals.

title: Bushwhacked by TT
content: I have using TT since 1998, feel like I have been ambushed. I need schedule d for one little mutual fund I'm using for a grandson's college fund. TT reason for the change is total BS. You lost this loyal customer along with all my family members.

title: Goodbye TurboTax!!!
content: After using TurboTax for many years, I'm no longer purchasing this product. Intuit really kick over a hornetâs nest this time by forcing many of us to pay over $80 (can you say price gouging) for functionality available in less expensive versions earlier. To add insult to injury, even if you wanted to manually fill out some of the forms, you would not be able to e-file your return with the less expensive version. Fine Intuit â there are other alternatives and my money will be going elsewhere. This along with the other problems that have been reported in the news lately with TurboTax have driven me (and by the looks of the reviews on amazon and elsewhere) to look for other avenues. I've returned this year's product and am looking for another alternative.

title: It is easy to keep a customer
content: I will have to go elsewhere this year. It is easy to keep a customer, but almost impossible to get one back.

title: Not recommended in this configuration. Consider alternatives.
content: Intuit periodically manipulates Turbotax configuration in ways that raise questions about its integrity. This year it has eliminated some form access in the Deluxe edition in order to push consumers into higher priced versions that they would not have needed in prior years. A few years ago, as i highlighted in a widely read review, they did something similar by curtailing the ability of the user to do several returns with the same software purchase. Resulting criticism and buyer resistance prompted Intuit to reverse themselves. As for me, a longtime user, i am exploring other software solutions. If i am happy with the conversion capabilities of a competitor, then i plan to switch. If not, I will hold out and see if Intuit rediscovers its business ethics. Note that negative reviews already outnumber positive ones, and at least one of the five star reviews appears to have been posted on behalf of Intuit.

title: Change Not So Challenging
content: After 15 years I switched from Turbo Tax Deluxe to HR Block Deluxe. No Phone call needed. $32 to H & R Block for their deluxe download. Does schedule C & D. Imports from etrade and vanguard. So change is not really challenging at all as Bob Meighan with Turbo Tax suggests.

title: Tired of Intuit. I'm out.
content: Glad I researched this before blindly purchasing the same product I've purchased for several years. I will be trying a competing product this year. Especially after the latest FORCED upgrade to Quicken completely screwed up all of my online bill pay and banking, it is clear that Intuit values fleecing its customers more than providing a stable product at a fair price. Can't do much about Quicken because unfortunately there really is no competing product, but I have an option to Turbotax and I will be exercising that option. Intuit, you are proving to be the best thing that happened to your competitors in years!

title: Caution!! It is not the same Deluxe as last year.
content: Careful of the Bait & Switch. They advertise it as the Deluxe edition, but they require you to upgrade for another $30 if you want it to have the same forms included in the 2013 Deluxe edition.

title: WARNING!! TurboTax Downgraded for 2014
content: Very unhappy that Intuit has downgraded their TurboTax product line for 2014 (see many 1-star reviews)! Their VP, Bob Meighan, states here that they needed to take away features to be consistent with their other (mobile and online) products. IMO, this is pathetic reasoning. If they've been planning how to position their product line for 5 years, as he states, they should have aligned their products in each "level" so that each delivers *at least* the same functionality as in past years. This would have boosted customer enthusiasm leading to increased sales, and made the higher-priced TurboTax products (relative to competitors) a better value proposition. Instead, they chose to downgrade products whose names are familiar to long-time customers, thus surprising and alienating many who just stayed with the same "level" they have used for many years. Consistent branding is important, but Intuit seems to be oblivious to this (or figured that once the product was bought, many users would buy in-product upgrades to get the functionality they took away--essentially a "bait and switch" tactic). BUYER BEWARE! Take another look at the competition, as I will be doing. This from a long-term user of Intuit products, who has seen their software quality decrease over the years (e.g. forum-based Turbotax help, Quicken bugs and forced upgrades).

title: Schedules removal
content: I join in those protesting the removal of schedules from the 2014 tax year in the Deluxe version. It's not so much about the money as about the TIME I have to spend screwing with this issue.

title: Intuit CEO salary goes from 13.4 million to 16.5 million in one year. Wonder why?
content: Just like the rest of you I am tired of companies finding new ways to screw customers. If it's not grocery items being packaged in smaller sizes and quantities to try to fool us it is guys like Turbo Tax going after more money from the public. I went on line and after reviewing my needs was directed to Basic. After a few entries I was told I needed to upgrade to Deluxe and as I proceeded further was told to go next step higher. Disgusting. H&R block on the other hand very straightforward and easy to use. I've read where Turbo Tax is apologizing and offering rebates but in my case, the damage is done. Getting caught cheating is not always forgiven just because you say you are sorry Turbo Tax. I've used Turbo Tax from the beginning. No more. By the way, their CEO's pay went from 13.4 million in 2013 to 16.5 million in 2014. Some of it is stock options so don't think he is offering the rebate because he is a nice guy. He needs the stock to stay up so he doesn't personally lose money. How would he live without his 3 million dollar raise?

title: Now the public knows what Intuit does to tax preparers ...
content: Now the public knows what Intuit does to tax preparers who use their Professional Product. Intuit is a greedy company. Don't worry they will figure out another way to fleece you

title: H&R Block is better and much cheaper
content: No more Turbo Tax. After using it for 10 years this is the end of the line. Never again. The 2014 H&R Block COMPLETE tax software is $29.99. And it imports data from previous TT returns. Thank you for your price increase Intuit. Without that I would have just continued paying too much.

title: I hate being held hostage
content: I hate being held hostage. So much so I'd rather fill out my taxes by hand than submit! Fortunately there are more enlightened alternative companies. I wonder how much this is going to cost Intuit and if they will behave better next year.

title: Here's my reply to the apology letter rebate offer
content: I have used TurboTax deluxe for years, filing paper copy returns. I just received the "apology email with rebate offer" I can't get the rebate because they require me to provide my social security number -> no way that's going to happen Here is the email reply I sent back in response to the apolgy email rebate offer : ******* Hello, Thank you for the offer of a rebate. I went to the website to enter the information for the rebate, but unfortunately it appears you require me to provide you my social security number in order to get the refund. Your company has the records showing I purchased a CD copy of the 2013 turbotax, and it was verified online as valid in order to download updates. There is NO valid reason why you require my social security number. I did use turbotax for my 2013 taxes, but filed via paper, the old fashioned way, just as I have done so using turbotax for MANY years. I will NOT provide your company with my social security number, as your greed driven profit motive change to the 2014 TurboTax deluxe version eliminating the ability to do schedule D capitol gains proves to me your company is not to be trusted. Although I have used TurboTax to calculate my Taxes and file paper returns for many years, I seriously doubt I will be purchasing your product this year. I am exploring the H&R Block software and TaxAct software now. Thanks, but NO THANKS on your offer of a rebate - Good Luck with your future business models - you're going to need it. From a long-time FORMER customer, Sincerely,

title: Another Customer Lost
content: I was going to buy this product again (as I do every year) until I read how TurboTax had removed many essential forms. Hopefully TurboTax will reverse course for next year but this year, at least, they have lost me as a customer.

title: The gouge continues
content: As if it wasn't bad enough that intuit makes people buy the SAME exact software each year, now intuit has crippled the functionality of the basic version to force people to pay more money for the premium version by eliminating common schedules used by virtually every small business owner. Two thirds of reviewers rated this release one star for a reason Bob. Listen to your customers for a change.

title: Goodbye TurboTax
content: I've used Turbo Tax for the last 8 years but it looks like that streak has come to an end. I'm just glad I saw the reviews that tipped me off to that they gutted the Deluxe version and were going to force me to pay 50% more before I wasted my time using their product this year. Congrats Intuit, you've taken a loyal customer who has recommended your products in the past and turned them into someone who won't use your products again. PS - You can keep the $25 refund you're offering this year and I'll keep my money this year (and next year, and the year after that, and the year after that, and the year after that...)

title: DON'T BUY THIS!
content: This product is now useless to me... they disabled some of the key features that were standard in it for the past 10+ years (i.e. schedules C, D, E, etc.) So, basically if you have anything more than a W-2 and a 1099.. this software is useless. (check other reviews for more details)

title: Dumb move Intuit
content: I have never used any product except Turbo Tax to do my taxes. I was able to get everything done that I needed using the Deluxe version. I usually just grabbed a copy from Costco. Did the same yesterday and when I got home I saw a story in Yahoo news about the changes folks were not happy with. Thank goodness that I did not open the package and was able to return it to Costco. I am retired and have a small amount of self-employment income, so I need schedule 1040 SE which is not available in the deluxe version. Looks like I will be changing to H and R Block software, better than TT at about half the costs. Bad move on TT's part, losing long time customers for the sake of a couple of bucks. Haven't bought the replacement software yet maybe TT will get the message in these reviews and get that free upgrade out to everyone, not just to those who call and complain/beg for help.

title: Bad design to remove previously included schedules
content: I returned this product after finding it did not include Schedule e. I have been a turbo tax user for 10 years but am now going to the H & R block product.

title: Lack of features, price too high
content: The 2014 version does not have the features - Intuit has not disclosed this upfront, if you have any stocks or other investment you have to buy premier version the software. The software is priced too high.

title: Greedy, greedy Intuit
content: This is ridiculous. $30 extra so I can file schedule D. The CEO of this lousy company should be stripped of all bonuses he's every been paid and then fired. I'm going to ask Amazon for a full refund and do the following: Email H&R Block at SwitchToBlock@hrblock.com and include your name, address, and phone number, operating system and a photo, scan, or email showing proof of TurboTax Basic or Deluxe purchase. Once approved, H&R Block will then send a link for one free download of H&R Block Deluxe + State tax software. You can even import last yearâs tax return from TurboTax into the H&R Block tax software.

title: I'd rather switch than fight
content: I've very upset about this. This year, I have a rare situation in that I need to report 1099 income on my taxes. I did a ton of research and realized that I could not use TurboTax Basic and had to upgrade to TurboTax Deluxe. I wasn't so upset because this was a new situation for me, and I figured it wasn't reasonable to keep using TT Basic. However, I have been filing Schedule D for a decade or more using TT Basic. Now, I see that they want to push me to Premier. That's plain unadulterated greed is what it is. Nowhere-and I mean nowhere--was it mentioned that they were pulling back on Schedule D support in the lower priced versions. H&R Block is offering their Deluxe version for free if you can prove that you bought Intuit's TT Deluxe in the first place. I'd rather switch than fight.

title: Sneaky price increase
content: Goodbye Turbotax I have used your product for more years than I care to recall - hello H&R Block, for 1/2 the price you do what Turbotax used to do and you can read my previous years Turbotax filing.

title: To: Bob Meighan, VP TurboTax, I've used ...
content: To: Bob Meighan, VP TurboTax, I've used turbotax for about approx. 20 years.... I will not use it now.... Why did you guys do it???? I'm now telling my friends not to trust The 2014 turbotax!!!

title: Turbo tax are bait and switch artists. Then when ...
content: Turbo tax are bait and switch artists. Then when caught they offer to refund part of the money. Refund all of it and I may use you next year.

title: So long TurboTax. It's been a long (10 yrs) ...
content: So long TurboTax. It's been a long (10 yrs) run. H&R Block provides the same functionality for much less $$. Reducing what TT can do and charging the same price was a BIG mistake. I'm done with Intuit.

title: Pure Corporate Greed
content: I posted the below comment yesterday 1/10/2014 and it stayed up for a little while and apparently was taken down. I guess Amazon and/or Intuit didn't like the comment. So I am posting it again. We will see how long it says up this time. You really should read the FORBES article referenced below. I was about to buy TurboTax as I have been for the last 10-12 years. Then I saw all the negative reviews. You should read Janet Novack's article today from Forbes, (...) I recently bought Intuit Stock(INTU) thinking it would be a good investment. Within the last few weeks I got Intuit's Proxy Statement/Vote and noticed that their CEO earned over $16.5M for 2014, over $4M than the year before, most of the increase was Option Awards. That's nearly a 25% increase in one year, how many of you have gotten that kind of raise this year or ever? I voted my disapproval of Executive Compensation and intend on selling my stock Monday Morning. I would call what Intuit TurboTax Deluxe has done by removing their support for electronically file a Schedule D, for capital gains and losses; Schedule C, for profit and loss from a sole proprietorship business; Schedule E, for rental real estate, royalties and distributions from partnerships; or Schedule D, for farm income pure Corporate greed.

title: Intuit's Greedy Bait-and-Switch loses this Loyal Customer of 20 Years
content: Silently slip-streaming a shrunken version lacking the most basic of tax forms, into the same-labelled, same-priced "DELUXE" product, is a sneaky, cowardly act of corporate guile: as duplicitous as it is transparently poor business. A commentator at the Occam's Razor blog summed up Intuit's folly as being nowhere near as fatal as the BP oil spill, nor the Bhopal disaster - yet - perhaps it will rank high, regardless, for how it will be remembered as a gross act of blind corporate greed. So: I am a TurboTax customer who's been using TurboTax each year, faithfully, since its origins: for about 20 years now. And: recommending it to others. All that has changed in the last few weeks. Disgusted: by Intuit's outrageous disrespect toward its loyal customer base. And also: distrustful, and downright fearful, about purchasing and using the product now, since the last few days' revelations of widespread hacking of its customers' tax filing identities. Intuit claims the data hacks had nothing to do with Intuit. Yet headlines and research, including Krebs on Security and CNBC, seem less convinced, or inconclusive. Should we let Intuit off the hook regarding the exposure of customer data? Well, one bit of evidence may be the Matt Krantz piece at USAtoday (January 28, 2015) indicating Intuit is saving personal data of tax-filers who used TurboTax's efile, directly or through their CPA, including social security numbers (which Intuit evidently is asking customers to provide as a form of identification in order to claim their $25 product refund during the Deluxe version debacle). As a long-term TurboTax customer and tax efiler: I'd love to know how long Intuit is retaining my tax data. (Years?) Fortunately there are alternatives, such as downloading IRS forms directly, or using H&R Block's product which can even import prior year TurboTax data. (Ultimately I bought H&R Block's, then snail mailed my return this year.) Funny. I'm an IT analyst who's spent a career studying data privacy and security best practices... not an uninformed, superstitious rube. I suspect we simply don't yet know the full story of the TurboTax hacks. Can't back up my concerns with evidence.... but in a multitude of ways, the best I can say today, is that a company whose product absolutely MUST be all about trustworthiness: has simply and profoundly lost my confidence. _ Update: Recent headlines disclose Intuit's prolonged, aggressive, costly lobbying of Congress to suppress simpler IRS filing procedures. In other words: your major annual tax prep headache is largely engineered by Intuit's strong-arm lobbying. As NYTimes (April 2015 article) illustrates: what if paying your annual car registration required you to find your car's VIN, cross-reference multiple lookup tables, calculate the vehicle tax you owe, and process it much like you do now under income tax prep? Fortunately, instead, that tax uses a far simpler model. We could also be offering (not mandating, just offering) a similar simplification for the majority of income tax filers - if Intuit weren't playing hardball with elected officials to prevent meaningful reform. Multiple news sources suggest Intuit wants to keep your income tax prep mindbogglingly complicated: to earn a steady flow of dollars out of your pocket.

title: Do Not Buy TurboTax "Deluxe". It is not what it was...
content: Donât buy this. It is not the product it was. The rumors that schedules C, D and E have been removed from TurboTax Deluxe are true. Their removal is not totally clear at first use to those of us importing last year's tax return. What do I mean?? I imported last yearâs return and the schedules were present. I did this in November. Yesterday, Jan 24th I resumed working on my tax return, but having seen complaints regarding these tax schedules for TurboTax Deluxe, I looked closer. I found various warnings on the three schedules. One was on the second page, another scheduleâs warning indicated that I may needed to upgrade to Premier, and another stated I needed to upgrade in order to use the schedule. So I called TurboTax customer service at 800-445-1875. FYI, donât hang on, use the automatic call back feature â it works. Customer service did in fact call me back within 15 minutes. After much begging, telling them how stupid this change was. I was told the box is clearly marked. And perhaps it is, but having used TurboTax Deluxe for years and TurboTax before Intuit was around, I thought I knew what I needed and to expect. Not so anymore. And since I had no box as this was an online purchase in which I downloaded TurboTax, I really did not see any warnings. FYI, donât be mad with the service agent. They are trying to help. But you have to make your case if you want a dollar free upgrade. Else, all you will obtain is a $25 cash credit at the time of your electronic filing. After you purchase the upgraded product.
