I worked this issue from 10AM until 3:30PM. A customer should NOT have to do this! To me this is like buying a car. I expect it to come with 4 wheels and tires. Who would have thought I needed an upgraded product as management decided to market the âDeluxeâ product this year without the needed tires... Since my purchase was made more than 60 days ago, it exceeded Intuitâs warranty refund period. And Amazon, blessed their hearts, they understood the issues. My customer service agent (Ben) was even able to obtain approvals to help me from his boss. However, with Benâs information and him on my cell, I called Intuitâs customer service for a 3rd time with our home phone. With Ben in one ear and Intuit customer service in the other I was able to relay information such that Intuit provided me a one-time, free upgrade to âhome & Businessâ as I needed a schedule C, which does not come with any of the other TurboTax products. To say Intuitâs management made a mistake is an understatement. I have used TurboTax since day one. Next year I will use H&R Blockâs tax prep software unless Intuit reverses this stupid decision. What were they smoking? Clearly they were not thinking. And I know they are not based in Washington or Colorado...As their HQ is nearby. TurboTax Deluxe is no longer my turn-to tax product and it should be rebranded âTurboTax Minusâ. I thought of other names, but kids could be reading this review... My thanks to Amazon and their staff. You continue to retain my business with your outstanding customer service. Great job Ben! I am Mike Angles in San Jose, California.

title: am I glad I read these reviews first
content: Wow, am I glad I read these reviews first. I had already put the product in my cart, then read the reviews. After doing my first TurboTax return in 2000, I am not going to downgrade now to a version that does not prepare and file Schedule D as it does the rest of my return. ("Prepare it by hand"..."Mail Schedule D"...really, that's the proposed solution???) It was a great run with TurboTax, but for this year I'm going to find a new solution. (Anyone have suggestions? I've read a bit about the HR Block product, that's my pick for now...but I have more homework to do) Somewhere a projection was made that the lost customers would be off-set (plus) by increased revenue from moving customers from Deluxe to Premier to retain ease/consistency in how Schedule D is prepared/filed. I'd love to see if those projections turn out to be true. I'm thinking that TurboTax must also be betting that people who leave them over this issue will not like the other products on the market...and that those customers will be back next year. Again, it would be interesting to see if those projections turn out to be true.

title: Switching to H+R Block.
content: Boo. I had been a loyal TurboTax user for over 15 years. I switched to H&R Block this year and have been thrilled with the results.

title: Dear Intuit: Fool me once, shame on you...Fool me twice, shame on me
content: This is not the first time I have been a victim of their surprises - 2012 TT Deluxe was marketed to "Intel Mac users with 10.6.8 and above." But once I installed the software I discovered that even though my Intel iMac running 10.6.8 OS met their written specs, I was out of luck because I had a 32-bit CPU, not the 64-bit CPU that their code required. No where on the packaging did it say anything about 64-bit architecture required. And it took several calls to Intuit customer service to get their explanation (about the code differences). I almost switched to HR Block then but instead, used my 64-bit laptop. Now this surprise (it feels more like a hold-up) - I file a short form C and Sched E and neither need nor wish to pay an extra $30-$50 for their hand-holding....Sayonara, Turbo Tax!

title: Sasan Goodarzi, General Manager of the TurboTax Team, Must Think We Are Stupid!!
content: So I, like thousands of other longtime TurboTax users (18 years so far), received the "mea culpa" e-mail from Sasan Goodarzi, General Manager of the TurboTax Team, saying, in effect, "We decided to screw you this year - but we forgot to tell you about it in advance. But never mind, we're going to make it look like we are sorry and throw you a bone - all the while storing away your Social Security number so we can become the biggest target for hackers the world has ever seen!" Pleeze ... H&R Block, here I come!

title: TurboTax gets NO stars for this! This is NOT a star!
content: I have a need to deduct a home office for employees who work from home. That ability is a small part of my tax preparation picture, which is pretty simple overall. The Delux version has done what I need for many years. All of a sudden Intuit has decided that I must use a version TWO levels higher at DOUBLE the cost to do the same job. I don't think so! That decision is such an arrogant, money-grabbing move, done deceitfully, that I will not use TT again if I have to go manual! Some poor decision-maker needs to be put in the unemployment line for this!

title: Very Disappointed
content: As the others have said, thanks everyone for alerting us prior to ordering this year's edition of Deluxe. Time to move on.

title: This Year's Version Is Not Worth Buying
content: I've used and loved this product for over 15 years, buying it every January like clockwork. This year I was stunned to learn that because I sold some stock in 2014 I will need to pay $30 more for the Premier version. I have the cost basis for the stock sale and everything else I need to report it - all I need from Turbo Tax is the form. This is ridiculous.

title: Suck it
content: They charge you 40 for a state return then charge you 20 dollars to file it. I plan on never using this tax product again.

title: Hello H & R Block
content: Thank you everyone for warnings such as "(and yes Mr. VP, I know I can print it out and mail it in. Good grief. With a comment like that form the VP it now makes sense what you guys did)" Hello H & R Block. Thanks again.

title: No nonresident alien returns
content: The software does not do nonresident alien returns. Instead Turbotax refereed me to a third-party provider called Sprintax for which I need to pay additional $40 for the return. This restriction is not mentioned anywhere in the product description. I even followed the guided wizard on their website to determine the version that suits my needs. Such a waste of time and money.

title: TurboTax, a new epic fail business school case study
content: I bought the Deluxe version like so many others venting here. As soon as I started my return, the program alerted me that I'd need to upgrade this year. I could have told them this would be a corporate disaster. For every dollar they gained in the upgrade ploy in one year, they've lost five dollars in lost long term market share. I just got an email today from Intuit offering a rebate, but again I predict this miserable PR strategy will backfire. They didn't apologize for jerking us over, just for not communicating it better. Epic fail, TurboTax. You'll be the subject of many a business school case study.

title: Will you trust TurboTax with your financial identity?
content: I wish to thank all of the reviewers for pointing out the problems with the new limitations placed on TurboTax. I will not be purchasing TurboTax this year. TurboTax has tried this kind of pricing "surprise" before. Apparently back in 2008 they were attempting to charge users an additional $9.95 for each additional return whether they were printed or e-filed. After many negative reviews on Amazon, TurboTax apparently capitulated removing the extra fees for printing another return. Take a look at the Amazon reviews for TURBOTAX 2008. Seems like deja vu all over again! Honestly, how can you trust your most intimate financial details with a company that is so seemingly disingenuous or at the very least is so careless with their most valuable asset --- the customer ? Excerpts from Dec 2008 AccountingWeb Article Entitled "TurboTax turmoil: Online reviews pan the top selling software" are copied below illustrating the TurboTax issue in 2008. The holiday season doesn't seem to be very jolly for TurboTax 2008, at least not on Amazon.com where 171 online product reviewers have panned the perennial best selling software with one-star ratings. Users are not complaining about the functionality of TurboTax. The problem, as they see it, is with pricing changes. For the first time, TurboTax producer Intuit started charging users an additional $9.95 for each additional return whether they print or e-file. Many reviewers commenting on the product identified themselves as long-time TurboTax users who would be switching to different software because of the pricing issues. "I have used TurboTax for many years, but not any more. The $10 fee for printing of each additional return is simply not acceptable for those of us who file a return for our children or parents as well as our own. TurboTax has not made this new fee very obvious in their advertising, so many previous users are in for a nasty surprise," one reviewer wrote. Another user in Santa Cruz, CA, claimed to have been a fan of TurboTax since first using it in 1992 but would be switching to another program because of "a completely obnoxious pricing decision by Intuit." The reader continued to comment, "If you want to print another return you have to pay $10. I actually only do our joint return, but I often create new files to model "what if" scenarios, and I would be unable to print even a single form in the draft file without paying $10." Of the 182 product reviews as of the evening of December 9, 2008, 171 of them were one-star reviews and only five were five-stars, the highest rating.

title: making it useless. Of course they lowered the price(and I have ...
content: I have been using this product(the Deluxe version) for ten years. I bought it again and installed it. After that I found out that Intuit removed many forms from this version, making it useless. Of course they lowered the price(and I have a bridge to sell you). No, they forced me to then go uy the most expensive program they make. This is extortion, plain and simple. Unfortunately, one star is the minimum on Amazon. Buy the H&R Block program. DO NOT BUY this piece of FECES!!!!!!!!!!!

title: Leaving TurboTax for another
content: Thank you all for your reviews. I too have been a loyal TurboTax customer for many years and was preparing to purchase the Deluxe version. After reading the reviews, I have decided to purchase something else.

title: We have used TurboTax for 25 years. Based on the changes they have made, it is time we also make a change.
content: We have used TurboTax for 25 years. Based on the changes they have made, it is time we also make a change.

title: Lost Faith = Lost Business
content: Intuit has lost my business. Customer since 1986 except 2007 when my wife was so sick I didn't have time (REALLY - I am and am willing to post the proof, partial images of first page with the vendor id information from the bottom of page 1, if desired!) This whole fiasco with Schedule C (<$100 of royalty income) and having to pay another $25 shows a company that has badly misjudged it's audience. If they screwed this one up so badly, what other issues are lurking in the weeds. Guess I'll take H&R Block up on their free offer (I keep the receipts as a tax record). Once burned ... I won't be back and urge others do do the same.

title: Sneaky Change
content: Got sucked into the upgrade for $40 when I did not have to last year... after 7 years with you I am done!

title: One last insult from Intuit!
content: Intuit did not learn the lessons from a few years ago when then changed and would only let you install Turbotax on one computer. They got a huge black eye for that and as I recall the CEO apologized and promised not to make that kind of PR mistake again. Well welcome to stage two, with making it necessary to upgrade for $30 to the Premier addition to work on schedule D, which has been standard for years. Thank goodness I looked at the review before buying the Deluxe version. Amazon is running a sale this weekend on the H&R Block tax programs which will import turbotax files and their software is less expensive than Intuit's. I am gone forever after this latest insult of out intelligence by Intuit, This is just a pure money grab on their part. I have been a loyal Turbotax customer since they first brought out this software, almost 25 years. This is sad.

title: "Closing time, every new beginning comes from some other beginnings end".
content: HR Block is my new beginning after 12 years with Intuit. As a software executive in charge of client satisfaction this decision blows my mind.

title: One of the worst moves from Intuit
content: One of the worst moves from Intuit. I would always get Deluxe and and pay extra to upgrade to Premier whenever needed (due to ESPP or ESOP). But most of the years, for standard Schedule D, Deluxe would suffice. This is nothing but a significant price increase by Intuit. I really don't buy this cross platform excuse.. this is a tax software not Netflix that I want to use on 10 different devices. Visionaries even someone like Steve Jobs apologized whenever they screwed up, not telling customer that everyone is entitled to his/her opinion. Bob, I'm really surprised instead of addressing disappointment from loyal customers you are trying to justify this price gauging. Considering that Intuit doesn't care about my opinion, they probably don't care about my dime either, which definitely going somewhere going forward.

title: It's Really a Shame + HR Block Software Experience Reports
content: Successful businesses always under-promise and over-deliver. However, judging from Intuit's unintuitive actions, they have actually OVER promised and UNDER delivered. A fantastic recipe for failure and anger from formerly loyal customers. It would have been a better idea to just up the price a bit rather than disabling features and passing it on as though it was the same product from previous years. Sure, you can say just read the label, but there was a certain amount of trust that was built up over the years between Intuit and its users...TurboTax Deluxe has always worked the same way, except for this year, that is..Forms C, D and E are no longer available and you must now upgrade to either Premier or Home and Business versions, depending on your needs. Basically, it's no longer a matter of paying more for the functionality that used to be TurboTax Deluxe, it is now a matter of confusing the issue by selling a product under the same name, same price, but with major features disabled. This is neither smart business nor good PR, as can be seen by the many negative comments written here. But it goes further than just people being mad about this "bait and switch" tactic, what this means is Intuit has burned its bridges and have presented themselves as untrustworthy. What other changes are coming down the road that will affect customers adversely? Let's put this simply: If Intuit staff were used to going to a favorite restaurant and were used to ordering their favorite entrees year after year, and suddenly found that the dishes they ordered all had less food, and was missing important ingredients and food components, how long do you think it would be before they left and never came back? And on top of this, the owner of the restaurant says, "But you can get the same ingredients, food components, and quality if you only pay two times more for our new improved dishes!" Buh bye. I am sure Intuit felt that it had a good reason for doing what it did, but it wasn't a good decision as far as I'm concerned. I have been a long time user of TurboTax, but this recent debacle has left me feeling cold and disappointed with a company that I have trusted for years. A quick fix may be in the works to get a free upgrade to a version that works, but the irreparable damage done to this company's reputation has not only angered its users, but has started a wave of bad feelings and distrust that will take years to repair. Remember, one dissatisfied customer tells 10 people, and those 10 people tell more people. Intuit, you cannot afford this kind of bad publicity. Someone dropped the ball on this, and whoever it is, needs to step back and return the full functionality of TurboTax Deluxe for next year's version, or risk losing even more customers. Intuit needs to also whip (or fire) the programmers or lead programer that cannot find a way to make cross-platform versions for TurboTax work smoothly. It's not rocket science guys. At this stage of the game, H&R Block's Premium or Deluxe version may be the way to go for disgruntled TurboTax users such as myself. I was tempted to take the free upgrade offer by calling TurboTax, but thought differently about taking this course of action because of the dirty tactics by Intuit. I may get the freebie this year, but what about next year when I have to pay full price or get more features deleted? I will drop TurboTax this year and will be switching to HR Block Deluxe, which covers all the schedules formerly in TurboTax Deluxe, to see if it works; I have already ordered it. It's worth the risk in order to move away from TurboTax and Intuit's customer angering policies. They have to make a profit, and this is understandable. What isn't understandable is the sneaky and underhanded way they did this. They have lost my trust and it will be hard for them to win it back, if ever again, as I'm sure other former TurboTax users will agree. I will provide an update on HR Block Deluxe here after I receive it. Look for the in-depth review on HR Block Deluxe in the coming weeks. UPDATE ON HR BLOCK DELUXE: 1/12/2014 ----------------------------------------- I just installed HR BLOCK DELUXE in lieu of my usual TurboTax Deluxe product. HR BLOCK states that this version is compatible for Windows all the way to XP with SP3. After installation, which was very easy, I was presented with the option to import last year's TurboTax income tax data. It was able to search and find this file automatically, but after I hit the "import" button, I received an error message that stated: "HRBLOCK has encountered a problem and needs to close. We are sorry for the inconvenience." Apparently, after doing a search on the Internet, this seems to be a bug in the software when running on XP machines. HR BLOCK has not given an official fix date for this, nor an official statement, although some users said they were promised a fix from the 1/9/2014 update release. However, this did not solve the problem. The next update is scheduled for 1/22/2-14 from HR BLOCK, but no word as to whether or not this will fix the import bug. As I am typing this update, I have been online waiting for a chat representative to explain and offer some sort of fix date for this bug. I am number 10 on the waiting list, and it has been almost an hour and I am still waiting. (I am doing other computer related work while waiting). I also tried calling HR BLOCK's customer service number and was put on hold for over 15 minutes, when I decided to hang up. So far, this experience with HR BLOCK has not been stellar. I do NOT want to return to TurboTax Deluxe, but if HR BLOCK drops the ball on this, it will have lost my confidence, as well as many other former TurboTax users regarding the inability to import TurboTax data as promised. If you are running Windows XP, you may want to hold off buying HR BLOCK DELUXE until a fix for the import function is available, and hopefully, this will be soon. UPDATE 1/12/2014 CHAT Session with HR BLOCK REP ---------------------------------------------------- Here's a transcription of the chat session I just had after waiting one hour and 20 minutes to chat with an HR Block rep. The results aren't very inspiring for customer support there. The rep's name has been replaced to protect the guilty, other info has been changed to protect the innocent. The dialogue is funny and tragic. Read the part about "TT." ----------------------- HR REP.: Hello ----, welcome to H&R Block Tax Product Support! Please allow me a few moments to review the information you have submitted to us. ME: Hi, I hope you can help me. I cannot import my 2013 TT data into 2014 HR Block Deluxe as advertised by the product description. I get an error message that states the program has run into a problem and must shut down. I have just switched from TT Deluxe to HR Block's version this year due to the Intuit downgrade fiasco eliminating Schedules C,D, E and other forms. But unfortunately, this hasn't been a very good start with the HR Block product. Is there a fix for this from HR Block, and how long will it be till the update fix is available, if at all? If it takes too much time or the fix isn't available, I will have to go back to TurboTax for full functionality, something that I really would hate to do. ME: ...I a running Windows XP Service Pack 3 HR REP.: I'm sorry but when you say TT, can you explain what you are referring to? ME: TurboTax Deluxe HR REP.: Thank you, let me just verify some information from you. Can I please get your e-mail address, phone number, and zip code please? ME: Sure, my email address is: -----------------------ME: Home phone is: --------------- HR REP.: Where did you purchase the software? ME: Amazon.com HR REP.: Do you need help with the steps to download it? ME: no. I have already installed it. As I mentioned, it does not import last year's Turbotax info as stated in the description for HR BLOCK Deluxe. I would like to know when a fix for this bug will be available. HR REP.: I'm sorry this will be technical support, and this is product support. I am not sure when the bug is available. I would either return the CD back to Amazon or get in touch with Tech Support. ME: How do I do this? ME: And since this is product support, can you look up an answer for me? HR REP.: I would call the 1-800 number tomorrow morning, the number is on the H&R Block website. ME: Wow. This isn't looking too good for us former Turbo Tax users. Thanks anyway for your time. I waited over an hour for this, lol. HR REP.: Is there anything else I can assist you with today? ME: No. That's it. Have a good evening. Take care. HR REP.: I would like to let you know that you may receive a short Customer Satisfaction Survey by e-mail in the next day or two. If you could take a moment to provide me with some feedback on my performance today, I would really appreciate it. HR REP.: Thank you for contacting H&R Block Tax Product Support, ------. We look forward to supporting you in the future! ME: Not too sure about that, though. Thanks anyway. Thank you for using H&R Block Technical Support. Your satisfaction is important to us. You'll soon receive a short survey via e-mail. Please share your thoughts about your service experience. Your chat has now ended. Please close this window. Your session has ended. You may now close this window. UPDATE 3/23/2015: ------------------------------------- In the early part of February, HR Block released a fix for the Windows XP bug that wouldn't allow the importing of last year's Turbo Tax Deluxe tax data. The fix worked perfectly and I was able to complete my taxes with HR Block Deluxe. The session went smoothly, the e-filing of both my federal and state tax forms went without a hitch. As of now, I am an HR Block convert and have dropped Turbo Tax Deluxe as my go-to tax preparation software. Intuit's incessant agenda of taking advantage of its customers, its highly confusing product line, and the constant juggling of its prices for its products has left me with a large confidence hole in ever doing business again with Intuit and its Turbo Tax products.

title: What a sad story for Turbo Tax
content: What is going on with Turbo Tax Deluxe 2014?? I have been using Turbo tax since early 2000. I really liked the product. I used to file the basic version when I was single. Since I got married about 8 years ago, I've been using the Deluxe version. Last year for the first time I used Schedule C for my spouse's business income. It came in handy though I never used the feature before. Due to the business expansion we hired a CPA to do our business tax this year. I don't foresee doing any schedules this year. I do not need to have this feature to do my tax this year so I was just going to purchase the Deluxe edition for our 2014 joint personal income tax. As of today I see 171 one star review out of 242. I could not believe my eyes and I started reading the reviews. They were terrible. I think Intuit is making a big mistake. I do use other Intuit products/apps like Checks (Now Mint Bills), Mint, and ItsDeductibles. I still like them. I do not understand why Intuit made this move. Is this how they want to do their business? I could have been care less about those who need their schedules to file their taxes. I could have said it's not my problem. But as a customer it is important for me how a company conducts their business and treats their customers. I was not happy when I read all these reviews and what Intuit was doing. It bothered me greatly. According to lar (Dallas, Tx) & Larry Bellinger (Albany, NY USA) H&R Blocks seems a better choice both in pricing and features over Turbo Tax. I have been doing some pro-bono work at my job for those who are working in retail to file their taxes each year. I always use H&R Block software to file their Fed/State e-file at behive website. It's free if you are earning $58,000 or less, and if you have a straightforward tax filing needs. I am not sure if this is available in other states. I live in NY. I wished I was qualified. To those who do not need to file schedules just like me, it might also make sense to consider H&R Block. It is so sad because I had been using Turbo Tax for almost 15 years. Now I need to look for another product. Is it the greed why Intuit is doing this? This seems be the worst rating Turbo Tax ever had. If I am noticing I am sure others are also noticing about their bad decision.

title: Too bad they tried to pull a fast one on their ...
content: Intuit has lost their way. Too bad they tried to pull a fast one on their customer base by reducing functionality. Taking advantage of the HR Block offer for free deluxe software. Goodbye Turbo Tax.

title: Finally reversed, but this disaster will be studied at business school for years
content: A few minutes ago, a blog post from the Wall Street Journal announced: "Amid a continuing uproar, the maker of TurboTax tax-preparation software said Thursday it would reverse changes in its products that forced some customers to pay more to prepare 2014 tax returns. Intuit plans to reverse the changes next year, and also said it would shield some customers from or compensate them for additional costs incurred this year." As a very long time user of Turbotax, it's about time. Will this permanently impair the product? Hard to tell. I can guarantee this, though: the series of disastrous decisions that led up to the reversal will likely be studied in B-School for decades to come, along with Intuit's attempts to regain their customer base. We'll see, but their track record isn't exactly promising.

title: What a boneheaded move.
content: No apology for giving me less, just an apology for not communicating the change. I hate when a company does this to loyal, long-time customers. Unfortunately, they already have my money for this year. I'd consider coming back if the apology included a statement that moving forward, they will include the old feature set as part of the Deluxe product. Until then, good bye TurboTax, hello H&R Block. I hope the CEO feels shareholder (and Board) pressure and that the product manager got fired because this was a move to increase revenue without fully assessing the impact to customer experience and retention. The correct way to handle this is to say, "Wow, we really screwed the pooch. It happens and must have been caused by bad mushrooms. Here's the link to download the (former) full feature set for Deluxe. Rest assured that we hear you and will rectify the situation moving forward. Please accept our heartfelt apology." That, I could understand and respect. Anything else is an attempt to justify greed.

title: How to stick your foot up your backside, corporate style!!
content: I too will most likely be joining the ranks of FORMER long term TT users. I wish I'd seen these reviews sooner than today. I was in Costco a few days ago and decided to grab the TT software while I was there as it was convenient to do so. I know I need more than the basic version, and *thought* I remembered purchasing the 'Deluxe' version in the past, but always glance at the bullet points to make sure. Turns out I must have been mistaken, because Deluxe doesn't do what I need. I guess it was the Premier that I got before. Ouch, the price has gone up. Oh well, I need it. Bought it. Now I come on here after seeing a comment on a board I read, and realize that TT has made some "cross platform improvements" to eliminate "inconsistencies", and done so by dumbing down the version I actually *used* to buy by removing functionality from it. Here on Amazon I discover from these comments what's ACTUALLY happened, and the damage control attempts being made by Mr. Mieghan and his associates, which appear to me mainly to be making things worse, with many of them seeming to have at least a slight tone of condescension in them - things like (paraphrased here) "We did this to make things consistent across different platforms" "The changes are noted on the packaging" "We'd like to keep/regain you as a loyal customer" (when taken to task by decade + long users who're leaving for other software) and one of my favorites, when asked why the name wasn't changed "Should we change the name when we add features to it too?" My response to the last is that no, you don't need to change the name when you add features (though you can if you'd like, to call attention to the improvements), because adding features actually IMPROVES the product. ADDING features means that the product is AT LEAST as good as it was last year, and that if it worked for me LAST YEAR it will still work for me THIS YEAR. What you've done in your "improvement" is to REMOVE features that I used last year, which means that this is ABSOLUTELY NOT the same product that it was. It is not AT LEAST as capable as it was last year, and it WILL NOT do what I used it for last year. Here's a news flash, on the off chance that the other thousand plus scathing one star reviews haven't gotten through to you all - this is not an improvement! Mr. Meighan, in the future if Intuit wants to make cross platform improvements may I suggest that you look at the software's capabilities on all the platforms, and if features are lacking on one or more of those platforms that are present on others, then the way to actually IMPROVE things would be to ADD the missing features to those platforms that lack them, rather than what you've done in this case which is to REMOVE the features from something that's had them for years, and then tell people "Oh, sorry, we made this better for most people (you must be in that 2-4% who we figure can go jump in a lake). If you want to do what you did last year with this product that has the exact same name as last year (though see - it's different - the word 'Deluxe' on the packaging is smaller this year - you should have noticed that and realized that because deluxe is in smaller print it means it's a little LESS 'deluxe' this year!!), you need to buy the next one up in the line that's $30 more than the one you used last year. We made that old one 'consistent' don'tcha know? We're very sorry that this affects you - it only affects a few people. I'm terribly sorry that you're righteously pissed about it, but if you waste some of your time and call us and luck out with the right customer service rep, we *might* cut you some kind of break for what you need. If you're going to do what you've done in this case, then CHANGE THE NAME, because REMOVING capabilities means it's NOT THE SAME AS LAST YEAR'S WAS!! That way at least people will know it's different, and realize that it may not do what it did before, that they need/expect it to be able to do. Whoever came up with this brilliant idea should be sacked, because it appears that they've caused some pretty major harm to the Turbo Tax 'brand'. Based on what I've seen here, despite the fact that I bought the higher level product that WILL do what I need I plan to return the software (fortunately have not opened it yet) for a refund and try the H & R Block product, apparently for less $$ than what the 'Deluxe' version of your software, which I've always used in the past but cannot this year thanks to your 'improvements'. As for next year, who knows. If H&R Block works as well, why change back?

title: Sad,Sad day!
content: All I can say is thank you for those early purchaser's this year. I just researched my software box and found TT disk (floppies) going back to 1992. Wow, what a disappointment, and I have convinced so many other family members and friends to choose TT. Well I guess my email list will have to suffer one more hit so that I can notify everyone of this strange new "marketing" by Intuit. I guess they will find out if this gamble payed off soon enough. But, for me and my circle of friends and family, we'll be looking for the competition to complete our taxes this year. Bad form Intuit!

title: Been using this for years and now they wont allow small business filers?
content: FORMER TurboTax customer. Why would they get rid of the schedule C and other forms in Deluxe this year? BAD move intuit. I'm not paying more just because I have a small business. I've been using your product for years, and have always used the deluxe package to file. Now, you wait until I get everything entered and to the business part, and tell me I need to pay another $40? Yeah right.... I'm no longer a TurboTax customer, and I hope others will bail ship on them too for such a poor business decision.

title: better yet, say
content: Who has a business with less than $100 expenses! That is ridiculous, might as well just say don't use deluxe if you have a small business and you keep books for that business. Or, better yet, say, if you have a small business, get HR Block software instead. Loyal turbotax customer (17 years) - now switching to HR Block. Dumb move Intuit. I would put zero stars if it was an option. I feel deceitful giving it a star at all. The first star should really be a frowny face.

title: No Schedule C, unless you pay double the price.
content: No schedule C, and now double the price. It's time to switch tax software.

title: Disappointed With 2014 Deluxe package
content: Disappointed that they took out certain functions and place them in the more expensive Premium package.The Deluxe is now useless to a whole rage of people who used it last year. Before you buy please check to see what's missing.

title: if you like features from previous year removed please buy this product
content: Removed schedule D and E from e-filing? And have the audacity to tell loyal customer to print and mail it ??? After 12 years using turbotax, now it's time for me to move on

title: I am soooo "done" with Intuit.
content: After using Intuit's TurboTax for seems like decades, and Quicken since something like 1993, but I am soooooooo done with Intuit products. I've been a TurboTax Deluxe user forever, it always did exactly what I needed. For 2014, I had one stock sale I have to report this year - one! - and I was forced to spend $30 to upgrade to Premier. I get to my wife's low-volume Schedule C work and now I'm being forced to spend another $10 for Home & Business! All functions that I've done in Deluxe for seems like decades. I know that if I jumped off into a profanity-laden tirade that my review would get deleted, so I'll just say this, Intuit: it's not me, it's you. You've lost a long, long, long-time customer. There's just too many other options out there, and your tactics have completely alienated me.

title: I used the product for 15 yrs and was very satisfied - I won't be a customer next year
content: I agree with previous responses about not including all tax forms unless you buy the premium version. I used the product for 15 yrs and was very satisfied - I won't be a customer next year.

title: I have been using TurboTax for years. No more ...
content: I have been using TurboTax for years. No more. The upsell tricks making one buy the more expensive version cost them my loyalty. Intuit, this is what happens when you screw your customer.

title: Goodbye Turbo Tax, Hello H&R Block
content: Thanks for the warning! I have used Turbo Tax since 2003. I was about to buy it again when I saw the 2-Star rating. After reading the negative reviews I ended up buying the H&R Block program from Target. It is a shame that Intuit chose to treat their long-term customers this way. So far the H&R block software has been good. It imported my information from my 2013 turbo Tax file without a glitch. I notice too that I get 5 free federal eFilings and free representation if I am audited,

title: No more Turbotax for me.
content: I am returning this and switching to HR Block. Cannot believes that Turbotax removed schedule D. Ridiculous. Don't buy Turbotax if you expect to get what you used to get and use.

title: One Star
content: What a bunch of weasels. I'm switching to H&R's product.

title: Rebate doesnt work!
content: Surprise surprise. After years of loyalty, they screw me on my rental home forms and force me to upgrade to Premier. Then the $25 rebate doesn't work. What a joke. Pass

title: So far- good results after abandoning TurboTax for HR Block!
content: After more than a decade of using TurboTax, I just switched to HR Block at half the price. So far- good results from HR Block. Lot's of $ saved by abandoning TurboTax.

title: I cannot believe that Turbotax just shot itself in the ...
content: I cannot believe that Turbotax just shot itself in the foot with by changing the features in the Deluxe version. I'm moving to HR Block. I've checked with a few people who use it. They're less expensive, accurate, offer tax defense services at no additional charge, and have all of the features in the Deluxe version that Turbotax removed. The most important note is that HR Block software will read your Turbotax file and import your data!

title: I'm a CPA and they've lost my business
content: Thanks for the warning TURBO TAX!!! I've used Turbo Tax for years and I am a licensed CPA, not working in public accounting. I do my own taxes with Turbo Tax because I trusted them and choose not to keep up with current tax law because I work in private sector industry. I ordered the Deluxe version as I always have in the past. I learned (in the past) that Deluxe took care of my rental property situation and all other aspects of my income and deductions. I didn't realize that it was a MUST to upgrade to Premier this year. I thought Deluxe would still handle my Schedules D and E and ignored the advertisement saying Premier was best for me. (because they have always said Premier was best for me) Well, not true anymore, I'm forced to upgrade to Premier, for the same software I've used in the past. I'm over it... TURBOs competitors have made it much easier for me to switch to their tax software. Shady, under-handed tactics on Intuits part...looks like you've lost a lot customers over this.

title: Thanks TurboTax for the Free Software!
content: Thank you for motivating me to use H&R Block for free! I sent a copy of my invoice for last year and got this years software for free from H&R Block. I was quite happy with your product for the past 11 years but your marketing genius saved me $50 this year. Hope your parachute is golden Bob Meighan! Amazon users: google switchtoblock@hrblock.com. Cheers, and this is the power of Amazon reviews! UPDATE 24JAN2015: H&R Block just sent me a code for a free download for their product after I provided a copy of my tax year 2013 TurboTax invoice.

title: "Fix it 'till it Breaks"
content: Intuit's decision to eliminate Schedule D from the Deluxe tax package is shabby, rapacious capitalism at its worst. The suggestion that the customer provide a write-on Sched D to be mailed with the eCopy submission is laughable and patently absurd, no doubt the product of some wet-behind-the-ears B-school wizards whose sticky fingers have successfully poisoned the well and lost my business for this year. Fortunately there are other vendors.

title: Marketing Blunder
content: Deluxe 2014 does not provide sched D functionality ... outrageous. What are they thinking? It's not worth the price. Time to switch to another product.

title: Have been using Turbo Tax since 1995. Apparently, ...
content: Have been using Turbo Tax since 1995. Apparently, with the changes to the Deluxe, Intuit has taken me for granted. Will switch to H&R Block this year.

title: Intuit is paying for their greed
content: One more long time (30 year!) Intuit customer leaving for more hospitable pastures. What other software dies (not just loses support) soon after release? Quicken does, unless you pay for a new version every two years. Now comes this underhanded move with TurboTax, crippling capabilities without changing the name. It's interesting to see that Intuit's stock (INTU) has dropped more than 10% in the past month. I'll bet more losses will follow, and they will be taught a painful lesson.

title: Mismanaged product success.
content: Having used Turbotax for as long as I can remember, I've had enough. They have simple gotten too expensive and light on features. Sad. Success is sometimes mismanaged. Will try H&R block.

title: Crippleware, Beware!!
content: Apparently Intuit has decided to cripple strategic forms for all version of their products except the most expensive ones. It makes the term "Deluxe" which they have applied to this product laughable. I've never heard of crippleware being described as "Deluxe" before. Hmmm... Should the product be called Turbotax Crippleware Deluxe, or Turbutax Deluxe Crippleware? Guess we should ask the Intuit marketing folks which name we should use.

title: I've been a long time user of TurboTax, but ...
content: I've been a long time user of TurboTax, but this year they've really made a mess of it. It won't permit you to e-file a federal return without filling out a child care information form, even if you're not claiming child care expenses. Basically it's requiring information that doesn't exist. When I used the on line help section to resolve this issue the response I got was: "We are aware of this experience and will be resolving this issue in a product update currently scheduled for 2/12/2015". If they are aware of this issue why is it not being fixed for weeks?

title: Not as good as it was!
content: I have been using Turbotax since 1997. This will be my last year. Apparently they are on a money grab with no concern for their customers.

title: Turbo Tax first; any other InTuit's to follow?
content: Have been using the TT Deluxe version for many years. Surprised to have to add another $32.93 to my initial $49.99 purchase (It did include Costco discounts) to upgrade to Premier after the product's guided interview. Very disappointed in their marketing strategy. Either the marketing is out of touch, or their communications department needs a review to refocus them on service and product BRANDING. This current InTuit strategy has me wonder if this approach will be applied to their Quicken product. I guess it's time to decide to trust another company. Jan

title: Intuit does me a favor makes me look at other tax software
content: Yet another legal hold up by yet another corporate entity. The way of our country now since we can't make anything or do anything simply charge more for less or add a fee mentality. Intuit killed Quicken for Mac users, turns out that forcing me to change to Ibank was a blessing in disguise. Far superior program, far less cost. Looks like maybe they are helping me out again. Have been using Turbo Tax long as I can remember but obviously time to bite the bullet and research other brands HR Block or whatever. Thank you Intuit for getting me off your gravy train. George in NY

title: If I could give TurboTax Deluxe 2014 zero stars I would
content: At best a marketing mistake, at worst a deliberate attempt by Intuit to wring more revenue from "upgrades" by intentionally crippling the product. The Deluxe version no longer includes the same schedules (e.g., capital gains, rentals) provided in prior years . At a minimum, Intuit should give fair warning the 2014 version has been significantly downgraded. Instead the box boasts "Includes every form you're likely to need for your tax situation. For a complete list, go to www.TurboTax.com/forms." Talk about misleading. If I could give TurboTax Deluxe 2014 zero stars I would.

title: Another lost Customer...
content: Removing the ability for my to manage my stock sales and investment income out of the Deluxe version is unacceptable. Schedule D is a key part of a large number of household filings, so I can only conclude that removing the feature to force people up to a more expensive product is a deliberate and cynical plot to extort tax filers. Fortunately, there are alternatives out there that cost less and I'll be using one of those products this year.

title: Beware of significant reduction in Deluxe functions and unethical practice
content: The previous year's version included rental income Sch E, which is now moved to Premium. A message with a link offering free upgrade led to an online payment demand.

title: Very bad move on their part resulting in huge complaints
content: The 2014 tax year version as originally sold deleted critical forms to make you upgrade to Premier version. Very bad move on their part resulting in huge complaints. They have recognized their bad judgement and will now upgrade for free but I am going to use TaxACT next year because I don't trust them any more after 20 years of loyalty. They can apologize all they want but I feel like they have changed their priorities from providing a quality product to squeezing as much money from us as possible and pushing out software before it is debugged ( quicken ).

title: I have been a happy customer for all these years
content: I have been a customer since you first came out with Turbo Tax. But you have just lost another long time customer. I have been a happy customer for all these years, but with the changes you have made to the deluxe version, (Schedules C, D, E) ,I will be going to another product. I will try the H&R block product this year. And once a customer changes, you never get them back. I would give a zero star if it were possible.

title: Constantly raising price is Intuit's history!!
content: I started using TurboTax somewhere around 1990. It was $19.95, then went to $29.95, then to $39.95 and I was aggravated. At the time Parsons Technology had put out a product called Personal Tax Edge for $19.95, so I switched. Within 2 years Intuit purchased Parsons Technology and offered TurboTax again for a lower price, so I stayed with TurboTax. They have steadily increased the price of both Quicken and TurboTax. I was a repeat customer who allowed them to pre-order the software, charge my card and later email me the download link. Last year I noticed that Amazon customers could purchase the same software for $20 less than a repeat loyal customer. I called and complained and was told that Amazon could charge whatever they wanted but Intuit was bound to the price I paid. So I discontinued the "automatic renewal" subscription with Intuit and boy am I glad I did! I would have been totally whacked if I had got the renewal and then discovered that it would not file my schedule C. So I researched TaxACT and discovered that this company is the same people that did the Personal Tax Edge for Parsons Technology before Intuit purchased the company and canned them. I can get the TaxACT software download for state and federal PLUS a backup CD-rom, plus a state e-file (for which TTax charged an additional $19.95) for under $37!! So, TTax for $89.95 (on Amazon) or TaxACT for $36.95......no brainer...I switched...particularly after I found out that TaxACT will grab all the pertinent info from the pdf. file saved from last year's TurboTax and quick-fill the new tax form.

title: Done with Intuit - HR block here I come
content: I enjoyed turbotax and turbotax online for it's ease of use and quality as a program. Last year I noticed that they removed some features and this year requiring me to fully upgrade left me feeling forced to pay more for the same thing. I won't support a business that attempts to make more money by taking away features and attempting to charge for them. I'm done with intuit and turbotax.

title: Intuit no more!
content: So I called the number for a free upgrade 3 different times and held for over a half hour each time before hanging up. I also call and submitted my phone # for a return call. I never received a call back. There's probably one asian speaking representative manning the phones. Pathetic. No Turbo Tax ever again. I will personally host a massive celebratory party when Intuit goes out of business. Sianara and good riddance.

title: Buyers be aware! Your TurboTax Deluxe 2014 could not ...
content: Buyers be aware! Your TurboTax Deluxe 2014 could not be upgraded to include Schedule D unless you were using TurboTax 2013! Any other version you used last year will not be qualified for free upgrade as I was told last night in the middle of preparing 2014 tax return. Intuit should announce this restriction so that people won't spend over half an hour on the phone waiting for a decision from their support line. Call the 1(888) 777-4160 support line to find out any restriction before your purchasing the TurboTax Deluxe 2014!

title: Glad there's a substitute for 2014 TurboTax, I've jumped ship...bye by Bobby /
content: I bought H & R last month when I saw their big price increase & their big decrease in software functionality. I've been a TTax user since 1999 using both Deluxe and Business (for trusts) editions. With the new NIITax (3.8%)on trust income starting at any amounts over (approx.) $12K and also the LTCap Gains rate is now higher, the last thing needed was the new and unjust TTax $ increase. (The trust distributed income again gets taxed after flowing onto the beneficiary's Form 1040). I don't believe Intuit's explanation on their substantial price increase, if so they would have kept the comparable products (what's needed to do the same as what was included in 2013's Deluxe, for example)at the same price plus any incremental inflation. They would have to explain the substantial $ increase when wage growth is stagnant and inflation is low. Maybe it's a good time for buying some H&R Block shares. I started using the H & R product that includes both discs and find it good so far (for approx. 1/4 price). I will most definitely remain with H&R Block for the duration of my life providing the software is easily navigated and achieves my goals. If even it has some problems it's not a deal breaker since for me, problems also occurred using TTax.

title: No Schedule C or D and No Disclosure - Goodbye Turbotax FOREVER
content: I have been a loyal Turbotax customer for 20+ years, but no more. I will try the free H&R Block free offer for those CHEATED this year by Turbotax. You can no longer do a Schedule C or D in this software. What is more galling is that they don't disclose the change clearly on their product info, which means they are intentionally trying to trick customers. I wish I could give zero stars.

title: Poor business decision IMO
content: Greed has destroyed many companies. Is this one trying to join the club? I have used turbotax deluxe for over 10 years. Now they have quietly removed schedule D and when they are called on it publicly say it was to reduce user confusion. Intuit, I don't think it's the users that are confused. One article reported them as saying that the change only affects 20 percent of the users...ONLY 20 percent? Oh, that's ok then. Goodbye Intuit from one of the 20 percent, hello H&R Block.

title: One Star
content: Biggest rip off ever.. They have made it where you ahve to buy Premium to do almost anything..NEVER AGAIN

title: VERY DECEPTIVE - HUGE STRATEGIC BLUNDER
content: Rip-Off - after many \years of being a loyal Turbo Tax purchaser, this will be the last year use this product. As many reviewers have noted, the "Deluxe" version of the software no longer includes schedules D and C. The Inuit marketing people cleverly managed to mask this change on their packaging materials and product descriptions. It is only January 14 and there are already hundreds of complaints about this. Wait until people actually start using the software and realizing what is missing this year. The complaints will go through the roof! I called the Turbo Tax helpline and surprisingly got through to a real person with minimal wait. The rep was pleasant and provided me with a "free upgrade" to the Premier version, which basically means they upgraded me to the same version I bought over the past 15 years. They did say in the future the ability to generate a schedule D will require that I purchase the Premier version for $75 to $85 instead of the normal $40 to $50 cost that has been fairly constant over the years. If the good folks at TurboTax don't add this basic functionality back to their Deluxe version of the software next year, I will be purchasing the much less expensive H&R Block software in the future. Paying a huge premium to prepare a schedule D is ridiculous, and they way in which they failed to clearly communicate the change this year is almost unethical. Let's see what next year's version has in store for us, and let's see how many customers they are willing to lose.

title: I am glad I started to read your reviews before buying my ...
content: I am glad I started to read your reviews before buying my copy of Turbotax this year. I also noticed the product changes, along with price, and were tryin to understand why TurboTax has to make significant changes every year with corresponding price increases. I am following the advice of others and switching to another product this year after at least 15 years with TurboTax. Thanks everyone for meaningful criticism.

title: TurboTax Deluxe 2014 - Big Mistake by Intuit
content: Here's a new corporate tactic. For the past 10+ years you can get TurboTax Deluxe and file schedules C, D, and E for your side business, investments, and rental properties. This year you can't do that with Deluxe, you have to upgrade to the considerably more expensive Home and Business. I called up TurboTax's support line and spoke to a Mike who confirmed this; he also stated that there are many complaints about what Intuit has done, and that he could help me by offering me a free upgrade to TurboTax Home and Business this year. So if I want, I can accomplish this year, what I did last year, at the same cost as Deluxe. But this year only -- next year, I'll have to buy TurboTax Home and Business for much more. Or, will I? I think I'll try alternative software like H&R Block. Which frankly is sounding more interesting to me right now. I see that H&R Block will give you their software for free if you buy TT Deluxe and get fed up with what Intuit has done. Personally I think this is a Big Mistake that Intuit is making, companies have gone out of business doing this. Maybe Intuit will realize this before it's too late and other tax software takes away the lead they have held. (This comment is mostly my opinion but it's based on confirmed information; I urge you to do your research and make your own decision.)

title: 2014 BUYER BEWARE: CHANGES TO SOFTWARE!!
content: What?? No Schedule D in this version!! (Capital Gains for just 1-2 sold stock lots). Also Schedule C, E missing, though I would not use them

title: Run to another vendor. This has major hidden flaws (they are spelled out in the really small print at the bottom of the add.
content: I have used Turbo Tax since 1990 according to my files and I have never looked anywhere else. It was a good reliable product. I have all the background I need to do the filings, so all I needed Turbo Tax to do is provide me the forms and a way to file. Because of this, Deluxe has worked perfectly fine for me in the past. I've always looked at the higher end versions as providing the information behind what went on a form. Also the interviews and advice videos to get users to the correct form or to think about what else. Now for "consistency" they have crippled Deluxe. Not sure how having different versions handling the same piece of "paper" differently adds to consistency. Guess H&R will get another look; go to TaxWise, or another vendor. All of them handle the "paper" the same way and their additional costs are related to them giving you additional information or advice on what goes where. I'm happy to pay when they add value I need. Not willing to pay when their work consists of crippling their product and providing advice I don't need. They had to build a version that does everything and then do more work to dumb it down. Having a form in the software and then not being able to file it I think borders on what I would call fraud, in my non-legal opinion, or at best the old bait and switch. They are betting on users buying Deluxe out of habit and then paying for the upgrade at the last minute because all the data is entered and they found out on April 14, they can't file the necessary forms.

title: Never again
content: I was about to purchase this, figuring it was a no-brainer like every year, then noticed all the negative reviews. I had thought Intuit had learned their lesson after the infamous "you can't print your return unless you pay us more" scheme of a few years ago. I need to file schedules C, D, E, and K-1, and I find Intuit's baffling double-speak responses to criticism appalling. H&R Block has gotta be rolling on the floor laughing.

title: There Are Affordable Alternatives Out There
content: Most people here already know the mess Intuit made by taking away previously included features. I have been using TurboTax for years. I got a couple of emails from Intuit about this. The latest one says as a previous user I can still use the Deluxe with schedule C, D, E and F at no additional cost. The email provides link for me to "Lean more." But the link merely opens a product page on which it clearly shows that to get Schedule C, D, E and F I'll still need the Premiere version. There is no mentioning how I can get those forms the Deluxe version. What a joke. Newegg.com is having a 50% discount on H&R Block product and I took advantage of that. With the discount I get the premiere version with those forms and free state e-filing for only $32.47. Granted I have not used it but H&R Block is a reputable brand and I expect I'll be fine. H&R Block claims that it import previous Intuit tax file, too so that's a big plus. The discount ends soon so if you are in the same situation as I am you might want to take a look. Intuit made the mistake of making me look elsewhere, and I may never go back.

title: Disappointed in Intuit for Misleading Their Customers
content: I join many other long-term TurboTax customers in being disappointed/aggravated at Intuit for removing from the Deluxe product electronic filing support for Schedules C, D, E, F and K-1. My issue this year is Schedule E, for my share of a family farm, though I'll often use Schedule D for mutual fund sales. It seems silly that they chose to cripple the desktop product to make it compatible w/ the online product, rather than enhancing the online product. Selling investments will probably become a lot more common in future years. I'm not so disgusted w/ Intuit because they made this change but, rather, because they failed to effectively communicate the change prior to tax season. I still don't find a description of this change on the TurboTax website. I had to find out about it from a TV news story. I'm also unable to return this software to Amazon, presumably because we downloaded it over a month ago, so I'm stuck. I'll be looking at other alternatives, specifically the H&R Block product. What a bonus this must be for them.

title: Turbotax deluxe just took about schedule D and wants you to upgrade to premier for you to get it.
content: been a loyal turbotax customer for more than a decade. I've been buying deluxe over and over gain due to simplicity of filing taxes. Now, they took away schedule D supported by a baloney kind of explanation. That sucks. You just lost 1 loyal customer. I'm not inclined to upgrade and get a rebate this year just to get stuck on a more expensive product. So long turbotax! Thanks to a free HR Block software - i have a recourse to this turbotax headache.

title: -500 stars
content: If there was -500 stars that's what I would give this crap TurboTax has become. First off, I'm a loyal customer of Turbotax for 7 years. Never had a problem... until now. After buying and downloading Turbotax Deluxe, I did all my taxes and went to file. It takes and extra $19.99 to pay to e-file State. I'm OK with that. I went to pay... but TurboTax could not process a credit card. After trying 10 times I gave up. I called their customer Help. I got an message saying the are busy, and left my info to get an Auto call back for Help so they could process a good credit card. I now have little faith in the accuracy of thier tax software if they can't even handle processing a credit card. I waited 2 hours. Finally, their automated system called me and said it was connecting me to a customer service rep... then all I got was light static and a slight humming noise. TurboTax automated system has my phone line in CONSTANT USE!. I cannot get it to hang up. I cannot make a call, I cannot even dial 911 if there was an emergency. I cannot get in touch with anyone at Turbotax to help. Now I'm trying to call my phone company on someone else phone to get them to force a disconnect with the Turbotax system. After years of using Turbotax, This is a nightmare!!!!!!!!! If there is TurboTax person that reads this... CONTACT ME... turn my phone line free.!!! For all others who are thinking of using TurboTax, even if you used them for years... BEWARE!!! THEY ARE NOT THE TURBOTAX WE KNEW.!! - Update: My phone company did manage to disconnect the in use line that TurboTax we holding. TurboxTax never called me back, even after another help request. They couldn't process a good credit card to pay for the extra $19.99 efile for State, but thier system did ask me to pay another $29.95 to deduct the $19.99 from my refund. NO THANKS! I'm done with you.Next year I go to H&R Block.

title: Too bad. Intuit has lost yet another loyal customer
content: Too bad. Intuit has lost yet another loyal customer. H&R Block's TaxCut will do the same as TurboTax Premier for a good $20 less. When you maintain a strict budget, it makes no sense to spend $20 needlessly. I just hope Intuit comes to their financial senses and reinstates the forms into the Deluxe product that they removed this year. They stand to lose a lot of loyal customers that will take years to win back. Sad.

title: You've Lost a Long Time Customer TurboTax
content: For years and years TurboTax is the only product I've ever used. How disappointing that they have removed Schedules C and D unless you upgrade. I agree with one comment - once they say "call us and we'll work with you on a resolution" - I stay away. Nothing is worse than getting on the phone with an automated answering system and waiting to be routed around so that 30 minutes later you can talk to a human. Time to move to H&R Block.

title: Ripoff version without the forms that were included in the past
content: After using TTax for over 15 years, I am now an ex-Turbo Tax customer. You must now buy the Premier version to get the basic forms that most filers need. Do they care? Nope. Time to move on H&R Block SW imports your prior TurboTax files. I will never buy another Intuit product again. They have not only lost a loyal customer but they have gained an enemy. Don't reward their greed with a purchase of this SW. Fight back and boycott all Intuit products.

title: Intuit is making a mistake.
content: So far, I haven't yet purchased TT for 2014. I'll wait a while to see how this plays out. But unless Intuit improves the situation, I'm gone. I can wait until late March - no problem. But if I understand correctly, Intuit is screwing everyone so that some people can create a return on a desktop, read it on a laptop and file it with a tablet. It's hard to believe that so many people need this.

title: Strange marketing move. Less features, higher price?
content: I came here, like I have done every year around this time, to get my new version of TurboTax but I see they have removed features and increased price. It's unlikely losing some of its TurboTax base will affect Intuit's bottome line - they have branched out into other profitable areas - but I predict this will be a very good year for H&R Block ("TaxCut"). After 15 years, I'm going to finally give it a try.

title: I called support (800-624-9066) and explained my tax situation in great detail. I specifically mentioned 1099-B and Schedule D
content: I have been using "basic" for over a decade. It has taken care of all my needs. I file a "long" 1040 with schedules A, B, and D. Basic used to handle all that no sweat. When I saw that Intuit had changed things up I checked their "pick the right version" pages. They all said I needed Premier. I called support (800-624-9066) and explained my tax situation in great detail. I specifically mentioned 1099-B and Schedule D. I was told "Deluxe" would do the job. I ordered it and installed it (including all the updates). When it came time to enter my 1099-B information it said "you need Premier - Insert another $30". I called support back and waited over 30 min on hold. Intuit has promised me a free Premier and free TurboTax next year. But the phone lines are only going to get more backed up as people figure out what's going on. So I certainly can not recommend Deluxe unless you have a return that is basically an "EZ". It did seem happy to process my 1099-DIV so if that's the extent of what you need you may be ok. I did not get to the deductions section so I don't know if it will let you itemize or not. Intuit should just ship Premier when you order Deluxe. BTW, the Intuit robo-response is totally inadequate.

title: This is very poor customer service
content: I have been a loyal TurboTax customer for many years. I have always used the Deluxe version because it handled everything for my taxes. I purchased the 2014 version as part of a promotion for prime customers. Now I find out this version will not support Schedule D and you need to upgrade. This is very poor customer service. I would encourage anyone to try the H&R Block software and send a message to Intuit.

title: ... and cannot use because intuit removed several needed feature like schedule C
content: bought this and cannot use because intuit removed several needed features like schedule C, D, E. I have spent money for this useless item and I guess I have no recourse to return to Amazon or upgrade to the needed product. Seems both Amazon and Intuit are complicit in this decision to allow Turbo Tax Deluxe to go forward for sale and not inform the previous users in a proactive manner like sending them a heads up email way in advance of purchasing for the 2014 tax season. They have our email so why not let us know in advance that they are basically increasing the price for the same functionality we have used for years.

title: Deluxe no longer meets my needs
content: My returns are so simple (salary and standard deduction) that I can almost use TurboTax basic. However, I have a small investment account and need schedule D for one or two transactions on that account each year. I was ok with paying a bit more for the deluxe version, but will not be buying premier. After 12 years as a TT customer, It looks like I will be trying H&R Block's software this year.

title: I really really hate to learn a new program after 20 years
content: Many thanks to early purchasers who clued me in to the fact that the version I need would cost me $99 this year. I really really hate to learn a new program after 20 years, yes, two decades, but I've started working with the H&R Block program I bought instead. It's a bit of a headache to adjust to, but the program itself seems just fine. Adios Turbo Tax, I won't be back.

title: I hope you go bankrupt like Radio Shack and soon to be Sears
content: You guys su<X. You've lost a long time customer. The whole entire intuit executive management team should be fired for doing this bonehead stunt. What were you guys thinking? Trying to make it in the anals and case study of taking customers for granted? I hope you go bankrupt like Radio Shack and soon to be Sears.

title: Beware! TurboTax Deluxe may be useless for you
content: Turbo tax removed Schedules C, D, and E from TurboTax Deluxe. If you have use for any one of these schedules, and it is likely you do, then TurboTax Deluxe is useless for you in that you CAN NOT file either Federal or State returns electronically even though you paid for the ability to do so. You will have to file paper forms and complete those paper forms on your own.

title: Unacceptable
content: Was loyal to Turbotax for many years but fleecing the customer this year is unacceptable. I heard they are upgrading the version this weekend to include the missing options but that ship sailed already when you made your decision to pull the wool over your customers eyes. Just purchased the competitors software a few minutes ago.

title: "Emily tries but misunderstands."
content: After using TurboTax almost since its first release, I switched to H&R Block and couldn't be happier. So far, the difference in usability is negligible and even somewhat easier. When I get deeper into the return preparation, I'll see if H&R handles my obscure entries more gracefully than TT's idiosyncrasies. Quicken, you're next!! TT, Buh-Bye.

title: all of this seems like way too much work for a product whose only ...
content: I have used TurboTax Deluxe for 15 years, and do use both Schedule C and D. After reading of the decimation of this product here, I called customer service. They agreed to send me a free upgrade to Premier, but then shipped it to the wrong place. I called (prior to the shipment) to tell them they had the wrong address, and the representative indicated that they would send another Premier upgrade to the correct address. A week went by and there was no notice that the product had shipped, I called again today to ask where the upgrade was. The rep promised to send it, but 6 hours later, I have no notification that the order was even entered. I prefer the CD as it is easier to access past years returns if you have the CD. Still, all of this seems like way too much work for a product whose only purpose is to simplify my life. I read today that Intuit has apologized and offered a rebate for those affected by the change, but really do not see why they cannot simply download an update containing support for the forms used by most people who need software beyond the basic. Given the number of people that are commenting on the issue here, the position taken by Intuit that the change will affect only a few people is clearly wrong. I will not use TurboTax next year if this awful decision is not reversed, and Intuit will have lost one of its most loyal customers

title: WTF
content: Went to open my download and ended up loading intuit site and spent 1 1/2 hours doing return , only to be asked to pay for product.... Which I did on Amazon.... So finally get to load Amazon copy but must remove other losing all data..... Been waiting 30 mi Utes for this POS to search my last years return.... FUBAR!!!

title: Switched to H&R Block this year after many years with TurboTax, glad I did
content: Switched to H&R Block this year after many years with TurboTax, glad I did

title: Another lost customer
content: Similar to the other reviewers, after 15 years of using the Basic for A, B and D, we would have to upgrade not one but two levels to the Premier to be able to file this year. I wouldn't have minded to upgrade one notch to the Deluxe version, but the Premier is an overkill for our needs. Really a bad strategy by Intuit. Thank you everyone for posting insightful reviews/comments.

title: Very disappointed in TurboTax 2014
content: I've been using TurboTax since 1996 and have recommended it to several of my friends, but no more. The price has always been higher than the competition, but it has been easy to use and reliable so I could justify the yearly price increases just to avoid having to learn to use a different product. I need to file a simple schedule E every year and most years also have to file schedule D and the Deluxe version handled them both very nicely. So when I found out that the 2014 version handles neither one (without upgrading to Premier), I decided it was time to look elsewhere. It's really a pity that Intuit has decided to "dumb down" the Deluxe version, because I suspect it is their best selling version. As soon as customers find out that they have been duped (again), they are going to speak out very loudly with their wallets. I'm going to wait until January to see if Intuit comes to it's senses, but if they don't, then I'm going to save 10 bucks instead of spending an extra 40 and go with H & R Block.

title: Guess whats in store for Windows XP users - and ...
content: Guess whats in store for Windows XP users - and there are a lot of them. You can't run TurboTax Deluxe, despite what it says on the box about being XP compatible. Yes, TurboTax requires .netframework 4.5 or higher and that won't install on an XP machine. Here come the class action lawyers - at least I hope they are coming.

title: FORGET turbotax deluxe if you have income property.
content: I just attempted to do my taxes using TurboTax Deluxe when a pop-up screen came up and notified me that I can no longer use TurboTax Deluxe for my rental property (Schedule E) and that I would HAVE to purchase TurboTax PREMIER. I wish Intuit would just have increased the price rather than deceive their customers with this %$#@. I was forced to pay another $32 to complete my taxes. I already invested the initial $49 for the Deluxe version, so another $32. seemed the logical way to go, HOWEVER, I have already researched H&R Block Software and read all the positive reviews so THIS WILL BE MY LAST YEAR USING turbotax after 20 plus years. If you did not purchase this software yet **** S T O P ***** before it is too late and go with another software.

title: Wow..just wow..goodbye TT since no sched D anymore.
content: Many thanks to all the other 1 stars out there for highlighting this before I just picked up my Deluxe which I've done for the last 15 years or so. Nothing too fancy in my returns. Just your regular office workers couple, so with standard 1099's and some stocks/mutual funds here and there. I'm guessing the sneakiest part is that people will buy this and complete a major portion of it and then get blocked requiring them to upgrade to premier. Thanks again to all the 1 stars out there that caught my eye before buying. Guess I will buy H&R Block or go with TaxAct. I'm in New York State so the efiling is $0 by law. Do the math though to figure out what will work best for you. Make sure to shop around to price compare also, as the H&R Block price seems to be all over the place.

title: Greed killed it
content: you've heard it all in the reviews, a greedy and unethical company loses it's customer base based on that greed, then tries to get them back by reversing their shady pricing tactics by saying "oh, you can NOW upgrade free after February 8th. Nope, I switched H&R after being a loyal customer for 12 (yes, TWELVE) years. Shame on you!

title: I bought the Deluxe software as I have for many ...
content: I bought the Deluxe software as I have for many years. Then when I went to do State I had to pay another $39.00 for something that had always been included before. So now I have spent $80.00 for the same service I paid $45 last year. Next year I will use H&R Blocks software. At least they don't call something by the same name and leave features out.

title: Like many turbo tax users I have used TURBO TAX ...
content: Like many turbo tax users I have used TURBO TAX FOR MANY YEARS and was quite blindsided when they asked for additional monies after purchasing and installing the 2014 turbo tax to get the additional schedules to use Turbo tax - Would not recommend turbo tax 2014 at all this year - First -they did not tell you before purchase that schedules c d etc not included in original purchase price of turbo tax deluxe - second their lame late attempt at fixing the problem by offering a refund post purchase -not acceptable - correct and re release the software with the a lll the schedules included in the purchase price-withdraw current flawed product-apologize-then re release -then they even asked for ss number to give you refund - do not give out ss number -turbo tax multiple missteps this year - I would hope this would affect the ceo and marketing people at turbo tax this year -lobby for their removal for the multiple missteps -do not buy turbo tax this year -go ahead try Hr block or another and see how that works and let them see drop in revenue and send them a message

title: The marketing depatement just blew it.
content: The business practices of the company tells me it's time to move on. I've been using TurboTax for many many years and as a software programmer I've always been impressed with the software, and hate to see a good product get ruined by the marketing department, I've seen this happen many times in my 30+ years in the industry.

title: Disappointed in Intuit
content: This will be my first year NOT using Turbo Tax. Smells like a scam to me. Too bad - I was an advocate for the software for many years but am unwilling to buy a product that appears is being marketed in a deceitful manner. As I am retired I am required to make minimum annual withdrawals from my tax deferred IRA's. No problem with TT in the past but now using it would cost significantly more. Next up - H & R Block.

title: Does this count as the biggest blunder of 2014 or 2015?
content: I too am glad I read the reviews before purchasing. The only reason I even read the reviews was because I happened to notice it only had 1.5 stars. This caught me off guard. I don't know if I've ever seen a rating this low. I was about to go to Costco to pick up our copy but thankfully I decided to price check on amazon first. Based on the reviews it looks like it won't work for me anymore. Bye bye Intuit.

title: Another mad TurboTax (former) loyal customer
content: I've been using TurboTax Deluxe for over 15 years and have always loved it. Before hitting the "buy" button, I'm glad I read the reviews about the dumbed down Deluxe version TurboTax is offering this year! I just ordered H&R Block's software instead. Bye, Bye TurboTax - you just lost another loyal customer. Bad business decision.

title: Crashes Constantly
