content: I have used turbotax for many years. However, this year the software crashes so often that it is basically unusable. I will not be purchasing again next year. I'm an IT person, so have done all the troubleshooting, updating etc. to no avail. I would not recommend this product.

title: I have been using Turbo Tax since 1994, but ...
content: I have been using Turbo Tax since 1994, but not this year. I am insulted by the modification to Turbo Tax by Intuit. Removing a feature of any software and requiring a more expensive version is purely a money grab. I will be switching to another package this year, and will not go back. Twenty year customer intuit, was it really worth it?

title: I would just look for the best price. This year they moved some of the ...
content: TT Deluxe was all I've needed for years. I would just look for the best price. This year they moved some of the schedules that were previously included in Deluxe to the Premiere and Home/Office software at a MUCH higher price. Next year it will not be TurboTax. Unbelievably stupid move!

title: Turbotax Sucker Punches loyal customers!
content: We have been loyal TurboTax customers for many years. I can't believe they removed Schedule C, D, E & F from this version. To make matters even worse - they only place the had this information was on the back cover of the product - which you wouldn't look at if you always purchase the same version every year. Anyone who has any investments needs Schedule D, and this is probably at least 50% of the customers who used TurboTax Deluxe in the past! They said they removed functionality to be consistent with the online version. This is ridiculous! No customer is going to use both the online version and the CD so who cares if they are consistent? The only one who will care is Intuit - because they are now overcharging people for the same product they have loyally purchased for years. They are offering a one time $25 rebate for a $30 upgrade. I am pretty sure they aren't going to keep giving us a $25 rebate every year!

title: Another Lost TurboTax Customer
content: I have used TurboTax Deluxe for the past 13 years; however, with the changes this year I decided to switch to H&R Block. It imported my return from TurboTax without any problem and seems to do all the things TurboTax does. I will say it is not as intuitive or well designed as TurboTax. But, for software I use once a year it seems to be good enough.

title: I feel tricked and very disappointed for trusting Intuit
content: Have been using TurboTax deluxe in past years and had no complaints. I just started importing my data for 2014 and was shocked to find out that I am forced to upgrade to Premier version. Why can't Intuit just change the product name? same name product with reduced functionality is very misleading. I feel tricked and very disappointed for trusting Intuit.

title: Starting to really hate these guys.
content: With the changes this year forcing me to upgrade just to get the same software options I'm certainly going to look hard at competitors options. H&R block looks a lot better. Plus I had problems last year trying to import my prior years info even though I have used turbo tax for over s decade and their tech support was non existent.

title: This is why I love Amazon!
content: I was on my way to purchase TT as I have for at least 15 years but was shocked to see the poor star rating and subsequently the negative reviews. Iâve had a few gripes about TT the last few years but it was what I was familiar with so I stuck with it. I honestly donât think I even need to use Schedule-D this year, so I may have been fine, but after seeing the number of people saying H&RB pulls in the TT files with no problem I figured Iâd give them a whirl this year; and save some money to boot. I see that H&RB is rated the #1 selling tax software right now on Amazon so it isnât just people complaining, people are actually switching. Count me in, I just purchased H&RB for $22 based on the reviews here on TurboTax on the favorable ones on H&R Block. Thanks Amazon for providing a voice for the customer!

title: Breaking Up Is Hard To Do
content: Dear TurboTax, We're breaking up after 20 years. I'm getting a new squeeze. Too bad, because our album includes, instead of photos and dried flowers, TT disks back to 1994. Buh bye. See ya, wouldn't wanna be ya.

title: Good bye Turbo Tax
content: I've used Turbo tax since 1993 or 1994 with my PC XT to do my rentals for the schedule E and C. As business, it is fine for Turbo Tax to set any price because it is a supply/demand. However. people are upset because the features and forms they except in the Basic or Deluxe are no longer there. For example, you know what you could get when buying a Basic, LE or XLE Toyota Camry. I've though for a while to move to other Tax prep SW but is hesitant to do so out of passiveness. The recent increase of Turbo Tax has forced me to buy the HR Block which could import my Turbo Tax data with ease. It not as good, but it is Ok with me. Once loyal customer left Turbo Tax to try other SW, it would be difficult to get the back.

title: I did not like being held hostage
content: Always used Turbotax, until this year, when they raised the price and deleted features from their deluxe version. I returned it when it would not handle a stock sale and dividends. Before returning it, I called TurboTax, and they said that I needed to upgrade to their Premier version for $30 additional, and they could unlock it over the phone to give me the added features, that came with last years version. After a lengthy discussion they said this one time they would unlock it for free. I did not like being held hostage, so I told to keep their onetime free unlock code. I then purchased HR Block Deluxe, much, much cheaper ($32), the cd-disk version. It imported the TurboTax data from last year very easy, does all the things that last years TurboTax did, and is much easier to use if you need to override a number or change a number on the completed tax form. Very easy to use. Goodbye TurboTax.

title: Definitely going with H&R Block from now on
content: Thanks everyone for the info on how easy it is to transfer to H&R. I am buying H&R Block going forward. Time to short intuit stock... H&R has the schedule for that next year

title: Changes to product :o(
content: It used to be fine...but this year they took out some vital forms so the user needs to buy the next one up (Premier). Shame on Turbo Tax for not alerting it's past customers of the change. Now I have to figure out how to get a refund for the Deluxe and then but the more expensive Premier.

title: Goodbye, TurboTax. Next year I'll be using H&R ...
content: Goodbye, TurboTax. Next year I'll be using H&R Block.

title: I think the many, many other reviews adequately cover ...
content: I think the many, many other reviews adequately cover the biggest issue with TT this year. Last week I received a letter from Intuit highlighting the big need for the change and offering to reimburse $25 if I subsequently purchased Premier. Although they recognize the self-mutilation they have caused their company the executives gamely try to cover the issue with a refund. Sorry folks - I had a different idea. Deluxe was returned and I purchased a different tax preparation product. I don't think your $25 will recover very many of the previously loyal customers that you lost with this trick. Probably time to give the boss a big bonus for his wise leadership.

title: Like everyone else here
content: Like everyone else here, I read about the changes that were made and decided to switch to H & R Block software. I had used Turbotax for two years since I switch from paying an accountant and loved it, but with the added cost of the software and the VP response I've decided to go with H & R Block and love it.

title: Too bad they forgot their customers
content: Dumped TurboTax this year due the reduced features of Deluxe Version and the price. Been using it forever. Too bad they forgot their customers. Just look at the other negative reviews. This is a costly mistake for Intuit. The Free Market is wonderful. There are other acceptable choices with more features and lower price.

title: Intuit omits basic tax forms in Deluxe
content: This is criminal. Yeah they are giving a rebate to upgrade to Premier. But Deluxe should have the most basic forms needed, like Schedule D. Not the complication of ESOPs, options, etc., but basic capital gains. Rebate this year, but screwed next year, you can bet on it.

title: Thanks for all the reviews everybody this makes my decision easy I'm switching this your to H&R Blocks software
content: Year by year turbo tax has become more and more expensive squezing every penny out of you they can, while not giving you any noticeable improvements for the money. Thanks for all the reviews everybody this makes my decision easy I'm switching this your to H&R Blocks software. You lost another once loyal customer TurboTax.

title: Switch to other tax prepare software
content: I used Turbotax deluxe version for over 10 years, purchased this year deluxe edition without any thinking. When I start use it, I found this year I can't do schedule D. I switched to H&R BLOCK 2014 Deluxe, so far I like it. Very easy to import last year's Turbo tax file, and also it is easy to use.

title: This is WRONG!
content: I have been using Turbo tax for myself, my mother and my brother since 1997. During all this time, I could reliably depend on Turbo tax Deluxe to painlessly guide us through the complex tax process, especially to account for my mutual fund transactions. To hear that the Deluxe version is no longer capable of taking care of my investments data, and that I have to purchase the much more expensive premiere version to do so, is plain WRONG. I'm glad I had a chance to read the reviews on this site before I purchase Turbo tax this year. Regretfully, I must part with Turbo tax, and I will heed the advice to look into H&R Block's deluxe version for my tax needs from this year onward. PS I will also relate this sad news to my friends who have also been using Turbo Tax for the same time period.

title: Another customer lost
content: Intuit, you just lost another long-time customer. Removing features to make it consistent with your crippled online version is not the way to repay loyal customers. I'm guessing you heard about customers complaining about the missing features in online Deluxe which you recommend upgrading to online Premier. Too many people realizing they can just buy the desktop version to get the features they need? Offering me a "one time" upgrade to Premier won't keep me either. Plus, I have to install the software to get the free upgrade via download? That complicates the fact that I might want to return the product, and doesn't fix the problem for next year. I will be returning the product and using HR Block's software from now on. I thought Intuit would have learned its lessons from the big DRM issue in 2003, but I guess they are still trying to wring every dollar they can from their loyal customer base.

title: Moved to H&R Block software.. Half the price!!!
content: Just wanted to post a comment on this Tax software! I have been using Turbo Tax for ever. I was on their AUTO BUY and had the software sent to my house every year automatically. I cancelled it this year because of the PRICE jump and what they did to the to the software making you have to go to the more expensive product for certain features. I was shocked to see the almost 300 1 star reviews, and a VP of Turbo Tax replying to the comments. Guys, remember "NETFLIX"?? I bought H&R Block tax software this year mostly due to price. Again I used your software for years and years and loved it but if someone is going to give me the same service for almost half less with all the features & SUPPORT I need and not have to go to the next level for additional features.... BAD MOVE!!

title: Disgusted
content: I've been using Quicken since the early 90s and TurboTax for several years. The change to remove electronic filing for schedules C, D E and F is absolutely ridiculous! Why shouldn't I be able to manually fill out the forms then e-file them without paying an extra $30? I did call Intuit and they did upgrade me for free to the Premier version, but that was after spending at least 30 minutes on hold. Intuit better get it right next year or I will be switching to H&R Block Deluxe. I will also be looking for a Quicken replacement (after using it for more than 20 years). Bob, why are you having people call customer support? Why have them get even more angry for being on hold for 30 minutes? You have their email addresses. Why not just send them an email with instructions for getting the free Premier upgrade? Or are you not sincere in your response?

title: No More TurboTax For Me
content: Have been using TT Deluxe for a number of years now. Was just about to download the 2014 version from Amazon, when I noticed its abysmal rating. Then I read the reviews, and realized why. I need to file a Schedule D as I buy and sell a few stocks, and TT Deluxe has always handled this in the past. Not anymore, it seems--Intuit now wants me to purchase the Premier version at a significantly higher price to accomplish this. This is America. Intuit is as free to decontent their products as I am to not purchase them. And I'm voting with my wallet. Goodbye, Intuit! Hello, H&R Block!

title: As much as I liked and was comfortable with Turbo Tax after about 15 ...
content: As much as I liked and was comfortable with Turbo Tax after about 15 years of use, it looks like it time to try something else. Iâm a very small investor and I donât think my Capitol Gain for this year will cover the additional $30 for Premier to get a Schedule D.

title: Intuit's Epic fail
content: I have been an auto renewal Turbo Tax Deluxe customer for years. No more. Not only have they constantly sold me a product that costs more than I can get it here on Amazon or at one of the membership box stores, but this year they changed Deluxe and dropped Sched D without informing me that they had made a significant change. I just purchased a second copy for my father-in-law two weeks ago. Both of us have been long time TT Deluxe users. Evidently, no more. From reading the VP's comments here, it is clearly spin to try to damage control. We changed it so mobile users were better off. Really? It wasn't so you could charge more? I cannot believe all that many folks file with mobile phones or tablets on something as critical as taxes unless it is a 1040EZ.

title: Minnesota Tax Fraud
content: *****WARNING****As of yesterday, the state of Minnesota will NOT accept TurboTax due to related fraud and unsecure software. Research before you buy.

title: Glad I saw these reviews before purchasing
content: Was in the process of ordering when noticed the low average rating. Having sold stock in 2014, I was very glad for all the reviews alerting me to this change in Deluxe. Based upon other's reviews, I purchased H&R Block for a little over $34 after tax. While I haven't filled it out yet as don't have my W-2, it installed easily and imported last year's info from TurboTax. An aside - while a satisfied customer of TurboTax for years, I am happy to leave them given this latest move and my experience a couple years ago when I did the online version. The price wasn't shown (should have been a red flag) but I assumed it wouldn't be more than what it cost to buy the disc at Sam's Club or Staples. I was wrong! It was more, but at that point I had everything entered and didn't want to start from scratch. Left bad taste regarding Intuit's business practices.

title: UNCONSCIONABLE!
content: UNCONSCIONABLE! : not guided or controlled by conscience : unscrupulous. That is the perfect description of Intuit. I have used Turbo Tax software for probably over 20 years going back to the DOS versions but not this year. I am done with them and am switching to H&R Block software. To intentionally disable critical forms that have been an integral part of TurboTax Deluxe for years and then try to gouge users for double the cost to get access to the forms IS UNCONSCIONABLE! The genius at Intuit that dreamed up this PR disaster should be shown the door faster than you can eFile! Any class action lawyers reading these reviews should scrutinize the Turbo Tax packaging and the methods Intuit has employed with this bait and switch attempt to see if their is a basis for a lawsuit.

title: What has happened to Turbo Tax?
content: Just got online and went to Amazon to purchase "Turbo Tax Delux" which we have been using for our family's tax filing for about the last 14 or 15 years. I briefly glanced at the review rating and then did a double take when I noticed that out of 1237 reviews 87 were five star, 17 were four star, 7 were three star, 30 were 2 star and then a staggering 1,096 reviews were ONE star. I could not believe it. I've used this product for so long and now it was being advertised as having basically a one star rating?? So I read the reviews and just could not understand what has become of what I have depended on for so very long. This year my wife and I retired. We worked up until April 2014 and then started receiving Social Security and distributions from our retirement accounts. With all the changes that Intuit has made to this product, including requiring the user to purchase needed forms which have always been included in the past, how may I trust the performance of this products original intention which was to: *interview the user *determine any scenario that the user could present *using that scenario, calculate if the user owed the Federal and State governments money or be entitled to a refund *fill out the proper forms accordingly From the many comments it appears that "Turbo Tax Delux" is a shattered product and I do not know if it will interview my situation properly, provide the necessary forms automatically and fill out those forms automatically as well? I do not feel that if I purchase Turbo Tax, what I submit to the Federal and State governments will be dependable, reliable and safe. What has happened to Turbo Tax? Even if the product needed to be changed to: accommodate changes in technology, accommodate changes in tax law, or for whatever reason that Turbo Tax offers, that dependable interview with the user to determine all the variables needed to formulate their individual tax return and to provide assurance that one's return was being prepared safely and correctly, is now lost. I don't know anything about Turbo Tax's corporate culture but being a new retiree I really must wonder who is running the ship over there? Have things shaken up? Is the employee base mostly younger inexperienced workers? Where is management? Are they paying "close" attention to their subordinates? How many staff meetings did the different departments have and how many successful resolutions were determined on how to deal with such a drastic change in their product? What thought was put into how their huge reliable customer base would react? Was this really the best approach that the CEO, Vice Presidents, General Managers, Managers, Supervisors and staff could come up with to provide a dependable product for the 2014 tax return? I think that the main concern for this great company now will be "damage control". According to the reviews on this merchants site alone, 88.6% (1096 1 star reviews) of the Turbo Tax customers coming to Amazon has been lost. I really do not know what I am going to do this year for preparing taxes. I'll look at H&R, or I may just return to the olden days when I would have to go to a professional tax preparer and pay more than the $49.99 price that Turbo Tax is asking.......but.....I do hope that Turbo Tax works harder on next years products.

title: Major Change to the Deluxe Version
content: Well, like the others have said, Intuit removed key features to file anything but the most basic return....thanks Intuit!! Now they want another $30 to file our return. I guess this is the LAST year we will use this software!!! Thanks again.....

title: Deluxe doesn't import investment info
content: Deluxe no longer imports investment results from your financial institutions and create the Sch D. Sneaky way to force you into spend more to get what 2013 Deluxe offered. Not wasting my time and going to a different company for less. Sad since I have used their product from the start.

title: The thing I dislike about Amazon reviews is having to give one star ...
content: The thing I dislike about Amazon reviews is having to give one star -- this product doesn't deserve any. Like others, I have been a long time TT user and expected to do the same this year. I was fortunate to read the many reviews on Amazon and ultimately bought H&R Block Deluxe instead. Fox news even did a piece on Intuit's sneaky move (http://video.foxbusiness.com/v/3978602133001/turbotax-users-upset-over-sneaky-price-hike/?intcmp=us_topics#sp=show-clips) and suggested an 800 number to complain and possibly get a free upgrade this year (800-445-1875). I also use Quicken, but will never upgrade it or purchase another Intuit product. Weren't they making enough money?

title: Be warned, this is a stripped down version of ...
content: Be warned, this is a stripped down version of what has been offered in previous years. It does not have the same functionality, requiring users that need certain schedules that were previously supported to purchase an upgrade.

title: Do Not Buy - missing schedule D
content: Do not buy this - compared to last year, they have increased the price AND removed a lot of functionality including schedule D. Getting the functionality back requires upgrading to Premier. I will be voting with my wallet this year and purchasing H & R Block software.

title: DO NOT BUY this product if you use Schedules C ...
content: DO NOT BUY this product if you use Schedules C or D. In prior years, TurboTax Deluxe let you complete and e-file Schedules C and D through the interactive Q&A method. The 2014 version will not permit you to e-file those schedules, and does not make the interactive feature available for them. In my opinion, this is sharp practice on the part of TurboTax, and they have lost me as a customer. See this URL for what you can do: http://www.forbes.com/sites/janetnovack/2015/01/09/irate-turbotax-users-can-get-free-upgrades-or-block-substitute/

title: Thank you for all the negative reviews as this has ...
content: Thank you for all the negative reviews as this has alerted me to the product deficiencies and saved me a lot of headaches. TaxCut here I come

title: Overpriced and no longer used by me.
content: I used Turbotax exclusively for years, up until about 2 years ago. The steady price increases along with no increased value that I could see, convinced me to look for alternatives. With the Deluxe at $49 (Which is less than the deluxe of prior years) the premiere at $75, and the business edition at $135, I decided to switch to a slayer of taxes instead at less than 1/3 of the cost of Intuit's software. There are other less expensive and valid choices as well, no reason to stick with this product if you're not happy with the price.

title: Glad I read the reviews before buying
content: Wow!!! I just came here to buy TurboTax Deluxe, as I have for the last 15 years or so. Then I started reading all the one-star reviews. Glad I did. I need schedule D, and frankly Deluxe is overpriced anyway compared to competitive products. So I definitely don't want to pay even more for Premier for the same functionality I got with Deluxe previously. Looks like a great year to try out one of the other products like H&R Block. Goodbye TurboTax. It's funny, I dropped Quicken several years ago for similar reason... they started forcing upgrades by disabling online data downloads after 3 years. Apparently, Intuit does not care about retaining customers, which seems like an unusual business model. Oh well, change is good.

title: Poor decision by Intuit
content: I've been a TurboTax Deluxe user for the past 15 years. Intuit's decision to remove most functionality for Schedule "D" in the Deluxe version of the product is accompanied by the disingenuous corporate speak which has become all too common in today's consumer marketplace. The rational for the change is to provide "consistent product functionality across [platforms]". Well, my platform seems to be behaving in a very inconsistent manner with this change. Why not just support schedule D in all versions of Deluxe? If consistency is the goal, implement changes in a way that is the least disruptive for customers. I expect that next Intuit will be saying they made the change for my "convenience". Kind of like when Intuit decided to require product activation for TurboTax in 2003.

title: Like the other thousands of long time
content: Like the other thousands of long time, loyal users I am extremely upset over the 50% increase in cost to get three critical schedules that have been a standard part of the Deluxe package for over so many years AND the sneaky approach and illogical (weasel worded) explanation utilized by Intuit senior management with long time customers. I am so angry that I have made the switch to H&R Block and Paid the full on line price, declining to take the significant H&R Block discount offered to customers who had already bought TurboTax 2014. You have to question the key decision makers at Intuit who agreed to this roll out approach and the intellectually insulting explanation that was emailed to TurboTax customers.

title: Dont Support this
content: Ends up requiring you to upgrade to premium

title: The millions of satisfied customers you had are about to abandon ship
content: I have used Turbo Tax Deluxe for at least 10 years. H & R Block ..here I come. Taking out schedules C & D is totally unacceptable. I know at least 15 others that buy this program every year. I am currently calling and emailing them to dump Turbo Tax programs. This is simply a money grab but this time I believe you are about to take a big HIT! I truly hope you take the largest profit decrease in your company's history. I feel that you just lost your most loyal consumers and I'm sure they will share their frustration with all of their friends and relatives. You made a BIG MISTAKE. You're bottom line just fell through the basement. The millions of satisfied customers you had are about to abandon ship. I would also hope that Amazon will pull your products from their inventory.

title: Like a lot of the other reviews
content: Like a lot of the other reviews, the deluxe version will no longer allow business or investment returns. I have not purchased it and will not be. There are plenty of other programs that will do it for cheaper and just as well. Disappointing !!!!

title: No Sch D. File Sch. D by Mail... Really?
content: So this is TT response - "As I've mentioned in many other places, you are NOT required to upgrade to Premier. You can still use forms mode to complete Schedule D and print/mail your return to the IRS" - really? This is what TT is recommending. Maybe we need to start contacting our elected representatives to make sure they understand that they should encourage a true low cost alternatives and "real" electronic filing. If I have to do this, then why use TT in the first place. Yuk. Also, I _think_ this "consistency" argument is a bit misleading as well. Deluxe version used to allow Sch. D in past years. So what did TT do - last year they "removed" it from the online version but left it in the CD/Download version to make it "inconsistent". Wait - now we need to make it consistent this year and so what do they do - remove it in the offline version as well. Look at this review from last year - http://www.amazon.com/review/R36ZQMJDLW90V3/ref=cm_cr_rdp_perm .

title: I've enjoyed our time together
content: Well Bob Meighan, From this day, Turbo Tax and I permanently part ways. I've enjoyed our time together, but clearly what you are doing here leaves no doubt you are no longer the type of folks I like to do business with.

title: Poor Business Judgement
content: I have used TurboTax for 15 years or more. I was set to buy the 2014 version and then I read the reviews. I hate when companies have a "new and improved" product. But for a company to have a "new and degraded" product is just wrong. I no longer have any respect for or trust in Intuit. I have also used Quicken for more years than TT. I will dump this product at my earliest opportunity also. Today I purchased the H&R Block tax software. Too bad Intuit, you lost another previously loyal customer. The entire marketing dept. should be sacked and the CEO should admit they screwed up horribly, apologize profusely and add back the functionality that was taken away. Maybe some of your lost customers will some day return to TT. But maybe not. Goodwill is easily lost and hard to earn.

title: Such rip off
content: Like everyone else, I used Turbo tax Deluxe for many years and have used Schedule D almost every year without problem. Even though Turbo tax is more expensive than other tax software, I stick with them. Then, as I am working on my return now and like everyone else I found out that they removed Schedule D. I felt so ripped off. Yes, they gave back $25 for a $30 upgrade. But why should I deal with the hassle. Doing tax is painful enough without these frustration. Intuit, you are disgusting and if at all possible, I will not buy your product again.

title: Intuit MESSED up Dah lol
content: From TurboTax today .. Jan 26 2015 Our apologies. We want to make it up to you. Your Kidding right. Little late .. moved on to H&R Block after 15 Years with you!!! apologies NOT accepted!

title: Duped TurboTax Customers get Free Download of HR Block Deluxe + State
content: Bob Meghan, I had been a loyal customer for almost 15 years. I bought my usual Deluxe software and was disgusted to find out that Deluxe functions and features had been stripped away and moved into the Premier version. The software price had been steadily increasing and I, along with millions others, had been willing to go along with it because I could count on the year-to-year consistency of the user interface, the functions and features. If I had to figure out what's in and what's out from year to year, I might as well try different software or methods. You noted that "only 20% of its TurboTax E-filers last year used the boxed or downloaded software and that only a small share of those filed a D,C, E, or F. ". I hope you didn't pay a lot of money to data scientists, or the executives who made this decision, who gave you a profile of your customers and how they use your product, and how you can maximize your income... What is your CUSTOMER ACQUISITION COST and your CUSTOMER RETENTION COST? Let's see how that 20%, ONLY 20%, will hurt your bottom-line. Loyalty can be quite expensive. UPDATE: So after seeing the backlash from their loyal customers, and only after more than 2 months of mounting negative reviews on Amazon, Intuit makes a public apology and wants to make it right by offering a $25 rebate(subject to certain conditions) to ease the transition to their new pricing. Still leaves a bad taste in the mouth because they maintain the move to strip the Deluxe of its old functionalities was to improve customer service when we all know it's to improve their bottom-line. Still no respect for their customers' intelligence. So even though I got a free upgrade, I'll get the HR Block software going to ease MY transition.

title: I think they should rename it to "basic" from now on, it's not the deluxe it used to be.
content: Having the same issue like a lot of people here. Removing important schedules in the current year is a good way to drive loyal customers away. I hope everyone just switch to alternatives until TT reverts the change.

title: Disappointed about Turbo tax downgrade changes
content: Disappointed about Turbo tax downgrade changes. I will try to return the downgrade deluxe version and get another tax software from H&R Block.

title: Just be honest next time but its too late for this customer,
content: 10+ year customer who is sick of the back door way Intuit is forcing me into the higher priced versions of their products. Used Quicken Basic 2010 for years but was forced to upgrade to the deluxe version when I upgraded to a new version because the Basic version would not import my legacy quicken files. Thanks Intuit. And now hear we are again, key schedules dropped forcing upgrades to a version two levels and $40 higher. Looks like I'll be moving to another program.

title: It's Time to Switch!
content: What a disappointment! After using TurboTax for so many years (even before Intuit took over) I am shocked to learn that the Deluxe version I've been using no longer offers some of the forms I use. In spite of the company's "20% explanation", this is an obvious move to force long time users to upgrade to a more expensive version. Their offer to upgrade only if you call them and complain loudly enough is insulting. As one of the 20%, I am taking advantage of HR Block's offer for a free switch to their software for purchasers of TurboTax.

title: I absolutely hate Quicken now with all it's attempts to force upgrades ...
content: What an absolute bonehead corporate decision. I absolutely hate Quicken now with all it's attempts to force upgrades by disabling features when the version I'm using still suits my needs. Now as a 30 year customer of TTax I am going to buy H&R Block this year and tell Intuit to go stick it up their corporate behind. I am also looking for a replacement for Quicken and will not be forced to upgrade that software any longer. Bye bye Intuit. Update:***** I purchased the H&R Block deluxe + state. Installed great and imported TTax with no problems. Seems easier to use and over 50% less than TTax and will do more. Intuit needs to terminate the VP for his ridiculous posts and redo their strategy which is a major corporate FAIL.

title: Try it... You'll regret it.
content: I've been using TurboTax for 6 years. Not this year. Bought H&R Blocks software and couldn't be happier. I'm glad I switched.

title: Turbo Tax forces needless upgrades, don't trust them
content: Turbo Tax got greedy and is now trying to make it right but only after they got caught. Can't be trusted, changed their products to force consumers into higher level and more costly product to get the same thing as prior years. I don't care how many free upgrades they offer, they proved they can't be trusted. My taxes will be filed with HR Block software this year and in the future. Apparently Turbo Tax figured they had most of the market share and could take advantage of their customers. The CEO should be fired for such a bone headed move.

title: Time to look for other software
content: Thanks for the notice on no Schedule D. Looks like it is time to make the switch after all these years of using TurboTax.

title: Dont waste your money!!!!!!!!
content: Doesn't get you your best return. A CPA did my wife and I's taxes last year and we got twice as much back as what Turbo Tax would have set us up with and we made less money this year because my wife was on maternity leave. We actually had to pay out state income tax and like I said, last year we received back from the state, this year Turbo Tax said we'd have to pay. You have to pay an extra 39.99$ for 2 different state income taxes. Most things are clear but not all. Don't waste your money here.

title: Not this year...
content: I was going to take advantage of the price break for TurboTax Deluxe this week as I do every year. But having read all the comments that people have left here I realize that I'm going to need Premier instead. I don't have a complicated return by any means but I do use schedule C for one or two transactions and try out simulations on schedule D. Forcing me to upgrade to a more expensive version of the software I have been using for over a decade is a crummy way to do business. I will be giving H+R Block a try this year. Loyalty will be difficult to cultivate when people realize that tax software has become a commodity item.

title: Bait and Switch
content: For the past 10 years I've been using TT Deluxe. Was about to order than began reading about the despicable deceptive tactics of removing Schedule D forms from this version of TT. I always used TT Deluxe in the past without thinking that something like this would happen, glad I check the reviews. Shame on you Intuit! You've drop to a new low like Snickers, Bounty and Toilet Paper Companies, less candy volume and square footage changes respectively; whereas offer less of the product in the same package, for the same or higher price. I was so angry, I purchased a copy of your competitors HR Block Deluxe program.

title: Formerly loyal TT user, and looked into it this ...
content: Formerly loyal TT user, and looked into it this year, read all the scathing reviews here, contacted Intuit Customer Service (it's not easy) and decided-- all these reviews are RIGHT. It is unconscionable what Intuit has done with the software and the "Bait and Switch" pricing this year. They apparently are/were of the opinion that they have a monopoly in this market and can do whatever the heck they want. I have just two words: H&R Block. I am no longer a TT customer. Maybe I'll come back if they change their tune on this one, but I doubt they will.

title: Price Gouging - time to make a switch!
content: Well, it's time to change. I've been a loyal TurboTax user for many years. Before that I used the H&R Block Software. Intuit has raised the prices significantly this year to get the same services I've come to expect over the years. It cost me $63 to submit a pretty basic 1040 with State and efile. That's about $20 more than last year and about $25 more than the competition charges. So long TurboTax, I'll be switching to H&R Block.

title: Lost my trust
content: I've used TurboTax for 20 years -- since it was Chipsoft -- but I'm done. Never again. I resent being treated with such contempt. Being forced to upgrade at the time I tried to file meant I had to pay them much more -- even with their partial refund -- than if I'd bought Premier in the first place. Allowing me to enter K1 info, but then refusing to file electronically, is petty. This wasn't an honest attempt at raising prices, it was slimy subterfuge. They've lost my trust after a couple of decades of loyalty. Scott Cook, how could you let them destroy your company like this?

title: Yes I could have read all the fine print, but the joy of turbo tax has ...
content: Same thing I ordered last year but now they require an upgrade to get to all forms at $30. I should have downloaded premier from Amazon and saved $15. INTUIT certainly led me into their trap. Yes I could have read all the fine print, but the joy of turbo tax has been that they lead you through the forms. Now, once you are working through return, they let you know you need more and have to upgrade through them at a premium. I have been a loyal turbo tax user for over two decades, but once I feel cheated...Never again.

title: TurboTax miscalculates Federal Taxes!
content: Update: I worked through where the error originated on my state taxes--it starts on the Federal Itemized deductions which flows down to the state forms. TurboTax does not include the state taxes paid on 1099R forms in its calculations (this should be included on Schedule A, Line 5). This in turn flows down to the state tax forms. I just completed manually filing a Amended Federal return (Form 1040X) to correct TurboTax errors! Intuit your quality control is pathetic. My son uses Tax Slayer and is happy and H&R Block is getting positive feedback. All I know is this is my last year using TurboTax. Original note: I purchase the online product. The download and installation went well, So did importing my prior years' tax information. Filing Federal taxes felt much like last year--no issues. Then I went through the state taxes. I have two kids in college so I had to take money out of my IRA to help pay the college bills. I had estimated how much tax would be owed both Federal and State from these withdrawals, so I would have these covered. At the end of the year I had $2,400 paid in state taxes on my 1099 Forms to cover these IRA withdrawals. TurboTax state only included the taxes paid on my W2, not on my 1099s. According to TurboTax I owed the state $2,100 instead of getting $300 refund! Testing the product to ensure the 3 sources of taxes paid the state should have been caught even if Quicken have performed the most basic quality control! The quality control on this product is very poor. The good: - Downloads worked flawlessly and installed cleanly - The prior year tax information imported correctly (from TurboTax 2013) - The Federal return appears accurate The bad: - The state product miscalculates taxes - Quality control remains a huge issue for Quicken I can't recommend this product.

title: Double the Price for the Same Software???
content: I have been a loyal TurboTax user for 15 years and have used the Deluxe version because I have a small part-time business where I make about $10,000 a year and now they want me to fork out double of what I paid last year to upgrade to the next level? That isn't going to happen and since so many reviewers opposed to TurboTax's price increases have been recommending H&R Block, I am going to save myself money and try H&R.

title: Another great product destroyed by misguided corporate executives. After 12 years, it's sad to say good-bye...
content: Another great product destroyed by executives who aren't in touch with their loyal customers' needs. I've used TurboTax since 2002 and have always told people how great Turbo Tax is (was). Unfortunately, I have decided to switch this year and have already installed my new copy of H&R Block 2014. From what I can tell, it is going to do everything I need for half the cost. Thank you H&R Block, good-bye Turbo Tax!

title: Can you trust these people? Obviously not.
content: I too have been a TurboTax customer since about 1995. Their continuous attempts at up-selling were always annoying, and the tricks about state returns exasperating. But this is just amazing. The price increase of 40 to 60% is the least of it. The real problem is the disingenuous way the increase is implemented, and the questions this raises as to what's next. Can you trust these people? Obviously not. Time to move on to another product. In business integrity, or at least the perception of integrity, is worth a lot. Intuit just tossed away any hint of integrity.

title: Wow! They have really raised the price and jacked up their customers.
content: I have to use TurboTax Premier due to investments which is $69 vs H&R Deluxe $27...After 20 years, switching to H&R Block.

title: fine. But what Intuit has done is outrageous
content: Pure and simple: Intuit-Turbo Tax has initiated a minimal 60% (sixty percent price increase). What is included in Deluxe in previous years - schedules C, D, E and F - has been omitted forcing many users to purchase either Premier or Home/Office at about $30 more on what was previously a $50 purchase. That is a 60% increase. If they want to bump up the price some nominal amount annually, fine. But what Intuit has done is outrageous. No doubt I will be amongst many loyal Turbo Tax users who will no longer use Turbo Tax in the future. Are you listening Intuit?

title: One Star
content: Goodbye intuit, we will never additional feel, going to your competitor unless you reduce price permanently

title: I saw it coming.
content: I saw this coming. And like many others, I've used TurboTax for many, many years. In the last couple of years TurboTax Deluxe has had more and more programming code put in to try and force you to upgrade to a more expensive version. Now it's not just a suggestion, they figure that customer loyalty will work in their favor as they force you to a more expensive version. Time to look for another vendor.

title: Intuit Drops Important Functionality From Turbo-Tax Deluxe
content: I have used Turbo-Tax Deluxe to do my taxes since the product's inception and have always lauded its benefits to friends and family. Also, for the last 10 years, I have used Turbo-Tax Business for my LLC company. For those of you who are not familiar with how the taxes work for an LLC, the business generates a very simple K-1 form where the profit or loss passes through to the partner's personal tax return. TT Deluxe always had a field for recording the dollar amount of the profit or loss. It was really that simple -- one field!! Now, I am required to pay an extra $20 for Premier just to be able to fill in that one field. Acceptance of Schedule C, D, E, K-1, etc. is a feature of the software (programming) not the platform. Itâs a shame that TT isnât providing the features in Deluxe across all platforms. Instead, TT chose to drop the functionality all together in the Deluxe version thereby forcing customers to pay for the pricier Premier version which is available across more platforms. The company made this change for one and only one reason -- to increase their revenue/profit. As customers we have to decide if the Premier versionâs price is worth it or if we want to take a chance on a different product. After reading some of the positive reviews about the H&R Block product, Iâve decided to give H&R Block a chance. As a side note, I am also extremely unhappy with Intuitâs Quicken which Iâve used for as long as I can remember. I installed the latest version of Quicken and it crashes every time that I do an online update. The person on the help desk acted as if I was from a different planet saying that she had never heard this complaint before. However, if you do a simple Google search, you will find a multitude of people complaining about the exact same problem. There are forums on the subject! After I pointed this out, she directed me to an Intuit support site on the subject. I followed the convoluted directions to the letter (and I am an IT geek) without success. So I paid over $30 for a product that doesnât work and I have to manually type all of my transactions into Quicken in order to reconcile my bank accounts and credit cards. Something is really wrong with Intuitâs customer service. The customer rep promised to follow up with me, but did not. Sadly, this is something that too often happens when a company is a monopoly. Thatâs one reason why Iâve decided to throw some support at H&R Blockâs way.

title: Bait and switch
content: Intuit has brought the tax software experience down to the level of used car salesmanship. It's going back...

title: Heads should roll at Intuit for flushing loyal customers down the toilet.
content: As a loyal customer since the days of Chipsoft, I truly feel taken advantage of by the "hidden" price change for DeLuxe users needing schedule D. What's next, a hidden fee for Quicken 2017 upgrades for Quicken 2014 users forced to upgrade in 2017? I'll be evaluating the H & R Block product and, if it fits my needs, Intuit has lost another customer.

title: One Star
content: This product is now USELESS for millions of TurboTax and Intuit customers. Time to look for alternatives.

title: This firestorm of criticism is richly deserved. Good-bye TurboTax.
content: Intuit has once again proven itself arrogantly disdainful of its users. Years ago, it incorporated copy protection that made its products nearly unusable. Users revolted, and TurboTax relented. Intuit has now outdone even that. Its 2014 TurboTax product suite forces those with the most modest of side businesses into a product that costs double that of what most formerly used. Intuit could have encouraged users to upgrade by adding enhancements and timesaving features to its higher-end offerings. Instead, it removed from its mainstream products all (Schedule D for capital gains) or most (Schedule C for one-owner businesses) functionality for schedules used by millions. Intuit apparently decided we do not pay them enough to endure their constant pitches for added-cost services, and that it would not make the effort to better market enhanced versions and added services. Instead, they elected to gut its mainstream offering and force users to change to more costly ones. When this became apparent to its millions of loyal users, did Intuit offer a mea culpa as it did with the earlier copy-protection debacle? Absolutely not! This time, Intuit doubled down, insulting us with their claim that this was not to pad their profits, but to improve our user experience. That is absolute, transparent malarkey. I will return tomorrow the recently acquired copy of TurboTax Deluxe from which I thankfully did not remove the shrink-wrap. After more than 25 years, I am looking for a different product. Thanks, Intuit, for rewarding my loyal patronage with a combination of greed, arrogance and deception one receives from politicians and monopolists but seldom from those who must compete for our dollar. P.S. to Bob and Blake: Do you really think I want to talk to one of the associates you have trained to spout drivel similar to yours, and to wait endlessly on hold for that privilege? Trust is a fragile commodity, which you have now squandered.

title: Turbo Tax is messing with loyal customers
content: absolutely disgusted. I have been using Turbo tax for decades and the deluxe version has done everything I needed even when for a short time I was self-employed - bought it again this year and when I went to do investments it was not covered and I needed premiere ($50 down the drain) - I bought the premiere version with the free state - when I went to do state they wanted another ($40) on top of the $80 the software already costs - what is up here?

title: Two cautions: 1) Turbo Tax will not support the ...
content: Two cautions: 1) Turbo Tax will not support the filing of Schedule D with the deluxe version of the software, if you need the Schedule D you will have to upgrade to the premiere version. 2) When buying software as a download (not a physical software package) from Amazon, once downloaded, it can't be returned for a refund.

title: Recipe for Disaster - it's too late to modify the software
content: Thanks but no thanks. Intuit's attempt to fix the problem at the 11th hour is a recipe for disaster. Changing the deluxe version to include schedules found in previous years version is not going to go smoothly. People familiar with changes to information technology software or hardware know changes aren't easy. They also need to be tested. This late in the cycle does not allow for testing needed to ensure integrity to the product. TurboTax has definitely lost my business.

title: "Bait and Switch" should be their corporate slogan.
content: I haven't actually purchased the software physically, but I used the online version as I have a few other years before. Consumer reports tested it out and made it sound like it was cheaper to use the online than to purchase the physical software and file. Their online prices indicated a $34.99 filing fee for federal, which seemed reasonable. I figured there would be a state fee as well, and that would be a convenience factor for whatever that price was. I guessed my total would probably be around the store price of $50-$60. I get done filling out everything and get to the end to pay and the state fee is also $34.99 bringing my total to $70. At this point, do I go to the store and purchase the software and risk hidden filing fees again? No - it's not worth it. As I"m going through tons of finalizing steps, I get to the point where it asks if I want to pay for the filing through my refund or via credit card. I choose through my refund. I'm almost ready to file and I get the summary charges of $104.00. Turns out that in addition to the federal and state, they want to add an ADDITIONAL refund handling fee - as if they haven't already bait and switched enough. Turbo tax might have good software to calculate refunds, but I'm so angry that I spent well over 3-4 hours filling in documents only to find a bait and switch. I'm going back to H&R block like I did last year and will never again use Turbo Tax!

title: Nasty surprise for loyal customers
content: I have been using TurboTax since 1998. Every year I need to file Schedule D, and every year TurboTax has provided that form. So it was reasonable for me to expect TurboTax Deluxe to have the same functionality this year that the same software has always had in every previous year. But now I discover I must pay an additional $30 for a product with the same features. Bad move, Intuit. I'm stuck with your product this year, but will not make the same mistake next year.

title: Intuit is the problem
content: I've used TurboTax for a long time. Maybe even in the DOS days, at least I know I've used Quicken since the DOS days. If what I hear about the TurboTax I will need to purchase this year to do my taxes is true, I will be switching, moving...saying hello to H&R Block. I am self employed and need a Schedule C form and apparently from what I hear TurboTax deluxe no longer has Sch C in the package and it will cost another $40 to get the package that has Sch C. Maybe it is time to entirely move away from Intuit. As mentioned before I've used Quicken since the DOS days and I am getting a bit annoyed at the corporate manor of Intuit. I just got a message from Quicken that after April 2015 I will no longer be able to download from my credit card companies, direct into my credit card accounts I set up on Quicken. I will need to purchase a new version of Quicken if I want to continue having the down load option. This is the third time I've had to update because of the down load issue and it is a BIG strong arm technique to make me buy their software. I think 90% of the abilities in the Quicken (bloat ware as computer geeks would say) is not needed by me. I just need to keep balances of checking / saving and credit accounts. Corporate buzzards flying about to pick your bones.

title: Disappointed in Intuit
content: It seems that Intuit has decided to test the loyalty of their customers. Charging more for less. So now I am buying H & R Block Tax software. It costs $26.00 and has all the features Turbo Tax used to have. According to H & R Block's website it will import Turbo Tax 2013 information. Nice job of shooting yourselves in the foot Intuit. I have been a customer for well over 10 years, but no longer.

title: I too bought Turbo Tax Deluxe as I have for ...
content: I too bought Turbo Tax Deluxe as I have for many years. I just assumed I would be getting the same product that I had always gotten. To my surprise, there are numerous schedules missing and now it is completely worthless to me. I now would have to buy a much more expensive version to get the schedules that used to come with the Deluxe version. I will never again be their customer. They hoodwinked their customers and I hope they pay dearly for it.

title: I tried TaxAct Ultimate instead (since it is free until you try to file) and it is just as good as TurboTax
content: I have used TurboTax for 20 years years, but 2014 is the last time. I need to file Schedule K and this year you are blackmailed into upgrading to Premier. I held my nose an forked out the extra $30 since I had already installed Deluxe and the store wouldn't take it back, but this is the last straw. I'm done with Intuit. I tried TaxAct Ultimate instead (since it is free until you try to file) and it is just as good as TurboTax. I should have switched years ago.

title: The changes to your "package" won't get simply swept under the carpet by the explanation that you were trying to make things sim
content: Sorry, I'm moving over to H&R Block software. The changes to your "package" won't get simply swept under the carpet by the explanation that you were trying to make things simpler and better for me the consumer. The DRM fiasco in 2003 should have taught you something. After that mess I switched to block for about 5 years but I came back now only to be disappointed again.

title: D or E it is useless and the increase in price in order to do ...
content: I agree with most of the posts. I am a retired CPA using TurboTax Basic for many years. I see that even with Deluxe product I cannot prepare my return. Without a schedule C, D or E it is useless and the increase in price in order to do a common return is ridiculous and outrageous. I will start hunting for a new program format immediately. I WILL NOT buy TurboTax. Their explanations are not acceptable. Just say you wanted to increase the price.

title: One Star
content: DO NOT BUY.. it forces you to upgrade for things previously covered by Deluxe.

title: Don't waste your money with Intuit I went to H&R Block ...
content: Intuit has really messed up their product this year. They have removed many things and give no indication that they have done this, Then you get an offer to upgrade for $40 to complete the job. The reasons Intuit gives for making the change are laughable. Don't waste your money with Intuit I went to H&R Block and had a nice surprise. It didn't take long to learn how to work with the program and it did everything I wanted. Goodby TurboTax.

title: The best to all this tax season
content: I appreciate the time everyone took to provide feedback. After a couple decades of being a loyal TT customer, I'm going with the overwhelming consensus and switching to the HR Block product. I may be back to TT after I try the competition, but this negativity is soooooo overwhelming that I can't/won't ignore it. The best to all this tax season, and once again...many thanks for the energy put into the reviews!!

title: Bye Bye Turbo Tax -- H&R Block Here I come.
content: Turbotax--this is offensive. I have used your software for about a decade but no more. For me it's the principle of the thing: I already dislike corporations pushing their weight around. This ends my relationship in full with Intuit. H&R Block makes a great alternative and I'm going there from now on.

title: How Disappointing!
content: How disappointing of Intuit to treat loyal, long-term customers like they have. Very disrespectful after so many years using Turbo Tax. Today, while at my local Sam's Club store, I let the manager know what Intuit did and that they should consider purchasing H&R Block instead of Turbo Tax in the future for their stores. Not sure if anything will come out of it, but at least I planted the idea with him.

title: Lost confidence; errors in the software that Intuit is slow to fix.
content: Others have already commented on the lack of functionality in this year's release; you should also be aware that there are errors in the software that Intuit is slow to fix. With Intuit's efforts focused on addressing the lost functionality with the Deluxe version, they seemingly have little time to address other issues. As an example, the one that was particularly vexing for me was on Form 2441, the Daycare Provider worksheet. Erroneous information is generated and is not easily corrected. Although reported weeks ago, Intuit will not release a fix until 2/12. I don't believe Amazon allows links in reviews, so please see Intuit's TurboTax Support forum if you would like further information. I experienced several other issues going through my taxes, and frequently ended up on the TurboTax Support forum. As with the issue associated with form 2441, permanent fixes are slow in coming, and the suggested workarounds may or may not work for a given user. For the very first time as a TurboTax user, I am not confident that my taxes are being created accurately. I would suggest an independent review of the tax forms before submitting them if you are at a medium to high risk for an audit. This may also be the year to consider an alternative product or tax preparation solution.

title: Like the majority here
content: Like the majority here, I have used TurboTax for years, even paying a premium over H&R Block for the "privilege". I too am switching to H&R Block. Higher prices I can live with but this whole situation leaves a bitter taste in my mouth. Why in the world would anyone continue to pay more for less? This is corporate greed and arrogance personified.

title: One Star
content: Will never use again, free tax is a lot clearer when it comes to errors.

title: What was Intuit thinking? Horrible product segmentation.
content: Same price but a lot less functionality this year gets it a 1-star rating from me. I can't understand the business model where they have to spend some money to slightly tweak the software each year (minor improvements for years) but the majority of their cost is implementing new tax rules. After that it's simply price it accordingly and watch the money roll in as they sell millions of copies of the software. Apparently that model doesn't work for them any more. Premier is a stupid segmentation... there are a lot of people who have investments via stock purchase plans, IPO, etc who need the investment option but do not have rental property. I'm not going to spend $80+ when I thought $50 was kind of ridiculous. I'm moving to H&R Block this year... their Deluxe edition was cheaper to start with (I'm about to purchase it for $35 on Amazon) and it's half the price of what I would need from TurboTax now since I would need the Premier edition. Good bye Turbo Tax after 12+ years.

title: PR Nightmare - why not just enable the functions?
content: Why all this "call in" and be on hold for 30+ minutes arguing to a CS rep who had nothing to do with the gouging. "We don't want to lose your business" - what a crock. It's more like "we hope you don't complain and just pay us the extra money to help our bottom line". I'm just returning my copy and moving on.

title: I am happy to say I am now a H&R block customer
content: I am happy to say I am now a H&R block customer. As a 15+ year customer of Turbo Tax I just want to say thanks for treating us customers so badly that I was forced to consider another software program which worked flawlessly and I am now free from being held hostage by your greed.

title: VERY disappointed. I have used and recommended your product since ...
content: VERY disappointed. I have used and recommended your product since the 90's. What you have done this year with your changes is misleading and dishonest for those of us who have been faithful users. If I don't get satisfaction when I call your company, I will gladly move on to one of several other products that I know are good - like H&R Block, or Tax Act. You have destroyed your base of customers!

title: Pop Goes the VP Intuit Weasel
content: Another long time (1999 ?), loyal TT Deluxe customer is leaving. After the weasel worded response from Intuit here on Amazon, I decided to buy a different tax program for the first time ever. Just ordered the H & R Block Deluxe program. Cheaper and they don't lie to you. Now, if I could find a replacement for my Quicken that they make me update every three years, I'll be gone for good from Intuit.

title: Avoid Turbo Tax in 2014
content: I transferred last years information to this year. After spending several hours, I completed my Mom's tax return for this year. I closed the application. When I went back to print out the forms, the tax return was not there. I did a search for it on my PC. Not found. That is when I realized it never saved it. Previous years it would save the return every 10 minutes. This option was removed in 2014, as was the option to save the return when you start working ion it. I checked with help. It only mentions the online tax return, not the one installed on my PC. What a piece of junk software from India. But it is constantly trying to get me to upgrade to Premier for $30. What a rip off. Clearly Deluxe sucks and so does Intuit. I will be looking at another brand next year. It was because of similar problem years ago, that I switched from Taxcut to go with TurboTax. They lost me as a future customer.

title: Smart People Sometime Making Not So Smart Move!
content: How do you expect me to complete my tax return without those forms? If I can file it without those forms, I may just do it manually. Loyal customers no more, Turbo Tax may not even care to keep their customers. I'm going back to Taxcut or TaxAct for 2015 tax return.

title: It is just GREED on part of Intuit / TurboTax. Shame on them.
content: As a CPA and long time and loyal user of TurboTax I am VERY DISAPPOINTED. They took a great product that I have used for more than a decade and now took out functionality so you have to upgrade and pay more for some common schedules. If Intuit / TurboTax does the same next year in their 2015 version I am changing to H&R Block tax software.

title: Glad the execs all got a huge pay raise earlier ...
content: Ok, Intuit, I'm done with you. Every year you pull the plug on something in Quicken or TurboTax or both to force me to upgrade. You haven't added ANY significant new functionality in ten years. Your free ride at my expense (Quicken v x.x all the way up to 2012, TurboTax up to 2013) is over. Glad the execs all got a huge pay raise earlier this year (http://insiders.morningstar.com/trading/executive-compensation.action?t=INTU). A word of advice - put it in your savings accounts. You're gonna need it once Intuit folds up because nobody will patronize you anymore. UPDATE 3/6/2015: I purchased TaxAct and I'm very happy with it. It's just as fast and easy as TurboTax, and it's a LOT cheaper. I filed early this week and I already have my state refund! TurboTax refugees, fear not - this is easy. TaxAct can even IMPORT FROM TURBOTAX if you saved a PDF of your returns last year.

title: My hat's off to the Amazon community for these reviews ...
content: My hat's off to the Amazon community for these reviews. I was about to blindly buy TurboTax Deluxe for the umpteenth time again this year. Obviously I'll have to switch now. My brand loyalty is a two edged sword in that it took this type of action to even get me to look at a competitor but it will be equally difficult for them to get me back.

title: Now suddenly the Deluxe version which was fine for the last 10+ years is suddenly crippled
content: Unbelievable. I have been using TurboTax since at least 1994. I still have Disk 1, V94.01 buried in an old pile of floppies. I have NEVER had an issue with this software. Now suddenly the Deluxe version which was fine for the last 10+ years is suddenly crippled? If that is the case Intuit should have put a huge warning on the label proclaiming âif you have any investments of any kind this is the wrong versionâ on the front. Now they want to double the cost of the software to get me to where I need to go here. Pathetic. Looks like I will be reviewing other programs out there. And just to be 10000% clear, this isnât about the extra cost. It is about the hassle, the disingenuousness of Intuit, and the sudden change in format without any kind of warning to the consumer. Whoever it was that allowed this change to be made should be fired. It is going to cost you a lot of customer here. I also use Quicken Deluxe for all my home finances. I will be reviewing that decision as well because it is only a matter of time before someone starts messing around with that package tooâ¦

title: Switching this year
content: I have been a customer of Turbo Tax since the 80's on a Mac. I have been satisfied all these years. I have decided not to use it this year due to all the negative reviews. I am switching. Sorry. maybe I am wrong to do so, but all those negative long reviews must have some credence.

title: H&R Block - here I come. Bye Intuit and your Turbo Profit scam.
content: As others have shared - I too have been using Turbo Tax since the 90's. I don't even think about any other product. Since reading of this very "sneaky" and obvious profit gouging move Intuit has made this year....I will NOT be buying Turbo Tax. Instead, I am taking the advice of others and trying H&R Block this year.

title: Intuit made a fatal mistake and ruined their product
content: Enough said, read the hundreds of 1-star reviews for details.

title: TurboTax may be falling on their sword after being busted ...
content: TurboTax may be falling on their sword after being busted but it does not hide the fact they were trying to extort more money from their customer base. H&R Block will import your old TurboTax return and includes investment features and forms. This screw up is going to cost TurboTax a lot of money and somebody there needs to get fired.

title: Do they actually believe their own words?
content: I agree with many other commenters; it's the contempt and weasel words that are the worst. Even worse(r) is that I think management of this and many other companies actually truly believe their noises. Many have been only spouting this kind of "stuff" for so long that they actually believe it to be true.

title: So far so good. But that still leaves the issue of sneaking ...
content: I have been using Turbo Tax for over 15 year. I had bought the Deluxe a few weeks and didn't even realize that I won't be able to use it this year until I saw the article in a local newspaper. I called the 800 number provided and they upgraded me to premium without a problem. So far so good. But that still leaves the issue of sneaking in a huge price increase for the same functionality, and all this in the name of improving "customer experience". I can live without this improved experience. I would invite Intuit's CEO and CFO to review their marketing organization. It probably needs a new head. Remember, this "great experience" comes around every year and it is only so much it can cost before we jump ship or just start doing it manually, which most of us are capable of doing anyway. I will be petitioning my congressman to pass a law that lets IRS provide the software to all tax filers free of charge.

title: Fortunately, we found out in time we are moving ...
content: We have used TT for years and thank everyone for the reviews on TT 2014 that alerted us to the significant reduction in value. Fortunately, we found out in time we are moving on to H&R Block.

title: Rip Off
content: Bought the software at Best Buy but was not aware that it didn't include Schedule C at the time. Now I'll have to either upgrade to the Premier or give it to my daughter and purchase the H&R Block software. This is the last time I use TurboTax! What a rip off!

title: Price HIKED for features that used to be at no additional cost!
content: Wow. How depressing. I've used TurboTax for years now. For the reasons sited by 1000+ other users, the removing of schedules C,D, and E, forcing you to upgrade. I'll be headed to H&R Block. What's so terrible about this is that up until this year I've always RAVED about TurboTax as a perfect do it yourself option for the cost.

title: Intuit shows their contempt for their customers by gimping this version! If you have Capital Gains, DO NOT BUY
content: As many others have indicated, this product has been purposefully gimped. They removed the ability to submit electronically if you have any capital gains in order to force people to migrate to a more expensive platform. And while they keep saying you can still print and submit your forms, we all know that we don't buy turbotax expecting or wanting to print and mail forms. Clearly they believe they have monopoly powers and I join the many others here in being totally disgusted. To Bob Meighan, VP TurboTax, I do not find your rationale that you had to standardize platforms to reduce confusion to be at all compelling considering you only removed the capital gain functionality from the on-line product last year. You created the confusion a year ago. It would have been far less confusing to restore this functionality to the on-line platform rather than gimping the PC platform as well. This move serves mostly to show your disdain for your customers.

title: Don't trust its auto import values
content: You can't even trust it to copy last years information correctly. I used it last year, and got a state refund. The auto import of the state refund for last year was not equal to what it was in their own document. I put in a support request because this might be happening to others, but got no response.

title: Crippled "Deluxe" version
content: Very sad to see that Turbo Tax has made changes to the "Deluxe" edition of their software (you can no longer file Schedules C, D, E, or F). So if you done something as simple as bought or sold stock last year, you'll need to spend about twice the money and "upgrade" to Premier. I've been using TurboTax for more than a decade, but this is it. I'm switching to H&R Block. They'll give you a free download if you email them (do a google search for SwitchToBlock). You just need to have a copy of a valid receipt for the 2014 Deluxe Edition of TT. H&R Block software uses the same friendly interview approach and it will import last year's return from Turbo Tax. I haven't used it yet, but I've heard good things. Shame on you, Inuit. You have lost another customer.

title: Terrible that they decided to quietly change the pricing and ...
content: Terrible that they decided to quietly change the pricing and features. I have been using it for years and just found this action absolutely greedy. I don't expect their "sincere" apologies. This was a well planned slap to existing deluxe customers. Time to compare with Taxcut now.

title: Goodbye TurboTax
content: Been a loyal TurboTax user for 12 years and expected to buy it again this year when I logged on tonight. Thank you all for the one-star warning. I just downloaded HR Block instead.

title: One Star
content: no schedule D and E, you must be kidding me!!!!!!!!!!

title: US Resident, London UK
content: They changed what was bundled in TurboTax Deluxe for 2014. Now you have to buy the more expensive version to get the forms you used to get with the Deluxe Version (Schedules C & D for example) So be warned !!

title: Pain in the shorts!!
content: would not upload the info from my previous years turbotax. told me to enter it all manually. When I used the program off intuit it did load the info but wanted another $35 +- to file my state taxes. Pa has a very user friendly program that is free. The Amazon version would have been ok but more expensive then the Intuit program plus Pa's program. There was also no way to contact Turbotax to make the Amazon program work. All in all a deal that was too good to be true and a real pain in the shorts

title: I have been a loyal TurboTax customer for years but ...
content: I have been a loyal TurboTax customer for years but due to this policy change and price hike, I switched to H&R Block. I prefer the TurboTax software, but the price increase makes it not worth it. FYI, I'm not rich but file Schedule C and D every year, thanks for driving me away TurboTax.

title: Beyond the pale
content: The decision to remove Schedules C and D from the Deluxe version of Turbotax has made me switch to TaxAct. I have used Turbotax without complaint for more than ten years. However, I simply cannot support a company that gouges long time customers. In addition, the explanation from the company president was insulting.

title: What more can I say that thousands of others have ...
content: What more can I say that thousands of others have said about TT's raw deal of not warning us of the $30 price increase. I will give them credit. They say they will refund my $30. They also need to fix the sales tax deduction. Look up your states sales tax on the chart. If that is higher than state income tax you get to deduct that. There is also a rule that says if you bought a new car, boat, etc. You can add the sales tax on that to the chart. Well, their interview process completely ignores that. I had to go to their sales tax work sheet in forms. After I had filled out the worksheet in the forms section TT finally gave me the higher sales tax amount. I don't care whether they fix the sales tax problem or not because I won't be using TT next year. I think I might give Tax Slayer a try. I am confident that next year they will up the price to $80 which is more than I am willing to pay.

title: Goodbye INTUIT !
content: Goodbye INTUIT !

title: Done with Turbotax after over 15 years
content: Wow, Not sure who made the decision to change the business model at Intuit but who ever did should polish their resume. What is the point of TT Basic now? Looks like I will be trying H&R Block software for both my business and personal returns. Goodbye Turbotax RIP.

title: All I can say is I'm glad I started earlier this Tax year
content: I did not purchase my copy of TurboTax deluxe from Amazon but purchased it somewhere else. But what Intuit has done, is despicable. I'm a Quicken customer from the early 90's. I started using TurboTax in the late 90's. The functionality of the Intuit Turbo Tax product has been in decline for the last 3-4 years. This last change is the icing on the cake. Today I started looking for a replacement and guess what I found one! For those that don't know, H&R Block will send you a free download for their equivalent based software based on your Intuit purchase. Read the text and as an EX-Turbo tax user, I'm looking forward in using the Block software. Link -> http://newsroom.hrblock.com/hr-block-offers-free-software-turbotax-users/ Heads will roll at Intuit for this decision. I just hope they don't go out of business, because a competitive replacement for Quicken is no where on the horizon !

title: TurboTax Deluxe - NOT for investors!
content: I've used TurboTax products annually since 1994. I won't use TurboTax again. Despite Intuit's assurances, I've been unable to obtain the free patch to restore functionality. Running out of time and patience with TurboTax Deluxe, I purchased H&R Block Deluxe and have been generally impressed.

title: No Turbotax Deluxe for me!
content: I was ready to purchase this at Costco until I saw all the one star reviews on Amazon. Thanks to all the reviewers for warning us. I was expecting it to be the same as the prior years' programs. I also need Sch D & E. My brother had told me about H & R Block Deluxe software for two years now, that it does the same thing as Turbotax Deluxe and was also cheaper. Since Turbotax Deluxe worked for me I didn't feel all the price differences (product, extra state download, state efile) were worth switching until now! I've purchased H&R Block's Deluxe from Amazon but have yet to install it. If it works as well as expected, Turbotax will lose another repeat customer. Once people make a software switch, it is always hard to get them to go back.

title: Sad.
content: I can no longer use Deluxe for my home business. Am switching to another software package, such as H&R Block. It's not really apparent in the 2014 TurboTax literature that they've removed all the Sch C and Sch D features. Sad.

title: How not to treat your longtime loyal customers.
content: I was *this* close to ordering TT Deluxe -- the same I've always used. Then I read the long litany of negative reviews. With Intuit's new price-gouging bait-and-switch scam, I'm going to get H&R Block's offering instead. Bob Meighan, and Tiffany E -- you simply do NOT understand the first thing about this situation.
