content: Tried to go with a competitor, it couldn't handle my situation with respect to health care insurance. After waiting for weeks to get my issue resolved with the competitor, switched back to TurboTax, which it handled it smoothly.

title: Another Customer Lost
content: Count me in the group of former TurboTax users who abandoned this product after Intuit made their crooked move to switch Schedule D forms to the Premier version. The funny thing is if they had left the forms where they were and simply raised the price I probably would have purchased it again with no questions asked. But this bait and switch is an insult to all of us. Here's my message to Intuit: price increases I understand and can accept as part of the cost of doing business but pulling a stunt like this shows us you have to be deceitful in order to take our money. That is why we are no longer supporting your product. Fortunately this odious event made me explore other options and I found that H&R Block Deluxe has all the features I need and is significantly less expensive; it's even less than what I paid last year for TurboTax. Thanks for the help, Intuit!

title: Deluxe has degraded
content: Very dissapointing that the deluxe version has been downgraded to exclude anything but the most basic schedule c and schedule A. C'mon, alot of americans itemize their deductions. Going to give h&r block a try with their free offer for people who purchased turbotax deluxe this year

title: TurboTax Has Lost Their Edge
content: I've used & trusted TurboTax software since at least 1999 (maybe before, but that's as far back as my Quicken books go). Last year, I was unable to install TurboTax 2013 on my desktop system at home, running Windows XP. I spent over an hour with various Intuit tech support people to no avail. I ended up having to install it on an old laptop (also running WinXP). Not ideal... A couple weeks ago, I received my 2014 TurboTax software disc from my preferred seller, and attempted to install it. No go. Got a cryptic error message. Tried Googling the message, went through the countermeasures listed on TurboTax's website....NoGo. Same error message. Just tried installing it again so I could give details of the error message in this negative review, and got a DIFFERENT error message. It now says "Sorry but TurboTax 2014 cannot be installed on your computer because you need Windows XP Service Pack 3 installed." Ummm...I'm no longer running WinXP. I'm running a new box I assembled earlier this year, running 64 bit Windows 7 Pro. This year's software is too stupid...too dysfunctional to even begin installing on my computer. Disappointing, to say the least. Prior to last year, TurboTax would install without fail. No jumping through hoops, no need to install this-or-that piece of software prior to running the setup program. No need to make multiple phone calls to tech support staff here in the US or the Philippines. Their software is broken, and they apparently didn't care about TESTING it before releasing this year's garbage. Helloooooooooooo, H&R Block?

title: Leave Turbotax - go to H&R Block
content: I dropped TurboTax a few years ago when I couldn't enter the rental properties because they limited the number. H&R Block (formally Taxcut) did not. It took a little get used to Taxcut the 1st year, but I'm so happy I switched. You will be too. I guarantee it! TurboTax has become greedy and will charge whatever the market will bear. It's not going to get better with them, only worse. Switch to H&R Block now. If you already bought TurboTax Basic or Deluxe for 2014, you can get a free copy of âH&R Block Deluxeâ tax prep software. Send an email to SwitchToBlock@hrblock.com with your name, address, phone number, operating system (Mac or Windows), and a scan or email showing proof (receipt) of TurboTax Basic or Deluxe purchase. How much easier can it get?

title: Looks like this is the year I make my move to ...
content: Looks like this is the year I make my move to another software company. I've been a TT user for 20+ years and can't believe they are standing behind this new pricing model. Well, they can stand behind it and admire it while I spend my money with their competitor.

title: Dissappointed in IN TU IT!!!!
content: With all the negative reviews, I will not take any chances by purchasing TurboTax 2014 this year.....will check out TAXACT...

title: I have been a TurboTax customer since it first came ...
content: I have been a TurboTax customer since it first came out. I have a small consulting firm with no inventory and only simple office expenses. I also have dividend income from my brokerage accounts. Halfway though entering some data in the 2014 version, I got a popup telling me I had to upgrade the version I have been using for years. Because I was planning for a quarterly tax payment, I was over a barrel and did the upgrade. That is it. I am done. Without a refund for the upgrade, Intuit has lost me as a customer next year. This topic has come up at several on-line forums for consultants, and the anger seems to be universal. Intuit has really blown it. The comments here say 'call us to make it right'. Does that mean a refund? My last call to Intuit support resulted in a Keystone Cops -like episode with someone in India who could not speak English.

title: the death of a great product
content: I visited this website today (January 2) expecting to buy TurboTax Deluxe as I have for many years past. I'm shocked to find out that this product no longer suits my needs. Many years ago, H&R Block dropped support for the Mac, so I switched to TurboTax (then called MacInTax?), and have been a satisfied customer ever since. My next step is to visit the H&R Block website and see what they offer for tax preparation software - the 2014 tax year may be the year that I switch back.

title: THIS IS NOT THE FIRST TIME TURBO TAX HAS SUPRISE HIDDEN COST
content: Along with so many others, I will likely find a new software package for 2014. After Turbo Tax sprung the last surprise on users several years ago (when the CD was limited to one machine download - creating a major hassle since I worked at home and in my office on my return) this is a surprise but probably shouldn't be. I imagine that just like the last idiotic move, and after losing many customers because of it, they may back track next year (such as when they discontinued the one maching download after just one year). But its too late. I may take advantage of HR Blocks offer to transfer over for free. This is a simple business decision for Turbo Tax. When you have such a significant market share, raise the price. They expect to lose some customers, but hope that the increased revenue will make up for it. Hopefully enough customers will leave to prove them wrong.

title: If you're looking for Schedule-D, look elsewhere!
content: It's always pretty tough when you finally realize that you've been "had", but I had to wait until I was half-way through the program - and even then - thought it was my error in not being able to access Schedule-D. But then it's even worse when you realize that you've been "had" by a company that you have been a loyal customer of for as long as they made it easy to file your own taxes. I guess that loyalty means different things to different folks. At last count, there were already 1,485 customers who gave this product one star ("I hate it".) If you subscribe to the 10x rule of thumb, there are already 14,850 Amazon customers who have vowed to switch - and it's just January 20th. This is a sad day for Intuit, but a bonus day for H&R Block. Sorry TT, you can only take advantage of a customer once before they vote with their feet!

title: Bait and Switch
content: I've never been much of a "review type" person, but what Intuit did this year moved me to write my first. My spouse is a self-employed house cleaner. This business doesn't have much to report, but we report it nonetheless. In the early years TT has made this fairly easy. In more recent years, the Schedule C & C-EZ interface has been somewhat buried, but still usable. Now this... I find the current omission of such self-employment aids, along with the Schedule D abandonment inexcusable. Sure, they'll throw us a $25 bone this year (after jumping through hoops), but what about next year? For me, it's time to search out an alternative.

title: I have already bought the CD from COSTCO. I was stucked this year. Next year, I am going to switch. Bye-bye, TurboTax!
content: I have already bought the CD from COSTCO. I was stucked this year. Next year, I am going to switch. Bye-bye, TurboTax!

title: Way to Go
content: Another previous user of TurboTax for years, but no longer. Many thanks to the thousands of other reviewers who got the word out, both here and elsewhere. You know it's pretty bad when a company's own representatives are providing real-time feedback to online reviews. I'm sure the shareholders at Intuit are totally thrilled right about now.

title: I should have switched years ago!!!
content: It has already been said in previous reviews but... I contacted TurboTax to state my thoughts about changing the software to force me to a higher package. Their response from VP Bob Meighan "You're entitled to your opinion. ". My opinion is that I will go ahead and switch to TaxAct. The software costs less and the Efile for state is HALF of what TurboTax charges. TT, Thanks for the boot in the butt! I should have switched years ago!

title: Like every year I went to Amazon to buy TT ...
content: Like every year I went to Amazon to buy TT Deluxe and shocked to see so many one star reviews. I am so glad that I took time to read those. Like many folks I have been a loyal TT customer for 10+ years, and I feel cheated that Sch D is removed from the Deluxe version - I would not have known if I had not seen these reviews. I see many folks have recommended H&R block so I am thinking of giving it a shot this year. Unfortunately for TT, next year for me will be H&R by default, as it is easier to continue on the same software. Feel bad that TT has forced me out from their loyal customer list.

title: Amazon PC download not working... After the free Premium offer, now I get DLL errors. AARGH!
content: I'm really trying to be patient... I order TaxCut when i heard about the "missing forms" issue, and when they offered a free upgrade to PREMIUM, i went ahead and purchased Turbotax download from Amazon. Now, after 3 hours, this dang download won't work. It gives me an error that says C:\Windows\SYSTEM32\d3d8thk.dll is either not designed to run on Windows or it contains an error. Two downloads and one repair, and STILL HAVE THE FREAKN ERROR. I have a typical Win 7 Pro OS. Give me a break!!! I want my money back.

title: So sad to be leaving
content: Makes me very sad to leave TurboTax. I've not quite got the length of service with TT as some of the folks who have commented, but I have used it effectively for the last decade. TT saw me through tax implications when I had to figure out how to use the Lifetime learning credit to pay for college, deducting mortgage interest for my first home, and even how to adjust my withholding when I got married last year. Alas TT will not be there for me any more. The chicanery with the prices and the removal of schedules from the "deluxe" version means I will switching to one of the many other products out there. Good TT, your like an old high school friend who has just drifted too far away.

title: TurboTax No More! H&R Block gets my business
content: I've been using TurboTax since the '90s. Since I've been self-employed over the past 10 years, I've used TurboTax online. Navigating through business expenses, the death of my husband, and now college expenses was a breeze and though my income dipped (way) below the Federal Free-File, I stuck with TurboTax. "Free-file" wasn't free last year (2013) since I had a Schedule C, but since I was still unsure about the widow(er) filing status I forked over the $50-60 plus another $19 for the state. Today I went through all of my entry and it would have cost me $116! I didn't believe it possible, so came to Amazon to see how much it would be to buy the disks with free Fed filing. I'm blown away. I went to IRS . GOV, clicked the "free-file" logo, selected H&R Block and completed my taxes in a short amount of time -- Schedule C and all. State filing cost $16 including tax. H&R Block saved me $100. TurboTax is gone for good in this house.

title: Intuit DEFLATE-GATE - Hello H&R Block, Goodbye Intuit Turbo Tax Deluxe!
content: In its infinite wisdom and own version of the New England Patriots' `Deflate-Gate', Intuit, in its 2014 Turbo Tax release, decided to `deflate' the 2014 version of Turbo Tax by eliminating the ability to electronically file Schedules C, D & E. Yes, you can print them and manually fill them out and mail, but Intuit advises against it. I don't recall Intuit having the courtesy and professionalism to send me an email telling me this, do you? After all, Intuit has email addresses (if unchanged) of all previous `loyal' users on file. And if I wanted to do my taxes manually, I would have no need to purchase tax software. What a disgrace! I would like to know whose `bright idea' it was to offer less value and charge $30 more for the Premium edition to electronically file the aforementioned Schedules. Other companies have learned the hard way that you should never fool with `the old family recipe;' it came back to haunt them. It is now Intuit's turn to reap the repercussions. Intuit was `hoist by its own petard,' i.e., a victim of its own actions. Too bad Intuit - you have lost another `loyal' customer. No matter what their refund or appeasement policy is, I will not be party to it. This was perhaps one of the dumbest business decisions ever made by any company. PS If you have already purchased a boxed copy of TT2014, take it back or return it to where you purchased it. The retailer I dealt with said they have had many, many returns in exchange for other tax software. I exchanged mine for H&R block's Deluxe edition and got a $15 credit! PPS Unfortunately I did not have the ability to rate this product a ZERO or I would have, so I gave it a LOW, LOW 1 star.

title: Will look at other tax software providers
content: Long time user disappointed in the removal of Schedule C forms, etc. I had to upgrade to Home & Business and now it won't download my state forms and have to contact Intuit. Total fail Intuit, will look to switch!

title: Dumped TT after years
content: I have been a Intuit customer for years, after reading all the reviews I switched to the Green Box (H&R), I'm still disappointed, only because I have to pay taxes....not because of any problem with the software. I can't believe TT made such a dumb mistake, but typically it's some moronic manager trying to squeeze one more dollar from it's customer. Smooth move jerk, whoever you are.

title: Bad software. Fails to file correctly.
content: They forced me to upgrade for an extra $30. Then charged me for state of Maine filing. State of Maine filing rejected 3 times with error code ME1040-1150. I had to file Maine taxes manually. Then I applied for $25 rebate for forced upgrade and they refused the rebate request saying I did not file 2013 taxes with them. For over 15 years I have bought the Turbotax CD and filed with them, including 2013. I will never buy from Intuit again. When my forced upgrade to Quicken expires, I will also not buy it again.

title: Deluxe is Not Deluxe
content: Disappointed with Turbo Tax this year and I haven't started yet. I purchased Deluxe as I have other years but this year the product does not include Schedule D. Fortunately I this was brought to my attention before I opened the package so I can return it. This was the year I was going to have my kids buy their own software and be responsible to file their own taxes as we have done it together in several past years and they understand the process, but a $79.00 per copy we'll share the single copy. So Turbo Tax Premier sale and not 3 Deluxe purchases. I'm guessing that my kids first purchase may be another brand in future years or free copies. Intuit has had a good name, but me eyes and minds are now a bit more open.

title: I'd like to thank Intuit for giving me the incentive to ...
content: Don't buy this version if you have investments requiring capital gains reporting - schedule D. I'd like to thank Intuit for giving me the incentive to try H&R Block software this year by removing features from the version I've bought for the last 14 years. I've been reluctant to change to the cheaper H&R Block tax software because I was fearing the change and learning curve. But, Block software is easy to learn and similar to Turbo Tax. I've used the free on-line version for years for my kids' returns and I've had no difficulties. Why Intuit ( Turbo Tax) decided to remove fairly commonly needed forms and yet still call this the "Deluxe" feature is a mystery or better stated. . . a big goof. I've read that Intuit is offering $25 rebates if you bought Deluxe and if you bought Deluxe last year and if you now need to upgrade to the Premium edition in order to have the same features as Deluxe had in the past. Too late for me, I've already switched to H&R Block. For others, even with the rebate H&R Block Deluxe is cheaper and does the same thing. You can even import your Turbo Tax files from last year. Vote with your money and show the software providers that they have competitors and they can't just increase prices without providing more benefits and features.

title: Pay more, get less.
content: It will be interesting to see what share of the market H&R Block has for filed returns this year.

title: I always went to the store like a robot and just bought the next one each ...
content: I have been using TurboTax since the 90's. While I discarded older disks and am unable to locate a few from here or there, my remaining disks are in the collection in the attached photo. I always went to the store like a robot and just bought the next one each year. Apparently, that just isn't going to cut it this year. I am awaiting my W2's so I haven't gotten started yet, but it looks like my collection will end at 2013 and the 2014 version is going to be returned. I had no idea that Deluxe would no longer handle my investments. I'm not self employed and I do not own my own business. I am just an average Joe who is investing for retirement. I should not need more than Deluxe to do my taxes. Just like Crest toothpaste and Heinz ketchup.... TurboTax has been a part of my life. I am very loyal... but Intuit... well... relationships depend on trust. I can't trust you. I have no idea what you will be pulling next year and the year after. I think we need to start seeing other people. It's just not going to work out this year. I can't be with someone I can't trust, and well, I'm not getting any younger. It would be better for me if I start over with someone else sooner rather than later. sorry. UPDATE: H&R Block software will not only import my 2013 TurboTax returns (I do 4 returns each year, so I was hesitant to switch for all of the typing), but it will also download/import my 2015 W2's, 1099's, and Scottrade tax statements just like TurboTax did! I will not miss a beat!! Switching will result in no extra work!! I would not have ever known this had Intuit not tried to put the screws to people! and BONUS: H&R Block is less than half the price!! UPDATE 2: I had a photo of 14 or 16 prior year disks proving my year after year loyalty.... the photo has seemed to disappear. sorry...

title: One less Intuit product to buy
content: Glad I noticed all the 1 star reviews before I bought this. I haven't used anything but TurboTax since 1997, but I need schedule D (really, just how many homeowners don't?) and it appears that H&R Block's product will do what TurboTax Deluxe no longer will, and for less money. Totally sick of Intuit's featureless and bug-ridden Quicken 'upgrades' also; time to send Intuit a message (and save some money, to boot). This is the kick I needed to finally motivate me into looking at Quicken alternatives, as well.

title: Don't give corporate greed a chance
content: I have been using Turbo Tax since the DOS days on floppy disk. The move Intuit pulls this year is the lowest of low. It has lost a long time customer here. Regardless of price. I move on. The reason is that what Intuit is going to do in the future? Its greed is bottomless and this year dissatisfaction will make it smarter at how to go about gouging the public. The best way to stop the greed is to hit the bottom line. Those who are familiar with competing products can help outline the ease of transition to H&R or other products. Let's move on. It's not fun having to file taxes. The public doesn't deserve to be jerk around by corporate greed.

title: used turbotax for years. Not this year
content: Thanks for reviewing. Returned my purchased deluxe version back to costco. Switching to Taxact

title: Mark me down as yet another defector to H&R block ...
content: Mark me down as yet another defector to H&R block. Shame on you TurboTax for this sham! If you wanted to increase the prices then just be honest about it. All this talk of "consistency" is a bunch of bull. You will be the ones 'paying the price' for this fiasco. I encourage all who are unhappy with this turn of events to put their wallets where their mouths are and buy elsewhere. I have been a TurboTax/Intuit customer for over twenty years but no longer. Bye bye....

title: and for some reason Intuit decided to be extra greedy this year and charge for a simple tax return like mine. After Googling wha
content: After entering all my information for their free edition, it then tells me I need to purchase the deluxe edition in order to do an itemized tax return. I have done this exact same return for many years, and for some reason Intuit decided to be extra greedy this year and charge for a simple tax return like mine. After Googling what changed, I see the uproar about Intuit's greediness and their tumbling stock price so I had to add my two cents as well. Don't waste my time, TurboTax.

title: So Long Old Friend
content: I have been using Turbo Tax since the mid-90's but no more. The discount for Prime members is enticing but hubby does the finances and I do the taxes so I never know what schedules I need until I sit down to work through the taxes. I do not have the time or patience to try the Deluxe and find out I need the Premium so I will be checking out H&R's offering as a replacement.

title: Removing schedule D and forcing me to use Premier is ...
content: Removing schedule D and forcing me to use Premier is absurd! I have used TurboTax for over 20 years, but have decided to switch to H & R Block because of Intuit's decision.

title: I think I will try out another product instead.
content: I USE to be a loyal TurboTax customer. Then I read the reviews... Next I read the following article. "KANSAS CITY, Mo. â H&R Block (NYSE: HRB), the worldâs largest consumer tax services provider, is offering its Deluxe + State desktop software free to taxpayers who already purchased TurboTaxâs Basic or Deluxe software for 2014. The offer comes in the wake of a change in forms available to TurboTax Basic and Deluxe clients. Many TurboTax clients are discovering the products theyâve used for years will no longer support their tax needs without additional paid upgrades. The biggest change TurboTax made in their forms coverage ***is no longer supporting Schedule A*** in their Basic product. Taxpayers who itemize deductions and use forms for mortgage interest, charitable donations and Health Savings Accounts will now have to upgrade to TurboTax Deluxe, a $40 increase in price. However, the 30 percent of DIYers who file a Schedule A can use H&R Block Basic software, normally $19.95, to access Schedule A forms. H&R Block Basic users will also receive a 5 percent bonus on top of a federal refund when the taxpayer puts some or all of their refund on e-gift cards from more than 40 retailers." That's with Basic. With the Deluxe version, apparently they removed other forms as stated in other people's comments for this product... I think I will take up H&R Block's offer for that free software...

title: Although I've been a loyal Intuit customer for many years ...
content: Although I've been a loyal Intuit customer for many years, choosing Turbo Tax as well as Quicken, that all has been changed. I could deal with the fact that Intuit has failed Mac owners with their feeble versions of Quicken, but the gouging in the most recent version of Turbo Tax is appalling. I use 10.6.8 as my Mac OS, and the recent versions of Turbo Tax require 10.7.5 or higher to run.Then Intuit decided to gouge their customers by requiring everyone who has traded a single share of stock to purchase the Premier version of Turbo Tax. Obviously a company more concerned about their bottom line than their customers. To resolve this problem I have changed over to Money Dance for my "book-keeping" and have also made the change to TaxAct. Other than a minimal number of "Quirks" in TaxAct, I am almost ready to submit my federal and state forms. And that's at half Deluxe's price, assuming that it would work. By the way, I needed some assistance in preparing my TaxAct return. I found their customer service personnel to be knowledgeable and eager to answer my questions. They even beat their published response time in getting answer to me. If Intuit wanted me to go elsewhere, they just should have told me.

title: Well, well, well. I've been using TurboTax ...
content: Well, well, well. I've been using TurboTax Deluxe for probably 20 years now. Ever since I had to insert about a dozen floppy discs. Now I have to upgrade to Premiere to do what I could do before with the Deluxe edition which is download investment data and rental expenses. I read here that someone that claims to be a VP or something at TurboTax is making amends to those of us that have been screwed. Not true. I called his 1800-445-1875 number and talked to Mateo (India?), only to be told that they would only offer me a 50% discount on the upgrade. I will now switch to H&R Block and will NEVER return to TurboTax.

title: In addition to the removed Schedules mentioned thousands of times ...
content: In addition to the removed Schedules mentioned thousands of times, there are more features missing. I've always used direct deposit to get both of my refunds, Fed - e-file, State - mail in (to save $19.99). This year, I find that somehow state refund type is set to MAIL A CHECK instead of direct deposit, and now way to go back and fix it. I'm locked out. Is this a way intuit treats their loyal customers? I'm officially done with TT.

title: What are you thinking Intuit???
content: What are you thinking Intuit??? You can't bait and switch your long term customers like this. I have been a customer of yours since year one but I immediately purchased your competitors product this year instead. This has to be one of the biggest corporate blunders of the modern era. I'm sure your shareholders won't be thrilled with your 2015 (and beyond) financial results. I suggest to save face that you admit your "mistake" and rethink TT next year.

title: One Star
content: No Schedules C, D and E on Deluxe Edition after all these years? Goodbye TurboTax!

title: Boycott TurboTax
content: I have used TurboTax for over 13 years now, in between I switched to H&R Block software once (way back), it was effective, needed a little more thought to use it than TT. Given this fiasco, I am going to give H&R a try again, I am sure they may have made things a lot easier, if not, I can live with a little inconvenience of having to put a little extra effort. I guess 13 does happen to be unlucky, for TurboTax, as it is losing one customer. I hope the small "fraction" they claim are affected jumps ship rather than pay the extra price (or deal with their support to get the free upgrade, because there will be no free upgrade next year), only then will Intuit realize that the false claim "of small fraction" hurts its business, and that people do not get confused with different capabilities on different platform. Oh, and I think TurboTax should promote "Bob Meighan, VP TurboTax", to "Bob Meighan, VP, Excuses & Lying TurboTax".

title: One Star
content: Cynical ploy to freeze out previous features to make you buy an "upgrade".

title: Another loyal customer lost
content: Like many people, I have been using TurboTax Deluxe for many years. I am floored by the serious changes to the product that now make the product useless without an additional paid upgrade. I am now left either having to call Quicken and beg for the product that I thought I was buying, and that I have bought annually for over a decade. Thankfully, H&R Block has extended an offer to provide their product for free for anyone who was fooled and scammed by Intuit. Way to go H&R Block, you've got yourself a new customer.

title: Surreptitious Price Hike
content: I've been using TurboTax since the Eighties, before Intuit bought it. I have been a loyal customer and guided many people to it's use. I'm not upset with the folks who create and support TurboTax, they are the people who actually do the work. I despise management's deceptive method of forcing consumers into purchasing a more expensive product by removing forms that have been a TurboTax Deluxe staple for over twenty years. The apology, which blames the deception on the need to consolidate products, is a crock. Not for a minute do I believe that the use of online and mobile TurboTax apps require this type of modification to their core product. The bait and switch move is simply a way for greedy management to increase income and thereby justify their salaries to shareholders. Mr. Goodarzi's "We messed up" letter only occurred because so many people were outraged by his surreptitious price hike. If not as many people would have spoken out then there would only have been a "We scored!" letter to the Intuit board. What is at best a beguiling attempt to reconcile their deceit falls short by $5.00 plus tax, so Intuit still scores. The good product from the TurboTax folks in San Diego makes it hard to switch to H & R Block software but Intuit's Goodarzi makes it easier.

title: No more TurboTax for me!
content: I have used TurboTax Deluxe for at least 10 years. I will now switch over to H&R Block since the latest TT won't do the job anymore. Thanks to the other reviewers who let me know Schedule C & D are no longer included. I was pleased when I could download my investments easily, but no longer. Hope it hurts, TurboTax!

title: I'm joining many of the 1000 + people that are ...
content: I'm joining many of the 1000 + people that are exercising the "vote with your feet" option. .Have used TT for 10+ years - NO MORE.

title: No Schedule D for 2014
content: I almost bought TT Deluxe like I do every year. Then I saw all the 1-star reviews. My taxes are not complex, but I do need Schd D and I am not paying $90 to get it. I'll follow the advice of other reviewers and switch to H&R Block for 2014.

title: TurboTax Delux removes critical functionality from their product by removing the Schedule D.
content: Thank you to all the reviewers who alerted me to the changes in TurboTax Delux this year. I have been using Turbo Tax for many years - started with the old Parsons version. Many of us will require the schedule D functionality and I find it hard to believe the folks at Intuit would make this kind of money hungry decision. I hope many of the other loyal users will look for alternatives. I, for one, will give H&R Block a shot this year. Very poor marketing Intuit. I wonder what alternatives for Quicken, which I have used for over 10 years, might be out there?

title: No loyalty. Period.
content: As somebody who is resistant to change, I dread what must be done. Unfortunately, TT deluxe was purchased by a household member this week with no knowledge of the 2014 limitations. Fortunately, it has not been opened, so it can be returned. I even had no idea until this morning. I wasn't aware of the buzz until tonight. I will acknowledge that I thrive on routine. I thrive on planning. I like status quo. I have been using TT since at least 1997, it has been like a well worn path that I can fly along confidently. But this weekend I will be purchasing HRB. I was not even aware of the TT changes until I received the email from TT. I am not exaggerating when I say that I was numb. It was partially due to the change, and partially due to how it was handled. By the time I was done reading, I was checking the bottom of my shoes because something smelled awful. Dishonesty on top of deceit, insult added to injury. The attempted spin was so incredulous, that's what made me numb, that somebody would think I was that ignorant. I suspect that those using Deluxe for the schedules are more likely to be able to afford the additional cost, and less likely to have time to re-do their filing...especially after entering all of their information. As unscrupulous as it is, it was a very slick move. I work for a software company, in charge of development. I have to think of how to improve the software, I have to evaluate suggestions from customers, and integrate these, so that the software can evolve to keep up with present times. If I were to remove an integral function of the software, and tell customers that this is now only available for an additional fee, I am pretty sure that I would lose my job. Do I WANT to switch to HRB? No. But after reading about their offer of free software to TT purchasers, I realized that they really want customers. Hopefully a business that is willing to give away software to acquire new customers will be a business that will make an effort to keep customers. I'm sure that using different software will be cumbersome. But next year, it will be easier, and the year after that, even more so. HRB, stay loyal to me, and I will reply in kind! I did read that if I called them and kept pressing for a free upgrade, that I would get it, but if I had time to jump through hoops, I might as well file taxes manually.

title: Intuit needs to learn how not to damage customer loyalty.
content: If I could give zero stars to this version I would do so, primarily because of Intuit's attitude toward its customers. I have used Turbo Tax Deluxe for more than 20 years. It has always had Schedule D. Yesterday when I started to do my taxes I discovered that Schedule D is missing. Of course, for another $30 I can get that schedule. So, basically my software is useless to me unless I accept their bait-and-switch tactic. They have a support phone number but good luck getting past the music. This is poor way to treat loyal customers. I would sooner throw away the software and switch to H&R Block then reward this kind of behavior. Post-script: To be fair, after waiting on the phone for about 30 minutes, I got through to a Turbo Tax agent who had undoubtedly heard versions of my complaint many, many times before I called. She was polite and efficient. She determined what forms I need and upgraded my software to Home and Business at no charge. I told her about the second program I bought for my daughter, who will have the same problem, and the agent promised to send me a free upgrade on a new disc. Clearly, Intuit is feeling the heat. If the complexities of the tax code required an increase in the price of the Deluxe addition I could understand an increase in the price. But that is not what Intuit did. We will see what they do next year as to whether I will stay with Turbo Tax or switch.

title: avoid intuit until they become sane again
content: I've used TTax since the olde days of floppy disks. every year they "improved" the interface and made me a learn a new one. OK. But now I see that they are splitting off sections of the return and making you pay more if you do such common items as own stock, or do a small business (aka schedule C). After tearing my hair out reading their info both on amazon and at the intuit site I finally broke down and called them. All I wanted to know was if I could access schedule C through the 'forms' tab on either deluxe or premier. Sadly for their operator I don't think anyone had ever trained her anything about the product or tax software. IN theory I could get access to a hobbled down version of schedule C to be used for "minimal" income. What is minimal I asked?> $5, $50, $500, $5,000? She did not know. I asked for a supervisor. She checked and of course no one could talk to me but the supervisor did not know either. I pointed out that schedule C is a standard 4 page form everyone uses. If they do the code for it for their expensive version (which used to be included in the simple version), they have to Pay someone extra to write the code to hamper it- but then they charge less for a product that cost them more to make. I have never seen a company that wants to go out of business the war Intuit does. The money they spend on trying to explain all the differences between versions must be immense, yet they continue to produce a watered down product, charge us more for it, and drive away customers. Does the CEO have a clue as to what is going on? Or does he just want a solid gold helicopter before the company crashes and burns? So after my request for info, and then my complaint, she says she will just give me the expensive version for free (rather than find out the answer). She says next time I log on to my intuit account I can download it. Guess what?!?! Yep. its not there.

title: Invest In Competator's Stock!
content: I believe now is a good time to invest in another tax software company.

title: Even the solution to their screw up is pathetic
content: Might as well voice my disappointment to this company's greediness. I have been using this program for way too many years. Even the solution they came up is pathetic. $25 rebate, only after you spend more money and after you file your taxes. See you later intuit.

title: Great product; sleazy company
content: TurboTax makes a great product and then cripples it by removing a key feature in the Deluxe edition so that you have to buy the Premier edition. Then their advocate tells you they are doing you a favor because people were confused last year and they labored over this decision for 5 years before deciding to screw the customer.. Do you remember a few years ago when they removed the ability to print more than one tax return? Great product; sleazy company trying to maximize profit.

title: Good by Turbo Tax - I have been a loyal ...
content: Good by Turbo Tax - I have been a loyal customer for more than 20 years. During this time frame, I have watched as Intuit continually reduced product capabilities while increasing price with no value add. Like so many others, I will explore competitive products this year. The money I save this year will fund the cost of your competitors products for the next two years!

title: No Schedule D in Deluxe? Goodbye to TurboTax
content: I just learned that TurboTax has dropped the capability to do Schedule D (Capital Gains) from its Deluxe version. I've been a Turbotax user for 20+ years, but it's now time for me to go elsewhere. I won't pay the price for the Premier version. Intuit apparently needs to lose some business so they'll feel consumer pressure and stop their price gouging practices.

title: Annoying software
content: The program is currently forcing me to either answer 1) upgrade me or 2) I don't have business income. I DO have business income (which it knows because I've already entered some), but I just want to enter a d%$m 1099-MISC without going through the upgrade at this moment. I detest it when software won't let me do what I'm trying to do.

title: Turbotax just lost another loyal customer...
content: I have used TT for at least 15 years, since the floppy disk days. I never looked at another option as I always felt that they were a stand-up company and their Deluxe version always accomodated my pretty basic income, expense, and investment needs. Every year I get e-mail from them wanting me to buy their product. If they had any desire for customer retention they would have sent an e-mail telling us that they had removed critical funtionality that many of us had come to expect. They did not. Their e-mail simply says: "The interview support for certain tax situations in our TurboTax products has changed. Before you choose a product, we suggest you make sure it's right for your specific tax needs. See product comparisons to find out more." In other words, Caveat Emptor, or were gonna stick it to you and it's your fault if you fall for our ploy and deception. My loyalty has eneded, and today I ordered H&R Block. TT will never get another dime from me, and more importantly (or obviously not to them) I will never recommend them again to anyone. H&R Block: half the price, imports my TT return from last year, imports from my financial institutions, five free federal e-files, and, did I mention, half the price?

title: bait and switch
content: This was my first time using Turbo Tax and I was reluctant to use it when reading the reviews but after hearing a friend praise the software, I decided to give it a try. I downloaded the software after purchasing it on Amazon and immediately began the process. Let me first say that it is immensley user friendly. It honestly guides the user through the questions and I think it's great for anyone who becomes overwhelmed with filing their taxes. I also enjoyed the ticker at the top that estimates your refund/payment and changes as you enter new information. At the end of the process when I was about to efile my return, I was given a bill for $54.98 with the charges of: Turbo Tax Virginia State E-file Fee $19.99 Refund Processing Service Fee $34.99 I just want to ask what was the $39 that I originally paid for? I get it that everyone looks for opportunities to upsell but I really feel taken advantage of. I purchased a product that states efile is included... if it's included there shouldn't have been a refund processing service fee. Please be more forthcoming with the price. Update: I called to ask what the $34.99 charge listed as Refund Processing Fee was for and was told that I choose to pay the $19.99 Virginia State E-File Fee from my refund versus paying it with a credit card and that is the reason for the charge. I said that I understand but I didn't see an explanation for this when I made the decision; if I would have known that paying with a credit card would have been free of extra charges versus an extra charge for paying from the return, I would have gladly paid with a credit card. He said that was a common problem that people had. I'm not sure if the problem is due to my ignorance but I really think that they made everything so well explained throughout the process of filing, I am sure they could have done a better job of explaining this. I learned my lesson I hope others avoid this mistake and hope that Turbo Tax makes it better understood on their next version.

title: Beware TurboTax Users - Radical changes on the feature set supported by TurboTax Deluxe 2014
content: Completely disappointed. In the 2013 Deluxe Edition of TurboTax there were no problems with Schedule D. Without notice Intuit is now forcing us to upgrade to Premier for additional $30. I guess that after 15+ years of loyalty to TurboTax, it is now time to look for alternatives. Just to be clear, this is not related to the additional $30, it is related to Intuit making radical changes on the way their software works; what used to work in the last 15+ years now requires additional money to work.

title: Seriously Intuit?
content: Logged in to make my annual TT purchase. Now evaluating other products. Simply put if the product carries the same name as the previous product it should contain the same functionality. I've see the VP state the chart shows the difference, the chart I found shows that Deluxe includes Schedule C but I'll admit there is an asterisk. Although I never found what the asterisk meant but I am sure we all know what it means now. Seperating it out into more products takes an already confusing process for a lot of your customers and makes it even more confusing. Most cutomers choose TT for simplicity and paid for the version they have used for years, changing the core versions means simply if taxes are not confusing enough let TT confuse you even more. Unless TT makes an about face and fixes this before I find another product I as well am done with Intuit.

title: I like others am disappointed with Intuits decision to remove functionality ...
content: I like others am disappointed with Intuits decision to remove functionality and their disingenuous attitude. I look forward to reading in the months to come that Bob Meighan is out of a job for his poor decisions and poor treatment of long time customers.

title: There are better options out there and I'll be moving to one ...
content: I wanted to also lambaste Intuit for these transitions. In a year when many people will be suffering and owing, adding further premiums to services seems unreasonable. The ACA will make it difficult enough for those operating on 1099 forms as it is, to add on a bogus usage tax to a software that remains largely unchanged year over year deserves the shaming it gets... There are better options out there and I'll be moving to one of them.

title: I have used TurboTax for years and been very happy with it
content: I have used TurboTax for years and been very happy with it. This year is a complete rip-off, a case of bait and switch. The Deluxe version was always very satisfactory in prior years, but this year TurboTax wants another $40 is order to access the simple forms that I need and always had access to before. The H R Block software now appears to be a far better value, and I expect I will be using that in the future.

title: You've lost a loyal Turbo Tax customer. For $630 ...
content: You've lost a loyal Turbo Tax customer. For $630 of farm rental income, you're charging me an additional $30 to upgrade to Premier in order to complete my return due to your changes in the forms included in Deluxe. I've used Turbo Tax since 1995. Assuming the Deluxe version would cover my needs as it always has, I purchased without reading the reviews, big mistake, I'm done with you. Can't give it a 0 or I would. You've deceived your loyal followers.

title: After 15 years, farewell TurboTax.
content: I am very glad I happened upon the Prime TurboTax offer, which led me to these reviews. I had not known about Intuit's removal of Schedule D from the Deluxe version and would have purchased automatically based on my previous loyalty to their product. H&R Block is now offering free software to anyone who has already purchased TT2014, btw: http://www.marketwatch.com/story/hr-block-offers-free-software-to-turbotax-users-2015-01-12.Terrible move, Intuit.

title: Scam
content: Bait and switch this year. Imagine what next year will bring.

title: H&R Block, here I come
content: Don't *ever* remove existing functionality unless it's obsolete or you can replace it with something better at the same price point. Ignore this and expect to lose customers and goodwill. I have been a TurboTax user since at least 1994. I need investment filing and I haven't yet purchased TurboTax for 2014. If I do, there is no rebate for me -- I will have to pay $90. I am certainly not going to purchase the Deluxe version and then jump through hoops to request a refund. And 2015 pricing will be (at least) $90, anyway. H&R Block is 1/2 the price, includes investments, imports TurboTax returns, and apparently values their customers more than Intuit. Consumers need to vote with their dollars -- H&R Block, here I come. Once I make the switch, I don't expect I'll be coming back.

title: like the majority of you
content: Thanks to all of the other long time TT customers who took the time to submit their opinions. After browsing a sample of the reviews, I, like the majority of you, will be dumping TT and trying out H & R Block software this year. Maybe TT is having problems and can't survive without gouging more money from their customer base. If they are, they are doomed anyway, because most customers will switch software or take their business to a tax professional before they buy in to TT's new price structure. By the way, having designed considerable hardware and some software along the way to retirement, I feel qualified to submit that TT most likely designed the FULL version first, and then had to spend more design time to back out features to produce the second CRIPPLED version. From that point, the cost of reproducing the CDs and packaging for either version was the same. Like most of the reviewer's opinions surmise, the whole scenario was probably just another bone-headed corporate decision to increase income. If it was, it is certainly seems to be backfiring. Adios TurboTax. Don C.

title: wasted half hours doing tax
content: One big scam, wasted half hours doing tax, then suddenly tell me if I want to keep those deduction, I have to pay extra. Never again.

title: BEWARE !!
content: BEWARE !! Turbo has stripped out all it's old forms and is gouging the consumer. I bought their Deluxe and it is a rip off !! Does anyone know of another software that will work with my old returns ? TURBO may have just tanked as a corporation.

title: Went from great to garbage
content: This product went from great to garbage.Intuit no longer links your data on its server to their software so when you buy the download you must start from scratch. As a 10+ year user this stupid. A user should not have to enter information that has been stored for years. The instructions claim you can import a copy of last year's return but didn't work. Don't even bother this is CRAP!!!!!!!!!! Plus they charge you an additional $19.99 to file your state return.

title: Do the Math
content: Let's do the math. First, TurboTax cripples Deluxe to force loyal repeat customers to upgrade to, at least, Premiere at an upfront cost of $30. Then, after the peasants revolt, they promise to rebate $25 after a return is filed. It actually costs TurboTax essentially nothing to provide the upgrade download, so they immediately pocket at least $5 more from the customers they have previously insulted. It's at least $5 more because it is easy to complicate any rebate program enough so that most people never actually collect it. It would be interesting to see how those numbers end up. In addition, they know that by forcing a Federal filing before allowing the rebate, they have an excellent change of collecting a state e-file fee of another $20 dollars. Again, this costs TurboTax almost nothing, so most of that money goes straight to the bottom line. With H&R Block offering their equivalent software free to the victims of this charade, it's hard to justify trusting Intuit's clueless management with my financial data, let alone pouring even $1 more into their coffers.

title: Hey Turbotax, I just bought H&R blocks software. ...
content: Hey Turbotax, I just bought H&R blocks software. I buy the tax software as a convince to prepare taxes. By charging $100 for the version I would need, after I have been with TT since the DOS days, I couldn't take your gouging anymore. Adios.

title: Goodbye Turbotax
content: I have been using Turbotax for 14 years straight, always using the schedule D with a few stock sales. Now I am forced to pay twice the price for the Premier Edition? No sorry. Glad I read the reviews, pfew ! And I am determined to switch to H&R block.

title: Flee while you can. TTAX has been taken over by thieves.
content: Yes I have been a loyal customer since 1989 with Turbo Tax. When I first started using tax software there was something called truth in advertising. It would clearly say on the box what forms the program had and what it was capable of doing. Over the years I have had several issues with using TurboTax all of which fell of deaf ears. In the earlier years my chief complaint was that they kept changing the user interface; actually that continues to this day. Now add on the problem that they put advertising right in your program so you have to continually be pimped to upgrade your product, which they will happily do so for a fee. This year after finding out that the Deluxe no longer has Schedule D and with all my issues I had last year using your product I decided to jump ship before TurboTax went out to sea. I have heard that the H & R Block product will import my tax data. I am not to happy about having to jump ship, and frankly wish that I had done it sooner with the shabby product that TTAX.EXE has become. Ever since TTAX was taken over by Intuit years ago the product has been less functional and more commercial. It is sad that we have to leave a product that we used to trust. Maybe just maybe Intuit will get the message and produce a clean product next year; get rid of their advertising; and tell us what is under the hood. There truly is no way anymore to tell just what the various versions of TTAX are capable of doing prior to purchase. Also as H & R Block was smart enough to have import of TTAX data. INTUIT AFTER FIXING YOUR CRIPPLED PRODUCT YOU MAY WANT TO HAVE IMPORT OF H&RBLOCK DATA as many of us have left your shores. Lastly TAXES are stressful enough without having to worry if your software is up to the job, or that your software company is going to nickel and dime you for "UPGRADES" that are nothing more than putting back what they have taken out from last years product. Okay enough of my rambling... Hopefully INTUIT next year people will like you again.

title: Forcing you to upgrade from Premier to Home and Business ...
content: Forcing you to upgrade from Premier to Home and Business is a ripoff. Dishonest advertising and shabby treatment of long time customers.

title: Refuges to be gouged --buy another product in protest!
content: Shame on turbotax for suddenly denying a simple feature of importing investment info and forcing millions of customers to buy a "premiere" version instead of the deluxe version they used for years. This has caused unnecessary aggravation to these customers, and I for one will start looking at other products next year after having used this product for years. Send Intuit a message: Refuse to be gouged, and buy another product rather than rewarding them for this rip off move. UPDATED March 17, 2015 I tried to upgrade this with the promised "free" upgrade but noticed I would have to pay for it! I tried that because the instructions for "Deluxe" are pitifully inadequate. Next year I am planning to research the alternatives to this product.

title: Missing Schedules, don't buy.
content: While I could live without the missing Schedule C, the removal of Schedule D and E from the Deluxe version is a major issue for me. So after 16 years of using TurboTax, I will finally switch. Turns out that the same functionality that I used to enjoy with TT is available with HR Block's tax prep. software at considerably less $$.

title: The Basic Version Used to Do Investements
content: I've used the Basic version of TT for many years and it had always done Schedule Ds. So they actually made the Schedule D folks jump 2 versions not just one. I'm guessing their marketing made many folks think the original Basic version did not do Investments as no one seems to be complaining about that.

title: Wow, I'm glad I checked the reviews before making my annual knee jerk purchase of TT Deluxe.
content: Removing Schedule D and imports so you can bait and switch loyal customers seems a little short sighted. After 20 years of Turbotax I guess I will be trying H&R Block. Intuits explanation that "we improved the product by removing features and raising the price" is insulting and a little Orwellian.

title: Poor decision
content: Like many others who have been using TurboTax for many years, I am extremely disappointed with the changes this year. They should have at least kept Schedule D in the Deluxe version. I haven't decided if I will use TurboTax for 2014 yet, but I think it is still unacceptable how they are taking advantage of customers who have been loyal to them for years. I think this move will cost Intuit in the long run and that's too bad.

title: What was Intuit thinking!!!
content: I really appreciate the reviews detailing the change from previous years' version of Deluxe. I find it hard to believe that Intuit actually thought this was a good move. Reputation is everything in business and Intuit really did a job on theirs. I have used Turbo Tax for over a decade (I don't remember when I first started but it was in the 1990s). Guess I will be switching to H&R Block's version. And once I switch I won't be back.

title: What a Stupid Marketing Decision!
content: Too bad. I have used Turbo Tax for over 15 years. No Schedule C means I am going to move on to try a competitor's product. H&R Block is looking pretty good. I guess Intuit has no respect for their loyal customers. Perhaps I will also re-evaluate my use of Quicken.

title: scam on price.
content: Was shocked to find out the turbo tax scam. I got in there today with normal version i have been buying for years. Had to cough up another 40 bucks. Scam. Do not buy. Last year for me.

title: TTax removed schedule C and D
content: Just adding my opinion on this change. The descriptions on the back of the box were always confusing, as the higher levels of the product would offer extra assistance with businesses and investments, but yet the basic versions still handled them well. I have been using Turbo Tax since the 90's and like the basic deluxe version - it always worked fine for businesses and investments - NO MORE! They have removed it forcing customers to upgrade or look at alternatives. After completing my taxes with H&R Block software, I am revising my rating of TTax from 1 star to 4. I rated H&R Block software a 1. Although I was very disappointed with the way Quicken handled the TTax changes this year, I have to say that I used TTax for years for a reason - the questions were clear, additional info was readily available, and the software accurately calculated information. I can't say the same for H&R Block and if I had not caught the mistakes I made due to unclear questions or that the software itself made, it would have cost me far more than the price difference between these programs. Next year I will be buying TTax

title: It's obvious why Intuit really stripped functionality out of the ...
content: It's obvious why Intuit really stripped functionality out of the "Deluxe" edition while not reducing the price. They thought they could get away with it! Kudos to everyone who is proving them wrong. I am joining you. Sayonara, Turbotax!

title: TurboTax Deluxe SUCKS. I will never use an Intuit product again.
content: I have been using TurboTax since 1990 ans have never experienced any significant problems with TT Deluxe. However, that has changed this year! I bought TT Deluxe and started my tax return. About half way through with my taxes I discovered that TT Deluxe could not produce a 1099-Q or a 1099-R. I had a couple of deadlines I needed to meet, namely: ** Submitting the FAFSA for Student Financial Aid ** Submitting my 2014 Taxes to the IRS in a timely basis beat others to the gate for Financial aid. TurboTax has made an egregious error and their response to Purchasers of TurboTax Deluxe is anemic. I will never buy another TurboTax product again. I am now on my way to an H&R Block appointment so they can complete my 2014 tax filing and put the TT Deluxe debacle behind me.

title: Not this year
content: I've purchased TurboTax I believe every year since the company was founded. This year I'll go with another product because of the reduced feature set in TurboTax Deluxe. It isn't the money, it's the way customers are being treated that will cause me to make this change. The tax software business is mature. I guess to grow the bottom line at Intuit and thus have the executives make their bonuses, some features have been removed from the Deluxe version and are only available in Premium version. It is a hidden price increase, although I guess not very well hidden based on the response here on Amazon. TurboTax has been an acceptable, but not great product. It's best if you know how to do your taxes and use the program for convenience and to avoid careless mistakes. That's why I purchased it over the years. The fact that current versions won't open old returns (MS Word, Excel and numerous other programs open old documents), the initial screen that almost demands personal data for marketing purposes, and the requirement to constantly load updates (likely bug fixes) when the program is run, among other items, eliminate the product from A-team status.

title: The Minnesota Tax Department will not accept the return produced ...
content: The Minnesota Tax Department will not accept the return produced by Turbo Tax. I reside in Minnesota. This product has no use for me. Please refund the purchase - about $80.00.

title: What happened to the DELUX in TT Delux!
content: Their new effort to earn more money by making DELUX no so DELUX is unbelievable from such a well know company. The letter which explains the change is BS. They are abusing their market position to get more $$ from their loyal users. Since I have already have bought 2014 I will upgrade, but there are other providers that can import from TT, so this is my last year!

title: I'm a long time TurboTax Deluxe user. With this ...
content: I'm a long time TurboTax Deluxe user. With this years removal of Schedule C, D and E from Deluxe, I ordered H&R Block Home & Business instead for a very competitive price. The problem I experienced was H&R Block Home can not import TurboTax files, search "deluxe crashes when import last year's taxes from turbotax". I ended up hand.copying data from TurboTax 2013 into H&R Block Home.

title: Intuit's New Coke Moment
content: I have been a user of TurbTax for more than 20 years. This will be the last year I use it. Almost every modification TurboTax has done over the years made it less and less consumer friendly. In a few of those years, the changes were very problematic. This year's mods, though, take the cake for being 100% corporate, self-serving, revenue driven crap. There is not a single feature of the new lineup that is customer driven. The new packaging even avoids any mention of whether filings (federal OR state) are free. Hell, there is even no mention of whether the software will even DO filings. That makes me wonder just what Intuit is trying to tee up for the future. If you are new to the use of tax preparation software, do yourself a huge favor and look at one of the other providers. After this year, Intuit will die a slow death.

title: Use the 60-Day Money Back Guarantee!!!
content: Returning my copy under the money back guarantee.

title: 50% off list price sale on turbotax ending January 26th
content: There is a 50% off list price sale on turbotax ending January 26th. Do a google search on "Intuit is running a special 50% off email promotion" to find a Forbes article by Janet Novack. In the 4th paragraph click on the word "link" to go to the sale page. Then later in the article is the link to get a free version of H&R Block's Deluxe that is equivalent to Turbotax Premier. I have already downloaded the free version of TaxAct. My plan is to try all three and see if they do what is needed and go with the lowest cost that works for me in the future. Thanks Turbotax for this boneheaded move that finally spurred me to check the competition!

title: Wow, what a stealth and slimy way to attempt ...
content: Wow, what a stealthy and slimy way to attempt to get a substantial price increase. However, being both a TurboTax and QuickBooks user I guess I should not be surprised by anything unseemly done by Intuit. Hello H&R Block.

title: Avoid at all cost - even free.
content: Imagine you always buy XYZ gallon of milk. It's bad enough that XYZ decided to give you only 3 quarts in the same container and same price, it's downright fraud if they continue to use the name "gallon of milk". Turbo tax, you are not cute, you are not smart, you are not sneaky, you are blatantly and unequivocally trying to trick your customers (specifically, customers who have bought from you before) into buying your products by insisting on using the same naming conventions but removing key features. Never buying from turbotax or Intuit again, guaranteed. I vote with my feet, charge all you want.

title: Deal with Intuit at your peril
content: Intuit management is simply dishonest! They quietly removed needed features from TurboTax Deluxe, and then charged you extra when you discovered their 'bait and switch' tactic. Now the Intuit president has apologized. Only because of the incredible negative feed back that the president personally received. Last I checked, TurboTax only had a rating of 1.3 out of 5 here on Amazon. The people at mouseprint.org also did a great job of exposing their dishonesty. Deal with Intuit at your peril. They've proven themselves to be cheaters. Look for a quiet fee hike or some other money grab.

title: Excellent move by turbotax to offer free upgrade to Premier ...
content: Excellent move by turbotax to offer free upgrade to Premier for those customers who bought deluxe last year. By doing this, they set right the mistake they did earlier. Smooth/easy process to upgrade. Intuit - You did the right thing and I am back as your customer Thanks

title: come up with ANYTHING where you give the consumer what they pay for and leave it at that and not poke them with a stick and hold
content: Video games, paying by phone, cable companies, "convenience fees" and now turbo tax...just add to the list of people trying to make more money by screwing the consumer rather than giving an honest product for an honest buck. I've said it before and I'll say it again, come up with ANYTHING where you give the consumer what they pay for and leave it at that and not poke them with a stick and hold a carrot in front of them like the above mentioned (and now turbo tax by eliminating critical areas you've had for years but now you pay "extra" for) and you'll have a monopoly on the world. Hopefully H&R moves in and gives you your money's worth, then by the time they start nickel-and-diming you, turbotax will have taken suck a hit that they've decided to straighten this crap out. Their excuse for exclusion is "to support the availability of the program" or so I've read...that's absolutely ridiculous.

title: Bait and Switch Pure and Simple
content: If this bait-and-switch isn't consumer fraud, it should be. Intuit needs to give and publicize free upgrade to every user, not just those who call to complain.

title: The rep was very nice when I said that I needed a work around ...
content: I hadn't heard of the software change for TurboTax. I was surprised when I fired it up the other day and, not very far into the guided help, a blocking screen came up and said I needed to upgrade for $30 just to enter my dividend information. For an hour I tried to figure out why that was happening and then I called the help line. I explained that if such a big change was included in the product that it should be more clearly explained on the marketing and descriptive info for the product. In my case, I had bought the physical disk, opened it, and would be unable to take it back for a refund. The rep was very nice when I said that I needed a work around so that I could complete an estimate for my taxes. My message to him and to INTUIT is "Shame on you for not clearly stating the changes you have put in place." And to read that INTUIT stilI is claiming you can add these dividends etc, sure, if you want to only fill out the forms for EVERYTHING on your taxes, you could do that, but you can't use the guided program unless you say you don't have any stocks or bonds. And then when you add them in later.... how does the review handle all that??? I guess next year I will have to do some extra homework before I decide what to buy....

title: I have used TurboTax for many years. I am ...
content: I have used TurboTax for many years. I am a lawyer with a fairly strong tax background, so I have always used the forms method by preference. So I never needed the more expensive versions. But now that I learn that it won't even do a consistency check with Schedules C, D or E in the Deluxe version, it's time to change. Goodbye, Intuit.

title: Turbo tax is a JOKE the state print for ohio ...
content: Turbo tax is a JOKE the state print for ohio to mail in is not ready 3 different dates so far OR you can E-file for $19.99 now! Burn in Hell Turbo tax!

title: Dear Turbotax VP who replied to one of the reviews - I Switched over to H&RBlock Delux for this year... and so have many others!
content: Have been using turbotax for 6+ years, and this year, forced to switch to HR Block delux due to the removal of functionality and ugly extortion by TT.

title: I'm done with Turbo Tax - good riddance!
content: The 2014 Turbo Tax Deluxe bait-and-switch was downright sleazy and was only rivaled by Mr. Goodarzi's "apology" email letter. Fortunately, I received the letter prior to ordering my tax software this year and it made me researched before I blindly ordered Turbo Tax Deluxe again. I didn't fall for Intuit's $25 rebate gimmick to upgrade to premier, which would likely keep me on their inflated price Premier product in future years. I made the switch to H&R Block Deluxe this year, and so far it has worked great and even imported my Turbo Tax files from 2013. It will take a lot for me to even consider using Turbo Tax or even another Intuit product again, and if I do, it will be with great skepticism.

title: Turbo Tax easy to replace
content: I agree with all of the negative comments already made. I just purchased H&R Block's Deluxe for 40% lower than Turbo Tax's useless Deluxe product and was able to immediately download my prior Turbo Tax files.

title: So far the H&R product looks and behaves just like TurboTax Deluxe
content: I came to the Amazon site to buy my Deluxe TurboTax, having heard that Intuit/Turbo Tax had decided that their attempts to gouge customers was backfiring, and thus decided to replace the forms that TurboTax Deluxe had always included. However, after reading comments about the H&R Block Tax software I decided to not buy TurboTax Deluxe but by the H&R product instead from Amazon. I download the software, installed it from Amazon without issue. I imported my 2013 TurboTax Deluxe tax file without issue, just as I had done with TurboTax. So far the H&R product looks and behaves just like TurboTax Deluxe. So I think I have been paying too much to do my taxes over the years and will now ditch TurboTax Deluxe in favor of H&R Block. Next, I am going to find a replacement product for Quicken/Intuit, which forces you to buy a new version by cutting off access to data downloads every 3 or so years. Now I am a happy H&R Block customer and am saving money!

title: SwitchToBlock
content: I will be taking up H&R Block on their free software offer: google SwitchToBlock for details.

title: I have not purchased TT this year and like many others need the full schedule D features with ...
content: I have not purchased TT this year and like many others need the full schedule D features with e-file. I really appreciate all of you that took the time to post and provide very valuable information about the short comings of TT Deluxe. I too have been using TT Deluxe for 15 + years and have been very pleased with the feature/functionality. I am really glad I decided to read the posts before I purchased this year. I read over 100 and while I understand some of the points by Intuit I believe that it would be better to create another version to remove functionality and leave your most POPULAR product alone. Or as many have pointed out, why not IMPROVE your most popular product rather than diminish it. I am not sure what I will do but I can tell you that I would have been very disappointed and upset had I purchased the TT Deluxe and found out about the schedule D issues when I went to file. I realize that it is difficult to change popular products and communicate these changes in a positive way. No one reads the fine print anymore. That's why you should leave the features in Deluxe and create another lower price version.

title: 2014 Deluxe is not same as 2013 Deluxe version
content: Been a loyal turbo tax customer for years. Went to do my taxes and found that I need to upgrade to do a schedule E. I couldn't believe this because last year's deluxe which I purchased was fine for my situation. When I took out the 2013 package and compared to 2014, the comparison of turbo tax versions on the back was exactly the same. In other words 2013 deluxe like 2014 deluxe didn't actually have a check mark next to Investment properties but they always supported them in the past. I don't paying more I just can't stand when I'm ready to do my taxes I find out that Intuit decided to change the rules and make me pay another $25 to do my taxes. I stayed with turbo tax because of the ease of transfer but this is my last year.

title: Karma
content: Posting one star to help prove a point. You screw your customers and they'll screw you.

title: Long time TurboTax user who made the jump to H & R Block
content: I have used TurboTax and Quicken for over 10 years. I believe the products are great and have been very useful to me over the years. The problem is the company and it's greed. This year with the removal of features but keeping the price the same or increasing it was the last straw for me. The fact that they are trying to lobby for laws that would keep the tax code complex and expensive (see below for more info) lets me know they do not have my best interests in mind. The fact that in Quicken they force you to upgrade every several years or they will disable parts of your program lets me know they are trying to get every penny possible out of me and will go to extremes to do it. What software company goes into your old program and disables parts of it to force you to upgrade? Enough ranting... So I had a lot of data with TurboTax and I was nervous it wouldn't transfer over to another company. Well I read great reviews from other former TurboTax users when they used H&R block. So I took the dive and it worked very smoothly and quickly. It was like I never even switched programs. I'm so glad I switched and am finally free of a company that I feel is trying to bully me out of my money. I don't even care if Turbotax gets desperate and gives the software away for free at this point. I'm glad to be finally free of them and their nasty surprises. Now I just have to find an alternative to quicken before they disable my software. From Wikipedia: Opposition to return-free filing Intuit, the owner of TurboTax, spent more than $11 million on federal lobbying between 2008 and 2012. Intuit "opposes IRS government tax preparation," particularly allowing taxpayers to file pre-filled returns for free, in a system similar to the established ReadyReturn service in Califronia. The company also lobbied on bills in 2007 and 2011 that would have barred the Treasury Department, which includes the IRS, from initiating return-free filing. An Intuit spokeswoman said in early 2013 that "Like many other companies, Intuit actively participates in the political process." She said that return-free filing had "implications for accuracy and fairness in taxation."[18][19] In its 2012 Form 10-K, Intuit said that "We anticipate that governmental encroachment at both the federal and state levels may present a continued competitive threat to our business for the foreseeable future."[18]

title: How to destroy 20 years worth of reputation!
content: Like many others here who have used TT Deluxe &/or Macintax for 20 years, I am disgusted and appalled by Intuit's destruction and castration of TT Deluxe to force us to use unnecessary more expensive versions of Turbo Tax by eliminating Schedules C,D & E & 8949 from TT Deluxe. It's bad enough that they don't include the questions in their question and answer version, but they do not allow us to fill out these forms directly as many of us prefer to do and often do using the IRS.com forms for special cases. I can download TT deluxe for free from Vanguard and have done so and have seen their "Do Not File" entries on the forms we wish to use. I could do my taxes for free using CCH's Tax Wise (as a AARP tax prep volunteer), but the tax history in my previous TT returns for MLPs, Form 8206 and other entries, would take much extra time and effort. The limitation excuse for Schedule C to $100 of expenses is particularly egregious. Most of the additional features for your Home & Business schedule C are totally unecessary for most small businesses which can use section 179 to eliminate the need for depreciation schedules and fill in the Schedule C income and expense line items themselves. Turbo tax marketing management, shame on you. It's no wonder you have apparently discontinued your customer focused "Inner Circle" program.

title: One Star
content: Yep, you just lost a 10+year customer.

title: Useless Deluxe version ...
content: Hamstringing the Deluxe version was a very bad move. Almost everyone I know had some form of stock transaction and so if all these folks have to buy the Premier version, what is Deluxe good for? I guess if all tax returns were simple, we all could just use the free IRS online version to file our taxes.

title: Intuit's CRIPPLING of TurboTax has lost me FOR GOOD
content: Intuit made a huge mistake in the long run. Their crippling of TurboTax Deluxe this year has not just lost me THIS year, but I've move to H&R Block FOR GOOD. They have no idea how to grow a company through good software design and customer service - instead, they resort to blatant money grabs to increase profits. It didn't work with Quicken (I dropped that years ago due to their similar strategy), and it won't work with TurboTax. As Intuit's market share declines, it will be easy to look back at this year as the reason.

title: I loved TurboTax for ease of use
content: Well, I don't have an actual review, but I have to say that after reading all the other reviews, I will not be using TurboTax Deluxe this year. It's a shame. I loved TurboTax for ease of use. If I wanted to print out forms, call for upgrades, etc., I wouldn't need TurboTax. Your reasons for change are about as lame as when Jet Blue said they were making seats smaller in the best interests of their customers. What kind of stupid customer wants less? Sorry, but you've just lost this longtime customer.

title: Update to my previous rant
content: I got a response from someone who apparently represents TurboTax and they are saying the upgrade will be free. Since I've used the deluxe version for years, I was really annoyed they would make it so you had to upgrade to the premium version just to use schedule D, especially for $30. Original rant I just purchased Turbo Tax deluxe and went to enter some sale of investments and was told I'd have to upgrade to Premier for $30. If I could return the software I would. but now I'm stuck. There was a promise of a $25 refund at some point in the future.They must think we are stupid, Why not charge $5 for the upgrade.
