Obviously they are betting a lot of people will not fill out the forms for a refund. Probably have 10 pages of forms to fill out.

title: Turbotax degraded disguised as turbotax deluxe
content: Thank you all Amazon Reviewers. Was about to get a copy of the turbotax degraded, disguised as turbotax deluxe, from Costco, so glad I check out Amazon first! Dear Intuit, if I sold just one share of stock or mutual fund, by your definition I am an INVESTOR, I will need to use Turtotax Premier because this year turbotax degraded, Oops... it's the one that you called turbotax deluxe, no longer able to handle the most simple schedule D? If my daughter got a 1099 from her after-school / weekend babysitting jobs, she will need to use Turtotax Home & Business to finish her schedule C or C-EZ? .....Oh, thank you Intuit for your explanation and justification, sorry I just don't buy them.

title: I was about to buy Turbotax Deluxe today in a ...
content: I was about to buy Turbotax Deluxe today in a Staples store, the same version I've used for over a decade, when I happened to notice that it was only the more expensive Premier version that appeared to support Schedule D along with automated imports from banks and brokers. I couldn't believe it, but my research led me here to all of the former customers similarly upset. So it is goodbye to TurboTax for me as well.

title: Intuit will never learn....
content: You'd think that Intuit would have learned a valuable lesson back in 2003 with the sneaky DRM they installed with Turbotax 2002 and all the bad press they received. I ditched Turbotax back then and went with H&R Block software but returned the following year when the DRM was removed and they allowed multiple eFiles from the same install. Here were are in 2015 and Intuit again is trying to be sneaky by removing Schedule D from the Deluxe version and force us customers to pay more for the Premier version. Guess it's time to ditch Turbotax once again since they obviously only care about the bottom line and not their loyal customers!

title: TurboTax following the Quicken path
content: Same story different day. 5 years ago I left Quicken after a decade of use as Intuit made you "upgrade" to maintain online functionality. Bought MoneyDance and have never looked back. Cutting the Intuit chord altogether after 15+years with TurboTax with their latest tactic. H&R Block here I come.

title: Good by Turbo Tax.
content: I too am a disgruntled Turbo Tax Deluxe user. Unfortunately I bought the product before reading these reviews. And yes, I did see in the product description that Premier was recommend for rental property owners. Same as it was last year and other years past. However in the past years this recommendation referred to extra hand holding and not the crippling of an entire schedule (E). It wasn't until I installed the Deluxe version and the software noted that I had filed a schedule E in the past that I was made painfully aware that I had to upgrade to premium in order to e-file with my rental income. I'll be switching to H&R Block in the future. Hint H&R Block, this seems like an opportunity to attract customer by offering a rebate to disgruntled Turbo Tax customers to apply to their tax software. I'd certainly be aboard, especially if I can import what I've already entered in Turbo Tax for 2014. Or if Turbo Tax is concerned about the majority of Turbo Tax being confused by rarely used basic schedules such as D and E, they can offer the option to release these basic schedules without the hand holding by allowing the user to request them free of charge. I don't see how that would be any more confusing than asking the users to pay 30 more dollars as well.

title: TurboTax Gouge / H&R Blocks Gain
content: I have been a TurboTax User for at least 10 years. Due to the changes made for 2014, I will be switching to H&R Block's software.

title: Good by Turbo Tax
content: Intuit just lost my business.....been using their software for so many years. Can no longer file my self employment taxes and Schedule C with the Deluxe version....they want to tack on additional fees to enable what was included for years. Good by Turbo Tax, hello H&R Block. Absolutely furious!!!!!

title: To not include schedule E in a tax package like this is absurd and they are going to pay ...
content: To not include schedule E in a tax package like this is absurd and they are going to pay a big price obviously by the reviews.

title: 15 Year Customer Lost for good.
content: I will not be held hostage or support unethical means of profit generation. This loyal customer will NOT BE BACK.....EVER.

title: Angry and Disappointed
content: Sayonara, TurboTax! I have been a long time user (I began using TurboTax when it was acquired by Intuit). But this fiasco of bait and switch is too much for this gal to take. How can you trust a company who engages in such practices? Let alone, trusting said company to assist incompleting tax returns. If I wanted to complete downloaded forms and submit them, I could go to the IRS website and save the expense of TurboTax. While I will be the first to try some thing new, as all things must change, I don't find this new or innovative. In fact I found this more work because I had to re-input all information instead of just confirming last years information. Whoever is responsible for "this update" needs to be shown the exit sign before more damage is done to TurboTax and Intuit! Maybe next year...

title: enough is enough
content: Schedule D was in the Basic version in 2013. Now TT moved it 2 levels up to Premier version. Their VP kept saying they dropped the price of the Basic version. Big deal!, but it is useless to me even offering for free. Although I have been using TT for a long time, making the change to use H&R and importing TT data is surprisingly easy and straightforward. Plus H&R costs less than $20. TT shall wake up and understand their product is replaceable. Customers can stay if the price is OK but always ready to switch. Bye-bye TT.

title: Avoid the download version especially -- no refunds
content: Just another sucker who thought he was buying the new version of the program I've used since forever. But no, to get the functionality of last year's version, they want $40 more. Avoid buying this through Amazon downloads, too, since they will not allow you to "return" it, even given what seems like fraud. In one fell swoop, Intuit and Amazon Download have both let me know my business is not wanted.

title: Pretty hair brained
content: I've got TT files dating back to 1993. The overt price gouging by INTUIT this year has given me the extra push needed to become familiar with competitive offerings. Pretty hair brained, but thanks INTUIT! UPDATE. I have completed my taxes using HR Block Tax Cut, and found it to be an acceptable substitute for TT. In some ways, it's even better. The tutorials were more succinct, and it sure seems like I got done very quickly. I am pleased to have an option for the ugly task of filing taxes. Especially since I no longer trust INTUIT as a conduit or custodian of my personal data.

title: TurboTax MESSED UP!
content: You lost a loyal customer! I've used TurboTax for the past 4 years. I'll give H&R Block a try. If you've sold one single share of stock in 2014 you are forced to buy TurboTax Premier. This was no accident and now offering a $25 refund is too late. You should give 100% of the cost back!!! I can't believe 300 people rated this product a 5 after this price gouging. Susan Godarzi (TurboTax GM) should be fired for approving this suggestion.

title: Dumb move intuit
content: I have filed with turbotax for years. With this new pricing scheme, I'm out... permanently. Will not call to ask for a "discount" on a product I have been using for years just to keep the level of service. Dumb move intuit. Bye.

title: Been a customer for over a decade buying Deluxe. ...
content: Been a customer for over a decade buying Deluxe. This year, they decide to downgrade the version without telling anyone. Halfway through my taxes it tells me I have to upgrade for another $30. Search online tells me H&R Block will give me free software if I switch.

title: I am glad i read this review before
content: Turbotax - you have lost another customer who had been using Turbo Tax for so many years. I am glad i read this review before. No schedule C/D/E in Deluxe anymore!! - really poor and the VP from Turbo Tax tries to justtfy it. Instead he looks more foolish with his silly justifications. Yes we will give you the premier this year- but next year you will have to pay more for premier.. Why didn't they just keep it the same and give a small price increase instead. I bet most self preparers (i.e old Turbo Tax users) are savy enough to see that we/they are getting the royal scrooge job..

title: Dissapointed This Year
content: Like others have said, lots of changes. If you have ANYTHING going on Schedule C, you need to upgrade, because -while this product claims to allow 1099 income and up to $100 deduction- I had a hard time with filing if I made any of the slightest changes. I guess they are putting money ahead of customer! Also, the 'free' state tax means that it is prepared free, but NOT FILED! You have to pay a $19.99 fee to efile the state tax, on top of another $30-$40 +/- fee to efile the federal return. Not too happy this go round.

title: Time To Move On!
content: I have been using Turbotax since 1990....that's 23 years. However, that has just come to an end. After reading some of the reviews, I see that I will no longer be able to use Turbotax Deluxe, and I am not going to pay the extra for Premier just so Intuit can make more money. I will switch to another vendor (probably H&R Block) this year. I also normally do my grand daughter's taxes using Turbotax, but I learned last year that, because she worked part time a couple of months in another state, we would have to buy the additional program for that state. I checked into a local tax provider, and it was cheaper for him to do it than to go the the extra expense. I am really sorry to have to do this, as I am very familiar with Turbotax, but in recent years Intuit has been pulling the same trick as many grocery manufacturers.... that is, putting less and less into the package for the same or increased cost. It has finally come to the breaking point. It is time to move on.

title: Sometimes Smart Companies do Stupid Things.
content: Same as all the rest. 20 year turbotax customer. Assumed Turbotax Deluxe could handle the most basic of tax situations - a capital gain or loss and found out that this year, I was mistaken. This is like subscribing to cable TV and finding out they don't have ESPN, or going to a restaraunt and finding out that silverware is extra, or being a New York Jet season ticket holder and finding out they don't have a quarterback or... well.. you get the point. Historians might remember that back in 2003, Intuit did something equally antagonistic towards their loyal customers, writing over the boot partition of a hard drive to combat software piracy. After sales crumpled, they reversed that decision. Perhaps it will happen again. If not, H&R Block will have a great year.

title: One Star
content: downloaded the free H&R Block software and it's much better. Thanks to TurboTax for recommending H&R Block.

title: It's not Deluxe anymore since they're removed the Schedule C ...
content: It's not Deluxe anymore since they're removed the Schedule C form! Not going to pay the $40 up charge to add it.

title: RIPOFF ALERT!!
content: Quite the ripoff. The end of a longtime loyal customer. More money and features taken away in an obscure way..

title: Not the same as last year! Inferior product.
content: Brought this same version last year and 2013 was great. However, for 2014, you have to upgrade to Premier ($30+) to be able to work on the same type of return as I filed last year. Next year, it will definitely be H&R Block software

title: Sad Unexpected Downgrade
content: Many thanks for the warning about the degraded capability. The reviews have saved me money and a lot of grief.

title: They learned nothing from Obamacare, apparently
content: Unbeknownst to most, me included, TurboTax moved many of the schedules and forms that I had been using for years in "Deluxe" to the more expensive "Premier" version. They sent out a letter after hearing from so many irate customers saying that they would offer a $25 rebate after you spend $30 to upgrade. Recently, they told me over the phone that there will be a free upgrade coming out in early February due to the uproar from so many customers. We'll wait and see. They also said that they would be going back to the old functionality of Deluxe in 2015.

title: HR just as good IMO.
content: Left TT 5 years ago due to their unethical privacy practices. HR just as good IMO although I will not tell you that it's great but does do the job. TT has had a history of apparent disdain toward its users and there was an incident about five years ago that made me bail after several years of using TT. I would rather pay more than for another product to have been treated that way. I am convinced I made the right decision to leave TT about five years ago and their cooperate behavior hasn't changed after all those years. They have a right to do what they did but we have the right to give them one star ratings and go somewhere else. This reminds me when one hotel charged a guest a fine of $150 for posting a negative review on TA. You can imagine what happened to the reviews after that. The VP of whatever he does, doesn't seem to have a clue. I guess he's too much in the briar patch.

title: Too bad, their software works great
content: I have used Turbo Tax for over 20 years (see photo for proof : years 1994 - 2013) and I even kept my disks/boxes as you can see. I used if before 1994 but moved and threw the older boxes out. However with the recent problem (need to spend more $ to get the same features in Deluxe) I did not want to do it. Too bad, their software works great! Trust is hard to earn and easy to loose. Intuit's recent attempt to recover from the bad press by giving a $25 rebate still does not give me any confidence. What's next? So I switched to H&R and while i have not yet filed my taxes, the program is working well and is easy to use. It is also a bonus that the H&R version is noticeable less expensive than the turbo tax deluxe too. Amazon keeps deleting my photo so here is a link to it (if it stays?): http://s1062.photobucket.com/user/v12346/media/tt_zpsmllfowic-1.jpg.html?sort=3&o=0

title: Listen to the bad reviews.
content: I gave this product a chance because I have used it for years. BIG MISTAKE. The program gave me issues on the install once it found the updates. So I skipped the updates initially but then it redoes it before letting you do your state returns and then I was stuck in an infinite loop where it kept saying the same thing over and over and not letting me do my state form. I have requested a refund. Listen to the bad reviews.

title: REALLY!!!
content: I have been a loyal TurboTax and Quicken user since the beginning of Intuit. I buy copies of TurboxTax and Quicken every year. I need certain features in TurboTax Deluxe (Schedule C, D, etc.) and I do not want to pay more just because. I will not purchase TurboxTax this year without these features. I will switch to another product. Simple as that! Also, I will not upgrade Quicken and will look for another product!

title: Long Time User Making the Switch
content: TT lost a long time user. While I appreciate TT offering free upgrades or rebates, after reading all the reviews here weeks ago I purchased H&R Block. So, the TT offers come too late for me. Unless something crops up with the Block product I will stick with it for future years. Besides, I figure TT will stick with their new model next year and continue to raise the price. I do want to thanks all the others who posted their reviews here as it helped me to not make a bad purchase.

title: Non-Existant Tax Advice
content: Good luck getting competent help through support. Call them, and you'll get an automated response which says they will call you back... And they do, however you will only be connected to Customer Support who are only trained to help with basic questions of how to use the software.. they cannot transfer you to anyone else. There only advice was "Wait and call back the 1-800 number again." Cycle repeated.. If you think you may need to speak to a tax adviser this year, please save your time and use another tax filing solution.

title: That pretty much makes the product worthless for an ordinary filer
content: No Schedule D? That pretty much makes the product worthless for an ordinary filer. No Turbo Tax for me!

title: Just another victim of greedy Intuit
content: Had to pay to upgrade to Premier in order to file investment activity. Intuit is offering a refund for those in this situation, but I still have to go through the hassle of filing for a refund. This is may last year using TurboTax. I've previewed a number of free or similarly priced products this year and Intuit's product really isn't any better than the competition.

title: 2014 TurboTax Deluxe Travesty
content: The removal of Schedule D from TTax Deluxe is a travesty. Plus the increases of the TTax offerings across the board is a double whammy. So if I sell or buy equities or similar, I am forced to ante-up $30 + the 2014 products increase. And don't get me started on the Quicken 2013 / 2014 requirement to have an Intuit account to download or otherwise access financial accounts. For taxes, my new choice is H&R Block Tax Software 14 Deluxe + State @ $32.99 (Amazon) to include one state and e-filing. This is a descendant of the old Tax Cut. Still looking for a Quicken replacement. Intuit has lost its vision.

title: Hidden costs on top of hidden costs
content: Advertised price: Federal $0, State $0. Then I did my taxes. New price: Federal $35, State $25, bank fee to pay for it with part of my refund $35. Actual price, $95. Be honest, don't hide the costs. I got a discount on the federal, did my state using the state's website, and payed with a credit card. Final cost: $25. I don't mind paying for a product that makes my life easier. I don't like all the bs hidden costs and advertising about free this and that. I have pretty simple returns, if I didn't get it free, hardly anyone will.

title: Goodbye TurboTax... Its too little, too late.
content: I've been using TurboTax since 2002. After reading about their profit first, customers last tactics, I decided to switch to H&R Block Tax Software Deluxe. It has gotten good reviews on Amazon and you can import your previous year's TurboTax data. TurboTax is now backtracking, offering rebates and free upgrades but why did it take two whole months of angry complaints and one star reviews on Amazon? I am not comfortable giving my money to a company that seems to care so little about their customers. I ordered H&R Block Tax Software Deluxe for $30, much less than the $50 for TurboTax Deluxe with no missing schedules for investments, no filing for rebates or upgrades, and most important, no funny bait-and-switch tactics. So long TurboTax.

title: Thanks for All the Warnings!
content: I just purchased mine from Costco two days ago but will be returning it after reading everyone's comments. Like many other posters, I have been a loyal Turbo Tax user for more than a decade, maybe even close to two decades. I'll be switching over to Tax Act or H & R, which I just realize is ALOT cheaper. Thanks Intuit for letting us customers know that we have been overpaying on our tax software for years! You now have given us the incentive to make the bold move! Bye, bye Intuit!

title: I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS SOFTWARE
content: after I paid the $40.00 for the software, I had to paid $59.00 more ??????? I don't have Schedule D or C so I figure I would be ok with the deluxe version but after I finished it told me that I needed to pay $59.00???? I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS SOFTWARE!!!! I'm going to try www.taxact.com next year.

title: same aggravation as usual, for double the price.
content: Intuit figures if you own a home or work for a living, you can afford the suddenly doubled price .. many of the previously included things are no longer available unless you "upgrade" (the option of doing that was always so well hidden in previous versions anyway). BUY ALTERNATIVES or use a paper/pencil .. I can't believe in the age of e-everything that the "free" option is using a dead-trees form that humans have to transcribe, but every time the government tries to offer a free online tool, Intuit sues them for competing. FWIW, H&R Block's software does all the missing stuff, for way less money.

title: TurboTax screws folks who must extend
content: The offer to refund $25 to prior year Deluxe users applies ONLY to those who can file the 2014 return by April 20, 2015. That means that folks who extend their returns are out of luck, and for folks who do use Schedules C, D & E, the info necessary to prepare a complete and accurate return simply isn't available by April 20th. This is especially true for taxpayers who receive Forms K-1 and 1099's. TurboTax is alienating a huge segment of former users, like me!

title: I liked the product
content: Wow, sleazy, deceptive business practices, most people tend to steer clear of this behavior. Thanks everyone for these reviews, I've been a customer since 1993 (21 years) and I was about to purchase my annual copy. If they were honest and transparent, there would be a big disclaimer on the product stating that their product lineup has changed this year. I liked the product, but I'm sure I can like another product just as much without the deceptive behavior and hiding changes in the fine print. Goodbye TurboTax, hello H&R Block!!

title: Like many others
content: Like many others, I got caught in what I would characterize as a bait-and-switch. I have been a loyal TurboTax user for about 15 years. Now, after all that time buying the same version (Deluxe) I discover that it no longer handles electronic filing of Schedule D. What?!? I will try to call the national number to get a free upgrade, but if that doesn't work, or if they don't change their software capabilities back to what they were for next year I will be forced to go to a competitive product.

title: What a rip off!
content: Do NOT buy TT deluxe! Intuid decided this year to remove a feature in their -already- expensive deluxe product. If you have rental income they now force you to upgrade to Premier! What a bad business practice! I have been a TT customer for 15 years but this is it, I am now moving to H&R Block software or to TaxAct! Thake that Intuit!

title: Intuit just turned an 11 yr customer into a shopper.
content: As legions of others have accurately pointed out, this year's Turbo Tax Deluxe has been stripped of IRS Schedules which have always been included in the past. There is no price break to compensate for the new lighter version. I'm giving 2 stars instead of one because outside of the missing schedules, important as that is, I'm confident I would like the rest of the software and experience. I'd been a loyal customer for a decade but now I am a shopper. There are very capable alternatives offering better value. Intuit, I hope you respond to the strong feedback from your customer base. I'll check back with you next year to see if that has happened.

title: Deceptive marketing and price gouging
content: I've been a loyal TurboTax customer for over 20 years. It's always had a few issues but overall worked well. The most important thing was that you could always do anything with any version. I would buy the one most suited to my situation but if I have a small home business I could fill out Schedule C with Basic or Deluxe, I just didn't get all of the help I would get with a more advanced version. Same thing with investments. With this new version, Intuit has completely changed the functionality of the product and they are taking advantage of their customers. I refused to pay the upgrade fee they require and switched to H&R Block software. That seems to work fine and I plan on sticking with it for future years as well. Intuit's greed is going to cost them a lot of loyal customers. I probably won't buy a new version of Quicken either for fear of them pulling a similar stunt with that product.

title: Last year Deluxe worked fine. This comes across as a sharp business practice
content: As of this year I need TurboTax Premier so I can enter one number from a K-1. Last year Deluxe worked fine. This comes across as a sharp business practice. If you haven't started using TurboTax for you federal taxes I recommend you go elsewhere.

title: Like many of today's corporations loyalty earned is loyalty squandered
content: The bottom line is that Intuit wants all but the basic user to pony-up $100 for their software. I, too, have used TurboTax for years and years but this is my last year with TurboTax. I took adavantage of H&R Block's free replacement offer. Intuit, you really screwed-up and today's customers are not as loyal as you assume them to be. Like many of today's corporations loyalty earned is loyalty squandered.

title: How about learning some great etiquette from Safeway
content: TT's apology is an insult to consumers' intelligence! Enrage its clients then shamelessly trying to tame the fire with $25 cash back. How about learning some great etiquette from Safeway? If shoppers point out prices discrepancy at the register and shelf price tag, Safeway would go out of their way to make shoppers forget about the inconvenience ... FREE merchandise coupled with sincere apology!

title: I have been a Turbo Tax customer for 15 years ...
content: I have been a Turbo Tax customer for 15 years, NO LONGER, any CEO that gives the apology the way he did then ask for $30 for the upgrade so you can use the product as it worked for many years is incompetent and needs to be given his walking papers. I talked to a rep on the phone and they could upgrade me for $30 then 7 weeks later they would send me a check for $25 back, ARE YOU KIDDING ME, my disks went back for a refund, I AM NOW A H&R BLOCK software user.

title: Please don't give your money to Intuit.
content: As with so many others I have used turbo tax exclusively for well over a decade. No more...I don't intentionally give my money to crooks. I don't even need to use schedule C or D this year, but will not support a company that does business this way. If consistency with the Mobil platform was so important, that platform should have been designed to function as Turbo Tax has for the last 15 years. What a perfect example of corporate greed.

title: I have to file by mail because turbo tax delux ...
content: I have to file by mail because turbo tax delux deleted the stock sales from efile without advance notice. I only have a couple of sales each year and turbo tax wants twice the money to do what they have done for years witjh the delux package. After decades of use, they've lost me!! Hello H&R Block

title: Switching to Competitor!!!!!!!
content: I too have been using Turbo Tax Deluxe for many, many years and need access to schedule D and C with "real" expenses in order to prepare my return. Thank you reviewers for saving me the angst of buying the Deluxe version and not being able to complete my tax return without having to cough additional $. I was then going to buy Turbo Tax Home and Business - but, after reading these reviews - it looks like this may not work for me either and the only way I can find out is to buy it and try it. Baloney! I shall buy NO TURBO TAX product - I don't care if they give it away. Any company that sneakily pulls the rug out from underneath their customer base will not get my money - ever again. I will willingly pay more to a competitor - even for a lesser product if I have to.

title: Bye Bye Turbo Tax after 25 years
content: Bye Bye Turbo Tax after 25 years. Just bought H&R block Deluxe for $25 at OfficeMax. I does everything I need. Thrilled to have a great alternative at half the cost. Include 5 federal e-filings just like TurboTax which is what I need. Bad decision by Product Management at Turbo Tax.

title: Why did yu go and mess up a great product. The elimination of several forms in your ...
content: Why did yu go and mess up a great product. The elimination of several forms in your Deluxe version makes it useless. I have used Turbo Tax for over 10 years but this is the end for me. H and R Block will get my Business.

title: H&R Block Premier cheaper and better designed than TurboTax
content: This restructuring "bait and switch" by Intuit is outrageous.I'm so glad I saw this information before I bought my copy. Looks like H&R Block has a free competitive upgrade switch as detailed at http://www.networkworld.com/article/2867286/microsoft-subnet/intuit-gets-greedy-nearly-doubles-price-of-turbotax.html Update: I just bought, downloaded, and installed H&R Block's Premier version. After using it for just 10 minutes, I think it is more cleanly designed and clearly organized than TurboTax. The way the interview process runs makes a lot more sense to me without having to click on extra help links frequently.

title: Time to part ways with a longtime abusive partner
content: It is unconscionable for Intuit to remove schedule D from the Deluxe offering and pimping us for upgrades while entering tax information. I purchased TurboTax Deluxe without knowing about the reduced coverage. H&R Block if offering a free replacement to people in my position. A leading consumer magazine rated H&R Block better than TurboTax. Looks like this is the year I permanently break my longtime relationship with abusive TurboTax.

title: Will buy H&R Block Instead
content: I will eat the cost of TurboTax and buy H&R Block before I'll give Intuit another penny.

title: Goodbye TTax
content: What I have read is alarming and discouraging. I am still another old-time user (remember the Gateway computers?). I need Schedule D. Goodbye Turbo Tax. Just bought and easily downloaded and installed the H&R Block software. No problems on my Win 8.1 laptop, did not encounter any of the install problems that some mentioned. Started it up and imported my TTax 2013 return easily. Have gone no further, may update this later.

title: I've used TurboTax for many many years. This new ...
content: I've used TurboTax for many many years. This new pricing model is unacceptable. I bought the same functionality in H&R Block Deluxe for $22 and change. Don't buy into this gouging...

title: ... our TurboTax products this year to deliver only the best, guided experience based on your specific tax situation
content: We've changed our TurboTax products this year to deliver only the best, guided experience based on your specific tax situation. This means you may need to select a different TurboTax version than what you have used in the past to ensure you have the necessary guidance and coverage to complete your taxes. After using TurboTax for more than 15 years I will select a different product, and it will not be from intuit.

title: Really customer unfriendly change to the product
content: Huge disappointment with the loss of ability to do schedule D unless one upgrades to Premier. Over a 30% increase in cost to support electronic filing of Schedule D/E in my opinion is poor value. Yes one can use forms view to complete Schedule D and print and file by mail. Which defeats the whole purpose of using a product like Turbotax. Though I hate it, there is really no great competition for a similar product, which is probably why the decision was made that they could get away with this approach. So I will use the product as an unhappy customer and change my previous advice to friends and colleagues about how to manage their taxes. I have been using Turbotax for more than 20 years, this is the most disappointing change yet to the product.

title: wow intuit wow
content: I have been a turbo-tax user only for a few years now and was going to use it this year but I will be taking my business elsewhere on sheer principal for companies like this that gouge and try to justify this by some stupid PR response that no one cares about, good luck with that. I realize profit is any company's motivation for doing business but when you throw a cheap shot at loyal customers you lose them for good. It only takes one bad move to lose a customer and you just did, so thanks for showing your true colors.

title: Short sell them now and make cool cash, their earnings are going to tank this ...
content: Thanks everyone for pointing out and then confirming the "dis" from Intuit. Clearly having to pay an extra $30 this year just to get a schedule D is ridiculous. If you buy and sell stocks, Intuit wants a share of your profits. Short sell them now and make cool cash, their earnings are going to tank this year. Can't wait to hear what the earnings conference call sounds like in May. "Uh, we goofed." Bye Bye Turbotax for me too.

title: Hidden cost tactics are really shady
content: For a number of years before I bought my initial home, I was using free software by various tax software company. There were no needs for special deductibles or itemization, so I was happy. But when I bought my first home and started planning for my retirement, I wanted to really save money and look out for my own interest. So with my brother's advice, I got TurboTax. It was nice and all, but even from the beginning I noticed tricks of hidden costs to get the consumer to pay more. The wording they use in the software were obviously created by copywriters to play into the fear of people who don't know a thing about taxes. So the Audit Protection plan for an additional $50 now so you don't have to pay a CPA $2000 to protect you from the IRS later is just the perfect ploy to sucker people into willingly give them $50 for nothing in return. But what infuriates me more is the fact that they have the audacity to charge you an additional $20 to file your state tax when the front of the box and in the program that you get 1 free state tax return, only to be charged $20 so you can file electronically through their program. Are you serious? And to add more salt to the wound, they wanted another $40 so you can get a refund electronically by IRS for your federal refund. Swear to God, I'm only using this stupid program because it made importing last year's tax return to this year's form so easy. But I've had it with this scam company. They're not getting my money anymore. I'm gonna look into other companies next year. Do not buy any software from this company, they should be ashamed of themselves for ripping regular hard working people off so they can line their pockets. Sick.

title: Forces $30 upgrade to handle a basic return
content: Already overpriced for what it is, the program forced me to pay a $30 "upgrade" to Premier for it to handle a very basic banking transaction "not included" in Deluxe. There was a time when TurboTax was a good value, have used it for years but not anymore. Overpriced and poor performing product now.

title: All of the other reviews are right - AVOID even if you think you have a simple tax situation
content: Well, I have been a loyal TurboTax buyer for years and years and years. I thought my tax situation was so simple, I wouldn't run into the Deluxe vs. Premier situation. No rental property, no exotic investments, nothing at all complex. Income from my job, normal retirement/health savings account/savings funds, housing & charity deductions and a small money-market type investment with Edward Jones. I read through and tried to understand to make sure I was okay with Deluxe. Ha! That 'small' investment means I should have bought Premier. I called the hotline, they upgraded me for $10. I hope Intuit enjoys that $10, that's the last money I'm sending their way. I'm so irritated. The (very nice) person on the hotline mentioned TurboTax knows they did a poor job of marketing it. That is not it at all - this isn't a marketing problem. It's a problem in how they are opting to run their business. Count me as one of those who will be searching for a new tax software next year.

title: Buyers-Read these reviews and buy HR Block!
content: After reading all the negative reviews due to changes with this product, I too, ordered HR Block taxCut software. I hope Intuit realizes their mistake and the power of customer feedback forums. Maybe they will modify their strategy next year, or go by the wayside like so many businesses that get too greedy.

title: Totally useless
content: Totally useless this year, due to the elimination of many necessary schedules (C,D, etc.) as mentioned in the other detailed reviews here. Wish I could give it zero stars.

title: A reply to Bob Meighan, VP TurboTax:
content: Bob, per your reply to my earlier post (Mike PA), I did call, and I genuinely appreciate your gesture of sending me Home/Business for free. But two lingering questions remain: 1. What about all the people who bought Deluxe from "bricks and mortar" stores and are unaware of this option? I've already had two friends tell me they bought theirs but had yet to discover either the cutbacks you've made or the (one-time?) solution you've posted here. Unless you publicize this option elsewhere for their benefit, you'll wind up with a lot of even more unhappy former customers. What are you doing to reach out to them? Can you afford to ignore and alienate them? 2. Your explanation of consistency/functionality in each version is still weak. For example, why not remove Schedules F and J, for people with farm-related income? (I'm sure a much greater percentage of Deluxe users have no need.) And what about people with no children, to eliminate 2441/8615/8812/8814 and all the other child-related forms? Look at this from the customer's point of view: I always used Deluxe, and since my situation hasn't changed, I would plan to continue to use Deluxe. Unless you announce that Deluxe may no longer have all the features they need, telling people to "look at the chart" is silly advice for customers who have bought the same version year after year (and whose situations haven't changed). A growing number of people are angry, and they don't have short memories. As the old saying goes, "one burnt, twice cautious." What are you doing to reach out to them? As I said, I appreciate your sending me H/B for free. However, your chief competitor has offered me their Deluxe product (with all of the features of legacy TT Deluxe and which has always been more reasonably priced) as well, and although it will take me more time, I plan to use and compare both apps to see whether it's worth my while - or anyone's - to pay for your steep upgrade path next year and the year after. Or will we be grandfathered? Bob, I applaud your involvement in this discussion, and I offer these comments as constructive dialogue, to try to make sense out of this. This is not Intuit's finest hour. It has already become a case study in marketing circles. It's not too late to keep it from going from bad to worse.

title: Turbo Tax or H & R Block????
content: I specifically signed in to Amazon with the intention of ordering this year's version of Turbo Tax and taking advantage of the $39.99 Prime Member price. I had heard some grumbling regarding the "switch" and price increase, but hadn't paid much attention until today. I too have used Turbo Tax for many years - back to the original floppy disk versions, which I still have. All I can say is I am disappointed. It's great that consistency is the goal, but not at the expense of loyal customers. Block is offering dissatisfied TurboTax customers a free download of its Deluxe software, which normally sells for $44.95 and still allows E-filing of Schedules D and C. Gene King, Blockâs director of communications, says TurboTax purchasers should send an email to SwitchToBlock@hrblock.com containing their name, email and phone number; whether they use a Windows or MAC operating system; and a scan of their store receipt for TurboTax or a copy of the email showing their TurboTax download code. In return, theyâll be sent a link good for one free download of H&R Block Deluxe + State. (Data youâve entered in last yearâs or this yearâs version of TurboTax should be transferable.) At this point I have not purchased anything as I am hoping Intuit will repair their public relations nightmare prior to losing many, many loyal customers.

title: Read this article
content: Just read this article...http://www.msn.com/en-us/money/personalfinance/irate-turbotax-users-can-get-free-upgrades-or-jump-ship/ar-AA7Y2U9. Thanks so much to Amazon reviewers for alerting the rest of us to Intuit's deceptive practices. Mr. Bob Meighan, VP TurboTax, I know you are just doing your job but your posts are quite lame. After many years of using TurboTax, looks like I will trying H&R Block this year.

title: I'm glad I read these reviews about losing sch
content: I'm glad I read these reviews about losing sch. D and F before buying again this year. I have used Turbo Tax from the first time it was offered 20+ years ago. Usually I just buy the Deluxe and go do my taxes. But not this year. I will be looking in to H&R Block's program. I can not believe Turbo Tax is doing this to its customers.

title: Amazon's bundle did a bait and switch
content: As I was about to purchase TurboTax Deluxe 2014 Fed+State+Efile, I was offered a bundle with Norton Security. Apparently I did not look closely enough, because the bundle, seemingly a good deal, included TurboTax Federal Returns and E-file. The $20 I thought I was saving will now be going to purchase the State software I had originally selected. Edit: the state software cost $39.99 for one state. However, I did take advantage of the refund bonus offer. In the end, I was $10 ahead, just not as I had planned.

title: More expensive versus competition and now with even less features
content: I had been a TurboTax user for 11 years straight until 2003 when Intuit decided to include malware in their TurboTax 2002 program [ see: http://www.extremetech.com/computing/53054-turbotax-customers-strike-a-blow-against-intuit ] Even though Intuit tried to screw over their customers back then, I would still foolishly include them on my list of contenders when shopping for and comparing the various tax programs each year. But every year since 2003 I've found myself going back to H&R Block Deluxe (used to be called TaxCut back then). This year will be no different. Not only has H&R Block Deluxe been less expensive to purchase than TurboTax Deluxe year after year, but this year it includes ALL the features (such as Schedule D for reporting capital gains and losses) that Intuit removed from their Deluxe version. This makes H&R Block Deluxe an even bigger win in my book. I strongly suggest TurboTax users give H&R Block a try. I have had zero problems with them and when I compare their results with that from TurboTax online (I just plug in the numbers without filing the return) to verify H&R Block's accuracy, everything is 100% the same. In the end I can't really fault Intuit for their decision to raise prices and remove features. I mean, someone needs to cover the big pay raise and bonuses Intuit executives received in 2014 vs 2013 and prior years [ see: http://insiders.morningstar.com/trading/executive-compensation.action?t=INTU ].

title: I cannot comment on the TurboTax software itself because after ...
content: I cannot comment on the TurboTax software itself because after numerous attempts to download this version as well as emails and phone calls to Amazon I have been unable to complete the download. I always receive the same error message: Gateway Error 810. A little research on the interweb leads me to believe that software & game download problems are common when purchased from Amazon. I would think that Amazon's support would address these complaints and take appropriate actions. Until then, I will avoid future software purchases. Amazon did refund my money however.

title: Goodbye, TurboTax. Hello, H&R Block.
content: Like so many of the other reviewers, I have been a long-time user of TurboTax Deluxe. Intuit's decision to remove features previously available makes no sense except as a strategy designed to force TTD users to "upgrade" to TurboTax Premier at an additional annual cost of $30. Well, I don't need or want Premier, and I don't like Intuit's greed. So, sayonara, TurboTax. I'm switching to H&R Block.

title: After 20 years with Turbo Tax, I've switched to H&R Block tax software.
content: I realize TurboTax wants to maximize its profits, but it is doing so at the expense of its loyal customers by disabling Schedules C, D, and E in an attempt to force customers to spend another $20 on the Premier product. And Turbo Tax's suggestion that you use forms view to fill out and print out Schedule D along with the rest of your return and mail it to the IRS is no real solution at all - electronic filing and near immediate verification from the IRS that they received my return is a large part of the reason I file online.

title: Supporter of good businesses
content: Last year I was a previously 15 year user of TaxCut, who switched to TurboTax because they included the EV tax credit form. TaxCut worked well for me, and I thought that despite the higher price, I was going to continue to use them. Today I come to buy my 2014 software and I'm so thankful that I read the reviews. Yes, for many years I used the Schedule C and many other forms, with no problem with H&R Block. Now I see that they pull all this stuff from the "Deluxe" version of TurboTax? That's just crazy. Pull them from "Basic" but not deluxe. So, rather than support a company that is getting too big for it's britches, I'm going back to order H&R Block, as I was happy with them with everything until they missed the EV tax credit form. Read the reviews on Amazon for yourself..check out the number of stars for TaxCut Deluxe 2014 Federal and State, vs TurboTax Deluxe Fed and State. It's a no brainer...intuit, you ticked off your customers and you must pay the price.

title: Turbo Tax, please listen to your loyal customers. And how easy is it to switch to H&R?
content: I just logged into Amazon to purchase my copy of Turbo Tax. A 15-year old tradition. But as with everything I purchase at Amazon, I always read the reviews. And they are usualy pretty accurate. Specially when the number of reviewers is this high. The 5 stars and the one stars. I'm pretty chocked on how many people took their time to write bad reviews about this year's TT. Over 1000 people can't be wrong. Right now I see a 1,200 bad versus 50 great. It does tell me something. So here is my question...I know this is not a forum, but how many of you did move to H&R Block and are completely satisfied? How easy was the import from turbo tax process? Did you really save money on the software? Do they offer the audit protection (for a small fee)? Also, Turbo Tax, are you listening to your customers? I know you did change policies in the past (state filing charges and number of federal allowed), so it might be time to reconsider this one. It's still January and I think you can fix this one.

title: You really stepped in-to-it this time, Intuit.
content: This year I need the more expensive "Premier" version to do the exact same thing I was doing with "Deluxe" for the last 15 years. Goodbye Intuit.

title: How to Alienate Customers in One Easy Step
content: Being a long time Turbotax customer, and someone who is familiar with its in and outs I'll continue to use the deluxe edition this year even though it doesn't support Schedule D anymore. I'll not be forced to upgrade just for that. That's a total rip-off on their part. I'll fill Schedule D out manually, but I understand that precludes e-filing. In the meanwhile I'll familiarize myself with non-Turbotax offerings and see what I want to use for next year. If this is a sample of how Intuit treats their customers I'd highly recommend that anyone looking to start using tax prep software look to another vendor.

title: Buy something else!
content: Really bad decision to cripple the deluxe version. What is Intuit thinking?

title: I don't understand the reason that I have to wait ...
content: I don't understand the reason that I have to wait until after I have filed my return before I can get my rebate -- TurbTax certainly didn't say that I didn't have to pay for my software until after I filed my return. You don't suppose they are hoping that we will forget about it by March or April, do you?

title: Stop Lying Bob Meighan
content: Bob Meighan should admit his mistake and stop lying about it. The switch is clearly a pure profit motive. Any PR firm will tell you when you are caught in a lie, admit it, apologize and make things right. Recall all the sleazy advertisements that Intuit tried in the past with their products? I thought they learned their lessen then. I've switched to H&R Block with no problems.

title: Rip off your loyal customers. You can't e-file even ...
content: Rip off your loyal customers. You can't e-file even though I have virtually no schedule-C income or expenses. I've used this for years but it is over. now.

title: Intuit - a shameful and pathetic company
content: Shame on you Intuit for gouging your customers by moving several commonly used forms to the Premier software. A tax program is used once a year for a single purpose and the cost is already hideously expensive and Intuit has the gall to charge more; how pathetic. I have been a dedicated Turbo Tax customer for over 30 years but not anymore. Intuit has lost a dedicated customer.

title: Count me in the camp of very disappointed they removed the ability to e-file the schedules (especiialy ...
content: Count me in the camp of very disappointed they removed the ability to e-file the schedules (especially D) in the Deluxe version. I have been a TurboTax user for years but have jumped to HR Block Deluxe this year for about half the cost of TT Deluxe and 1/4 of Premium which I would be forced to upgrade too. If all goes well I won't be looking back.

title: Intuit has made a stupid, greedy mistake. I won't be back.
content: I actually bought the TT product as I have for over twenty years. Then I found Intuit changed the features mix in the product. As I research feature combinations vs my needs, I kept getting angrier. Resolution: Return product, get full refund, buy competitor (Tax Cut), & save money. Intuit threw away my loyalty. I doubt they can get it back.

title: Gouging AND lousy service
content: Absurd, simply ludicrous. Complete lack of transparency for those of us with automatic updates. My husband has a business, we both have capital gains - and now I have to upgrade TWO levels to get the software that I need. Okay, so free upgrade for this year. Big whoop. But only if you can spend a couple of hours on the phone with the Call Center folks who cannot even find a 20 year customer in their database. Have just asked for a supervisor - do they have those anymore? - gosh, no, they have Team Leaders. Oh yippee. If I hadn't already paid for this year I would switch to HRB right this minute.

title: Deceived
content: Mad as mad can be. 20 year turbo tax user who has always bought Deluxe and purchased again this year without studying the product changes and was unaware of the lack of investing support. I feel deceived and will never purchase another intuit product again.

title: Stunningly bad move
content: I would like to add my voice to the chorus of very unhappy TurboTax customers. I, too, have been using TurboTax since the mid-80's. Although they have angered me in the past, nothing they have done has surprised me as much as their decision to drop support for mutual fund/stock sales (Schedule D) from their mainstream product (Deluxe). For those of us who make a couple of sales a year, dropping this very basic support is stunning and is a nothing more than a calculated, cynical decision on Intuit's part. Defending this move by stating that the functionality was removed from TurboTax on-line therefore it had to be removed from the desktop version so as not to confuse us, the customers, is just as ridiculous as it sounds.

title: It's a painful lesson I'm sure
content: Thank you all for your reviews. As a long time turbotax user, since the late 80's, I am investigating alternatives. Over the course of my use, my taxes became more simple, so only recall a couple of frustrations - but the expression of being gouged and weasel word explanations is spot on. See your later intuit.... It's a painful lesson I'm sure.

title: "Deluxe" is the new Basic
content: "Deluxe" is the new Basic, apparently. Time to move on.

title: Disaster! Avoid. I have used turbotax exclusively for ...
content: Disaster! Avoid. I have used turbotax exclusively for years. All the other one star reviews explain very well how Intuit ruined their own customer base. Returning my copy and going for H&R Block. I suggest everyone else do the same and demonstrate that the customer is what matters in the end and we can take our business else where.

title: I always look for the best deal. I was shocked to read all these ...
content: All I can say is THANK YOU! I received an email this morning reminding me that it was time to purchase turbotax. So, I went to Amazon to check out the price and try to decide whether to buy it online or at Sams club. I always look for the best deal. I was shocked to read all these reviews. I appreciate it so much though. I think it saved me some grief in the long run when I sit down to do the taxes. I have used turbotax for years and have trusted it. But, I definitely do NOT want to have to mail in some of the schedules. I need something that I can trust, is easy and convenient to use and is cost friendly. So, I guess I need to start researching the products to make a better decision. I am very open to any help and suggestions as to what I should purchase not. I don't like change and am hesitant, but will do what I have to do. Any recommendations or suggestions would be appreciated? Thank you very much!!!

title: DO NOT BUY - They require you to get the ...
content: DO NOT BUY - They require you to get the Premier Version to file Schedule D. Yes you can manually fill out Schedule D and mail it to the IRS. So what's the point of buying a tax preparation software?

title: Well... Intuit tries to screw their loyal ...
content: Well ... Intuit tries to screw their loyal customers this year ... so I will be using H&R Block software. You lose Intuit!

title: Turbotax was expensive to begin with. Now they make ...
content: Turbotax was expensive to begin with. Now they make you go to Premier for functions they had in Deluxe for many, many years. I'm looking at the competition this year for sure !!! Turbotax likely lost a customer they had for a decade !!!

title: Hate to do it because I have always been such ...
content: Been using turbotax for 15 yrs and this is probably my last . I sold 1000$ worth of stock and now I have to spend extra to get the Preimere edition. H&R Block software, here I come. Hate to do it because I have always been such a big advocate of TT. Just money grab is just too much . The corporate BS letter that they sent out explaining the reasons was the worst jab at our intelligence. Just pure greed... Someone at Intuit will hopefully learn a lesson the hard way .. your fired !!!

title: THE DELUXE VERSION HAS BEEN DUMBED DOWN! I have been using TurboTax for 27 ...
content: THE DELUXE VERSION HAS BEEN DUMBED DOWN ! I have been using TurboTax for 27 years (Developed by Center Piece Software, then by Chip Soft, now owned by Intuit).... Time to take a serious look at H & R Block's TaxCut program. UPDATE: BOB: Note that OVER 50% of the reviews as of 11/26/14 are one (1) star. When you find yourself in a hole...stop digging. The time has come for damage control. Reduce Premier by $30. You will lose less revenue than all the folks going over to H&R Block...a lot more than just the ones writing reviews. Customers who go to H&R Block will be lost to you in future years as they will find that program to be a good one and year after year it is priced below TurboTax

title: Good bye Intuit
content: When Turbotax makes me pay another $30 just to file a schedule D it time to switch to H&R block software. Good bye Intuit.

title: One Star
content: Yuck! Time to switch to H&R Block or a personal accountant.

title: Thanks for the comments about TurboTax Deluxe changing their product ...
content: Thanks for the comments about TurboTax Deluxe changing their product & excluding the sch. c & d. I understand that you can not efile those schedules with Deluxe. I will be looking at H&R Block's package this year. I have used TT for many years but no longer.

title: I installed the deluxe and when I attempted to do ...
content: I installed the deluxe and when I attempted to do the final review a message came on the screen indicating that I needed to install Premier. Apparently as a result of two Schedule D transactions. How does Intuit expect to charge $30 more to handle two Schedule D transactions? I complained to Intuit and they agreed to provide a free upgrade this year. After many years using Turbo Tax I will purchase alternative software next year. Intuit's explanation that the additional cost is due to "software upgrades" is B.S, I suspect that Intuit made the change because their "bottom line" needed an upgrade. I hope that Intuit's "bottom line" incurs a significant downgrade because of its despicable conduct. In addition, Intuit was unable to download the State return with the free upgrade to Premier. I prepared the State return manually. Now, intuit is attempting to charge me for State return that was not usable.

title: A disappointing and expensive change
content: Like many others who have commented, I have used TurboTax for years and have normally purchased the "Deluxe" version. I was quite surprised to learn that, because of a single form that was no longer in the "Deluxe" version, I needed the "Home and Business" version this year, and that this would cost some $30 more. Though I considered other products, to save time, I got the Home and Business version of TurboTax, which I find looks a lot like the Deluxe version of last year, right down to the same oh-so-helpful photos of mostly(?) the same "real tax experts" and, it seems to me, almost the same dialog: only the upsell pages for "Home and Business" are missing this time this time, maybe because they already forced that upsell on the consumer. Next year, I'll go with somebody else for tax software. Enjoy the $30, Intuit, it's the last you'll get from me.

title: Intuit takes one step to far
content: I am also tired of being scammed. Count me as ex customer.

title: Costs More; Does Less
content: IN the past, Intuit has implemented customer-unfriendly policies such as the digital-rights fiasco from a few years ago, but this year's changes take the cake. Not only did they remove Schedule D from TurboTax Deluxe, it costs $10 (25%) MORE this year than it did last year on Amazon! Even if purchased the software on sale last year, the best that can be said is that Intuit removed core functionality of the product and kept the price the same. Said another way, if you want the same functionality as last year's Deluxe, you have to purchase Premier, which costs 20% more than this year's increased Deluxe cost! Terrible decision, and I don't appreciate their "VP of TurboTax" stating in comments that one can still complete Schedule D in forms mode -- not only is this no better than getting the form on the IRS site (for free), but it eliminates the ability to e-file. It appears that H&R Block's TaxCut Deluxe software kept Schedule D functionality, and costs less than TurboTax, to boot. Looks like I will be switching since TaxCut can import prior year's TurboTax files.

title: another customer switching
content: intuit, you have lost a customer of 15 years.. each year I buy 10 copies as gifts... not a savvy approach toward making more money taking away the ability to e-file Sch D with Deluxe.. now have to upgrade to Premier....its not the dollar increase , its the way you went about it.. the principle.. but then again you know best...

title: If they need the money that bad, Intuit could have come up with a different ...
content: After all these years of using TurboTax Deluxe and being a member of their former support/evaluation group, I feel cheated that the product no longer provides the same level of support. If they need the money that bad, Intuit could have come up with a different product name rather than conning us. I have not opened the physical copy I bought so it is on the way back to the BX. I hope the learning curve for H&R Block equivalent is not too steep.

title: I was disappointed that the Schedule C was not included in the ...
content: I have a small business and have used Turbo Tax for probably 25 years. I was disappointed that the Schedule C was not included in the Deluxe version this year, & that I would have to upgrade to Home & Busines. So I purchased H&R Block Premium. I was amazed at how easy it was to import information from last year's Turbo Tax Return. I am extremely happy with H&R Block software, which was almost $25 cheaper than the Turbo Tax Home & Business.

title: Another one bites the dust.
content: I have used Turbo Tax since the early 90s but like so many others here have switched to H&R Block. The transition was painless. Honestly Bob, I think you are wasting your time here doing damage control. Other quality alternatives exist and are readily available.

title: TURBO TAX STICKS ONE TO ITS LOYAL CUSTOMERS
content: I have used turbo tax for many years without ant problems except for this year 2014. I bought turbo tax deluxe then found out it did not include the state return. Previous years it was included. I bought the state and downloaded it could not open it in turbo tax. Tried to get help from them to fix this problem. Could not get any answers. Went and bought H&R BLOCK program. Will not use TURBO TAX again They should be ashamed of themselves for duping the people.

title: stay away...try H&R block or other software
content: it will probably be my last time ever using TurboTax (after more than a decade). I was forced to upgrade to Premier and had to pay an extra $30. On the intuit site, if you are screwed by this bait and switch tactic, they will refund you $25. For this action by Intuit, I believe that I am done doing business with.

title: latest rebate is dumb, just restore features already
content: bought for last 10 years but switching to hr block. my suggestion to intuit is to restore Deluxe with features deleted or watch yuor customers move away. they just got too greedy. latest rebate is dumb, just restore features already.

title: Let market pricing prevail...
content: Never again!!! already moved on to H&R for now.

title: Thanks TurboTax for pushing me to look at other packages ...
content: Thanks TurboTax for pushing me to look at other packages for 2014. After years of nickel and dime'ing through the process where I had to upgrade to this add a payment here you just out and out show your greed.

title: ... TurboTax for many years and have always been very happy with the product
content: I've used TurboTax for many years and have always been very happy with the product. But I do need Schedule C for a few small activities and Schedule D for stock sales. The idea that you'd have to pay extra, and that much extra, for such basic and common tax situations is ridiculous. Especially in a product labeled "Deluxe". If you can't do these basic things, there's nothing "Deluxe" about it. I'll be moving to the H&R Block software for this and future years.

title: I've used TurboTax every year since 1995, except for ...
content: I've used TurboTax every year since 1995, except for 2002 when they had the rootkit/CD fiasco. I came here today to purchase this year's and find that it no longer will serve my needs. Telling me that I have to use manual workarounds to get Schedule D filed is totally unacceptable. Schedule D is a common form, and one need not be a small business owner or significantly into investments to need it. E-file used to be one of the reasons moving up to Deluxe made sense, but now that's not included if you need Schedule D. Yet the price didn't go down.

title: They screw you in the drive through!
content: No longer includes the schedules for investments...I have been using the application for the last ten years! Not any more, I guess I'm switching to HR Blocks software...had to learn this from the newspaper! WRONG ANSWER!

title: Intuit has sunk to a new low
content: Can I give less than one star? This is bait and switch at its worst. Surprise! You are not allowed to enter your 1099-MISC form until you pay us $40 to upgrade. Never mind that the difference in price between premier and deluxe is only $15 at Costco where I bought it. Intuit has really gotten bad over the years, but this is a new low.

title: Absolute Rip Off - DO NOT BUY
content: I was getting ready to order my 2014 software when I noticed the Deluxe version no longer really supports investments, and I would have to pay $30 more than last year in order to get the Premier version. This is a cynical, hidden, greedy, despicable money grab. Check out the H&R Block software sold on Amazon; good reviews and fair price. I was a TT customer for 15 years, but no more.

title: TaxACT works well and is easy for rental properties with ongoing depreciation from last year.
content: I too was furious about the gouge. I wanted to change but was apprehensive about whether another product would handle ongoing depreciation of rental properties. I decided to purchase TaxACT. TaxACT did not import the rental property information, but I manually entered the cost basis, date of acquisition, and depreciation method for each asset from my hard copy of last year's return (following the TaxACT interview questions). It was very easy to do and only took a few minutes. It was very straightforward to do. The results look exactly right and exactly match prior year figures. Bottom line is that you should not fear TaxACT if you have rental property depreciation from last year - it was a piece of cake to do. I find the TaxACT interview process as good or better than TurboTax. So far I highly recommend it for those seeking an alternative to TurboTax.

title: I HATE Trickery!
content: I've been using Turbo Tax for more than 20 years. Always bought the Deluxe Version. I come to Schedule D and it's GONE! $30 more for that! That makes my total cost far more than I've EVER paid for TurboTax. This is BS -- I am sending it back. There's a 60 day money back guarantee and I'm using it!! Fire the geniuses at Intuit who made this decision. Way to anger your formerly loyal customer base! Turbotax users unite -- send it back!

title: Intuit Turbotax not what it used to be.
content: I received an email from Intuit today saying Turbotax is now available for purchase. Went to Amazon to buy it and saw all the negative reviews. Wow! what a royal screwing Intuit is giving its customers. Started doing my own taxes in 1995 with Kiplinger's Taxcut. I switched to TurboTax in 1999 at my brother's recommendation. Been very happy using TurboTax ever since. Based on what I've read in these reviews, I will NOT purchase TurboTax this year. I'll give my friends and relatives the news of what Intuit did to their formally great product so they don't get blindsided. Looks like it's Taxcut for me this year. At $33.98 for the deluxe + state edition it's a better deal than the same TurboTax edition at $49.99. My sincere thanks to all here who have shared their experience and gave warning about Intuit's sneaky and underhanded reduction of the capabilities in their tax software.

title: Loss of investment income is a total fail
content: With 2014 comes the loss of investment income in TT deluxe. Without this feature the software is useless to me. I guess I could just pay the extra money Intuit is trying to extort from its loyal users but I think I will just use it a good reason to pick another tax software program and make the switch for good.

title: Cuting service while jacking up prices.
content: I have used Turbo Tax for years and years - at least 15 - and have become steadily more dissatisfied. The price keeps rising, while the quality of the product declines. With the recent changes, I have decided to join those abandoning Turbo Tax. I hope Intuit pays attention and learns that you can't cut service while jacking up prices. Edit: Feb. 2, 2015. I had a question as to whether I might reconsider given TT's offer to give a partial rebate or upgrade if I contacted the support center. I thought about it and ultimately decided it was time to try something else. As I indicated above, this is not a knee-jerk reaction to the most recent change, TT has been ignoring concerns for far too long, while steadily increasing the price.

title: Pathetic Change in Product
content: I've used TurboTax for many years and have been one of its biggest fans. I'm one of their "Advantage Members." I've always used their Deluxe product. However, with the recent change of not fully supporting Schedule D, and requiring an "upgrade" to get full functionality, I'm leaving TurboTax and will never use it again. Your should read their rationale for the change. It completely ignores their customer base.

title: Turbo Tax Slides in Backdoor Change AGAIN !
content: Shame on TurboTax for removing Schedule D from the Deluxe package and not making the change transparent. I do not need the Premier functions and will switch to HR Block. Intuit did this a few years ago and reversed their decision at the last minute, let's hope they come to their senses again before January. Intuit you still have a chance to save yourself.

title: Fraudulent Product - Will Report to FTC
content: How disgusting can a corporation get in 2015 America? Buy this fraudulent trash product and find out. Without notice, Intuit/Turbotax removed basic functionality from this product (Schedule D) - and then hid it until you're halfway through inputting data, and then extorting an additional $30 to get back what we always had - preposterously slimy. No more TurboTax, No more Quicken, No more Intuit -- I hope this low-life bunch of creeps goes belly-up, and soon.

title: Bad Turbo Tax
content: From what I have seen Turbo tax just flat out isn't worth the money. I will be taking my taxes to taxcut this year, considerably cheaper and just as good but without all the pop up advice windows. Sorry Turbo I was willing to pay for the deluxe but not going that much higher, you lost a loyal customer from the last 7 years because of a change that doesn't help anyone.

title: Goodbye Intuit
content: I have been a loyal Turbo Tax user for many years and the Deluxe version has always suited my needs very well. To fill out my return using the exact same forms that I used last year, I would have to upgrade to their high end Home & Business Product. I was a Turbo Tax Advantage subscriber and there was no warning about these significant changes other than a fine print comment in the email notification that my product would ship within 10 days: "Please take a moment to review your account information and verify the product you selected is still the right one for you by 10/19/14." Why would I expect that Deluxe would no longer be suitable for me? I do not have any changes in my reporting needs. This is clearly a "bait & switch" and customer gouging tactic that I will not stand for. I have switched to H&R Block.

title: Glad to see that people are taking their business elsewhere
content: Thank you for all who took the time to inform of the inadequacy of this product for many filers. Glad to see that people are taking their business elsewhere. I too was a loyal TURBOTAX user for over 10 years. GOODBYE turbotax.

title: Capabilities removed from TurboTax Deluxe
content: I have been a TurboTax user for 20 years. After making this purchase (download), I discovered that Intuit has dramatically changed the product pertaining to Schedules C and D in addition to removing the capability to E-File these forms. Needless to say I was not happy. I called Intuit and explained my situation. I am giving them two stars because the customer support rep gave me a free upgrade to TTax Home and Business. He did get me to agree that this was a one time deal and I would have to buy the full Home and Business for next year. I'm happy they did this for me. However I am not happy about what they did with their Deluxe product. I like the TTax product, but it looks like I may have to switch to H&R Block for next year (unless they do something funny with their product). Maybe Intuit will wise up and put the stuff back that they removed from the Deluxe version. Wishful thinking when greed is involved. I recommend you call Intuit and plead your case if you are in this same situation. It worked for me.

title: Bye Bye Turbo Tax - Hello H&R Block!!
content: After using Turbo Tax for over 10 years I am switching to H&R Block. I purchased the software on one of Amazon's Lightning Deals and saved $40. I am tired of Turbo Tax's games. A few years ago they limited the number of returns, and now the the Deluxe version will not prepare or e-file Schedule D. Bye Bye Turbo Tax - Hello H&R Block!!

title: A poor way of implementing a price increase.
content: That was a poor way of implementing a price increase. Even after this year's upgrade from Deluxe to Premium, and all the rebates are settled, future years from 2015 on out will require the Premium version at the higher price. I would rather have seen them increase the price on Deluxe by a reasonable amount rather than eliminating features. I purchased the boxed Deluxe version like I always do not realizing that features I need had been removed. Now I have to screw around with the online upgrade, pay the increase for the upgrade, and then apply for the rebate. And from here on out have to purchase the higher priced Premium version in future years. Price for the Deluxe version is $54.99 and $79.99 for the Premium version. That was their way of implementing a $25 price increase of 45%.

title: Bye Turbotax
content: Been using Turbotax for many years. But forcing me to upgrade because I had a couple of small stock sales is ridiculous. So long Turbotax, hello H&R Block.

title: I've NEVER reviewed anything before, but I buy ALOT ...
content: I've NEVER reviewed anything before, but I buy ALOT! Before I do purchase, I double check the reviews....wondered why all the 1 stars...I've been loving TT all these years. All I can say now is THANKS! for the heads up, you faithful virtual community! I hadn't heards about the changes...(surprisingly as I read the paper, read on-line news, and watch the news and I've heard nada! Guess I'll check out HR block. Does stink tho....

title: Another customer leaving the Intuit fold
content: Duh Intuit! How stupid can your planning be! You have a major nightmare on your hands because you have removed a bunch of features. However you try to justify it and say you clearly labeled the changes, it doesn't change the fact that you have lost a number of loyal customers to H&R. Update -- If you want to finish your taxes with Intuit this time just call 800-445-1875 and they'll upgrade you for free. If you want to try H&R Deluxe send an email to switchtoblock@hrblock.com and they'll send you a coupon for a free download.

title: Stop the Greed of Intuit - Demand Free Tax Filing Like Other Countries
content: Interesting article in Consumerist about Intuit's greed. Intuit spends a fortune lobbying Congress so we have to pay do to our taxes. This is the time to demand free, online systems like other advanced countries have. Why should we have to pay greedy companies to do what should be free? Consumerist: "Itâs important to step back and look at the big picture, too. Intuit has spent millions of dollars lobbying the federal government to make sure that American taxpayers still have to file tax returns, even though for most people the IRS could simply pre-populate the form with the information they have and cut us a refund check or send us a bill. The state of California already does this for state income tax returns, and other countries do it."

title: TurboTax cost more money and has less "tax" functionality compared to competing products
content: Taxcut is on sale for 21.99 and it includes Schedule D. Even without the sale promoton Taxcut is significantly cheaper for equivalent tax filling coverage. So my question is, why did I spend more money on this product? Why would you pay more for less? Is not like you are going to get different tax fillings in the end... they both follow the same Tax regulations, thus one is not going to save you more taxes compared to the other, in fact you will only save money if you avoid buying TurboTax. US tax filling is already painful enough (in Europe most countries don't have this non-sense), tax payers should not be "played" around when they have to buy tax filling software.

title: Intuit has shot themselves in the foot (and knee, crotch....)
content: Intuit may have really shot themselves in the foot with this debacle. I've been less happy with TurboTax Deluxe the last few years--just seemed less user-friendly--but I didn't look at competitors because I was worried about how well information would transfer. Intuit had themselves a great deal, with pretty much guaranteed return business year-after-year. But now I'm switching, just not sure if it will be H&R or TaxAct, and they'll have to be really bad before I'd switch back and again take the risk of shifting. Lame, lame move, Intuit.

title: disappointed that they disabled critical functions and did not highlight ...
content: disappointed that they disabled critical functions and did not highlight the fact. They was additional $30 to get these features, whereas getting these features using the investment and rental property would cost you only $15 more.

title: Intuit excuses for why it took this action and failed to make it prominent to users are about as lame as a dog with no legs
content: I've been a long time Turbotax user since before Intuit took it over. I guess this year is the time for a change. No point being loyal to a company that doesn't honor its long time customers. Intuit excuses for why it took this action and failed to make it prominent to users are about as lame as a dog with no legs. So long Intuit. Hello H&R Block!

title: I am so glad that I saw the comments on losing the capability ...
content: I am so glad that I saw the comments on losing the capability for capital gains. I am going to find out what other products still have this capability and if they work with my stock site. Thank you everyone for point this out. I suppose that there will be others who will still pay the extra money, but I hope that they don't so we can keep both the functionality and the lower price in future years.

title: Time to find a new tax program!
content: Time to find a new tax program! I have used TurboTax Deluxe for many years and feel very comfortable using it. The reason for using "deluxe" was the need to account for "Schedule D" which has now disappeared from the Deluxe Version.
