So, anyone having stock sales is FORCED to buy Premier or Home & Business versions at a much higher price. I am in the process of finding out what will do the same thing as the "old" Deluxe for a cheaper price. Intuit has made a bad business decision by being greedy and they may have killed the golden goose!

title: Lost Loyalty
content: I didn't purchase TT Deluxe this year, but I have purchased it every year since 2002, usually from Costco. Luckily, I found these reviews before making the purchase. Intuit has tested me in the past with forced Quicken upgrades. Greed will cost you, Intuit. You will not get me back.

title: TurboTax Deluxe Crippled for Tax Year 2014
content: I've been a TurboTax user since I got the 3.5" floppies from Chipsoft (I've still got them around somewhere). I'm one of those brand loyal customers until my trust in the brand is misplaced. I've been exclusively desktop/CD based given the sensitivity of the financial information - and the cloud is out of my control. I've been using TurboTax Deluxe for years - and this year I have one (1) stock sale - and for lack of e-file on Schedule D, I'm forced to TurboTax Premier? The form may exist somewhere, but I can't e-file? C'mon... I've also potentially got one line on Sched C where my consulting deductions exceed $100. I'm forced for that one line to go up to TurboTax Home and Business or I can't e-file? Really? In the interest of transparency - what are the limitations for efiling with each version? Can they be spelled out somewhere? Not publicizing them is deceptive by omission - "changes have been made" does not cover it. Your vague "call us and we'll help you decide" offer is not transparent and does a disservice to the rest of us making an online purchase decision. Are you afraid that the version specific limitations will scare more customers away then these reviews? We're doing our own taxes - I think we can figure out what product we need if you give us the details what each version will allow for e-filing. It's nowhere on your website or in the product description. It needs to be explicitly stated "Premier required for efiling Schedule D". Not "Premier is the best version for your situation" - Sheesh... I can't take the chance that I'm buying crippled software, nor do I want to pay for features I'll never use. I don't mind paying for value - I'm using Quicken Home and Business - but will rethink that as well. The alternatives are out there. Intuit - you've lost me... I've rarely (if ever) written a review, but this was too much. For all of us that actually take the time to write something, there are hundreds (if not thousands) that will stay silent and just move on. Time to be brand-loyal elsewhere...

title: Time for a new alternative!
content: Atlast a good reason for me to consider an alternate tax filing software. Dont wait for refund. Save some money right away by getting something else.

title: so glad I read the reviews for Turbo Tax 2014 BEFORE ...
content: Uh, oh . . . so glad I read the reviews for Turbo Tax 2014 BEFORE ordering. I've been using this software since 1995 and search each Dec-Jan for the best price. The changes to Deluxe this year are putting me on hold, waiting to see if Intuit responds and adds back Schedule D function to the software.

title: Extremely poor way for a major corporation to treat its loyal ...
content: Extremely poor way for a major corporation to treat its loyal customers. Moving over to H&R Block from now on. 5 years of trust down the tubes

title: No schedule D? This is useless!
content: No schedule D? This is useless! That is half the reason to use Turbo Tax! How can they call it "Deluxe" and remove a major functionality?

title: Rotten Business Practice At It's Finest
content: I have been a loyal customer since TurboTax was invented but that one-sided relationship is now over. Intuit, you should be ashamed of yourselves.

title: Never buying anything from Intuit Again!
content: Never buying anything from Intuit again!

title: SCH C FILERS BEWARE!
content: SCH C FILERS BEWARE! Intuit is screwing us! You have to pay $90-$100 for the software this year if you have a small business. Thanks for appreciating my nearly 20 years of loyalty Intuit! Shame on you!

title: I'm outta here, too.
content: I've been using TT Deluxe for many years and just started shopping around for the 2014 version. I'm certainly glad I came to Amazon to see these reviews. I'll be switching to a different product. I probably won't need any of the schedules that have been removed this year but I refuse to reward this kind of behavior. Intuit must be taking lessons from the cable TV industry.

title: Buyer Beware! If you trade stock look elsewhere
content: If you traded any stocks in 2014 you are pretty much forced to either upgrade to Turbo Tax Premium ($80 -$90) or better yet find a less expensive alternative from another company! I was fortunate to read the horrible reviews on Amazon before I purchased the software. Thanks to all for their spot-on reviews! I went to Intuits website and every indications is that Turbo Tax 2014 will not automatically generate a Schedule D (Stock trading). It appears to allow for manual creation of a Schedule D form but you cannot eFile the manually generated form? The only question I still have is why they call it deluxe. Stock trading is not supported in Turbo Tax Deluxe 2014? Wouldn't that be Turbo Tax lite? or Turbo Tax 1040EZ? or Turbo tax for the part-time high school student living at home with Mommy? I'm searching around for a comparable and reasonably priced alternative. It's disheartening but I believe this concludes my 15 year loyal customer relationship with Intuit (Turbo Tax) I am thankful that I did hear about the shortcomings of TT 2014 before I bought it. It's nice when you can dodge a bullet :)

title: Shameful ..
content: The changes in their 2014 products are shameful. Not only does it create mass confusion, but it's an intentional ploy for this multi-billion ( yes BILLION) dollar corporation to add a few percentage points to their bottom line ...at our expense. If their customer base ( which I am one ) did not stand up and voice their outrage for this bait-and-switch tactic, I'd expect additional sublime changes in the future . They have a good product, but I know now I cannot count on TurboTax's management to watch my back. I will take the free upgrade this year, but my pride tells me to switch to another product next year. I'd like to know whose bonus plan was tied to this change ? Shameful !

title: Thanks for Alerting me to Problems with this Product
content: I've been using TurboTax Deluxe for many years, and my tax filing situation has not changed. If Intuit is going to cripple the Deluxe product so that it no longer works for me, it's not good enough to "alert readers to the fact that the product line-up has changed." Intuit needs to make it explicitly and unmistakably clear to 2013 Deluxe users that features have been removed from the 2014 Deluxe product. I would have re-ordered the Deluxe product if I had not been alerted by the overwhelming number of one-star Amazon reviews. I'm grateful to Amazon for providing a forum for the customer feedback that brought this situation to my attention.

title: Their effort to increase their profit is turning into customers like me walking out the door to a different program
content: Almost made the purchase...then read the reviews. Can't believe Intuit hasn't made the change already to include reduced capacity. I already was not a fan of the inflated cost for adding another state return. Their effort to increase their profit is turning into customers like me walking out the door to a different program. How could they not see this coming?

title: TurboTax download problem
content: I bought the download version from Amazon. Later, I learned I needed to upgrade to the Home/Business version. But there was one small catch-- I needed a confirmation number, which was not provided with my download. When I attempted to contact TT support, I was placed in a queue lasting several hours. When I finally got a call-back, I was placed on hold and then lost in cyberspace as someone passed me down the line. So, now 2 days later, I haven't a confirmation number and I can't upgrade. So, no matter how generous TT's offer to provide 'free' upgrades for what used to be a standard part of the Deluxe version, it makes it very difficult/impossible to actually get the support necessary to take advantage of that offer

title: Dear Turbotax, it's not me, it's you
content: No schedule D means I will be choosing another tax prep software for 2014.

title: Incomprehensible Decision
content: This decision is mind numbing and incomprehensible. Yes I read the part about calling the service team for existing customers but why should I? It's almost as if Intuit is being run for the benefit of an academic experiment on how annoying they can be to their customers and still retain them. I don't believe other products out there are superior but at this point I really can't digest any explanation on why I would continue to use a product whose developer has made such a customer unfriendly and ill-conceived decision. Here's the real rub for Intuit. Many of us, myself included, are habit based. If we move to another product this year, even if Intuit "corrects" this decision we'll stay with the new product we chose, just because it became the new familiar.

title: A 40% price increase for similar functionality.
content: I've been a loyal TurboTax user since 1998. The reduced functionality has forced me to switch to H&R Block software. Shame on you Intuit!

title: One Star
content: Terrible what Intuit has done! I am switching to a different software.

title: Loyal customer sad about switching to the enemy. L
content: Have to switch to H&R block. It's a sad day. I have verified that the TurboTax I have always used has changed in a deceiving way.

title: Intuit fired me as a customer.
content: As a MacInTac and the TT user for about 20 years and a former volunteer Intuit Beta Tester, I was a super Intuit loyalist -- and ready to put my Amazon order in for this product until I found out that Intuit had fired me as a customer! How? By no longer supporting Mac OS 10.6.8. The only way I could use this 2014 version was on my 11" Mac laptop -- not my choice of platform and not on the 21" desktop machine where my past years' returns are. While an OS upgrade is "free", I'd have to buy added RAM and tweak or lose other apps to effectively run a system which would satisfy Intuit. I'm a "forms" method user of TT and found that, for the past two years TT was pushing me to create burdensome worksheets which the IRS did not need just to enter multiple, simple cash charitable contributions or simple stock transactions. Together with Intuit's 2014 gross misuse of the word, "Deluxe" as so many reviewers have pointed out, I have several reasons to have bought a competing product which: 1) runs on my 10.6.8 desktop; 2) easily imported my past TT return and 3) lives up to its version name, "Deluxe". Leaving Intuit was not my choice, but when one is fired as a customer, best to cut my losses quickly.

title: I give up...
content: i have given up on intuit. I recommend searching for Glenn Reeves' fantastic 1040 spreadsheets. they *just work* with zero hassle.

title: Turbo Price Gouging
content: Thanks for gouging your long-term loyal CUSTOMERS by removing what was standard forms in the Deluxe version and forcing them to purchase Premium. Time to move on, as you will probably pull this stunt again and again. You've ruined your reputation - like Coke did years ago. If it works, don't fix it - what is wrong with your Company's decision makers?

title: TurboTax Deluxe? What a ripoff!
content: Yep, I WAS a Turbo Tax fan for over 15 years but NO LONGER! Shame on you Turdotax! Removing the ability to complete a relatively simple return that includes a rental and stock redemptions in Turbotax Deluxe is criminal. WHY DO YOU STILL CALL TURBO TAX DELUXE " Deluxe?" It should be called Turbotax basic!

title: Read This if You're Buying Deluxe Version
content: I hadn't expected to add to the negative reviews, but after reading here on Amazon that, according to TT "Returning TurboTax Deluxe desktop customers who need to file Schedule C, D, E or F and purchase Deluxe 2014 will be upgraded to Premier or Home & Business for free. This upgrade will happen automatically in your Deluxe product (starting Feb 7th)", it turns out that this isn't true. When my tax form from an investment company was downloaded and Schedule D was recognized as needed, TurboTax directed me to pay an additional $30 for the upgrade, which I did. This was not supposed to happen per their own information. If you try to contact TT about it, their website will tell you the wait will be an hour or two.

title: It's funny -- I thought that Intuit people were smart as ...
content: I've used TurboTax since 2005. Now -- with Intuit's new policy, that penalizes freelancers -- I'm going to definitely switch. It's funny -- I thought that Intuit people were smart as far as money is concerned, but must conclude that they never fully assimilated the basic business truth that the greatest costs to a business are related to acquiring new customers. Anybody here have any good alternatives to Turbotax? I'm in-market now (and I gather that I'm not alone).

title: Goodbye TT, hello free H&R Block!
content: I'm sorry that I purchased TT Deluxe at $44.97 today before I read these reviews. I don't need the schedules this year (it's a good thing because having to pay almost double the amount to file them is ridiculous!) but the principle behind the price gouge rubs me the wrong way. I was happy to find that H&R Block will give me a free Deluxe version of their product and it's getting good reviews so I'm no longer a TT gal! I have been a long time TT user (since 1997) and always enjoyed the ease of being able to import all of my previous years info, give it a couple of tweeks and be off and running. This long term relationship has come to an end. Even though I purchased the product, I won't be using it, I'll give it to my daughter or my son to enjoy this year and encourage them to use H&R Block next year . This year I'll be using H&R Block (free of charge of course) to see what they offer. All it took was a simple email sent to SwitchToBlock@hrblock.com with the info they asked for: Name, address, and phone number Type of operating system in use (Windows/Mac) A photo, scan, or email showing proof of TurboTax Basic or Deluxe purchase and I get a free download of their deluxe program. Here's hoping that the Block is much less greedy than Intuit and works hard to keep their customer base. Next year I'll need those schedules so keep me happy Block...happy customers are repeat customers. And Intuit, the smoke and mirror show you keep blowing because you think people won't see through it.....it's not working. Removing the schedules and charging more didn't make it easier for anyone but you. I didn't use the schedules last year (even though I bought the deluxe version) and all I had to do was skip those sections, I wasn't inconvenienced in the slightest. You purposefully left off the "important" changes from the cover of the package hoping that people would just purchase the product even though it had changed. If you flip the cover over, on the top of the product is a small (I mean small...like maybe 1/4") orange strip with tiny words that say "! New- Some features are now only available in these versions of TurboTax" and then product descriptions listed below that. The fact that the Deluxe version only has 2 sections in the descriptions is what made me get online and start looking around and lead me to Amazon reviews...wish I would have done it BEFORE I had hubby bring it home.

title: Caveat Emptor!!!
content: Even though I never used the parts that are now missing from the 2014 Deluxe version, I cannot believe a company would de business this way. Instead of adding features or making the Premier/Home & Business versions better to entice customers to purchase, they take away features in the base version that a vast majority of people use. This is an absolutely piss-poor way of doing business and a way you can let Intuit know you feel this way is to either not buy the software (duh) or leave a nice 1-star review. Hell, feel free to copy/past my review if you don't feel like writing anything. F-you, Intuit!

title: I have used turbotax for years, I don't even ...
content: I have used turbotax for years,I don't even have any itemized deductions anymore. The last two years after entering all my deductions, Turbotax says to take the standard deduction. I will not support a company that uses shady tactics to rip us off. After reading all reviews I will be going with H&R Block!

title: Switched to H&R Block Deluxe
content: I have been a loyal TurboTax Deluxe user for as long as I can remember. I have never used any other software. Changes to the 2014 Deluxe product have caused me to look for a different vendor. I loaded H&R Block Deluxe today and I think all will be fine with that program. It imported my Turbo Tax information from last year's return and the program looks like it will do what the old TurboTax Deluxe used to do. I think H&R Block should consider some kind of financial bonus for the TurboTax employee who came up with the idea for the changes to the TurboTax Deluxe program.

title: the 2000 + negative reviews sums it up best.
content: Yada yada yada....the 2000 + negative reviews sums it up best.

title: Changed and not for the better.
content: I'm one of the victims of the schedule D changes. They say they are offering $25, but the program wants to charge me $30 to "upgrade." I tried calling the 800 number that they have been posting. Waited on hold for a half hour before having to go and resume my life. I've never used the Block software but going to send the email and see what happens. Might as well test drive it. Worst case I can always end up "upgrading" my Turbotax if I don't like. Otherwise the same as past years, but a little more sluggish (and this on a new windows 8 machine that is plenty fast on non-Intuit software). It takes multiple steps to get past the marketing and handholding, but I know some like that. And it asks you the same questions over and over again even after you've said no once. Not sure what is up with Intuit. Quicken is becoming ungodly slow and bloated and now this. I'm disappointed.

title: Terrible
content: I've been using Turbo Tax for several years. This software release is by far their worst. I cannot do the state return. I try to download the necessary files and the software simply tells me it's up to date. Also, this isn't a new issue. If you google it, you'll see that several people have complained of the same problem. My expectations for TT were very low, but the product is so bad that I'm completely done with Intuit. Hopefully, H&R Block will be better.

title: TurboTax is "The New Coke"
content: Not only did they jack up the price for those that need Sch. D and E, but they made a user go through laborious Q&A rather than simply filling in a form. This product is certainly "New Coke." It is time to switch software.

title: One Star
content: Another twenty year TurboTax user who has switched to another product. Intuit has carried greed a bridge too far.

title: Total crap this year
content: Total crap this year. I'm supposed to pay more now to do my return or figure out how to file by paper? No thanks.

title: BEWARE of changes to what TurboTax Deluxe will not do now!!
content: BEWARE!! TurboTax Deluxe will not let you file a Schedule C or D! This is a change from last years TurboTax. After you buy the Deluxe version and expect to file your return the same as last year, you find out you have to pay $40 to upgrade so you can file the Sch C or D. What a rip-off!!

title: You just lost a 25 year customer with bait and switch tactics.
content: I have been a faithful Turbo Tax user since the late '80s when it was just a glorified spreadsheet. I have been able to do my somewhat complicated tax return with the TT Delux $39.95 product from Costco that included the state filing. Now according to Turbo Tax's web site I need to purchase a product that will cost $149.95 from them with their generous $10 discount. I'm not even sure what product this is. If you buy TT Delux 2014 and expect the functionality you've had for years, you'll be surprised to see you need to do a $30 upgrade to get forms C, D, and E. What underhanded bait and switch crap! Not only has Intuit lost my TT business to H&R Block, but I will not upgrade Quicken either. Intuit, you've lost a 25 year customer by this underhanded move. Don't expect me back.

title: RIP Turbotax - You're Dead to Me Now (Turbotax user since 1996)
content: I've been a loyal Turbotax Deluxe customer since 1996, with only occasional minor gripes about the software functionality. But, this latest move to de-content the product (removing Schedule D, specifically, for me) is a deal-breaker. What a huge corporate blunder. I'm changing to H&R Block.

title: Glad I read the reviews
content: Well here's another lost customer. Glad I read the reviews. I have been using TT for years, like so many others here. It is so automatic I even had to check my last return, but yeah, some of my investments call for using schedule D. So I am now the proud owner of HRB. Since I will be using that product this year, even if TT reverses their bad decision, I will probably stick with HRB from now on.

title: EVEN WITH PARTIAL ADMISSION, INTUIT CONTINUES TO LIE
content: I have previously reviewed this year's Turbo Tax but needed to follow up. First, I refuse to buy another version of Turbo Tax. Intuit cheated long-term customers. Plain and simple! Now, after months of trying to cover that up, their General Manager of the Turbo Tax division, Sasan Goodarzi, "begins" to confess. He admits that they "messed up". However, he lies and claims two things: 1) that Turbo Tax has not lost any market share because of their mess up. NOT TRUE. All you have to do is look at the more than 1,600 customers on Amazon that gave them a one-star rating. Many of US have already purchased H&R Block's tax software, and MANY of US will never go back to Turbo Tax. 2) that they had already decided to offer "deep discounts" BEFORE THE USER REVOLT. It is just plain pathetic that someone would make those two false claims publically. All you have to do is read the reviews going back for the past several months to see that those deep discounts were NOT being offered. Instead, they attempted to explain away their violation of customer trust and loyalty. I will pass on their "deep discount" because I have already completed my 2014 tax return with H&R BLOCK's software and found it just as user friendly and much cheaper. I will continue to be an H&R BLOCK customer, that is as long as they don't pull the same kind of dirty trick that Intuit did.

title: Intuit squeezes customers in greed-driven move
content: As a long-time user of TurboTax, I was about to order this year's program. When I started reading all the negative reviews, I quickly decided that I will not be using this software for tax preparation this year. It appears that Intuit has adopted the "shrinking usability and upgrade option" that they have employed with their other software "Quicken". This is a transparent move by corporate honchos to squeeze every penny possible from loyal customers. I, for one, refuse to be squeezed. I

title: Rip-off
content: They've crippled the product.

title: Former Loyal Turbo Tax User
content: I am a 18+ year loyal veteran of various versions of Turbo Tax. I need Schedules C & D. For security purposes I prefer to download a copy to my desktop and not use a web based version. There are times I have had to file Amended Forms. It's easy when you still have a disc. I just bought a copy of Deluxe, but fortunately have not opened it. It is time to see what the competition is offering. Thanks Intuit, you just lost another loyal customer. Reading the other reviews, I am not alone. I guess I am not the type of customer they want to target.

title: Disappointed
content: This is not the good software of old. I was disappointed in using TurboTax Deluxe in 2013. It no longer sorted dividend payers alphabetically, and inserting trade totals was more easily reported from an IRS Schedule D. Now that the Deluxe 2014 has fully removed Schedule D, I bought H&R Block 2014 Deluxe for the first time in over a decade. So far I'm happy with this easy to use software.

title: I don't like that Intuit has removed Schedule C from the Deluxe ...
content: I've used Intuit TurboTax for the past 20 years. I have a small business and need Schedule C. I don't like that Intuit has removed Schedule C from the Deluxe Edition. I think maybe this year I'll give H&R Block's Tax Cut software a try instead.

title: I believe it will be best. If
content: I addressed my complaint in the form of an email. (turbotax_advocate@intuit.com) I received an immediate reply by the VP and he stated: "We are days away for sending out a communication acknowledging our mistakes and what we plan to do. If you can wait a few days for that communication, I believe it will be best. If, however, you need to upgrade now please let me know and Iâll arrange for the upgrade." I waited a couple of days and requested the upgrade. That was last evening. So far, I have not received it. I read an article regarding this situation today stating, (quoting VP Meighan speaking to Forbes), if you demand it, you get it, otherwise TT will only do what they have to. (I'm paraphrasing) I choose not to be a jerk. I'm one of those people that just quietly go away which also means there is a chance they are misreading my lack of being a jerk means I'm a pushover....their loss. Based on their online fix for the situation, it is calculated much like a typical rebate. Statistically people are lazy with following up on rebates and I'm sure that TurboTax knows that. TT could have easily charged $5.00 for the Premiere upgrade, but chose instead to charge $30. and then rebate $25. after filing only to those who filed their 2013 taxes on TurboTax. Although this marketing blunder only affects those who require specific schedules, other Deluxe users will never notice. Monetarily TT may come out just fine. If not, I suspect some heads will roll. In the meantime, I choose to politely wait and see what they do compared to what they say. At this point, I have no reason to believe it won't work out, but either way, I'll let everybody know how it turns out.

title: Greedy B@stards....ITS NOT ALL ABOUT THE STOCK PRICE!!!!!!!!!!
content: I filled out ALL the home office information and SHOULD have been told that Schedule C was NOT included......the software should be smart enouph to see that if I filled out the home office info that I need that form and I should have been FORCED to upgrade,,,,,instead I file and later see NO schedule C....WHAT!!!!!!!! Now I have to file an amended return.......greedy bast@rds needed MORE money to satisfy the F@cking shareholders....THis country blows now........

title: TurboTax changed so am I
content: This year TurboTax changed, I am also changing to H&R Block. cost less and does more. I have been using TurboTax for many years looks like it is time to change to a more affordable Tax software.

title: Goodbye TT it has been nice knowing you
content: DO NOT PURCHASE THIS PRODUCT. Have used Turbotax Deluxe for >17 years and now they have reduced it's functionality. Can't even file the most basic Schedule D with a couple of stock sales. How can they call it the Deluxe version when it is less than basic. Going to H&R Block. They are providing a free copy of their Deluxe (which actually is Deluxe) software to Turbo Tax users that have purchased Turbotax Deluxe 2014. Goodbye TT it has been nice knowing you. Oh by the way H&R Block is less expensive than TT.

title: Bad move, Intuit
content: Bad move, Intuit. For the last 10 or so years I've given several people TT for a Christmas gift every year, but no longer. The product is too crippled and too expensive. "Deluxe" is not much better than 1040-EZ at this point. But the larger point is this: TTs target market is people who: 1. Are smart enough to do their own taxes 2. Are cheap enough to endure doing their own taxes. Did you really think these changes were going to go unnoticed? Stupid.

title: after 8 years of giving them chances, I AM DONE!
content: didnt include state. I had already thrown away money buy the business and personal for myself, which took all day to get my prior year returns due to Intuit's business model of Locking prior year returns. Anyway i had paid for this deluxe for my wife, and of course had to uninstall the other 2014 turbotax business, then install this. At the end of it all they are trying to make me pay for state again (another $39) so im sitting here on hold (21 minutes so far) waiting to even deal with this. Garbage company. Garbage software. they dont keep your taxes in cloud, the ipad app doesn't transfer to the pc, or the online. And its the most expensive on the market. If they ever go out of business, i will cheer just like i did when Blockbuster did. Go elsewhere. *****UPDATE after half an hour on the phone waiting, i was promptly transferred to another agent, so now i am on hold again because the first person only helps recover passwords.. Yea seriously. So their software directed me to the wrong person. This is the WORST company I have ever dealt with, hands down. Dear god dont pay them, do ANYTHING else, it has to be better.

title: Dissatisfied Long Time TurboTax Customer
content: So TurboTax product line goes from the free "Federal Free Edition" to "Deluxe" and in the process drops supports for Schedule D (along with other schedules) for capital gains and loss. [...] There's nothing between FREE and DELUXE per the Intuit website? What's so "Deluxe" about the deluxe version if your dropping capability that's been available for years. I've been using TurboTax for years 15+ but I guess to voice my dissatisfaction it's time to change to H&R Blocks offering... Goodbye Intuit !!! [...]

title: Bye TurboTax
content: I'm real disappointed with Intuit. I have been a faithful user of TurboTax for nearly 15 years (Deluxe Version). Now I find out that in their great wisdom, they have removed the Schedule D from the Deluxe Version, forcing people to buy the more expensive Premium Version. GREED. I, for one, am dumping TurboTax this year and moving over to H&R Block Deluxe Version which still includes Schedule D. Bye TurboTax. I'm guessing this decision will really hurt your bottom line.

title: Sleezy move by Turbo Tax - Go with H+R Block for a lot less money
content: What a sleezy move removing the schedule D from the deluxe edition. Go with H and R for a lot less..

title: Have been using Turbotax Deluxe for over 20 years, ...
content: Have been using Turbotax Deluxe for over 20 years, and am really mad about the changes this year forcing me to buy Premium. Agree with everyone else -- major ripoff and gouging by Intuit. Apparently now, after all these complaints, Intuit is trying to recover, and offering a $25 rebate to people who used Deluxe in previous years and now have to use Premium -- but only AFTER you buy Premium AND finish/file your taxes with it. Am going to switch to H&R Block.

title: just like every year before that
content: Today was the day to get my copy of TurboTax Deluxe, just like every year before that. Then I saw the abysmal reviews and thought "what is going on here". When I had to start doing my taxes, TurboTax was the program I started with. Way back in 2004. My dad used the program, I used the program, and it worked really well. I have no qualms with the interface of the software. This whole mess with the Deluxe version is just confusing. It sounds like I'd be okay with the software in regards to interest and dividends, as long as I didn't sell any stock or mutual funds. Then you have to buy the Premier version (for $80). So, am I going to have to bounce around between versions each year on the chance that I've sold a stock? Taxes are confusing as is, now this malarkey. No thanks. Someone at H&R Block was sure smart and dropped their price big time to scoop us all up. Well, it worked, I switched.

title: Appalling Management Decision
content: Appalling. Change the rules with no warning and prevent your customers from doing their taxes as they have for years unless they cough up an additional $40. I just want my money back and go elsewhere but that's not an option. I can't do anything about it until I reach them at their convenience. Used Turbotax for over a decade and this will be my last year. Unbelievably stupid management decision. I guess they'll make their bonus this year and move on as next year will be bleak for Intuit.

title: Run away.
content: Nowhere does it say that Schedules K-1 was removed from the Deluxe version. This was a total waste.

title: Turbo Tax User for 23 years - BUT NOT ANY MORE!
content: I'm going to switch tax preparation software after 23 years because Turbo Tax made the bone-headed move to gouge its customers. Basically, the Deluxe edition is only useful if you have W2 wages and itemize your deductions which probably covers most of Turbo Tax's customers. But, if you have investments or a business you have to purchase the Premier edition to be able to file your return. I'm sure Turbo Tax's competitors are having a field day with this marketing misfire!

title: bait-and-switch scam. stay away
content: I had been a loyal customer of deluxe for past 5 years. This year deluxe is basically stripped down so much it is equivalent to the (free) basic version of the past, while having to pay for it! This is a bait and switch scam where they trick you to buy and force you to upgrade to get basic functionality. I am very disappointed in this product. I received a free H&R DVD and although they are not as good as the TT in doing tax, I am forced to switch because Premier is out of my price range.

title: Deluxe version seem very unstable, according to TT update my software is fully updated
content: This year's software appears to have lot of bugs in it at this time. I had property tax information not reporting to the correct form and no way to correct in. Certain step-by-step prompts have disappeared, never to be seen again even after deleting the information. Missing MD forms are causing the program to loop, can't get pass the missing form or clean review. At this time, 2/11/15, I'm questioning whether any of the returns I've done so far are accurate, I'm going to wait another week or two before filing to see if future updates have any impact on this application - regardless of the updated I will be printing all returns out and manually reviewing for accuracy. For this tax year, at this point in time, you might look to another software provider. I've used TT since the early 90's and by far this year's version has been the most unstable version I've ever used. I will look at other packages next year

title: Good bye Turbo Tax!
content: I'm a long time Turbo tax user that just switched to HR Block...Sorry Turbo tax, I will miss you!

title: One Star
content: No capital gains support in TT deluxe? Forgetaboutit! This loyal customer is looking elsewhere.

title: Stealth TurboTax cost increase
content: A user since Intuit first offered it; they screwed all the Sched C, D and E users by upgrading to Home & Business. Called the 800 # and received a free upgrade, but next year I most likely will switch. The Intuit customer rep admitted they should have re-named Deluxe "Deluxe Light". I would call it Deluxe Minus. Intuit's goodwill took a serious hit. Let's see if they backtrack on next years' offerings. HRB and TaxAct, I am sure, are chomping at the bit to take market share.

title: Greed, plain and simple for a very basic software program.
content: Lets face it, this program is not Warcraft, Simcity 3D or MS Office, but a very basic text program that has always been expensive. But this latest b.s from Intuit is just plain immoral and greedy. I have been using TurboTax since 1998 and have officially switched over to H & R Block. Thanks Intuit, I hope you get screwed from this.

title: I'm switching to H&R Block
content: Very disappointed ! removing important features from product without any warning, that's not acceptable. I'm switching to H&R Block, they offer free software to TurboTax users.

title: TurboTax loses another customer
content: I have been a loyal user of the TurboTax Deluxe for the past 15 years. I could have used the basic version except I needed to submit Schedule K-1. Unfortunately, Intuit has removed support for that particular form, requiring me to upgrade to Premier at nearly double the cost of Deluxe. I will miss the auto-population of my forms this year that has been my sole reason for staying loyal to the product for so long.

title: Rip off
content: I hate turbo tax. They change what is included and every year just to annoy their customers.

title: a 20-yr user of TurboTax -- it's now time to move on
content: Adding my negative vote I've been a regular TurboTax customer since 1993, back when my Gateway 486 DX2 66MHz was the cat's meow. Based on their actions, Intuit can now find another sucker -- like many on this forum, I recently decided to move on to H&R Block's software. As one reviewer ("lar") wrote, the free upgrade offer from Deluxe to Premier is likely a temporary offering, in an attempt to quell the customer uprising. Capturing such a large market share has apparently left good ole VP Bob Meighan and the rest of the Intuit C-suite giddy and greedy. Their collective arrogance has led them to pursue a business growth model that calls for customer manipulation via a "boil the frog" strategy. I don't know about the rest of you, but I'm jumping out of the pot before it's too late.

title: It looks like the $25 refund if you upgrade is not available ...
content: It looks like the $25 refund if you upgrade is not available until you file your 2014 taxes. I gather Intuit is hoping you will forget or buying their product is not enough. They also still list TTDeluxe as the most popular choice for complex tax situations which leads one to believe they really don't care about their customers. Goodbye Intuit Hello HRB. Hope your market share is destroyed and you get done to you what you have done to your customers.

title: Farewell, Intuit
content: After reading the reviews, and then comments from Turbo Tax VP like 'call us so we can get you the right product at the right price', and the, IMO, totally bogus reasoning for it, I will be switching. I was an early adopter of Turbo tax, beginning well before the Intuit years. I need both Sched D and Sched C, and am not even clear which of the more expensive versions I need. Moot at this point as I'm sure I can find a reasonably price competitive product.

title: Been using this product exclusively past few years & while I never agreed with the price of it to begin with ( unnecessarily exp
content: Was going to buy it until I read the reviews. Been using this product exclusively past few years & while I never agreed with the price of it to begin with ( unnecessarily expensive ) I still went with TurboTax every single year. Not anymore, for what its worth it'll be cheaper have a tax expert do your taxes instead of buying this new version which is stripped of all the essentials old one had. Yet another loyal customer lost.

title: Long time user, no more.
content: It's not bad enough that Intuit is now forcing customers to buy the premier version for what has always been a deluxe feature, but just try to get them on the phone to make good. Bah! I'm going to use the deluxe box as a target and go buy H&R Block's deluxe package, which does everything that I need at a price less than TurboTax.

title: Darwin Award Winner
content: I have heard about how much Intuit angered their loyal customers. As a loyal customer myself, I now fully understood what a STUPID move they made. Whoever came up with the idea to remove certain features from the Deluxe version is certainly qualified to be a Darwin Award winner under the "Excellence" category.

title: Thank you all and Good Bye Turbo Tax...
content: Thank you all for the great feedback. I have bee a loyal TT customer for over 10 years as well as a loyal Amazon customer. Consumer power is here. I was shocked at the percentage of consistently bad reviews and additionally disgusted at the condescending tones in the company responses. A smart business would hear the voice of its customers and provide a quality product that is useful at a competitive price. TT needs to understand the industry..you guys aren't the only providers out there and your software, while convenient, can be improved upon by a different vendor...and has been as well as offered for a better price. I was just ready to purchase this year's TT and will not be doing so after reading through these reviews and responses, I will re-post this review on HR Block's product when I purchase it. I'll also suggest that they take a look at these reviews and send the VP a thank you note for all the new business and free marketing. I have directed all of my personal and business contacts here and to HR Block to read and make their own decision. Frankly, it wasn't a tough one. Turbo Tax..take a look at all of the loyal customers you have LOST. Not only will you have to work on your product..you will now have to work extra hard to win these customers back again, if ever. I hope it was worth it.

title: Hello H&R Block!
content: Like other customers, and after 20 years of using TurboTax, I will be switching to the very reasonably priced H&R Block product. All because Intuit has now eliminated the IRS Schedules D and E. I would have stayed with TurboTax had Intuit not decided to eliminate these schedules from TurboTax Deluxe 2014.

title: No longer useful
content: I have used Turbo Tax for the last 5 years. It is ridiculous that they dropped schedules c and d from this. If your taxes are so simple that you don't need those and the other schedules than you shouldn't be buying this product. Use the $10-$15 products or do them for free online. I just don't see why they dropped that functionality as I can't imagine anyone needing the "deluxe" version anymore. I guess I have to switch to H&RBlock.

title: Sub-Deluxe
content: Loyal TT user no longer. Bait & switch. Luckily I read the reviews & returned mine before opened it. TT should have re-named the product to Sub-Deluxe. Jerks.

title: TurbTax Deluxe not that Deluxe as of 2014 (read the reviews) buyer beware.....
content: Wow, I am glad I read these reviews about the 2014 version of TurboTax Deluxe. I am not putting in every Stock Sale manually (capital gains) and then can't electronically submit my return. Been using Turbo Tax Deluxe for many, many years. I am looking for something else this year. I am not paying for less. It should be the other way around. Intuit needs some new management to guide the company.....

title: I am certainly glad I read the reviews
content: Well, I am certainly glad I read the reviews! Definitely will not be buying TurboTax this year. Extremely disappointed in the changes and the fact that I would have to buy the premier version and still not have the forms I need. Oh well, their loss is another tax services gain. Goodbye TurboTax after 18 years of my loyalty. You blew it big time!!!!

title: No Longer Worth Buying
content: Turbo Tax is a great program. I've used it for years. However, I am no so completely put off by its most recent move to force you to buy the overpriced Premier version. For 15 or 20 years the Deluxe Version has always included support for the most important schedules and forms. But this year TT decided to drop support for Schedule D. Essentially you have to buy the Premier Version to get this fairly simple form which merely carries over the information from other forms which TT wants you to enter. Too cheesy for words. If they had just raised the price of Deluxe I would have been OK. Everyone needs to make money. But they're just being annoying by removing a form which you could fill out yourself and which wouldn't cost them anything to include. Bush league in the extreme. Hard to see why you'd want to deal with a company that thinks so little of its customers. I would definitely look at the HR Block software. It's probably every bit as good and, AFAIK, includes all relevant schedules.

title: I tossed the POS back and am glad I did
content: Hey Intuit, this is going beyond online chatter. I had this in my cart at Costco today, and some other customer walked up and told me I should check the online reviews and reconsider if I expected to file Sch D. I tossed the POS back and am glad I did. I used TT for about 14 out of the past 15 years but no more. I tried Block's product about 5 years ago when the price difference was about $10 and found the products similar in capability, really I liked TT's look and interface a little better back then. However this year I started the online version and even the appearance looks lame now (no longer intuitive, more like an interface built for a child). Thanks for the insult Intuit, see ya later. No way I'm shelling out for Premier just for a handful of stock trades.

title: I've been using Turbo Tax for years and have always ...
content: I've been using Turbo Tax for years and have always just done the automatic renewal. I was not told there would no longer be a schedule C nor was I told that filing the state return was no longer included. I will not be using TT any longer! This is a bait and switch if I ever saw one, but they'll only get away with it for short time...we have other options, people!

title: Loyal Customers Leave while Intuit gets greedy.
content: I have been a loyal Turbo Tax customer since 2000 because I thought it was a good value. With the most recent changes H&R Block and Tax Cut are better buys for your money. Hopefully they can win back my business next year.

title: Intuit Marketing Nightmare
content: After years of using the Deluxe version I am being forced to upgrade to the Premier version. I assure you I will seek other companies products and counsel my clients to do the same. Not a nice company!

title: LAME AND SNEAKY
content: Totally lame to have dropped schedules that most customers need. I've used this for almost 20 years and am SUPER ANNOYED. I usually like to order early in January, but am going to wait to see if they fix this mess. Someone in PR or strategy there seriously messed up this time -- it's never a good strategy to take a few key pieces out of a product so you can stick it to the customer.

title: TURBO TAX DELUXE IS A RIP OFF!!!
content: TURBO TAX (Intuit) has had my email address since I began using TurboTax. I have used TurboTax since it was first introduced and before that, JK Lasser's Tax guide. Did TurboTax make an effort to tell me the version I have been using (DELUXE) would no longer allow me to use Schedule D? NO!!! I had to discover this when I started entering my income data. This is an unconscionable movement to make loyal customers spend more money. It is $30 to upgrade on line to Premier. I will find another product that suits my needs rather than upgrade to the Premier product and NEVER buy TurboTax again. If you have invest income/loss DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT!!

title: One Star
content: Schedule C was removed from this release.

title: Greed has finally caught up.
content: I was going to purchase for this year's taxes and see it is not happening. When I see over 2000 negative reviews when last year it was the opposite. Wow hope others will follow and move on to show they cannot just do as they wish. To expect the consumer to continue using out of necessity.

title: No thanks!!!!!!!!!!
content: I have been using TT for years. However, I'm done with them. I'm not paying this price and all upgrades that come with it. Intuit, shame on you!!!!

title: Bad move to change the product Turbotax
content: Purchased H&R Block. I'm never looking back. 12 year turbo tax user. Bad move to change the product Turbotax!! This will be a hard lesson learned.

title: It's ridiculous and insulting that the 1099A support was removed ...
content: It's ridiculous and insulting that the 1099A support was removed from this edition of Turbo Tax and put into a version that costs twice as much. Vote with your dollars, and use Tax Act instead this year.

title: It looks like Intuit heard loud and clear
content: It looks like Intuit heard loud and clear. They're offering a $25 discount if you bought deluxe 2013 and you have to upgrade to premium to get the schedules omitted for this year. Just thought I'd post this.

title: Consider other options before buying TurboTax
content: Let me add my voice to the chorus of people who are disappointed with Intuit's decision to eliminate Schedule D from the deluxe version. A lot of ordinary folks need that form. I've used TurboTax for years even though it was usually more expensive than similar products. This year I switched to H&R Block software.

title: Stupid Business Mistake
content: Goodbye Turbo Tax, your sneaky way of changing your product is unethical at best and really shows your lack of dedication to your customers base, it actually is a insult to our intelligence. Believe me you will pay for this mistake financially, the exodus of your customer base will be remarkable. I do feel for your rep staff, they are getting blazed by people because of your arrogance.

title: A Once Excellent Product Now GUTTED! Do Not Buy!
content: One star only because you can't give no stars. They removed the functionality for BASIC FORMS that are used in filing tax returns. Of course, you can pay extra, and actually be able to file your taxes. Meanwhile, this Vice President Meighan just spouts corporate gibberish. My favorite was "While this may be irrelevant to you, it will become an issue for many others in the future..." Clearly this may be irrelevant to Turbotax, but it will become an issue for them in the future as multitudes of users become FORMER users. It will be interesting to see if they do the right thing. Don't hold your breath. So far, platitudes. Disgusting.

title: Sleazy Marketing
content: Unbelievable that Amazon and Intuit would stoop so low as to change the product in a major way and not advertise. I either have to spend $30 more dollars, making my total purchase even MORE to include my rental property filing which I have done with deluxe for the past 20 years!!! I think Amazon should post a notice on the site to warn customers and they should post an open letter indicting they think Intuit's marketing isn't at the standards that Amazon thinks it should be. I will NEVER buy Intuit products again.

title: A question of Ethics
content: I have used this product for many years but based on questionable ethics I may have to reconsdier this year Business logic (with a few exceptions) is quite simple and can be boiled down to three choices Charge more for the same Charge the same for less Charge more for less Iâll leave as an exercise for the reader as to the most likely choice.

title: Another Convert to H&R Block
content: Like some other commenters, I had always counted on the base version of quickbooks to include a schedule C. I have a small business, and it is a basic income-expense kind of business and I don't really need any enhancements beyond this basic reporting. Now I would have to buy their most expensive product. Frankly I am not surprised that Intuit raised the price and lowered the features. Intuit is all about itself. They don't give two hoots about little businesses. I also subscribe to their enhanced payroll service, and that keeps going up in cost all the time too. I pay our employees on a weekly schedule because that frequency is what our employees need for their family budgets. (Singles, Single mom's, and young families) Intuit has started slamming me with extra fees for running each payroll and now is charging for direct deposit. They are a bunch of crumbs who roll over little businesses once they get their hooks in. Well, I am not going to take it any more. I am moving to H&R Block, AND I am going to take a second look at Zen Payroll Systems. To heck with Intuit and turbotax and any other products they have- I hope others will follow me. Good Bye !

title: One Star
content: Rip off, because they removed Sched D and forced you to pay for next level

title: Yet another soon-to-be ex-TurboTax user
content: Well, I'll be yet another longtime TurboTax customer who will be migrating to H&R Block or another alternative. And i"ll be doing it not just because of the ridiculous price increase, which amounts to near-double; and not just because of the weaselly way in which it has been implemented (nice to find out half-way through your return; thanks, Intuit!); but as much because of the intelligence-insulting, ex post facto "explanations" that the flacks at Intuit have been spouting in response to what seems to be a torrent of complaints. One such flack, VP Bob Meighan, has claimed in a response to a reviewer that "most simple C filers receive a Form 1099-MISC that requires them to file Sch C even if it is for a one-off job or a temporary consulting job. For them, they really don't have expenses. That was the reason we provided the simple Sch C filing functionality in all TurboTax products from Deluxe up." Well, I am one of the many filers posting here who *does* have expenses; I file Schedule Cs for independent contractor/freelance work for myself and for my wife. I warrant that's a fairly typical use of Schedule C in the Deluxe version of TT, and now Intuit expects me to pay an additional $30 charge that they've snuck in the back door for the sake of "consistency?" Really? I don't think so; not when there are viable alternatives out there.

title: It's not just Deluxe! According to this WSJ article ...
content: It's not just Deluxe! According to this WSJ article, Intuit did the same with TurboTax Basic. They removed functionality, and if you want that, you'll have to pay more. http://www.wsj.com/articles/intuit-kicks-a-turbotax-hornets-nest-1422149606 details this. Caveat emptor on all Intuit products.

title: Bought H&R Block Deluxe and love it.
content: Was loyal to Turbo Tax but no more! Bought H&R Block Deluxe and love it.

title: Not good enough. They should be offering a free upgrade ...
content: Schedules C and D not on here anymore? That's never been the case before and I've been using the Deluxe version for nearly 2 decades. Now Intuit is offering a $25.00 rebate for misled users?!? Not good enough. They should be offering a free upgrade to the Premier version instead of making existing users jump through any hoops.

title: Previously Included Schedules Missing and Asks that You Update for more $$$$$$
content: All I can say is thank goodness the place I bought TurboTax 2014 accepted my software return! I don't buy the "it's clearly labeled" and "it eliminates confusion" argument by the Corporate spokespeople - it's sounds like "we're sorry you are so stupid to be a loyal customer who expected us not to change the product features without renaming it." BTW I pulled out my 2013 TurboTax box and it has virtually the exact same selection guide on the back of the package that the 2014 version did. I have used the product for at least 16 years (I found a 1998 version bouncing around the house a couple of weeks ago) and I'll never use an Intuit product again. Why? Whether they intended it or not, I feel like I've just gotten the old bait and switch from them and feel totally ripped-off. I'm sure Intuit feels that is simply crazy and not justified, but anyone with a modicum of customer experience understanding knows this is irrelevant. I have one simple rule: if I walk away from a transaction feeling I received the short end of the deal, I never do business with that company again. It will be interesting to see what they do if/when this becomes more widespread and a bigger scandal than it is currently is....

title: Do not trust the $25 rebate offer
content: I decided to give TurboTax another chance when they offered the $25 rebate. I bought Premier, filed my taxes, and applied for the rebate. It tells me I am not eligible because I already selected their "free upgrade" which makes no sense, since I bought the Premier CD version. More debacles.

title: I've been loyal to TurboTax for over ten years. ...
content: I've been loyal to TurboTax for over ten years. I never explored other companies products before now but with the old "bait and switch" sales tactic at play it is time to explore other options. I will be buying the H&R Block software or another software provider but TurboTax will not be getting my business this year or in the future.

title: Bad, Bad, Bad
content: Can't get it to check for updates and have tried various ways as suggested on the internet with no success. Been a Turbo Tax customer for many years and after this mess that they sent out for 2014 I will starting using another brand of software because it looks like they are headed down the tubes.

title: Turbo Tax Deluxe Not So Deluxe
content: I have been using Turbo Tax Deluxe for years. Now this year stocks/bonds profits and losses are not included in the Deluxe version. After starting my taxes, I got a surprise that I'd have to buy Premier if I wanted to do my profits and losses. So in addition to the $39.99 for Deluxe I was forced to pay an ADDITIONAL $31.80 for Premier in order to finish my taxes...for a grand total of $71.79 PLUS the charge for efiling State. I feel totally ripped off.

title: Ex User Now
content: If the Deluxe does not do Cd, D, E and others, I will not pay twice the price to get functionality that has always been available at the lesser price. I am a long time ~20 year TT user, but I am now switching to HRB for a looksee. Goodbye TT.

title: Deluxe is worst than others basic
content: We have bought TurboTax for the last 10 years. Always Deluxe because of the Schedule D. Well we bought Deluxe this year and surprise, surprise, you now need Premier for another $30 for investment. I hope Intuit that you make enough this year because you have lost our business for the future. Greed is ugly.

title: Joining the switch
content: I don't know if enough people will migrate from Turbo Tax to offset the new revenue, but I hope so - perhaps not in year 1 but maybe over time. Have been a long time user of both QuickBooks and Turbo Tax and am looking to get away from both as Intuit doesn't move prices incrementally, they jack them up in big chunks.

title: Ditto! Ditto! to all the other reviews - reason is the same.
content: As a long time user of Turbo Tax, the changes to TurboTax Deluxe is very disappointing. In order to use this addition I now have to upgrade two versions to complete my taxes. I will switch to TaxAct or H&R Block to now do my taxes. Goodbye Turbo Tax. I am sorry you made the changes.

title: Where's that free upgrade?
content: They are now saying that "returning TurboTax Deluxe desktop customers who need to upgrade will be able to do so within the product for free, making it simple and seamless." Except they are not providing any instructions on how to do it, and I don't see any evidence that our copy of the software has upgraded itself. My advice is to save yourself the trouble and use some other tax software.

title: I had to puchase Premier, Turbo Tax to be ...
content: I had to puchase Premier ,Turbo Tax to be able to accept K-1 information from LLC's, Partnerships, and S-Corps. I could not not get a definitive answer from Turbo Tax before I bought the Deluxe. I telephoned and still had a problem as to how much Premier would handke the K-1 information. I cannot track" basis" automatically.

title: Bait and switch
content: Just found the 30 dollar upgrade surprise. Then to offer as a rebate 25 dollars and have to submit paperwork is shameful.

title: Doubled the price.
content: Don't bother. If you have investments, you need the premier version. In effect, they have doubled the price. Forget it.

title: H&R Block has better software and pricing
content: No longer will use TurboTax after being a loyal user for 20 years or so. H&R Block has better software and pricing, and they do not gouge the customer. Turbo Tax Deluxe is not "deluxe" if you need to upgrade for basic schedules (*C, D, E). Classic bait and switch by Turbo Tax, unless you read the fine print. Disgusting greed!

title: One more customer lost
content: Although I am typically opposed to writing reviews for products I have not purchased, I will add my one-star to the many already posted here as a warning for others. Like many others, I am not a small business owner, but I do trade a few stocks throughout the year. Yes, I know I can call the 1-800 number and speak to Bob's team to get a free upgrade to Premier, but I will not do so based on principal. The changes were made to "provide a consistent experience across all of our platforms".... you should be adding features to your other platforms, rather than removing them from your base software. Take a page from Amazon's book - serve your customer first, always, and the money will follow. TT, I am a "millennial" who will be paying taxes, and preparing them, for the next 50+ years. I used your software for the past two years, as it was recommended by family members - you might say I was getting into a purchasing habit. You've lost me and the many years of revenue I will provide to your competitor. No amount of "free upgrades" will change my view of your business practices. I'm glad I'm not as invested in your software as others here are.

title: Disappointed
content: So this is only the 3rd year I've done my own taxes and I can say for sure this has easily been the worst year for hidden extra fees and just all around disappointment. It's been stressful to the point where I really wish I just paid a consultant to do these for me. I'm young and stupid, I don't read everything I should apparently in the fine print. Seriously disappointed in myself and Turbotax.

title: Goodbye TurboTax
content: Wow, I was just about to buy the TurboTax Deluxe, as I have done for the past 20+ years, and I noticed for the first time the 1 star rating. After reading all of these reviews, there is NOTHING I can say that hasn't been said already. I am simply outraged and extremely disappointed with what they have done. This will serve as my petition and public notice that I will NOT be using TurboTax for my tax filing this year, I'm not interested in "discounts", I'm not interested in public apologies. I'm not interested in waiting until next year to see what TurboTax will do about this problem. I'm guessing nothing except for discounts to soften the blow. The automatic, generic-looking responses from VP Bob is giving the consumers a message that this problem is widely known and massive by comparison. It also gives a hint of suggestion that they are not interested in responding to the key issues that have been brought forth. We want answers. Don't you think your long time loyal customers deserve that? I guess not. Just fix it then! And MAYBE you will get your customers back. That's if we don't fall in love with another product that is not only cost competitive but gives the loyal customers what they need: The missing schedules which have always been standard with deluxe AT A FAIR MARKET PRICE and the loyalty, consistency and security we as tax payers need! Someone commented "didn't Netflix teach them anything?". The difference is Netflix took immediate action and fixed it. I think Turbotax is waiting to see what the cause and effect will be to their customers by this action. They gambled with the idea that too many people have trusted TurboTax for many, many years and are too reluctant to change. They banked on human nature. But in this economy? When do the consumers say enough is enough? With capitalism comes freedom of choice. I choose to go elsewhere. Start a new beginning. I don't know what will happen next year but I don't want to wait to find out that I should have made the change THIS YEAR. I will make the change now. I believe they plan to keep it this way since most consumers are Deluxe users and they are hoping they will "buy in" and accept the fact that buying the premier version will be their only option with no questions asked. We are smarter than that.

title: Whether I use TurboTax again after this year's debacle will depend on whether Intuit can do substantially better than the beyond
content: A very small royalty payment for an old book I wrote--a payment smaller than the cost of the upgrade from Deluxe to Premier even after the $25 rebate I will supposedly get--forced me to get an upgrade to Premier. What shabby disregard for longstanding customers--in my case since TurboTax first begun. Whether I use TurboTax again after this year's debacle will depend on whether Intuit can do substantially better than the beyond-lame, self-justifying statement that they thought was an apology. There was something deeply disturbing about the soul of a company and its leadership in the business ethics of this whole sordid affair, and that "apology" did nothing but underscore how disconnected Intuit apparently is from what most people expect as the bare minimum of honest and fair dealing. Tax time is unpleasant enough, especially having to contend with a tax code and bureaucracy that is severely broken. But getting poked in the eye and treated as an idiot by Intuit even before getting started really makes the whole experience particularly repugnant.

title: like I have for the past 11 years
content: Logged on to Amazon this morning to purchase TT Deluxe, like I have for the past 11 years. Was shocked to see 900+ one star reviews! Intuit must have changed ownership to take a reliable, valued product and turn it into a deceptive money grab. Thank you to the Amazon customers for saving me from an expensive mistake. Intuit, you lost my long time patronage. Goodbye. I see H&R Block Deluxe has high ratings and can import TT information. I encourage Amazon to drop Intuit products.

title: HR Block gets better reviews than TurboTax at consumer reports and is less ...
content: I have been using Intuit products since DOS. I stopped using Quicken due to their changes and now it's time to convert to HR Block for similar reasons. What marketing genius at Intuit came up with the new TurboTax 50%+ price increase. I do not own a business and only have a few investments outside my 401ks and now they want to gouge me because they think they can. Get Real! Note: HR Block gets better reviews than TurboTax at consumer reports and is less expensive through Amazon.

title: Major feature downgrade = pay more for less
content: For 2014 Intuit downgraded the feature set while raising prices and keeping the TurboTax Deluxe (TTD) name. The lack of clear notice and openness about it seems very deceptive, and this longtime TTD user is appalled. People like me have used TTD for years with Schedules C, D, and/or E and been able to e-file. Not this year. You wonât find interview questions for these forms in TTD. You can enter Schedules C and D tax data manually or by import but then may otherwise not realize it until ready to e-file that you must choose to either upgrade to Premier or Home & Business or paper-file using Deluxe (and forgo Intuitâs audit guarantee). Yes there's a phone number to complain and request a free upgrade. But if you read carefully, you see that there is no blanket free-upgrade policy. The Intuit executive here has said the free upgrade decision is made on a "case-by-case basis." Some have reported getting right through and being given a code to upgrade with no hassle. Others posted here that they canât get their request handled properly. Some people here said that they were offered only a partial discount or no discount. In my opinion this mess has been handled abysmally by Intuit to date. BTW: Think any loyal TTD customer will get a free upgrade next year? My money says: Nope. Just say no to TurboTax Deluxe. H&R Block Deluxe (HRBD) is a better choice. I know it seems like a hassle to change tax software youâre used to, but 2014 HRBD has been hassle-free. Nearly all 2013 TTD customers import their 2013 tax return to 2014 HRBD with no problem, although it may not work well with WinXP. (See reviews and comments for HRBD.) 2014 HRBD feels like 2013 TTD to most customers who have used both. HRBD costs less than TTD anyway and is a much better value in terms of the e-file-supported feature set.

title: Does not support Forms K-1; Product can't be returned through Amazon
content: Buyers should be aware that Deluxe also no longer handles all Form K-1s in its interview section. The program states that upgrade to Premier is required. (There was no mention of any "forms only" option.) I have no need of any sophisticated securities purchase and sale support or support for complex business accounting, but will apparently have to upgrade solely to get accurate input off of this one key tax form. UPDATE: I find TurboTax's response -- which is essentially that they have retained, but buried in the Forms mode, functionality for Form K-1 -- to be totally unpersuasive. If you're going to not support Form K-1 data for product symmetry reasons, then don't support it. If you are going to support Form K-1 data, then support it. You don't choose to eliminate maybe at most ten screens, but console customers by telling them if they are tax-savvy enough, they can still find a work-around by going to forms mode. (And I again reiterate, THE PROGRAM ITSELF DOES NOT TELL YOU THIS. When you try to enter a K-1 in the interview process (for which there seems to be an opportunity if you import last year's data), IT TELLS YOU ONLY THAT YOU MUST UPGRADE AND SPEND $30 MORE. No mention of the supposed forms-only workaround.) I requested a refund on 12/3 pursuant to Intuit's satisfaction guarantee. (Amazon directed me to this as the method for return; Amazon will not allow return of a downloaded product even if the description was misleading -- which also is a problem and a caution for any future purchases.) Still have not heard anything from Intuit about getting me my money back.

title: Never thought I'd switch to the "competition" because I've always liked TurboTax in the past
content: I have been using TurboTax for close to 20 years. Was just getting ready to purchase when I saw all the negative reviews and started reading. Will not be buying TurboTax this year and likely ever again. Never thought I'd switch to the "competition" because I've always liked TurboTax in the past. Now that they have become greedy money hungry grubs they will no longer be getting my money and countless others as I'm sure the negative reviews on Amazon only represents a small fraction of lost customers/revenue for Intuit.

title: Completely useless for me.
content: The changes to TurboTax Deluxe make the program useless. I've been using this program for years and bought it this year before I knew that Intuit had changed the program. Hopefully there really is an update by February 7th. I can't even file taxes for my 18 year old daughter without Premier.

title: 60% More To Get Schedule D in 2014! What a bonehead move by Intuit!
content: I have used Turbotax for many, many years. However, I will not use it again after Intuit's bonehead move to move Schedule D from Deluxe to Premier. I do not like being held hostage. Anyone who has used Schedule D in the past knows it is a simple matter of downloading all the info from your investment provider & computing the numbers. Intiut can try to spin this change so it looks like a benefit, but anyone who has used TT Deluxe in the past knows it is just plain & simple greed. H&R Block can't believe their good fortune!

title: I have used TT since the first edition. They ...
content: I have used TT since the first edition. They have a gravy train in that we have to buy a new program every year anyway. But to keep increasing the price and diluting the product forcing us to buy an upgraded version just to be able to file the return is greedy. Pigs get fat ... hogs get slaughtered.

title: One Star
content: I've requested a refund and I'm switching to the competitor.

title: I used TurboTax for years. I will find a ...
content: I used TurboTax for years. I will find a different program.

title: BYE BYE TurboTax ... Shame on YOU!
content: After reading these TurboTax reviews, and verifying the facts that TT is taking away functionality that I have used often during the MORE THAN 20 YEARS that I have been a TurboTax customer ... I must sadly join the very many folks, that I know, that are LEAVING TT after so many years of LOYALTY on our part. I "shake my head" at the AUDACITY of such POOR EXCUSES for the removal of these needed items, WHILE at the same time ... Telling us that we will SELL YOU BACK, WHAT WE JUST TOOK AWAY FROM YOU ... at a HIGHER PRICE, Of Course! What a lot of NERVE! I am also a long time customer of AMAZON (Though not as long as TurboTax) ... I would leave them TOO if they should show me such disrespect! Folks, this year ... will be a "TURBOTAX-FREE YEAR" for me!

title: Was shocked to come and see the negative reviews. ...
content: Was shocked to come and see the negative reviews. Something went wrong, I thought,I was shocked to see the changes they made, No schedule D? You must print it out? Give $30 more for premier? Call for the free upgrade to premier this year? Not happening. Goodbye turbotax.

title: Hate being deceived and ripped off!
content: For years I have been a loyal and satisfied user of Turbo Tax Deluxe. I used it for doing my taxes and my aging father's returns. Now I find that the ole reliable Deluxe version has disabled features that were essential to me, and that now cost an additional $30 or $40 if I want them. This is despicable product and market manipulation by Intuit, and I will now explore H&R Blocks software which I had never considered before. If I could give a minus-star rating I would in a heartbeat.

title: I hate the disabling of Schedule C
content: I hate the disabling of Schedule C, D, and E which were present in past versions of TurboTax Deluxe. Nice job Intuit... angering your loyal customers. Give your CEO a bonus!

title: Turbo tax sux
content: turbo tax - no way ever again! Two years in a row they gouged me in the middle of the process with a surpirse you need our up version and or the state level. There are other options without the deceptive tactics and mid process take it or leave price hikes. Intuition says zero stars!

title: What a rip off!!
content: Without any notice Turbo tax discontinued the schedule C,D and E in the deluxe version. I would never have bought it if I had known that. Way to alienate your customers TurboTax. The very least you could have done was print that information in large letters on the front of the package. I plan on returning my copy and going with another brand although I have been using Turbo tax for about 15 years.

title: No to TurboTax this year.
content: I saw TurboTax at Costco last week and considered getting a jump on tax season by making the purchase right then. However, a quick Google turned up this long chain. I'm going with a competitor product this season. If you don't protest with your dollar, Intuit will keep gouging us. UPDATE: Despite Intuit's remorse, I decided to HR Block Tax after 7-8 straight years of TurboTax. After reading some reviews on Amazon for HR Tax I was confident that it could import my 2014 TT without issues. The import went without a hitch and my simple tax return was filed without issue. Package was $24.95 + free federal and $19.95 for state filing. The price is less important than the sending a message to these companies that they can't gouge at will -- jacking up prices by taking making you pay extra for the value you used to get. Vote with your wallet.

title: The product is mostly good. But based on a lame attempt to disguise ...
content: Been using TT since the beginning, maybe 20 years or so. The product is mostly good. But based on a lame attempt to disguise an obvious whopping price increase, and the even weaker attempt to explain it, I purchased H&R Block software. To my surprise it works just like TT. No issues in importing last year's TT data, etc. So, the switch was easy. Perhaps should have considered this as an alternative some time ago instead of feeling captive. Painless to switch! Oh, and less money too! ! ! FYI - Purchased the download copy from Amazon.

title: I'm glad I took a look at the reviews
content: Wow, I'm glad I took a look at the reviews. Looks like I need to start researching alternatives. It's a shame. I had been a user of the software for the last 15 years. It's hard to believe Intuit got this greedy and decide to offer less value for a higher price.

title: Price gouge plus reduced features = H&R Block
content: Price gouge plus reduced features = H&R Block! Wow, I never thought I'd do this after using Turbo Tax EVERY YEAR since 2001!!! $50 for the Deluxe version of Turbo tax that has been stripped down and price gouged via Intuit and Amazon. I have NEVER paid this much for tax software, so I decided to jump ship after THIRTEEN solid years of using, and being happy with, Turbo Tax. Just read all the other ONE STAR reviews and you will see why I decided to try H&R Block's software for the very first time this year. H&R Block's comparable product is more than $10 cheaper than Turbo Tax, just for starters. Intuit started this crap this year with Turbo Tax and for quite a few years now they have FORCED you to buy an "updated" version of Quicken or else they would kill your online downloading abilities for your financial accounts. Bad business practices equals lost revenue. I would be willing to bet that the loss of customers far outweighs the extra profit they think they are going to make by raising the prices of their products and stripping out features... wait and see "marketing geniuses" at Intuit. You may not notice it this year, but wait until tax time next year.

title: Very frustrated by the removal of common and necessary forms ...
content: Very frustrated by the removal of common and necessary forms from this version in an attempt to force an upgrade to the more expensive version. After 15 years I WILL NOT stay with Turbotax for this year and will be purchasing another brand of tax software.

title: Deluxe doesn't cover stocks anymore.
content: Last year this product covered stocks. Now it doesn't. You have to buy the Premier version.

title: Dissapointing
content: Big disappointment that TurboTax completely changed this year and crippled support for what they have always had in years past. It comes as a shocker and makes one feel completely fleeced by Intuit.

title: Horrible design
content: I've been using Turbotax for more than 10 years and 2014 version is the worst. So, many glitches, makes doing taxes frustrating. I can't even transfer my 2013 taxes because it won't recognize my password and security question answer. I have both written down, so I didn't forget. Even when I try to open 2013 TurboTax, it asks for my password. I can't even get into 2013 to view or amend. 2014 TurboTax - where to begin with the problems.
