You can't even print forms that you want. Example: Schedule B if you are not required to file that form (less than $1500 in Int & Div) you can't even select to print it for your records. The new healthcare form 8965, it walks you through questions but if income is too low, you are told no penalties. It doesn't even ask for the Exemption Certificate Number that you need to file with your tax return. If you are not familiar with taxes, you could easily overlook necessary information because TurboTax doesn't require you to input the info. I've had frustration with every tax return I've done this year so far. Schedule D, C etc are not part of Deluxe version. You need Premier. But you can get free upgrade, except, info given by customer service is incorrect. I still have to figure out how to get my free upgrade. What a nightmare TurboTax has created. Whomever designed and authorized this end product needs to be fired. No excuse. The older versions of TurboTax 2010, 2009 etc were much better and easier to use. I didn't care for 2013 and 2014 is the worst. Edited: I got my free upgrade to Premier. In the Federal taxes - under Wages & Income - Investment Income 1099-B, Stocks, Mutual Funds etc - click Update. It will ask if you want to upgrade to Premier. click. Then it will say already paid for, click confirmation number. Call TurboTax number provided, they will ask for that Serial number and will give you a confirmation number free. Also, finally figured out how to print a form even if it's not required for filing. ie Schedule B in this case. Click Forms. Then 'Open Forms'. check on bottom left - 'open in separate window' at top in search box, type Schedule B( or whichever form of interest). Open. Click file. Print Front Window (Mac). This shouldn't be this difficult.

title: There are many good alternatives. I saw it coming in previous years' ...
content: They finally hit the tipping point, after 20+ years as a Turbo Tax user, I will switch. There are many good alternatives. I saw it coming in previous years' versions, the last-minute state filing charges and persistent upgrade offers.

title: Worse greedy corporate strategy to nickel and dime loyal customer
content: purchased Deluxe without knowing that Intuit completely crippled the 2014 Deluxe version. Worse greedy corporate strategy to nickel and dime loyal customer!!!! Time to switch to alternative! ADVICE TO INTUIT: Restore the original feature sets!!

title: Do not buy this!!
content: Another long time TT customer switching to H&R Block. Been using TT for as long as I can remember but I'd rather take the additional 1-2 hrs to learn a new system than pay Intuit another dime.

title: Sleazy move.
content: Trust is lost forever because of their sleazy move.

title: Goodbye
content: Thanks for the heads up! Time to change providers.

title: Take action against this rip off
content: Interesting article on the Forbes website about this screw over done by Intuit. [...] It gives a phone number to call and says Intuit can upgrade your software for free if they want to. Also HR Block is allowing people to get their software for free if you purchased TurboTax this year. Intuit claims the reason they made the change was to make the desktop version the same as the the online version. The online version doesn't have all the options as the desktop version (Schedule D, C, etc) Well Intuit, you had a choice to make the online and desktop versions the same. You could have either added what was lacking to the online version to make it the same as the desktop version or you could remove the extra features of the desktop version to make it the same as the online version. We see which option you choose. You chose the option that screws the customers and makes you more money. Your excuse of trying to make the two versions the same doesn't fly. Why didn't you just add what was missing to the online version. If you were going to take away features from the desktop version why didn't you reduce the price. Also i'm not seeing where TurboTax attempted to warn people they were going to be ripped off this year. If you had of informed people you wouldn't have all these angry people that got ripped off this year. Shame on Intuit. People need to move to other tax software and not let these people get away with this.

title: Long time formerly satisfied Turbo Tax Deluxe user but I can't recommend TurboTax ...
content: Long time formerly satisfied Turbo Tax Deluxe user but I can't recommend TurboTax Deluxe 2014. I get Intuit wanting to obtain more revenue but most businesses understand that they have to add capabilities and features that make the customer perceive he is getting more value for the higher priced item. Instead they are charging the same price as last year but are delivering a crippled product that can't do pretty basic tax functions like e-filing with a Schedule D or E. They are relying on their valued customers buying Deluxe again same as last year and only then finding out after they've opened the product and can't return it that they have to spend another $30 to get a product that actually works. This is outrageous from my point of view and you can only do this to me once. It is incomprehensibly stupid from Intuit's point of view. Intuit just handed a very large part of their loyal customer base directly to H&R Block on a silver plate.

title: Goodbye Intuit
content: I've used Turbo Tax for years. But this crud of removing Schedule D from the program just made me really mad. I bought H&R Block Tax Cut, and guess what? H&R Block Tax Cut imported my 2013 Turbo Tax info perfectly. and it's got a great, easy-to-use user interface. So, goodbye Intuit, forever. Intuit will never get a penny from me again. P.S. I am still using Quicken 2005. Why? Because it works well, does what I need, and is not filled with pushed advertisements and bloatware like more recent Quicken releases. Vote with your wallet. Buy old, good Intuit software from Amazon or Ebay, and not the crap that Intuit sells these days.

title: Turbo Lets Us All Down
content: As a Turbo Tax user for the past 10 years, I was shocked that Turbo would remove the Schedule C from Deluxe only to make more money off us small business owners. I do not need all the bells & whistles of Home and Business; just need a Schedule C. When I called Turbo to lodge my complaint, I was immediately offered a free copy of Home and Business and received an apology for not getting any advanced notice of the change. While I appreciate their efforts to appease me, do they really think that I will now be okay with having to spend $80 next year and the year after, etc. Turbo should have left their products alone. They were #1 in the industry. This was a bad business move on their part. For me, I will be looking for a new software provider.

title: Be sure the Deluxe version meets your needs . . .
content: I have been a TurboTax user for over 20 years, but I will be changing to H&R Block this year due to Intuit removing Schedule D support from the Deluxe version. I have very simple investment sales reporting needs and do not require help calculating capital gains/losses, etc (so do not require Premier version hand-holding). In the past being able to manually enter my info onto the Schedule D form that was included with the Deluxe version served my needs well, so I always stuck with TurboTax despite being more expensive than H&R Block. Also, while researching the H&R Block Deluxe version I found that for no additional cost they include professional support in the event of an audit. In the past this has been yet another extra cost item from Intuit and I would not expect it to be any different this year.

title: I've used TurboTax since 1988. I even stuck with ...
content: I've used TurboTax since 1988. I even stuck with them thru their DRM that hosed your hard drive. Now they keep the same name but remove functionality (schedule D & E). I'm going to have to return this version and check out the competition.

title: One Star
content: I hate being gouged, and I hate weasel word explanations even more. Nuff said.

title: Former TurboTax customer - will *NEVER* go back
content: I used TT for several years and found the software to be adequate for its purposes. I could certainly see opportunities for improvement but so long as I only had to use it once per year I was willing to put up with its deficiencies. That all changed a few years back as I started sensing pure and simple greed creeping into Intuit's policies and pricing structures. Their arrogance at ignoring their customers complaints is exceeded only by their consummate greed. I notice the same issues with their other products like Quicken. I can only hope this most recent 'misstep' will be their undoing, and their entire culture of corporate greed will be irrevocably changed. Upper management should be replaced. I also found their Super Bowl XLIX commercial about the Boston Tea Party to be insulting to our national heritage. Another example of their complete disconnect with their customers and way off base. Hopefully people will not accept their bribe to come back and will vote with your money to purchase any other competitors product from now on.

title: Good Luck on trying to take Intuit up on their offer to repair the damage
content: If you've read anything above this post you know about the out-pouring of anger and dismay that Intuit so thoughtlessly trashed its customer relationship. You may have seen the Intuit president's apology on-line and his promise to try and regain the good relations Intuit had. Regretfully, Intuit is continuing its stumbling. The Intuit website has posted the president's offer to upgrade the Deluxe software to Home and Business - essentially that restores Deluxe to the level of functionality that it has always had. Since the president of Intuit has had to publicly apologize for this fiasco, you would think they would do anything they could to recover the customer's faith and allegiance. Instead they continue to damage credibility The offer made by the president to make things right only appears in small print at the bottom of the intro page, hidden under an asterisk as though it were a dull legal disclosure document instead of an important offer. If you sincerely wanted to fix this wouldn't you make the offer in large, flashing letters? I searched the website and could not find anything. I called and was told by a cold, mechanical voice that I would get called back. That hasn't happened. I figured, well, we have a savvy tax and software giant so certainly there would be something in the purchase process that would kick in so I went through the entire process until just short of buying and nothing showed up. Folks, you can stay with a company that is so transparently unconcerned with customer relationships - except in empty platitudes - but for the first time in decades my tax return will be done by H&R Block. UPDATE. Finally got a call back from Intuit and was pleasantly surprised, considering. The lady at the other end of the line quickly got the necessary information and promised a mailed CD to update my Deluxe software to Home and Business capability. Delivery in two days. No additional charge. I still feel that the Intuit management stepped all over their ... well, anyway, it was a dismal performance but the intent to repair is now appearing. No change to the rating until I see what transpires but you can call 1-(888) 777-4160 to get the process started and good luck.

title: Really Bad Decision, Intuit
content: Like many, I have been a satisfied user of TurboTax Deluxe since the early 90's. But this year I plan to give H&R Block a try. I need Schedule C, D and K-1 and the ability to E-file but am not willing to pay the additional money to get them from TurboTax. I'm sure TurboTax will continue to serve you well if you have a very simple return. I am glad I noticed the poor rating this year before making my purchase. I would have been very upset if I had purchased TurboTax and stumbled onto these changes while preparing my return.

title: Ridiculous changes
content: Ridiculous changes. Intuit profits are gonna get hurt this year. I'm going to H&R Block Deluxe that has the expected forms and schedules included. If you already bought TurboTax you supposedly can get H&R Block software free by contacting them. Paper issued from ConsumerWorld.org about the changes Intuit made: http://www.consumerworld.org/pubs/ttprs.pdf

title: Boycott TURBOTAX for their Bait and Switch to Premier!
content: I'm NEVER using TurboTax again after this year's debacle of charging an additional $30 to upgrade to Premier just because I sold one mutual fund. They have shown tremendous arrogance and deceit in both their belief that we'll stick with them just because we always have, regardless of the cost.

title: Now using H&R Block and I am very happy. All info from Turbo Tax is crossing over ...
content: Have been a Turbo Tax customer for very many years and will never return to them after this "stunt". Just before buying the software this year I read the reviews and was shocked. I could not believe and did more research. Now using H&R Block and I am very happy. All info from Turbo Tax is crossing over very nice, nothing lost. Thanks for your reviews guys and keep us informed. This probably will be a good study case for how not to do business.

title: Turbo Tax Deluxe no longer supports Sch E so if you have rentals don't buy this!
content: This will probably be my last year using Turbo Tax. I bought it at Costco. I have used Deluxe version in the past and had little problems with it. Now after buying Deluxe I found that they no longer provide Schedule E as they had in the past. This is basically almost 100% increase in cost because I had to pay $30 to upgrade to premier. I'm going to try another competitor and if they are less money, I'll go with them. Make sure before you buy that you know what product you are going to need. If you have anything but a simple return this product will probably not work for you.

title: The Voice of Intuit's "Former" Customers is Loud and Clear!
content: Dear Intuit, The public is making its dissatisfaction clear. The result is currently, and hopefully will continue to be, reflected in Intuit's bottom line. The arrogance and apparent lack of concern regarding your now former loyal customer base is unbelievable. Customer service 101: The customer is always right! I may have just been one of the 20% that this brilliant decision affected, but 100% of my family is using H&R Block software this year. So, that 20% of customers you figured you could afford to lose is likely to be much more significant than your marketing geniuses anticipated. May I recommend a good resume writing product? It sells for a very reasonable $39.99 and for just $9.99 more, you can even print your finished resume! I know it seems silly to force customers to pay to print, but it seemed like the most effective way to eliminate the confusion created by providing a print capability when some of their customers don't own a printer.

title: Don't support crippled software!
content: Thanks for all the 1 star reviews! I almost bought this out of habit of 20 years. I'm glad I didn't buy a crippled piece of software. I bought H&R Block instead. How does it feel to lose a customer for life, Intuit?

title: Tubo Tax Lies When they say that you do not have to pay to upgrade!
content: I have no problem with the product. However, I received an email telling me that I would not have to pay to upgrade to TurboTax Premier if I needed it effective 2/7/15. However, I was required to pay $30.00 anyway. I was lied to. Do not believe TurboTax when they tell you that you will not have to pay to upgrade!

title: Turbotax free deluxe to premier upgrade polciy change
content: Intuit is going from bad to worse. I did get a free upgrade from TT Deluxe to TT Premier but my PC went dead. I reinstalled TT on another PC. I called to upgrade TT again. I was told that I had to pay $30 upgrade fee first an Intuit will send me a check of $25 after I e-file my return. What a joke!

title: Totally surprised at $49 charge to deduct electronic filing charge from Fed return
content: Totally surprised at $49 charge to deduct electronic filing charge from my Federal return. I was forced to accept Audit Defense at $44, which includes said charge.

title: I'm not at all happy. Next year I'll use the pen again
content: I just bought the 2014 deluxe version to estimate my taxes before selling several stocks. My overall taxes would be a simple 1040A if not for the sale of the stocks. Whether I had to mail in or could file electronically didn't matter to me. You can not enter any info in the Schedule D form to complete the taxes. I tried. Instead you must pay $30 to upgrade. And no it is not clear on Amazon or Intuit's web site that you can not enter the info. I'm not at all happy. Next year I'll use the pen again, no more TT.

title: Not a normal competent tax program
content: To get a normal competent tax program from TurboTax, you have to get the highest priced Home and Business version. The other versions cannot do normal forms such as Schedule C for business or Schedule D for stocks. I don't like being forced into an upsell. If Intuit's software developers are as dumb as their marketing execs, there are probably a lot of errors in the programs as well.

title: Bye, bye TurboTax
content: I've used TurboTax Deluxe for years, and it was great. Intuit's marketing manipulation for 2014 is despicable. This year I've switched. Bye, bye Turbotax.

title: Will be using HR Block after10 years buying TurboTax
content: Their lousy $25. rebate program does me no good at all since I don't file electronically. Lost a customer for life.

title: TurboTax "Deluxe" now worthless...
content: TurboTax really screwed the pooch with this move... especially the removal of schedule D, used by millions of users who may trade a handful of stocks each year. The $25 "We're sorry" rebate is not going to help smooth anything over with any long time Deluxe customers. I've been using TurboTax Deluxe since 1995, but I guess it's time to find another software package. Maybe time to try the H&R Block product... although I really hate to give up the ease of porting in all of last years info. They should have just raised the price... that would have been accepted much better than just moving all the previously covered Deluxe options to the Premier package. Hopefully they fired the idiot that came up with the idea!!!!

title: Disgusted
content: TurboTax user for many, many, years. I have always bought the Deluxe version and did again this year. I was really surprised to discover that functions I needed had been omitted while version name (and the price) stayed the same. Guess I should'a read the fine print, but I didn't. H&R Block will send a free copy of their full function tax program to anyone with proof of purchase of Turbo Tax Deluxe. If H&R Block's software works as well as the reviews say I'll stick with them in the future. I don't have time to play Turbo Tax"s new game, "guess what we omitted this year".

title: Turbo Tax is now giving a $25 rebate for those that where forced to upgrade. That would be nice if the upgrade was only $25
content: 12 Years of loyalty for what?? Thanks for nothing. Turbo Tax is now giving a $25 rebate for those that where forced to upgrade. That would be nice if the upgrade was only $25 But the in software upgrade is going to cost me $40. Guess I will switch to H&R Block software next year.

title: I have been using TurboTax for over 10 years. ...
content: I have been using TurboTax for over 10 years. This year I will be switching to TaxAct or another similar product. The reason is simple. TurboTax changed it's platform, no longer supporting schedule C or D in it's basic form. You must now purchase the Premier Edition which is much more costly. Goodbye TurboTax!

title: Yup, read the Cbs Philly article that alerted me ...
content: Yup, read the Cbs Philly article that alerted me to this rip-off before I opened the package, so back to Costco it goes! If you are screwed because you opened the package, read the info at the following URL (looks like the URL is not accepted so search for turbotax cbs philly for the info)for info about getting a free copy of the HRBLOCK SOFTWARE. After over ten years of TTax it is time for a change.[...]

title: Fortunately via the email from Intuit I found out about ...
content: Time to get off the ship I think. After years with first Basic, then Deluxe, I find I now need Premier. All with essentially NO changes to the returns filed over the years. I'm done. I have taken my purchased 2014 Deluxe back for refund - all for the want of a schedule D form. Even the Basic once provided these functions. Fortunately via the email from Intuit I found out about this prior to opening my purchase.

title: Time to say goodbye...
content: Not "so long", "see ya later" - the final goodbye. Intuit has been fiddling with what people get and finally they jumped the shark. Absolutely shameful greedy behavior. Plenty of other offerings out there - See ya Intuit! Who needs to pay money for the equivalent of 1040EZ?

title: TurboShaft products stink!
content: After using TurboShaft since 1994, I switched over to TaxACT for 2014. TaxACT is available directly from its website, and even TurboShaft employees like Bob, Tiffany, and Blake could probably figure out what to type into a web browser to see what a real tax software program looks like that doesn't have all the gotchas that TurboShaft has. TurboShaft won't get one penny from me in the future due to its underhanded, deceitful marketing practices. It should be quite apparent from TurboShaft reviews that most purchasers of tax software aren't inclined to switch products, but TurboShaft has done the nearly impossible for 2014 and run off a lot of former decades-long customers! Intuit/TurboShaft stuck its corporate feet where the sun doesn't shine too bright! TurboShaft 2014 products would best serve as a substitute for newspaper at the bottom of a bird cage. Stick a fork in TurboShaft.

title: Turbo Tax just lost another customer
content: Good thing I decided to investigate as to why this product had a huge majority of one star (would have been zero star if possible) ratings before I purchased it from Amazon. I started using Turbo Tax 10 years ago when Edward Jones said I could import my investment information painlessly into TT--I always did my own taxes previously but was intimidated by all the forms I would now have to fill out on account of my investments. So helpful to not have to fill out all those pages by hand, not to mention trying to figure out what blanks to put all those numbers on. I joyfully hopped on the Turbo Tax bandwagon and urged friends and family to do the same. I was a happy camper, thrilled that if an error was discovered, I had only to correct that blank and all other blanks would be corrected (very helpful when we moved and my husband's company sent some needed 1099 forms I wasn't expecting after I'd done the taxes but before I filed them--no having to rewrite a bunch of forms by hand). I had noticed over the past several years that Turbo Tax had been dumbing down their questions, making it take longer to get through the forms because of longer, more detailed questions, but I continued to follow their directed questions to make sure I didn't miss anything. And maybe newbies to the product were helped by questions I considered to be redundant and on a very elementary level. A friend told me about H & R Block, but I was reluctant to leave a system that I was already happy with, even though it was cheaper. To summarize, since the new and improved Turbo Tax Deluxe will no longer serve the purpose for which I have bought it for 10 years, I will take the advice of the many reviewers and purchase H & R Block's software.

title: Is Jonathan Gruber now at Turboax?
content: Like others, I've been using TurboTax seemingly since the earth cooled. I've often wondered if the other, less expensive competitive tax package software offerings would be worth investigating, but out of sheer laziness and habit I stayed with TurboTax since it was just a once-a-year expense. As I was looking at the 2014 versions with their new naming conventions and classifications, I got this sneaking suspicion that TurboTax was making a marketing power play to dupe a lot of customers into increasing their spend. I was right! Note to TurboTax's Marketing department... Fire Jonathan Gruber. The American consumer is not stupid. Good-bye, for good.

title: Had to drop Quicken, now dropping TurboTax too.
content: Finally gave up on Quicken 6 months ago. Switching to the HR Block software. I read that if you already bought Quicken this year you can email HR Block to get a free copy of their stuff. Might be OK if they were honest about it - capitalism is capitalism. Hiding the deficiencies it just tricery.

title: Moving away from turbotax after decades of use
content: Not happy about the change done by Intuit eliminating schedules C/D from deluxe version, I have used turbo tax for decades, will switch this year to another product. I will be curious about how this corporate decision plays out eventually with its impact on the customer base.

title: Read this before you purchase!
content: http://mobile.nytimes.com/2015/01/10/your-money/taxes/users-say-turbotax-deluxe-is-not-as-deluxe-as-previous-versions.html?referrer=&_r=0

title: but without Sch D it is useless to me
content: Unbelivable Intuit. I have used Turbo Tax Deluxe for almost 20 years, but without Sch D it is useless to me. Time to switch companies.

title: Goodbye Intuit. I hate being deceived, manipulated and taken advantage off for being a loyal client
content: After 15 years goodbye Intuit. I am switching to a competitor. I already got my full refund from Best Buy. I will rather pay double or whatever price than being treated as a schmuck. The arrogant obtuse CEO decided secretly to take functionality away from Deluxe, assuming that loyal schmucks would just pay up like sheep. Not me. Imagine the extra useless, expensive programing code they inserted into Deluxe version to talk you into and guide you into buying upgraded Premiere version. When Netflix changed their payment plan in a similar way their stock went down 50%. I hope the same thing happens to Intuit and the weasel CEO gets fired by board of directors.

title: TurboTax 'free' upgrade not working properly
content: Enough has been said about the terrible mess Intuit has made of TurboTax, a once trusted program and company. However, it's gotten worse. VP Bob Meighan told us that after February 7th, customers who had used TurboTax Deluxe in 2013 would be eligible for a free upgrade - from within the program. They did provide an update to the software and it's an easy click in the program (or in a menu item) to access the free upgrade area on their website. However, their software update does not work correctly because the popup window still requires a credit card for purchase. Worse still, nobody in customer service seems to be aware of the problem. At this point, you still have to call them if you want the 'free' upgrade.

title: Turbo Tax user since 1993
content: Let's see, I have been using Turbo Tax since 1993. I have seen it evolve as my tax complexity as evolved and I loved its ease of use and the painless preparation of my taxes. A couple of years ago, I have retired and started my own (very, very small) business, I was still loving as it met my needs. Now Intuit ups the ante and will make us pay more for the same functionality we had in the deluxe product in 2013. Well, no more for me. I will start looking for an alternate solution.

title: Yet another long time (10+ years) TurboTax user sufficiently annoyed by Intuit removing features from this product and then ...
content: Yet another long time (10+ years) TurboTax user sufficiently annoyed by Intuit removing features from this product and then justifying it with classic corporate BS to switch to H&R Block Deluxe. Not only cheaper than Intuit but imports all TurboTax data from 2013 and has all the schedules Intuit removed. Why would you continue to buy anything from a company as unreliable and cynical as Intuit?

title: Management seems to be doing well!
content: Guess someone has to pay for the management raises... http://insiders.morningstar.com/trading/executive-compensation.action?t=INTU

title: Even if I concede the points that the VP of TurboTax made (and I actually think he is probably a very good VP), the bottom line
content: When I heard about the change to TurboTax Deluxe a few weeks ago, I wrote a review here ultimately saying that I would withhold judgment for a while. Even if I concede the points that the VP of TurboTax made (and I actually think he is probably a very good VP), the bottom line for me is TurboTax is now out of my price range. Why do I say that? Last year I was able to switch to the Standard Deduction for the first time, but I still had capital gains and losses. This year I only have one capital gains issue: the sale of a single stock. So in my case switching to TurboTax Premier would be like using a sledge hammer to kill a fly. So for me this will be a simple case of the public making a decision on price when I switch to a different tax solution. So I have changed from one to two stars, but I still don't buy products that have been rated at one or two stars by a large number of people. Ultimately, Intuit, like most businesses, will examine the bottom line: If the change in policy helps profits, they will keep it; if it hurts profits, they may reverse it.

title: Not this year, Intuit.
content: When you consider the amount of money Intuit pays to lobbyists to ensure the tax code doesn't get more simple, it's already hard enough to stomach giving them money. This year's debacle is the final straw -- quietly changing the features of a long-standing product class is nothing but greed. We're not talking about a simple price increase, but an attempt to extort customers into a higher level product than they've ever needed before. Of course Bob is on here defending these new tactics -- he's probably the one in line to get canned for this fiasco.

title: TurboTax Deluxe - PR Disaster in Decision-making
content: I rarely write reviews... cannot pass on this one, however. HUGE mistake changing the feature set for Deluxe version, especially with sooo little communication to long-time, loyal customers. Disappointed with 2014 changes in feature/functions and Intuit's lame response to customers (web site, phone, media/press). I have been using TurboTax products for about 25 years. Is it really worth the extra $20-30 bucks to lose a repeat customer over this? I suspect somebody in Intuit's Finance/Marketing Dept. ran a "model" and determined that "x" % of customers will flee to competitor products over this change. BUT -- 'net net' it is the RIGHT thing to do to improve revenue (think "Ford Pinto" gas tank design decision disaster!). I hope they change their minds and all FREE upgrades to Premium or Home/Business versions -- and get this silly mistake behind them. Coca Cola did it -- and saved their brand. You have choices... do the right thing! UPDATE: After receiving eMail from Intuit about $25 Rebate Offer today ( Jan 28, 2015 ) Here's a letter I sent to Sasan Goodarzi (General Manager, TurboTax Products) I am sorry -- this is just not enough to make this issue "go away" for me and many others... While this offer may help a little bit this year (2014 taxes)--- I still end up paying another $15 for Premium Version after the $25 Rebate! The bigger issue for me - and MANY other loyal TurboTax Customers - is that we are EXTREMELY UPSET about "the change" in feature/functions that have been part of TurboTax solutions for the past 25+ years (I have used the product since mid-1980's). The fact is --- this "change" impacts your customers "going forward" into 2016+. I am not prepared to pay an additional $40-60 per year for Premium or Home/Office versions than I paid in past years. I have already "moved on" to H&R Block 2014 Deluxe Version. You will NOT get my business back -- after I migrate my 2013 data into the H&R Block solution. The "return switch-back to TurboTax" is going to be a low probability in my case --- since I have psychology already "moved on" from Intuit products. The ONLY way I would be willing to give you my business is if you REVERSE YOUR DECISION and RETRACT "the change" in the "Deluxe" product. Restore the "Deluxe" features/functions into the 2016 product -- and make your 2014 customers as 100% whole for the 2014 Premium or Home/Office version mandatory upgrades. If you do this --- you have a 50-60% chance of having me return to TurboTax in 2016. Brutal news - I am sure... but this is how I feel right now.

title: Switched to H&R Block with the changes TT made.
content: I switched to H&R Block...love it!

title: So long TurboTax
content: What bonehead in the Intuit marketing department came up with this pricing scheme (already described in other reviews)? I've been put off by Intuitâs pricing of TurboTax for the last few years, but this year I was pushed over the edge. I've been using TurboTax since the Chipsoft days â before it was acquired by Intuit. But after doing an evaluation of the H&R Block program this year, I think it will suit me very well for a lot less money.

title: Now Using H&R Block Tax Software
content: After using Intuit for 15 years, I just finished my taxes using H&R Block software. The only difference was the user interface. All the questions were the same, etc... Easy peasy. After what Intuit did to us this year, I will NEVER go back. Besides, H&R is cheaper, and works the same.

title: Don't be fooled. The deluxe version has been downgraded ...
content: Don't be fooled. The deluxe version has been downgraded from previous years. If you have sales of investments, this year you must upgrade to Premier for additional cost. This is a bait and switch. Be sure you evaluate other options before you purchase Turbotax.

title: Glad to know that H&R Block works so well
content: This is a deal breaker for me. I have never seen such an overwhelming 1 star rating -- almost 11 ones for every 5. If Intuit had any sense they would reduce the price on the Premium version to save their customer base. Glad to know that H&R Block works so well.

title: Vanguard Investors may qualify for discounts up to 100%
content: Attention Vanguard investors: After hearing about the changes TT made to it's deluxe version this year I started surfing the net looking for the best price for the Premier version. One of the links that popped up on my Google search was at Vanguard.Com. Seems that Vanguard is offering discounts up to 100% for on-line use as well as for downloaded TT products. The TT Deluxe and Premier versions (including a state download) were listed as 100% free. It seemed too good to be true but I just downloaded TT Premier for $0.00. If you have a Vanguard.com account check it out.

title: Absolutely Unacceptable
content: In a ridiculous move by Intuit, this version of TurboTax does not include all of the features contained in previous editions. This change is leaving many unable to complete their taxes without "upgrading" to another program for an additional cost (of course). Luckily, I discovered this prior to starting my taxes. I purchased this product at Sam's Club, not Amazon, but I am using every platform at my disposal to spread the word about this. I've used TurboTax for years, but I returned the product I purchased and will be using H&R Block's tax program from now on.

title: Lost a loyal customer due to their greed
content: Been using Turbo Tax since the beginning and this year I bought it again. There were some changes to the software but I received an email from Turbo Tax assuring me that it would not affect me...it did. The homeowners edition only covers one family dwellings. I have a 2 family house and for another $30.00 I could buy the upgrade. No where did I see this on the description. So I ended up buying Tax Act for $14.95 which did everything that Turbo Tax used to do at a fraction of the cost. Never again will I but Turbo Tax and would like a refund for software that I did not use because of their own description.

title: Time to break a BAD habit
content: After more than 10 years as a loyal customer, it is obvious it is time to move on to a different product. Deluxe is now Basic and the lack of forms for investors makes it incredibly useless. The explanation offered by Turbo Tax is condescending at best and this is a perfect example of corporate arrogance at its finest. Goodbye Turbo Tax and hello H & R Block.

title: One more one star.
content: Haven't bought this product, this year, so I'm not a Verified Purchaser; nor do I intend to. I've been using Turbo Tax Deluxe since the mind of man runneth not to the contrary; but the bait and switch they have perpetrated on that product needs to be punished, so I'm providing another one-star review just to make the rating that much more damning. Planning to try Block, just waiting to get my 1099's in to see what I might need.

title: You get half the product now for the same price ...
content: You get half the product now for the same price as last year. Anyway they can gouge the very small biz owner, they will.

title: TurboTax is great if you do not mind uploading YOUR final return ...
content: NO OFFLINE PRINTING! TurboTax is great if you do not mind uploading YOUR final return to THEIR servers before you can print. Yes, that is right. BEFORE YOU CAN PRINT. I have been a TurboTax Software user for 10 or more years. I will never buy their product again. Why does TurboTax require me to connect to the internet through their servers to print my return you might ask? I would love to know the reason for that too. My return is between me and the IRS, not TurboTax. We have been victims of identity theft in the past. So, excuse me if i am just a little apprehensive about sharing information with TurboTax SERVERS just to print my return. I am going to the post office and getting the paperwork to file my return the old fashioned way. Why? Because I cannot export my return to print it NOR can I print my return to MAIL it to the IRS. If you don't like to put your social security number on the internet with a company that has NO BUSINESS asking for that information, save your money. Use another product. As for me, GOOD BYE TurboTax!

title: Goodbye Intuit
content: Switching over to a different product this year. Turbotax is selling at twice the price of other software. Turbotax has been my go-to since college, but there are too many bad reviews this year.

title: Buyer beware
content: It is bad enough the IRS gets you. Now Turbo Tax is jumping on the ban wagon to raid your wallet. I have used Turbo Tax Deluxe for years and made the mistake of buying it again this year. I now have to upgrade to a more expensive version to fill out the exact same forms I have been using for years. Unless you have no investments or anything out of the ordinary, look else ware before buying this product. One star is too high of a rating.

title: No Schedule D! Seriously, Intuit?
content: I almost downloaded TurboTax Deluxe by rote when I discovered a significant part of its functionality and value to me had been gutted - particularly Schedules C,D and K-1. Finally, after a lot of thought, I paid the extra money for the Premier version. But it will be my last such purchase from Inuit and I've started telling my friends to buy the H&R Block products. I'm not sure what has offended me more, the sneakiness of the change, the true loss of functionality in a product I had used for years, or the cluelessness of Intuit's corporate response to its customers.

title: Thanks to all the previous reviewers I've abandoned this product ...
content: Thanks to all the previous reviewers I've abandoned this product as well - despite the flashy banners, graphics, and promises of amazon Prime rebates. This was disingenuous and reprehensible.

title: More expensive now.
content: I have been a TurboTax customer for many years. Last year I filed my taxes using the Deluxe version. My tax circumstances have not changed and I will still file the exact same forms but I'll now have to pay $30 more for the Home and Business edition if I decide to go that way. That's a pretty big percentage jump in tax prep software. I appreciate all the negative reviews, I'd been even more irritated had I bought the deluxe edition got part way through and had to pay an upgrade fee. I've never looked at other products but will before I buy this time around.

title: Went to TaxAct, No More TurboTax
content: Have used it for years. Never considered anything else although there are other products out there. After finding out what they did this year forcing an upgrade, I have finally left TurboTax. Bought TaxAct for a fair price. It had good reviews. I suspect, once I get all my data and complete my return (I don't have business related income and expense) that I will be a long time TaxAct user. I tend to stick with products that work well until they screw up, which is what TurboTax did big time.

title: Another Customer Gone
content: I have used TT for years to file my taxes but they have lost me as a customer for the 2014 tax year. Disingenuous rate hikes is not the way to treat loyal customers Intuit. Good riddance.

title: Terrible. Deluxe is no longer deluxe
content: Terrible. Deluxe is no longer deluxe. By now, you all know what's missing - virtually anything needed for a non-plug and play return. But wait, Forbes now reports customers can now call and complain to get the upgrade fee waved. This kind of haggling sounds like the cable company all over again. And if you don't haggle, you're getting screwed. Why should I support a company that will charge its loyal customers different prices for the same product? So long, TT, after 8 years of loyalty. Apparently no loyalty reciprocated. For 2015, TaxAct here I come.

title: Bait and switch comes to Turbo Tax -- avoid it if you can
content: Stay away from this product if you can. I have been using turbo tax for many, many years with general satisfaction. This year, I bought the standard package for someone who has to itemize and then I get to the section for reporting capital gains and the program won't go any further unless I buy the upgrade. That ladies and gentlement, is what's known in a con game as a "bait and switch". And now I am, what is known in marketing, as an angry former customer who wil be advising any and all to stay away from this product if you can.

title: No Schedule D In This Version. Can We Say GREEDY?
content: No Schedule D In This Version. To handle sale of securities, you need to buy a version that costs about twice as much. Combine this with Turbo Tax's behind the scenes actions to prevent automatic filing of taxes (for relatively simple tax returns) and it will be a cold day in (whatever location TurboTax resides) before I every again buy ANY of their products. Too bad I can't give zero stars . . .

title: Caution This Is NOT Deluxe like the past versions
content: Be very careful, this year's version of Deluxe has stripped out several key schedules (C/D/E). You will need to buy upgrades to either Premier or Home&Business. I used Deluxe version for at least 15 years. Always had the necessary forms and schedules for me until this year. They did publicly say they are sorry and After you buy the upgrades and After you file your return, they will give you a twenty five dollar rebate for your time and expense. Its like ordering the combo meal for years at the drive through and then getting home and finding that fries are not included anymore. Check out what you need before you buy.

title: I purchased this software for years but will gladly take ...
content: I purchased this software for years but will gladly take my money to another software provider to prepare my taxes.

title: Amazon needs to allow negative stars - this was a bait and switch.
content: Like many others I'm super-frustrated with TurboTax 2014 DELUXE. Changes have been made to the DELUXE version this year such that it is incapable of completing a simple return for a college student earning less than $10,000 per year. After appealing to Intuit's customer service without remedy my trust in the company has been broken. My daughter received a small scholarship from a trust, resulting in a 1041 K-1. This has been a regular occurrence for my children for many years, and in all prior years this was easily handled by the DELUXE edition. This year (2014 returns), reductions in functionality have been made to the program such that the PREMIER edition is required to complete this tiny aspect of her return (literally $219 of income). These changes were made, in my opinion, without adequate notice of the changes - a "bait and switch." All of this was discovered, of course, during a last-minute rush to complete the return, requiring an upgrade to the PREMIER edition from within the program at the retail price directly from Intuit. Intuit apparently did offer a partial rebate but that window expired before I found out about this problem. I appealed to Intuit customer service. The lady was agreeable but ultimately unable to offer any remedy. I hope it was worth the $30 upgrade to the PREMIER version that I was compelled to pay at the last minute, because I intend to do everything I can to make sure that was the last dollar Intuit ever receives from me. By the way, I'm a degreed accountant from a prestigious school, and have worked for many years in "Big 4" public accounting, and corporate controller positions.

title: Might be me but I don't feel like wasting a day troubleshooting what should be a simple ...
content: Hard to rate when you can't download it thru amazon. All I get is "windows cannot access the file". Might be me but I don't feel like wasting a day troubleshooting what should be a simple download.

title: After More Than a Dozen Years....I'm Switching This Year
content: As a user of TurboTax for more than a dozen years, I was about to order the new version, just as I do every year. Until I read the comments here.....it's clear that intuit chose to go the route of price gouging and are attempting a thinly veiled smokescreen effort by having a company VP attempt to justify their new strategy in response to comments posted here. Sorry, where there's smoke, there's usually fire. I just prefer to go the other direction. I believe in giving customers value for their dollar, without the dishonesty and the bait-and-switch.

title: If you want to print your return or password your file read this first!!
content: I have the Premier Turbotax desktop edition for Mac, which I have used for many years; prior to that I used the Deluxe edition. This year's is buggy. The updates function is broken. When I open the software and am told there are updates, I download them. If I then go to the update tab (either right away or after closing and re-opening the software) I am told there are updates to download--the same one(s) already downloaded! In addition, for the first time, I can't even print an interim copy of the return for checking without having to sign onto a "secure print center"! In fact, I can't even password my own file without logging on to intuit!! I can only guess what Intuit does with the private information it gets. I elected not to give this info to Intuit and will purchase a competitor's software. It can't be any worse.

title: Schedule D not included
content: No Schedule D in turbotax deluxe this year. Bad bad move, intuit. Very bad !

title: No Schedule C, D, or E - nothing Deluxe about TurboTax Deluxe
content: They crippled the functionality for Schedules C, D, and E with virtually no notice to their customer base. Then they try to blame their customers because we don't like change and "change is challenging." Well, I'm changing to H&R Block's software. There's nothing deluxe about TurboTax Deluxe.

title: Works as of 2/15/2015 thanks to you.
content: Well, Turbo Tax got greedy took away features AND raised the price. Thanks to all of you who complained and reviewed their product they have put back the features and lowered the price. Why the one star? It never should have happened in the first place. If you stab someone but then pay for their stitches and hospital stay, you have still stabbed someone, the scar remains...way to go Intuit.

title: GREED
content: Tax software is not necessary in the first place if your elected representatives would do their jobs representing the people instead of moneyed lobbyists. Hopefully this idiotic, GREEDY, blunder by Intuit will make that possible. It is very possible for the IRS to just automatically initiate returns and issue refunds with no action on your part. This was in fact initiated but stopped by companies like Intuit and HR Block.

title: It really isn't surprising that Intuit is doing this. ...
content: It really isn't surprising that Intuit is doing this. I stopped using this product in 2003 when they added DRM that replaced people's CD drivers causing system crashes and affected the performance of your computer until it is forceably removed even though this software is only used once a year. I've been using the H&R equivalent ever since and it works exactly the same and will even import your previous year's return from TurboTax.

title: This product uses the same name "Deluxe" but doesn't have ...
content: This product uses the same name "Deluxe" but doesn't have the same content: No Schedules C, D, or E. I have been a loyal TurboTax customer since sometime in the 90's and always used this Deluxe version. When I started this year, I found the Schedules I need are missing and the program asks me for another $30 fee to use them. This is cheating. I am angry about the deliberate disabling of critical features in TurboTax Deluxe. Shane on TurboTax. I will find a different program next year.

title: IT was not written anywhere that the Deluxe version no ...
content: IT was not written anywhere that the Deluxe version no longer included schedule C forms. I am unable to cancel the order because it was a down load so now I have to purchase it again but this time the home and business one. It is not right for me to have to pay twice because of this sneaky move by Turbo Tax. I'm a very unsatisfied customer and I will not be using turbo tax next year.

title: Intuit hits a new low
content: Awful, awful, awful. Not *only* do you have to shell out an extra $30 to file a schedule D, and apparently even more for a schedule C, but you can't even use the program if you aren't online. I used to password protect my returns (as everyone should). The password was just stored in the return, all good. Now you can only password protect it using a password that's stored on the Intuit web site. Every year, TurboTax turns more intrusive and becomes more of a ripoff. TaxAct is higher rated and I'll be trying that for my 2014 tax year return. And it's cheaper, to boot. www.taxact.com

title: 20+ years of Loyalty wiped away, just like that...
content: Thank you to all of the other reviewers in helping me out before I went and purchased TT Deluxe this year (yet another long time TT user... 20+ years). I have exactly ONE Schedule D stock trade on my taxes this year... ONE. And for that I need to now buy a pricey upgrade when I didn't have to last year? Forget it. I won't be calling anyone on the phone to finagle me a TT upgrade; I shouldn't have to. The BS explanation and pandering to get us "valuable" customers to call in and haggle for a discounted "upgrade" is an insult to our intelligence and to our loyalty. Calling a spade a spade (price increase) is much easier to stomach than getting fed a pile of sh@t and being told it's Filet Mignon.

title: TurboTax has damaged their own brand
content: ...by omitting Schedule D and otherwise downgrading the capability of TurboTax Deluxe. Every user I know has assumed that he/she can use the same product as last year. Those folks _were_ loyal users for years and years, as I have been. Intuit's misleading and confusing descriptions are bad enough, but Bob Meighan's lame and insulting explanations are worse. Really, Bob - I can actually go to Forms and fill out my own Schedule D? You forgot to apprise us that we can download and complete Federal and state forms for free or instead go to our local tax preparer. There's plenty of time to push out an update that restores previous functionality, Intuit. I'm pretty sure most users know that they can submit an Extension of Time to File (with payment, if required) and sit tight until October to see if you've done the right thing. Update Feb '15: Ok, there were the disingenuous apologies from Meighan et. al. Once Intuit realized the breadth of their error, there were rebates and promises to do better next year. Now, there are reports that just to print/get hard copy, purchasers of the retail disc version must upload their returns to TT servers - one _cannot_ print without an internet connection. That defeats the privacy advantages of the disc version - unbelievable. Intuit, you've gone from very bad to worse. Every one I know, except one, has switched to HRB. Now it's my turn. Let's not even discuss the lameness of Quicken Essentials and Quicken 2015 (I personally know dissatisfied beta testers) vs. Q2007. Intuit, quo vadis? I can't go with you. Update 4/16: My understanding is still that "just to print/get hard copy, purchasers of the retail disc version must upload their returns to TT servers - one _cannot_ print without an internet connection." I still find it difficult to determine whether the functionality I require (as opposed to what TT, in their marketing wisdom, suggests), is provided by a particular TT version. Intuit has gone its own way. I went with HRB for 2015.

title: Unbelievable
content: I have used Turbo Tax software ever since I started electronic filing. I was surprised to see such a low rating for the deluxe version but after reading many of these reviews, I have decided not to purchase any Turbo Tax product for filing my 2014 tax returns.

title: Incredibly stupid business decision as a flood of customers are going ...
content: What a rip off of it's customers! Suddenly dropping Schedule D from the Deluxe version with little if any warning. Incredibly stupid business decision as a flood of customers are going elsewhere, even those of us who bought TT this year. We'll also be looking to drop other Quicken products as such a firm is not the kind we wish to do business with. I hope the stampede away from Quicken will both doom the company and send a lesson to others.

title: Shame on me trusting Intuit to deliver the same functionality ...
content: Shame on me trusting Intuit to deliver the same functionality. Shame on me for not reading the reviews. Contemplating now to bag it for 2014 or pay the additional $30 for a very small amount of Schedule D activity. Beware!

title: Schedules D and E Not Supported In Deluxe
content: The Deluxe version does not allow you to file Schedule D or E. This is noted on the Intuit website and I can confirm this after downloading and installing. Get the Premier version if you have rental property or capital gains/losses. You can prepare the forms with Deluxe but can't file until you upgrade to Premier.

title: Bait and Switch for long time users.
content: Picked up Deluxe CD at warehouse store like we have been doing for past 10 or more years. Now I need to return it. I don't have much in the way of investments but my Son has a college fund so we do one or two sales a year to pay his tuition. Now they tell me i need to pay $30 more just to fill out one very short schedule D and still to e-file. You can fill it out manually and mail it for free, but I can go the post office or library and get all the forms for free if I am not going to e-file. They were clearly relying on customer inertia for this hoax to work. My bigger concern with Intuit in general is that do you really want to trust any of your financial information to any of their products if this is how they treat their long time loyal customers. Big late Christmas gift for H&R Block. Noticed that for today 1/12/15 NewEgg has H&R Del+State for $23

title: The 2014 Turbo Tax Deluxe will not perform a step ...
content: The 2014 Turbo Tax Deluxe will not perform a step by step "Schedule D" as in previous years version. They require you to upgrade to Premier for $30. I'm out. I will never use them again and I have used them for at least 15 years.

title: Good Bye to greed and arrogance
content: WOW, Just when a full trust had been built, corporate greed and arrogance may quickly change Turbo-Tax from big winner to biggest loser. Of course, maybe VP Bob was hoping that buyers would not beware. Well Bob, you ought to be aware that this is the information age. We the people have fast access to information, especially bad news, which travels quite fast. Having reviewed the expertise expressed by others with greater tax software knowledge than me, our long relationship with Turbo-Tax is over. You might try to make things right. But, in my case, it will be too late. As some mentioned, you also have designed your software to disable exceptions/options which preparers could use to address their specific need. This has been annoying with the past several versions of Turbo-Tax. So, a 'back handed' thank you for helping us to break our relationship.

title: While it's intimidating to me to switch to another software I cannot justify it based upon the literal thousand 1 star reviews a
content: I have been using TurboTax since I had to start doing taxes. While it's intimidating to me to switch to another software I cannot justify it based upon the literal thousand 1 star reviews and almost no good ones. Intuit, as I'm sure your getting by this point, you've lost another loyal customer. Profit matters, but the strategy you used is going to lose it.

title: One Star
content: Premier simply to enter in K-1's ?!?!?! WTH Intuit? Last year with Turbo Tax unless this changes.

title: How wonderful to be able to spend more money than ever
content: Dear Intuit- How pleasant to find that the program I used last year has been "upgraded" to provide less work at a higher cost. How wonderful to be able to spend more money than ever! This will be the last time that I ever spend a dollar on Intuit products. Mint is no good either, now that you have your hooks into it.

title: Won't be coming back
content: 20+ year customer. I left about 5 years ago for a year over price gouging, but reluctantly returned when they offered me a great deal. I won't be coming back over this latest move. Downgrading Deluxe to be a more expensive version of Basic truly shows the contempt TT has for their customer base. They are hoping to fool 99% of their customer base and quiet the rest with this call and get a free upgrade scheme (which will only work this year I am betting, next year you will be screwed). Best of luck TT in your new price gouging scheme. Hopefully some state attorney generals will pick this up and sue you for false claims and bait and switch. I'm sure you'll just lobby that away too, you have plenty of money to throw at the problem obviously.

title: 100% Price Increase for a product that won't do what you need
content: I've used TT for years. The Intuit business model is to lure you in, make you "sticky" (make it difficult to leave their products) and then reduce functionality and jack up the price in the hope that it will be too difficult for you to leave. Don't use Quicken anymore, don't use Quickbooks anymore (freshbooks, check it out) and NOW....don't use Turbotax anymore. Bye Intuit...forever your detractor.

title: Switch to a Decent Tax Progam
content: I downloaded Turbo Tax (Deluxe version) out of habit. I didn't read the reviews because I had used it for 10-15 years., the last two in the Mac version. Thus I only discovered that it could not handle capital gains, when I was halfway thru my return. But the program said I could upgrade to Premier "free," undoubtedly because of the massive number of complaints that the its deficiencies had generated by then. But when I downloaded the "upgrade" it would not install. I kept getting messages "new version available" but when I tried, I got another message saying that it would not install and "try again later." After three or four tries I gave up. But I don't have access to my partially completed return and will have to start over. I gave it one star for shocking me out of my inertia and convincing me that Intuit has no concern with customers and I need to switch to another program.

title: Profits place well above customers. But now there are alternatives!
content: Hey Bob, I too have been a loyal Turbo Tax customer and have steered many folks to the product. I am also a business man and understand the need for corporate profits. But, what you've done this year is coercion or worse. We've watched the price steadily rise over the years; I understand that. Reducing the capability (loss of eFile if you need a schedule D in the Deluxe version) is coercion and an obvious attempt to force many of us to an unneeded upgrade. There are good alternatives out there now and for the first time in over 20 years, I'll be switching. Each of your customers knows about 200 people, according to a famous sales book. Think about it. Sadly, good bye.

title: Turbotax needs competition
content: I think that Intuit is getting complacent and needs some competition. I filed my 2103 taxes through Turbotax online, but unwittingly saved only a .pdg copy to my local hard drive, not realizing that they would want the .tax2013 version to start this 2014's taxes return Now, I can't reach the 2013 file at all after signin. Wither went the data? Why wasn't I prompted last year to save both the .tax and .pdf docs locally?

title: There are plenty of alternatives out there that do as good or better job and are a product of more ...
content: After over 20 years of purchases from Intuit. Never again will I purchase a Turbo Tax product. The elimination of basic forms in attempt to gain additional profits is a deal breaker for me. There are plenty of alternatives out there that do as good or better job and are a product of more ethical companies.

title: Thanks for the warning, everyone,
content: TT now claims to be changing their change, but only after issuing an apology bundled with a refusal to reverse their original decision. Now they're issuing a mea culpa for their mea culpa along with a pinky promise that there are no strings attached this time. I'd say they should fire the circus clowns who thought this up, but then they'd probably need to fire their CEO and board of directors.

title: One Star
content: SHAME ON INTUIT

title: Not support for Self Employment - Shame on you
content: Have used TurboTax and Quicken for many many years. Now there is no support for self employment in the Deluxe addition of TurboTax. This should be more apparent on the box. I have now purchased a product I cannot use. Shame on you Intuit. I will be purchasing tax software from one of your competitors now for this tax year. I will also start to look for a Quicken substitute. Greed will sink your company. Your CEO cannot be too bright.

title: Go to H&R Block software (for free) and DUMP Turbo Tax!
content: Since Turbo Tax decided to gouge we users, I went to H&R Block software. They are giving away for FREE their version of tax prep software. It imports all the data from Turbo Tax and works just fine. Bye-bye Turbo Tax forever!! If I could give less than one star I would!

title: Has there ever been a product with this many 1 star reviews?
content: Thank you to the 1,288 previous reviewers. Haven't read them all but I have the picture. I had been using TurboTax since BEFORE Intuit bought it from the original developers - probably around the early/mid 1980's. Bad business decisions to give less and less value for more and more money. Good luck, Bob! Hope the guy/gal who came up with the 10 million user number doesn't go to work for H&R Block.

title: One Star
content: Not happy, wanted to add my 1 star. Bought 2 copies for christmas presents and now this.

title: Customer support unresponsive
content: In addition to the removal of functionality from the Deluxe version, TurboTax customer support leaves a great deal to be desired. I've been trying to revolve a problem with the state download in TurboTax for four days, and calling their customer service number has been fruitless. Callers get a message stating "we are experiencing high call volumes" (really? You're not staffed to handle an influx of calls at tax time?) and an offer to have TurboTax call back. Unfortunately, the call isn't returned for two or three hours, so it's easy to miss - might as well be waiting for Comcast to fix my cable. In my opinion, Intuit has lost its customer focus, and I don't plan to be using TurboTax next year.

title: Agree with the 1 star reviews: Deluxe de-sope is an Intuit money maker
content: I've been using TurboTax for many many years and the need to pay $30 additional to get REAL Sched D support (not via manual forms) is truly a money making move by Intuit. If I had read the Amazon reviews before I bought the software, I would have switched to their competitor. Surprising enough, the comments on the Intuit site don't discuss this change to Deluxe. And what the Intuit VP wrote in previous posts is just plain poor public relations. If Deluxe 2015 doesn't go back to the previous 2013 capability, I will definitely be switching products next year. Next is to find an alternative to Quicken- they already force an upgrade upon you every few years whether you want improvements or not.

title: Stay Away From the 2014 TurboTax Deluxe
content: I have used the Deluxe version of TurboTax for well over ten years and have up until now always appreciated the ease of use and effectiveness. I'm sorry I did not read the earlier reviews before I jumped on the special deal for Prime members (that does make me wonder). As others have reported they are trying to force us into buying the Premier version for simple Schedule D, C and other functions that we have always been able to complete with the Deluxe version of the software. Called their help desk and never got a call back seems like intuit does not care about loyal customers, not a good business model. Avoid this purchase now and look at some of the other tax packages now available for a more reasonable price. I also plan on staying away from any future Quicken updates as well.

title: I'm done. Screw Turbo Tax.
content: Bought this after they said they'd let you do schedule C and D and it still forced me to pay 30 to upgrade to premier. I didn;t think that was a big deal because I'd get 25 off. No dice, since I didn't use deluxe last year I don't qualify.... I'm done with turbo tax this is ridiculous. I've used them since 1997. Just terrible.

title: Never again
content: This was the last straw for me using Turbbotax software. My taxes are pretty straight forward and easy to compile and complete and TurboTax is good for that. However, this year when I tried to e-file my State taxes, I was unable to opt for the credit card payment because their payment system doesn't work. I called customer service three times and had to go through their hateful phone queue each time. On all three calls, the customer service rep disconnected me - every time. Now, one of the things they ask you for in customer service is your phone number to verify your account, so I know they had my number. Did anyone bother to call me back? No, of course not. So instead of it costing $19.99 to e-file my state, the only option left is the $39.95 to e-file with TurboTax taking the money out of my federal refund. As far as I'm concerned, this is nothing but a scam. You either pay them an extra $20 or they simply sit on your return. No more TurboTax for me - they an join AT&T as a banned company in my household.

title: Intuit top management FAILURE!
content: I am also a 15+ TuroTax user. Intuit has come so far to lose so many loyal users with this years several great management blunders. What with the recent data loss - tax refund abuse fraud, and Intuit's war on its long loyal customers, I am thinking about making the shift to get help from a tax (CPA) accountant this year. A anticipate that doing so will make leaving Intuit a pleasure, that may stick on me. Adding to the major issues that most of us have, I am also a swing option trader. As far as I know, TurboTax still does not provide any way to automate option trading data into any of its software cost levels. Regrets, and wishes for a satisfactory tax filing to all.

title: I'm forced to look elsewhere
content: I, too, have been a long-time user of TurboTax Deluxe and Quicken Deluxe. I don't need schedule D often. In fact, I used it for my 2013 taxes for the 1st time in a long time. Why? Because I sold a few shares in a mutual fund. Other than that, I have no need for schedule D. And I certainly don't need the hand-holding to fill it out. Sell 1 mutual fund? What's the big deal? But if I have to pay up more $ for that, then I must look elsewhere for my income tax support. Why? Because if I sell a few shares of a mutual fund, the extra $30 (or whatever) for the "privilege" of filling out schedule D will wipe out much of my profit, if any, never mind the tax man's vigorish! Add to that the nagging in Quicken 2014: The new version is out, buy it now! I uncheck the "remind me later" box, but every now and then it reminds me later! I've been happy with Quicken and TurboTax, until now. I'm sorry it's come to this. I'm forced to look into alternatives for both.

title: Say Good Bye to Turbo Tax
content: Looks like it's time to jump ship and go the H&R Blocks tax software. I've been using TurboTax Deluxe for about 20 years now. No sense being loyal to a company who thinks this low of their customers. I use to work at H&R Block and their software is just as good as Turbo Tax. This would have been the first year that I actually needed Schedule D. Once I change to H&R Block, I won't go back to Turbo Tax.

title: I was just ready to purchase TurboTax Deluxe for the 20th time and lucky for me I came here and noticed the bad reviews. Strippi
content: My thanks to Amazon and to these reviews. I was just ready to purchase TurboTax Deluxe for the 20th time and lucky for me I came here and noticed the bad reviews. Stripping out the investment forms is just awful and not fully disclosing this fact is even worse. I am ordering H & R Block Tax Deluxe (and for about 1/2 the price of TT Deluxe). I would give Intuit zero stars if I could.

title: Returned it!
content: Bought it. Read the changes made. Returned it. I'll try H&R Block's software this year

title: Unethical
content: I bought the competing product as a result of TurboTax's unethical business practices.

title: Like the other reviewers I have used TT for many ...
content: Like the other reviewers I have used TT for many years. I agree totally with their comments 0n the requirement to upgrade to Premier. The other issue people should consider is the poor level of customer service. I will never purchase this product again.

title: Email switchtoblock@hrblock.com for a free HR Deluxe version if you've been a previous TurboTax customer.
content: Mr. Meighan, I received your email and understand you'll be bending over backwards to undo the damage your greed has done this year. Guess what, too late. Yes you have the lion's share of the tax market but even that won't make your board happy considering you've cost your company, thousands, perhaps tens of thousands, maybe a hundred thousand or more customers for years to come. You have one job, keep a customer happy once a year and you can't even do that right. Regards! Update**** After emailing H&R Block, I received an email welcoming me to Block and confirming they would send me a download link within three days for a free copy of deluxe software.

title: TurboTax, You Blew It!!!
content: TurboTax, you blew it! I have been using TuboTax since the 1980's (DOS version), and have purchased the program every year since. After purchasing the 2014 version I received that apology email from "Sasan Goodarzi and the TurboTax Team." Because I had not opened the product yet, I thought, what the heck is he apologizing for? Then I come to find out that my tried and true TurboTax Deluxe will not function as it did in the past, and I for one, need all of the forms that they have eliminated. Well TurboTax, I would have never even thought of using any other tax software, but with this type of underhanded business practice, I have returned my yet unopened TurboTax Deluxe and purchased the H&R Block Deluxe - after all, what do I have to lose? I want you to know that you have lost another long-time, loyal customer to the competition. Also, I hope that the TuboTax team measures their failure in the number of programs returned and the dollars associated with these returns. This blunder is as bad as "New" Coke (1985).

title: Price gouge
content: Note to Turbo tax. After reading this (I use sch C and D) but very minimally I will not pay extra $50. Am moving to H&R block.

title: Good Bye TurboTax after years!!!
content: I am switching to Tax Act as Turbo Tax got too greedy. They will not let you do all the forms. Bad business move Intuit!!!

title: Disgraceful. How can you describe this tax software package ...
content: Disgraceful. How can you describe this tax software package as "deluxe" when the changes incorporated into the 2014 version do not allow to complete some basic schedules. I have bought the turbotax deluxe version for many years but I plan to switch to H & R Block which allows you transfer last years' tax data from turbotax.

title: Intuit lost another customer
content: This year's it's too late. I've shelled out $50 for an inferior product already. But next year I'm buying H&R Block's SW.

title: One Star
content: H&R block it is!! peace out TT.

title: a crippled schedule D would have been fine. But
content: I've used TurboTax for almost 20 years. This year I've switched to HRBlock. Why? Because Intuit decided to drop schedules C and D form its "Deluxe" version. I am not a daily trader but I do need to be able to report a few trades a year .. a crippled schedule D would have been fine. But, forcing me to upgrade sounds like they are just trying to make a quick buck without any regard for their customer base or reputation. Yesterday I received an e-mail from an Intuit exec apologizing for "messing up". However, instead of acknowledging the mistake in deciding to drop the schedules from the "Deluxe" version, Mr. Goodarzi (his career has limited potential now) blames the negative acceptance by the customer base on poor communication and introduction of the changes to the product line. Yep, it is the fault of the poorly educated consumer for dropping TurboTax and switching to another product that offers the same features that he has come to rely on for less.

title: Intuit shot themselves in the foot. Again.
content: After being forced to upgrade Quicken 2011 to the bugfest that was Quicken 2014, I was very unhappy with Intuit (further insult: those bugs never got fixed and I had to BUY Quicken 2015 to get a usable product again). Then, discovering that I needed to buy the more expensive TurboTax Premier to handle my investment sales pushed me over the edge. I, like many people, have switched to H&R Block Deluxe. I was nervous at first, but it imported my TurboTax 2013 file easily. Been as easy to use, and costs a lot less.

title: gouging at its best
content: Gouged for more prices. No new functionality, just more price. Ridiculous.

title: Intuit's new business model? Enrage long term customers!
content: I have been purchasing Turbotax for years and have always bought the Deluxe version as this has always served my needs. For some inexplicable reason, Intuit has decided that the best way to increase revenue is to annoy and disenfranchise long-term customers.

title: No automatic refund
content: Force to upgrade, now thwarted in getting the 'apology refund.' I purchased TT Deluxe going back many years, including many years of the floppy era. I did figure out they'd pulled a fast one and forced me to upgrade to a different version last year, as if raising their prices across the board was not enough. I wouldn't have bothered to submit a review, but for the press coverage of their giving consumers a black eye (good job, marketing department!!). But I purchased and filed an online return in 2013 using Deluxe and I purchased and filed using Premier last year. And even though I filed through Quicken itself, so they have my complete records, their online refund 'helper' denies that I qualify. Which means I will have to waste an hour or two of my time finding my licenses and whatever other crap they'll demand and spending 30, 60, 120? minutes online with customer support as they presumably will keep stonewalling me for the promised refund. Time to check out the competition.

title: the last time, Intuit
content: I have used TurboTax and its predecessors since 1995 on Macs. Because of Intuit's attempt at a money grab, this year I had to go from Deluxe to Premier. With Amazon's offer to Prime Members the price was still barely tolerable, but I have learned my lesson with this company. Next year it will be different tax preparation software.

title: What? No schedule D in Deluxe?
content: Schedule D is a basic form that should be included in any basic to mid-range tax preparation package. It may have seemed like a good idea to catapult schedule D to Premier, but I don't think so. It's too bad when successful companies get bad advice from some internal product manager. After 15+ years I'm looking elsewhere.

title: One Star
content: what crap, switching to HR Block after 12 years because of nickel and dime

title: RIPOFF!
content: I have been a loyal user of Turbotax since the first year it came out. I am saying good-by to Turbotax. I used to do my schedule C on the deluxe version, and now they want to gouge you by forcing us into the premier version. I called Turbotax and was told that they would send me a free upgrade (never received it) . I told the woman that I would not even consider purchasing the new version unless I had the free upgrade. I am switching to H&R Block Deluxe.

title: Switching to H&R Block & Looking for Alternative to Quicken and Quickbooks after this FIASCO
content: After being a TT customer since the 1990's, I will be switching to H&R Block's software this year. The level of disdain Intuit has for its customers (and loyal ones at that) is simply breathtaking and very telling of the type of company Intuit actually is. I no longer care to be associated with such a company and will be switching to H&R Block's tax prep software. Furthermore, I am a Quicken and Quickbooks user (other Intuit products). I will start searching immediately for a replacement to those products as well.

title: TurboTax Program Glitch
content: Last year I switched to TurboTax after years of using TaxCut from H&R Block. After efiling with TurboTax I received a letter from the IRS informing me that I had not calculated the tax on my Social Security earnings correctly and my refund was increased.
