I did not miscalculate my taxes, the TurboTax program did. If the IRS had not caught this error by TurboTax I would have overpaid my 2013 Federal taxes by $513. Needless to say I will be returning to H&R Block's program when I do my 2014 Federal income tax.

title: INUIT is insulting to buyers and I'M shopping elsewhere this year - how DARE they try to FORCE purchase of higher priced items
content: As a long-time Turbo Tax user, I am insulted by the response from the Manufacturer to one of the reviews on this product. Why? Because it was condesending to the purchaser. Call us and we will get you into the "correct" product for your needs. I don't flipping think so. EVERY SALESPERSON is there to sell you MORE than you need when you talk to them. That is true for ANY product you want to purchase. The fact that Turbo Tax has now decided to "cash in" on their popularity and impose RULES that keep you from being able to file your taxes unless you PAY THEM the amount THEY think they deserve to be paid is outrageous. I was going to buy Turbo Tax as usual this year to to taxes. Guess what? After reading the reviews on the product, I'm going shopping for a new tax product that does the same things but that won't try to GOUGE me for more money. I GET TO DECIDE HOW I SPEND MY MONEY - NOT INUIT/TURBO TAX CEOs.

title: Used for approximately 10 years and have liked it. Until this year when I filed and ...
content: Used for approximately 10 years and have liked it. Until this year when I filed and was told a return had already been filed. Turns out it was filed though turbotax using a different account. Seems odd that for the last 10 years my SSN has been associated with the same online login and they allow a filing using a new account. Not sure I will use them again next year. We'll have to see how much of a headache it is to get my refund. My in-laws had the same happen last year (again with turbotax). Nice that they allowed me to pay again to file with them.

title: Yet another Intuit customer holding his last copy of Turbo Tax
content: Another loyal customer of Turbo Tax lost here. I have used Turbo Tax since floppy disk days and am extremely disappointed to see their product handled this way- disabling schedules on different versions and trying to upcharge for piecemeal additional functionality. Like other reviewers have noted, why not just raise the price if money is the object here? Aside from the hidden price gouge, they have added undue complexity to the buying decision (which version do I really need?) I will move to a different product for next year. (As an aside, the responses from Intuit people to the negative reviews could become a case study on how NOT to talk to customers. Intuit managed to take a bad situation and make it even worse, completely diminishing their credibility.)

title: Turbotax has really screwed up a good thing. After 15+ years of using their tax ...
content: Turbotax has really screwed up a good thing. After 15+ years of using their tax software, we will now be switching. And once we switch there is very little chance we will ever return as customers. This change in pricing/what is included in each version is not just going to hurt Turbotax this year, but for many years to come as for many customers this was basically an annual subscription. Nice move Intuit! This will be a business school case on how to destroy loyalty and revenues for years.

title: H & R Block Now Has a New Customer
content: I've been using TurboTax since the DOS days, and I need to file Schedules C, D, and E. After reading press reports of the changes to the 2014 version as well as the reviews here, I'd go back to pencil and paper before I would consider using TurboTax again. They apparently no longer want my business - well, that's fine with me since I no longer want their product. Good bye TurboTax, hello H & R Block. I'd give zero stars if I could to show my opinion of this woefully mishandled fiasco.

title: Intuit TurboTax Bait and Switch
content: Intuit bait and switch. I'm so disgusted at Intuit's tactic to gut schedules C, D, and E from the Deluxe version which I've used for over 10 years. I've been a loyal TurboTax user for so many years. Like past years I automatically picked up the Deluxe version knowing it will do everything I need. I only learned of the gutted Deluxe features from reading online. I already purchased the Deluxe version not realizing what Intuit had done to it's loyal customers. Intuit, I hope you enjoy the $$ gains from forcing people like me to pay you more to get the same features now that I purchased your lousy Deluxe version. Enjoy it now because this is the last time I will have purchased your product.

title: Too little to late
content: I was a long time. Turbotax user, After realizing Turbotax Deluxe did not include vital schedules, I switched to H & R block software this year. Not only is as the program cheaper, the transition was easy, H & R Block transferred my prior year TurboTax data and the H & R program required no learning curve.

title: Last year using Intuit
content: The issue with Intuit changing their software for the 2014 year are well documented. Only purchased to run along side HR block software for this year. Will not be using Intuit next year. Vote with your dollars!

title: So long TT..
content: A terrible marketing blunder by Intuit. Count me as another loyal customer lost.. You would have thought that this ploy would have been thoroughly vetted, but apparently not. This is a perfect business school case study as to how NOT to do business.. H&R Block should be writing Intuit thank you letters..

title: Do not buy!!!
content: Very poor! Bought with state and then had to pay extra 20 to do state. A certified tax preparer would have charged me less than I spent and no headache of doing myself. Would give it a 0 if possible!

title: Add me to the list of long-time users who will no longer use TurboTax
content: Add me to the list of long-time users who will no longer use TurboTax. Intuit is being ridiculous.

title: Cannot e-file with Windows XP - what a RIP OFF!
content: I've used TurboTax for many years and had been very happy with them. This is my last year! After completing my returns, and paying the $24.99 to e-file my state taxes, I get the message that my transmission did not go through and that I may have lost internet connection (I did not). I did the trouble-shooting on the TurboTax website and followed all the instructions, including putting Internet Explorer back on my computer. Finally after hours of trying to e-file my taxes, I find out that since I have an older version of XP and Internet Explore, I cannot e-file from my very functional, but older desktop computer because I do not have a newer version of Windows and Explorer. So now I am not only out the $24.99 I paid to e-file my state taxes, but I also no longer qualify for the additional Amazon 10% refund bonus, plus I have to print everything out and mail all the supporting documentation. What a huge waste of my time and money. VERY DISAPPOINTED! I will find a different way to file my taxes next year. Goodbye TurboTax.

title: TurboxTax Deluxe is NOT what it used to be...be aware!
content: As a TurboTax Deluxe user for years now, I was totally surprised and taken off guard with this years change of the product. I have just purchased my 2014 Deluxe version an had NO idea this was changed out...Just by rote I picked up the newest Deluxe. An discovered it NOT the same product I have just for years. Here is the problem I have filed a simple Sch D. with Deluxe for years. NOW with this being dropped by TurboTax from the Deluxe version I am disappointed. PLEASE PONY UP MORE CASH, says TurboTax Corporate to do your Sch D filing. An Corporate TurboTax CEO and V.Pres must have known there would be blowback with this change in their product that they have pushed for years and now suddenly changed. I read reviews at Forbes and another financial outlets that customers are reeling from this change up. I can think of CEO's that have had to reverse themselves (Netflix comes to mind) when customers revolted and pulled support for a product. SO Folks be aware TurboTax Deluxe is NOT what it was.

title: Changes to 2014 Turbo Tax Deluxe
content: I've used Turbo Tax for several years, so I just downloaded the 2014 version this morning. Shame on me for not reading the 'current' product information before purchasing. Intuit has changed the Deluxe version, eliminating the import brokerage information with capital gains calculation. According to an article an Intuit official says that it's not a big deal since it doesn't effect that many people. Here is one person that will never use Turbo Tax again!

title: Turbo gouges consumers; get H&R for free.
content: Taking it back to Costco. Most of the documentation etc is from the government. The design is much the same as years before - except less explanation, less available forms, less help which were all pretty slim to begin with. Less; same price. Since when has that ever been good for the consumer. This version could cost you an extra 30 to 40 bucks just to file AFTER you already bought the thing! If you bought it, send your receipt into H&R Block at switchtoblock@hrblcok.com to get a FREE copy of H&R. Or if you makes less than 60,000 try the IRS website for free. Or TaxAct for free. Or if you are doing a simple tax form EX or, apparently 1040A, with Turbo Tax. Google New York Times Users Say Turbo Tax Deluxe is Less Deluxe Than it Used to Be. Thanks NYTimes. I've used it in the past. Never really like it because it

title: Time to check H&R Block Basic Software
content: As a long time customer, the title, Deluxe edition is misleading. It's no longer include stock sales in this version. I wholeheartedly agree with what Lar who reviewed this product and suggested to look around for other softwares such as H&R Block Basic software for $19.95. I like to support the company which may have better vision and goals than Intuit. Ultimately, I wish the tax calculation/report should be done by government perhaps and should be accessible online. If you know how to code/program, you would know how easily this software could be reproduced by other software companies. Perhaps, that's what's happening with Intuit that they need to make the price market higher to create more revenue while they start to lose their long-time customers to other tax software companies such as H&R Block or TaxCut every year. Time to check other softwares in my personal opinion.

title: Another Lost Customer
content: I have been using TurboTax for more than 10 years, and have been mostly happy with it. But with the loss of e-filing for schedules C and D on the deluxe version, not to mention increasing prices over the years, I am done. I just downloaded H&R Block's tax software and imported last year's TurboTax data into it with no problems. I have the feeling that H&R Block and TaxAct will be gaining a lot of new customers. It probably won't put as much of a dent in Intuit's TurboTax business as it should, but I just can't support them any more. I already stopped using Quicken a few years ago.

title: Lies, lies and more lies... you ...
content: Lies, lies and more lies... you spring an additional $37 fee to file my state taxes at the end.

title: Well they have lost a customer and I am not pleased with Amazon for not making this change clearer
content: I foolishly purchased this software believeing that it had the same capabilities that it had the previous year. It doesn't and it is not returnable. Well they have lost a customer and I am not pleased with Amazon for not making this change clearer.

title: Another loyal customer gone.
content: I bought Deluxe from Costco, got home and never opened the box after reading the back and noticing that Schedule C was not included anymore. I decided to call TT and talked to a guy to get an explanation. He basically told me he had the answer memorized because of the vast amount of calls he was receiving. He stated that the interview portion for Sch. C was not complete enough on the previous Deluxe versions. What? Not complete enough? So their way of fixing this was by making you pay for the highest upgrade they have. What a joke. I have faithfully bought TT Deluxe since 1998. What a horrible business decision by these guys, absolutely horrible. I am done with TT, absolutely done!

title: While this product is easy to use the free filing claims are nonsense
content: While this product is easy to use the free filing claims are nonsense. Processing fee is 39.99 to file. I paid for the software because filing was supposedly free.That is not free fed filing! Turbo tax free filing advertisement is totally misleading. More corporate lies to the consumer. Intuit and turbo tax can shove it and their $39.99 processing fee!!!!!!!!

title: No free upgrade anymore
content: The disaster that was Intuit's removing full Schedule C from Deluxe re-emerges. There is no free upgrade anymore. I was told that, despite Vice President Bob's communications, that the upgrade offer was terminated on April 20. The worst part is that nowhere could you find this information. Some places said yes, some said no, I went with Bob's letter. Nothing about an expiry date on the upgrade offer. I'll work around it for now, but I'm not giving Intuit another dime, ever. For the cost to them of essentially nothing, they lose a customer of at least 20 years. Hell of a marketing team.

title: Dumped!
content: I switched to H&R and I'm happy with my decision. Easily imported 2013 tax return and begun using the software for 2014 tax return. H&R Deluxe does what it suppose to and I don't see any issues with it so far.

title: TurboTax is going downhill very fast.
content: They removed Schedule D without highlighting that fact anywhere. I had used this product for years and ordered it this year as well. When I found out they had removed schedule D from the online submission capability, I demanded a refund. I am going with H&R Block this year. I am not going to be forced to pay the extra money for TurboTax 'Premier' addition, just to get the functionality that I always used to have. TurboTax is going downhill very fast.

title: Nice to have a choice and not have to accept ...
content: Will not be purchasing TT again until previous Deluxe features are reinstated. Will instead use H&R Block. Nice to have a choice and not have to accept the forced price increase. Not a good move Intuit. 20+ years of brand loyalty gone in one year. Business school lesson someday.

title: I'm one of the "small percentage" of users that is affected, and I'm also angry
content: I rent out the top floor of a two-flat and for the last five years I have used TurboTax Deluxe to file my taxes including a Schedule E for the rental. This year TurboTax wants to bump me to a higher tier product--with an associated 50% price increase. They removed support for Schedule E (along with Schedules C & D) from Deluxe and want me to use the more expensive Premier. Well, I'm not playing. Fortunately, I found out about the change before I made my purchase this year. I'll gladly give up the automatic transfer of my prior tax returns and do a little more typing in a new product. I might not find anything that much cheaper than Turbo Tax Premier, but that's okay as long as I find a company that wants my business enough not to try and gouge me. ***Update: Looks like the H&R Block software that includes Schedule E retails for $64.95. That's about $5 more than the price of TurboTax Deluxe. You know what Intuit? I would have stayed if you raised the price of Deluxe $5 but retained the functionality I needed. But this $30 forced bump to a higher tier? That's just insulting.

title: Disappointed in Turbo Tax!
content: I also have been using Turbo Tax since it first came out in the 80s. It has been a great tool, and actually made it fun to do my taxes. I'm very disappointed to learn that they have stripped the most important tool out of Deluxe - downloading investment data - "to be consistent with the online version"? What do they take us for - fools? Why not make the online version like the desktop version? Likely, it will be just a matter of time before the other tax preparation software companies follow suit. Accounting firms might have weighed in on this, since they also purchase and use the software. It could be that accounting firms lobbied to strip the Schedule D out of Deluxe so that it was no longer affordable, and would drive some individuals to use them instead. I'm not familiar with other tax software - but guess I will have to learn a new one, and go through the trouble of filling out all of the information that previously was transferred automatically. I wonder if H&R will transfer my Turbo Tax data? I guess I will find out. No more Turbo Tax for me!!! :(

title: I've used TurboTax for years, now I'm headed over to the competition.
content: I've been a TurboTax customer for more than a decade, buying the Deluxe version every year. I was in for a surprise when I was presented with a mandatory $30 up-sell in order to keep working on my taxes. Not a chance...I'm taking H&R Block up on their offer and never looking back.

title: I feel your love so clearly when you removed C &
content: Intuit, I feel your love so clearly when you removed C & D

title: Is T.T. storing my social security number ?
content: The T.T. $25 rebate requires you to provide T.T. with your social security number so they can tell you if you are eligible for the $25, after you purchase Premier & e-file. Is T.T. storing information from my tax return, & if so, what business is it of theirs.?

title: Price hike
content: Dear Intuit, I have a pretty simple return (one rental house) and last year I could use Deluxe. Now, I see that I need to get Premier. Yeah, I agree with the one star reviews. I have used Intuit products for a while, but now I am going to rethink. Don

title: Pulled features to force people to pay twice the usual ...
content: Pulled features to force people to pay twice the usual price for Schedule C. What kind of idiot did Intuit assign marketing responsibility to, a summer intern? So long Turbotax! I'm outta here.

title: Forget the VP and GM, where is CEO, Brad D. Smith? The CEO is responsible for boosting "shareholder value".
content: Bought TT Deluxe from Costco three weeks ago and just thought I read the reviews on Amazon before starting to file. Wow, such overwhelming anger from loyal customers (of which I was one), and justifiably so. I find it difficult to believe that only 20% of TT customers use the missing schedules (especially Capital Gains and Losses). This could mean one of two things: either the 80% is low-income or high income, because these are the folks who do not or cannot have investments. I doubt high net-worth individuals will use TT over an advisor or specialist. Then if the customers are mainly low-income, then Intuit is facing price competition and margin erosion due to the increasingly tax code revisions - meaning more investment required to coding without the ability to raise prices on products due to low transition costs to alternatives (such as H&R Block). GM & VP should be ashamed. Thank you CEO Brad D. Smith, for helping your shareholders and boosting your own bonus.

title: Waiting for tomorrow's statement from Intuit
content: We have used TT Deluxe since the 90's and just purchased the latest at Costco last week. It will be returned tomorrow unless Intuit comes out Monday with a statement that everyone who needs an upgrade will get one and from now on the Deluxe will contain all the forms previously included. Otherwise we will make a permanent switch to H&R Block. Not only that, but we will short Intuit stock.

title: Buying another product
content: Thanks for the advice everyone. I got that lame email from Intuit as well. I've used TurboTax for well over 15 years, but I'm going to switch to H&R Block this year. I hope this new Intuit strategy gets them what they deserve - a lot less business.

title: really glad i read all these negative reviews and avoided buying ...
content: really glad i read all these negative reviews and avoided buying the wrong product this year. unfortunately, looks like i need to switch from turbo tax to H&R Block after using turbo tax deluxe for as long as i can remember. Also, the latest version of quicken for Mac 2015 is as bad as the old one, don't buy that either, i will be executing my refund options on that bad purchase...

title: This is all about increased revenue despite that you'd like to dance around that accusation and minimize the users ...
content: Really, Intuit? Do you really think that your customer should pay the price for your "streamlining"?? This is all about increased revenue despite that you'd like to dance around that accusation and minimize the users that are impacted. Even if that were the case, why would you impact those loyal users to your gain? Reputation is everything...and having those that are upset have to call to get what they need does nothing to improve your reputation for making this change. Bad move. There's competitors, remember? On another note, your mobile app is a joke too. Despite it's very low review ratings since inception of the app (1 1/2 stars in iTunes due to messing up the desktop files after syncing, not being able to split transactions and tag each of them individually is another example) there has been nothing done to correct these issues despite several people providing you feedback for 2 years!!! Intuit likes and appreciates their customers, right? Spare me.

title: Total rip off
content: Bought deluxe & got a letter apologizing to me for changing the software and offering $25 IF I buy the Deluxe version AND the Home & Office version for ANOTHER $100. WHAT A DEAL!!!!! I give you $150 - you give me $25 back. Next year its H&R Block.

title: Don't waste your money if you have Window XP and Google Chrome!!
content: This year....I'm not liking Turbo Tax at all!! It is STILL the quality program it's always been, however, this year I'm having a HUGE issue with getting it sent to you thru the internet! I have Google Chrome and it worked to get updates and EVERYTHING, EXCEPT to get the actual finished taxes sent!! I am SO mad about that! I have called several times, and of course, the first time I was told to download Internet Explorer, which I tried, but it WILL NOT download on my computer as it's still Windows XP! I DO NOT have the money to upgrade to Windows 8, so XP will HAVE to do for now. So when I tried to download Explorer, it says it won't because it does NOT support Windows XP!!! Well woopie! I DON'T HAVE THE MONEY TO CHANGE IT NOW!! What I DON'T understand is WHY I can do EVERYTHING (Updates, etc) using my Google Chrome, but I can't get my finished tax forms uploaded!! I have used Turbo Tax for years and NOW there is a problem! I can't believe that they don't have a fix for that!! So, needless to say, I am VERY disappointed and upset about this! I feel like i've just wasted $50. I have spent numerous hours on the phone about this....NO fix for it! I WAS able to download Mozilla, but it did not work or help! After ALL these years of using this product, right now, I can't use it!! What good is it to be able to put all the information in, but can't get it to where it needs to go! I can't believe that I'm the only one with this problem, so where is the fix for it?? I do NOT have a problem with the Turbo Tax software other than that....at this point, I WILL NOT be recommending this to anyone else after ALL the time I have wasted and the money I've paid for it!

title: Over and out.
content: Hate it when corporations put the squeeze on customers by stripping out previously-available functionality and providing it back as a premium service. Congratulations Intuit - you have joined the same club as cable providers and most airlines. After 17 years of using Turbotax, I'd rather do my taxes by hand than buy TurboTax again.

title: Short and sweet: Good bye TurboTax
content: Short and sweet: Good bye TurboTax, I'm moving to your competition. Longer version: The removal of Schedules C and D was deceptive no matter what double speak an Intuit spokesperson attempts; you will have lost loyal customers who if even are accepting of some settlement for this year, they will be gone next year. Unfortunately, zero stars are not an option.

title: Go suck eggs Bob.
content: As a long time TurboTax customer, I certainly appreciate the heads up with all of the negative reviews on the unacceptable changes that Intuit has undertaken with this product. I'll be going elsewhere. Go suck eggs Bob.

title: Very Unhappy. I'd short the stock and make a ...
content: Very Unhappy. I'd short the stock and make a ton of money, but then I would need a Schedule D to record my gain. I need to check quickbooks and make sure it still provides an income statement.

title: Dishonest Practices by Intuit
content: Next year I am going to definitely switch to H&R Block's software program. Like most people, I was suckered into buying the Deluxe version only to find out that I needed the Premium version. After I upgraded for $35, Intuit offered to refund me $25 for having to upgrade. Only problem was I had to call a number and that number kept getting disconnected...hmmm. Wonder if it is just another trick by Intuit? Never have received my $25. Anyway, I am finished with Intuit and their dishonest tactics. Please join me in switching to H&R Block next year and show Intuit they cannot continue to screw people over. Update 3-9-15 As of today, still have not heard from TurboTax about my rebate even though I have an Incident ID#

title: Moving to something else because of the increase in price.
content: I too am moving on to another tax software. I have been using TT for a long time also, but the increase in price has moved me to Block Financial H&R Block Tax Software 14 Deluxe which I have already purchased here at Amazon. I have given this software one star only on the price increase. I could not give it anything for use, as I am not using it this year. I will review the new software after I complete my taxes. So long Intuit and Turbo Tax.

title: I have been perfectly happy with this software as it does exactly what I ...
content: As is my custom (for at least 10 years now), I bought TurboTax Deluxe while at Costco so I would be ready to do my taxes. I have been perfectly happy with this software as it does exactly what I need at a quite reasonable cost. I was SHOCKED to see an article yesterday informing me that what I bought is not the software I have always purchased under the same name. It's now more or less the old 'basic' version. I sold one stock this year, and I'm supposed to pay an extra $50 because of that??! Sorry, not going to do that. I'll take H&R Block up on their free switchover offer and give them a try instead. If Intuit wants to make a change that large, they should realize that they need to communicate it up front so that people know what they're buying. Even now that I know, when I read the packaging you still can't tell that it has no schedule C,D functionality. So long Intuit...

title: Quality product, but a greedy company who wants to extort you every chance they can
content: We have something in common. We all paid a premium price to TT, only to be extorted by TT to forceably upgrade our purchase to do common tasks that were previously included in the Deluxe version of TT in the past. For shame. This year, I had a K-1 filing. Simple form that was included in years past. Unless I spend another $30 plus state sales tax to upgrade to Premier , TT Deluxe would not take process my K-1. The form was not even listed in the forms section of the program. Quicken went down that path with forced upgrades to keep on-line updates of banking and credit card transactions. The program is good for 3 years and then "poof" this feature is shut off overnight. I'm still fuming over that one and I am working on an alternative now. I have two years to find it and I will do just that. Very disappointed with TT and Quicken products right now. Like many others here, I will be using H&R Block next year and into the future. Intuit, you have dug into my pocket for the very last time. Good bye and I hope sales plunge next year to a point you see the error of your greedy ways! ***** 2014-01-09 - Update Pandora's box has been flung open and the goblins are now out with NO hope of putting them back in without direct damage to Intuit and their reputation. Yes, I too received one of the condescending responses from Intuit today. There was absolutely no sincerity in their response to my review and adding insult to injury, the tone of their response was dubious in their sincerity to make things right for the end customer. Right now, Intuit is in full damage control mode. Reading back over the last 700 comments tonight, "Bob's" comments went from 1) you shouldn't expect what you got in years past and read the fine print on the box, to 2) we have made changes to align our product lines both on-line and on home computers uniformly to finally, 3) change can be challenging. These statements only threw gasoline on the fire in an attempt to put this PR blunder fire out. Intuit working these forums as hard as they are right now makes me think that Intuit is really seeing the mess they made. They are trying to see how they can dig themselves out of this and try to save face at the same time. From my vantage point, Intuit is not doing a very good job right now. How much worse is it going to get before Intuit takes some drastic action that should have been done at the outset of this problem? As one other reviewer put is so eloquently describing the current state of things (I'm paraphrasing) -- This blunder will be taught as a Marketing 101 case study in Business Schools. This mess has taken on a life of its own. I, for one, am interested to see what will happen at the end of this disaster. Stay tuned for more interesting developments. ****** 2015-01-23 - Update Finally, Intuit admits to their stupid mistake. They are now offering a $25 "rebate" for people who were forced to pay for the upgrade. First, I paid $30 plus 8.1% state sales tax, so I am not made whole. I'm still out of pocket $7(+) even with the rebate Second - a rebate that you have to jump through hoops to get, many many months from now. There are too many weasel ways out of this and Intuit will do just that. Lastly - to process the rebate, the very first question, out of the box - Intuit wants your Social Security number. What??!! I'll be dipsticked to give Intuit this most precious of precious numbers after this major screw up. Who knows where it will end up with these clowns. I didn't have to give my SS# to buy TT Deluxe, I didn't have to give my SS# to purchase my extorted copy of "Premier", I never gave a SS# on any Intuit product rebalte in the past, what makes you ,think I will do it now. Like I said before - POUND SAND Intuit!

title: Cautionary Reviews Make You Pause About Bad Products
content: I was about to stop printing all the forms myself and following the instructions to fill out the forms. I was just going to be lazy this year and have turbo tax do it for me, but after reading all the negative reviews about how they are charging extra for the schedules I see that it still makes more sense to just do my taxes myself. I'm not an expert I just give myself plenty of time and double check my work. You can probably do that too!

title: Deficient by design?
content: I have used TurboTax for the last several years, and each year, there is exactly one form that is keeping me from using a cheaper version of TurboTax. One year, it was having an HSA. I could have filed with TurboTax Basic except for needing a single form (8889) causing me to need Deluxe instead. The next year, it's a single stock sale causing me to need Premier instead of Deluxe. Is this by design? I think intuit needs a better business model. Perhaps allowing you to buy single form add-ons for $1-2 each, instead of one form being a $20-40 upgrade to the next TT tier. Or just having only two versions of TurboTax: Home (includes ALL non-business forms), and Business (includes everything else). Hopefully next year's TurboTax releases have a better strategy. If not, I will probably try out H&R Block's tax prep software.

title: I am glad I read the reviews before buying this
content: I am glad I read the reviews before buying this. I have been using Turbo Tax for 20 years back when it was for DOS. I am not going to do the "buy and beg" as some have done to get the Premium version. For about half the price I will be buying HR Block's Premium software. Intuit is free to do what they want but I am free not to buy it. My tolerance for Turbo Tax is already lower than ever because of bugs that have lingered for years without getting fixed such as the vehicle registration deduction in Iowa.

title: Intuit Bait and Switch ?
content: Bob I would think you might want to have your legal team review your recent Turbo Tax tactics. Somehow the recent obtuse product descriptions may violate state laws regarding "bait and switch" marketing and sales. In any event after 20 years I have abandoned Turbo Tax in favor of H&R Block tax preparation software. This ridiculous product placement by Intuit will certainly be fodder for Wharton MBA students. Just to add a little fuel to the insanity of this Intuit fiasco I enclose documentation of my H&R block purchase. Good grief what were sophomoric product planners thinking ? 1 x ($64.95) H&R BLOCK 2014 Premium Windows - Download $64.95 1 x (($32.48)) DISCOUNT FOR PROMOTION CODE($32.48) Subtotal: $32.47 Tax: $0.00 Shipping and Handling: $0.00 Total Amount: $32.47

title: The three mistakes of Intuit pricing.
content: As other posts indicate, Intuit is being deceptive in sales and marketing by not clearly forewarning loyal customers about the changes in their software. I have been using the product since inception. Initially, one product did it all. Then they started segmenting the capabilities. But as recently as last year, the Deluxe Federal (no State) with 5 e-files was available as I recall on disc from Best Buy and others for $29.95. And you could do all federal filings. The Premier version only added "extra guidance and help" but that one package was complete federal filing for 5 returns. The even cheaper Basic version would also do all returns bud did not have the deduction "maximizer" features of Deluxe, and as I recall you could get it for $19.95 (although hard to find). These prices are retail outlet prices not Turbo Tax Intuit prices. Now to file my return I would need the Home and Business version, Intuit disc price $109.99 for $99.99 on sale. (Same price at Best Buy today). So my tax prep cost has more than tripled from $29.95 last year to $99.99 this year. I am calling the 800-445-1875 number tomorrow to inquire as any other options, which I expect to be none, and then I will be looking elsewhere for my tax prep software. Don't understand any logic that would make this good business for Intuit. First, essentially tripling the price. Secondly, doing it in a sneaky way. Third, playing politics with their comments that they have not raised prices in years and blowing smoke. It's like they have taken advice from the Obamacare Gruber consultant and assumed their customers are stupid. There is no way this move will do anything but hurt them by ticking off longtime customers. Reviews indicate there are other good well priced tax packages out there and Intuit customers will be angrily flocking to them. HAPPY UPDATE: Thanks to another review pasted below, Intuit also upgraded my Turbo Tax this year after calling 800-445-1875 and speaking with a customer service rep. Apparently the entire program is on the disk and if you need a feature that is not available, you have the opportunity to pay and upgrade when you need the form. The rep will give me an unlock code to enter when I have the program installed on my PC. As Janet says below, hopefully they will change the 2015 product back to like the 2013 product!!! (Are you listening Intuit?) Many Thanks to a review by Janet McLaughlin "I agree the 2014 Deluxe is not the same as previous years. However, I read Bob's suggestion to call 800-445-1875 (8am - 8pm EST M-F). I explained my tax return needs to the nice woman and she upgraded me for free. Hopefully TurboTax will change their product features back into Deluxe for next year, but for this year I can confirm that TurboTax is not being a Grinch!" So all you users out there, buy the Deluxe and call 800-445-1875!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! AFTER RESPONSE from Intuit Rep, my response was: Overall satisfied for this year, but next year will probably change horses. And as for the comparing Deluxe no state to Premier etc not apples to apples I agree. With the caveat that last year I did my C D E A schedules no problem with Deluxe for $30 and this year it would be at least Premier at $90 that I need (Best Buy), thus the triple the cost for my situation. Note also I am in Texas and do not need the state return. I wasn't born in Texas, but I got here as fast as I could!!! Thanks Ray .

title: Very Disappointed
content: I was burned by this as well. After years of buying TurboTax Deluxe who would think that this year it wouldn't support Schedule D. How can it even be called "deluxe" if it doesn't have this basic functionality.

title: Good Bye Turbotax
content: Glad I read the reviews before wasting money on this years version. Used TT for about a decade, but now that I know H&R Blocks software can import my data from last years return the time to switch is here.

title: Not Pleased with Intuit!
content: Was using deluxe over the last few years but now have to go to premier just for sale of stock and cost basis. A hike of $20 is not appreciated due to the removal of schedule D.

title: 1099-DIV
content: I got burned on the 1099-DIV section as well. $30 upgrade required to report dividends and stock sales. I am a small time stock player and didn't even earn much over $30 in stock sales and dividends. I understand you can print your return and add the 1099-DIV manually which, lol now makes this software more complicated and defeats the purpose of using it. I noticed H&R includes 1099-DIV for about $40.

title: Another 20 year customer heading out the door
content: Been a TurboTax customer for probably close to 20 years, but I will be moving to H&R Block this year unless Intuit changes their tune ASAP. I'll be shopping for the software in another couple of weeks, so Intuit still has time to change their policy. But I'm not getting my hopes up. And no way I'm going to spend 10+ minutes calling or e-mailing to try to get the "free" upgrade. That's a non-start for me. Sorry, Intuit, you blew it big time.

title: Avoid for 2014 Taxes!
content: I was also a loyal TurboTax customer for years...not anymore. Their removal of schedules in the deluxe program and then trying to charge you the premium fee for access to them was the last straw. I'll be using H&R Block's much cheaper program from this point forward (which allows you to import your TurboTax info from prior years, so no worries there). Heck, H&R Block's premium program is cheaper than TurboTax's "Deluxe" mid-range one, so it makes even more sense to switch. TurboTax is going to lose a lot of customers over this price gouging, and they deserve to.

title: Used H&R Block Instead
content: Thanks to everyone who gave a bad rating on this product. I heeded your advice and bought H&R Block Deluxe Federal + State + free federal e-file. It linked up with my Turbotax 2013 return seamlessly and I had my taxes completed (both federal and state) and electronically transmitted in one hour flat. It was much easier than Turbotax. I won't be going back to Turbotax any more, no matter how much they say they will fix the problem this year.

title: Stay away!
content: If I could give it zero stars I would! Listen to all the reviews and stay away. Waste of money and time. You've been warned lol don't complain when you're out $60 and couldn't submit. Sucks but lesson learned...listen to reviews!

title: Bad management decision costs Intuit another customer (x millions more)
content: Thanks to Yahoo news and other sites for warning me of Intuit's crippling of Turbotax Deluxe this year. Some common forms, needed by just about everyone with a tax return more complicated than a 1040-EZ, have been removed from the Deluxe product in a bid to get people to spend twice as much on a more expensive product. Fortunately, H&R Block offers a product very similar to what Turbotax Deluxe was last year, for less, and it imports your previous Turbotax files. I will switch over to that. I have been using Turbotax for 17 years, and with one stupid fatal decision, they have lost my business for the next 17 years (plus the millions of other people who will switch). Congratulations, Intuit. With one move, you have followed Myspace, Blackberry, Netscape, etc. as products that everyone used to use, and now almost no one does. On the plus side, besides the money I will save switching to a cheaper software product, I expect to also make some money shorting your stock (NASDAQ INTU) because I doubt you will still be in business 3 years from now.

title: Thank you to all who have taken the time to ...
content: Thank you to all who have taken the time to comment and thank you Bob for taking the time to respond. This discussion has helped push my decision to change to H&R Block from over a decade of using Turbo Tax. I will give H&R Block a try as I shouldn't have to call to get a "free" upgrade or find the product I need at the "right" price. I am not afraid of change and will work through the learning curve. Very eye-opening comments and I do not remember a time that a product received so much negative reviews from its customer base. Bob says they get the sentiment we are expressing but I have a hard time believing that statement. For me...I am in the minority as Bob as stated repeatedly...I get it and am voting with my wallet.

title: Missing forms prevent filing with no ETA or customer service, company holds paying customers' prior years data hostage
content: Iâve been using TurboTax for many years to file my returns, and had always been satisfied with them prior to this. Iâve used both the online and installed software versions of their product in the past. My tax situation has been complex enough that Iâve had to purchase much more expensive âeditionsâ of the product to handle all the forms, and Iâve generally paid extra for the âaudit defenseâ guarantee. This year I had two issues that really soured me on their product. First, in some situations Intuit wonât let you retrieve and print prior yearsâ returns unless youâve paid for the current yearâs product. I canât remember whether I filed the prior year in their online version or the downloaded software, but I am buying a house and needed to retreive the prior return for the bank. The lesson here is donât just save your tax return in Intuitâs file format. Export it as a PDF, save AND print it for your records. The second problem had to do with one form I needed not being ready. I started my taxes in early January and filled in details as the forms arrived. The warning that I couldnât file because a particular form wasnât ready yet kept coming up, and finally I started looking for help in the forums. I found an article posted by them which said the form in question was available for everything but E-File on Mac, and that it would be available for that final format on January 30th. Two weeks past that date not only is the form not available for E-File, but printing a copy of it produces a big watermark âDO NOT FILE - FORM NOT FINALâ even though itâs supposed to be available. I tried checking for updates and reinstalling as suggested but no luck. I was finally able to find a telephone number for customer service and speak to someone there after a 20-minute hold, only to be told they had no information other than what I knew from searching the forums, and no process for escalating my call to anyone who could help or even give me an updated ETA. I was promised a full refund for the software but have had to start all over on preparing my taxes and several weeks have gone by in which I could have already filed my return. Intuit makes it hard to speak to anyone in the first place, and harder still to find anyone who can help you with your problems. Between that and the limited access to your own information that magically becomes no problem if you simply give them more money, Iâm very dissatisfied.

title: I have nothing new to add that hasn't been said ...
content: I have nothing new to add that hasn't been said already. I'm a nearly 20 year used of Turbo Tax who will be moving to an H&R Block product now. Sorry - not going to pay $30 extra just to fill out a single Schedule that was always part of the Deluxe product.

title: TurboTax Deluxe no longer a value to me
content: Thanks to all who alerted me to the changes in the 2014 edition of TurboTax Deluxe. After countless years as a loyal TurboTax Deluxe customer, I will be switching to another product. I have a single investment account with Merrill Lynch that consisted over the years of various mutual funds. The consolidated year-end tax statement from ML made entering the tax information into TT Deluxe a no-brainer. In recent years, the imports were done via electronic download. There was never any need for the extra assistance offered in Premier, although each year I was urged to buy the more expensive product during the tax preparation and filing process. To think that I would have to upgrade and pay extra just to e-file is preposterous. Goodbye TurboTax.

title: Loyal customer since 1994 going elsewhere, Intuit's money grab has taken priority over customer satisfaction!
content: Loyal TurboTax customer since 1994, yes 1994 and still have the diskettes and the product CD's from every year to prove it. Where on any of the product documentation is it highlighted that features and functions have been removed from the Deluxe version? Intuit needs to admit their mistake and simply restore what they removed via an online update, automatically, free of charge. Requiring customers to call and complain to get upgraded to Premiere is ridiculous. Note to Intuit: Better increase the staffing in your call center. I have also used Quicken for longer than TurboTax and I am tired of the continual every three year forced upgrades on that product. I am leaving Intuit as their business model is to bilk more and more money out of it's customers instead of offering best of breed software that consumers rave about. Well the consumers are raving now. Congratulations Intuit. No more feeding the Intuit pig. If there was a negative 5 stars rating option I would have picked that.

title: Timing of Intuit's Proposed Corrective Actions - Lack of Responsiveness!
content: After I had purchased the Deluxe version, I started reading about the reduced functionality - should have done my homework first; my fault. Whilst doing taxes this morning, I was prompted to upgrade to the Premier version for an additional $30. I have also read Intuit's response about allowing present Deluxe users a free upgrade within the program, starting February 7th. Can they not immediately allow users with genuine Deluxe copies a free upgrade to the Premier version without charging the $30 upgrade fee. Not impressed with the proposed corrective measures and lack of responsiveness by the company.

title: TurboTax Messed Up Big Time!
content: As so many have noted Intuit is gouging their loyal customers with a pitiful excuse for forcing them into buying a product double the cost of last years program. What a poor excuse for an apology in the letter sent from Goodarzi at TurboTax. More corporate bull for screwing the consumer. I have used Turbo Tax as well as Quicken since their introduction. Now you can be sure I will change to a competitor next year. And to add insult to injury they offer you a $25 refund for a product upgrade that costs $30 more on their own website. If they wanted to do it right they should have given all their 2014 Deluxe customers the Premier edition upgrade at no additional cost for misleading them and give them a discount on the 2015 edition next year to insure they stay with TurboTax. But that would be the honorable thing to do and we know that corporate America does what is right for them, not the consumer.

title: If you're self-employed, don't bother buying. Intuit has ...
content: If you're self-employed, don't bother buying. Intuit has just shown everyone precisely how much they care about gaining your business as a customer.

title: Intuit epic fail...I purchased H&R Block 2014 this year. (Side note: Microsoft, please bring back MONEY software)
content: I purchased H&R Block 2014 this year. Just like the majority of past customers...I found Intuit's "apologies" insulting and their business practices appalling. Their products, TurboTax & Quicken, have just been horrible over the past several "upgrades". I'm hanging on to Quicken 2012 because anything beyond that is a joke. INTUIT, WAKE UP!

title: One Star
content: I can not believe they removed Sch D

title: What a scam! Secret price increase hidden in the ...
content: What a scam! Secret price increase hidden in the product. Schedules that used to be part of DELUXE are now requiring you to upgrade to PREMIER. If you call and complain about it, they will give you the free upgrade...this year only. If you do it...your in the same boat next year. As a 20 year customer...its a shame but I just moved over to HR Block which includes those schedules. What a creepy way of getting a price increase through. Shame on TurboTax.

title: Purchased Too Early This Year!
content: Downloads fine... unable to install. Amazon says to contact software publisher and won't provide additional help. Intuit doesn't even show that I've purchased from Amazon. Been buying for years the same way with no issues. Usually wait until April.... perhaps I'm the one finding the problems and helping the overall QA efforts.

title: I hate Intuit
content: I hate Intuit--I have used Turbotax for more than 10 years and have had a small consulting practice and investment transactions throughout this period. Prior to the 2014 version, I would be offered an opportunity to upgrade so the software would provide more support in each of these areas. As a CPA, I do not need the extra support so declined. This year I was given no option to even prepare the return if i had Sch C income and the price to upgrade within the application exceeded the difference in price I would have had to pay to buy the "enhanced" version. This is just highway robbery. Amazon was great and let me do the exchange for this year. This will be the last year I use Turbotax. (PS- the upgraded version really provided no better support; it just cost more)

title: Most people are right most of the time...
content: I've been a TurboTax user for years too, but I'm not planning on buying it this time just to say I wish I didn't. Some are saying that the functionality of TurboTax "Deluxe" was downgraded to "Basic" level, but is still called Deluxe. Yes, TurboTax is probably easier to install and use than H&R Block software. I'll give H&R block a chance this time. It seems like Intuit got a bit too greedy. Maybe next year, Intuit.

title: Getting the middle finger from TT...Buh Bye
content: I must be one of the 2-4% that TT doesn't care about anymore. When running a small business, I would hate to even lose 1% of a loyal customer base. It was always my goal to maintain current customers and add to that every year. From some of the flippant replies from the VP, I can only assume they are cool with losing loyal customers. Hey, if we all treated clients like that, then we wouldn't need a schedule C, because we would be out of business. Getting ready to install H&R software, so far they seem to appreciate my kind. PS- If I had the kind of reviews TurboTax has, I wouldn't be able to sleep at night.

title: I've used TurboTax pretty loyally for over the past decade
content: Here is the thing that Intuit seems to be missing. I have NO IDEA what forms I need for my taxes. That's the whole point of my purchasing a tax prep software. I do know, however, that TurboTax Deluxe via the interview process, has always met my needs. I dont know if it will this year or not, and herein lies the problem. I have a judgement call to make. I can either purchase TurboTax deluxe and, given the changes to the product, hope that all of my needs are met. Or, I can purchase a different product based on all of the reviews and comments about this and other products. I've used TurboTax pretty loyally for over the past decade. Ive not only done my taxes, both both my parents as well as my in-laws. TurboTax Deluxe has always met our needs. Will it this year given the changes? I have no idea. I havent decided what tax prep software I am going to use. Given the reactions to this change, I may purchase this and, if it doesnt meet my needs, use one of the options for the "right" software. Or I may just purchase the H&R Block software and call it a day. I havent decided yet, but I am keeping a very close eye on what is happening and that will strongly drive my decision.

title: Disappointed in Intuit
content: I donât fault Intuit for trying to get more money for their products. Every company strives for that. What I do fault them for is (1) the size of the effective price increase (double, seriously?) with no improved value proposition (2) that they believe weâre too dumb or too wealthy to care, and (3) for lying to our faces about why it was done. The VP repeatedly states on here it was not a money grab but was a âdifficult decision done to align the products.â Well, the online Deluxe version had been aligned with the Deluxe packaged version every year until last year, when the Sched D was first removed from the online Deluxe product. I know this because I was a longtime user who was an unlucky discoverer of the schedules quietly being removed last year after many hours invested in my online Deluxe return. So the products were deliberately misaligned by TT last year, and now they are claiming that Sched D must be removed from the packaged version âfor the sake of alignmentâ. Well, that explanation is disingenuous at best, and dishonest at worst. Like others, I donât like the arrogance and lies coming from Intuit and will be voting with my wallet this year over to a competing product.

title: What a rip off! -- I've been usingTurbo Tax ...
content: What a rip off! -- I've been usingTurbo Tax for about 10 years. I guess it's time to look elsewhere. Gouge your customers with switch and bait: that's a sure fire way to instill trust.

title: One Star
content: Very disappointed for price hike.

title: HELLO H AND R BLOCK, GOODBYE TURBO TAX!!'
content: I JUST DID BOTH FEDERAL AND STATE TAXES THRU H AND R BLOCK. COM FOR FREE AND EFILED INTO MY BANK ACCOUNT. I WILL NEVER USE TURBO TAX EVER AGAIN. BUYER BEWARE. USE H AND R BLOCK!!!

title: Unethical!
content: Cheats! They took out essential parts so you have to upgrade to the higher priced version. I'm stuck this year, but after a decade of using them, it will be H&R Block next year!

title: Unhappy TurboTax customer
content: After having been a loyal TurboTax customer for the past 20 years I am very disappointed. It is disturbing that this is the direction Intuit is moving with this "slick" move of selling a perennial highly reliable product. After you purchase the tax package you have used year after year, then when you go to actually use it you find it no longer works without spending an additional $20 or $30 dollars for a required "upgrade". I'll be upgrading alright - and it won't be to a TurboTax product! I think I will try H&R Block software since they seem to be honest with their customers!!

title: Last Year for Turbo Tax For a 15+ yr-long customer (back into last century)
content: I'm just starting out, installing it although I, like a number of other reviewers, have been a long time user. Just starting out, I'm pretty sure this will be the last year. The offline update process is extraordinarily painful: just try & find where you go to download updates. (I will not connect my tax machine to the internet -- also if I need to reconstitute my install, I want to have the update executables handy - data & updates are burned to a data CD). Product registration is overbearing and beyond annoying. This alone would drive me away. Additionally, the software no longer starts up with the tax form when you click on the tax form you want to use -- it starts in initial start mode, including doing a product update (even though it was disabled in the Online->Update menu). And think that I haven't even started the actual tax form yet. Perhaps I'm overly picky because I'm a software engineer, but I can see what Intuit is doing, how they are encouraging the "desirable" behavior. I will update this review after I'm more into my taxes.

title: Good bye, Intuit. After 20 years, this is the last straw
content: Intuit has always felt like a gouging, niggling, greedy little company. They don't understand customer goodwill -- they don't know how to delight customers so we we will want to stay loyal. After over 20 years using TurboTax (originally MacInTax), this year's ridiculous feature cut is the last straw. Good bye, Intuit. I hope you lose millions of customers. Until you learn to treat customers better I think you're going to be on a downward decline -- well-deserved given this year's policy and the infuriating "defense" by your executives.

title: TurboTax....you're out.
content: I have used TurboTax for years, but am going to switch. It was extremely irritating to read their response to their bait-and-switch tactics. Apparently, it was necessary to decrease functionality of their store products to match the decreased functionality of their online products for a more "consistent customer experience." Are you kidding me? I haven't decided yet, but am looking at HR Bock or Tax Slayer. TurboTax....you're out.

title: Big Mistake TurboTax - another lost customer!
content: Well, thanks Amazon and all you reviewers. I am glad that I took notice of the very poor star rating and the reviews. I too have been an 18-year customer of TurboTax. That all ends now, as I am switching to H&R Block. It appears that I would need TT's Premier version to H&R's comparable Deluxe version. TT's Premier would cost me about $40 more (Amazon pricing). My only concern is the transfer of last year's info. I have various carry-forwards that need to be transferred. I will update this post once I have installed and imported last year's tax info to insure it worked properly.

title: Used to use Deluxe Edition; Now have to buy Home & Business Edition. Great revenue move for Intuit but unfair to customers
content: I have used Turbo Tax software for decades. Have used the Deluxe edition to handle stock trades, rental property income, and self employment income for the past several years. Purchased the Deluxe edition this year as I have always done only to find out that it now will not handle rental property income or stock trades. Thought that I only had to upgrade to the Premier edition. I called Intuit and was told that since I also have self employment income, I have to upgrade to the Home and Business edition. Very disappointed in this change that Intuit has made and if I had not already purchased Turbo Tax Deluxe before finding out about this very sneaky move, would have purchased a competing product. Anyway, for 2015 I will not be returning to Turbo Tax.

title: I am so glad I saw all the reviews before I was about ...
content: I am so glad I saw all the reviews before I was about to purchase. What Intuit has done is simply deceptive. I've read all the responses from the VP of consumer advocacy and no amount of explanation explains this move by Intuit. Standardization across products?...BS. Only 2-4% affected?...BS. The only comment I saw that was honest was his own admission that this was a very, very bad business decision. So over 15 years of being a loyal TT customer.....now gone. Will find an alternative software this year, probably H&R Block.

title: One Star
content: No schedule D makes this: not tax software

title: Goodbye TurboTax
content: I was a 20+ year TurboTax user, but while ordering for 2014, noticed all the bad reviews and warnings about the changes to TurboTax Deluxe and the impact on customers. Being one of those affected by the change, I decided to take the opportunity to try a different solution. I chose H&R Block Deluxe. After completing the 2014 filings for myself, and my extended family (6 returns), I have found H&R Block Deluxe to be as easy to use, and as accurate as TurboTax. The returns included home sales, investment sales and exchanges, IRAâs and capital loss/gain calculations. I was able to import prior year TurboTax files without issue, import investments from Ameriprise just as easy as TT, and even though the interface is different than TT, it was intuitive, and just as easy to use. My only minor complaints are that the pre-defined list of items in the donation calculator DeductionPro product in H&R Block is not as comprehensive as the ItsDeductible product in TT, and the state product did not contain the calculation of tax penalty, you had to download a form and calculate yourself, or request the state to calculate for you. Based on my experience this year, I will continue to use H&R Block Deluxe moving forward, unless they make a bonehead move like Intuit did this year with TurboTax. Thank you Intuit for giving me the incentive to try another product and find that it works just as well, for less money. Your back peddling and empty apologies are not enough to win back my business. I have found that your product is not superior, and your business practices and care for your customer are offensive.

title: NO SCHEDULE D!!!!!
content: I'm glad I read the reviews here since the reason I've always purchased the Deluxe version of TT is for the Schedule D. Goodbye TT.

title: Goodbye Turbotax
content: Yeah, I haven't written an Amazon review before but Turbotax's move to downgrade the software for 2014 bothered me enough to chime in. Let's get this straight, in order to enhance user experiences the features in Turbotax Deluxe are downgraded as prices go up? Sure, the forms option for Schedule D is still available in Deluxe but I think many people were using Turbotax for the hand holding and interviewing the software provided based on one's situation. I will be researching H&R block and TaxAct's software this year... Heck, I see through TaxAct you can get federal plus state and free filing, plus interview support for all the schedules, for like 20 bucks. Sorry Turbotax, I really think you made a mistake on this one.

title: Costs went way up. Features are way down. ...
content: Costs went way up. Features are way down. Each states is now $40 bucks extra. Everyone should call in t o Intuit to get cash back on these changes: 800-445-1875.

title: Another 15+ year customer disappointed in Intuit's tactics like everyone else after purchasing (locally ...
content: Another 15+ year customer disappointed in Intuit's tactics like everyone else after purchasing (locally through Sam's Club). Guess I should say ex-customer. Shame.

title: There are good tax preparation alternatives out there
content: Add me to the list of baffled and upset EX-TURBOTAX customers. There are good tax preparation alternatives out there. Intuit, what you fail to understand is that loyal customers automatically repeat their purchase (mostly) without a second thought. When you do something like this, you lose those customers forever. We will not be coming back....EVER. What a bonehead move. If you were starving for extra income, a simple price increase to the Deluxe version would have been MUCH more palatable than a reduction in features. Fire your Marketing and Packaging management for this. Chalk this up to another rollout made by a respected brand name working hard to tarnish it's image. Think people....THINK!!!!!!

title: Rip off
content: Rip off

title: I recommend you use something else this year and avoid the ...
content: For the past 10 years I have used Turbo tax to do my taxes. I have always had capital gains and K-1 forms. This year Intuit requires me to spend a lot more money to accomplish the same thing with Turbo Tax.. Unless they come to their senses I will be using another product next year. I recommend you use something else this year and avoid the headaches. They have gotten greedy.

title: Are you listening, Intuit? You have lost a long-time customer.
content: This is a horrible way to treat your customers. I have used Deluxe for many years now. This year I will use TaxAct or some other program. Intuit has lost a long-time customer. I hope you are listening, Intuit. The damage control comments about product inconsistency are so transparent and stomach-turning that even if Intuit backtracks on this odious attempt at grabbing more money from us, I doubt I would ever do business with them again. Hey, Marketing Guy, if you are so worried about product inconsistency, why don't you give the online users the same functionality as the desktop users? Please do not bother to respond with the same swarmy offer to give me the upgrade for free this year. My loyalty is not for sale.

title: Got Ripped Off
content: Could use this version last year to do my taxes bought it now they want $30.00 more. Bait an switch. Could have bought the next the primer for $10.00 more but now Turbo Tax wants $30.00 to up-grade. Never again will I use turbo tax have been using it for at least 15 years.

title: What they said.
content: When I started reading the reviews, I was fairly annoyed that TurboTax made these changes so looked for alternatives, too. I bought H&R Block's s/w for $24.99 and so far so good. Like a lot of other reviewers, I had been using TurboTax for a long time so it's unfortunate. It's also amazing that TurboTax thinks they have a stranglehold on the market.

title: This is a rip-off. They've removed the capability to ...
content: This is a rip-off. They've removed the capability to complete schedules C,D, and E from this year's version.

title: Last year for TT
content: The regulations TT uses for my state are in error. Their much vaunted experts availability seems to be a myth. unable to access anyone on chat or phone. I purchased a download from Amazon - couldnt access past years taxes. when I signed in TT recognized my prior files but would not link to just purchased copy from Amazon - wanted me to buy from them.

title: Seems like they decided to mislead a lot of people this ...
content: I have purchased this product for years from various retailers. Seems like they decided to mislead a lot of people this year. I may still purchase the product again as the changes won't effect me but I'm looking into the HR Block software in protest of Turbo Tax Trickery. HR Block software is getting much better reviews than TurboTax. Update: I purchased and filed with H&R Block software. It was less expensive and it was also less expensive to e-file state return. I think I will be continuing with H&R Block software in future.

title: Bye TurboTax
content: Very disappointed to learn that I can't e-file various Schedules with TurboTax Deluxe as I had been able to do for years now. I have been a loyal customer - I don't think I ever used anything but TurboTax. But this change is a dagger to the heart. I will move to H&R Block. This move is made all the easier by the fact that reviewers have stated that my TurboTax data will import nicely into the H&R Block product. I will still be able to save PDF version and I can download the State version for an additional fee (just like TurboTax).

title: One Star
content: I'm switching to H&R after four years with TurboTax. I disagree with it's pricing for basic tax service.

title: Adios TurboTax, You Blew It!
content: TurboTax let me down, I used their products for years and now they have changed the pricing to gouge users. Adios TurboTax, you blew it.

title: Read the Reviews PRIOR to purchasing
content: Please read the reviews here at Amazon!!! I have been using TurboTax for a number of years. This will be the third year that there were problems with the Amazon download version of this product. I don't know it this is an Amazon specific problem or a general TurboTax issue. My software would not update properly (same problem for the last 3 years...). There is a manual update available for the Federal section of the program that can be found with a quick Bing/Google search. There is no manual update for the State packages... Last year I had to use telephone support to get the State updates to work and I guess I will be doing that again this year. I did not read the reviews prior to purchasing this product, and it appears there have been changes that are not appreciated by the user community. Please read the reviews prior to purchasing this product. You may want to look at another solution. I will be looking elsewhere if I cannot get my State to update today...

title: The Great TurboTax Deluxe 2014 Fiasco, a review from an actual person not employed by a marketing firm paid by TurboTax.
content: The fake five star reviews are hilarious: the reviewers haven't reviewed any other product on Amazon. Nice marketing scam. I've used TurboTax for a few years now and have always had a good experience - until this year. I needed access to Schedule C, like almost everyone else that has complained, which is no longer available in this year's version. The automatic free upgrade to Premier that was supposed to be available after February 7th still has not happened for me (I purchased the download for Mac on February 7th specifically for this issue). I just was on hold for 2 hours and 20 minutes waiting to speak to someone: when I finally came off hold, it rang twice and then disconnected my call. Really? As long as TurboTax resolves this problem in next year's version, I will probably continue to use it because I like the interface and it's way cheaper than a CPA. It's just a shame that they really dropped the ball this year, both in product quality and customer service. Good luck to everyone else out there that's trying to get a live person to help them from TurboTax. I'll update this to share any advice I get, if I ever get a call back or any satisfactory outcome. UPDATE: I've updated my rating from 1 to 3 stars after receiving a call back from TurboTax and receiving the free upgrade to Premium to access forms that were previously available to Deluxe customers. I agreed to a call back from their automated system. I received a call back from a live person within 3 hours, explained that I needed the upgrade and received a confirmation code from a polite employee within a few minutes. I'm leaving it at three stars for the ridiculous hold times, being hung up on, and the fact that the free upgrade prompt (which was supposed to have been automatic in the application after February 7th) never happened. All in all, I think I will continue to use TurboTax in the future, but this year's experience was poor.

title: No d & c schedules after 10+ years of doing business with them
content: They dropped schedule d and c without really telling us. After using turbotax for the past 10 years very disappointed in their greed.

title: Terrible
content: Good software but sleazy business practice. I'm looking elsewhere for tax software as of this year.

title: Don't buy if you have capital gains/losses on sale of investments
content: Unlike the 2013 version, the 2014 version of TurboTax Deluxe does not allow for capital gains on investments. Instead you get a message informing you that you need to upgrade to Premier. However, apparently due to the large number of loyal customers who complained they do allow an upgrade if you used TurboTax deluxe last year. I think I will be trying out the competition next year, these up-sales are too annoying to deal with. Will be mad about this for quite some time...

title: OBFUCATE AND DEFLECT WITH DEVIOUS CORPORATE SPEAK THE FACT THAT YOUR DE-CONTENTING WAS FOR THE BETTER AND NOT AS A WAY TO RAISE
content: AS PREVIOUSLY STATED BY ANOTHER FORMER TURBOTAX CONSUMER, MY USE OF THE PRODUCT WOULD HAVE REACHED DRINKING AGE. THINK ABOUT THAT INTUIT, OR DID YOU. TO LIE, OBFUCATE AND DEFLECT WITH DEVIOUS CORPORATE SPEAK THE FACT THAT YOUR DE-CONTENTING WAS FOR THE BETTER AND NOT AS A WAY TO RAISE PRICES RAISES QUESTIONS AS TO YOUR MORAL COMPASS OR LACK THEREOF. TO CRIPPLE C, D AND E, NEAT USE OF ANALYTIC'S TO RAISE YOUR PRICES AND MORTALLY OFFEND CUSTOMERS. COOL DAMAGE CONTROL BOB, WHEN DO YOU RELEASE THE EDSEL, PONTIAC AND PLYMOUTH VERSIONS. I CAN CONFIRM ALSO THAT THE H&R BLOCK PRODUCT IMPORTS FILES AND PERFORMS WELL. THE FEW QUESTIONS I HAD WERE QUICKLY ANSWERED BY A CUSTOMER SERVICE DEPARTMENT MORE THAN APPRECIATIVE FOR YOUR BLUNDER.

title: One Star
content: Price gouging. Switch to TAXACT.

title: I am glad I learned that they dropped schedule D before I ...
content: I am glad I learned that they dropped schedule D before I paid. That does it, all done with Turbotax now after years of using it.

title: Dodged the bullet..
content: Wow.. I am so glad I read the reviews posted here before I purchased my tax software, I have been a Turbotax user for years but brand loyalty has to be respected and in this case I see that it has not.. Too bad. I intend to vote with my wallet and purchase other software. Thank you for the honest feedback from you reviewers. And Bob, you dont need to waste your time with a copy and paste of the company drool, I'm not interested.

title: Loyalty lost
content: I've been a loyal Intuit customer dating back to the 1990's. I'm gone - they aren't loyal to us, no reason to be loyal to them.

title: It looks like both of the other software products will do what ...
content: As others have stated intuit has decided to gouge their loyal customers by changing the features of their product. I have used TurboTax Deluxe for several years successfully. This year I am informed that I have to spend another 50% to get the Premier even though nothing about my tax situation is any different from prior years. I would suggest that everyone drop Amazon an e-mail asking for a refund of their purchase and request TaxAct or H&R Block instead as it seems that there's no visible way to get a refund for TurboTax once it has been purchased. It looks like both of the other software products will do what TurboTax won't at the lower price.

title: One Star
content: Used H&R Block online instead this year. Just raise the price, don't eliminate functionality!!

title: Luckly I caught the omissions in this years Deluxe version ...
content: Luckly I caught the omissions in this years Deluxe version before purchasing. Went with HR block and not only was it less expensive but did everything the old TurboTax Deluxe used to do. Guess I will be switching to HR for future tax prep solutions after this years shady TurboTax practices.

title: Horrible Customer Support !!!
content: I have used TurboTax for countless years! Have finally had enough of their lack of concern for their customers. First I wasn't going to use TurboTax after they removed the extra schedule forms from Deluxe, and made you pay an extra $25 for them. However, after they realized they had a PR nightmare, they agreed offer it again for free. So, after purchasing the software, and doing my return, I found there was an error with an amount it imported from my 2013 return on my federal carry over form (not with my numbers I entered). Contacted support and used the call me back option. Well, the return call took a half a day. Then, the support person that called me wasted my time, because after about 20 minutes and sending her my tax file via TurboTax software, she determined she needed to transfer me to tax support, instead of product support (or something). So after she transferred me, I was on hold for another 2 hours before I hung up. This is horrible customer service. I have spent the better part of a day waiting on them to either call or while I was on hold. I won't be using TT again. I will be switching to HR Block!!!!

title: Sleazy
content: I have been a loyal customer of Turbo Tax (and Quicken) since 1991. Now you pull this bait and switch and cripple the deluxe version? I'm returning my unopened software to the place of purchase for a full refund and I hope you choke on it. This was my last Intuit purchase.

title: BUYER BEWARE! You have to pay an additional $19.99 to eFile State!!!
content: I am a longtime TurboTax user (since 2005) and I love(d) the product. When I saw the download was available through Amazon.com for $39.99, I was FLOORED because if I logged into my current account and processed my return via the online site, I would be charged approx. $80. Now, I find this REALLY irritating! I have been a loyal customer for a freaking decade and I get NO price break?!? This is a huge slap in the face. OH, and it gets even BETTER when you download the software from Amazon. It seems the description of the product fails to tell you that if you want to eFile your State return, you have to pay $19.99 more. Yeah, that's right! Also, THIS DOES NOT "PLUG" into your current online account if you have one and this product claimed to be trying to "locate" my previous years return on my laptop, but it couldn't locate it even though I was looking at it on my C drive. I had to MANUALLY input the information from my previous return. What I want to know is WHY is it that you want to SCREW your loyal customers as well as potential customers? Loyal customers should be given price breaks too! I am giving THIS product/download 1 star because of the deceptive advert!

title: I left TurboTax and purchased H&R. It was an easy change
content: I am incensed with Intuit. I had been a long time Turbo Tax customer (about 15 years). Well, no more. This year I purchased TurboTax Deluxe as I usually do only to discover days later that Intuit de-featured the software (no support for stock transactions or self employed income), which I have been using for years. Intuit did not transparently/openly disclose these to customers. Intuit held me hostage after having purchased the software and require additional money for an upgrade to the most expensive product. I called Intuit customer service to request a refund. They told me they would send an email with instructions, it did not happen. I call all of these being deceitful. Intuit, you lost my trust and lost me as a customer ..I am never going back... compound this for the number of years that I have left paying taxes and the other Intuit products I would have purchased. Intuit CEO and Board of Directors, if you happen to care about your customers and you see this, rest assured that shady moves like this one will be negative to your profits. End of the story. Instead of paying Intuit ransom, with that money I purchased H&R Block and I am found it an easy change. Will keep using H&R for many years

title: Or to our great, and profitable
content: You screwed up! I've used TurboTax for several years (10 or more).
