This year I load the 2014 version and lo and behold, it can only find the most basic personal information from my 2013 file. So the burden's on me, reenter all the 1099 info that I entered years ago and which hasn't changed for over year (10 years), when my wife and I both retired. Oh the nontaxable portion of my 401K, gee you hope I kept a record, since you don't have any information you can supply. But t was there when I did my 2013 return. Who knew how much detailed information and carryover could be lost in going from one year to the next. Oh, that's right we pulled a lot of stuff from the "old" deluxe package, so there's no way we could simply carry over everything from last year. You might of had forms from last year, that we don't support in this years version, so we'll just have to drop last years detailed information and have you reenter it. Or to our great, and profitable, surprise you'll have to upgrade to our more expensive version. Oh, sorry we're just doing what's best for you.

title: They have raided the cost too much AGAIN
content: too over priced, removed features I ended up switching to H&R for 1/2 the cost.

title: I'm jumping ship to H&R Block
content: I have been a Turbotax Deluxe customer for years and have seen it get better and better. But having read the uniformly negative reviews of the 2014 version -- and needing the schedules that were eliminated -- I'm jumping ship, and will switch to H&R block deluxe. It boggles the mind to see what a terrible, greedy decision Turbotax made in alienating its loyal customer base.

title: Say No to Product Downgrade!
content: Thank you to the reviewers who have protested the cut back in the Turbo Tax Deluxe product functionality. Thank you for alerting me to TT's contempt for its customers. I will not be forced into an involuntary "upgrade". The TT VP's "explanation" was laughable. After many years of Turbo Tax filing, I refuse to submit to this manipulation. I am switching.

title: This year the product is a horrible piece of junk that will charge you out the ...
content: I've used TurboTax for years. This year the product is a horrible piece of junk that will charge you out the nose for basic features from years previous. I've switched to another product and doubt I'll do business with Intuit again.

title: I am a long-time TurboTax user but will be abandoning ...
content: I am a long-time TurboTax user but will be abandoning TurboTax this year after reading about TurboTax's decision to remove key Schedules (C, D, E, F) from the Deluxe version. The misguided thought that your customers would all flock to the significantly higher priced Premier is costing you your loyal customer base. I guess I should say I *was* a long time TurboTax user. Hello, H&R Block.

title: Must switch to H&R Block!
content: Sad. Really sad. Cancelling my automatic annual subscriptions to TurboTax. Switching to H&R Block for a fraction of the cost.

title: but when a company lets its customers down like this they need to be punished
content: A Turbo Tax user (and an Intuit stockholder to boot) for 14 years - I will NOT be buying Turbo Tax (and probably sell my stock too) after reading the reduced functionaity in the Deluxe version. This is bait-and-switch of the most egregious order. I will unfortunately have to switch to a competitor, most unwillingly, but when a company lets its customers down like this they need to be punished.

title: It would be nice if they show the total cost for person.
content: Ok I hate doing taxes because its just data entry. SO I always ask myself why pay for me to d the work every year. Here is some magic math that turbo tax does not show in the total cost. Also this price is only good until you have used up all your free filings. The more you use the more they make money. I thinks if this is for one person it makes more sense to pay (HR block/other tax prepare) someone to do this data entry for cheaper. So this is the turbo tax math I hate. Price of product 49.97 state file 19.99 ( if you don't pay using credit card and want to use your refund it goes up to 39.99) total=69.96 or 89.96 What a shady company. Up sell Up sell and milk all of us.

title: Hey turbo tax admit you just wanted to charge more ...
content: Hey turbo tax admit you just wanted to charge more! I don't play games. I'm getting H&R Block Deluxe this year.

title: Never had a complaint until this year!!
content: this product has been nothing but trouble since I downloaded it a few days ago. It is a new design and in my opinion, after working 40+ years in designing computer systems, one of the worst ones I have seen! In the first few executions, the program had to download new or updated modules(CAN'T DO THESE FIXES AT ONE TIME)! Now, when I started to do additional work on my taxes this evening my complete system appears to be being influenced by something(key stroke - wait, wait, wait - depress mouse, forget it waited a minute until arrow cleared. . I removed program and system seems do be running fine. Will attempt to download new download.

title: Intuit made a big deal about the fact that they ...
content: Intuit made a big deal about the fact that they were doing rebates and free upgrades. However, there doesn't appear to be any way to get a rebate or free upgrade after April 20, 2015. So those people who bought after that point are screwed.

title: If I owned TT, I would be making a change before tax season got in full gear!
content: Thank you for all the heads-up warnings! I was here to purchase Turbo-tax deluxe as I have for the past 15 or more years. Over 600 negative reviews definitely carry some clout. I rarely see any product with that many 1 star reviews. While it seems a little scary to go to another product when I am so familiar with Turbo tax,I guess it is time to step out of the box. Bye bye turbo tax!

title: Fill form Sch-D, print and mail it ??
content: 114/179 reviewers gave this product 1 star. Some were even ruing there is no option of 0 star. I was about to buy this product, but dropping off after seeing the reviews. I have been using TurboTax for 14 years, and that is ending now. Bob Meighan, VP of TurboTax advises to fill the form for Sch-D, print and mail it. Is he serious? Then I can as well fill Form 1040, print and mail it. Why do I have to shell $50? There should be limit to greed. This year I am not buying TurboTax. I am out.

title: One Star
content: As the others have stated, deleted capital gains worksheets from Deluxe version so that you have to upgrade.

title: don't think this is your final price to file.
content: Turbotax little surprises after buying this software: First state filling fee for that free stats : $20. Second state software download: $40. Cost to file a simple state return for kid's summer job that would have been free online: $20 Oh and if you have to refile a state because it missed a major deduction: software can't efile amended return . The clearly marked DO NOT FILE forms that it prints for you to hand transfer to a pencil and paper form (why?!?) were also incorrect.

title: Time to move on ...
content: It's a no brainer. After 10+ years as a loyal TTD customer, I moving to H&R Block.

title: Another customer lost by TurboTax
content: I have always been very happy with TurboTax (as offended as I am by having to re-buy the software every year). But their new product model is outrageous. My taxes are straightforward, butI have one small rental property that would force me from Deluxe to Premiere. I have jumped ship and gone to H&R Block's software, which is significantly cheaper.

title: Another long-term customer who's switching to another program
content: Like many others I've used Turbotax for many many years. I do use the schedules they've removed. Thanks to those who described how easy it is to switch to H&R block, which I'll be doing. Not interested in a one-time upgrade. Only in restoration of all the schedules they removed.

title: Bye, Bye TurboTax, time to switch to something else
content: Thanks everybody for the heads-up. I was just about to buy this software, then noticed the low ratings, so read the comments. TurboTax blew it big time this year. I, like many others, have been a faithful TurboTax customer for many years, but now it's time to try something else, either H&R Block or TaxAct. Any opinions about which if these 2 to choose?

title: Total Debacle
content: This has been a total debacle. I bought TurboTax Deluxe this year as I had for the past several years but suddenly (as reported by thousands of angry customers) it is missing some key forms (Schedules C, D, E) that I need. The product prompts me to upgrade to the "Home & Business" version for $40. I felt as if I had been screwed, but I had no choice because I needed the forms, so I paid the $40 plus $2.40 sales tax. Then I discover that I am eligible for an eventual $25 refund (not the full $42.40 I paid) only after I file my taxes. Then, a couple days later, I learn in the press that TurboTax has unlocked the missing forms for everybody for free. Good news? No, not quite. If you hadn't already been coerced into paying for the upgrade, you get it free. But in my case, I had already paid $42.40 for an upgrade that I no longer needed. So, I called TurboTax customer service and politely requested a refund. I was told "sorry, you are only eligible for the (delayed) $25 refund, but not the full cost you paid for the unneeded upgrade." This is complete nonsense of course. They should have simply processed a credit card refund for $42.40 and moved on. Frankly, the $17.40 difference that I forfeited in this exercise is not important, but it is the principle that matters most. These people still haven't straightened out their act and I am reluctant to recommend this product for that reason alone.

title: No, No, No Time To Take Care Of Long Term Customers
content: No, No, No, in addition to the other comments about them trying to pull one over on the schedules( which they did email and make right, after they tried to get over on people ) I personally must say, they screw up my state tax every year, I work in one state but live in another, for two years in a row now, they have been wrong and the state has to adjust them. I will also say, it's a decent dea for $40, but when you keep tagging on extra money for an additional state, and additional money for e-file, it doesn't become worth it for $120, when my accountant can do it right with zero effort for $100. I am extremely disappointed, and would like turbo tax to recognize long term clients and offer them better incentives to stay repeat customers.

title: Use TaxAct instead
content: Intuit has removed certain schedules from their Deluxe version requiring on-line upgrades for a fee. Plus, Intuit/TurboTax is currently (Feb 2015) being investigated by the FBI regarding potential computer data breaches. TurboTax is on a very slippery slope.

title: Leaving turbotax due to dropping of forms from deluxe
content: Upset turbotax took out forms from deluxe version. Been using it for several years now. We are going with H&R block deluxe version. They have the forms needed. Another customer leaving turbotax. They should learn something from this. Change is not always best for the bottom line. Would be interested to see how much they loose by this change that only effects a small amount of people.

title: This will be my last Intuit purchase...
content: This will be my last Turbo Tax and Quicken updates. Not only did I have to upgrade Quicken 2012 to the latest because Turbo Tax does not allow transferring the tax data from Quicken prior to 2013, but now I find that TT Deluxe does not support Schedule D info (transferred from Quicken!). I'm fed up with the greed of this company, and I've had enough!

title: POOR SUPPORT
content: I tried to download it and was NEVER able to. Product support was pitiful.

title: ... am a long time turbo tax user and feel like this is ridiculous
content: I too am a long time turbo tax user and feel like this is ridiculous. I know what my customers would do if I raised the price of my product 2 fold, so why do you expect me to do anything different. When you look at the 2014 turbo tax sales numbers I think you will somehow find a way to address this in 2015. Bye Bye.

title: Turbo Tax- Don't Lie Cheat and Steal!
content: I'm supposed to get a free upgrade to premier, but the turbotax website tells me to choose my product and asks for a credit card. What a bunch of boneheads! I suggest you use H&R Block for now on. At least they don't aggravate you.

title: TurboTax deceives customers
content: I have been a Turbo Tax customer for several years but won't use the product again. I entered my information as usual but was blindsided when I got to e-filing my return. TurboTax makes a big deal about offering free Federal E-file but failed to let users know that direct deposit of your Federal Refund was no longer free. Going from free to $34.99 is a big jump in cost and I was not willing to pay it, I could wait for a paper check. I went back a couple of pages and changed the payment indicator to paper check. All seemed good and when I got back to e-filing - the paperwork showed that all I was going to pay was the $19.99 to e-file my state return. Apparently, TurboTax does not do a thorough job of testing it's software - I got my federal refund by direct deposit and low and behold, I had been charged the $34.99 fee for direct deposit. So when I had gone back and made changes -they weren't stored even though the printed paperwork was correct. Shame on you TurboTax for your shoddy workmanship.

title: Your "Corporate Greed" is Showing. OOPS!
content: Dear Turbo Tax, You are the corporate, greedy, back stabbing ex-friend that I wish I never had the misfortune to meet. My money would have gone a lot further had I gone see anyone else. Removing important features and charging up the WAZOO for anything beyond basic. Free state filing? No, not really. Charging 25 dollars (before sale taxes - the irony!) for e-filing after your price increase? OOPS. Showing that corporate greed WE know SO well in this country. This is a SNAKE OIL sales pitch. Nothing better than buying a "deluxe" version that charges you extra! Your reputation has been tarnished and I will not hesitate to alert the sheeps who year after year renew your service despite the shrinking services and overpriced crap.

title: Looks like the greed factor has finally hit Turbo Tax (aka ...
content: Looks like the greed factor has finally hit Turbo Tax (aka Intuit). Looks like HR Block or TaxAct is in my future. http://www.consumerreports.org/cro/2014/02/best-tax-prep-software-h-r-block-deluxe-versus-turbotax-deluxe/index.htm

title: You have to pay for free state after an upgrade. What a rip off!
content: I just upgraded from TT Delux to the TT Home & Business due to lack of schedule C in the Delux version. Now, TT is asking for $40 for the free state. What a rip off company Intuit has become over the years. I'm switching to H&R block.

title: Was a satisfied user, will move to Block's software
content: Non competence pricing. Deceptive presentation of their product. Was a satisfied user, will move to Block's software. Typical Quicken nickel and diming. I doubt they will stay in the business of tax software, unless they review their policies.

title: Asked about bugs, they answered by email.. ...
content: Asked about bugs, they answered by email..... with a price increase. Even more frustrating? They refused to disclose how much the price increase would be. After 7+ years as a Turbotax customer, I'm upgrading to another company.

title: TurboTax Abandons Loyal Customers
content: I have been a TurboTax user since product inception, but this move by Intuit to no longer include Schedules C &D in the Deluxe version is a price gouging scheme that insults the intelligence of loyal customers. The explanation Intuit management offers for crippling the program is preposterous. This dumb, stupid marketing decision requires me to seek reasonably priced alternatives. So long, Turbo Tax AND Quicken!

title: I hate the extra work
content: Enough said by other reviewers. I hate the extra work, but am going to H&R Block Deluxe.

title: if you do any contract work you are better off using a competitive product that doesn't gouge you ...
content: No more schedules C, D and E, if you do any contract work you are better off using a competitive product that doesn't gouge you with a 100%+ markup for features that have been provided as part of the base product for years.

title: Money grabbing greedy corporate-inbred customer backstabbing losers. Goodbye.
content: Integrity is like virginity - once you lose it you can't get it back. This company has shown their true colors one too many times. They behave as though there is no competition. I'm going to park my loyalty somewhere else. Since I'm the 'go to' person among my friends and family you can be sure there will be many more customers Intuit will lose as a result of their stupidity.

title: Terrible that I have used Deluxe desktop for years and ...
content: Terrible that I have used Deluxe desktop for years and now can't because, without telling us, they removed some of the investment aspects of it. I've always known Inuit to be so customer-unfriendly, but this is the worst.

title: As others have mentioned, I have for many years ...
content: As others have mentioned, I have for many years been a loyal TT user. Those years of loyalty have gone to the wayside. Granted, I had a "complex" year...sale of my home and foreign tax credits. But TT never led me to believe they were totally incapable of anything more than an EZ return. TT Premier has failed severely to the point, after untold hours of frustration, that I've filed for an extension just so I can go shopping for alternative tax software. I've been trying for a month+ to get some response for Intuit (I see several others looking for related help as well). But I've received not so much as a "go screw yourself" response (which - excuse me, but lacking any response, is what I assume their attitude is). Totally unacceptable to me, after 20+ years as a customer, I'm moving on.

title: Shell of its former self
content: This generation of the product has removed schedules C, D and E, some of which are necessary for me to do my taxes, rendering the product rather useless to me. Since it's a digital download, I don't even get a frisbee for my $50.

title: I am very disappointed in this year's product
content: After using TurboTax for several years, I am very disappointed in this year's product. First the Deluxe version was changed and I lost all my entries when I upgraded to Premier in order to record capital gains. When I tried to get help when I prepared a simple return for a handicapped person I was unable to get a phone number in order to speak to a tech. The return was VERY simple and kept being rejected by the IRS. I followed all the directions to get a phone number to speak with a tech but was unable to do so. Hopefully TurboTax will get its act together and return to a quality product. This year it is a disaster!

title: Don't go against your customers Intuit
content: Left turbotax after they messed with everything this year, my dad originally started using it ages ago and got me into it but due to their changes I am going to venture out and try other services like TaxAct. Maybe Intuit will think again about messing with something that has worked.

title: Making the software useless
content: Money grubbing company..... Making the software useless.......

title: Busted, Disgusted and can't be Trusted.
content: I want to say thank you to everyone who exposed Turbo Tax's sneaky money hungry tactic on Amazon's rating and saved me the money and trouble. I was poised to buy Turbo Tax again this year until I began to read the reviews. Turbo Tax has lost me as a customer and I have already contacted my brother who will contact our other brother to advise him of this and switch to H&R. Turbo Tax must think their customers complete idiots who wish to throw their money away to them. In such a competitive market I can hardly comprehend a company thinking they can get away with some garbage like this. It is INSULTING.

title: Sneaky Move by Intuit
content: I have been using turbo tax for years and I think this is terrible. They should let you know before you buy if it's not the same as all other years. Just another way to get more money. I will not buy it again.

title: wow. not buying this year...
content: wow. not buying this year... Who made this decision to exclude the form D?

title: Read the reviews and listened, I switched.
content: Long time TT user, not liking the idea of getting hoodwinked.

title: Can't be used with even a single stock or mutual fund sale
content: Having to upgrade to Premier to report a couple of mutual fund sales is BS (filling out Schedule D from the mutual funds co.'s tax form is trivial). Was easily handled by Deluxe in the past years, but not this year.

title: A disgruntled customer
content: Too many hidden costs in it. I paid a fee for the Deluxe Program then I had to upgrade a higher level to e file, Then I checked the box declining the Audit Insurance, then the program back me up for some reason and changed my Audit Insurance selection and when I got the final bill online, I had been nicked for that lousy fee of $39.95 anyway, sooooooo, as a result, I will never use Turbo Tax again, you lost a future customer. Art Leighton

title: TurboTax Deluxe should have been clear that Investments required the upgrade for investment income.
content: Last year for me. In the past Turbo ax has recommend premier for people with investments, but Deluxe has always been fine for my needs. Now this year to do anything but the most basic investment information I have to upgrade to Premier? No thanks. They've got me this year, unless I can try H&R Block tax software for free. I read that somewhere online H&R Block was offering such a thing. The product should have been clear that it would not process the investment info that it has in year's past prior to purchase.

title: Fool me twice? H&R Block is the answer
content: Forget the rebate. Damage done. H&R Block is the answer. Just years ago TurboTax tried a quick one limiting the number of allowable efiles. They ate that, and we forgave them, This year was too egregious. Trust broken. Fool me twice.

title: Goodbye Intuit!
content: I agree with the majority of criticism with 1-star ratings leveled at Intuit. I don't like the under-handed way they have forced an increase in price by moving Schedules C & D to higher priced versions of their product. I have been a long-time user of Turbotax, 10+ years, and have recommended it to many of my friends -- but no more. Goodbye Intuit! I recommend H&R Block Tax software.

title: No schedule D = no sale
content: Good thing I read these reviews before buying this year. I've used Turbotax for ~20 years, but I'm not spending twice as much to do my taxes (which requires schedule D). H&R block gets my business starting this year.

title: I didn't get screwed by TurboTax. Thanks for the reviews everyone.
content: I am so glad I saw the Reviewes everyone has posted. If it weren't for everyone's commentary I would have purchased the deluxe edition, and then discovered that Intuit screwed me over. I Thank everyone for the heads up. Hey TurboTax, see ya Never.

title: So far so good with H&R Block
content: Just an update. I bought and returned this product after reading that it does not include Schedule D. I've used TurboTax for a million years and never wanted to change. I read the extremely helpful reviews published by Amazon readers, and wrote to H & R Block according to the instructions in the Forbes article. About 24 hours later (on Sunday), I heard from H&R Block telling me they would soon be emailing me a download instruction. I heard from them today (2 days wait, pretty darn good), followed their instructions, and downloaded the file. Good for one free state, and 5 free Fed filings. Easy process, easy download, easy import of my TurboTax files. Obviously they are under the microscope now. But so far H&R Block has performed admirably, in my estimation. They will have a customer for life if they keep up this good customer service. And I'll bet anyone dollars to donuts that their Deluxe edition next year WILL contain Schedule D!

title: Going over to the other side
content: Like many other commenters I have used TT Deluxe for many years and this year wasn't going to be any different until now. I think the folks at Intuit have put huge smiles on the faces of the H&R folks (way to go Intuit on making people happy). Switching to a different tax software package isn't done lightly and usually people like me stay with the same package year after year until something forces them to switch. That time has come for me to switch to H&R Block and most likely I will be satisfied with their package (functionality, useability and cost). Maybe many years from now I will be complaining about H&R Block but until that time Intuit (or some other company) won't get my tax software business. IMHO I believe Intuit is going to lose significant market share over this. Thanks to all who have reviewed and commented.

title: Good bye Turbotax
content: I have been a Tubotax user since they started. I was confused this year about all the different Turbotax options that have cropped up. Now, after reading a number of user comments, my mind is already made up. Good bye Turbotax, hello H&R Block.

title: "PLEASE call us and we'll help you get what you thought you were paying for!"
content: So, let me get this straight... you want your products on different platforms to align better, so you REMOVE features and make people pay more to do what your product has historically allowed them to do. I suppose on some planet that makes more sense than adding features to the platforms that have shortcomings and maybe charging a bit more for those added options. I do find the Intuit reps groveling amusing though. "PLEASE call us and we'll help you get what you thought you were paying for!" - No mention of how much that help will cost, right? Bleh. Another long time TurboTax user out the door. I probably would have used your products another 20-30 years too had you (Intuit) continued to be reasonable.

title: I almost bought TurboTax then I read what was included ...
content: I almost bought TurboTax then I read what was included (or not included) this year). What fools at Intuit to sacrifice loyal Deluxe customers by forcing them to move to Premier. After so many years as a loyal user, so long TurboTax.

title: Beware! Despite assurances you WILL be charged to upgrade ...
content: Beware! Despite assurances you WILL be charged to upgrade to get the features once on Deluxe. They want $80 on top of the $50 paid. There is no free upgrade within the software despite what Mr TurboTax VP says. Plus their customer service people are completely clueless. Go with HR Block

title: Longtime TurboTax Customer--I'm switching to H&R Deluxe this year!
content: It's Jan. 2, and time to start thinking about taxes---sigh. I decided to check out possible deals, and as a long-time TurboTax user, went to the TurboTax versions page to make sure Deluxe would work for me. I've used this version for quite some time, and it's been useful. I discovered that Intuit has changed the software for this year, eliminating the ability to handle any stock sale. I have a few stock holdings, and sometimes a fractional share is sold, triggering the need for a Schedule D form. I see that I will have to upgrade to Premier ($30. extra!!) if I want to continue with Intuit. I DON'T! I see Amazon is giving half off on H&R Deluxe today, and their Deluxe version includes Schedule D. :>) This is an excellent day to make the switch!

title: -10 stars
content: turbo tax lost a loyal customer... hr block in benefit

title: Same price as last year, fewer features, upgrade available at extra cost
content: I have been a customer of TurboTax since 2000. I am no longer a TurboTax customer. It is very clear that Intuit wants more profit, so they removed commonly required schedules from the DeLuxe version in order to force people to the Premier version. There was no reason to do this except to force people to pay more for their software. This change was not communicated to customers. I believe that they are relying on people not realizing that there are features deleted until close to the filing deadline, and then are forced into paying for the upgrade rather than starting again with another product. I suggest H & R Block Tax Software instead.

title: PURE GREED
content: No longer supports Form C? Bad decision that will cost you this 20+ year customer!!!

title: Jumped ship and glad I did.
content: Unhappy with some of the changes this year I went with another company. I am not a small business owner but don't respect companies that don't respect their customers. And the changes to TT this year are nothing short of gouging an already high priced product. The new software I picked (starts with an H) integrated last years turbotax document perfectly. I will say TT is a little bit easier to use. I felt like the new one asked a ton of questions it didn't need to at times. But it was a lot cheaper and they seem to respect their customers. I will never go back to TT again. If you are nervous like I was about jumping ship don't be.

title: BEWARE - No Sched D in 2014 Deluxe version
content: Thanks to all that commented before me and saved me from buying this - what happened to Schedule D?? So if I trade a few stocks or receive a dividend I now have to shell out an extra $40? Time to find a new tax software.

title: Trying H&R Block Instead
content: I am also a long time Turbo Tax user and always had to buy the Premier version because I had rental property. Each year I kind of looked at the H&R block version because is was less, but ended up with Turbo Tax. Fortunately for me, I sold the last income property I had in 2013, so I don't have to deal with that, and was looking forward to being able to move down to the Deluxe version. After reading all the reviews, and causing me to look into the H&R Block product, I ended up buying it for about 36% less than Turbo Tax. I do agree with most that reducing features and not reducing the price is not a good decision.

title: What good is a rebate if I have to buy another ...
content: I bought this, then found out that it is not up to past standards. Now what should I do? Can I get my money back? What good is a rebate if I have to buy another version? I need those missing forms...

title: Sad. Very Sad ...
content: I've used, embraced and trusted Turbo Tax Deluxe for over 15 years. I am, regretfully, switching to H&R Block this year after Intuit has forced me to upgrade to TurboTax Premier to do what TT Deluxe did previously. Goodbye Intuit.

title: Jerks
content: Unbelievable. After years of buying their software. For modest consulting income, my Schedule C deductions are probably a wash with the extra cost for H+B. Now it's not even worth it to claim anything.

title: the decision was easy; a $75 Premier shifts the cost/benefit the other ...
content: https://turbotax.intuit.com/personal-taxes/online/deluxe.jsp This is the link to what Deluxe does and (more importantly) does not get you this year. I purchased this product, then found out it did not support Form 4835, which I use yearly. I have been a loyal TurboTax user since 2000 (at least), but the price point for Premier is not that far off from having my taxes done by a local CPA. With a $50 Deluxe in years past, the decision was easy; a $75 Premier shifts the cost/benefit the other way. I bit the bullet and bought Premier this year, but unless corrective steps are taken, I plan to let someone else handle my taxes next year.

title: Unfortunately, I will not be buying this year due ...
content: Unfortunately, I will not be buying this year due to the lack of Sch D in the Deluxe version. Intuit did this forced upgrade thing with their commercial products a few years back as well.

title: Another lost customer
content: Like everyone else this I'm gone. I downloaded the software only to find out that what used to be covered by the basic version for $20 now costs me $90. Next year I will use another software provider. Intuit got their last nickel from me

title: Intuit Listens to complaints and takes action
content: Like everyone else I was very surprised to find the changes in the software eliminated several forms which now require additional payment for other versions of the program. I have been a Turbo Tax user for many years and even was a Beta Tester for the program in years of the earlier development. Now I will have to pay very good attention to what these Tax programs actually provide and the related cost. I am adding addtional comments because Intuit has now provided for upgrades to the program that will allow filing and use of froms C,D,E, thereby making the Deluxe version the same as Previous years and will continue for another year. The negative comments submitted by all users were heard and Intuit took action.

title: Turbotax Deluxe is RANSOM WARE
content: Made it 1/3 of the way through my 2014 and got hit with a $30 upgrade screen relating to K-1 forms. This worked in TurboTax Basic 2013. Great!!! I am already $59 into this, and am dead in the water. I know I cannot return the software because software is generally not returnable. I am going to try anyway. I instead bought tax software from another vendor --- TaxAct --- and finished both federal and local. Total cost $21. I will not buy another copy of TurboTax. Or Quicken. Or anything from a company that would resort to ransom.

title: Intuit is very unethical. I am returning turbo tax ...
content: Intuit is very unethical. I am returning turbo tax and will never use it again. They changed the product without any warning and it will now cost an additional $30 to do my taxes.

title: Another loyal TurboTax user says goodbye
content: I have used TurboTax since it was first offered many, many years ago. On the basis of the recent changes, I will no longer use the product. I am now a former TurboTax consumer.

title: Cheated like millions of others. If only I could return it for a refund.
content: Like so many others, I had no idea I was being cheated by having functionality removed from the product since last year. I will never use TurboTax again after this year, no matter the inconvenience, or the fact that I used it for 10 years running now. It was great before, now...not to be trusted again.

title: Big issue with online version users not getting refund (see Update)
content: I have been a loyal user of Turbo Tax for over 20 years, and an online user since 2008. That loyalty has most likely stopped as of today for the following reason: While preparing my taxes as usual in Turbo Tax online, I was surprised and shocked when after about halfway through entering my information I was forced to upgrade from the Deluxe version to Premier (due to preparing a Royalty entry for Schedule E, I assume). In researching the problem, I found out that Intuit/Turbo Tax people decided to arbitrarily and without notice to their customers/consumers not only increase the price of the product, but also that they removed several items normally used in the Deluxe version (specifically Schedule C, D, and E). I also saw that they offered â as compensation for their actions â a $25 cash back offer (refund) to customers who used a previous yearâs Deluxe product (2013) and this year (2014) had to upgrade to Premier. Seeing that, although I was still upset at the âsurpriseâ upgrade, knowing Iâd get a $25 refund from Turbo Tax I decided to continue on and finish my tax preparation online and e-filing. Imagine my surprise then when I tried to take advantage of their âmea culpaâ offer (*after* I paid and completed my e-filingâ¦ they said you have to use the upgraded version, used a 2013 Deluxe version previously, and have filed your taxes before you could apply for the $25 refund â all of which I had done), only to find out that the $25 refund they offered does NOT apply to online users!! So my question, rightly so, is: Why not? Why are we (online users) being punished for using the product online? It still was a âbait and switchâ, and was totally unexpected and without reason (other than the company admitting their error, I found out later), and ALL users were affectedâ¦ not only the CD or download users. Why then does Intuit/Turbo Tax feel their online users should not receive the same monetary savings/rewards/compensation that others do? Online users have suffered the same issues â being forced to upgrade â that the CD/Download users are. Had I known I was going to be forced to upgrade â and then they weren't going to honor online users the $25 refund â I would most certainly have gone elsewhere. It cost me an additional $16 to upgrade, the extra cost for the added difference in sales tax, plus the extra time, effort and energy for me to research on what happened. Additionally, the number they have listed to call to inquire about this issue is a waste of time â you donât even get to speak with anyone! You get an automated recording telling you to leave you phone number and theyâll call you back. You donât even get an option to hold! I'm very angryâ¦ on several levels. Not providing the same compensation for ALL their customers is not acceptable, and is blatantly discriminatory. Because I feel so strongly about this, I intend on warning everyone I can in every venue possible. I will NOT be using Turbo Tax ever again. Not providing the same compensation for ALL their customers is not acceptable and is blatantly discriminatory. UPDATE 3-13-15: When I was finally able to contact TurboTax (ironically, the only venue that contacted me back was via Facebook!), after stating what happened, I was given a refund. So while I was upset about the issue overall, at least TurboTax does listen to at least some of their customers. I appreciated this a lot, and because of that, I will reconsider using TT again in the future - especially also because they stated they plan on putting back the forms they took out of the Deluxe version this year and making it the way it was in prior years (such as Schedule C, D, and E). If they do put back those forms in next years version as they say, I'm sure I will be a return customer. And I have also changed my original 1 star to a 3 star because of this. I didn't give them 5 stars because of the problem (they should not have done this to begin with) and because they are sooo difficult to get in touch with (the toll-free number is useless... and they never did call me back even though I left several messages on their automated phone system).

title: Intuit continues their trend in gouging users for every cent ...
content: Intuit continues their trend in gouging users for every cent. Removing the limited support for Schedules C, D, and E in the Deluxe edition, forcing users to upgrade.

title: Looks like me and my family will be moving on to ...
content: Looks like me and my family will be moving on to H&R. Too bad, too. My dad used turbo tax every year, and when I got old enough, so did I. 9 years with turbo tax, hopefully many more with H&R.

title: Long time customer is now gone.
content: Just adding to the fodder about turbo tax marketing. I'm trying out H&R Block this year for free. See a Forbes Magazine article. After a very long relationship, I've had enough of Intuit.

title: Too greedy
content: Too greedy. This is the year I switch.

title: Buh Bye Intuit
content: I'm done with Intuit! I used Turbotax for many years, but only because the bought out their competitors that actually had better products. Now they are relying on American laziness & stupidity. I did my taxes by hand years before Turbotax. Contrary to what they want you to believe it isn't rocket science. Investments make it a little more complex & it seems Intuit wants to cash in on your investments by making you pay more for a few more forms. Buh Bye Intuit. I'll vote with my wallet.

title: Two strikes; you're out. Switching to another product again - this time for good.
content: I've used TurboTax every year since the late 90's. Every year, that is, except 2003 (tax year 2002) when Intuit decided to treat their customers like criminals, and included crippleware with the product that locked your TurboTax program to a single computer and prevented you from using it on any other machine. That was a showstopper for me, so I switched to another product for a year, then switched back after Intuit wisely dropped this 'feature'. But it looks like the lesson wasn't learned, and I see that the features I need to do my taxes have been crippled in the Deluxe Version which I've always used. I'll switch again to a competitor's product, and it looks like I'll save a bit of money in the process. I doubt I'll be back to TurboTax again - they don't appear capable of learning from their mistakes, nor of valuing their customers.

title: I read the negtive reviews, and knows that stock ...
content: I read the negtive reviews, and knows that stock or investment tax is not included. so I bought this version, as I do not have those. But it even can not do K1 which is similar to w2.

title: Greed little ***** want more money now for what used ...
content: Greed little ***** want more money now for what used to be included, Schedules for investment, rental properties, etc... I will be finding another software.

title: Like many other reviewers
content: Like many other reviewers, I am disappointed at the way Turbotax confused consumers to charge higher prices--even their promotional discount was made to confuse; I gave up getting a rebate--not worth the time.

title: misleading, switched products after a decade of use
content: With everyone else here. Turbotax's changes are deceptive. I have switched to H&R Block after using TT for more than a decade, and I'm delighted (H&R is cheaper and not misleading).

title: Shame on you Intuit!
content: Like others, I have been a loyal turbo tax user for 20+ years. As long as we continue to put up with this type of underhanded change and marketing, it will continue by Intuit. What will be included in the 2015 version. maybe just the 1040 short form. The Premier version? Maybe the long form, but no schedule D. Perhaps the new 2015 platinum version at $199 will give us all the forms we need for completing a personal income tax return. Shame on you Intuit. At least I read the reviews before I installed the product so I can do a return.

title: Waste of money
content: Waste of money. Instead try TaxAct.com which is awesome! Have used it for the last 8 years. Cost me a total of $13.99 to e-file federal and state with automatic refund deposit.

title: Ripoffed - no schedule D - they should mark that in bold on the cover
content: I've used Turbotax Deluxe for at least 20 years. I was SHOCKED to find, after downloading the product, that it no longer supports Schedule D investment income. What a RIPOFF!

title: Might as well convert now...
content: Turbo tax was the one good thing about filing taxes. Thanks for the heads up. I will be converting to another program. Guess it isn't possible they could fix this with update?

title: Support non-responsive and too expensive.
content: Turbo tax is getting too expensive to use. I was charged an additional $35-$39 dollars to file a MA non-resident return by efile even though I diid not file a NY resident return electronically. Also, unlike previous years, the deluxe program does not allow for many misc income items. Additionally, the program will not allow me to make copies of the returns because it insists I do not have acrobat even though I have the latest updated acrobat 11. So, I do not recommend using turbo tax any longer even though I have used it since the 1990's

title: More money and less content
content: I just bought Turbotax for the last time. It won't handle Schedule D anymore. I didn't know this ahead of time or I would not have bought it. I will be looking for another tax software next year.

title: One Star
content: Beware - Schedule C is NO LONGER INCLUDED

title: Enough. We're done here.
content: Sorry, Intuit. I've had it, I'm done, this is ridiculous. I've been a (sadly) loyal customer since about 1990, back when you were ChipSoft. I followed you to Intuit. I (blissfully) ignored your privacy attacks on my computer back in '03 when you installed DRM on my computer without asking. I sat back and watched as you lobbied state legislatures to shut down effective and state-operated FREE filing programs, for no reason other than to be able to gouge us again--your loyal customers. But now your arrogance wins--you have pushed me away. Oh sure, you made a huge gaffe by underestimating how angry your customers would be when you gouged us again. Sadly, I expect that from you. But that's not the big deal. The big deal is how you responded to the problem. It wasn't your mealy-mouthed, disingenuous set of apologies and re-apologies. Again, I expect that from you. Instead, it was your CONTINUED arrogance and complete disregard for your customers. At the exact moment that you should have been straightening up and flying right--when you should have been on your best behavior--you just couldn't help yourself! 1) Instead of just giving everyone the product that you should have, from the start, you decide to set it up as some kind of special refund system. And you suddenly require me to cough up my social security number to you??? As though in this day and age of identity theft you think that handing out my social security number is *nothing*??? Obviously, to *you* it's nothing. Because it's MY identity. How can you be this tone deaf on the issue of security. 2) Instead of just giving everyone the product that you should have, from the start, you set up a special telephone hotline which is authorized to give people refunds or upgrades, but only if they complain loudly enough! Really? You're going to make some of your customers whole, but not all of them. Because why? Because if you can still gouge *some* of us, then that's what you're truly committed to doing. What an insult! 3) Walk with me down this tree-shaded web site. Intuit. Turbotax. Do you see anything on there about getting the product that you should have given us from the start? No. Your whole pretend apology is communicated only via email, and on LinkedIn, and who knows where else. Once again, the customer who comes to your web site wanting to buy the correct product ... nope, they're gonna get gouged. Because your apology is hollow and you truly, *truly* don't mean a word of it. Your business model is to gouge us. That's what you're about. Every page on your web site hides how to get the correct product for what I need. You could not be more clear. Thank you. 4) HOW CAN I FIND OUT how to buy the product that I need? There is no-place that I can find where you clearly state a policy for selling me the actual product that I need. You continue to play hide-the-puck. As though it's a cute game. Forty apologies later, and the rules keep changing. What are the current rules? Anyone? Anyone? (Bueller, Bueller?) That's it, I'm done with you. 5) Your cut-and-paste replies to Amazon negative reviews demonstrate in no uncertain terms that you really, truly, just don't care. You don't have the time to actually answer people's complaints. You issued an apology, or ten, and that should be good enough for us *customers*. I can hear your voice curl when you say the word. Every time you cut and paste a non-denial denial, it tells everyone exactly who you are: We recently communicated to you about the changes we made We recently communicated to you about the changes we made Enough. We're done here.

title: If you bought this and are unhappy you can get a FREE copy from their competitor. See below.
content: Also was angered by lack of Schedule C. I have a really small business, and the added cost is way too much. Did find an article stating I could get free copy of tax software with Schedule C from HR Block with proof of having purchased Turbotax. You need to email your receipt and some info, name, phone, address, Mac or Windows and copy of receipt to them at switchtoblock@hrblock.com. Google it.

title: Time to change
content: I just ordered H&R Block Deluxe based on the reviews here and on the H&R product's page. It feels good to cut the cord with Intuit and I saved anywhere from $10 to $40 dollars. Who knows if I needed a TurboTax upgrade or not. I didn't want to buy Deluxe, get tied up with it, and THEN discover I needed an upgrade. As others here, I've been a TurboTax customer for many years. Not anymore.

title: Horrible Website and Customer Support. Don't buy if you think you will need to ask any questions or need support.
content: I have always used TurboTax in the past but had never tried to get help from their support lines. After trying to get help through their website and via questions sent, I will never use this product again. Their support website is arcane at best leading you in circles. Their support people send canned responses to questions after you state what you have already gleaned from the limited information available. Its really too bad a good product is ruined because of a companies lack of understanding how important customer support can be.

title: Greed trumps customer satisfaction
content: My wife quilts for a hobby. Occasionally she sells a quilt and unfortunately receives a 1099 Misc. As purchased, Tubo Tax saw fit to change Deluxe so it would no longer handle the small amount of expenses associated with the quilts. While Turbo Tax tried to reverse its marketing crisis, it was too late for me. While I like Turbo Tax and have been a long time customer, I will never purchase their product again if they make it a requirement to use the Business version for a very simple business (hobby).

title: bait and switch
content: Like everyone else who purchased TT deluxe, I was shocked by the bait and switch tactics employed by Intuit. Next year...H&R Block for me.

title: I Hope TT learns from these negative reviews
content: I'm a long time (20+ years) user of TurboTax, and have used it to deal with investment data with Deluxe version. After buying the Deluxe version this year I found out it won't handle my investment data. To their credit, a pleasant call to their 800 number Customer Service, resulted in a free upgrade to Premier, so I can file this year. I wonder if TurboTax will listen to their customers and return the investment calcs back to Deluxe next year or keep their heads in the sand??? I will certainly be very careful next year about whether to get TT or go over to the HR Block. D Westergren

title: First, thanks to all those writing reviews for helping ...
content: First, thanks to all those writing reviews for helping me avoid a mistake. I too was a 20+ year Turbo tax user and just ordered H&R Block software for 2014.

title: As a long time TurboTax user, I was going ...
content: As a long time TurboTax user, I was going to give them one more chance. Looking at the details, I learned that I need have my 2013 tax files on my PC to get the upgrade to the version with schedule D, even though I filed electronically through TurboTax last year. I don't. I just spent 45 minutes on hold with TurboTax to get clarification. I can't think of anything else that Turbo Tax can do to drive off long time customers - I'm done! I just bought H&R Block.

title: Deception And Greed, Don't Buy TurboTax Deluxe Because Of Missing Features
content: I have been using TurboTax for at least 15 plus years and I can't believe they would be so dishonest by taking out features without letting the consumers know. I have already opened my software and can't take it back. I will be taking up H&R Block's offer and trying their software this year. I hope more people complain to put pressure on Intuit to return the features. Or better yet, having their sales drop along with their stock price. Update: I just answered a question someone else had about this problem then read some of the TurboTax five star reviews. The reviews have to be written by Intuit employees or stockholders.

title: TurboTax is no longer what it used to be!
content: I have been a TurboTax customer for years. I am extremely disappointed with the decision TurboTax has made in down grading their product. Be aware that TurboTax deluxe will no longer supports all forms. If you have to file a schedule D you are forced to upgrade to the premier version. It all comes down to greed. I've decided it's time to look at the competitors. It looks like I will have to bite the bullet and pay this year but I will also take advantage of the free H&R Block offer. If I can get all my data transferred I will make a permanent switch.

title: this was an excellent way to irritate your loyal customers
content: I am posting this to try to drive the Amazon review score for TurboTax Deluxe even lower than it already is. I have been using TurboTax Deluxe for many years without issues. My return includes forms D and E. I feel totally screwed that they removed support for these forms this year. I did not know this until I read a short article in my USA Today news app today. Go to this URL to compare the supported forms for the different versions of the program: https://turbotax.intuit.com/personal-taxes/online/premier.jsp Yes, Intuit, this was an excellent way to irritate your loyal customers.

title: I have contacted TurboTax & Intuit to remove me from future solicitation.
content: Due to their product shift on the former "TurboTax Deluxe" and the ensuing consumer fallout\rebellion\abandonment to other tax-prep competitors of which their whole enterprise has surely become aware, I've requested TT/intuit to please remove me from theirsolicitations in any medium--i.e., email, message or phone. (I'll resist the temptation to characterize it as a product "deflation" as that terminology is currently monopolized by another "brain dead" business undertaking: http://blogs.wsj.com/law/2015/01/23/nfl-taps-attorney-ted-wells-to-lead-deflategate-probe/.)

title: Shane on you Intuit
content: I began using TT deluxe in its first year of existence and it always included Schedule D. Not even thinking I purchased Deluxe again this year. Now I find I have to upgrade to Premier to complete even the most basic Schedule D at a cost of $30.00 Shame on you Intuit. If I cannot return TT for a refund I will take advantage of their 60 day money back guarantee. I hope I can return it since that way i will also get a refund of the sales tax. I loved this product but one can only take so much. I am now looking for reasonable alternatives to both Quicken and TurboTan.

title: WANT YOUR PERSONAL INFORMATION SHARED ???????????????????????????????????
content: The process is good, but here is a fact for you: At the end of preparing your return, you are offered the opportunity to buy an Amazon gift card with a 10% match. Sounds great until you read the terms you have to accept. At the bottom of the terms it discloses that you are authorizing your information to be shared. I guess the folks at Turbo Tax figure that by the time you are done working through your returns, you will be too worn out to read the details. Intuit continualy walks the line of violating trust.

title: I have never purchased this form of TurboTax but have ...
content: I have never purchased this form of TurboTax but have used them online since 2005. This year, I cannot access my account with them which means no access to last year's returns with addresses and such. I called and they can't access it either. Their answer to this problem was to give me the number to IRS and ask them what is going on with my return. Really? From last year? And no notice from IRS? TurboTax, I cannot tell you aggravated I am. I have more to do on my return than I care to do by hand but I just might resort to paper return.

title: Deluxe Version Features Missing in 2014 Version
content: Have used TT Deluxe for the last 8 or so years. I'm one of the people on here that also needs the schedule D and have been great with the Deluxe version this whole time. Now we have to pay significantly more for the next version up for that feature and other features we don't need? This company literally sells nothing more than what amount to updates to its software year after year for full software prices, and then nickel and dimes customers for every single additional feature like additional states, e-file, etc. Now they are pulling something like this to bilk even more money out of long time customers. I will not be using TT again...ever...even if they put the Deluxe version back to what it was next year. Sorry Intuit, I live on principle not to support larger CEO bonuses. It's obvious that you've lost any balance between corporate greed and providing a good, quality product. Bye! **UPDATE : My favorite part of this whole debacle is the excuse the VP is using to justify Inuit's actions of crippling the Deluxe version. Paraphrase, "We want to ensure a long running inconsistency between our standalone version and our online version was finally resolved to ensure fairness for the customers of both versions". I get it, you wanted to make sure standalone copies of the software had the same features as the online version. The only problem is... THE STANDALONE VERSION WITH ALL FEATURES WAS FIRST! You people at Intuit created the inconsistencies by not providing the same features with the software when you built the online version later. Shame on you all for attempting to hide the truth by skewing what's really going on. The public's perception is completely dependent on how you spin it isn't it? Better luck next time guys...

title: Serious problems with not having access to Schedule D and ...
content: Serious problems with not having access to Schedule D and E even if using only the forms view. Note that Turbo Tax did give me a free upgrade to premium after complaining. Note the person I talked with did not seem to know how to get the Code to upgrade and it took a long time.

title: Thanks for the Warning on TurboTax changes.
content: I appreciate the heads up on the TurboTax changes. As a new Amazon Prime member I noticed the banner and thought how simple to order on line vs going to the retailer. I am so happy I saw the reviews and it saddens me. Have been a loyal TT user since 1996. I guess it is time to bite the bullet and move to the H&R block product. Does anyone know if I can easily import the data from my prior TurboTax returns in to H&R's product or are there any others to consider? Looks like the Intuit stock is down from $10/share from Dec 15th, and HRB near a 52 week high, Ouch!

title: Turbotax STINKS! I used it for decades. This ...
content: Turbotax STINKS! I used it for decades. This last year. they got greedy and started removing features from the basic software package. So, no more Schedules C or D. On top of that, if you use their online service, it's virtually impossible to go back and correct items that you might have entered incorrect data for. Never going to pay these turds my hard earned cash again.

title: Good bye Intuit
content: Good bye Intuit. Just purchased H & R TaxCut. Have gotten tired of Intuit finding new ways every few years to screw their customers.

title: I changed to H&R Block after 20 years using Turbo ...
content: I changed to H&R Block after 20 years using Turbo Tax. I am sure I don't need to give the reason why I changed. Thanks Turbo Tax!

title: How dare they?
content: Removed 50% of the features I need, and my return is pretty average for a retiree. After 10 years of use, I'll switch.

title: I hate being extorted
content: Intuit downgraded the deluxe version removing several schedules I previously used. Now it appears they think I will pay twice the amount of money for a more expense version. WRONG. After 15 years, I am moving to another brand. I hate being extorted. Intuit has always been sneaky, think quicken. It's another way for Intuit to pad their bottom finances. BYE Intuit !

title: They must think we are stuck on stupid. If they could not figure a way to ...
content: Have used TTD for the last 5 years. Getting ready to buy 2014 TTD, started reading the reviews about the capital gains and now I am going to order HRB. Thanks for the revealing reviews. Will be telling all my fellow employes about this and tell them to switch to HRB. Advise everyone that reads these reviews to do the same. Refuse to believe that they had no choice but to remove the capital gains from the Deluxe.. They must think we are stuck on stupid. If they could not figure a way to keep it in, they don't belong in the software writing business.

title: I've been a TurboTax customer for years. This year ...
content: I've been a TurboTax customer for years. This year Intuit has, as a company, lost all of its integrity by resorting to "bait and switch" tactics by selling you one product but making it unusable unless you upgrade to a more expensive product, in my case they require me to install the "Home and Business" addition. So shame on you Intuit, you've just lost a long time customer.

title: Hello H&R Block, Goodbye TurboTax for not supporting Mac 10.6.8
content: I have been a loyal TurboTax customer for years. I bought the 2014 version at a local store. I inserted the startup disk and received an error message that I must upgrade Mac to 10.7 from 10.6.8. That is ridiculous! I am going to to H&R Block so that I don't have to upgrade to a new operating system. Goodbye TurboTax -- thanks for all the great years!

title: Intuit is very sneaky
content: Intuit tried screwing me some years back when they made a similar sneaky change. I switched to H&R Block and never looked back.

title: Dumped
content: Long time user, not this year.

title: Was probably my last Turbo Tax year
content: Bad this year !!! Couldn't see last yrs comparison to check if things were entered right, at the end couldn't e-file, had to call Turbo Tax and leave a phone number and wait for a call back ( THAT NEVER CAME) .Finally wrote a complaint to turbo tax saying "Turbo Tax won't be doing my taxes next year", and believe it or not I got a call very quickly. image that. NOT A HAPPY PERSON, Les

title: Hey Hey, Hey, Goodbye!
content: I've been a loyal TT user since back in the floppy disk era. No more ... this is BS. Goodbye TT, hello H&R Block.

title: Turbotax, you screwed up!
content: TT now charges about double for the same features as last year! Deluxe no longer includes the forms for simple stock and mutual fund transactions! Guess what: H&R Block software still does for around $30! And H&R Block will pull in Turbotax info from last year! Guess what: I bought H&R Block to do my taxes this year and it works just great! I'll not be a slave to your greed!

title: Time to switch to H&R Block Deluxe
content: I first used MacInTax for my 1987 tax returns and have been using it (and TurboTax after they bought MacInTax) for the last 27 years. I bought TurboTax Deluxe 2014 without paying attention to the reviews since it has always done what I needed (including Schedule D). Thanks to the news articles (and the reviews, which I have now read) pointing out that TurboTax Deluxe no longer supports Schedule D, I am going to take up H&R Block on their offer to try out their Deluxe edition.

title: Caution on usung 2014 turbo tax
content: Not pleased with the 2014 edition. When the software performs a final check for errors and item(s) need to be corrected you get an error "long running script" which makes it impossible to fix the problem and prevents you from e filing. So you pay upfront for e file then you are forced to send your returns in by mail.

title: Bad company!
content: Well they have to raise the price they didn't want to. They feel very sorry but they need more money to lobby government. See if they don't spend all that money lobbying then government passes a law that makes filing taxes much easier on all of us. And certainly no one wants that. So you see it is in your best interest to give them much more money.

title: No more integrated Schedule D? No more me...
content: Just made my annual purchase of this yesterday at Costco. Like everyone else, I've been using this software for 20 years. Now I'm just happy I haven't opened it. I will be returning to Costco and buying the H&R Block software instead. Does anyone know if they carry that at Costco as well? I think they might, but I looked right past it for my old standby. I'll be informing my entire family of these changes as well, and as we all have minimal schedule D items to report, I'm certain they'll all be switching. Nicely done, Intuit.

title: I purchased the Deluxe version like I did last year from OfficeMax
content: Don't buy this version if you need schedule D.. A loyal TurboTax user since it's inception. NO MORE. I purchased the Deluxe version like I did last year from OfficeMax, I had credit there. Today when I started to look for schedule D, it tells me to buy this Premier version. Thanks but no thanks, I'm switching to H & R Block. How can they double the price with no warning?

title: TurboTax once again disappoints...
content: I was very disappointed that they changed the software for 2014. I felt it was misleading and even deceptive. The package that always allowed schedule C and other associated forms no longer were available in the Deluxe version.Though the price hadn't changed. In order to have what I had in 2013, I needed to upgrade to a version costing $30.00 more when nothing changed for almost all federal tax forms. I really felt used and lied too. To increase the cost of a product by almost 65-75% simply because your marketing people tell you that it will be a money maker. Its really disappointing. I have been with Turbotax since before they were TurboTax. Almost 20 years. This is the last year. I wont be back next year and will make every effort to alert others to the manner in which you have brazenly went for money and not improvement.

title: Beware: Deluxe version this year does not handle K-1 or Sch C in interview mode
content: I have to agree with many of the one star ratings. I have been using the Deluxe version for many years now and have been very happy. This year's Deluxe version will not allow me to use the interview mode for adding the K-1 or Sch C without having to do a $30 upgrade to Premier or Home and Business for an additional $40. The differences may have been shown in the comparison matrix, but it is not clear to myself or these disgruntled buyers.

title: It is a terrible product with a built-in scheme to fleece the customers
content: I would have rated it zero if I could. It is a terrible product with a built-in scheme to fleece the customers. I called to get a "free upgrade" to Premium , it took 20 minutes. TurboTax should just simply let customer download the upgrade through the normal upgrade process. The call-us-on-a-case-by-case approach is another scheme to short change the majority of its customers who do not want to be bothered with the complex, time consuming process.

title: One Star
content: I need to cancel this order

title: Not Happy!!!
content: Have used it for many years but they are now being very petty and forcing an upgrade to get basic forms. "D" for example. I'm sure there have been many thousands of consumers that have previously purchased this software.They are chasing the customers away. Bonehead decision! The free upgrade is not being offered to me when I try to upgrade the software. When I choose the upgrade option it states that my software is up to date. When I try to upgrade I continually get an error message. I have called the phone number and have been on hold for 30 minutes so far. My tax preparation is now on hold. Thanks!!!

title: Intuit Price Gouging
content: Disabling Schedule D and Schedule E from the 2014 TurboTax Deluxe was a mistake. It was not advertised that changes had been made and Intuit forced people to pay more for the Premier version upgrade. They should have left the Deluxe version as it had been in past years and just raised the price and see if people would pay more for the same version. I used TurboTax for numerous years and I will switch to another vendor.

title: Saw all the reviews before and they generally outline what ...
content: Saw all the reviews before and they generally outline what has happened. I'm a ten-year plus user of Turbo Tax, but why pay $80 for TT Premium when you can get HRBlock Deluxe for $30? Nothing wrong with TT product (based on 2013), but they have so obviously tried to pull the wool over all their customer's eyes - how silly! Just started with HRBlock - as far as I can see it does all the same things and is now a bargain compared to TT Premium.

title: One Star
content: worst form of blackmailing

title: How to alienate your loyal customers in one easy step!
content: The H&R Block software works great. Did my Schedule C no problem. You guys really screwed up here. You could have raised the price $20 and kept me as a customer. That would have been fine. But my time is valuable to me and I refuse to do business with a software company that disables important features and then makes me read online reviews for hours just to be sure I am purchasing the right product. Have been using and recommending turbotax for decades. No more. The purpose of tax software is to save time vs. using the forms. How did you forget that? If I have to waste an entire morning trying to figure out which flavor to use because you crippled the product, well then what's the point? Might as well ride my bike down to the post office and grab the paper forms like the old days. Get some exercise too. Trust is gone, and it ain't coming back. You really need to fire the marketing genius that came up with this plan. People with no common sense need to be kept out of positions where they can do serious damage to a company. Jobs are at stake here. Or was it a business consultant? Having delt with a few of them in the past, this sounds like the kind of short-sighted scheme they would push on you. Might want to ask for a refund of their consulting fee.

title: SLAP YOUR MARKETING DEPT INTO NEXT TUESDAY! What a brilliant move!
content: What a joke, not only are you diluting the product but even the higher "concentrated" products have been crippled by dismantling features. I have been using Turbo Tax for as long as I can remember. Thank the financially mindful companies who believe in capitalism and competition. They must be laughing all the way to the bank, the intuit customers including myself will be going elsewhere. What a joke of a strategy. Fire your marketing research team asap.

title: Trapped
content: Pissed. Have been using TurboTax for over 15 years. This year, I had to buy upgrade to do Sch C. Pissed.

title: Sux: with a capital $
content: Greedy bastards. Decontent your software then charge more for it in pricey versions. Never again.

title: Two Stars
content: No longer worth the money. Dropping schedules C & D is a huge mistake that will benefit the competition.

title: Beware of the hidden price increase!!!
content: I bought the deluxe hoping to do my taxes as last year. I didn't need the extra "help" from the Home and Business version but was forced to upgrade before I could even start my return. This was a really crappy thing to do. This is how they reward my 15 years of loyalty? I have use H&R Blocks Taxcut in the past and will go back to that for next year.

title: TurboTax didn't screw up, they screwed US!
content: No longer includes the same forms and scheudles they did last year. You need to upgrade to higher priced version.

title: It worked fine until I needed schedule D and a 1099-S form ...
content: It worked fine until I needed schedule D and a 1099-S form and then I had to pay another $30, which was a surprise compared to last years. Now I hear there are some free additions available. Rob The e file probably will not work because of the extra forms not in the original format??

title: This year's product stinks..............
content: I have been a Turbo Tax user for over a long time and this year's product is very disappointing. My parents died last year so I am doing their taxes as well as my own. Once I began I had to download an up grade which required an additional purchase. The download itself did not go well and while I thought I had only purchased one product in the up grade my CC account showed two purchases. Turbo Tax did email me a letter earlier explaining this issue and offering $25 to cover the upgrade. The actual cost of the two upgrades was $42.40. I am very disappointed with this product and when I went to their website I found no link to contact anyone either by phone or email. EDIT: as a further 'insult to injury' on April 11 I received a notice from my stater department of the Treasury that I owed additional money to the state! Un freakin' incredible! My state taxes ARE NOT COMPLICATED! I filed them electronically using TT on March 2 without the slightest indication there was a problem, then BOOM! I tried to lower my Amazon rating from 1 to zero stars but could not. I tried leaving feed back on the TT site, but could not! GOODY BYE Turbo Tax, from a decade plus user!!

title: Almost twice as expensive as last year for the same features.
content: Used to be a loyal TurboTax customer. Now I'm rewarded for my loyalty by getting ripped off.

title: I wanted to go on record as being very disappointed in Intuit's decision to remove Schedules C
content: I don't have anything more to say beyond what many others have written, but as another very-long-term user of TurboTax, I wanted to go on record as being very disappointed in Intuit's decision to remove Schedules C, D, and E. Like many others,I will switch to the HR Block product.

title: Major ripoff
content: Turbo Tax deleted Schedule D from this version for 2014 after having included it for years. Not readily apparent to past users (such as me) and if you need Schedule D you have to get a $30 upgrade for the Premier version. Understand the competition includes Schedule D in their priced equivalent to Deluxe + State. Suggest considering that option as supposed to be compatible with prior TT files.

title: Total Rip Off
content: This is a total rip off. The promised rebate of the required upgrade that you don't know about expired on April 20, 2014. Do these people think we are fools????? Do they think we will not remember how they treated long standing customers? The answer is yes, I will remember. I will be using H&R Block software next year. Shame on TurboTax. Rip me off once and I'm gone. Why would you drop the promised rebate until the tax season has ended.

title: Been using TurboTax for years and loved it, but now that they took away support ...
content: Been using TurboTax for years and loved it, but now that they took away support for stock sales reporting from Deluxe, I'll be switching the H&R Block Deluxe. No way am I going to pay $30 more just to e-file my federal return that happens to include a few stock sales. It's insulting that they try to sell this change as anything but the money grab it is. Shame on you, Intuit.

title: Beware of TurboTax Deluxe 2014
content: "If you like your Schedule D, you can keep your Schedule D." Gee, where have I heard that line before.

title: I am out!
content: Count me out after years of turbo Tax, calling it Deluxe is like calling a Chevy a Cadillac!!

title: Not the same old TurboTax
content: Turbotax has removed essential features that existed in past years. Please READ the reviews before making a purchase. Many people have been loyal customers for years and decades, so replying to these reviews by blaming users isn't a great strategy. Why would anyone assume an already functional product would have features removed vs. past years?

title: Charging extra for different forms???
content: It is interesting what others are saying about this years version of turbo tax. I have used turbo tax, like many here, for about 20 years and have had those times, most noticeably in the early years, where there were problems with the software and updates. I have also struggled with Intuit's support of software - during the migration from 1999 - 2000 for Quickbooks for Macintosh. Because of Intuit's lack of support for Quickbooks on the Mac (Intuit was not supporting all of the software and directed using another brand software for different features - a company that I just moved from because of the problems I had with this other company's software), I had to purchase PC's to continue the use of Quickbooks. In the past I had used TurboTax's competitor - again many many years ago - but it sounds like I will be checking out the competitors again after reading these other reviews. In this day and age, taxes cannot be done without using software, but to charge additional money to get certain forms just doesn't sound right to me. I have been doing taxes for so many years that going through the handholding feature (interview function) just takes that much more time to do taxes which take way too long to do. Anyway - yeah - it has been interesting reading the VP's comments too. In my humble opinion, tax software is too expensive - yeah its complicated for sure - but to have to pay for it every year (and some will say its tax deductible - but it depends on your taxes whether you can actually write it off) at up to $100 is crazy. But I suppose if you are making $100k or more then you can afford it. Of course, probably someone making $100k or more has someone doing their taxes for them. The other thing that sometimes surprised me is how the software changes on its ease of use. One year it finally is easy to use and then the next year the software totally changes and now you have to learn a new way of moving around in the software - of course I guess if you go through the handholding feature then that doesn't matter. Well that's my 2 cents worth - but based on other reviews I see - I will be looking elsewhere this year.

title: One Star
content: I can't get it to download and they can't help me. However you can't return it. Such BS.

title: Warning! Do not buy! If you have ANY ...
content: Warning! Do not buy! If you have ANY investments, you will have to shell out an additional $30!!!!! Buy H&R Block which it is included at a MUCH cheaper price. Even though Intuit said they will adjust the software to not charge you, it still does!!!!

title: This is my last. Too much money for too little improvement.
content: I'm not sure why I keep buying TT. I guess it's just inertia. They deliberately change it every year so that you have to buy the new version over and over again, instead of just buying an update. Then they charge convenience fees to do things that are otherwise free. Plus they tout the "Free" like it's company generosity and not a federal mandate. There are only so many ways to fill out a 1040; how can Inuit's marketing department keep a straight face when they come out with a new and improved "Interview" process. Every year for over 30 years? Really? This year is no different. Seems everyone else does the same thing for less. Next year so will I.

title: The oldest TT files I have are from 1997 and ...
