content: The oldest TT files I have are from 1997 and I've used it every year since. I almost left when they installed that Macrovision CDilla DRM software years ago. But thru inertia and familiarity, I didn't switch. I just bought HR Block Deluxe. Thanks for the other reviews so I wasn't surprised with a needed upgrade in the middle of doing my taxes.

title: Better luck next year
content: Intentionally crippling a product to make money. No thanks. Better luck next year.

title: No longer does what is has done for me as ...
content: No longer does what is has done for me as a sole proprietor. GREEDY . They are misleading people in this latest edition you either. If you did already buy it you, H&R Block will give you a free copy with proof of purchase od Turbotax Email SwitchToBlock@hrblock.com and include proof of purchase of the 2014 software.

title: BYE BYE Intuit from another LONG term loyal Customer
content: What a Fiasco. Have been a loyal Intuit TurboTax user for many Years. For the first time in my life I actually accrued a small amount of self-generated income, it was only a $1400 honoraria for speaking at an event. My expenses of traveling almost wiped out the entire $1400, but wanted to speak to help out the non-profit whom benefited. Back to TurboTax, I downloaded the Deluxe version, same version I have been used for years, plowed through entering all my W2's etc, then came to the 1099-MISC... It let me enter everything and even offered to itemize the expenses, so good so far. Then after entering my plane ticket costs it advises me that I need to shell out another $30 for an "upgrade", or else "not deduct" my VALID expense!! Are you friggin kidding me? Its bad enough that I am taxed helping out a non-profit, then Intuit lines me up to extract another $30 just so I can recoup some of my losses from my huge honoraria of $1400 ($1300 of which went to expenses to get there). See ya Intuit, after many years of faithful service I am headed to the "Block" as suggested by the other reviewers.

title: TurboTax Ripoff
content: I have had rental properties in the past, so I have always used TT Premier. I no longer have these properties, so I was looking forward this year to 'downsizing' to the Deluxe version for the first time. Now I find that TT has downgraded Deluxe by removing schedulesa C and D, so I still have to pay for Premier. Bad company. Bad, bad, bad!

title: One Star
content: For the same reasons as others have stated-- same product, twice the price. 1/5

title: Beware!
content: The program froze at the "submit Efile" and technical assistance was not able to resolve. This is the same computer that I had used last year to work on TurboTax, so obviously they have a flawed product this year. With poor technical trouble shooting services and flawed program I can not recommend this product.

title: After enduring Intuit's constant offers to upgrade during my many ...
content: After enduring Intuit's constant offers to upgrade during my many, many, years of using Deluxe, this latest move to squeeze the customer pushed me out the door; I just ordered H&R Block's software, which isn't shackled the way TT is. So long, Intuit!

title: Expensive shareware
content: $50 for what should be called shareware. Transferred my return from last year only to see DO NOT FILE across the top of my 1040 and schedule C. Oh, and if I like the product and want to actually file my taxes with it, I have to pay them even more. Not to mention that e-filing my state return will cost another $40. Well after 20+ years of using this program, I'm done.

title: It has become useless. Goodbye Intuit
content: Used Turbotax for years, but no longer. It has become useless. Goodbye Intuit.

title: Mass Repudiation
content: Has there ever been such a large repudiation on Amazon for a product? One-star reviews are running 10:1 over 5-star reviews (and how many of those are legit?) Like so many others here, I was a long-term TT user but have happily moved over to H&R Block. My 2013 TT return imported in a breeze. Bye bye, Intuit.

title: Taking away critical features like e-filing schedule D
content: Shameless display of corporate arrogance. Taking away critical features like e-filing schedule D, without lowering price is disgusting. Too bad for Intuit - there are alternatives and you are not monopoly as you would like to think about yourselves. It's more like "Chicken the little" act that will be remembered.

title: Nothing "Deluxe" about it.
content: After a dozen or more years with Turbo Tax, I finally jumped ship last year when Intuit first removed Schedule C and D from their online version of Deluxe. Went with TaxACT Online and will do it again. Last year was $21.99 which included Schedule C for freelance work.

title: SEAMLESS AUTOMATIC UPGRADE DOES NOT WORK
content: I've been a TurboTax user for years (back into the '90's. They've lost me as a customer. The promised "automatic upgrade" DOES NOT WORK. At least for me it's not. If you are lucky, maybe it will work for you. It does not for me (purchased and downloaded on 2/28). Searching on the web I see many with this problem --- the only fix is to call their inundated customer service number during business hours M-F and get a code to plug in. I almost went with H&R Block this year because of this problem, but it appeared to be fixed and I felt loyalty to the company. I'm not sure there is anything they can do to keep me as a customer. Their CEO should be fired.

title: Shame on you Turbotax! It's not nice to try and take advantage of your bread and butter!
content: Thank you, thank you, thank you all of you amazon reviewers! I almost purchased this, out of habit and not realizing that there was an alternative. H & R here I come! Power to us little people! With the help of social media, we may now join forces, speak with our wallets, and finally have a voice!

title: Fed Return and State Return Do Not Match???
content: Something weird has happened to me. A couple of days ago, I received a notice from Virginia state taxation office saying there is a discrepancy on my 2012 tax return because the "Total itemized Deduction" on the Fed return did not match on the same item on state tax return. Therefore I owe Virginia $119 plus interest. So I found my 2012 tax return and checked the numbers and they did not match! I have been using Turbo tax for years with the assumption that all I need to do is to enter the numbers and Turbo Tax will do the calculation for me. In this case, Turbo Tax should simply carry over that value from Schedule A to Virginia 760 Form. Unfortunate Turbo Tax did not do it for my 2012 return. I don't understand how things like this could happen. Does it mean from now on I have to manually verify all the numbers? Then what is the point of using this software? What other issues does Turbo Tax have? Am I going to receive notices for my 2013 and 2014 returns? This really makes me nervous. Mike

title: If you had premier last year and want deluxe this year with schedule D option it's not straight forward
content: The free upgrade to premier is a spam. You will have to call customer care (multiple times) after purchasing the product and be on waiting for long time or wait for callback and hope they will upgrade it free. I got mine upgraded for free. They say its seamless and happens automatically. But its not. There are other products which are good and are truthful. If you have the patience to call customer care, this deal is for you.

title: A sleazy trick
content: I've used Turbotax for 6 years now, and this year will be the last, and that only because Amazon won't let me return the downloaded software. Regardless of Intuit's belated offer to refund 25 bucks, that they would pull a stunt like this in the face of increasing -- and cheaper -- competition from other companies is a sign of sleazy and stupid management. May the buying public repay them with everything they deserve.

title: Another Loyal Customer Lost
content: Goodbye TurboTax.

title: PASSWORD PROTECTION SCREWED UP
content: Not only did they screw up the forms in the deluxe version but they now do not allow you to password the file without signing into Intuit. I really don't want anyone having my passwords. Previous versions of the software allowed password protection at the desktop level. A BIG thumbs down

title: Never pay for Intuit products
content: Inuit baits and switches you into using their pay editions when most people can probably use the free version. The online version is actually much faster than the PC version of the program. Hideous company.

title: Horrible what intuit has done with this
content: Crippled software now. Horrible what intuit has done with this software

title: Last year, I used the Deluxe version to file ...
content: Last year, I used the Deluxe version to file my taxes including schedule E. When I reached that form in this year's version, I found out that I needed to spend $30 additional to upgrade to the Premier version. Had I known, I could have purchased that version for only $6 more on Amazon. If the product is supposed help you do your taxes, it should do all the routine schedules.

title: Unbundled their Product Line in Yet Another Money Grab
content: After 15 years or so of using TurboTax Deluxe, I've switched over to to H&R Block software. Through the years Intuit has made other money grabs...do you remember calling in for help and having to provide a credit card before connecting with a customer service rep?, but this is the straw that broke the customer's back. Someone sat in a boardroom and decided that "unbundling" the existing products would squeeze an extra $X Million out of their loyal customers. I can see the powerpoint presentation in my head now. And I can see all the stuffed suits nodding in agreement and wringing their hands. But there's one problem. Their loyal customers have told them to go pound sand and it's going to be a bloodbath when sales figures come out. Customers' backlash has hit the news outlets including the New York Times and Intuit is now in damage control mode, giving away stuff, teaming with Amazon to link your tax refund to Amazon gift cards and making deals with complaining customers on a case by case basis. I think they will take a serious hit financially and next year they will come to their senses. But in the meanwhile GOOD-BYE TurboTax; Hello H&R Block. Enough is enough.

title: Switched to H&R Block
content: This program was fine in previous years but for 2014 schedule D was removed and I have switched to H&R Block software. Sasan Goodarzi, General Manager now has tried to make things right too late for me.

title: May I Please Have a Refund
content: After installation on Windows 8 an update was required. The update froze so I had to restart. Upon restart of TurboTax 2014 it says I have an error code and that another user is running the software. Restart should fix but it just isn't working. I tried reinstalling but after waiting about 45 minutes that is still going. I'm switching to H&R Block. Sorry TurboTax.

title: Do not buy TurboTax until you understand if the product will work for you!
content: My review of Basic applies to Deluxe as well: Like many, I have been a very long-time user of TurboTax Basic for years. It let you use ANY form you needed to file for your taxes, and did what software should which is to add up all the numbers from page to page to create a correct return. This year, Basic is not what you could buy in the past, and you need Deluxe for this form, and Premier for that form, and so on. This is not a great experience, and paying 3x for the same software and experience is not acceptable. I will not be using TurboTax this year. H&R Block will give your their Deluxe version for free if you show proof of purchase of last year's TurboTax, and frankly I am more interested in the straightforward TaxAct product pricing. I have never used H&R's or TaxAct's products, and plan on doing my taxes with both H&R and TaxAct this year to compare the two. A quick search of news will point you to info on how to get H&R for free by email only. I am at a loss to understand how Intuit and TurboTax thought this was a great business decision. Why not just raise the price of TurboTax basic a few dollars and keep the exact same experience?

title: So long..........
content: Just adding my name to the long list of former users. I've put up with the changes in costs and functionality through the years, but no more. In my case, you can teach an old dog new tricks......bring on H&R

title: Thanks for nothing.
content: Wow! They keep trying to screw their customers year after year. Charging extra to e-file state taxes. This is the most horrible offense. Dropping basic forms so they make people buy the more expensive version. No thanks . I'm off to buy tax cut.

title: go to hr block
content: Thanks for all the helpful heads up on downgrade of deluxe. I ve been using TT since the days of the floppy disk but now I m switching to hr block. GFY intuit bye bye I haven't seen anything this stupid since Netflix decided to double their price : )

title: Gouging scumbags
content: I now have to go see if Costco will accept for return opened software. I installed it before finding out it no longer had the functionality I needed. Even if I can't get my money back I'm going to buy Block. Intuit done getting my money.

title: Rip Off...BEWARE
content: Horrible. I've used TurboTax every year since it came on floppy disks. I bought Deluxe, paid TOO MUCH, and still got half-way-through and was told I bought the wrong one and had to pay $30 MORE. Save your money. Get TaxCut.

title: There are no automatic upgrades to Premiere from Deluxe for past users. I had to pay for the upgrade!!!!!
content: I have used Turbo Tax deluxe for years and after reading that Inuit would upgrade to Premiere for free, I decided to trust the source and purchase Turbo Tax Deluxe instead of H & R Block. I got a huge surprise.........., there was no automatic upgrade to Premiere for free. I had to pay an additional $32.00 to file the schedules for my investment trading. Here is a copy of my additional payment for premiere. I feel like I've been had twice. Order information Order Summary Qty Item Current Amount 1 TURBOTAX PREMIER TY2014 ACCESS FROM DELUXE $30.00 Subtotal: Sales Tax: Total: $30.00 $2.58 $32.58

title: Bait and switch tactics
content: Turbo Tax will never see another dime of my money. The description makes it seem that that federal and state efile is included. However, right at the very last step as you're getting ready to efile, the software tells you that state efile is not included, and wants you to cough up another $20 to file your state return.

title: Bye Bye TurboTax
content: I've been a loyal user of TurboTax since 1998, following the nightmare I experienced the previous year wrestling with the infamously confusing Schedule D form. Now, 16 years later, I have decided to stop using TurboTax because they no longer include Schedule D in their standard (so-called "deluxe") version of their software, plus they jacked up the price. #1 Rule of Good Business: Never downgrade your product and simultaneously increase its price. This year I have gone with H&R Block's tax software, which is cheaper and more fully functional... plus it imports my old TurboTax file. Take that, Intuit! Your disregard for your customers has lost you a customer.

title: Current version no longer does what past versions did
content: Program has been stripped of essential features. Do not buy if you have any investment income. This used to be a quality program but no longer. Intuit has unethically stripped out the ability to produce schedule c,d and e. you must now pay $30 for an upgrade.

title: One Star
content: The Deluxe version does not allow you to file Schedule D or E.

title: Do not buy this product.
content: I've been using TurboTax for 17 years, and this is the first year that I will not be using them, because of their terrible product. Please, no one buy this product and get whoever made this decision to cripple their Deluxe version fired.

title: Bye Bye Intuit. Hello H&R Block
content: I'll never buy Turbo Tax again let alone any Intuit product.

title: it DOES have a little orange "i" next to the advanced features saying in fine print that they are now only available in the ...
content: Welcome to capitalism folks! First, they reeled us in with their easy-to-use import feature and links to Quicken. Then, little by little, they lulled into complacency by including all of the forms in all of the versions for many years... then once no one was looking, they tightened the screws. I know this because I just bought TurboTax Deluxe only to find out that it will not handle my Schedule E rental income. Now that I check the back of the box (also tauntingly displayed in the online help for UPGRADE) which I obviously did NOT do before I plunked down my hard earned money, it DOES have a little orange "i" next to the advanced features saying in fine print that they are now only available in the upgraded versions. Let's vote with our $$$$ America and next year begin using alternative products which DO EXIST since it is obvious that TurboTax that does not value our business.

title: Color me Not Happy
content: I've been a loyal TurboTax customer since the days of 5.25" floppy discs. I've been on the automated renewal service for at least 14 years and have been using the Deluxe version since it came out. This year I find that I either have to print my return and mail it in since I use Schedules C and D or I can almost double my costs to use the Home and Business version. Frankly I don't see what has been added to the product other than to charge me more money. This change can be found on the website, but since I (up to this year) pre-order and download when it's time I feel mislead. Nothing in the emails I received said the product I had been using and was purchasing again would no longer meet my needs. Not Happy Intuit!

title: First Quicken, now TurboTax. - Lessons in stupidity.
content: Well, Intuit, you've shot yourself in the other foot. I have used TurboTax since the early 90s and am disappointed to learn that the product has been changed. It's not that I use schedule D or E mind you, but I don't like surprises. Want to raise the price on your Deluxe version, go ahead. I have no problem with a company who raises prices. I generally just say "Hm, they raised the price this year" and head to the check-out. However, pulling content makes me wonder if I'm in for a surprise later and THAT I deeply resent. Like others, I feel that I'm being set up for some kind of bait and switch. I was a loyal Quicken fan for many years until they pulled the plug on my 2010 version with the bank. Guess what? Once I closed out my use and started using the bank's on-line features, I didn't miss Quicken at all. The same may well happen to TurboTax. Anyone in business knows that (many) customers once lost will never return. The genius who proposed this "downgrade" will be looking for a job by April 15th and as well they should.

title: Need Premier to do my taxes now and update operating system!
content: Update 1/13/15: BEWARE! TurboTax will NOT work with my Apple iMac computer because I use version 10.6.8 - TT now requires version 10.7.5, so I'd have to update my entire operating system just to use TT Premier. What a joke! I'm sure glad I read the reviews that Deluxe now excludes Schedule D starting with this tax year. I changed my order to Premier after using Deluxe for over a decade. I did see that big box store Costco is selling Deluxe for $40 and Premier for $55 (plus tax) for the next few weeks. One huge irritant for me with TurboTax over the years - while it can calculate quarterly estimated taxes, it does not allow me to override their figures if I want to pay a different amount on Form 1-ES. I always end up having to download Form 1-ES from the IRS site.

title: Intuit - Get a clue!!!!!
content: What was Intuit thinking? Deluxe supported Schedule D for years and now they are forcing customers to upgrade to Premier for an extra $30 so that they can file a Schedule D. Nice way to alienate long time customers of TurboTax like myself. I guess I'll be using H&R Block tax software in the future. Way to go Intuit geniuses!

title: Seems very unstable - too many crasshes!
content: Wow - I was prepared for needing to upgrade to calculate more than $100 in business expenses for a side business, but I wasn't prepared for how often the program is crashing/freezing up/ getting stuck in "calculating" loops. I have re-booted half a dozen times in the past few hours trying to get my taxes done. Really disappointing!!! I understand that my computer is ancient now at 2.5 years old. but really? last years Turbo-Tax worked great on this machine. now I feel like I'll be lucky to get finished within the next month!

title: Intuit has forever lost this customer with this incredibly stupid business decision
content: After over 20 years as Deluxe user with a small self-employed business, and needing schedules C, D for those years, Intuit has forever lost this customer with this incredibly stupid business decision. The disingenuousness of the VP Bob Meighen who asks you to call so his "team" can work with you to "get you the right product" simply means they have the chance to sell you the upgrade since they have nothing else to offer but the upgrade if you need schedules C, D, or E before you go elsewhere. I'll go elsewhere, since this company no longer has a reasonably priced product by market comparison nor any regard for their customers by the way they did this and the disingenuous explaination. This could be taught in business school as a worse decision that ending "regular" Coke. Find a way to enormously increase your price and BS your customers as to why you're doing it.

title: DO NOT BUY THIS SOFTWARE IF YOU NEED SCHEDULE D!!!
content: I bought this from a big box retailer only to find out later that Intuit has made a major change, eliminating Schedule D, and it is now useless to me. I am now going to test the limits of this retailer's return policy.

title: Cant install and customer service is a waste of time
content: Cant install and customer service is a waste. I am having the same problem I had last year. I am trying to install the windows version and it fails. Something is blocking it from installing. I searched online and their support pages are very generic and useless. I called in and waited a long time for a call back. The person calling backed needed to gather information like my email phone mailing address. This is a waste of time and I told her I didnt want to give my mailing address. She said technical support would not speak to me without this info. I told her I was returning this to the store and never using the product again. She said ok, is there anything else I can help you with. Nice attitude. Many options exist as opposed to turbotax. Good for me.

title: Fees, services, and up-charges all the way
content: The software charged me for a state e-file, and then tried to charge an additional fee to take it from my returns. Another $45 for the privilege of e-filing state? So I changed to a credit card to pay for the e-file. I was then told that I had to print a form and send a check to the state... even though I paid for e-filing? An Intuit rep told me that my taxes WERE e-filed correctly, and that I did not need to mail a check. Now I've invested way more time trying to sort out the mess than if I'd just mailed taxes. Fix your customer messages, and stop trying to grab more off this already-too-expensive piece of software. Watch what you check, or you'll get charged for any number of services Intuit tries to stick you with.

title: What a nightmare!
content: Filing my 1099K turned into a nightmare. First the program asks me if I ever work from a home office then asks me to upgrade it to find out I am not eligible for a deduction... Then it asks me if I need to file a state return too ( Duuuhh??) and another upgrade.. (Both upgrades cost more than the program itself.. Even after the upgrades I spend 3 hours in front of the computer to do absolutely nothing. What a smart way to scam people... Do yourself a favor and go to your local accountant for help.

title: Switching to the competition after several years
content: I have no choice but conclude that Intuit has acted in bad faith against its own base of customers. Instead of being transparent and just hiking their prices, they kept their product names and took away some features. So you've been doing the same thing for 5 years and all of a sudden... Surprise! "You need an upgrade to the xxx version to do the same you did last year". When you are halfway through your taxes you almost have no choice but pay for the upgrade because who's in his/her right state of mind will buy a new product they are not familiar with and start over? I prepared and filed my taxes with TurboTax for several years but now I'm switching to the competition. I will buy whatever similar product is available out there, I just want to make sure Intuit doesn't get my business. Their total lack of transparency and respect for me as customer made me question their integrity.

title: Fees, fees, and more fees
content: It's expensive to purchase, then charges a $35.00 refund processing fee. Also, the wording is misleading; you do not get a free state e-file, you only get a free download of their state tax product. Plus, it couldn't access any of the information we put into the TurboTax website last year. Furthermore, it has a condescending tone.

title: Too damn expensive compared to TaxAct
content: I used to use TurboTax for a long time. About 3 years ago, I switched to TaxAct because it was much cheaper and gave me the same returns. Ever since, I have given TurboTax the boot. You should too

title: Bad decision or good business
content: I suspect Intuit deployed bean counters to cull the product sales statics and generated a report that provides a stream of revenue generation at the expense of targeting a small fraction of the user base. Bad decision or good business? Depends if you are a shareholder or user in the select group. The company has no doubt hired an advertising firm to manage the message. Application software revenue is based on volume of sales. Once a product is established their market share only changes with competition or more sales. That would mean more people paying taxes. That would mean more people working. That would mean a successful economy. How do you make more money if market share doesn't fluctuate, raise the price of the whole product or raise the price of the custom product? Suspending judgment enables analysis but does little to put money in your pocket:)

title: Good-bye.
content: I'm done with Turbotax, and with Intuit. I waited fruitlessly a couple of years for routine upgrades to Quicken for Mac, and they responded only with a version that would run on my current operating system, but with important features removed. iBank is now my bank software, perfectly satisfactory, excellent help and support, trouble-free and routinely upgradeable. This year's "improvement" to Turbotax only moves Deluxe version features into the more expensive Premier, claiming that I would appreciate the change. I resent it when a successful company assumes their customers are stupid. Tax software is a competitive business, and I expect I will find something that does very well with my modest tax returns. Intuit has provided me the incentive to make the change and drop the solution that has worked for me for 20 years.

title: Works great and much cheaper and no bait and switch tactics
content: Bought H&R Block. Works great and much cheaper and no bait and switch tactics. When Quicken needs to be upgraded I'm going elsewhere. So long Intuit. You blew it for this long time customer!!

title: Good-bye TurboTax
content: They have crippled this software. I have always used TurboTax basic for Schedule D ( $29.99 last year ) . Now they want to charge as much as $99.99 for the same functionality. Good-bye TurboTax

title: Hello H&R Block!
content: Thanks to everyone who gave me the head's up on Intuit's latest slap at its long term customers. After using TurboTax for about 20 years,I am buying the H&R Block DELUXE software this year.

title: I've used TT since (gulp! ) the floppy disk ...
content: I've used TT since (gulp!) the floppy disk days. Removing functionality from a product to promote upsell is penny wise and pound foolish. Buh-Bye TT, I'm off to the competition.

title: TT Dirty Trick
content: Complete rip off. Do not bother to tell that Deluxe no longer does Sch D or E. Switch to Tax Cut. Free download with proof of purchase of last year's TT. Don't stand for their trick.

title: Beware the crooks at TT
content: 20+ years of using TurboTax. Now I will have to find another software. Since Premier is just too expensive. Plus the almost criminal way TT tried to sneak in the changes to Deluxe.

title: Intuit Removed Basic Functionality
content: I have used TurboTax for many years. Unfortunately, for 2014 Intuit has removed basic features, requiring users to upgrade to higher levels (more expensive) of the software to obtain basic functionality, like Schedule D. Unfortunately, I didn't realize this until after I purchased the product. I have since switched to H&R Block tax software.

title: Gouged with fees at the end 24. 99 to ...
content: Gouged with fees at the end 24 .99 to file state taxes then 34.99 if u take it out of your refund Omg Turbo I already paid for the state taxes wtf I have used you every year now I can go out and have it done for the same price.........

title: VERY UNHAPPY WITH NEED TO PAY EXTRA $30 FOR PREMIER ...
content: VERY UNHAPPY WITH NEED TO PAY EXTRA $30 FOR PREMIER VERSION. AMAZON won't accept returns on software, so no choice by to pay extra $30 to Intuit to complete ruturn this year.

title: Don't buy this if you have investments,... or anything else remotely complex
content: I purchased TT Deluxe, just as I have for at least 10 years, assuming I could still do my simple self employment and investment income entries, just as I always have been able to do. Well... I can't, and having invested $50 in a non-returnable product, now have the choice of doing a big chunk of my return in "forms mode" - gee isn't that a helpful option (NOT), or doing the whole thing on paper and flushing the $50 down the drain. No wait! There's another option! like a Ginsu knife ad... I can plunk down another $30 for the privilege of having TT fill in the forms for me. Let me tell you, they aren't complicated enough for me to need to spend another $30. TurboTax, you blew it, big time! I won't be back unless this changes back.

title: Beware - Deluxe may not longer work for you.
content: I had been using TurboTax (Basic or Deluxe) since 1994, and I had been recommending it to my friends. That's history. This year, TurboTax now requires Premier (at $90) for common forms like Schedule D for sale of stocks. So, I'm going to finally convert to H&R Block ($19.95/$44.95) or TaxACT ($12.99), and I'm never coming back. Both of these programs get great reviews but I had been happy with TurboTax. The huge price difference is now enough to overcome the inertia that kept me in the fold. Intuit just got a little too greedy.

title: Buggy software
content: Crashed twice and can't get through the review because of a bug. Frustrated! Will call 800-445-1875 to bring to their attention my displeasure. Next year won't be TurboTax!

title: Good product, but much more expensive than last year
content: I've used TurboTax for almost 10 years. Pricing change is deceptive at best. Last year i remember being up sold near the end for being able to pay out of my refund or having TurboTax do something for me. It even charged me for my "Free" state return. That was all fine, but this is manipulative. I imagine they thought, "Get them to start their taxes. No one wants to start over." My decision is not to purchase TurboTax this year despite wanting to use the consistent platform I've been using for almost 10 years, due to the deceptive nature and size of the price increase.

title: If you have any stock transactions avoid at all costs!
content: I wish I could give this 0 or -1 stars. After using this product for at least a decade, they decided to remove content from it. I should have read reviews before buying it. I didn't as it had worked to my expectations for a decade. Now it no longer will deal with stock transactions. I am so upset about this I will most likely no longer send my money to Intuit.

title: Not at all worth the cost, what with the need for Premiere for schedule D
content: I am extremely aggravated that they make me upgrade to PREMIERE just for Schedule D. In the scheme of things it isn't that complex, and in the past this was covered by the BASIC version, and I thought that was pricey for just doing taxes. It's now way beyond the point of being cost effective. For that price, they should send someone to do them for me. It's also a real inconvenience buying one level through Amazon, and then having to buy the upgrade through Intuit. I used to do my taxes manually, and it wasn't that hard. I do like importing from the brokerage and electronic filing, which is the only reason I don't just do it manually. This was the last time I use TurboTax, and the last time they get any of my hard-earned money. Next year, I'll look into one of the other packages. ***Update: Since the package I paid for included the State, I tried the State package for the first time (AZ). I thought it might help with being a part time resident since I moved there during the year. It certainly wasn't much help. 1) To make any changes, it takes you through all the questions again; you can't just make changes to the particular area. 2) Not all data is pulled from the Federal form. At one point it indicates you should refer to the Federal Schedule A (that TurboTax has filled out). Not the kind of integration I expected. 3) When providing the split amounts between the states, TurboTax shows summarized values, asking how much was from each State. You have to manually go back to the Federal forms and figure out what the constituent values are and then go back to the State (starting at the beginning each time). 4) I had two W2's, and the split showed one in AZ, when both should have been in the other State. (I found this by reviewing the 140PY form). I went back to edit the AZ State return, and went through answering the questions several times, and was unable to correct the error, since it didn't show those particular values. I therefore had to change the form manually. 5) In general, I spent much more time doing manual calculations outside of TuboTax State, than I did within TurboTax State. Especially after this first year with part year residency, filling out the State form manually should be easy. Bottom line, even if I did change my mind and use TurboTax again, I wouldn't pay for the State return.

title: I hope they pay dearly for this dirty trick. Thank you New York Times for the ...
content: I have some stock sales for 2014 so deluxe will not work since its been crippled. I hope they pay dearly for this dirty trick. Thank you New York Times for the expose.

title: Scammed by TurboTax
content: I just happened to see, online what TurboTax did to the Deluxe version this year. In order for me to complete my return with a lousy Schedule E I would have to upgrade/buy the Premier version---after all these years. H&R Block is offering a free download with your state for free. I sent back the TurboTax disc today for a refund and emailed H&R Block to get their tax program. Goodbye, TurboTax. I hate being scammed. The link to the article with info on how to get the H&R Block download as well as a link to the TurboTax refund info is at: [...]

title: Bob, you made the big time. Forbes TurboTax article
content: Have fun now Bob....the word is out. http://www.msn.com/en-us/money/personalfinance/irate-turbotax-users-can-get-free-upgrades-or-block-substitute/ar-AA7Y2U9

title: Vote with your wallet
content: Intuit just lost another long time customer of TurboTax (due to the dropping of support for Schedule D). I switched to H&R Block. Goodbye Intuit.

title: Intuit has crapped the bed
content: Intuit should have not named this years product "DELUXE". It does not perform the same functions as in the past and as a result mass confusion ensues. Intuit should be honest with their customers and just raise the price but keep original functionality, rather than doing the bait and switch to get everyone to find out they now need "PREMIER" at a higher price point. It has been my tax software forever but i don't appreciate being yanked around to pay more. H+R Block should have record software sales this year due to Intuit officially crapping the bed on it's loyal customer base. I will happily use H+R block to process my taxes for less money. It's not like TurboTax makes my filing process fun.

title: Not as good.
content: Unable to submit state tax until we contacted turbo-tax via phone. Could not bring up credit card forms on line. It seems every time we were asked to spend more money we had to bring the screen down to access "continue ". Some info from last years didn't carry over.

title: Ta-Ta TT!!

title: I have used Turbo Tax Deluxe since 1984. I ...
content: I have used Turbo Tax Deluxe since 1984. I stayed with Intuit even when I got burned with their Quicken for Mac. With this exploitation I am gone.

title: Price increase and less features? Switched the h&r block ...
content: Price increase and less features? Switched the h&r block which was cheaper and had more features ..... not looking back and you shouldn't either

title: Extremeely Dissapointed
content: Extremely disappointed that Intuit took investment related code out of the product and moved it to a higher cost product. And even wioth the publics outcry over this, all they are doing is giving a rebate that doesn't cover the full cost of the upgrade required to get that functionality. And get this --- they will not return that functionality to Premium next year, it will be part of the higher priced product. I have used TurboTax since 2001, but this is the last year. Beginning next year I will be going to a competitor --- one that doesn't require a 50% increase in consumer cost to get the same functionality as the year before.

title: I'd rather switch than fight. Price deception caused me ...
content: I'd rather switch than fight. Price deception caused me to switch to HR Block after using Turbotax for a long, long time

title: Intuit disses loyal customers
content: I have not bouoght Turbo Tax 2013 yet. I have been reading the posted reviews and can not figure out which package I am going to need this year. I have multiple requirements that change each year. I have been using Turbo Tax Deluxe for many years and have been able to file online both Fed and State. What really bothers me the most is that the product discriptions don't give a clue that they are so crippled that they are unusable. Bad move Intluit! I have been a loyal customer for over 20 years and feel like I have been dumped.

title: Bye Bye Turbo Tax. It doesn't take whole lot to bring the company down. Please collect your last bonus
content: Time to go to HR Block or TaxCut

title: Bad Intuition
content: First, it was a bait and switch not to have the complete program as previous years in this Deluxe edition, and secondly, I am not about to send my social security number for a $25.00 rebate to what could possibly be a scam site. That is just simply not worth the associated risk. So, Intuit wins again.

title: Turbo Greedy Corporate Mistake -
content: I am long-time Turbo-Tax user and very upset SOMEONE in corporate thought it was a good idea to deceptively remove integral parts of the software WITHOUT telling purchasers and then REQUIRING an update with an EXTRA FEE (corporate robbery). Oh yea, then they send an email LATER that says they will "REFUND" if you had to upgrade but only refund part leaving you with an extra charge still. I assume many will consider dumping Turbo for a competitor based on this very, very, very, poor corporate decision (pure greed).

title: What a Complete Disaster!
content: I have used TurboTax Deluxe for eleven years without complaint and with full satisfaction. NO MORE! Intuit found a way to take a winner and turn it into a platinum loser with the 2014 version! First, they cheapened the Software by eliminating specific forms and guidance tools. You don't find out that the Deluxe Version is inadequate for your needs (eg., lack of K-1 and Schedule D Forms, etc ) until you're midway through Tax Preparation; suddenly you are advised that you are required to upgrade to the Premiere Version and must pay and additional $30. Oh yes, Intuit came clean AFTER THE FACT and offered some rebates. Intuit also made it possible for Deluxe Buyers to get a free upgrade to Premiere. That process added insult to injury. You must call them while in the middle of your Tax Preparation(and go through an Easter Egg Hunt to find the correct phone number); then when you get to the warning page(stating upgrade required) you need to wait on hold for a lengthy amount of time(because there are so many confused and irritated customers on hold) and then when a service representative responds, you are asked for your product serial number. This info is buried in the "warning" page links and none of the service reps seem to know this. If you don't have the serial number, they won't authorize the upgrade or send you the required link. After being put on hold for ten more minutes, I terminated the call, fished through the page links, and found my product serial number. I then had to call again, stay on hold almost forever and repeat my entire issue to another apologetic Rep, to get the elusive, required upgrade link. So for 2014, if you want to take the road to hell, you must first make a stop at TurboTax Deluxe!

title: Customers Beware! Management has become idiots!
content: I've been a Turbotax user since the beginning of time. Earlier this year I stopped using Quicken. Upgrades were not useful and they stopped, effectively, my use of the product. I said good bye and haven't missed it. Now, Schedule D is not supported! This is beyond stupid. Is it a board level decision to go for short-term profits for financial gain at the expense of customers, or brain-dead management looking for bigger bonuses. Doesn't matter since they won't see a penny from me for the first time in a very, very long time.

title: Leaving Turbo Tax.
content: Thanks Amazon shoppers and review writers. After researching and reading many of the reviews I too will leave Turbo Tax after 10+ years.

title: After buying their products for over 10 years, I ...
content: After buying their products for over 10 years, I really, really feel cheated. This morning, I read in the NYTimes about not being able to do investments on Deluxe. Since I had already purchased the product (I also purchased Business for trust returns that I do) I tested it and realize that I could have been doing taxes on April 14 and realized at that time I had to spend $30 more to file. From "Intuit Operating Values" - Intuit was founded in 1983, committed to integrity, to our customers and to our employees. That commitment remains as strong today as it did then. Bull.

title: A big downgrade from last year or a $30 price increase if you buy the Premium version
content: I'd give 0 stars if I could. Deluxe does not include schedule D. I confirmed with my brokerage firm that I'd need to buy the Premium version to include my few stock trades. Instead, I purchased H&R block's deluxe version for $35 less than TurboTax Premium. TurboTax had a good product. I just can't understand what they were thinking. Based on all of the one star reviews I suspect they are either losing a lot of customers or have a bunch of really angry customers who bought what they did last year without realizing the change.

title: Regular people do, in fact, need schedule C/D from time to time.
content: I've been using TurboTax the last few years, ever since it informed me that I could deduct part of my vehicle registration tax on schedule A as a personal property tax. I had been using H&R Block for years before that, but it never called it out that deduction and I hadn't been getting it. So I switched. Unfortunately, this year TurboTax lost me with its ridiculous, anti-customer decision to move Schedule C/D functionality out of Deluxe and only to Premier. Now, if you really did a lot with small business income or stock trading, you always wanted premier for the additional guidance. But if you had a tiny reason to use those schedules, it was really important they be in Deluxe and not cost an arm and a leg more. Let me give you an examples. Lots of people say, "Well, you don't run a business so why would you need that (Schedule C)?" One year I had a single small job I did that someone gave me a 1099 for (otherwise I'm just a regular employee getting W2s). TurboTax Deluxe filled in a couple blanks on schedule C and filed it. Should I really I have to pay an extra $25 bucks to handle one 1099? Here's another example. This year I bought a single stock in my IRA. Or so I thought. Unfortunately, I had selected the wrong account (I have a regular investment account and an IRA at the same company, and the accounts are together in the same dropdown box). I didn't have money for the purchase in the regular account I accidentally bought it in. I had to immediately sell. So for this year I had 1 (one) stock purchase/sale for all of 2014. It is one line on the schedule D. But Quicken wants me to pay another $25 bucks for Premier for the privilege of handling one lousy line? Regular people do sometimes need a minimum amount of schedule C/D support. You don't have to be a stockbroker or a business owner. And the explanation that "we need to make our product consistent across mobile/web/PC devices, and mobile and web don't have this functionality" doesn't really carry water. That's just weasel words. If you need consistency, then add schedule C/D INTO the web/mobile versions. You didn't have to take it OUT of the PC version. This year, I returned to H&R Block to give them another shot. Their Deluxe program is cheaper than Intuit's, AND it still has schedule C/D. Intuit, start treating your loyal customers better!

title: I just don't even want to deal with the prospect of buying the product I was comfortable with to discover it won't do what I nee
content: I've used TurboTax since the mid-90's, purchasing the Deluxe version every year. Based on Intuit's actions changing the Deluxe product, the Amazon customer reviews posted here, and the feeble attempts at spin posted to this forum by the Intuit VP, Bob Meighan, I'm taking my business to H&R Block. Sorry Bob, I just don't even want to deal with the prospect of buying the product I was comfortable with to discover it won't do what I need - - so put that on your color chart and be well.

title: Shame on you!!
content: Shame on you Intuit!! Greed cost you another long time, formerly loyal customer - I purchased H&R Block software this year.

title: Don't buy you have been warned
content: With all the reviews telling me that the schedules almost don't exist this year I will just say this: thanks, but no thanks.

title: The last straw
content: Already miffed by Intuit's sunset policies on their Quicken products, the discontinuation of support for Schedules C, D and E has put me over the edge. I had been a repeat customer for TurboTax for 23 years but I will never buy another Inuit product again. When you calculated that only 2-4 % of your customers would be impacted by this change did you not realize that we were the ones not gullible enough to move to Premier or Home and Office in the first place? Ok, so you decided to force our hand. So be it. Bye.

title: Seems to be the popular thing to do!
content: Jumping on the band wagon!

title: Very disappointed!
content: Very disappointed. I always file under extension so I bought Turbo Tax 2014 Deluxe in July. I used Deluxe 2013 for last year and none of my circumstances have changed materially. Well, running 2014 Deluxe I discovered that I was solicited to pay $30 in order to upgrade to Premiere, because Deluxe no longer supports entering S corp K-1 schedule info for Schedule E. Yet I read in various posts here that Intuit had acknowledged their "mistake" and provided free upgrades for Deluxe customers in my situation. Well it turns out the free upgrade was only if you filed your return by April 30, 2015. The irony is TT reps have stated here that they will have this "fixed" for 2015 returns, which means that for some reason the only customers "burned" by this are those who bought their TT Deluxe in good faith in order to file their 2014 returns on extension. WHY should WE be penalized?! I paid the $30 begrudgingly, because I had done most of the work and wasn't included to start all over with H&R Block software. As far as I am concerned if a tax software is going to drop a major component of what they cover, it's obligated to make this clear in its marketing both in online descriptions and on the box itself. Nowhere does it indicate that Sch K-1 coverage has been dropped. The software seems to work fine, as it did last year. But this kind of "bait and switch" marketing, just to drain more money out of customers.... this just isn't do right by regular customers.

title: Stupid move
content: Why, oh why, would these people think that changing the Deluxe version like they did was a good idea? What boneheads !!

title: No more Turbo Tax for me!
content: Have used Turbo Tax since 2003 and made switch to H&R Block as a result of Intuit's disregard for basic customer requirements. Was a bit unsure of what to expect since I always thought that TurboTax had clear differentiation of capabilities versus other tax software (I was wrong...). H&R Block picked up prior year's returns just like TT and has all features that I need. No issues w/ capabilities or usability.

title: FAIL
content: FAIL_FAIL-FAIL! I am(now was) a loyal INTUIT TurboTax Deluxe user until today. I happily use turbotax to file my taxes, but use schedule 1099e some years. Well, this feature is no longer in TurboTax Deluxe! It is only in Premiere or Home/Business Edition. TurboTax software says I have to upgrade to either software to file my return. Ok, so I pressed the update button, and it says I am eligible for a FREE upgrade to Premiere since so many people complained about it's form 1099 exclusion. Press "upgrade", NOTHING, it says I have to call INTUIT to get a upgrade code. OK, I call and their busy lines, and says they will call back due to excessive wait times. OK, they call back about 2 hours later while I am at work and try to provide me an upgrade code. It cannot work since my software is installed at home, not in my work computer-at work. (Most people do have jobs and cannot wait on hold for hours) I have to wait until I get home, then call from my home phone and wait for a few hours while turbotax is up and running (on my home computer) to provide me a serial-code number, and they provide a counter serial-code number to input... just to allow the upgrade. Blah... I will NO LONGER purchase INTUIT TurboTax from now on, due to my lack of confidence in this recent exclusion of the prior standard 1099 forms/schedules, and piss poor upgrade procedure. Version patches work fine, but the online upgrades DO NOT! I am moving on to H&R Block Tax Software Deluxe + State from now on.

title: VERY DISAPPOINTED!! >
content: I agree with so many other reviews. I, too, was forced to upgrade to the $45 version and still have spent HOURS trying to figure out how to carry my loss forward in the return. I would have been able to use the regular version and just do the schedule since we do not own a business any longer, but NOOOO.... I think I could've handled the cost if TT would have pulled in the information automatically into the correct place from 2013, but it doesn't at all. VERY DISAPPOINTED!! >:-{

title: Unabashed greed
content: Rather than enticing customers to upgrade to Premier by making it better, TurboTax has instead decided to eliminate essential features from its Deluxe suite. That's simply unabashed greed and a big middle finger to customers. Luckily, consumers have options. As a (former) longtime TurboTax customer, I am switching to a competitor who WILL allow me to electronically file a Schedule D (hello H&R Block!) Perhaps others should consider doing the same.

title: This product misleads the average customer using Turbo Taxs Deluxe in the past.
content: I was extremley dissappointed in the product and intuit this year. You have continually raised the price and disturbingly changed the forms within the program without clearly letting your loyal customers know. Your program continues to load slowly taking up valuable time. H&R Block's program appears to be as good, less expensive and faster. The course of action you have finally taken is good but comes too late. I believe I am only one of many customers who will be taking my business elsewhere next year.

title: Bait and Switch Alert! Don't Buy Turbo Tax! Slimy tactics!
content: I am a 20+ year customer and I don't like their tactics one bit. I would like to thank everyone that explained how Turbo Tax Deluxe has REDUCED FUNCTIONALITY. I love Amazon.Com for things like this... I would have fallen into Intuit's trap without Amazon's rating system. Looks like I'm going to learn a different software this year!

title: I'm making the switch after 15 yrs of TurboTax
content: I've used TurboTax since my first copy on my 486DX2-66 PC.. I've never even considered anything else.. However with the price I've decided it's time to see what my options are. Folks, you can use TaxACT online and e-file state and federal for $20 TOTAL!!! AND AND AND - you don't pay until you file!! And from what I see you can do a lot for free...

title: I do like the interface to Turbo Tax better but done with ...
content: Switched to HR Block. I do like the interface to Turbo Tax better but done with TT for the change they made.

title: One Star
content: Unbelievable bush league move by Intuit to require Premier for even one trade. Hello to H&R next year.

title: Good bye Turbo Tax
content: After 24 years of purchasing and using Turbo Tax Deluxe, Premium and all the add-ons, I AM DUMPING INTUIT!! Yay!! This year, I waited until the last minute after seeing the news reports and reading up on all the flaws, security breaches, and fraud. IRS blames T-Tax and Intuit blames IRS.. nobody is held accountable. So, I was still hopeful when an email offer from Intuit arrived in my email inbox. About $90 for the Premium edition (business expense) but I didn't have my sign-in password. Typed in the email on file with Intuit and got a support & reset email. Clicked the reset email option and they display a security question I'd never seen (I keep all PW acct records written down). Get bounced out and have to call the help line. After 10 minutes with a robot, I finally got a human. An illiterate human with an apparent hearing problem compounded by multiple cognitive delay issues -- I'm not even kidding. Lady tells me my email isn't on file, please provide another. Then, provide an alternate email that 'we have here on record'... done. 'Here it is'... She asked me what I wanted NO LESS THAN 4 TIMES.. Again, all I wanted to do is BUY TURBOTAX. No input detected. "Sir, can I help you with a turbotax issue?" After this, I sloooooowly explained what I wanted to do. "Sir, we need an email address and your social security number." Done. "We don't have your email address from last year Sir." Me: Yes you do, I received a confirmation message from Intuit 20 minutes ago for a password reset. After a few more back and forths, I asked for a supervisor. "Sir, they're all really busy." Me: I can wait, thank you. Thirty minutes later, no help. Good bye Turbo Tax. I hope the invisible hand of Mr. Market pulls all the cash out of your pocket and hands it over to a company that actually wants to make money. Do you like pain? Just try to buy it. Run, don't walk, to the other competitor of your choice. After 24 years ... that's all she wrote baby. It was good knowing you.

title: This is a negative review of Turbo Tax 2014
content: I only give 1 star as I am not able to give none. Likely my last use of any Turbo Tax product. I receive a K-1 every year that has either little or no income or a slight loss but now TT wants me to pay much more than it is worth to add that to my 1040. Thank you Amazon for at least providing your Prime customers with a discount on this product. You are customer friendly.

title: Intuit lost me as a customer for good. H&R Block was cheaper and just as easy ...
content: After ten years, Intuit lost me as a customer for good. H&R Block was cheaper and just as easy to use.

title: Changes coming
content: Intuit blew it and they know it. Here is an email I just received explaining how they are going to rectify the situation. So hang in there, it will get better. Dear xxxxxx, We recently tried to explain the changes made to our TurboTax desktop software and apologized for the impact it had on you. Many responded and let us know our apology and rationale were not acceptable. You want the TurboTax desktop product (CD or download) you've used in the past to do what it has always doneâhandle your tax situation. We heard you. It's time we make it right. Beginning February 7, 2015, you can buy the same product you'd normally buy, and if you need to upgrade for your tax situation, we'll help you do that at no additional cost. This means you'll get all the forms you need, including Schedules C, D E, and F, without paying anything extra. If you're a returning TurboTax Deluxe CD or download customer and you've already filed using TurboTax Premier or TurboTax Home & Business, we're offering you $25 cash back. Simply visit TurboTax.com/25back to claim your money. Next, we are committed to bringing back the product you know and love. By the time you are ready to prepare and file your taxes next year, the TurboTax desktop product you trusted in the past will include the forms you've counted on for years. I understand our actions have caused anger and frustration, and our response has been far too slow. TurboTax is committed to regaining your trust and providing you with the level of excellence you have come to expect. Thank you for your feedback and continued loyalty, Sasan Goodarzi and the TurboTax Team General Manager, Intuit TurboTax

title: I too am disappointed with the loss of the schedule C
content: I too am disappointed with the loss of the schedule C. This may be the last year I purchase TurboTax.

title: I have grown to hate Intuit Quicken
content: H&R Block for me next year. Updates won't install properly. Must manually download updates and apply. State tax updates requires a phone call to support to obtain. Given all the issues with functionality being excluded for a more costly version. I'm done with Turbo Tax. H&R sent me a licensed version for free. As they are attempting to gain market share from all the unhappy TurboTax users. H&R obtained an additional $250.00 more than TT. H&R also imported the TT 2013 return! I have grown to hate Intuit Quicken, Quickbooks and now Turbo Tax more each passing year. Do yourself a favor and choose something else.

title: Bring Back Schedule D!
content: I am extremely disappointed by Intuit's decision to drop Schedule D support in Deluxe. The purported "consistency" benefits do not make sense to me. Why can't the mobile/desktop products be made consistent by supporting Schedule D in the mobile version rather than removing support in the desktop version??? The unstated implication is that Intuit wants everyone to pay for the more expensive version.

title: Why Intuit has stubbed their toe big time on the removed functionality and what to do about it
content: Mr. Meighan, It should be apparent from all the negative reviews here that the "downgrades" to the Deluxe version have greatly alienated a lot of very loyal customers. The mere fact that you've had to write an open letter and respond to so many reviews should tell you something. When I started using TT in the late 90's, there weren't a lot of other choices but I was happy with your product and remained a customer since that time. I'm also a dedicated Quicken users and like the fact the two programs can "talk" to one another. FWIW, I also taught college in Fredericksburg, Va. and had dozens of your employees come through my classes and hopefully provided them with some additional business management skills to benefit Intuit. All this is background to let you know they don't come any more committed then me, even though I'm usually angry when I'm forced to upgrade my Quicken periodically but I always bite the bullet and do so. Now I'm ready to start the initial work on my 2014 taxes, come to Amazon to download TT and as always, research what others have experienced. Now I'm hearing things like "reduced functionality" or "hey, you can still mail it in with those schedules". Well, who mails their tax returns when they are using software to prepare them? Plus, I wish to file online to take advantage of the Amazon 10% gift card bonus, something I don't believe I can do if filing my mail. Just my own opinion, but when almost half the early adopters of the 2014 software are slamming it for these changes, it is perhaps time to look inward and consider that perhaps Intuit has made a huge error and take steps to correct it. Perhaps you need, as a corporation, to bit the bullet and pull Deluxe from the market and offer the Premier edition for the remainder of the tax season at the same price as Deluxe. Will it hurt profits? Sure. Will it build customer goodwill - you betcha! Will it insure returning customers keep returning and keep referring others - Absolutely! If you continue down this road of answering negative reviews with what is basically a "you can make it work - sort of", you are going to maximize short term profits at the expense of long term customer retention. If I taught your employees anything, I hope it was that a customer is the most valuable commodity a company has and don't ever, ever loose them over foolish, and preventable, reasons. It costs WAY more to get them back then it does to keep them. Thank you. Update 03/18/15: Fairness works in both directions and so I must acknowledge that Intuit finally recognized the error of their ways and corrected the problem. Better late than never certainly applies here and it looks like they've already committed to next years product returning to the old one we all knew and loved. No doubt from the reviews here that Intuit did a great deal of corporate PR damage. Much of it is, unfortunately, permanent and those customers will never return, especially since they have since purchased a competitive product, been happy with it and will now be able to easily export this years data into next years return.

title: Appalling!
content: I have been a loyal customer of Turbo Tax for 15 years. I am appalled to hear that Intuit has discontinued many basic forms from their Deluxe version. I don't even think it will affect my filing, but I will not continue to use a product that would do that to it's loyal customers. I will be buying H&R Block software this year.

title: Says it includes state filling however they charge 20$ to ...
content: Says it includes state filling however they charge 20$ to file state. This is a ripoff. I want my 20$ back!

title: now if we want to change to higher priced software for which we thought we were getting to start with is a very bad business mov
content: I have used Turbo Tax for years and now you change what is include on this software and did not make buyers aware of the change, now if we want to change to higher priced software for which we thought we were getting to start with is a very bad business move. I will not upgrade, nor will I ever buy Turbo Tax again. Barbara Alford- 33917 Silver Pine Drive, Leesburg, Florida 34788

title: Moving on
content: Another long time TurboTax Deluxe user moving on because of the removal of basic forms.

title: How to Show Long-Time Customers That You Appreciate Their Loyalty. Not!
content: I have been using Turbo Tax Deluxe since 1997 and have always recommended it for friends and family. This year they have taken away most of the functionality and have lost a long time, loyal customer. I would have to pay almost double to file the same type of return I have done for the last few years. I have read some of the press releases by Intuit and have lost all respect for this company and their way of doing business.

title: after almost 20 years as a user good bye! Hello H&R
content: Thanks for reviews.....after almost 20 years as a user good bye! Hello H&R!

title: Bye bye Turbo
content: I've been a long time TT user, but greed has taken over. There's better / cheaper options that offer more.

title: Ripoff
content: What a ripoff. After many years of using both Turbo Tax and Quicken, I can not believe Intuit would be capable of a gimmick like this. Taking out what was available for years, and than trying to charge quite a bit more only to get what was included before. What even makes it worse, is that if you are a loyal user, you buy the product without reading the fine print, only to find out after you start your taxes. Next year will be H & R.

title: This version is worthless.
content: I have used TurboTax Deluxe for over 12 years and suddenly this year I buy the same version and it won't do schedule D any longer. If they wanted a water downed version they should have made it under a different version. Now I have to figure out how to return it and look at other options. Any version of TurboTax is now at the bottom of my list!!

title: like in years past
content: I bought Deluxe thinking, like in years past, that this software package would work for me since I run a small business from home. But guess what? I get to the section where I'm ready to enter my business deductions and I'm forced to upgrade to Home & Business for $40. So guess what, Intuit? Next year I'll either be using TaxAct or H&R Block. You have lost my business.

title: One Star
content: I have always used TT for oing my taxes...Not any longer since they are charging more for schedule D

title: ... to extend our return this year and was so disappointed to find I have to spend $40 to upgrade ...
content: Had to extend our return this year and was so disappointed to find I have to spend $40 to upgrade from this version that I have used for YEARS for my home and business. I have very small Schedule C forms that are just not worth adding this kind of expense to file. I see I missed out on the rebate to placate customers - why would it expire before returns are even due? Well, I'm stuck now but I'll be looking for an alternative next year. This long term customer will be moving on next season.

title: Irritated with Electronic Transfer Fees
content: I've been using Turbo Tax for 6 years and this year I was very upset to find that they charged me over $50 to transfer my taxes electronically. This was never a fee in prior years. I have always saved money by using Turbo Tax, until this year! By the time I paid $50 for the software, $30 to file my state taxes, and then $50 for electronic transfer fees, it would have been cheaper to have them done somewhere; if not less work.

title: How nice of Intuit to eliminate schedule C and D etc ...
content: How nice of Intuit to eliminate schedule C and D etc from the delux version. Fortunately I read about this rip-off on Yahoo finance. I feel bad for people who will discover this in late Feb when they get their brokerage reports and find out Turbo Tax delux will no longer handle these forms, but for a mere 30 dollars they can get the upgrade. Me, I,m returning Turbo tax tomorrow and going with H&R Block. Bob, I think the reviews here pretty much say it all.

title: What a horrible product. I've used TT for years and half ...
content: What a horrible product. I've used TT for years and half way doing my taxes I realize the TT Deluxe I've been used to is now changed and I have to get the Premier or higher. Crooks to hide it this way and charge more. Why not just have the same features in TT Deluxe and charge more up front?? I will never use TT anymore.

title: but it still is terrible. I had trouble downloading and was connected to ...
content: They've moved their customer service back onshore, but it still is terrible. I had trouble downloading and was connected to a service rep who put me on hold six times. I couldn't get transferred to another rep. In the end she hung up on me. The rep I had when I called back was much better, but turbo tax is just difficult. This is the last year I will use it. I'm switching to Tax Cut.

title: Clearly gone downhill from previous years.
content: Clearly not as good as previous years, medical entries are too convoluted. State download is useless because it does not have a category for taxes prepaid to my state. I will not buy Turbo Tax again.

title: Stop buying TurboTax
content: This is the worst corporate greed. Time to stop buying TurboTax!!!!!!!!!!

title: Stinks!! ~ I needed to download the upgrade ...
content: Stinks!!~ I needed to download the upgrade, got charged $43.44 and now it appears I will not even get the $25 promised...there is something wrong with a company that changes their product knowing full well it will have a negative impact on returning customers. I will look for another provider next year....this is at least my 10th year using this product.

title: Fortunately, there are several well-reviewed alternatives in the marketplace
content: It seems to me this product is a public relations disaster - I would council anyone considering a TurboTax product to head for the nearest exit as quickly as possible. There are several other quite functional products on the market, but none of them are provided by an organization that, in my opinion, is so untrustworthy that they would cavalierly kick their loyal customers in the teeth by severely reducing the functional support that their product provides, and then not even have the courtesy to let them know about it. I have been a loyal user of TurboTax since their very earliest beginnings. For me (I own some mutual funds, stocks and a rental property), the reductions in product functionality for the Deluxe version amount to a 50% reduction in capability when it comes to helping me deal with the complexity of the tax code and the resulting amount of time it consumes (isn't that the whole point of the product?). Now, I would have to step up to the Premier edition, at a 50% increase in price, just to retain the functionality that TurboTax has been providing over the years. A loyal customer since 1991 - - that was me. I don't know about you, but when someone treats a loyal customer with such disregard, the real question is "where is the nearest exit? I'm out of here!". Fortunately, there are several well-reviewed alternatives in the marketplace, and they all provide the ability to import your TurboTax data from last year's return without a hitch. It's an easy decision, don't you think? Hey, TurboTax, I'd like you to leave my home now. Oh, and please don't let the door hit you in the butt on the way out.

title: One Star
content: Removing everything but the basics from the "Deluxe" edition. Absurd.

title: If I could rate this on a negative scale, I'd choose minus 5 stars!
content: I only give this a one star rating because you can't submit a zero star rating. If I could rate this on a negative scale, I'd choose minus 5 stars! Greedy Intuit has done it again by removing Schedule C, which self-employed people use, along with Schedules D, and E. Also, you no longer get a free state with this "Deluxe" version! For that matter, with the "Premier" version, you will not get one lousy free state download and there are *still* a few missing schedules as noted in the above. To add insult to injury, even the plain old sounding and most expensive Home and Business 2014 doesn't include a free state download. Intuit must think these state forms are liquid gold, but in reality they are simple, short forms you could easily do by hand if you wanted to! I'm DONE with TurboTax! Here's your opportunity H&R Block and TaxAct to move right on in! From this point onward I wouldn't even buy a copy of TurboTax on the black market or download a copy from a rogue site or snag a copy on a CD from a paying customer! It's a matter of principle! This was a sneaky bait and switch tactic . . . Intuit's apology having something to do with "reducing customer confusion" and not doing enough to "communicate the change" falls on deaf ears and insults my intelligence (yeah, you're sorry you didn't do enough to let us know you were cheating us and misrepresented your products with the same names with fewer features!) Hasta la vista Intuit!

title: "Deductions" Do Not Mean Deductions
content: For TurboTax Deluxe 2014, Intuit subtracted features that you've used for years. If you need to do deductions for a schedule c,d, etc, this product will require an in-software upgrade, meaning that you will have to fork over an additional $40. Because of the backlash from customers, Intuit announced a free upgrade for 2013 CD users who downloaded the 2014 software this year. The upgrade was reported by the company to happen within the automatic updates for the software. This is not the case. You must call Intuit support and give them a serial number (when you are prompted for a paying upgrade, click the button, then select, at the bottom of the next box, the option of having trouble/need help. You will be given a serial number and a phone number to call). I'm now on hold with Intuit, which I've been told can take an hour or more. I'm now at minute 8. And there is no guarantee of receiving the upgrade, as it's dependent on the discretion of the representative. After 19 years as a TurboTax customer, I feel I have to switch tax prep software on principle. Update: after 15 minutes on hold, my call was directed to a random voice mail and I was disconnected.

title: What a Bunch of Bone Heads!
content: Bad form Intuit! After many, many years as a loyal TurboTax Man, AND after having marketed it hard to friends and family, I regretfully have just purchased H&R Block Deluxe software (holding my nose) because I have a small business that requires a schedule C. What a bunch of bone heads Intuit! Why in the world would I purchase an $80 product when I can get the same basic function from H&R for $32. Are you nuts people?

title: Why do something this wrong with a solid product?
content: Reducing functionality, preventing e-filing and cranking up the price seems to have had the desired affect. I won't be using TT for the first time in 6 years due to this short sighted, convoluted attempt to deceive customers. There are alternatives and its time to give them a try.

title: I expected more from Turbo Tax
content: Due to the exclusion of schedules C and D from the deluxe version this year, I will not purchase Turbo Tax in the future. These (significant, to me) changes were a flagrant money grab. Downgrading the product while maintaining the same version name and price was shady. My refund is in the works, but how many people won't know to call?

title: Free H&R Block for Prior TurboTax users
content: H&R Block will send you a download of their software for free if you can show proof of purchase of the TurboTax product. I've never used it, but I am reading where there are no issues importing data from the prior years TurboTax return. Just an FYI.

title: Never using TurboTax again!
content: Overpriced and comes with hidden charges, it does not make it clearly known that there would be a $19.99 charge to e-file a state return! You're better off using other tax preparation software! Stay away!!!

title: Important issues
content: 1) Intuit is beginning a HUGE price increase in its tax software. Intuit's very limited apologies are only for doing the price increase in a sneaky manner. 2) Intuit has a long history of taking advantage of customers to make more profit. It's difficult to change to a new kind of software; that difficulty provides many avenues of abuse. (My opinions, based on many years of doing technology support.) 3) The U.S. government has a corrupt tax system. The tax system in the U.S. is so complex that even CPAs and Tax professionals easily say they don't fully understand it. If you love the U.S. like I do, I think you will agree we need to make taxes less complex. The present system is arranged to make money for lawyers and tax accountants. 4) The U.S. government must provide tax software, either online or downloadable. At present, the necessity to buy tax software is like a tax on tax returns, but the money goes to a huge corporation for private profit. If the U.S. government supplies tax software, the government would then be responsible for any errors or omissions in the software. Any tax law would not be considered complete until the government's software implements the law.

title: Deluxe a disaster product for the first time! Company ...
content: Deluxe a disaster product for the first time! Company reduced its capabilities without disclosing the changes made to buyers. Only when a free upgrade to the Premier version was granted did I decide to stay with Turbo Tax.

title: For the past 20+ years I have used the Deluxe ...
content: For the past 20+ years I have used the Deluxe version of TurboTax to prepare and file all the forms I that I needed to file. This year, to electronically file the same set of forms as I did last year, I would have to purchase the Home & Business version ... at nearly twice the price as the Deluxe version. You have lost a multi-decade customer.

title: It is a pity how greedy management can destroy a good product.
content: I have been using Turbotax since 1986 and was about to purchase the 2014 version but, after reading the reviews how Intuit has degraded it, I know it is time for me to try H&R Block. It is a pity how greedy management can destroy a good product.

title: I have used TT for many years. But this ...
content: I have used TT for many years. But this is the final straw! I have been looking at H&R Block and Tax Act the last couple of years and they (TurboTax) made my decision for me, when I read all the negative reviews. Typical big Corporation looking at ways to make more profits at the customers expense. I will be using another product this year.

title: Pretty sure they calculated that with the customers they lost ...
content: I have been a TurboTax user for almost 20 years. And I enthusiastically suggest people to use TurboTax over and again. But based on all the review for 2014, I am going to STOP using TurboTax - because I think TT made a strategic product decision to change their 'product structure' for more profit. Pretty sure they calculated that with the customers they lost they will make them up more than they lost with the 'upgrades'. I think it take some deliberate effort and contemplation to lose a 'bunch of' 15-20 year customers. And switching software is tricky.
