If I found other software that can do the same job just as good, and cost effective, I am not going to bother to look at TT in 2015, 6, 7... to see 'if they have reverted' and switch back. It is so hard to win a customer, and even harder to keep them, but so easy to lose one. Someone in TT lost his/her head(s) in the decision, and will lost their heads again when they were shown out the door. And on their resume : head of TT 2014 upgrade. And they are definitely A-head.

title: Missing Required Forms Schedule W
content: After reading the reviews here I am going to have to go with HR Block this year. I have used Turbo for the past few years. Last year after filing State tax I received a letter from the state informing me I owed them $5k. Upon calling the state I discovered I was required to submit a Schedule W. I thought maybe I had missed a step in TT. No Schedule W let alone a message stating I even needed one. I tried contacting Intuit and was told I would have to pay for cust servWhile I guess I am partially to blame for my ignorance on the required tax forms to submit. I trusted the software implictily. Intuit also wants the user to pay an additional $20 to file e-file when the user can print the forms and for less than $1.00 support USPS. ice, or submit a question and hope it is answered. I ended up manually filling out the form and mailing it in. Lesson learned. Intuit suggest you review your business practices and improve on the software.

title: Disgruntled with missing Schedule D
content: We have used TurboTax for nearly 20 years and have encouraged our four kids to do likewise. No More. I have to agree with many here, that the exclusion of Schedule D is unacceptable, and the solution of doing it manually laughable. If I wanted to do it manually, there would be no need to purchase your product. Guess its time our family started reviewing some competing products.

title: bye bye turbotax
content: without a complete set of forms available to efile, there is nothing left in turbotax for me to buy. i may miss trying to workaround its inflexible interface to get to the right result for complicated tax situations, but i am sure another product will provide the same challenge.

title: I won't support a company that behaves like this
content: Like all the other 1 star reviews, I'm disgusted with the lousy way Intuit is treating their customers. They seem to think their customers are fools who will stupidly continue to overpay for a dumbed-down product. I hope the message comes through loud and clear that they were WRONG in this assessment. Buh-bye, TurboTax.

title: Time to move on to another tax program
content: I have used TurboTax Deluxe for over 15 years. This will be the first year I will NOT be using TurboTax. It is shameful for them to change/cripple this once great product in order to force users to upgrade to their Premier version so they can make a few more bucks. I hope the geniuses at Intuit who thought this was a good idea don't let the door hit them on the way out when they get their pink slips. If the feedback that is being left on Amazon is any indication, I think this is really going to hurt their bottom line, as it should. I just purchase the H&R Block Deluxe tax program for $22.00 (on sale today at Amazon). It is a bit uncomfortable moving to a different product after all these years, but based on the reviews for H&R Block's software, I think this will be a pretty painless transition. So long TurboTax, good luck with this new marketing scheme of yours!

title: Price. Gouging XD
content: Price gouging ftw

title: but it is not looking like that will be necessary and should I need to ...
content: I thought Intuit would have learned from its previous ill conceived attempts to screw TT customers -- guess not. This year's changes meant that I would have had to jump from Deluxe up 2 steps to the most expensive package more than doubling my cost. I have used TT for almost 2 decades and now I am gone forever -- as they say, TT is dead to me. I bought H&R Block Deluxe and have been working with it for a day and so far it is handling everything about my fairly complex return with ease - txf imports, K-1s, hundreds of stock transactions, 1256 contracts, etc. Of course it it fails me in the next few days I'll have to eat my words and submit to Intuit's jackboot tactics, but it is not looking like that will be necessary and should I need to you may rest assured I will be vigilantly looking for my earliest possible exit from TT. By the way TT almost lost me forever the last time Intuit put their boot to our throats. I used TaxCut that year. It did an acceptable job but was not quite polished enough at that point so I went back to TT. The H&R Block product is much more mature now and I doubt I will see any reason to darken Intuit's doors again. auf Wiedersehen!

title: Been using TT Deluxe since upgraded from a Macintosh PC ...
content: Been using TT Deluxe since upgraded from a Macintosh PC sometime in 80's. Covered what I needed to file including 1065 (K-1)s info. This version with hidden $30 cost requirement ends it for me. H&R Block more honest in pricing and far cheaper.

title: Worst Product Year Ever- Time to change from Turbo Tax
content: This years turbo tax is awful, more error messages than I have ever experienced. Illinois state forms for Part Year resident still is showing"do not file" form not approved. Yet Going to the state site the form is in the final form and ready for filing. Whats up tubo tax to busy counting your cash vs working on the code? Awful!!!!!

title: Thanks to the CEO notifying the IRS that it shouldwatch out for fraud by folks using his product
content: I have been using TurboTax for years. This year right in the middle of doing my return I was up-charged twice. Not only that my return was flagged for fraud. Thanks to the CEO notifying the IRS that it should watch out for fraud by folks using his product, I believe. But, I am done. Back to paper filing, less headaches.

title: Four stars to one point fives star in one year. I hope it was worth it, Intuit...
content: If you want your loyal customers to stay loyal, give them more, not less.

title: Better read the fine print!
content: They didn't bother to mention until after I bought it that the Deluxe version no longer supports Schedule C or Schedule D, and I'd have to upgrade, for another $30, to finish the 1040 I had already spent so much time on. I won't give these people another ten cents, and I'm going with H & R Block from now on.

title: Made the mistake of buying and installing before finding out ...
content: Made the mistake of buying and installing before finding out it's missing previously included functions. Used their software for years, now I will move on to a new company. Their charging the same price as I paid last year for less functionality. Greedy? Make a flat tax and there will be no need for their software or business.

title: No more 1 free state e-file!
content: I bought this as it has always been easy/convenient to do in the past. Now that a free state e-file is no longer included, it is not worth my money. You can print it to mail for free, but that took forever to get the refund last year. I will definitely be going with a different product next year if this is the case.

title: Bait and switch by Intuit = finding a cheaper and better alternative to TurboTax!
content: I've dutifully bought TurboTax Deluxe for more than 15 years and came to Amazon to buy it again, only to see this flood of negative reviews and stories about the bait and switch tactics used by Intuit. Intuit Bob should just stop taking as his slick answers aren't helping. Ultimately, Intuit is a business and needs to maximize revenue - and fewer customers at $90+ a year (and more $ direct to Intuit) maybe makes more sense than a lot at $50 a year through Amazon or Costco. I guess we'll see - either Bob is a genius, or won't have a job for much longer. I hadn't ever considered moving my taxes online, but this made me try out TaxACT and was very pleased with the functionality and use of use. Importing last year's TurboTax file went very smoothly. And the TaxACT Deluxe product, which has more features and includes one state, is $22 ($6 more if you want it on a CD). Thanks Intuit for making me mad enough to switch - it saved me money!

title: I have used Turbo Tax every year since 1992, ...
content: I have used Turbo Tax every year since 1992, but this is it. I have already downloaded the 2014 edition and will use it this year, but Intuit will not get another dime from me even if they change their mind and give the additional parts at no charge.

title: Turbo Tax.. the biggest scam I've ever encountered ...
content: Turbo Tax.. the biggest scam I've ever encountered. Completely lied about "free"filing. Cost me over $100 to e-file using this scam product. They got me once and I will never use this scam product again. I will tell anyone I know NOT to use it. I also know that no one will read this review. I give it no stars.

title: Let me join the chorus of those complaining about TurboTax ...
content: Let me join the chorus of those complaining about TurboTax Deluxe suddenly becoming unable in this year's edition from being able to handle my return. I have been a TurboTax user since the 80's but I am giving up unless TurboTax immediately rectifies the program.

title: poor customer consideration
content: The function is and always has been unparalleled. However, the bait and switch technique used to force the consumer to upgrade to a higher product to reach the same functionality of previous years is unconscionable.

title: It is wrong to down-size a product and justify it through some lame explanation like turbo tax did
content: I have been a firm supporter of turbo tax forever. I am switching to H & R Block software. It is wrong to down-size a product and justify it through some lame explanation like turbo tax did. They won't go out of business, but I hope this bone headed decision costs someone a job and the Company takes a financial hit for this decision.

title: TurboTax Takes a Step Backwards
content: TT is looking to be the number 2 Tax Software they reduced functionality from last year and charge more (maybe when they become #2 they will try harder and return to the functionality of past years) No Schedule C, D ???

title: This is a perfect example of how corporationS just bleed you dry
content: Big Mistake gouging your log time users. Thank you to all the reviewers who gave us consumers the heads up. This is a perfect example of how corporationS just bleed you dry... Good Move... another 10+ year product user over to HR Block...

title: One Star
content: You lost another customer, Read reviews Intuit.

title: Not being able to e-file the return because of a Schedule D or simple Schedule C makes the deluxe version a waste of money
content: I've used for years but the changes in the software for 2014 means it is time to find a different tax software. Not being able to e-file the return because of a Schedule D or simple Schedule C makes the deluxe version a waste of money.

title: One Star
content: Just look at the other reviews. No reason for me to add anything.

title: Too bad I can't give TurboTax zero stars
content: I switched. Too bad I can't give TurboTax zero stars.

title: What's with the state filing fee problems??
content: Figuring out my tax return was easy. The problem was with filing. Intuit wouldn't let me use my credit card to pay for state filing, but they were FINE with charging me more than $50 to take the $19.99 fee out of my federal refund!!! I had to call a sales rep -- which means I sat on the phone for 25 minutes, listening to their insipid encouragement to go to their website. The sales rep was nice, and I was able to complete the filing, but I can't help but wonder if Intuit is snagging the credit card purchases on purpose, in order to charge more for processing from the federal refund.

title: Disappointing Company
content: Intuit has firmly made the decision to lose half of it's customers in one giant swoop this year and boy have they did it in style. The ole bait and switch routine has never been played better- you buy a version of their software that for many years has performed one way and without any warning this year you get shoved into a corner with a gun at your head and told you have to buy a more expensive version. Of course, you aren't told this until after you've finished your tax preparation and attempt to e-file, so they obviously hope you'll be too tired to do anything other than buy the higher priced upgrade. Me, I unloaded the software from my computer, bought the competitors product and will never touch an Intuit product again. I advise all to do the same. Oh and for those who want a review of how the product works- it's a very straightforward easy to use product- just know what you're getting before you shell out your money.

title: Avoid At All Cost
content: I have been using turbo tax deluxe for the last 5 years. This year they descretely deleted several of the features and forced me to upgrade to the premier when I was about 3/4 of the way through the return. Enjoy the $32 its the last $ you will ever get from me.

title: We dove into our taxes and ran into the missing sched D problem like millions of others
content: Really awful trick on loyal customers. My story real quick. I purchased my usual TT Deluxe at Costco with $10 automatic rebate. We dove into our taxes and ran into the missing sched D problem like millions of others. My wife was like "let's just upgrade to premier" but I was really upset. In the midst of my upset I heard about the HR Block free offer if you sent in a copy of your TT receipt - which I did. One day later I got a return e-mail with the download link and activation code. No attempt to scam - just downloaded and activated and it worked. Did my taxes this weekend. Imported last year TT return without problem. Completed my return and filed online - no issues at all. Smart marketing move by HR Block. They must have picked up millions of new customers. And a comment to the Intuit board of directors and share holders: why does "Bob Meighan, VP, TurboTax" still have a job? Serious question.

title: tu4rbo tax does not make their address readilly available for ...
content: tu4rbo tax does not make their address readilly available for complaints. Last year their final advice on their program was" do not file"(I have the print out). Their program never changed and I had to spend money going to others to complete my return. Would ask for a refund for their losey program.

title: Rebate or Upgrade Only Applies to 2013 Customers
content: Like many other reviewers I was upset about the 2014 version of TurboTax Deluxe not including support for schedule D as it has in the past. I had read that Intuit, maker of TurboTax, was going to give returning customers a free upgrade because of all the confusion about the limited capabilities of the Deluxe version. I have used TurboTax for over 20 years. Last year I started a small business and had an accountant prepare both my business and personal taxes so I did not purchase the 2013 version. I purchased the 2014 version to do my mother's taxes but now I find out that the $25 refund or free upgrade for the 2014 version only applies to customers who bought the 2013 version as well. It did not matter that I had been a loyal customer for the 20 plus years prior to 2013. Amazon is complicit in this deception since their bold header for this years version shows "FREE UPGRADE OR CASH BACK FOR RETURNING TURBOTAX DELUXE DESKTOP CUSTOMERS". Shame on you TurboTax and shame on you as well Amazon! TurboTax you have lost a loyal customer.

title: Switched to H&R Block Tax Software
content: After 10+ years of using TurboTax I have switched to H&R Block Tax Software Deluxe + State 2014 Win. It was less than half the price for the same features. I would have had to purchase TurboTax Premium to get the same features as H&R Deluxe.

title: Glad I did
content: Been using Turbo Tax for 20 years. Got lots of bundles over the years. Didn't care it cost more than others. Was about to order Turbo Tax Deluxe and thought to read some reviews. Glad I did. It would not have worked for me. I remember a few years ago Intuit tried to charge extra if you wanted to do more than 1 return. They ended up refunding everyone their money that paid for that and took out that restriction. Looks like Intuit is always looking for a way to gouge their loyal customers. A friend's been using H&R Block Deluxe for many years so I bought it instead while Amazon had it for $21. Intuit, your greed lost you another 20 year loyal customer. Hope it was worth it to you.

title: Be very careful of Intuit going forward.
content: The decision is yours. After passing email with Bob M at TurboTax and reading various reviews I am even more disappointed in Intuit for this move. So far they have various reasons ranging from "We warned you when we advertised features" to "You didn't need it anyway" to "You should not have had those capabilities anyway" to "We'll help you upgrade at no cost just for this year." There has to be a reason that their rating has dropped from 4 stars to 2 stars. The multi-platform and multiple devices explanation does not fly because they are talking about very limited use products for a small number of people. Now, going a step further I must ask the question: "IS INTUIT PLANNING TO DO THE SAME WITH QUICKEN AND QUICKBOOKS" that they have done with TurboTax? What happens when you update Quicken Deluxe only to find it has been gutted and now you have to buy Quicken Home and Business. My solution at least temporarily: I have bought and installed Block's offering which at about $50 does all that TurboTax Home and Business does. I am going to buy and install TurboTax 2014 Deluxe and do the offered free upgrade. Going to run my taxes through both. I have schedules C, D and E - not a simple return. Will post comments on results later.

title: Yet another paying TurboTax customer moving on...
content: The oldest TurboTax file I have handy is from 1999 (I've used TurboTax a lot longer than that), and it appears that 2013 will be my last. I used to use AM-Tax (anyone remember it back in the DOS days?) and when it went away I moved to TurboTax. Remember when you could purchase TT and get an upgrade or Quicken Basic? Remember how Intuit screwed that up? I think I've been using TurboTax mainly because I've become very comfortable with it. Well, with the latest TurboTax I've become uncomfortable and so I just purchased H&R Block Deluxe. It costs less and does more. I'm hoping to get "comfortable" with it and use it for many years...

title: Worst Experience Ever
content: I have been using TurboTax for years. Never had this much negative impact on me until I spoke to the customer service today. As they had promised, I was trying to upgrade to Premier for free yet it did not work (end up paying the regular fees of $30). The customer service person was not even aware of this big announcement Intuit had made and she was trying to making me pay to become a "member" so to speak with Technical Support. Not only this situation being so frustrating, it did not help at all when this person had no idea how to talk to their customers. Rude and very unprofessional. It is hard to believe someone like her is representing this big corporation. I am very disappointed with their service. I will never use their product again.

title: Turbo Tax Has Gone to the Dark Side--Try H&R Block
content: I cannot fathom such a prosperous company making such greedy and misleading blunders for 2014. They deliberately lead people with "Start for Free," and once all the computations are completed, drop the bomb that one must pay much more for services that were previously included in the Deluxe Edition. No more free state filing, so add 39.95. Unbelievable. I hope other more ethical software developers step into the huge space Intuit has just created. Another review suggested H&R Block. It cost less and was up front about fees. With some initial struggling to import my 2013 Turbo Tax files, I completed my taxes without too much sweat or cost. Turbo Tax was my go-to software for years. Never again.

title: Goodbye TurboTax
content: Very disappointed with TurboTax this year. I have used TurboTax for several years and had been a vocal supporter. Between the decreased features and deceptive marketing I will be switching to another service next year. Their customer service was extremely lacking and clearly did not listen to anything I was saying.

title: SwitchtoBlock
content: I have also been hit with what feels like a cheap online scam. I will be switching to H&R Block for free - They seem to care about us more than intuit. You can switch by emailing SwitchToBlock@hrblock.com with your name, address, operating system, and photo proof of purchase.

title: I purchased TT Deluxe version which no longer includes Schedule ...
content: I purchased TT Deluxe version which no longer includes Schedule D. I am required to upgrade to Premier. Who is the harvard mba Cretin who brainstormed the idea that underhanded and slimy business practices will generate customer satisfaction and loyalty. He or she needs to have their bonus clawed back. Here's a quaint notion; If you want to generate more revenue, just raise prices. Give the client less and charge more; There's a viable TT Mission Statement. There is no level of disdain that cannot be achieved when ethics is checked at the door. I contacted TT Customer Service and fortunately they made me whole by providing the Premier upgrade at no additional cost. The Lady I spoke with (Tina) was extremely personable, sympathetic and accommodating. Because of her care and caring, I will remain with TT. My heart goes out to TT's Customer Service Representatives. They are looking right down the gun barrel of the self inflicted mess that their superiors mindlessly created.

title: Fool me once, shame on you. Fool me twice...
content: To file my taxes this year I'll have to fork over an additional $25 over last year simply because I have investments. I forgave you Intuit when you pulled your stunts a few years back, but not this time.

title: One Star
content: Switching to a real accountant due to the price hike.

title: Shame on you Intuit
content: Beware - Deluxe no longer supports filing a Schedule D. $25 cash back is a pain to get since I didn't register my 2013 Turbotax. Shame on you Intuit - you got greedy and botched the recovery too.

title: DO NOT BUY TURBOTAX DELUXE
content: A loyal customer for numerous years, but the disabling of the Schedule D and the requirement to purchase the Premier Edition for $30 plus tax before you can continue with some schedules is a terrible way to treat your customers. Yes, you've said you'll now let people upgrade for free - but those of us that have already been forced to shell out an additional $30 plus tax are stuck with only getting $25 back - you are still keeping $5 plus tax from early purchasers - $5 that you don't deserve. This feels like such a cheat I doubt I will be buying any INTUIT products in the future - no more underhanded surprises for me. It is amazing that a company that had such a good reputation, no, a great reputation, could do this --- reading all your negative reviews I have to ask..... was it worth the extra $5?????

title: Ouch! The customer is gouged by Turbo Tax / Intuit
content: Ouch! The customer is gouged by Turbo Tax / Intuit. I have been using Turbo Tax for my tax returns beginning tax year 1999. I purchased the Deluxe Edition because it had Schedule C, D and E. I was going to buy the Deluxe as usual for 2014 and low and behold, I can no longer use the Deluxe Edition. I have to cough an extra $15 for the Premier Edition. It's not like living on a fixed income is easy. Let's see, Property taxes went up, income taxes went up, all the insurance went up (car, home and health care - about $6,000 in 3 years). I can't believe that Intuit spokes person Colleen Gatlin actually had the intestinal fortitude to say, âThe majority of the customers who understand the changes are OK with it,â. We're the ones that know about the change and are not okay with it. I bet Colleen received a big fat bonus to product that line. Surely Intuit can't believe we're that stupid, can they?

title: OK I am another one that is very disappointed in Turbo Tax
content: OK I am another one that is very disappointed in Turbo Tax. I have been able to complete my taxes using the Deluxe and now I have to purchase the Premier for an additional $30.00 in order to complete my taxes.

title: Poor customer service
content: The software did an adequate job of compiling a simple tax return, however there customer service is poor at best. I purchased a second state for $39.99 and could not get it to load after completing the purchase. I called their customer service line and, after describing my problem, the person I spoke to said they needed to "transfer me to another department" but instead simply hung up --- dial tone. I called back and got the same routine with someone else, but when they tried to "transfer" me I told him not to do that because I was hung up on last time. He told me to hold and he would get his supervisor to help me, he then proceeded to hang up on me -- dial tone again. If I got hung up on once, I could believe it's a bad apple or someone who had a bad day. Getting hung up on twice indicates this is is simply part of the Intuit culture; in a word: worthless. But you live and learn and move on. There are a number of other tax preperation software packages which I'll get looking into for next year

title: The only reason it didn't get one star is because the program works.
content: The only reason it didn't get one star is because the program works. Pros: The question-based guidance makes it reasonably easy to complete your taxes. Guided or unguided, the interface works. The updates are also helpful. Cons: Customer confusion on versions to buy. I have been a deluxe customer for years. Bought deluxe again to find that most of the basic stuff I have always had was GONE. Intuit really screwed this up. The stars are taken off for price-gouging your loyal customers. Had you kept your original feature-set, you would have gotten five stars. If Intuit pulls this @^%@%$^ again next year, I am done with TurboTax. There are other capable packages out there that cost significantly less.

title: No Snow Leopard support for 2014.
content: Besides the missing forms issue, which has been commented on by many, many people, this seems to be the first year that the Mac version of TurboTax will not work natively on Snow Leopard (10.6.8). A still fairly large percentage of Mac users are using Snow Leopard, so this seems like an additional poke in the eye to the customer base. FYI: A work around is to install the Windows version on a Parallels virtual machine and use Unity mode. That allows for cross platform functionality so that data from 2013 can be imported, etc. Doesn't solve the missing forms issue of course. Like everyone else, I will be looking for a different solution next year after 20 years of using MacInTax and then Turbo Tax. I had already purchased and installed TT Deluxe at Costco, so it was too late to switch for this year.

title: Turbo Tax Deluxe is Terrible. It is the Basic version @ Deluxe pricing.
content: It is terrible. Intuit changed deluxe without any warning. I have used Turbo Tax for over 20 years and it had been great. My son tried totalk me into using H&R Blocks software and I said no because Turbo Tax Deluxe had always done a great job. This year with NO notification took out schedules C, D and E and forces you to upgrade for another $30 to premier. I returned it to Costco and explained how I felt about Intuit's Turbo Tax. I tried to call Turbo Tax directly but all I could get was a busy signal, so I assume there are a lot of people upset with Intuit's Turbo Tax decision to downgrade it to the Basic and still charge a high price. DON"T BUY IT.

title: Time to switch to someone else.
content: Intuit, you guys have to be kidding. You make JCP executives look like geniuses. You claim to offer "free" upgrades for past users, but make it a real pain in the butt, and then send emails to customers complaining that I complained. What up with that?

title: No Schedule C in Deluxe version - Returning for refund and will never use Intuit products again.
content: No schedule C this year!!!! So it's absolutely worthless to me. I am returning the product and requesting a full refund. I wish they would reimburse me for the time I have wasted!

title: 2013 On-line Users Still Hit with the Upgrade Costs
content: I too had to upgrade to Premier. After reading the "Responses from the Seller" indicating that the issue with missing forms and schedules was being addressed with a free upgrade, I went ahead and purchased the Deluxe Package. Apparently it doesn't apply to those of us who chose to use the online platform last year. Thinking it would be more convenient to just keep files in the cloud, so I wouldn't have to worry about changing computers or crashed drives, I made the switch last year after over two decades of buying the disks. Now it's costing me an additional $30 (plus tax) because I made the switch. Next year I'll bite the bullet and take the time to learn a different tax prep program. Even if it's not as polished as TTax, at least I'll feel better spending my money with a company that's more transparent with their pricing and capabilities.

title: I need a Schedule E and Deluxe version no longer ...
content: I need a Schedule E and Deluxe version no longer supports that. So now I have to buy the more expensive product?! No thank you. I will be trying H&R Block's software this year.

title: Disappointing year for Turbo Tax
content: I was disappointed that this version of Turbo Tax does not include all of the features it has in the past. Intuit made the changes without letting anyone know and it has backfired on them. May be the last time I purchase Turbo Tax.

title: Nothing better than buying a "deluxe" version that charges you extra ...
content: Crashed and froze my computer multiple times within an hour. I had to keep cycling and pray that my return would go through. Worthless. I'll vouch on the price gouging aspect too. I ended up skipping a lot of deductions forms because they removed access to them (schedule D). Nothing better than buying a "deluxe" version that charges you extra to do what it used to do. I only usually get a very small amount back so it wasn't worth the cost since I didn't have any major investments or expenses, etc. What's worse is you can see that they knew for months that people were unhappy with the product (the comments on the reviews date back to 2014) and they didn't update anything. Yeah, really inspiring trust there. I used H&R last year, which wasn't as good as the Turbotax I remembered, but it was decent enough. However THIS Turbotax is definitely not the Turbotax you remembered and barely workable. Get H&R next year.

title: I am glad I read the reviews here before purchasing
content: I, too, WAS a loyal TurboTax user for over 10 years. As it happens, 2015 is the first year I would need to file a Schedule D. I am glad I read the reviews here before purchasing. I have switched to the H&R Block product. I got the version I needed (which includes Schedule D), with State filing, here at Amazon on sale for under $21.00. I started my return, importing last year's password-protected TurboTax file with no problems. So far, it seems as easy to use as TurboTax. I'll know more once I get into entering specific income and expenses, etc., but I am not anticipating any problems based on what I've played around with so far.

title: Enjoy it Intuit
content: I won't reiterate what others are saying here in regards to TurboTax Deluxe and the forced upgrade to Premier. I needed to finish my returns so I bit the bullet and upgraded. It cost an extra $32.70. Enjoy it Intuit, because it's the last nickel I'll ever give you.

title: So frustrated and disappointed with Turbo Tax Deluxe in removing some of the Scheduled Forms forcing customers to buy upgrade
content: I have purchased the Deluxe 2014 but have not open the box yet Having just read the users review on this product frustrated me and I was extremely disappointment with Turbo Tax from Intuit. They should not be taking out the Schedule Forms which are now missing. I have been using Turbo Tax for almost 20 years now and even back then, I thought that the program was expensive. Now they are taking away some of the Schedule forms of the program requiring customer to pay more for the normal program function. I will no longer use them. Will return my product. Very stupid for the company to be so greedy .

title: Get Serious Intuit.....
content: I agree with the other 2,215 people (so far) who gave TurboTax Deluxe one Star. I have tried for three days to get the "FREE UPGRADE" to restore the functionality removed from TurboTax Deluxe 2013. Intuit really "shot themselves in the foot" on this release. I have used this product for years but this may be the last straw. It is impossible to get the upgrade. The free upgrade feature in the software does not work. The tech support lines have pathetic wait times...I tried for three days. I finally had a call back from tech support and was told they could not help me. The "SYSTEM" was down and they could not get me authorization for the upgrade. They could not call me back with the authorization nor could they email me the required information. What kind of operation is Intuit?

title: Turbo Tax, Shame On You
content: Turbo Tax, you should be ashamed. I have used your product exclusively for at least 15 years and unless you pay me the full difference of $40 that I spent to upgrade from Deluxe to Home and Business, this will be my last year of using your product. I don't know who wrote the lame letter that came from the head of your company, but it was weak and did nothing to encourage me to continue using Turbo Tax. The letter claimed that Turbo Tax did not do an adequate job of explaining the need to upgrade to a more costly product, even though Deluxe has worked all these years. Saying you did not do an adequate job of explaining the changes to your customer base doesn't even come close to the "nothing" that I received. I know you have records of who has used which version of Turbo Tax in past years, and could have easily notified your customers of the upcoming changes long before I purchased the software December 26th. I hope you'll consider refunding the full upgrade cost instead of only $25.

title: Buyer Beware This May Be An Expensive Purchase.
content: This is an incredible rip off. There is no way to know , without doing a lot of research, that Intuit has changed the functionality of TurboTax. I find it hard to believe they don't acknowledge that this is a major error. I almost bought the Deluxe version which I have used for years until I noticed the very low review stars . As I read the reviews I realized what was going on . I would have had to upgrade . I will investigate the H&R block product and if it does everything I need ( I have a very complex return with cost basis in an IRA that I am taking MRDs from) I will switch and wage an Internet awareness campaign about this deception.

title: Beware--doesn't do what it used to.
content: It no longer supports Schedule C, D, E or F.

title: Fire the CEO
content: Although I have used this software consistently for 10 years, Management was unscrupulous in selling the package with restrictions to use unless an upgrade fee was also paid. The CEO should be fired. He is jeopardizing Intuit's franchise in this market. Next year, I will look at cheaper software that is available.

title: Intuit is driving customers away
content: I have been a TurboTax user since the mid 1990's I believe. This will be my first year to use something else. I refuse to be forced to buy the "Premier" version just so I can have a Schedule C. I have always had this in TurboTax Deluxe. Intuit is now constantly advertising and trying to upsell their customers. I recently cancelled an online QuickBooks account for the same reason. And Quicken is getting worse each year too and pops up ads to me. That makes me furious when I am working and an ad pops up...this is not FREEWARE software! Hey Intuit...you are driving customers away. I have been using Intuit products since 1993 and you are driving me away.

title: Very Disappointed in the changes this year
content: I have been using TurboTax for nearly 20 years. I started out with the 2014 Deluxe version, only to find that I couldn't include a single stock sale. Not only that, it wouldn't import from my Quicken 2012 without an upgrade to Quicken! So I decided to manually input my information from Quicken and I upgraded to Premier, only to find that I need to upgrade to Home and Business to include a single Schedule C item! I'm not looking for any features from TurboTax, just a simple tax form! I'm switching to TaxAct, abandoning Quicken for Pwersonal Capital (I've been using Mint - but I'm now against using any Intuit product or service). Way to go Intuit - you've turned a 20 year customer and advocate into an ardent enemy of your products and company.

title: Intuit TurboTax Deluxe Pre-review
content: None of us have filed tax returns for 2014 yet, so every review of the product to this point is a pre-review. I haven't purchased TurboTax Deluxe yet, and probably will not do so this year. On a personal level, I am unsettled about all of the really negative reviews of Intuit Turbotax, but they are consistent with my own observations of TurboTax through the years. TurboTax is expensive, and I can't understand why the prices are so high. Intuit has a large share of the accounting and tax return business already, and doing tax returns is not rocket science anymore. Yeah, the crummy federal tax laws are intentionally complicated, the states are all different, and technology is changing a bit, but when you are a big established company like Intuit, if you can't keep up, maybe you should be doing something else. From the customer's perspective, I see a lot of long time customers being frustrated by this year's TurboTax, especially the Deluxe version. Why is that? Why not give more for less? Does Intuit think they own the market and can charge whatever the hell they want to charge? Does that make any sense? Yes, we Americans are all 'enjoying' the economic depression imposed on us by a runaway and lawless federal government and a criminal federal reserve banking system, and our personal and business costs are rising every single year. A full restaurant dinner in 1970 was about $.80 - today it is over $8.00. We can thank the fed and their co-conspirators in the federal government for that problem. I'm sure that, like us, Intuit's costs are also rising, but it seems that this year they will be losing many customers. Ooops. Did they mean for that to happen? As an aside, I just briefly reviewed the H&R software, and guess what - there is a TurboTax import capability and the H&R Deluxe cost is apparently much less than TurboTax Deluxe. Do you think many TurboTax customers are going to be looking for alternative tax returns this year? It would seem that way. Anyway, I don't mean to rant on and on, but I am beginning to think someone at Intuit has screwed the pooch on this one. Onward and sideways as the old expression used to say? Let's all of us keep talking and reviewing this kind of software as our needs and goals are clearly different than those of Intuit and H&R. Competition is good for everyone, and there appear to be no sacred cows in the tax preparation business anymore. Another aside, I keep waiting for people to start asking why, if Americans only deal in fiat, debt based currency, and have no real wealth, profit, or income anymore, is there any obligation to file tax returns in the first place. But, hey, maybe that's just poor dumb me asking. ;-) Happy New Year!

title: From Really Good to Disaster - No More Chances
content: I have been using TurboTax since 1997 and have never had so many problems as this year. I started out simply wanting to purchase this year's version on their primary website. To do so, they con you into starting on online return with the premise that its free or will eventually take you to a purchase selection screen....nope. No instructions on how to simply buy the software, poor clarity of purpose on their primary site and no way to back out or delete the return that you start on line. From there it went downhill badly. Every time I needed to interface their software with the internet I had to call the help desk and wait 2 hours on their helpdesk....2+ hours to upgrade to Premium, 2 hours to download the state and now the same issues with Efiling. Too bad Intuit, you have really lost your way and a good loyal customer....or thousands based on these reviews. I'll do you a favor in return, you can adjust next years sales forecast by lowering by -1!.

title: Last year I did my taxes with TurboTax like I have for the last 10 years
content: I have to admit that this review is for the 2013 TurboTax but I'm putting it here with the 2014 so it will serve as a warning to others. Last year I did my taxes with TurboTax like I have for the last 10 years. I owed, and I owed a lot more than seemed reasonable. I have a friend who does taxes for a living as an independent business, so I had her over to review what I did. She went through each step, it looked right, but then went into the actual forms step by step and found a place where you click on a button to optimize your return, clicked it, and dropped our taxes by hundreds of dollars. Why this button is hidden away and why TT doesn't calculate it without having to dig for it, I don't know, but this year I am going to try another tax software.

title: Sorry but the Deluxe is STILL NOT Fixed. No ...
content: Nope, You blew it. Won't be back - - ever. Dropped Quicken for Money Dance. You see, there are options. Bye Bye Intuit.

title: Turbotax Glitch
content: Beware! I had tremendous trouble with Turbotax this year and received ZERO help through Turbotax. The system refused to allow me to be "head of household" which I am. It insisted "single" was best for me.I tried many work around through the day. I was told I needed to pay $1500 in federal tax because of being listed as "single" in spite of two dependents listed. Later that day, friends told me to just send in paper forms adjusted correctly by hand instead. The next day, as I went to print the forms I tried one more time to click on "head of household" and it worked. My tax dropped to $66. Probably using another tax service next year! Buyer and taxpayer BEWARE!!

title: As others have already mentioned, there's no Schedule C ...
content: As others have already mentioned, there's no Schedule C, D or E in the Deluxe version. I was completely insulted when I tried to do my business income and was told I needed to upgrade for an additional $40. I expected the same functionality from the same product and didn't get it. Yes, I could have read the reviews beforehand to see this, but I didn't think it necessary for a product that I'd been using for well over ten years. Needless to say, instead of Intuit getting another $40 from me, I purchased the H&R Block software for less than that. And it allowed my to complete my Schedule C!

title: The first is Fidelity will again support TaxCut and second it is far less money and I don't have to deal with a company like Int
content: From the latest reviews it is apparent Intuit has been working full time to have people post to this and other sites about their product. Frankly after buying it last year because I HAD to (Fidelity Inv no longer supported TaxCut) I am returning to TaxCut for 2 reasons. The first is Fidelity will again support TaxCut and second it is far less money and I don't have to deal with a company like Intuit who attempted to gouge it's customers and did it in such an obvious and ham handed way. Their apology was insincere and unacceptable to me. Besides when tax time rolls around next year the Turbo Tax software will again be outrageously priced vs TaxCut.

title: Time to drop TurboTax
content: Wow! I cannot believe that Intuit removed Schedule D from TurboTax Deluxe. Time to look at other options! (Too bad there is no choice to give 0 stars).

title: New Fees Added
content: This program added three new charges to the user that did not exist in prior years. 1. fee for State filing 2. fee for having refund deposited directly into bank account 3. fee for auditing insurance coverage which at first was listed as "optional," but when the form was finalized and ready for submittal the option was no longer available and insurance coverage fee was automatically tacked on. In other words, almost $80 of fees came out of the tax refund before the form could even be filed with the IRS. This smacks of deceptive business practice. I will not use TurboTax again.

title: Very disappointed to see Intuit forcing loyal customers to spend extra ...
content: Very disappointed to see Intuit forcing loyal customers to spend extra money this year to get same features. I will be switching to another product.

title: Yet another long-time Turbo Tax customer switching to...
content: After about 20 loyal years in a row, I'm moving my tax preparation software to H&R Block's offering. By dropping the Schedule D and others from the version of TurboTax I usually use, the value is just not there anymore. I've enjoyed being an Intuit customer over the years but it's time to say goodbye. I hope H&R Block will fill the void nicely, as other reviewers have suggested.

title: I used to use TurboTax every year; but no ...
content: I used to use TurboTax every year; but no longer! It's a huge ripoff now if you have investments or are self employed, I'm just going to spend a couple of extra dollars and get a real cpa.

title: Not at all happy with the new variants of TurboTax
content: Not at all happy with the new variants of TurboTax. I ordered the deluxe version which I have used for many years only to find out that it no longer allows income from a partnership K1. It prompted me to spend an additional $30 to step up to the next level. The product descriptions at the website are not very clear on what can be done with each version. This will probably be my last year with Turbo Tax.

title: Time to move to H R Block
content: I have used TurboTax every year for more than a decade. This may be the last year I use it. Basic features that used to be bundled in (like Schedule C) now require a $30 upgrade. What's more, that upgrade fee is significantly more than if I had known and bought the premier edition from the beginning. I don't know if it's price gouging or simple stupidity. Also, the product failed to prompt me to import my 2013 return, requiring me to re-enter information and possibly make mistakes in the process. I don't remember anything like that in the old versions Something else I noticed: after entering a 1099-MISC, it forced me to choose from four options, none of which actually applied to my situation. I had to choose one at random just to continue. I don't remember anything like that in the old versions.

title: there are much better deals elswhere
content: I was very irritated to realize that the state return was not free as the title implies. It was an additional $20, on top of the $50 I already paid. I will not be using TurboTax next year, there are much better deals elswhere.

title: Terrible bait and switch with premier
content: Terrible bait and switch with premier, will lose a lot of customers if they don't fix by next year. Robotic system on phone couldn't understand the difference between "f" and "s", so had to wait 20 minutes for live person, who also had trouble with the alphabet, and then the connection was lost. What a disaster, and this was my trying to pay extra $30 for premier. Instead, I went through Amazon and upgraded for $15. So, Turbo lost half of its upgrade because its customer service stinks. And next year I will look at HR Block and other software as alternative. TT had a great product and got greedy and will lose any competitive advantage it had from customer loyalty.

title: Switching to H&R Block
content: I've used TurboTax since the first year it came out, but their ridiculous changes this year have prompted me to switch to H&R Block's software. I work as a contractor, so my income is "small business", but my needs are very simple. I can pay $100 less for H&R Block's tax software. Next mission: Dump Quicken!

title: Intuit is over-complicating in attempt to increase revenue
content: Add me to the list of disgruntled long-time (15+ years) Turbotax users who are switching to a competitor this year. I am a CPA and prepare taxes for myself that I consider straightforward - itemized deductions, capital gains/losses, and a small amount of consulting income (board of directors fees). Despite the straightforward return, Intuit has designed a product that requires me to buy their most expensive product. The tax code is too complicated to have so many iterations of the software, which is creating their issues. They should take a lesson from competitors and have only two versions - basic and premium. Keep it simple! Taxes are hard enough for people as it is...

title: Missing Setup Files and Missing Tax Return 2014
content: I have used TurboTax for 7 years and always repurchased.. This year I purchased the 2014 Home & Business from Sam's Club. I did my taxes in February. I received a refund, but the process seemed weird. Today, I am trying to do my daughter's taxes only to find mine no longer exist, I cannot use the product I purchased, due to "setup files are missing" and apparently I have paid twice for the same product that will not work. TurboTax also does not have a record of my taxes. I called Intuit and the robot said they would call me back when it is my turn. It has been several hours and apparently it's still not my turn. If I don't get a call within the hour, I will purchase a different program and will never use TurboTax again.

title: It has been a fine product at a reasonable price until the 2014 version
content: I have been a loyal Turbo Tax user for more than 20 years. It has been a fine product at a reasonable price until the 2014 version. Pulling investment support from the Deluxe version without notification until after the product is purchased is a breach of customer loyalty that is inexcusable. Please read the article here (http://www.networkworld.com/article/2867286/microsoft-subnet/intuit-gets-greedy-nearly-doubles-price-of-turbotax.html) for how to get a free copy of HR Block's software. This is a huge mistake on Intuit's part.

title: Next year I will know better and read the details of H&R Block's tax S/W ...
content: Intuit stripped out many capabilities in the Deluxe version forcing an upgrade to the Premier version for simple things such as schedule D investment income. Shame on me for assuming that the version I have used for the past 15 years was equivalent and not reading the details before I purchased. I rated 1 star since I cannot rate lower. The reason being that Intuit effectively get 50% more revenue for the same product capabilities when compared to 2013. Next year I will know better and read the details of H&R Block's tax S/W before I buy it. Intuit got an extra $30 from me this year. Next year they get nothing.

title: Customer since 1997 when you bought out PTE - Now Leaving
content: Intuit bought out Parson's Personal Tax Edge, which I used from 1992 - 1996. I switched to TurboTax in 1997 because Intuit discontinued PTE. I've always felt they gouged for the product, but quite simply, it was the best out there. Your greed has finally overcome good business sense. I will no longer be put under the thumb of greedy corporate morons. Bye-Bye Intuit. I'd rather do my taxes manually than give you another dime.

title: Turbotax Is Not What It Once Was
content: Have been using Turbotax since 1992. This year it has gone completely off the rails. Download of the software did not work, and the problem was on their end. Three calls, hours long holds, and weeks later; I received discs to work around the download problem. The software finally installed, but then I had only days to file, and have now found that the state software won't load. As I type, I am on the phone again -- on hold again -- for over an hour and counting, trying to talk to someone who can help with the sate download. Overall, the amount of pain associated with Turbotax this year has greatly outweighed any cost savings of it versus just using a CPA. This is the last year, after 23, that I will use Turbotax. It has not gotten better with age.

title: Try H&R Block Deluxe
content: This year's Deluxe version does not allow you to file Schedule D or E. This is a take away feature from years prior and they want you to upgrade to Premier if have rental property or capital gains/losses. Nonsense I thought, so I changed to H&R Block Deluxe which seems to be just as good - if not better - and has Schedule D and E. Bye, bye greedy TurboTax we have choices.

title: Intuit will need to be vastly better to ever get my business back not just equivalent
content: Overpriced! Read the many posts about features removed from Turbotax this year. They are effectively driving people to premium version as a price increase. After comparing the features I've found that H& Block Deluxe version (half the price of Turbotax premium) is more competitive and higher rated. As a previous Turbotax customer I've switched to H&R Block. Recently Turbotax has announced "free" upgrades, etc to try to fix their problem. Too late, I'm going to reward the company who gives me honest features for a fair price. Intuit will need to be vastly better to ever get my business back not just equivalent. Bad move...

title: Not worth the time/hassle
content: Not even bothering this year. I'm a CPA and longtime customer-the convenience of the program can't be beat. That being said, with the changes made it's not worth the additional cost to buy the next step up and it's definitely not worth the hassle of paper filing. And you can be darn sure I'm not taking the time out of my day to call customer service to have them make it all better. Bad move, Intuit...

title: Greed, greed, greed !!!!
content: I have been using Turbotax for many years and was happy with the product. This year, they decided to change their pricing model and gauge everyone with the lame excuse they try to restructure they way they bundle their software in order to accommodate some existing customers. Did you wish to change your software to better serve everyone? No problems. Why did you have to charge me extra? The software costs the same to you once your write it, it's all a licensing scheme. Someone must have said in the board room : "we will lose customers over this" and someone else up the chain said "they are stupid and will keep buying". Well, we are not !!! Use your 2013 tax data and open it with H&R block, works just fine.

title: Time for something new
content: After years of using TurboTax, I switched to H & R Block. I've decided to only give my money to companies who listen to consumers.

title: 10-year customer; gone.
content: OK intuit, I guess you got me. Fine. Let's see what happens next year. PS- I want my $32 back.

title: I have been using Turbo Tax for more than 10 ...
content: I have been using Turbo Tax for more than 10 years. This year I switched to HRBlock with no problem

title: Really disappointed. Brokerage transactions and Schedule C input are gone
content: Really disappointed. Brokerage transactions and Schedule C input are gone. This year, due to all the negative reaction to this, TurboTax built in a free upgrade, which in my case required upgrading to Home and Business. If they keep the Deluxe version crippled next year, it will mean paying an $30 extra for Home/Business. That seems unfair and, if that happens, I'll be looking elsewhere for software. Hopefully the outcry this year has prompted Intuit to consider changes for upcoming editions. If not, based on the number of negative reviews, I think they can expect to see a significant exodus of those of us who have been loyal customers for years.

title: INTUIT clearly make a huge mistake - but they made it right for me this year - for 2015, they're halfway back
content: I purchased TT Deluxe from Costco, having used this product for more than twenty years. The guidance on what version to buy has consistently offered additional features regarding stock sales for the version above Deluxe including lookup of historical stock prices, features that I didn't need, but this year, without any clear warning, Intuit has seen fit to remove the long-present functionality of Schedules C, D, and E from the Deluxe version. I read the comparison chart carefully, but because of their previous guidance, it wasn't at all clear that this version was entirely crippled in this respect. I went ahead and bought TT Delux, just as I had done for many years. I wasn't aware of this problem until reading the headline on slashdot.org, which led me to detailed articles and the amazon.com reviews. I see Intuit claims that this removal of functionality was "in order to make the product line more consistent," but surely consistency can be achieved two ways - one could have added functionality to the online version to match the offline version, but NOOOOO, they saw fit to remove functionality from the offline version to match the crippled online version. That decision was clearly wrong as customers would certainly expect consistent features from the 2014 TT Deluxe version as compared to the 2013 TT Deluxe version. This represents a huge price increase to get the same product as I obtained in previous years. INTUIT, I intend to take you up on the offer of a free upgrade for long-standing customers to a version that meets the product I bought so faithfully over the years. If that works, I'll edit this review to tell you how easy or difficult the process was - if it doesn't work out, I'll let you know that too - and intend to return the product for a refund. I see that others are making the shift to competitors products that are apparently much cheaper - so raising the price of TT could cost INTUIT a huge bundle. I'm hereby putting INTUIT on notice that I fully expect them to make this right in future years. [EDIT as promised above]: By the time I used the product, the process for upgrading had been streamlined, and was fairly painless. Based upon whatever information they had, when I got to the point of entering stock sales and purchases, it prompted me for a free upgrade that took a little time to download, and after yet another restart of the software, worked as previous years' versions did regarding stock transactions. At the time that I'm editing this review (Jan 2016), Intuit has promised that they've heard the complaints and are restoring the schedule D to the Deluxe 2015 disk and download versions, but not the online versions. I'm still finding their version comparisons misleading in this respect: there are pages with large buttons asking what features you need, and these pages guide those with investments toward the Premier version. It's only by looking at some fine print at the bottom that they claim that they've restored the forms that were in the 2013 version into the 2015 version. They vaguely offer that the Premier version has "extra help" for those with investments, leaving it unclear what assistance is built into the the Deluxe version. One would expect to find the automatic downloading of investments into the forms, but can I be sure? Again, only time and experience will tell, and given my usual procrastination on tax matters, I'll discover that at the last minute. The net result, I'm setting this review to Three Stars, as these shenanigans still markedly reduce the comfort that this version has what I need. Intuit really needs to make their feature more clear. Notably, now they again have differing feature levels between their online and disk/download versions, and while they could have made the online feature match the disk/download features, they chose not to. [/EDIT]

title: Taken for granted.
content: Tired of being nickeled and dimed to death. It's bad enough that the price hasn't ever actually included state e filing (which is FREE on our states website), but removing needed forms and bumping them up to the next software level i just too much. I like the software, but when it's all said and done the cost isn't really that much better than I can get from a local tax preparer. For the slight increase in cost, all I have to do is hand over a stack of paper and go home to relax. Don't get me wrong, I've loved and trusted TurboTax for years, but it's beginning to feel like they take customers for granted, as if there aren't any other good options.

title: As the many that have already made comments I too ...
content: As the many that have already made comments I too was just about to purchase TT till I saw the reviews. I have used the TT products for the past 10 years and need the forms I have been able to get in the deluxe version. I have read all comments and I will be purchasing the H&RB product.

title: Rip off
content: Hate it turbo refused to give me my owed 25 dollars refund After 10 plus year of using turbo I will purchase a different one. It's the principle of the thing

title: Open Letter to Intuit (INTU)
content: Dear Intuit - You should be ashamed. Deleting tax forms from TurboTax Deluxe. Greed. Pure and Simple! However, Thank You for convincing me it's time to switch to a different software package. In addition, since I believe this boycott will only gain momentum, I sold my Intuit stock today. Goodbye. Hope you are happy and patting yourselves on the back. UNhappy Camper. P.S. A bit of advice: Fire those responsible for such a stupid move!

title: H&R Block is a much better price too
content: Used TurboTax for many years, until one year I couldn't get it to install. Called their tech support (like 2 months Before tax day), was on hold for at least and hour, then working with them for about 3 hours trying to resolve the issue. They were never able to provide a solution, and I was told that someone higher up would be calling me to try and straighten it out. That never happened. I switched to H & R Block and have used them now for 4 or 5 years without an issue. I've even called to speak with one of their tax experts around April 13 or 14th, and got through to them within about 5 or 10 minutes. Try getting that kind of service with Intuit...not going to happen! H&R Block is a much better price too!

title: Poor customer service
content: Don't do it. Caveat emptor, "Let the buyer beware". Don't buy Turbo tax 2014. Reasons: Forced upgrades for any additional schedules, includung Schedule C. Poor customer service. When unable to solve problems, customer service reps hung up the phone. Four times for me. If you have been the victim of identity theft and need to enter an IP-PIN (identity protection personal idetification number) forget about using Turbo Tax. Entering your IP PIN is so difficult and the software so buggy that you won't be able to file electronically. Get out the postage stamps. These are only three of teh many problems I have encountered using this software. I could go on but dinner is ready. Oh, and Intuit, they could care less.

title: Caveat Emptor - mishandling of reimbursed job expenses
content: Unless I'm mistaken, the step-by-step interview process for deducting job expenses is flawed. It asks for unreimbursed expenses, after which it asks if any expenses were reimbursed, but it treats the latter only as reimbursements not as expenses. Hypothetical: Suppose I have $1000 in unreimbursed expenses and $500 in reimbursed expenses. The program treats the $500 as a reimbursement but not as an expense. I had to work directly in the 2106 form to make the correct entries. I tried to call Turbotax to alert them to what I think is a serious flaw, but I was shuttled from one customer service line to another, with endless waits, until I gave up. Caveat Emptor.

title: Wrong calculations , poor customer service.
content: Wrong calculations and poor customer service. My actual state tax refund were miscalculated by this poor program , not only that. Turbotax claims that they have 100% calculations guarantee which is absolutely not true. I spent more than 6 hours trying to reach someone from customer service, and the best they can do is to place on hold for long periods period of time (136 minutes on hold!!, 40 minutes, 30 minutes and 29 minutes) and the end result is a "simple apology and please keep trying". No more Turbotax for me , it is more cost-effective to do your taxes with an actual accountant and not go through this hassle. I lost more than $700 because of this program.

title: I've used the product for years (out of inertia) and it was no better or worse than competitor's products for my purposes
content: I am outraged by intuit's tactics regarding schedule D etc. I've used the product for years (out of inertia) and it was no better or worse than competitor's products for my purposes. Next year I will switch to a competitor.

title: Sorry, Intuit. It's time to switch.
content: Too little, too late. Like many others, I was duped into purchasing the Deluxe software not realizing the one little 1099-B form would keep from allowing the e-file. I took the companies backtrack as a desperate attempt to save face. It is several weeks after the CEO released his statement about the free upgrade for desktop users and it's still not a done deal. Well, I am done. I have submitted my request to H&R Block for their free software offer and I encourage others to do the same.

title: Goodbye TT, I am divorcing you.
content: Good bye TT. I will not be paying for an item that can from someone else that does the samething for less money. It's like you got tired of making money.

title: I've used TurboTax Deluxe for years. I have a ...
content: I've used TurboTax Deluxe for years. I have a very basic art business and it covered what I needed for that and personal taxes - UNTIL NOW. How greedy to change it to where I would have to buy the full blown home and business version to electronically file the business schedule. Sorry, but I'll be changing before I'll pay double the price due to corporate greed.

title: Wasted a lot of time
content: Amazon's down-loader wouldn't work. Amazon tried to force me to deal with Intuit to get a refund so that I could go buy it for the same price on CD at Staples. Wasted a lot of time. AMAZON: IF YOUR DOWNLOADER WON"T DOWNLOAD IT IS YOUR RESPONSIBILITY TO REFUND THE MONEY rather than forcing me to deal with Intuit or process a charge-back on my card. This is your branded downloader, not Intuit's.

title: Go somewhere else...
content: I don't normally write reviews on Amazon but this one merits one.. A really bad one. Way to go intuit, corporate greed wins over again they changed the premium edition without warning to remove the small business schedule. I have been a loyal TurboTax customer for several years now. But next year it will be another tax software Super job Intwit!!

title: Buy H & R Block instead
content: I have always purchased this in years past and completed my taxes with no problem. My taxes include entering interest gained from a trust via K-1. This year, I got a message that said that I needed to upgrade to the Premier in order to enter that which would cost an additional $30. I ended up buy H & R Block program for about the same and completed it with no problem. I know where I will go in the future for my tax program and it will not be Intuit.

title: The forms I needed and useful previous years were not available and I had to ...
content: The forms I needed and useful previous years were not available and I had to upgrade to turbo premier. I will used different software next year.

title: Moved to HRB in 2015 and won't be going back to TT
content: Because of TT's inflated price this year, I decided to try HRB's tax software, not least because they have prepared my wife's business taxes for the past 4 years, without any problems. I only need Schedule C, which is available within HRB's Premium and Business, which I bought as a download, for a paltry $45.17 on Amazon. I am a Brit and in no way a US Tax expert. Despite losing the familiarity I had from 5 years of TT, I found HRB extremly easy to use as a first time user. The whole process was simple from start to finish, and it gives up to 5 Fed efiles free, so I won't be going back to TT next year.

title: Fool me once, H&R Block next year
content: I am one of the duped that bought this thinking it had schedule D, as it always did. I be one of the many that switch to H&R Block next year.

title: Send Intuit A Message - Do Not Buy Any TurboTax Version
content: As almost everyone knows, Intuit really messed up with their rollout of the 2014 TurboTax versions. To add insult to injury, they overcharge $5 to e-file the California return. Within the tax software, it's advertised as $19.95. At the time of e-filing, it became $24.95. Yeah, it's only another $5, but in light of the other corporate stupidity and "apologies", it just adds insult to injury. I've long wondered why they don't eliminate the state filing charge considering the price for the software. Intuit has grown to a corporate behemoth that actively lobbies the Federal government against revising the tax codes. I plan to change over to another tax software company come the 2015 tax filing season. I doubt they'll miss me even though I have used their software since they first debuted the Windows "DOS" versions.

title: The exodus will continue.
content: Nothing new to add. Just about everything that needed to said has been. Crummy move Intuit. But what got to me the most was the lame explaination. That was insulting. Your support rep did give me the free upgrade to Premium this year after I had already purchased Deluxe, but can assure you, if you don't restore the Deluxe version to its former functionality, I will be switching to H&R Block next year. So don't be proud of yourselves that your projected customer loss due to this change was what you predicted. I thnk next year the exodus will continue.

title: DO NOT BUY (NOT THE SAME TURBOTAX) FLIM FLAM NOT ...
content: DO NOT BUY (NOT THE SAME TURBOTAX) FLIM FLAM NOT COMPLETE. I USED TURBOTAX FOR 10 YEARS, BUT NOT ANYMORE,

title: Looks like 2013 was my last year
content: Been using Turbotax since 1997. Looks like 2013 was my last year. Just a tragic rip off so I'm off to H&R Block. Not because they're the best UI or easiest to use... but they seem to actually care about their customers. What's so tragic about this is that presumably there was a deliberate executive meeting which led to the short-sighted decisions to cash in all those years of customer loyalty in pursuit of profit at any cost. No doubt Intuit shareholders must be delighted at the outcome...

title: Want free exchange for Block software
content: I have used TT for years, but when I heard of the price increase, I bought H&R Block software this year. I recently got an email offer from TT for $25 off. If TT wants me back, they will have to offer me a free exchange for the Block software I already purchased this year. This would be equivalent to the offer from Block to get free software if you have already purchased TT.

title: Intuit kicks it loyal customers in the teeth.
content: Wow. I came here to purchase TT Deluxe, as I have for many, many years. Before purchasing I read the NY Times article and the comments of the many reviewers here at Amazon. I'm tremendously disappointed that someone at Intuit would make the decision to rip off their loyal customers...and then expect those customers to respond positively. Remove key features from the product, but keep the same "Deluxe" name? Check. Bait & switch? Check. Insult and disappoint your loyal customers? Check. Slimey? Check. Lost me as a customer? Check.

title: One Star
content: Really obnoxious, sleazy move by Intuit dropping support for ANY stock sales.

title: Do not buy if you have any investment activity!
content: You cannot e-file Schedule D and it will not populate the form for you. I have been using this product and Quicken for 20 years but this is the right time and reason to switch. Apparently this has become a cash cow for Intuit and they are happy to lose market share in order to maximize profit. I hope this turns out to be a faulty long term strategy and I'll do my part by switching.

title: Save yourself some stress... do not buy this product.
content: Last year the TurboTax system had a glitch in it. When I added my husband's 1099-MISC, the first went through under his name but each subsequent one came up under my name. I tried repeatedly to get TT to help with the issue. They promised that waiting two weeks for the update would fix the problem. It did not. I finally just submitted the taxes with the glitch. This year the same problem occurred. I opted to call TT and was put on hold for an hour and twenty-two minutes before I got to speak with someone. After less than a two minute conversation, the representative put me on hold again (telling me to wait "just one moment"). After another 7 minutes on hold, the phone call was disconnected. After being a loyal customer for almost 10 years, I am completely finished with TurboTax.

title: DON'T FALL FOR THE DOWNGRADE OF THE FEATURES OF THIS SOFTWARE -- WARNING RIP OFF
content: After reading that Intuit has offered to update the deluxe version to the premier version, I found out that's not true. When I tried to enter investments, I had to upgrade to premier and pay another $30. I then tried to enter business income/losses and had to pay another $10 to upgrade to the business version. I have used Turbo Tax for many years and this will be the last. You just lost a loyal customer for a big $40 that will cost you hundreds in the years to come.

title: Hidden fees, surprise convenience fees, fewer features.
content: Be wary of the hidden fees when you e-file and especially avoid telling it to take the fees out of your refund or you'll be hit with even more fees that will suddenly appear as you are about to hit send. Use your credit card and consider just snail mailing your state form, especially if you aren't due a refund.

title: Awful product. Errors and problems with payment. Last year using Turbotax.
content: It also screwed up my donations, sending me into a strange loop that took a while to fix, since there was no support for it. There were quirks like that everywhere. Turbotax likes to separate the price of a state e-file from their base price to keep the initial cost down, and make you pay the extra fee before you file. That's annoying, but, I expect that. What i don't expect is to not be able to pay the fee because of a problem on their end, and being shuffled to generic browser support tips when it doesn't. Every question on their support site goes like this. Q: "Hey, I'm trapped under a car and I think my legs are broken!" A: "I understand that being trapped under a car with your legs broken is frustrating. We want to do whatever we can to help you. Please follow the tips listed here to reset your web browser. If you are still trapped under the car, just wait and we'll resolve it." (Question marked as "Answered") (Man dies 4 days later of dehydration) Or they shuffle people off to "community support", where no questions are being answered. I'm done. I printed out the state forms and will just mail them in. This is my last year using turbotax. Amazon should partner with a different provider in the future. CG

title: Features are no longer "Deluxe". Deluxe now means basic.
content: Very deceptive on the part of Intuit to "dumb down" the product and remove Schedule D capability in Deluxe. Intuit is no longer competitive in the tax SW market. It's time to switch to alternate products.

title: Listen to the other reviewers... DON'T buy this!
content: Don't repeat my/our mistake - this is junk! It can't find my prior year's TurboTax return on my computer. There is zero support. It is not AT ALL client friendly. And - as others have noted in mass - they are screwing us all on the increased price, reduced function. Bandits, just thieves.

title: Not worth the price
content: The price is way to high for the quality. Have been 'stuck' with TurboTax for many years, not worth it anymore, especially if needing to file more than one state - have had to pay tax fines twice due to simple errors. Will be using a professional tax accountant or my own paper/pen in future.

title: Intuit is Pathetic
content: Pathetic. That's what Intuit is after they degraded TT Deluxe. I've used it for years to file my taxes. It's done the job. Now I have to upgrade to "Premier" to include stock sales information. I guess they decided that the stock market has done well the past couple of years, so those selling stocks can afford to pay for an upgrade. Time to look for an alternative. Will need to look for an alternative to Quicken also. I'm sure they'll try to rake me over the coals to upgrade that next year.

title: Intuit Lies
content: I only bought this because it said the product would be automatically upgraded after Feb 2015 (presumably because of the outrage Intuit generated by downgrading TurboTax Deluxe). The product was not--repeat, NOT--upgraded, and now TurboTax is telling me I have to upgrade to Premier to do the same operations I've done for years with Deluxe. The copy associated with this product at time of purchase therefore lies. This is the last Intuit product I'll ever buy.

title: Intuit paying Amazon to endorse their crappy product now!
content: Intuit - your greed knows no bounds! I read the VP's response to the most popular negative review here, and it is more of the same politically correct corporate b.s. Good job by other reviewers here. I am adding mine to snub Intuit - may you suffer the worst quarter ever.

title: Avoid at all costs
content: Same issue as everyone else

title: Get Lost, TurboTax
content: Loyal TurboTax customer since 1998, and was impacted by the 'Premier'-fiasco; my TurboTax costs would have been $75+ this year. Just filed my taxes with TaxAct.com for under $20. Unbelievable, what a poor showing by TurboTax. They had me for life. I would even have paid $10, perhaps $15 more this year without giving it a second thought. Now, they've likely lost me for life. Love that I got an email from TurboTax today stating that I need to file by March 20th, or they'll increase prices. hahahahahaha. Good riddance.

title: Intuit is sketchier than the IRS
content: I switched to HR Block this year (after 15+ years of turbotax) based on these reviews and everyone should do the same. The business strategy for turbotax is clearly to shake down customers based on income level -- why else charge more to support stock gains/losses, which is a basic function for tax software? It's because stock trading is more prevalent among those on the higher income scale.
