HR Block software is less expensive and offers better features and customer service, And the import of my 300+ trades was accurate and fast. Import from 2013 turbotax is seamless and quick. Switch and you'll have no regrets.

title: Avoid the 10% Gift Card Offer!
content: This is how it was with last year's version; I am sure this year is similar if not the same: By agreeing to the 10% Amazon Gift Card offer, you agree to share your very sensitive personal information with some little known entity called Sunrise Bank, who can share all of that info with any of its "affiliates" for marketing purposes. This is someone's review from last year with more details: http://www.amazon.com/review/R1Z6LRD46FH2MA/ref=cm_cr_rdp_perm (If any of this changed this year, Dear "Bob Meighan, VP TurboTax" who is posting a response at every review here, feel free to explain what changed. If you do, please include full terms and conditions of this tax year's offer with your response.) I have used TurboTax and Amazon for a decade or so. I am very disappointed they sell my personal information without making it apparent to me. Fine print on the software doesn't count, because I paid for software before I am presented with the fine print.

title: 2014 version is awful!
content: I've used TurboTax successfully for many years. I have the Preier version. This year there were little technical glitches, and I spent hours trying to find someone to call. Several numbers found were dead ends. I gave up on one that seemed promising after waiting over an hour.The main problems started when I was finished with my returns. I wanted to order Audi Defense but forgot my password. That got me into a loop where I couldn't get rid of the sign in page. If I signed in, all I got was a page of advertising asking which product I wanted to buy. THERE WAS NO WAY TO GET OUT OF THIS LOOP, AND IT COMPLETELY BLOCKED ACCESS TO THE SOFTWARE UNDERNEATH. So I couldn't get to the filing section, or any section, because all of the toolbar options were grayed out. I couldn't quit TTx because it said I had to finish the dialog, which of course I could not even reach. Same for trying to shut down the computer. Eventually I had to force quit TTx, which could have caused a loss of the data, but fortunately it did not. That's not all. I wanted to print a copy of my returns before filing to study to make sure I had added everything necessary. No. Have to file first. So I chose send by mail, printed the copy, and then went back to file by email. This was the most user unfriendly version I've ever worked with. The help you used to be able to get was nonexistent, or at least I couldn't find where I could easily talk to a human, or even chat online. Never again! I'll have to find other software for next year.

title: like many other people
content: I've used TurboTax for years, but, like many other people, was upset about the change TurboTax made this year to move certain kinds of financial transactions to a higher priced product. Specifically, Turbox Tax wanted me to spend significant additional money just to record the info about a small stock sale of under $1,000. I said no way and took advantage of the free offer H&R Block software made to disgruntled TurboTax users. The H&R Block software worked just fine, and I will H&R Block next year for my taxes.

title: Not Happy. Paid for two turbo taxes this year
content: Was not as described. Received an email from Turbo Tax apologizing for changing the Deluxe version, that we have used the past serveral years. Offered us $25 because we would have to buy a second Turbo Tax. We did, downloaded and have not been able to get anywhere with $25. Plus there is no return refund option on this purchase through Amazon. Not Happy. Paid for two turbo taxes this year. I can not even use the first one to file my children's tax returns because you needed to delete to install the premium. What a rip off Turbo Tax!

title: Vote with Your Wallet
content: Like others, I am disgusted by Intuit's dishonesty in instituting a crucial downgrade without adequately informing customers. The only effective countermeasure to corporate greed and deception is collective individual action. I therefore am dropping Turbotax after more than ten years of use and am switching to H&R Block, which is cheaper anyway. No one should countenance such blatant, brazen corporate abuse of loyal consumers.

title: Buyer Beware
content: What they don't tell you is that they have changed their product from years past and it does half of what it used to do.

title: For this I am disappointed and don't plan to access this product through Amazon ...
content: I have purchased this product over the past two years as a download without any problems. This year, I was unable to install onto my Windows based PC the 2014 TurboTax return. I did call the customer service line for Amazon, who did attempt to fix this issue from its end. Amazon was unable to do this and directed me to TurboTax directly. I was told by the Amazon representative at the time, that I would have 30 days to return this product if it did not work. I was unable to access this product, even after assistance by TurboTax and I finished my tax returns another way. I did attempt to cancel and/or return this item, because I was unable to use it, but have been told I can not do that. How would I have known that I couldn't access this product without attempting to install it first. For this I am disappointed and don't plan to access this product through Amazon again.

title: Intuit wins Darwin Award!
content: I have been using Turbo Tax forever and this is the dumbest thing they have ever done. I bought Deluxe 2014 like I do every year without realizing it won't do Schedules C and D. Way to gouge loyal customers, Intuit! And such hollow apology, clearly forced because of customer and media backlash. I am looking at alternatives as we speak! I hereby declare Intuit a Darwin Award winner- the one that goes to people who do astoundingly dumb things whereby removing themselves from the gene pool.

title: H & R Block is looking very good to me at this point
content: H & R Block is looking very good to me at this point. Turbotax continues to be sneaky in an effort to gouge customers.

title: Suddenly for 2014 the "Deluxe" version no longer does Schedule ...
content: Suddenly for 2014 the "Deluxe" version no longer does Schedule D cap gains. One must buy the more expensive Premium version. Since I've already bought something I can't use, I'm not going to buy TurboTax Premium. It's time to move to TaxCut Deluxe which still works for investors. I wish to God, I'd looked at the reviews before buying. But I've been buying Deluxe for years with no issue.

title: As a turbotax user for the past 7 years, ...
content: As a turbotax user for the past 7 years, I can say that I am finished with TurboTax in light of these recent changes.

title: Very disappointed
content: Very disappointed and it is not because I used those forms which are no longer part of the deluxe edition. I usually file my taxes in February because they're not that complicated. This year however, I had to withdraw from my IRA. I knew I had to pay early penalties and I was expect Turbo Tax to work me through it. It did for Federal but it messed me up for California. One day, I updated TurboTax just because I wanted to have the more recent version, I saw my taxes changed! I immediately freaked out because I had already filed online and everything was accepted. After reviewing my returns again, I realized the 3805P is now filled and I owed additional taxes. I later found out that this was an error in TurboTax and was fixed after I filed. Now I have to file an amendment and it could only be done through mail. If I had to fill by mail, I could have say $20 for filing state online. I'm just hoping I've done the amendment right because this will be the first for me too.

title: One Star
content: Don't buy-no sch c

title: Don't do it - DO NOT PURCHASE
content: I have used Turbo Tax for YEARS and have had nothing but trouble after purchasing the Deluxe software. I have wasted hours trying to upgrade to Premier since I need Schedule D. Waited on hold last Saturday for over an hour and finally had to call it quits. Tried again on Tuesday night, again had to hang up after 20 minutes. In between we found a problem that was similar to ours and tried the solution that was given - no luck. I have 6 returns to do for my family members with software that does not work. Stupid me thought that Intuit was doing right by their customers - that was my first mistake. I have decided to write off the $$ spent on this as a learning experience. Never, ever purchasing their products again.

title: No Schedule C, D, E, and F? Poor response by management? No more TurboTax for me ...
content: After MANY years as a loyal TurboTax user, I threw up my hands at the debacle related to removing features from the Deluxe version. I decided to switch to the H&R Block product. I paid less, got more, and it was simple to import my previous year's TurboTax files. Easy switch and I'm not looking back. Intuit can do what they want - put the features back, lower the price, fire Sasan Goodarzi (General Manger). It doesn't matter ... I won't be back.

title: It can be hard to win back the trust of a customer once you have lost it, and maybe you never will.
content: I have used TurboTax for over 16 years. I purchased it this year at Costco and found the changes that TurboTax had made, and I was just as disgusted as the hundreds of other users who have reviewed this product, with the changes they had made. Changing the price is one thing, but forcing someone to upgrade after purchasing it in order for them to be able to do what they expected the product to do, is another. I saw, and still do see the companies attempt to win back their loyal customers, but to me that is little more than a bribe. That doesn't settle with me very well. To my way of thinking, they thought that they could treat us with contempt and simply get away with it. I admit that I wasted some money that I didn't need to. I did that by uninstalling TurboTax, and throwing it away. I then purchased H&R Block. I found no major difference in the way the two programs performed. I did come up with one problem with H&R Block. I bought it with the State filing because I had some income from a state that I do not reside in. It turned out that this software did not allow me to file in the State that I needed to, and I don't have any idea why. It worked out better though. This could be a coincidence because I really have no way of knowing. However, last year using TurboTax to file my state taxes, for the same income, in the same state, I paid 5 times as much in State taxes as I did this year doing that same State return by hand. It took me an hour and a half and a $.49 postage stamp. Maybe the State taxes did change that much from this year compared to last year but it seemed a little weird. TurboTax, feel free to have one of your corporate people run a counter statement against my review. It may help stem your losses, but It will not change my mind because I no longer trust you, and you will not get my trust back again. Just because you try to make things right by offering a refund, or an upgrade, isn't enough to bring back trust that has been lost. At least not mine.

title: Last time to use Turbo Tax
content: I have used Turbo Tax Deluxe for over 15 years and this is the first time that I am disappointed..First I purchased the CD from Best Buy for $39.99 plus tax..Second my mistake I had forgotten that I had won alittle at a casino in another state, so when I entered my winning Turbo Tax wanted another $39.99 plus tax again,then when I finished my taxes Turbo Tax wanted another $19.99 plus tax to e-file...I could have had some do my taxes for about $75.00 and with Turbo Tax it cost about $105.00..After over 15 years I think Turbo Tax has gotten my last business.....

title: Hiding your price increase in the fine print is worthy of 0 stars
content: Adding to the rest of the previous comments. Hiding your price increase in the fine print is worthy of 0 stars.

title: Long time TurboTax user no more!
content: Long time TurboTax user no more! It was so easy to use HR Block. It imported the old TurboTax returns easily, and the Deluxe version of HRB found the carryover tax losses with no effort. It was even easier to use than TurboTax.

title: I am sorry Turbotax, you have lost a customer for good...
content: I moved to the US from the UK a few years ago. Until this year, I relied on these guys (used the online deluxe version) and filing taxes was a smooth procedure. This year I when I came back I was shocked by the steep price increase compared to the last year. The deluxe online program had costed me $30 for 2013 taxes and with the 10% amazon gift card option I had offset the purchase. However this year the online version price was $60 and the gift card option was not there (at least for me). I found a $10 off deal (coupons.com partnered with turbotax) but although it was legitimate, somehow the website prevented me to take advantage of that deal, on top of that I was not even asked for the gift card option as well (5% was mentioned in some places). I kept filling the form hoping that it will finally give me the option to take advantage of these benefits but NO, they had gone crazy and just asked for my credit card details right before submitting (They even ask for an additional $40 processing fee if you choose the option of letting them take the money from your return instead of credit card...) Having spent 3 hours on preparing my taxes I had two options: Surrender and pay the full $60 price and forget about all the deals for the sake of convenience or just start over somewhere else. I chose the second option and went to H and R block free version. It took me another 2 hours to fill the form from scratch in H&R website but in the meanwhile I realized that they actually have no difference at all. Similar questions, warnings, alerts, security check points, similar algorithm in comparing standard vs itemized deductions, similar level of instructions etc. And the final tax return H and R calculated was the same up to the last coin. On top of that even this free version was offering 5% bonus if I wanted to get part of my return in gift cards ( Target, starbucks, homedepot etc. in $100 increments.) I was happy with the result and filed it all for free with no hassle. If your taxes are relatively simple like me (married filing jointly, having W2 from employer, kids in daycare, house with mortgage, some interest from basic saving accounts, not too much work related deductibles and a few charitable donations) then go for it you won't even feel the difference. For those who have more complicated situations, it is up to you. (Honestly, I think the free H&R is still as good for anyone that thinks of getting TurboTax deluxe) Conclusion: I am sorry Turbotax, you have lost a customer for good... and you know what, just for the sake of convenience I was ready to pay the increased price if you at least let me take advantage of these discounts. But instead, you guys forced me to pay the full doubled price and that really pissed me off... Note: I gave it a 2 stars instead of 1 only for the sake of the good old days...

title: By far the worst follow-up program I have ever seen
content: By far the worst follow-up program I have ever seen. Needed help and phoned. NO Hookup! Sent e-mail. NO response! Still waiting on call-back from weeks ago. Tried to message management about my concerns. NO names or addresses available. I will not use nor buy again in the future. I will downgrade product to everyone and anyone that will listen. I usually don't bitch, but this product deserves the exception. If I could give it a minus five star I would. Only marked one star to have this comment go in. J Larsen

title: Terrible business decision on TT's part to remove Sch
content: Terrible business decision on TT's part to remove Sch. C & D from the Deluxe version. They have forced me to go elsewhere. Their $25.00 rebate is no palliative, either. It is more work. And they hope that many customers will not file for the rebate. So long TT; hello H&R Block or TaxAct.

title: The $25 back for those of us who already used ...
content: The $25 back for those of us who already used the software and were forced to pay midstream to upgrade is only for users who got the software as a download. If you purchased a CD you are out of luck. Also, I am in the midst of my filled state form printing out as "Do not file". Turbotax is supposed to clear up this mess by Feb 20, 2015. We will see. Meanwhile, I can not file my state return.

title: Can't install
content: I have been a loyal user since 1984. This has been the worst experiance using Turbotax ever. Downloaded from AMAZON 1/27/15 and can not install. Software directed me to turbotax help page. After entering a slew of data, nothing was ever heard for them. Now on my second attempt. Seriously looking at getting a refund.

title: Intuit lost a very good customer because of their financial greed
content: I have been a loyal Quicken Deluxe and Turbo Tax Deluxe user every year for 22 years. This is the first time that I refused to purchase Turbo Tax, and purchased H&R Block Tax software instead, when I found out that Turbo Tax Deluxe no longer lets you use Schedule D forms in your tax return without paying extra and going with Turbo Tax Premier. I was not about to purchase Turbo Tax Premier for only one or two stock sales for the entire year. Intuit lost a very good customer because of their financial greed! I payed Amazon only $21.99 for H&R Block Deluxe software plus State Return. That is 1/4 the price of Turbo Tax Premier. How could Intuit think that they would not lose most of their customers when they crippled the Deluxe version of Turbo Tax and forced you into purchasing a more expensive product, not even caring that their product was the most expensive tax program even before they changed it this year.

title: TurboTax shorted my refund $54. 98 in fees. ...
content: TurboTax shorted my refund $54.98 in fees. They say they upgraded people to premier after screwing people on the Deluxe version they charge fees. I will never in my life use TurboTax again. Update: $19.99 was for state efile which I didn't expect the other $34.99 was for Tax Products Group, some bank in CA that I never heard of and TurboTax gave my info to. This bank opened an account in my name and charged me a $34.99 processing fee to process my refund. What a rip off.

title: TurboTax gouging Deluxe customers who need Schedules C - F pay $40 for upgrade, get $25 back when you file
content: ...well I'm roped in at this point. Been doing taxes with TurboTax since the floppy disc days. Do it yourself Schedule C now requires an "upgrade"? What kind of B.S. is this? Just another big corporate gouge of a customer base. I'll find an alternative for sure next year. ...And I was buying 2 and 3 extra states per year from Intuit because I work in multiple states each year. You can take the $100+ you would have gotten from me each year and shove it. Update: So I'm locked in. Just purchased a Home and Business Upgrade for $39.99. Great News! I'll get $25 back *after* I've filed. ...Which means Intuit now has the use of my $40 for 3 months. And they'll only give me back $25 out of $40. Hello H&R Block! Update 2: 2/5/2015 ...So now I'm getting letters from the TurboTax Manager telling me that they'll give me a "free upgrade". But, if I've already purchased Home and Business, they'll only give me $25 of the $39.99 I already spent. TurboTax clearly does not understand customer service.

title: Gave this a chance despite the Not-So-Deluxe version issue - regretting it
content: Before purchasing TurboTax this year (after almost two decades using this software), I saw all the warnings that the Deluxe product had some pretty basic investment tools removed and you'd have to pay to get them back. But then I saw the comment from Bob Meighan, VP, TurboTax, saying sorry we messed up and from now on our returning customers will get the upgrade for free. It is supposed to be seamless from within the program. So I gave them the benefit of the doubt and bought the product. Well I'm in the program and I've used Deluxe or Home & Business for 10+ years so I figure I should qualify for the upgrade, and they're still trying to take $30 from me. Note this is just so I can report a $6 gain on a cash distribution for a partial share. Other than that I have no investment activity to report. I can forgive them for making a change and then admitting the mistake, but I'm still being told to come up with $30 to get the functionality that I was told the program would upgrade to for free (as part of their sorry-we-tried-trick-you modification). Update: I eventually called support again and after some initial "can't-imagine-what-you're-talking-about" answers I convinced someone to help me. She was very nice and got it sorted out. Still one star because I shouldn't have had to do that.

title: Turbo Tax is so pathetic.
content: I can't believe TT is ripping off customers, I've used it for over 15 years and always told my friends it was the best on the market. I have stock sales so now deluxe is worthless for me. I purchased it today and like many other customers I will be returning it to the store tomorrow.

title: Intuit has gotten too greedy
content: For many years I've been using Turbotax Basic. This year (tax year 2014), for the same type of return, I first had to upgrade to Deluxe, then later to Premier for what Basic was able to do before. Next year, I definitely will be looking at competing products. Too bad - but this price increase has annoyed me enough to make a change from a very good product.

title: Just like others, I've been using TurboTax since the floppy ...
content: Just like others, I've been using TurboTax since the floppy disk days. I've read about the crippled version but was hoping to take advantage of the upgrade to premium. I met all the requirements and went online to claim the refund only to get "We're unable to confirm your eligibility" Called the number provided, waited for 30 minutes on hold and gave up. Congrats TurboTax for loosing another customer!!!

title: Not worth the money if you need other than the most basics.
content: There are plenty of alternatives out there. Vote with your money.

title: Turbo Tax now a rip off...!
content: I will no longer use this product (after 12 years of using). The reason being is the change that no longer allows you to report stock sales. I've been preparing my 84 year old mothers returns year after year. She lives primarily on Social Security and sells probably $5000 in ATT stock to supplement her income. To do her taxes I would have to upgrade to the business version to report this small sale of stock. HR Block will be the product I use going forward..

title: I wondering if Intuit used Jonathan Gruber as a consultant and now thinks it's customers are stupid? So much for customer loyalt
content: The title says "Deductions & Homeowners", yet the remove Schedule D so you have to buy Premier. I would think most homeowners buy/sell some equities at least once or twice a year. Oh wait, you can still file with Schedule D but not electronically, you have to print off your forms and mail them in. What a joke! As for Bob Meighan (VP TurboTax), who is replying to people here, just be honest and admit it, Intuit wants more money and really don't care about their customers. I wondering if Intuit used Jonathan Gruber as a consultant and now thinks it's customers are stupid? So much for customer loyalty.

title: I am so disappointed to read something like this on a program that ...
content: I am so disappointed to read something like this on a program that has done my taxes for the last 12 years. After reading all the problems I have read and also surfed the net and read the same at different sites I have decided for the first time to download H&R Block program and give it a try.The price of TT doesn't bother me but the things they have removed does.I don't think any customer really minds paying a little more for a good program but when that same program starts to remove features that it's customer's have used it is time to move on. SORRY TT, another lost customer.

title: do not trust that they will auto upgrade your software ...
content: do not trust that they will auto upgrade your software up from deluxe to premier as they said they would. It did not upgrade the software. I had to call intuit and explain what was stated on the Amazon web site. They then had to mail me the premier after 1.5 hours on the phone with them.

title: Have used turbotax since it was invented, but no more
content: The unadvertised feature loss from every prior year's Deluxe version is a dirty trick. I don't want a cheating company to help me do my taxes. And I don't want them to ask me if it's OK to steal my personal information either.

title: Shame on me for not checking AMZN reviews before purchasing ...
content: Shame on me for not checking AMZN reviews before purchasing this product. Little did I know I'd get the "extortion" screen demanding an additional USD30 payment halfway through doing the income part of my return just to enter a few stock transactions. Never again, Intuit, I'm picking an alternative next year. Pure thievery.

title: Good but they charge $25 to e-file state taxes
content: This worked perfectly as advertised, and upgrading to Premium (which I needed for the schedule E) was surprisingly free. The only reason I'm giving it 3 stars instead of 5 is that they charge you $25 to E-file the State taxes.

title: No more for me
content: I have used TurboTax from my very first job and my very first tax return onwards. It was my product of choice despite their being other competitive products in the market. But this is the final straw...now I'm forced to pay extra to get the benefits that I'm used to. And to make matters worse, the VP Bob says to call some 800 number to make things better and he provides the generic email address to his most loyal customers. Seriously...time to move to H&R Block as others have suggested. Apparently, from what others have said its much cheaper and offers the same benefit and reliability - and you can import your old Turbo Tax files into it. So good bye Turbo Tax, you lost your most loyal customer.

title: These TurboTax changes scare me.
content: These TurboTax changes scare me. I have used TT Deluxe to do my taxes which include rentals and investments for over a decade. I have relied on TT Deluxe to handle my taxes, even at the last minute. I won't receive my tax documents from all my sources until close to the deadline. It bothers me that I might not be able to rely TT to handle all of it without paying for last minute updates.

title: Do your research...
content: Bought this thinking a 'deluxe' edition would include filing taxes for independent contractors. Half-way through, I get a message that I need to pay another $40 to upgrade to the Home & Business edition instead. OK. I suppose I am a "business" (I'm not) so I'd need the Business edition. Ready to file! Oh, another $25 charge from Intuit to E-file my state taxes. Thought it would be $50. Ended up costing $120.

title: Not happy
content: Not happy that I had to upgrade to the business addition because you removed the schedule c without informing your customers before buying it. I had to give one of my friends the 40 to upgrade because I didn't have my credit card so I probably won't be seeing the 25.00 rebate. Not happy at all. Thinking of switching to another software. Being using turbotax for over 15 years.

title: Abandonded it... now and forever.
content: You have seen it from everyone else... I too downloaded, installed, imported and finally had to abandon it. After twenty years (since 1995) of subtle greed that was annoying, they finally went too far for me. I uninstalled it and downloaded H&R Block. The writing to the boot track fiasco a decade ago should have been a warning that they were more concerned about missing out on a few dollars than providing a safe, usable and effective customer experience. Spending millions to oppose allowing taxpayers to file simple returns for free should have been a warning that they favored coercion to increase profits. There is no technical reason for removing code other than to reduce the cost of maintaining and updating the software... they saved a little money producing Deluxe and also made a little money by forcing users to upgrade... win-win for Intuit. As a business owner, Intuit had already forced me to abandon QuickBooks and TurboTax H&B for the same reason and now I have successfully eliminated everything Intuit from my personal activities.

title: Turbotax unpleasently surprised me.
content: I have used TurboTax successfully in the past, but this time I was caught by surprise. In the past the Deluxe version handled my stock portfolio fine. Since I am a passive stock trader (don't buy and sell) I was surprised that doing my return I got a popup saying I had to spend 30 dollars more for the "premier" addition. Now the input I got hit on was a $5 input and Intuit wanted $30 more for the upgrade. What really upset me was the difference in price on Amazon was only $15. Of course when I did the tax audit, Turbo Tax didn't catch the discrepancy and give me the go ahead. So I really don't know if I trust the software or not. Of course I could trust on their guarantee.... Otherwise the software was easy to use and interpret.

title: WOW! I just called the phone number provided by ...
content: WOW! I just called the phone number provided by the VP, and I need to buy Turbo Tax Premier if I desire to file Schedule D (cap gains, stocks) online. Those slimey bastages!!!! Am instead buying HR Block Deluxe Software (here on Amazon) for $32.99 Includes import from Turbo Tax. I will find out how well the import works. the price includes up to 5 Federal Efiles, and state tax software (filing state electronically will cost me more).me

title: Taking away basic functionality like Capital Gains and Losses
content: Really Intuit. Taking away basic functionality like Capital Gains and Losses?

title: Sad Money Grab
content: I have used turbotax since the late 1990s, but I think my run will end this year. Rather than work to improve the product, Intuit is now downgrading the features while keeping pricing the same. I have simple investment transactions that I could always report in Deluxe, but now is have to go up to the more expensive versions. I sure hope intuit listens to feedback and reverses course, but if not, I'm going to switch to Anothet brand next year.

title: You can tell accountants not sales people call the shots
content: Intuit messed up big time. They said that if you filed with them last year you could upgrade to Premier for free. IT WASN'T FREE FOR ME!! and I had filed with them for the last several years. I finally got $25 of the $32 dollars they charged me to update back. I can have someone do my taxes for me for $40. I think I'm done with them.

title: Do not buy turbo tax...
content: Will never purchase turbo tax again. Spent over 1.5 hours on phone with support and issue was never resolved. Support person was unprofessional and not knowledgable .Software is not friendly to use. Online version is different than CD version. Do not buy...

title: Intuit your greed has forced me to switch to your coompetition.
content: Time to switch companies for tax prep. Intuit you have lost my business.

title: The worst Tax Product on the market
content: I am very dissatisfied I had to wait 3 weeks for my Minnesota State Refund because this Tax Product had a big problem with Security. I have used this software for years and this year I am not happy. I will not purchase this again. Also I used to be able to file 5 federal returns now it is only one. I will go with H&R Block. Sharon Skalicky my e-mail address is ssorenson2006@yahoo.com

title: Easy to use, but increasing price is making it less of a value
content: I have used their Basic level for years. I have a simple return but needed one form that they no longer include. Not only did they raise prices, but I had to upgrade in the middle of my return and pay more to download this version. Then I tried to apply for their rebate, their apology for not including the forms that they used to. The rebate did not even cover the cost of the upgrade. I will try a different brand next year.

title: A sad day in the life of TurboTax
content: TurboTax was my bread and butter each year and now I will go somewhere else. Loyalty works both ways ya know Intuit, very sad because the change was not communicated well. It is terrible when a company kills there own product. You always offer MORE not less.

title: Tax Fail
content: Having read about Schedule's C removal from this year's addition and Intuit's response of the free upgrade I figured it would be fine and I'd figure out an alternate next year. Well, I was wrong. First off, they updated the system requirements. You need a min of MacOS 10.7 â so I canât even run it. After I called I was told the only option was to do it online which I didnât want to do. They said theyâd give me a code to upgrade to premier and another to file a 2nd return (disk allows 5). Since the rep would need to get someone else involved to get the codes for me I told them Iâd think about it and call back. Which I did last night. After 10 minutes on hold my call was dropped. Called again and spoke with a couple of people. After 104 minutes on the phone, yes, thatâs One Hundred Four minutes, I found out, that premier wouldnât let me do the schedule C which I needed, (and have used on Deluxe going back to â06) and they wouldnât provide me an upgrade to the necessary version. For years Iâve been telling people how happy I was with TurboTax. Well, no more. I couldnât be less happy. I donât know how the number of people necessary to institute these changes could all agree this was a good idea. It is a total FAIL. Iâm off to H&R Blockâs Tax Software (Tax Act which is rated higher is only available for PCs) and Iâm sure Iâll have a much easier time completing my taxes than TurboTax will have of ever getting me back as a customer, let alone brand advocate.

title: Haven't bought it / Hope I don't have to
content: I have been using this software for almost as long as I've been filing taxes. I understand prices rise (faster than my salary apparently). But removing functionality from Deluxe and putting it into the significantly pricier Premium version to make it "consistent" seems just plain wrong. It feels like they think I'm stupid enough to actually believe this argument. So I'm not reviewing the product at 1 but rather the company. I will be trying competitors products and hopefully they're good and don't someday do this... And I hope Intuit changes its heart.

title: Don't let Intuit to this to you!
content: I used TT for 20 years, notice the past tense. It on to H&R for me.

title: Disappointing ..........
content: I was disappointed last year for the first time at the "extra charges" that I needed to pay to e-file my taxes since I didn't read the fine print when I bought my turbotax edition but am outraged this year that I really need to upgrade to premier even though I have used deluxe for years on end. Next year I won't do this again. I really don't use a lot of the import features in turbotax and after reading reviews I see it is time to move on from intuit. Shame.....I have used tubotax for not just years.....but decades. Pretty poor practices to treat your customers this way. Same with quicken.....I've used it for decades but I am the silly one who upgrades every couple of years because I lose my functionality only to buy a version that really isn't any different and tablet features that are really pretty useless and slow down the program. Hopefully another company comes along and I can ditch intuit totally. As they say....it's the American way but the greedy pig also ends up on my table for dinner.

title: Buyer Beware.
content: Bought this a week ago i have been unable to download it. It keeps saying my network is unavailable but i was able to get to the download link. I have contacted amazon on this issue. All i get from them is to make sure in "Uninstall" the program and contact intuit. Emailing intuit twice last week with the required items and a week later all has been silent. This was my second online Digital Purchase and will be my last. Amazon Does not read their emails and Intuit doesn't seem to care. H&R block From Wally World Worked Perfectly. Update. Intuit did finally send a refund check. My only complaint is that they left me hanging without word for a month. But they did come through.

title: Disgusted
content: Turbo Tax should be ashamed. No form 1099B included. When I listed my question they provided, they sent me an email saying they could not answer my question by email. Huh? Then I got a message saying I would need to spend another $3O for an upgrade if I wanted access to form 1099-B. I'm 80 years old and I don't need this aggravation. Next year, I'll hire a CPA.

title: From an EX Turbo Tax user
content: I have been a Turbo Tax user for over a decade. I always spent a lot of time cussing at the screen when I was using it, but it got the job done. It almost always made at least one error, but my diligent auditing usually caught the errors (at least the ones that I caught!). And I HATED the way the mouse wheel would scroll backwards. What were they thinking?! I had always used the Basic version, even though I always had a fairly complicated Sch C and Sch E. It did the job. But I was warned off by the many negative reviews of the changes in this year's release, so I decided to give HR Block a try. This year's Block Deluxe cost me no more than previous Basic versions from Turbo Tax. This year I didn't cuss at HR Block, not even once. I will never go back to Turbo Tax. HR Block is SO much easier that it isn't even funny. The only complaint I have is that the form view is in a strange format, a little hard to read. But it is superior in every other way. And it DIDN'T make any mistakes! So yes, this isn't a review of this year's Turbo Tax-- I didn't use it. But if you've never tried HR Block, this is the perfect year to do so. You may be very surprised.

title: Don't let the $30 Door Hit You on Your Way Out.
content: Sorry TT. Just won't pay that much more for your inferior product. Goodbye Intuit. Hello H&R.

title: Being loyal customer for 10 years, but half way ...
content: Being loyal customer for 10 years, but half way down filling the form and got the shock of having to upgrade for $30 dollars for stock investment. Decided to take the pain and switched to Taxact. Bye bye TurboTax forever. Actually. the switch to Taxact is simpler for me than TT because the pdf import function of Taxact.

title: Very Dissatisfied with This Year's Purchase
content: Extremely disappointed with the fact that Turbo Tax withheld the fact that they removed program features prior to purchasing the program. The cost for the program had increased substantially this year and then I find out I have to purchase other versions in order to finish my taxes. I will definitely look at purchasing another tax program next year.

title: TurboTax Loses Another...
content: TurboTax lost another customer today. I just purchased H & R Block Deluxe w/ State for $22.48, and my TurboTax info from last year transferred perfectly. While I am not happy to have to learn a new way to do my taxes, I could not justify buying a product from a company that disrespects its customers. It has been said by many reviewers on this site, but when a company decides to remove features from a product that many loyal customers have grown accustomed to and repeatedly used year after year in an effort to squeeze out an extra $30 from them, the company has made it clear what it is that they value. Not an economics major by any means, but I do know that a lot of people aren't giving Intuit any money this year, which just might be a good wake up call for them. I had held out hope that Intuit would permanently correct this error in judgement after seeing the uproar they caused, but that doesn't look to be the case. (Didn't really feel like begging someone on the phone for products that should be there in the first place..) I would like to thank the reviewers who pointed out what TurboTax did with the Deluxe version before I actually purchased the stripped down product this year.

title: Intuit removed critical features. Shameful money grab. Been ...
content: Intuit removed critical features. Shameful money grab. Been using TuroTax for seven years. I will switch to a tax professional now, I guess.

title: Used TurboTax since Mid-90's But Now Switching
content: I've used TurboTax every year since the mid-90's but I'm dropping it now. The basic features of handling the sale of a mutual fund and being able to actually e-file it, or likewise a lowly Schedule C, have simply stripped out or the Deluxe version, because, heck, no one does that, right? But, I'm told I can buy the unenhanced, gold-plated Premiere version for 40% more than last years download to get exactly the same functionality. This is the second Netflix type blunder Intuit has made. Several years ago they dropped Quicken for the Mac because, as everyone knows, no one uses a Mac and Apple is about to go bankrupt. That worked out well. I used it since the early 90's but one day, they said it's not gong to be compatible with this new fangled Intel based Mac thing. No market there, have a good life (here's Mint). I switched to MoneyDance and could not be happier. When Intuit finally came out with a Mac version a couple years later I have not switched back and won't. So now, thank you Intuit, for helping me switch away from you as my tax software to a different vendor this year, probably TaxAct or H & R Block. One star because there is no half star.

title: Another long time user jumping ship.
content: I'm a turbo tax user of over twenty years. I had never considered the alternatives until today, but I'm making the switch to H&R Block.

title: Intuit does not communicate that it's Deluxe version is severely ...
content: Intuit does not communicate that it's Deluxe version is severely limited this year! HR Block will provide FREE robust version to purchasers of TurboTax. No more TurboTax for me. I've used it for over 20+ years. I won't support the greed of Intuit.

title: Looks like I will be joining the parade over to H&R ...
content: Looks like I will be joining the parade over to H&R Block after more years of TurboTax than I can remember. I was not impressed with the H&R Block Business version a couple of years ago, but I did revolt to the Deluxe version of H&R Block for my personal taxes about 10 years ago and had no problem switching to H&R/Tax Cut or switching back to TurboTax the next year. Based on reviews, it's a no brainer to switch to H&R Block this year if you need to file Schedule C (unless your expenses are under $100, come on!!!) or Schedule D at all. Then again, perhaps the customer may win. I recall when Intuit tried to use Digital Rights Management to limit printing to one return and the customer outrage persuaded them to recant.

title: No Schedule C
content: No schedule C

title: Great software, but beware you'll pay more (than cost of software) at the end of the process when you try to file your return
content: The software program is very user-friendly, but I was quite disappointed when I reached the end and my state return was held "hostage" until I paid (online) another $20 to file my state taxes. The program didn't offer the option to print and mail the state return. When I had the option of purchasing Turbo Tax, I bought the one that suited my needs based upon the "selling points" listed on the columns on the back of the box. This option offered federal and state e-file for the price I paid. There was no indication on the box or at any point during the process that I had to pay another $20 to file. This concept of "nickel and diming" consumers is another form of fraud. I know that numerous people have lodged recent complaints against Turbo Tax regarding various software problems and upgrades, etc. I think it's a shame that a product so user-friendly is ruining its reputation over $20. Instead of leaving consumers with a sour taste in their mouth, why don't they just change the price and sell for a set amount and not get the customer tangled up in paying additional funds to file - especially when there's no mention of that anywhere else. It's just bad business and prevents repeat customers. There's a lot of competition out there - this unethical form of business practice is one way to assure Turbo Tax will not have a loyal following and that's too bad.

title: Very disappointed! I work in a different state than where ...
content: Very disappointed! I work in a different state than where I live and only pay state taxes where I live. Turbo Tax required me to download another state which I had to pay extra for and pay more taxes to another state. This was way more expensive and time consuming than taking the taxes to my accountant.

title: Great Program...not so great company
content: I've always used TurboTax and have only good things to say about TT, but this year I've bought the H&R Block software. The changes that Intuit made to TT Deluxe this year are a deal-breaker.

title: No Schedule C
content: If you have any kind of hobby business that you previously filed using TurboTax Deluxe you can forget it. Unless of course you're willing to shell out another $40 to Intuit... After the fact.

title: Removal of Schedule D support is cause to consider alternatives
content: I am stunned to find that a relatively important feature such as Schedule D is no longer supported by TT Deluxe. I picked up the Deluxe version at Sam's as I normally do every year with the full expectation that I could do ONLY WHAT I DID LAST YEAR on the same feature level of the product. Now I'm finding that I can't, and that I'll have to do Schedule D manually, and that I can't electronically file if I do these things anyway. Manually filling out the form sort of defeats the purpose of having spent the money for software to "help" me. If the business I am in were to remove key aspects of the services we provide arbitrarily at the time our customers need us, we would lose them in record time. This action by Intuit certainly gives me reason to look at competitors - maybe not the outcome they expected with this action, but judging from the posts to this account, it looks like a few others will think that way also. I am a Quicken user as well, and I hope they don't use the same "strategy" on that product also...

title: I got it.
content: Thanks for you guys' reviews. Though I have been using TT for the past 10 years or so, I am convinced that I shouldn't buy TT2014 as a minimum and I think I can do a little more than that.

title: One Star
content: Another 20+ year TurboTax user walks away to H&R Block.....

title: I've used TT since it's inception (it was originally free ...
content: I've used TT since it's inception (it was originally free with a rebate). Based on the numerous negative reviews, I purchased H & R Block Deluxe. Thanks for the feedback, TT has lost a long-time customer forever.

title: Turbo Tax _ Idnetity Theft Headquarters
content: I bought my 2014 Turbo Tax at Costco but I don't think it would matter. After using the Deluxe version for at least 10 years this year has been a disaster! My Federal and State have been rejected twice, I've called their 1-800 # and waited and then the person I got couldn't tell me how to fix the problem that the e-mail said they could fix. I had to leave town for a few days and when I got home I had a letter from the IRS stately my Identity has been compromised and after being married to my wife for 47 years I was now married to Mary Caprara. I went into a contract with Turbo Tax that offered me a way to do my tax return and in return I would be offered a safe platform to enter my personal information WITHOUT my Identity being at risk because of poor, lax or possibly criminal neglect on the part of Turbo Tax. So here I sit 3 weeks later not knowing what to do. My IRS form 5071C offers me a website to Verify my identity but cannot do it, Their phone number1-800-830-5084 which is a special number to help people with an Identity theft issue tells you everyday to call back tomorrow or go to the website that doesn't work. I have a refund of around 1,500 and I'm not sure if I'm even going to file this year. If I do It might be the seed money I need to start a class action suit against TurboTax! What you you think the odds are for me to use them next Year? Probably better than seeing this in print on the "Review List".

title: One Star
content: Not offering schedule D is ridiculous.

title: Really, the product is great! Come to our site and check it out!
content: If you're looking for a good laugh, check out Intuit's customer reviews of TurboTax Deluxe 2014 here: (...) 4.7 out of 5 stars with 972 reviews as of this writing... Who are these people? Employees?

title: I've been using turbo tax for years and never had ...
content: I've been using turbo tax for years and never had an issue, that is until this year. Program kept timing out and wouldn't let me file my state taxes, called 3 times waited on hold for over 3 hours only to have person hang up on me while I was explaining my problem. I ended up printing my taxes and mailing in.

title: DO NOT BUY - IF YOU HAVE A HOME SALE!!!!
content: DO NOT BUY - IF YOU HAVE A HOME SALE!!!! you will have to BUY Premier for $30 more. Use another program!!! RIPOFF!!!

title: I was about to purchase Turbo Tax Deluxe as I ...
content: I was about to purchase Turbo Tax Deluxe as I do every year, but the negative reviews stopped me. I've got a few capital gains that should be reported, and I'm not going to purchase Premium just for that. Bye Bye Turbo Tax

title: Buggy software with poor support.
content: It was supposed to provide the upgrade to the Premium edition automatically. But when time came for the update, the program claimed it couldn't connect to the internet (Completely false). I had to google for an answer to this problem. An obscure phone number in an error message was the answer. But I still had to wait 30 minutes for a response from the call center to provide me with a certification number to plug into a form to enable the feature. THEN when it was time to download the state tax software, the same problem recurred. Another 30 minute call to customer support followed by another 20 minutes while the support rep tried to figure out what to do. Never again.

title: FREE forms cost an extra $20.00 to file.
content: I feel like I am being gouged. The deluxe version allows you to download one State's tax forms for FREE, but if I want to E-file those State's forms, it cost you an extra $20. If I wanted to print hard copies and mail them, I could have gone to the State's website and downloaded them for FREE. I am guessing I could have gone to all 50 State's websites and downloaded the forms for FREE. Very deceptive. I had to spend more time figuring out why I was being charged the extra $20.00 than it took to fill out the State Form. Apparently the H&R program will allow you to import TurboTax data to their program. I think I will move in that direction next year. Cue the canned response from TurboTax.

title: Software glitch they knew about.
content: They had software issues this year 2014 tax year. So a lot of people got resequenced which made them wait even longer for refund. Turbo tax you lost loyal customer for ever.

title: Making me want to switch to H&R Block
content: What? I have bought this software for years! The NEW "not improved" version is making me think H&R Block, here I come. No Form D....wow, thanks for nothing Intuit.

title: Thanks for the "heads-up"
content: I'm so glad I read these reviews before purchasing the 2014 TurboTax. I have just purchased H&R Block Deluxe and was pleased with the ease of downloading and installation.

title: One Star
content: TurboTax user for 20 years.....now their greed has pushed me to H&R Block

title: Based upon all the negative reviews of TutboTax Deluxe 2014 ...
content: Based upon all the negative reviews of TutboTax Deluxe 2014 and being a long time user of TurboTax, I have changed my decision from using TurboTax Deluxe 2014 to using H&R Block Tax Preparation software. Whether Intuit gets the message doesn't matter if enough former users change to another tax prep software.

title: THis year was a total rip off. The removed ...
content: THis year was a total rip off. The removed commonly used forms and asked for an upgrade to file your taxes.

title: H&R Block sounds like the solution
content: Have been using Turbo Tax since the days of DOS, but no longer. H&R Block sounds like the solution. Too bad Intuit did not really think this one through!!!

title: You Blew It Intuit - I'm Leaving You
content: Sorry Intuit, you've lost a customer loyal to you since the early 90's in annually using your TurboTax products. What you've done to TurboTax Deluxe 2014 so that now we have to spend more for Premier takes away any and ALL incentive to continue using any TurboTax product. I hope tens of thousands of people move to either H & R Block software, or that of TaxAct. P.S. I will also migrate from Quicken (another Intuit product) to a competitors finance software. Let's face it, YOU BLEW IT!

title: Be careful buying the 2014 Deluxe
content: I've been using Turbo Tax Deluxe for many years with no problems. Loved it. Now I found out that they have eliminated the Schedule C and D, forcing you to buy the Home and Business edition for $30 more. I have a small part time business and I receive a 1099 MISC for around $5,000 at the end of the year, so now I have to purchase the Home and Business edition. Not sure if this was intentional or just all of the new platforms that have come online. Turbo Tax claims they had no choice, so I will take them at their word. Update: I called TT support and they are sending me the Home and Business edition for the same price as TT Deluxe.

title: Tthis year is slightly misleading and restricted. Not Deluxe.
content: I am grudgingly giving Turbo Tax three stars. Why? 5 stars for the product itself being awesome. It really does help you get the most money back that you can get. It's very easy to use. it efiles quickly. Feds responded with receiving an HOUR later! State the next day. Hurray! They offer the Amazon matching gift card, which is really handy, since we buy stuff here anyway. That paid for the program easily. -1 star. It says Fed+State+Fed Efile. What is DOESNT say is that to *efile* your State taxes, that'll be another 19.99. Yep. You then have to pay them more. Super misleading product. -1 star. It's pretty basic anymore. I was able to add some very small amounts of income under miscellaneous income (I try and report everything, better safe than sorry), but had I made enough and gotten a 1099 for that income, I would have had to upgrade or use a different product. Really? How the hell is this "Deluxe" then if it wont even handle a 1099? Ugh. At least I read the reviews before I bought, so I knew this. But I will still fault them for this, because the complaint is very legit and it is a very bad fault. C'mon, TurboTax! This is BS. If you have basic stuff, like you get a W-2 or two, own a home, drive a car, have some kids, maybe have a few expenses of whatever (job related, some medical expenses, etc), this should do you fine. If you have enough hobby income to warrant a 1099, or you have some stock sales or whatever? This is NOT your product. It used to be in years prior, but not for 2014.

title: Worst TurboTax Ever
content: Worst version of TurboTax ever. I've been using TT for 15 years, and this year will definitely be my last. Yes, it eventually got me everything I needed, but it's very clunky to use and very frustrating. If you have to change anything after it's done (which I have to do almost every year), it literally forces you to walk through all of the idiot-prompts in that section step by step, just to change one field - and doesn't even remember all the information you already previously entered; it forces you to re-enter all the information in that section all over again, even if it's not pertinent to the changes you're making. The whole process took at least twice as long as it has in the past, and feels like it was jammed together at the last minute, just to get it out the door; so I feel I can no longer trust Intuit, and will move to a different product next year.

title: Give credit when credit is due
content: I began this year's saga with Turbotax back in December when the rebellion against the new versions was in full swing. I swore that I was done with Intuit forever; I'd rather file manually then to go along with the higher price of the "enhanced" versions for the same features I had always gotten with Deluxe. My review of one star at the time was rejected by Amazon - - I'll admit my anger got the best of me. Happily now I see that Intuit has made good and corrected their marketing fopar. I purchased Deluxe today and immediately received a free upgrade to make it feature neutral with last year's version. A happy customer once again. All's well that ends well. Thank you Intuit for listening to your customers.

title: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT
content: I tried to submit my taxes at the end of January. While the file was transferring to the federal gov't, my computer crashed. When I re-opened, the file was corrupted. I submitted a ticket online for support. In turn, Intuit asked for log files so they could investigate. As of 3/7/2015, they have NEVER gotten back to me. So today, I tried to call them to get some live support. You will never find a customer service number. You have to process a question online in order for them to give you the coveted number. So, I go through this process, call them and 2 hours later they still have not resolved my issue. Oh, and I forgot to mention, when I first tried to process my taxes in January, TurboTax charged my account $20 for the transmission that never took place! I've used TurboTax every year for about 10 years. This is THE LAST year. Never again. If you're thinking about buying this product, DON'T.

title: Turbotax lost a 10+ years customer.
content: Turbotax was not perfect, but sure was convenient, and somehow I found myself looking at 10+ and then some years worth of Turbotax return files. The convenience of just transferring the previous year return, and using familiar software that was pretty good overall, despite glitches, was just too good. NO MORE!!! Intuit and their greed finally got me to switch to the competition. Bye, TurboTax... you have changed, and I have not...You became overpriced, you dropped features, you tried to gouge me and use me, and hoped I would stay because of our long relationship. Wrong! Removing features and making lawyerspeak excuses was the final straw. Intuit, in case you forgot, you are not the only one making tax prep software. Perhaps my departure, and, no doubt, thousands of others, will remind you of that. For more info, https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/TurboTax

title: Intuit Has Lost A Long Time Customer....
content: I switched to the H&R product, they haven't played screw the customer yet, and seems to be just as functional. Intuit has lost a long time customer here.

title: An Open letter to Bob Meighan - This year, Turbo Tax is CONFUSING!
content: I've used Turbo Tax since 1998, and I was going to pre-order it again this year, but I keep reading rumors that Schedule C (which I use) and Schedule D (which I don't use) were once, but are no longer included in Deluxe. Bob Meighan has rebutted that limited Schedule C is available in Deluxe, but the TurboTax website as of November 15 still says nothing about it -- see for yourself: https://turbotax.intuit.com/personal-taxes/compare.jsp So, an open letter to Bob: I'm not paying $89-99 for the Home+Business version, and I'm not "taking your word for it" on the Deluxe version. If you want to save face and regain me as a customer, please fix your company's website to accurately reflect what the Deluxe product can and can't do with regard to small businesses, home businesses, and stock trades. Your sales will thank you.

title: Last time Intuit will scam me
content: For lack of automatic upload to schedule D I am switching to H&R Block. I already purchased TT deluxe so I am going to Switch to the free Block program for people like me. I received my free H&R Block 2014 tax deluxe download easily (sent email with scan of turbo receipt). It loaded all my 2013 data quickly. Started my return and like all new software, took a little time to learn how it works. Not more difficult than Turbotax, just different. All in I am VERY GLAD I switched to Block and no longer am I captive of Intuit. With Intuit you don't feel like a valued customer - you feel like they control you because you've bought their software and you are locked in.

title: Bait and Switch: fewer forms than before, but just as expensive!
content: I'm done. I've used TurboTax for a decade with no issues until now. I have a pretty simple tax situation. But this year I need to file a 1099-b form for a $50 gain on an investment I sold. I just found out the Deluxe version I'd always relied on won't let you get this common form - you have to upgrade to the Premiere ($$$) version. I dare you to find that little nugget of information on the packaging. I'm not waiting to find out what surprise up-charges are in store for me next year from Intuit. I'm retuning my unopened version and looking for alternatives. Taxpayers, beware! Look at all your tax forms and make sure they're supported before you buy any version. This used to be called "bait and switch", now its just a "brand tier strategy". TaxAct, H&R Block, or my friends accountant are getting my business now.

title: ANGRY in Orlando
content: Easy to use, but all the self-prepatory software programs are pretty easy these days. I find the software to be on the expensive side, slightly, compared with others but I am very upset at the expense of $30 to have my refund check deposited into my checking account - for my federal refund and an additional $20 for the state refund to be deposited into my account. That means that I spent over $50 for the purchase of the software disc, plus another $50 for automatic deposits for my refunds. Too much money. Lastly, I tried submitting my state refund and because of a computer glitch or some other lame excuse for international scamming, I was sent an email apologizing for the inconvenience and was offered a $25 rebate on my TurboTax purchase. I found this to be an absolute joke as I entered my info and ID number of my product and was informed that my purchase wasn't eligible for the rebate/payment for inconvenience. What a friggin' joke. This has PO'd me to the point that this will be my last Intuit purchase and I will not recommend your products to anyone from this point forward. BTW - I have used TurboTax for probably 20 years now and as I said - NO MORE.

title: Does NOT Support Schedule C (Self Employment Income)
content: Do not buy Deluxe if you have any self employment income, they force you to upgrade to Home&Business edition for an additional $40. I've used TurboTax since the 90's and have finally had it. I've submitted a refund request to ereturns@intuit.com based on their 60 day satisfaction guarantee, but have not heard back. I bought H&R Block Deluxe (http://amzn.com/B00P6U8B96) for $35 which is cheaper than the $40 Inuit wants from me to upgrade. It doesn't include state, but since I live in Washington state that doesn't matter to me. It easily imported my TurboTax 2013 file and it allowed me to enter my self employment income. I haven't completed the entire interview yet, but so far it seems like I'll be happy with my decision.

title: Goodbye Turbo Tax, Hello H & R Block. ...
content: Goodbye Turbo Tax, Hello H & R Block. I have used TT for many years and now that Intuit wants to gouge us to e-file Schedule D I will be moving on. Intuit almost lost me as a customer when I was required to upgrade my copy of Quicken because it was 3 years old and as such, my existing software would no longer update bank, credit cards, brokerages, etc. Now that Intuit has shown that all they care about is generating more revenue at our expense, I will be looking for a Quicken replacement also. So long Intuit.

title: One Star
content: Thanks to all for the heads up about Intuit's bait and switch with the versions of TurboTax.

title: Greed and Stupidity = Lost Customers
content: Add me to the list of unhappy longtime customers. Goodbye Intuit.... there is a point of no return and you have taken your customers there.

title: Absolutely not, did not accept Schedule D though appeared ...
content: Absolutely not, did not accept Schedule D though appeared to. Requested upgrade but only with proof of purchase from original transaction 8 weeks ago. Gave up , wrote it off and went to private preparer. I had been using for Turbotax for 5 years with no previous problem. Totally dis-satisfied!!!

title: MAC Users: There's a Leopard Lurking In The Background!
content: I have no qualms with the ease and accuracy of this tax program. I have used it the past nine years. HOWEVER, I do have issues with having to update my MAC Mini OS for no other reason than to utilize your software. There were no CAUTION stickers on your 2014 TT box that informed me of this new requisite! (In retrospect TT sales would have suffered if providing a disclaimer for all MAC users.) Being a casual computer user I did not foresee the inordinate length of time nor the hurdles encountered in performing my usual tax return WHICH until 2014 had been hassle-free and a piece of cake. I am truly interested and would appreciate a response from TT as to why I had to incorporate this OS update. My tax preparations are complete and have received my first Refund (Thank You), but remaining in the wake of this possibly, unneeded upgrade are some computer performance issues that seem to be related to this OS upgrade. At this time I am pissed off at the NEW slowness of this once rapid-fire system; I have read of similar complaints regarding MAC OS 10.xx online installations. Fortunately, there are other tax programs of like capabilities.

title: Rip Off
content: I need Schedule E for Royalty income but no expenses. I can't even enter the amount on the first page of 1040. What a stinking sneaky deal.

title: One Star
content: Having major problems downloading the program

title: Turbo Tax Too Expensivr
content: This years turbo tax was disappointing. I paid an extra 39.99 to file my state info. I was told that it included efiling. After entering state info, I was charged 24.99 to efile. I will not be using this program next year.

title: It's a scam
content: I purchased this at Costco, should not have purchased it at all. Turbo tax was fine once upon a time, but now it's just a scam to take as much money as possible while providing the least value. I could have prepared my taxes myself in the amount of time it took to go through Turbo tax. The true cost of the software is not obvious at first because even the 'delux' version doesn't support basic tax circumstances ... the software WILL force you to throw it away or upgrade to premium, and then you'll get charged again for your state e-file. The name of the game is bait and switch - offer you one purchase price, but take more money as you enter more data into the software. By the time you get to the end, you've already spent hours entering your information and you're ready to quit, so you're that much more likely to pay the extra fees to upgrade or e-file, since this software is pretty much useless without those features. It's a scam and as a former long-time turbotax user I'm pretty pissed. Even if they improve their software and stop gouging people and lying about the features you get for the original purchase price, I will never again be their customer.

title: Turbotax greed
content: Thanks for nothing Turbotax, I have used your product for over 20 years, but no more. You just lost another customer in your greed.

title: Schedule E user
content: Sad to hear about schedule E now being forced to go to Premier or just as bad mail in the forms, that is a sad joke. I have been using you since the 90's. I truly dislike HR Block, but I'm going elsewhere and if that is all that's left, oh well.

title: Thank you reviewers for the heads-up on the current TT ...
content: Thank you reviewers for the heads-up on the current TT Deluxe product! I was FURIOUS about 2 years ago when I attempted to sign in to TT online to do my taxes as I had been doing for years, and they 'enhanced' their security by REQUIRING CUSTOMERS' SOCIAL SECURITY NUMBER to complete the sign in process! I thought it was OUTRAGEOUS, INTRUSIVE, AND ENTIRELY OUT OF LINE to require such personal information in order to log in (and I communicated this with TT)! I was unable to access my previous years' taxes because I ABSOLUTELY REFUSE TO PROVIDE MY SS# as part of their sign in process. At that point I considered dumping TT, but instead I began buying the CD programs. Now that I've learned about TT's price gouging, how much cheaper H&R Block is, and the simple process of transferring TT data to the H&R program ...I'm jumping ship. Time for change!

title: Not Willing to Pay More!
content: Adios Turbo Tax, it was good while it lasted. I'm not willing to pay more because you took out schedules from the Deluxe edition.

title: This is absolute BS. They claim the software will ...
content: This is absolute BS. They claim the software will upgrade to Premiere automatically, free of charge for those that need it, but it doesn't. I need to file a 1099 but it won't let me unless I spend an additional $30 to upgrade to their Premiere edition. This is even after Intuit claims its being offered for free. Such bs.

title: Paid your extortion fee for the last time.
content: I've been using TurboTax for as long as I can remember and have been a loyal customer even when there were less expensive alternatives... but no more. Last year I paid the usual for the Deluxe version since it has always done what was needed. Lo and behold I get to my investments and find out that I have to spend more to get the upgrade to Premier in order to do my taxes. Frankly, I feel like this was extortion, sure it's still cheaper than having someone prepare my taxes but I don't feel the price is justified. It's not like you're reinventing the wheel. I'm done as a loyal customer. I've already bought HR Block's tax software... it does what I need for half the price.

title: Never Buy
content: Deceptive marketing, will NEVER buy again. Once again, a company takes a psoture of Screw our cutomer's - MAKE them pay MORE

title: One Star
content: I hate being gouged. This is an example of not under-estimate the customers.

title: Intuit spent $2,830,000 on lobbying in 2014, now I need to pay for an upgrade to feed the beast. Never again.
content: I'm done with Intuit. I already hated being gauged with mandatory upgrades of their QuickBooks software every three years. Now they've switched around the types of refunds I can file with TurboTax. Year after year since 2007 I've used TurboTax. Always the Deluxe version. This year, I need up upgrade to Premiere. I don't care about the discount, or about the "we so solly" spiel. That's this year. Next year it'll be "we told you so" and done. Forms I imported into TurboTax are now essentially taken for ransom until I pay up for the upgrade. Intuit has built up a solid customer base that they think they can squeeze. It's no wonder they spend millions lobbying politicians to keep tax filing complicated. Luckily there's choice, and I'll be exercising it on my 2015 return.

title: No schedule D
content: No schedule D.....Good bye turbo tax. Update....I called Turbo Tax and they provided a free upgrade to Premier...but warned me that next year I would need to purchase Premier. Thank you Turbo Tax, but in the future you should make it very clear on the cover of you product that it was changed, not in the small print. I have been using Turbo Tax for almost 20 years, but the H&R Block pricing has always caught my eye. I think next year is time for a change...especially since HRB will transfer your old data.

title: not great however. Intuit has lost my business forever
content: I have used turbo tax for several years. I use schedule d as well as k1's from my mlp investments. This is a sneaky, cowardly way to increase prices. I have always used the deluxe version and it was okay, not great however. Intuit has lost my business forever. I will be switching to tax act this year. Turbotax did not handle my k1's very well last year anyway, so why would i pay extra to buy the premier version this year. If these jerks wanted a price increase thy should man up and just increase the price of the deluxe version. I have usd tax act before and it is much cheaper and handles k1's much better than turbo-ripoff. I would give these jerko's zero stars if i could.

title: Just Not IN-TO-IT
content: Glad I read reviews about watered-down version of this product I've used exclusively for over 15 years before wasting my money. With all the bad PR about the switcheroo, it is time to sell shares of Intuit and buy some H&R Block...and change tax software while I'm at it so I can file the Schedule D. Buh-bye Turbo Tax, I'm sorry we had to end this way...but it was YOU!

title: One Star
content: Long time turbotax user and dropping capital gains from deluxe is a deal breaker ... switching to H&R Block

title: even with an excellent internet connection
content: I've used Turbo Tax for perhaps 10 years Never a problem. However, with the Amazon version there is a software failure. The version requires a software update to finalize and file electronically. However, every time you attempt to do the update, even with an excellent internet connection, the update process locks and never completes. Did all the work of doing the taxes but have spent several days simply trying to finalize the process and file but the program won't update or finalize.

title: After using TurboTax for many years I was reluctant to ...
content: After using TurboTax for many years I was reluctant to switch to a new software but was concerned after reading dissatisfied customers. After seeing TurboTax was offering a free upgrade from Deluxe if needed I thought I would give it one more try. Big mistake!! The free upgrade will not download, you get a message to call Intuit and a space to enter your upgrade confirmation number. I am on my second attempt to contact customer support. First attempt ended with my phone going dead after being on hold for 68 minutes. I am 57 minutes into my second attempt regretting my purchases. I will be using my hold time to research an alternative tax software.

title: Got screwed by them last year with the online version ...
content: Got screwed by them last year with the online version. Now they are out to soak the rest of their customers. I will switch to Block and will never use Turbotax again.

title: After 20+ years this looks like a good time to move on and explore what ...
content: After 20+ years this looks like a good time to move on and explore what the competition has to offer.

title: TurboTax is misleading. If you own a Mac, do not purchase it!
content: I purchased this program to do my taxes as it was supposed to work with a Mac Computer. IT DID NOT! I was forced to purchase a PC just to be able to use this program to do my taxes. I tired to contact TurboTax and never received an answer as to why it did not work with my Mac computer. It did work with the used PC I purchased in order to do my taxes but only give the program two stars due to the fact that it did not work as advertised by not working on a Mac computer and also because writing to Turbo Tax did not good as no one replied to my request for assistance as to the program not working with a Mac when the label on the packaging stated it did.

title: A terrible experience in 2015
content: We had used Turbo Tax several times in the past and were very satisfied. This year was an absolute nightmare. Although Turbo Tax confirmed that our return was sent to and received by the Federal Government, it was not. I also submitted our NYS Income tax at the same time and got a cryptic pop up telling me that "I must file it at the same time as my federal" (which I was doing). It also said that I could file the State Tax separately but it would not allow me to do so and kept popping up the same message. A call to the Turbo Tax help line resulted in a 45 minute wait only to have the agent say "Oh yes...New York State..a lot of problems with that one." She then put me on hold for another 15 minutes. When she returned, I heard her say "I can't deal with this" and I was disconnected. Being April 15th, I was forced to file for an extension and then manually submitted my Federal and State Forms I am totally dissatisfied with Turbo Tax and especially with their no-help line which is an absolute joke. It was a total waste of money and time for us.

title: Bad move Intuit!
content: Add one more long time TT user that will be moving to H&R Block software after seeing the shady actions by Intuit. I've used TT for at least 15 years and need a reliable tax software that I can use with rental property. I don't care what kind of "special" offers they offer this year to appease the outrage of all of their customers by cutting a large portion of functionality out of the deluxe version while still charging the same price. What about next year? Might as well start with a new company while my info will still import from TT properly this year. Typical short range outlook by another large corporation.

title: Turbo Tax, We'll Miss You!
content: Thanks for the information and your assessment of Turbo Tax 2014. I would have to agree that what I glean from your early impression of this product, as well as the comments by so many others with similar opinions, that Intuit has made a VERY POOR CHOICE in the direction theyâve taken for Turbo Tax this year. Having worked in the corporate world for many years, I would imagine that this unfortunate path that Intuit has taken with TurboTax is most likely due to the disastrous input of some newly âacquiredâ corporate executive who was totally focused on increasing immediate profit, instead of retaining patron loyalty. (Ironically, he/she probably got a VERY Big Bonus for gravely damaging this product!) Sadly, the new corporate model of the 21st Century is based entirely upon short-term gain (get in, get it, get out). Meanwhile, attending to customer needs to retain customer loyalty is becoming an âOld Schoolâ silly Grandpa notion. Now, though a LONG time Turbo Tax customer, I am taking a hard look at other products. Thanks again for taking the time to share your experiences.

title: Tech Support? NOT! Minus the 1 star I was forced to give
