content: Bad enough that they stripped the pgm down without telling us BUT now I find a blatant error that according to software rules can NOT exist. And when I try to report this to the TURBO Tax people surprise surprise there is no link for ANY technical support. You should ALWAYS be leery of software that does not have Contact info for tech support. What it comes down to is that when I was asked the following question: "Did (child) Receive a Scholarship or Grant in 2014?" BOTH radio buttons are one and I can NOT change them. We all know that the answer can NOT be both YES and NO. See Attached screen print AND no it wasn't photoshopped

title: Loyal Customers Betrayed by Intuit
content: I have been using Turbo Tax deluxe since 2004. I have always had dividends and capital gains to report. I purchased Deluxe this year (for 2014 tax year). When I got to the Capital Gains part of the walk through, I was informed on screen that "Deluxe no longer supports investment income". I would need to upgrade to Premiere at a cost of $30. Further they state that I will get $25 back after I complete and submit my Federal Return. They make this offer to help Deluxe customers transition to Premiere for this year. I wonder if they can be trusted to actually return the $25, or will they refuse based on some technicality. So there you have it! An unbelievable fraud perpetrated on their own loyal customers. I would not complain if there was a BIG label on the box in RED stating that Deluxe no longer supports investment income. No. I like many others I learned this after I started the return. Unbelievable! This WILL be the last year that I ever use Turbo Tax.

title: One Star
content: Just about everything that needed to said has been. I read the reviews here before purchasing.

title: Intuit is no longer a company trustworthy for a long term relationship if they continue the thought of a temporary touchup.
content: An update for what I tried. (1) The H&R Block software is not a bad choice in computing taxes. However, the download option (from financial intitutions) is much limited. If you have many transactions in trading, TurboTax is still a better choice. (2) Intuit's pricing is a mess. As an example, there are two TTD on Amazon. One is "Fed+State+Fed Efile" for $49.97. Another one is "Fed+Fed Efile" for $39.99. Yet, as tested with my colleagues, both copies come only with free printed State Filing (both can download on state filing). This make us who paid $49.97 like fool. With this, my rating is not changed. Intuit is no longer a company trustworthy for a long term relationship, regardless what they do now as a temporary touch-up. The typical trend in the software industry is to provide more functions for the same ore less cost. It appears Intuit is going against this trend. This is truly a bad business decision, regardless whether Intuit admits it or not. With a rate so low on Amazon.com, I am surprised to see that the VP of Intuit still expects to garner NEW customers (by providing only free upgrades to returning ones). This tells us something about the wisdom of Intuit's management, and their attitude toward customers. I purchased a CD as I used to do for many years before I found this discussion. Guess I am qualified to call for a free upgrade. Yet, I'd rather try a free H&R Block offer (please search for SwitchToBlock@hrblock.com) and decided to return the TurboTax CD.

title: I hate greedy companies.
content: Since hearing the news, I too agree with everyone. Was planning to get TurboTax as with every other year for the past 10+ years; now with all good things it must come to an end. Time for a change, and as everyone suggested, H&R Block maybe a good alternative. I too hate price gouging, and at this point even if H&R Block cost more than TurboTax, I will no longer use them till they go back to the way they are.

title: TurboTax has lost this life long customer...
content: I have been using TurboTax for as long as there has been TurboTax. What they are doing with pricing and leaving out functionality is inexcusable. I have decided to use HR Block software instead. What a shame TurboTax, you have lost your way. You once were a great company and with good pricing and functionality. You can right this wrong buy allowing us to update to get the forms and interviews needed at no additional costs.

title: A nightmare of problems
content: I was dismayed by the problems I had using the Deluxe version this year!! I had to upgrade online when I started to use it and then even had to pay $30 additionally; $25 was refunded after so many of us complained of a 'bait-and-switch' scheme this year. When I resumed using it, I had entry problems, so bad that I had to contact Intuit directly for help. A rep there ended up GIVING me the Premier version which was difficult to download; repeatedly tried to get it installed and finally was successful. When I went to use the state forms, they were locked up even though I was supposed to have free access to one state for filing. Had to contact Intuit AGAIN for help and it was eventually resolved; then had to pay $19.99 to file electronically the state copy. I seriously doubt that I will ever use TurboTax again after many years of usage. They seem to have lost their way!!

title: One Star
content: does not cover my needs. I returned it to intuit for a refund. Still waiting for the check

title: Unethical TurboTax
content: Based on TurboTax unethical marketing trick(s); I have changed to the H&R Block software.

title: Let the buyer beware
content: This edition of TurboTax would not download. Since it is not returnable and not refundable, I can't really say it even deserves one star. It's presumably a scam of some sort and it grieves me to say so for I have been an Amazon fan from the beginning. But, let the buyer beware.

title: I thought that I did not have any stock transactions ...
content: I thought that I did not have any stock transactions but in reviewing my 1099s I realized I did. I had purchased the Deluxe version and the product description says that I can upgrade for free after Feb 7th. Not only can I not upgrade for free (it displays a $30 upgrade fee) I can't even get it to upgrade - it just keeps telling me that everything has been restored.

title: got better each year and was clearly the leader because they ...
content: I have been using Turbo Tax Deluxe every year since it first came out as a DOS program. In the beginning it was cheap, got better each year and was clearly the leader because they listened to their users and subsequently kept improving the product. Somewhere along the line their hat size became very large and they decided the Users were there to be used. So they set up a business model which dumps the user in favor of pure Intuit Turbo Tax GREED. The product is nearly useless unless you go to a more expensive version and then that product still doesn't get your taxes done in many cases. I'm shopping for something new and I will post it here when I find a good replacement. Sucks.

title: Running back wont work next year.
content: I would have given 5 stars after TurboTax undid all there product changes, but I'm just too bothered by the 3 things they did this year: 1. change the software without good notice, documentation and/or a way to check last years return to see which version you now needed. 2. undoing the changes to the software in early February because of the backlash. 3. price being so much higher than there competitors. I've been using TurboTax for over 10 years and loved it for all those years, but depending on what they do next year this may be the last time I use TurboTax. I hope they consider matching there competitors product offers and match prices next year or I'll go learn how the competitors software works. I know for one thing I'm going to be watching for them to pull something next year.

title: Normal user steered away by all the negitive reviews
content: Well I am glad I read the reviews. I don't even need any of the schedules but that's alot of money when someone offers another option for half the price. Maybe TurboTax will figure it out next year.

title: Have used TurboTax since 1989; switching to H&R Block software this year
content: I refuse to pay $30 more this year than last year just to get Schedule D. UPDATE: WOW. I see that VP Bob Meighan left his pathetic "We understand that change can be challenging..." spiel on the reviews before and after mine, but apparently thought that my 24 years of using TurboTax didn't warrant an invitation to call, grovel and beg for the premier version. Well, Bob, if I had any remaining doubts about the weak-brained decision makers at Intuit, you have provided crystal clarity. My next stop, to buy and download H&R Block's tax software, since I'll gladly pay for decently priced, full-featured software. Too bad you decided to ruin TurboTax Deluxe.

title: TurboTax sucks now - stay away
content: I have used TurboTax for 10+ years and it has now, sadly, gone to hell. This year the basic software from my pre-ordered CD would not install properly or give me the "free" upgrade for what I had originally ordered and paid for. The online so-called "help" did not address the issue and I waited for an hour to get a call back from customer support. The first call was able to fix that problem (why did it take a call?), but then I encountered another problem trying to download my State return. I waited 2 hours for a call back from the so-called customer service, then was put on hold for another 25 minutes( so far) with no response. This once great company has apparently hired monkeys and retards to do their programming. Adios, TurboTax - never again.

title: Don't buy if you have stock sales...
content: Arrrrgh! I've been using TurboTax since the middle 90s, so let me add my scream of disappointment to all the others. I bought the deluxe version on Amazon without even glancing at the new upper tier versions...not being a stock churner, I'd had little trouble preparing my taxes with the deluxe version. To find that even one stock sale would prevent me from using e-file is more than just disappointing, it's a deal breaker. Intuit has made some fairly egregious customer service gaffes in the past, but this one takes the cake. I'm going to hold my nose and switch to H&R Block software. I'm sorry that since I've already opened the package and installed the TurboTax software I can't get my money back from Amazon. Shame on you Intuit. Update: I've mellowed a bit; I tried to talk to Customer Service about a free upgrade to Premier, but was disconnected after about 10 minutes waiting in queue. I'll give it one more try tomorrow before jumping to another software company. It would be so much simpler if Intuit just pushed an upgrade to users when they clicked "update". That way no one has to be on the telephone forever...neither users nor customer service reps.

title: Wait time was almost 2 hours and waste of time
content: I have been using Turbo Tax more than 10 years, I don't know causes but I had hard times e-filing State's return for 2014 and had to call TurboTax to purchase by phone. Wait time was almost 2 hours and waste of time. I have to consider alternate software for 2015.

title: One Star
content: As like all the others, I'm done with TT. I switched over to H&R Block. Dumb move TT.

title: One Star
content: False advertising. Does not work if you have a K-1

title: Jerks
content: Never Ever Again!

title: No Schedule C! Tens of Millions of Taxpayers like me need it!
content: No Schedule C! George Orwell's 1984 has arrived!

title: TurboTaxed, TurboAxed, and TurboGouged
content: I have a recent computer with Windows 7. Turbotax is horrible. I got an error when I ran the updater. I was able to use the program, but it appears I do not have the updated forms, so the return is useless. In addition, I got a similar error and could not even download State. Program is even more useless. Also, they downgraded what comes with Deluxe so I would have to upgrade to get what Deluxe has had for the last couple years. Intuit has become a gouging software company. Quicken is another good example, where features are disabled if you do not upgrade.

title: This works, but...
content: I have used Turbo Tax for years so I'm comfortable with it. I understand some people are unhappy because they keep jacking the price and taking features away. Losing the added feature didn't affect me though. I think I will try something new and cheaper this coming tax season. Intuit should be adding value, not taking it away.

title: Bait and Switch
content: Don't even waste your time. I've been using Deluxe for years now and it has handled my taxes fine until this year. When I had to add some info for a 1099-B, it said I had to upgrade to the Premier version to finish my taxes. WHAT A CROCK OF %$#@. Talk about a bait and switch. So I reluctantly paid the $30 upgrade fee so I can finish. Supposedly there was an offer for a free upgrade, but I never got one. There is a $25 dollar rebate for my trouble but I'm still out $5. Needless to say, Intuit has lost me as a customer. Get some other program, instead of TurboTax.

title: TurboTax is not worth the premium and their arrogance cost them my business this year
content: In protest of their arrogance and after using TurboTax consistently since 2009, and intermittently for several years before that, I just purchased another tax preparation software (by H&R Block) for much less than this. It is a tax software package I have used in the past and I have also ran comparisons to see if one or the other resulted in a better refund. They were both the same - within pennies of each other. So while TurboTax may have a slicker user interface it does not, in my opinion, provide any advantage in terms of maximized refund over their primary competition. If you are competent enough to know what you are doing and can live without the glitzy interface, then save yourself a few dollars and look elsewhere.

title: BUYER BEWARE - SOFTWARE GLITCH - TURBO TAX does not back their 100% Accuracy Guarantee
content: Buyer Beware... Turbo Tax does not back up their 100% Accuracy Guarantee. I have been using Turbo Tax for years and was contemplating changing this year to another software because of all the controversy. I wish I had. I processed and filed my return and then found out that the Deluxe Turbo Tax software had a bug in it when it processed the HSA data for year 2015. I received a SIGNIFICANTLY lower refund ($1,790) than I would have had it processed the data correctly. I called customer service , spent over 2 hours waiting on hold, was switch to two people. The "customer service" representative indicated this was a known software issue but since I had filed my return Turbo Tax would file an amended return on my behalf once the software glitch was fixed (which was about an 8 day wait from the time I called). The "customer service" representative said he would call me once the software was fixed and let me know how they would file an amended return. INSTEAD of receiving any call, they closed my open call case with the only designation that new software updates were available. I HAVE already filed my return , was given the 100% accuracy guarantee, however, Turbo Tax did not follow through. I would highly recommend you not purchase this software , they do not adhere to the 100% accuracy guarantee. I am extremely disappointed that my loyalty to this product was met with such disdain for my request they back up their 100% accuracy guarantee and the guarantee from their customer service representative that Turbo Tax would file an amended return on my behalf due to THEIR software error. I finally got in touch with a supervisor after hours on the phone. Resolution of the issue poorly handled.

title: After all the calculations were made and I was pleased with the refund I was to receive and ready ...
content: If I could give TurboTax (TT) 0 Stars, I would!! They have become a group of shysters... I had been using TT for years and TT never pulled a surprise with their product until this year. After all the calculations were made and I was pleased with the refund I was to receive and ready to file, TT levied an additional charge of $39.95 to file online. This charge was never mentioned in their product upfront. I had the choice of not paying and try to mail in my tax return or paying to file online. If I had known about this charge ahead of purchasing TT, I would have gone to a tax accountant which would have charged me $100.00, because that about is what I wound up paying TT. I am never going back to TT again. They have lost me as a loyal user, so, beware of TT.

title: We've endured the annual price increases (but remained loyal). ...
content: We've endured the annual price increases (but remained loyal). Now a scale back in service (no longer offering schedule C and D) forcing customers to the even higher priced premiere version. I thought I would never have to do this but, after 18+ years of using TT, I'm moving over to Taxcut.

title: Dissatisfied customer
content: I bought my Turbo Tax package at Staples and thought that 1 state return was included. When I tried to file, I had to agree to pay extra for the state return. I thought the price was something like $29 but I was charged $54.98. I think this was a bait and switch deal. In the past I have always been able to print my return, look it over for errors on hard copy, and then mail it in. This time, the program would not let me print until I had filed the return electronically. I have used this program for at least 5 or more years and this was the worst experience I have had. I will probably use another program next year as I have heard of problems from other users this year. I was not satisfied.

title: Needs competition
content: Same old thing. Fed efile free but not state. Program did not pick up on Ohio deduction for small business, which is a huge oversight. So bad that even the State Tax office sent me a card suggesting I amend my return. I hate how you have to do these stupid worksheets instead of just putting in the relevant number. How can one program be overkill and insufficient at the same time?

title: Incomplete 1040 filing!
content: Don't purchase this product unless you want to pay additional fees. I have been a TTax customer for both business and personal for 15 yrs. All previous years I purchased the Deluxe version and had all 1040 forms needed to file my return. This year, I had to upgrade to the premium version (~$40 with tax) to get 1040 Form C to calculate in my K1 from my partnership. I saw in other reviews that others got the upgrade for free. Unless intuit changes their product marketing model, I consider this an incomplete product and will purchase either the TaxAct or H&R Block products next year.

title: Charging more for less
content: I've used Turbo Tax Deluxe for many years, but this will be the last time unless its policy changes. I was OK with spending $50 for the "deluxe" package, but discovered mid-return that I needed to spend another $40 plus tax to do the same forms I've been doing for years. Intuit's greed will cost it a long-term customer. Update: Intuit has offered me a $25 rebate, but only if I e-file through it and email my SSN to it. That ain't gonna happen, since I don't e-file partly to avoid giving Intuit my SSN in the first place. Even if I provide that information, it's still planning to keep $15 of the $40 it gouged. No more Intuit products for me.

title: Almost bought it but glad I didn't
content: Logged into Amazon to buy TT Deluxe. Read that Schedule D is no longer fully supported. This is the main reason I've bought the product for the last 15+ years. Interesting responses from Intuit to the poor reviews - I don't think that will save the business for them. Guess I'll head to H&R. Update: It seems that all is not rosy at H&R either. There's a bug in their software that imports your 2013 return from TurboTax when using Windows XP. I called their customer service and apparently there's no current fix for this and they advised me to type in the data manually. This is where my second issue with TurboTax arose. When I accessed my return using last year's TurboTax, I got a message to say that I needed to update to TurboTax Premier 2013 to access some of the forms. This retro-active crippling of software already bought a year ago is very interesting and another indication of Intuits creative talents. Fortunately I had a paper copy of last year's return so I didn't need to upgrade this old software.

title: Intuit Extortion
content: Intuit extortion. They continue to take away features and force you to upgrade to the more expensive product. Aloha Turbotax!

title: This is very deceitful.
content: Intuit must be working for the Government now. The are not straight up about their products any more. I think it may be called Up Selling. I have been using Turbo-tax Deluxe for YEARS. Now after You purchase Turbo-tax Deluxe as you have for 20 years you will now have to upgrade to Premier to get the same product as you did previous. This is very deceitful.

title: It's like a bad breakup with a bitter after taste
content: It's like a bad breakup with a bitter after taste. So many years of using TT and now I have to go use/learn a new software.

title: State tax forms not available / loading correctly
content: State tax forms still not loading! Called 1 week ago and was told they were working on a fix, but not loading yet (Feb 2).

title: I also have been using TT for many years. ...
content: I also have been using TT for many years. Increased prices with reduced features? I think I'll give HRB a try this year.

title: Warning - cost to upgrade to Premier $30 despite all the hoopla
content: Unbelievable that the free upgrade to Premier is not available to purchasers who extended back in April but did not upgrade then. Nowhere did I see a deadline to upgrade. No email from them, no notification when I prepared the extension. Apparently next year they are going to include the extra schedules in Deluxe? Why wouldn't they just make sure to keep all longtime customers happy. I will be doing my return by hand this year and for certain will never give Intuit another dime. Have been using TurboTax for years and years. Disgusted - where is the appreciation for long term customers?

title: Turbo Tax 2014 worst program then over 25year!!!
content: I have been using Turbo Tax for over 25 years. (used Turbo Tax when Parsons before Intuit owed it) Turbo Tax 2014 is the worst!!! I use Turbo Tax to file taxes for family and friends. Turbo Tax Deluxe 2014 has omitted some crucial forms from their program, trying to force you to purchase their more expensive versions. When I print out the taxes to file, it omits the form whith the address of where to file. One thing over the years that I never understood is when I print out a return, it always print out extra supporting form that you don't need. (Paper reduction act).

title: Two blunders and out in my book. Without schedule ...
content: Two blunders and out in my book. Without schedule D I am going back to H&R Block. Years ago Turbo Tax made a mistake irritating customers. Now they are at it again. They also missed the price poit as others said. Bye-bye

title: BEWARE
content: It the most dishonest company I've ever dealt with, I've used turbo tax for about 15 years or so and always thought highly of them. This year I filed the same things as all other years but it made me pay an additional fee in order to finish my taxes. they made me upgrade to higher priced turbo tax. I called the number and talked to them but they told me to bad that there is nothing they would do. I think it was a very sneaky way to raise there prices. But its ok as they just lost a long term customer, I guess they figure we the customer doesn't count anymore so I hope everyone reading this beware as turbo tax doesn't care about anything but the bottom line.

title: and it has handled my brokerage gains and losses just fine. This year I purchased the same product and ...
content: This is a massive bait and switch scam this year. I have been using Turbotax Deluxe for as long as I can remember, and it has handled my brokerage gains and losses just fine. This year I purchased the same product and halfway into entering income I came to the investment section and found that Intuit says screw me unless I pay $30 more for an upgrade. With no fanfare Intuit has dropped investment income from Turbotax Deluxe. This is crap and I will post my negative review on every website that offers users a place to comment on their experience. I may just do my own taxes from scratch because this is so offensive. Be aware. This company doesn't understand customer loyalty. They burned mine and won't be getting it back. Edit: As I continued through the Deluxe edition I ran into a further impediment and this makes Intuit guilty of major fraud. I have for many years had a very simple schedule C portion in my return, from some business consulting income. Intuit has now decided that they won't process my schedule C in the Deluxe edition and I have to pay a $40 upgrade fee if I want to continue. I am so angry at this two-bit scam company. The software I bought for $60 is worthless and I now have to shop for a new solution. Intuit is an evil empire and I find myself wishing business failure upon them.

title: TURBOTAX LOST A LONG-TIME CUSTOMER
content: I've used TurboTax Basic for as long as I can remember. This year they decided to raise the price and cut the functionality of the program. After reading the negative reviews, I went with H&R Block and have been very satisfied. The Block program imported all my TurboTax data from last year without a hitch. Dumb move, Intuit.

title: Do Not Trust the Intuit Crooks!!
content: I used Deluxe for 2013 last year. In processing 2014 taxes I was shocked to learn that Premier was required to process Schedule D this year. So I was forced to upgrade. I was using my desktop software but the upgrade process created an online version of Turbotax without my permission instead of upgrading my desktop version. Why? So I could be wacked $80 for Premier instead of the $30 upgrade from Deluxe - or the free upgrade as was promised. After all, the scumbags who designed this corrupt procedure need to upgrade both their yachts and private jets!! Crooks!!

title: No schedule D = No thanks
content: I've encountered amazingly horrible bugs in TT in the past (at least two that led to incorrect tax computations by ignoring some of my deductions), yet continued to come back year after year for some inexplicable reason. Their changes this year to bait-and-switch users into upgrading to Premium make this a great opportunity vote with my wallet and try TaxAct or H&R Block...

title: Dissappointed after all these years
content: Thought I'd wait until all of the foul ups were resolved. First, Intuit advertises $15 off "this week only" but it's only $10. Second, the software wont download -- only the Amazon gift card offer. Without checking -- I know we have used Inuit over 15 years. One foul up in 15 years should be forgiven but boy is this beaut.

title: Keep it simple.
content: I thought I was the only upset customer. Thank goodness for these reviews. I've been using the Deluxe for years and was thrown a curve ball last year. Am sure some bozo got fired over this poor decision to change the current format. Anyways it shouldn't be so complicated. I tried to do the www.TurboTax.com/25back that the Turbo Tax VP Bob Meighan said but I didn't qualify because I bought the Home & Business last year think I needed it and they only honor it for the premium customers. 1 star for complicating things

title: After 15 years with Turbotax, I switched to H&R without problems
content: I have been using turbotax deluxe since it was first introduced--maybe 15 years? When I saw the price increase and crippled features, I decided to give H&R block a shot at only $20, figuring I could go back to Ttax if it didn't work. Best thing I did--read my Ttax information without a hitch and got me through all my deductions without needing to buy or download anything else. Intuit has also screwed up Quicken, so maybe time for a switch there too.

title: Insult and trick your most intelligent users. We are the ones that tell the ...
content: Betrayed trust! Is this marketing? Insult and trick your most intelligent users. We are the ones that tell the sheeple what to use. I used to recommend this program. Buh Bye!

title: Add Me to the List of Customers Lost
content: Add me to the list of TurboTax users that have switched to another product. I started with MacInTax decades ago and have used it or TurboTax every year until this one. Removing Scheds C, D, E, F, etc.from the Deluxe edition in order to force users into expensive upgrades is the last straw for me. I remember when MacInTax came on a single 720K disk. I just loaded up last year's to print out a 1040-ES for the 4th quarter and it took TT so long to start up and load a return it was absurd. I now have a Block product to use and it seems decent thus far.

title: that they have dumbed down the product
content: Just realized, after buying TurboTax Deluxe, that they have dumbed down the product, forcing you to the Premier version if you intend to use a number of schedules and e-file, but they still sell the product at the same or higher price! Pretty slick business Intuit. I will vote with my pocket book -- after 20 years using TurboTax, I'M GONE to another tax preparation product. So long, Intuit.

title: A con job from a previously fantastic company. This rotten and greedy change will go viral soon. Hope it was worth it for you.
content: After using Deluxe for 20 years, goodbye TT. This Bait & Switch con job is way over the top. You have lost my family's business and Schwab has gained at least 2 new customers.

title: I am not happy with you Intuit
content: I am not happy with you Intuit. I've used your product for years, and I diligently repurchased TurboTax Deluxe just like I always have. I bought the deluxe version so that I could fill out and efile my state returns. When I was filling it out, I found out that it would not let me efile my state without another $25 charge. I spent almost 2 hours on the phone and someone finally acknowledged that this was a changed that was not very well described, and there was no way they would give me even 1 efile. I did have one of the reps even tell me that I was getting more than I paid for because it was calculating my state taxes, even though I clearly paid for it (incident # 411399079). I am not happy with you Intuit. You used to have very good service.

title: Similar stunt in 2003
content: In 2003, Turbo tax added DRM anti-piracy measures that wrote to the boot sector. Problem was that they didn't bother to tell anyone what it would do and, for some people, it caused major problems with their computers. PC not booting, can't copy CDs, etc. [...] Looks like they haven't learned anything. I stopped using TurboTax in 2002 and haven't used it since.

title: Turbo Tax Screws its Users
content: I have used Turbo Tax Deluxe for years to do my tax returns, and now I find that the company has removed many of the features available in all of the prior years and that it will cost me $50.00 more (list price) to get the same features that had been available in prior years. A company that has always been reputable has just gotten greedy. Had I not discovered this before I purchased, I would have been screwed. Now it looks like I will have to go else where after using Turbo Tax for these many years. Shame on you Turbo Tax. May you rot in bankruptcy haven when your ratings and market share tank.

title: This is the WORST Tax Software!
content: Now I remember why I hated it so much I used TurboTax last time... misleading and deceptive: demands an upgrade after purchase, doesn't import data from other software for last year return even though it claims it does... hidden fees when filing electronically. DO NOT BUY THIS SOFTWARE!

title: YAAAYYY Amazon, Boo Turbo Tax!
content: I use Turbo Tax every year, and am not sure if this is a problem with Turbo Tax or Amazon, (it's rarely Amazon) but if you buy your product here instead of on the Turbo Tax website, it wont transfer all of your info. I would really like to get my money back and just get it from Turbo Tax since they are holding my info hostage. I want to make it clear that I LOVE AMAZON and rarely buy anything anywhere else, but I'm not smart enough to figure out (even after thorough searches) how to link last years info into it. I get so aggravated when other businesses won't play ball with Amazon because they are the best!

title: I'm not angry enough to write a one star review ...
content: I'm not angry enough to write a one star review cause it did my taxes properly in under 30 minutes by copying all kinds of information from my last tax return without me having to dig through tons of drawers. But, why the bait and switch? Why tell me the product comes with federal and state efile, then CHARGE me $40 more to use the feature? I mean, I would have paid $80 to know my very simple taxes could be done in minutes. I kinda felt ripped off. Even tho I would have paid that money for the convenience. I mean, at the very least, the title of this is very misleading. It should just say Tax Software ONLY. Additional fees will apply to efile.

title: Goodbye TurboTax! Hello H&R Block.
content: Thanks to everyone for the heads up. Have been using TT for over 10 years but now its time to switch. They just couldn't leave an excellent product alone. Will continue to spread the word about this greed grab.

title: What a waste of my money thinking I was going to get ...
content: I've been purchasing Turbo Tax for over 5 years, and yes they made a goof this year by taking the functionality of the deluxe version. They made a double goof by only allowing free upgrades to those who purchased Turbo Tax Deluxe the year before as well as this year. What a waste of my money thinking I was going to get a free upgrade and a difficult path for me to find the forms manually and fill them in manually. If you're going to offer a free upgrade, allow it for all Turbo tax deluxe purchasers for 2014 you dimwits.

title: BEWARE...AMAZON GIFT CARD NOT GUARANTEED! CAN BE DECLINED OVER 14 CENTS!
content: For the past dozen years or so, we have used both TurboTax and TaxCut (now H&R Block) at times. However, over the last few years, we have only been using TurboTax as we had found it to be the best option for us. This year, as we were preparing to make our tax software purchase in late January, we really thought hard about maybe not going with TurboTax given some of the complaints that were occurring at that time. But just as we were deciding, two things happened. First, we learned about the opportunity to get some of our return back in form of an Amazon gift card; second, inuit appeared to be trying to make things right around the issues folks were facing. So we decided to go with TurboTax. We now wish we would have done anything other than that. First, it kept wanting to force me to do my state property tax refund application in order to complete my state income tax return, only the state had not yet communicated everything I needed to do this and these two things are not connected in any way. Eventually, I had to just enter all 0's to get it to process and then as it finally did, I got a notification that the state had not yet completed its property tax application (its not due until the fall), so it was not complete nor eligible to be submitted. Good thing I was forced to complete it and spent 30 minutes trying to figure out how to get around it! Second, we live in Minnesota, so as we were finishing our filing, word came down that Minnesota had stopped accepting applications due to fraud issues. So here we were, wondering what was going to happen to our return...in fact, we still are. We have heard that they are now filtering through, but that they anticipate some having to be re-filed. Fingers crossed! Third, we got word that our federal return was completed, accepted, and our refund would be deposited within days. Then we get a communication from intuit on the day of deposit that our funds were now available, but we would not be receiving our Amazon gift card because the IRS had adjusted our refund. So here we are wondering two things...what happened to all these levels of checks that occurred to prevent any discrepancies? And just how much was our return changed to cancel our gift card offer? While we still have no idea about the discrepancy checks, we did get our refund deposited and eagerly checked to see just how much it was affected that we couldn't get our gift card. To our amazement, our refund was reduced by a whopping $.14. To reiterate, that is fourteen cents! Not $14 dollars, not $114 dollars, not even $1.40, but FOURTEEN CENTS! To give some added perspective, our gift card request was less than 20% of our total refund and $.14 would not affect it at all. But apparently, it was enough for them to cancel our order, not explain the discrepancy, and not be available in any reasonable amount of time to respond to our questions. Never again will we use intuit!

title: No State filing included. Liars!
content: It says that Federal and State are included, but it's a lie. You still need to pay filing for your state return. Scammers! Won't be buying Turbotax this year.

title: Turbotax Deluxe is WORTHLESS
content: The Turbotax Deluxe CD I bought is WORTHLESS since it no longer supports Schedule D. And no, I won't pay the $30 surprise ransom demand to upgrade! Time to switch to another vendor with more integrity!

title: Big Disappointment
content: I have been using Turbo Tax since the 90's. I am very disappointed that Turbo Tax has become a GREEDY MERCHANT. I always purchased TurboTax Deluxe because that version included Schedule C and I am homeowner. This year since the interest on my home is not enough for itemization I made the decision to use Turbo Tax online (which I discovered wasn't that much of a savings in cost). Although, I was informed that since I did not purchase the software this year I was not eligible for the refund "quite understanding" I am still very disappointed with the new Deluxe Version of TurboTax because I convinced many of my friends to purchase it, not knowing it had changed. I hate I did not read the reviews prior to completing my taxes with TurbTax online.

title: Intuit missteps in 2014? For sure. But after all the angst: worked fine for me...
content: ...and all I can base my review on is my own experience with the product. Yes, I know others had issues related to what schedules they needed, whether they used the 2013 version and the balky response from Intuit. No review of this version of TurboTax should ignore the extended dust-up at the start of the the 2014 tax return season, when Intuit took a lot of negative press (totally deserved). This is version of TurboTax bore the brunt of that on these pages and in the consumer software media. This was primarily not because of its functionality, but because of the perhaps not-so-obvious-to-customers changes in what schedules were included in this version of TurboTax for 2014 (fewer than in 2013...to the surprise of many purchasers who found these schedules missing). Three comments about this events: (1) My tax situation did not expose me to these issues. (2) Intuit implemented the change in version/pricing structure badly, and further bungled its response (in at least three different ways that I can count). (3) Yes: had I not received the same functionality that I'd enjoyed the year before, I would have be in the chorus of 1-star reviews for this product and would and bailed for alternative tax software. Since I wasn't, all I can report is how this version --which met my tax filing needs out of the box-- worked for me. And, I'm happy to report, it worked great. I've been using TurboTax for a generation, and this year's worked just fine. Installation and updates following the install (on both Windows 7 and Windows 8 machines) have been totally problem free for both federal and two state packages. After installation, TurboTax recognized the most significant of my prior years' information already in the computer. Both federal and state returns were therefore pre-populated with much of the employer, financial institution and payment data that I would have otherwise had to enter by hand. I have a relatively simple tax situation am lucky enough to have my deductions in equilibrium. It took about three hours start to finish for TurboTax to complete and efile my federal refund and prepare for tax-day mailing of my state payment. No hiccups, good error trapping and headache free tax preparation. Modest efforts to upsell other services are present, but are easily declined. I understand that many Intuit users were upset. They can vote with their feet, and I get it. However, it performed well for me, continuing to take the sting out of the onerous administration of tax returns. While Intuit deserves what it got from both customers and the media, remember this: the true pain of tax time comes from the governments that collect them and frame your liabilities (for all of earning, savings and spending) and NOT from Intuit). If you're a tax-time procrastinator: April is right around the corner. Now is the time to select with confidence.

title: I am going to H&R Block software also. I ...
content: I am going to H&R Block software also. I agree if I wanted to fill our schedule D your way and mail the return I would do the whole tax return that way. Its about efile. Bob you need to fix this for those customers you have left. I can tell you that once they switch to another software they will not be back. Instead of making the same comment over and over, fix the problem, fix the problem. Nobody what excuses they just want this fixed.

title: TurboTax 2014 was a disappointment
content: I've been a TurboTax customer for 3+ years and have had an ok experience with the product. There are a lot of games played with the hidden E-Filing fees but I've learned to expect that. This year's 2014 product crossed the line in regards to bait and switch. They diluted the features while selling it as the same product name and price. To add insult to injury, I've spent hours trying claim the free upgrade as promised by Intuit's blogs, Tweets, and memos on the Mac version. Not a happy customer...

title: Very dissapointed in the changes made for tax year 2015
content: The feature changes made to turbo tax for tax year 2015 are a measure of corporate greed simply there to drive up revenue. I have used TT deluxe for over 15 years but now I am looking at other options. I hate my business being taken for granted. A few years ago I stored a boat at a local facility and after a few years I got a notice saying the price was going up 50% for all renters. I talked to the owner and he said take it or leave it ,that it was not a price increase it was that I was underpaying before. This is the same thing. Pure greed and unacceptable.

title: No Automatic Upgrade to Premier
content: I purchased the Deluxe version based on the the guarantee that the software would be "upgraded automatically" to the Premier version in order to capture the schedule D information. I was half way through my tax return when I received a message that in order to complete my return, I needed to upgrade to Premier at an additional $30.00 which, combined with the price I paid for Deluxe, was $15 more than the Premier version on Amazon. Intuit is a liar and a thief.

title: Dishonest company
content: Thank you for all the amazon reviews. I was about to click the BUY button when I read all the horrible reviews regarding how Turbotax trying to squeeze every penny from their loyal customers. Whoever made the decision to force customer to pay extra for the features that were in Deluxe before, should be fired immediately. See how many complaints and unsatisfied customers you got!

title: Bye Bye Intuit from a 20+ year customer
content: Have been using this product since the 1990's. Used Their QuickBooks products before I retired my small business. My wife and I were just going to purchase TurboTax when we saw the FoxNews piece and read these reviews. I was considering purchasing their Quicken software as I liked the QuickBooks so much. Well, no more. Looking for an alternative now. Thanx for the memories Intuit. You think that screwing long time customers over is good business? Well, you're wrong. Over20 years over. Bye Bye Intuit.

title: prices go up, features down...
content: Bait and switch. This is the year I switch to HR Block or TaxAct. Bye-bye, greedy intuit...

title: One Star
content: Lots of bloatware and too much up selling throughout the entire process. Switching next year.

title: Agree with reviewers! Turbo Premiere is a rip off ...
content: Agree with reviewers! Turbo Premiere is a rip off to increase Intuit's rev. Am returning my unopened copy and moving to H & R Block's product.

title: Absolute Worst Vendor
content: I would rate this minus 100000 if I could. Intuit's removal of Schedule C from the Deluxe version causes you to LOSE ALL SCHEDULE C EXPENSE ITEMIZATION NOTES that you entered in previous years' Deluxe versions, even if you upgrade to Home and Business, unless you then do your taxes in forms mode. In some cases, you won't be able to E-File if you use forms mode. Intuit is the absolute WORST.

title: Used TurboTax for years, will see how H&R block ...
content: Used TurboTax for years, will see how H&R block goes. It would cost me more to upgrade to file my dividends than the dividends I will receive.

title: Bye bye TurboTax from a long time customer
content: Bye Bye Turtotax. I've been a long time Deluxe user since the late 90's. H&R Block made me an offer I couldn't refuse. I got their deluxe tax software for free because I had already purchased TT 2014. I've tried other tax software over the years but was happy with the TT interview style and I've always been concerned about importing my old return into new tax software after a bad experience years ago. For the free H&R Block price it was worth a look to compare the two products. I just finished my taxes for a 2nd time this year with the H&R software. The interview style was very good and included all of the right questions for my situation. No import issues and everything was picked up from last year's TT file. H&R even found an extra deduction TT missed this year. My state income tax refund was reported as taxable in TT but H&R correctly figured it wasn't taxable because we paid Alternate Minimum Tax last year. Easy to use and just as accurate. I've disliked Intuit's business practices for a long time. I'll stick with H&R tax software going forward and I'll dump Quicken Deluxe as soon as a viable alternative comes on the scene. Intuit needs to seriously look at how they treat customers. I'm hoping the lost revenue this year might help redirect their efforts.

title: Turns out theTurbo Tax state returns were hacked anyway and it was recommended that people file the paper form anyway
content: This years experience was awful. I wanted to do Schedule C which I had done previously-nothing complicated. I found I could not even get the form anymore without paying an extra fee of $20 or so. Very frustrating in the middle of your taxes. Also the $15 fee just to file the state taxes is outragious so I just printed it out and filed it with about $1 worth of postage. Turns out theTurbo Tax state returns were hacked anyway and it was recommended that people file the paper form anyway. I have used TurboTax for over 20 years but this may be my last year.

title: Last time for Turbotax--what an exploitation.
content: This is my last time to use Turbotax, after decades of use. I bought it in December to do my end-year estimates before Dec 31 and found after I had installed it (and with a tight deadline) that I had to shell out an additional $42.40 on top of purchasing the Deluxe just to get the forms I need for my investment and self-employment income. I find tons of similar reviews here that go into greater depth so I won't belabor the point. Do NOT buy TurboTax. Try the alternatives that cover all the necessary schedules.

title: TurboTax has finally given me the "boost" to move to a competitor's product.
content: I have used TurboTax every year since 1991. However, I've often been very disappointed about the "sloppy" and imprecise design, and how even if I send in comments, these items are rarely fixed (For example "Did you receive a refund in the prior year" -- if you actually previously overpaid but applied it to the current year estimated tax, sometimes the TurboTax "correct" answer is "yes" and sometimes it is "no".). Thus I've previously thought about switching, but was too lazy.... TurboTax's actions this year have given me that push I needed. I've filled in a 2014 "dummy" return using TaxAct, and I like it better, and it is much cheaper. So, "Goodbye, TurboTax". (Note: I continue to use Intuit's Quicken, but it also has similar "sloppiness" in its screens and design).

title: DO NOT buy this product, period! I've the ...
content: DO NOT buy this product, period! I've the very basic tax return plus homeowner interest and buy/sell a few stocks. I was able to do my tax last year (2013) using TurboTax basic. This year (2014) when I was buying TurboTax, it said I have to buy the deluxe. Now while I am doing the tax, I realized I have to pay another $30 to upgrade to Premier before I can add schedule D for stocks. Intuit is trying to rip you off. Shame on you, Intuit! You'll lose me next year for sure.

title: DONT USE THIS CRAP, I started using turbo tax online this year ...
content: DONT USE THIS CRAP, I started using turbo tax online this year and of course when I needed to add some more info they told me I needed to upgrade. At that time I owed approx $1,700 both state and fed. I then went to a preparer that was recommended by some friends. Lo and behold I ot a Fed. refund and paid the state 1/2 of what turbo tax said i owed. I have been using tax prep software for years thinking I was saving myself some money and it has cost me thousands. Any tax prep software should be avoided

title: Leaving the fold.
content: I, too, have been a loyal and happy TT customer for many, many years. However I'll be leaving the fold this year due to the changes.

title: I too was not pleased by the product realignment.
content: I was surprised to see all the negative reviews as I was getting ready to buy TT. I dug into the why's of this and, I found that because they re-aligned their products, I could no longer use this version AND eFile. This imbroglio was apparently due to the step by step feature not being available for Schedules D and E. I use these forms, but do not have a lot of transactions for them. The previous versions did include this functionality. I immediately wrote Bob Meighan, VP, TurboTax, who explained that step by step included some data validation required by the IRS. To use the two schedules in the current version, I would have to use form view which did not have these validations. Therefore no Fed eFile. He did offer and I accepted a free upgrade to Premier. This version works just fine, and based on that, it should be 5 Stars. However, I cannot in good conscience give that rate as I believe this realignment was not well thought out. I can see why so many are steamed about this. TT is a great product, but they shot themselves in the ol' foot this time.

title: BAD FORM AMAZON!! Your downloader App SUCKS
content: VERY disappointed. I purchased the the download version. Could not even download it...let alone install it. Amazons stupid download manager would not download the software. Gave me error 303 and some kind of nonsense about invalid email...IT NEVER ASKED ME FOR AN EMAIL ADDRESS HOW CAN IT BE INVALID?!!!??!?!! I installed the Amazon Downloader app. Still could not download. (For the sake of this gripe understand that I am in IT support and fix computers\servers etc for a living...been doing it for 20 years so understand that I know my way around a computer). So I started a chat with Amazon support 10 minutes after my purchase and asked for a refund. I bounce to TWO different chat reps and the end result was that I had to contact the Intuit to get a refund. EVEN THOUGH ITS AMAZONS FAULT I CANNOT INSTALL IT. So I contacted intuit. since they are supposed to have a 60 day guarantee. Keep in mind I requested this within an hour of Purchasing the software. and No Dice. So Bad form on Amazon for their crappy download manager, and Bad form on intuit for not responding to my requests. Luckily I found that I can get a free Version of the HR block software which I received within 2 business days... FOR FREE. and I didnt even care about the schedule D switch that Intuit pulled on their up charge. So My advice...Do not buy any downloadable software from Amazon (I imagine a Disk Version would be fine). And don't buy anything from intuit.

title: Goodbye TurboTax, one more customer lost here.
content: How can the management of a company take such retarded decision? Another customer lost here. After years of using TurboTax Deluxe. I hope whoever people decided to take away functionalities that were included before, get fired and never find a job again. You don't get to extort and scam thousands of recurrent costumers without consequences. Goodbye TurboTax.

title: Another dissatisfied long-term Turbo Tax user.
content: Dissatisfied for the reasons others have stated.

title: No more upgrades
content: Buyer beware. The automatic upgrade to TurboTax Premier or Home&Business is EXPIRED!!!!!. Amazon might want to update the description here. You do not get the upgrade anymore. I just waited for 45 minutes on the phone with Intuit to be told that I just have to pay up $40 more to file Schedule C. It sucks! I am switching to TaxAct now after 15 years of TurboTax. ByeBye.

title: Never using Turbotax again
content: This Schedule D fiasco doesnt affect me. Im still pretty pissed about it, though. My issue stems from the fact that my return was held without notice by the processing bank Turbotax uses. It took my congresswoman to get me my refund that I should have had weeks ago.

title: The people have spoken - and have moved to H&R Block.
content: I NEVER envisioned leaving Turbo Tax but I have. From where I sit, this is good software ruined by idiotic management decisions.

title: ... Tax Deluxe for the past many years always being pleased with the product
content: I've purchased and used Turbo Tax Deluxe for the past many years always being pleased with the product. I was about to purchase it again this past week when I noticed the packaging was different. Something told me to check the back of the box for the required schedules I needed. Luckily I had a picture of it on my iphone and I quickly looked to make sure I was purchasing the Deluxe and not another version of it. After reading the back of the product and noticing Schedule C was missing among other parts that I needed, I decided to wait. So that meant in order for me to complete my tax return I was going to have to upgrade to Premium at the minimum and pay about $30-$40 more than I've paid in the past. I dont think so!!!!!Also I decided to Google search this product and I always check the reviews at Amazon before I purchase anything, anywhere. Wow, what a shock. After reading these reviews, I noticed many people had put their complete trust in Turbo Tax and had already purchased the software and much to their shock, realized they had been deceived. Turbo Tax, shame on you!!!!! After doing more research and reading more reviews I've decided H&R Block gets my business.

title: No longer a customer
content: I am 60 years old and have used turbotax since I can remember. After reading the negative reviews and ratings, I have done my research, and have decided to purchase HR Block for the first time.

title: Turbo tax removed some features from deluxe.
content: I'm disappointed that Turbotax decided to move vital features of Deluxe into the higher priced versions. This makes Deluxe not useful to me at all, and the version that would be useful is nearly twice as expensive.

title: Poor TT Deluxe product - Bye bye Intuit -
content: Thanks for the update and helpful information about Intuit's changes to TT Deluxe, Amazon friends. I will be following many of you to use H&R Block's Deluxe Tax software. No, Intuit, I won't be filing by paper for 2014 in order to use TT Schedules C and D. Intuit, you're losing a loyal customer of over 10 years of both the Quicken and TT products, as well as my future upgrades.

title: Cannot believe Intuit would disembowel a fairly decent product like this. Surely the ill-will is not worth the ...
content: Cannot believe Intuit would disembowel a fairly decent product like this. Surely the ill-will is not worth the extra $30.

title: Shocked at this years release
content: Like so many others I have used Turbo Tax software ever since I started electronic filing over twenty years. I was shocked to see such a low rating for the deluxe version!!!! My yearly pilgrimage to Amazon and Amazons amazing deal for HR has made me switch products. It is shocking you can't use the deluxe version for simple sell of stock. I knew something was fishy when the product subtitle is 'Deductions and Homeowners'

title: Thanks for the reviews. I'm moving to H&R Block.
content: I've used TurboTax for 15+ years to handle my income taxes including investments and have been very satisfied and went to Amazon to buy. It looks like Intuit is intent upon killing their loyal fan base. To everyone else who's left a review, THANKS! I'm moving on to H&R Block.

title: Sleezebags
content: So now I have to stop what I'm doing and do something I've never done before because you sleezebags decided to de-content the software. I'm going to finish my taxes this year and do what I must but, you and I are finished. Enjoy the extra $5 bucks you make on me this year (the net between the premier upgrade price and the "rebate" which I assume I have to WAIT on) . You owe me a LOT more than $25 stinking dollars for this.

title: TurboTax Deluxe 2014 - NOT!!! Don't Buy! ZERO STARS!
content: I just bought H&R Block on sale today at Amazon. I have used TT Deluxe since before 1993. I didn't think that I would ever use another companies tax software but after reading all the bad reviews for TT Deluxe 2014, I finally have switched to H&R Block. I will update this review later if I am not happy with it. This is a very bad decision by Intuit. They are not only losing the income from the sales of the TurboTax software but they will also be losing the income for the state tax programs (I buy another state's program) and the e-filing fees which keep getting higher each year. Last two years I had sticker shock from the high cost of the additional state program ($45.00) and all the efiling fees. I have been upset with Intuit for many years for not updating the Quicken software for Mac. It is still stuck at 2007 with only one small paid update to work with the latest Mac OS. I have been searching for another program but when one is used to Quicken the rest don't seem to be as nice. Intuit has tried to write and sell new Quicken Mac software but they still can't get to parity with Windows Quicken. How hard can it be? Well, I have switched tax software and Quicken will be next unless Intuit gets it's act together. I urge everyone who reads this to write to their federal & state legislators to have the government write some great tax software programs that work and won't cost an arm and a leg. It shouldn't cost money to file a tax return especially to do e-file. It seems to me that filing a return by mail is a lot more labor intensive so e-filing should be free. They could bid out the job to one of the big tax software companies to write the programs and take the profit out of filing tax returns.

title: It's free for the Fed E-file but $58 for state ...
content: It's free for the Fed E-file but $58 for state E-file. I'll snail mail it!

title: This Really Sucks
content: One must be very naive to believe the LIES Intuit uses to justify their near-doubling of the cost for their product. Instead of using their product, I will use the H&R Block software, which is just as good as TurboTax and costs LESS!!!! I have used H&R Block in the past, and I will continue to use their software from now on, provided they do not pull any dirty stunts like TurboTax just did. I'm glad that I have a PERMANENT replacement - and I will not go back to TurboTax.

title: Excellent tax preparation tool!
content: TurboTax Deluxe 2014 is an excellent tool to file my taxes. It was easy to download and access on my computer and I really appreciated the easy to follow the step-by-step instructions to get my maximum federal and state return! I'm a satisfied customer for the past 5 years and will continue to use this program.

title: A BIG "NO VOTE" FOR TURBO TAX
content: I don't like the changes that they made to Turbo Tax this year (2015) - the program works very slow - the menu at the top of the page seems to be different than previous years and doesn't have the options of previous years. I don't like the fact that I can only print from their menu rather than go to "file" on my my computer. This will probably be the last year that I purchase "Turbo Tax".

title: One star = Do not buy!
content: I personally do not need any of the forms that have started this uproar from loyal consumers. I too have been loyal for ten years plus, but I refuse to buy anything with a consumer rating as bad as turbo tax has this year! This is one way we consumers can keep corporate greed in check! I suspect HR Block is going to have a record year!

title: Works as good as ever
content: Works as good as ever. If you should need to file the documents that everyone is complaining about, it simply asks you to download the premium version at no additional charge. Takes about ten seconds to do this and you are back at it with no loss. Apparently there is a lot of professional bitchers raising hell about nothing.

title: Product is OK, but hope you're not a TurboTax Online User
content: So, for the past several years I have used TurboTax Deluxe to file my taxes, which included Schedule C for business income and expenses. I used the online version though, not the desktop version. I am unable to complete my taxes this year online without upgrading to the Home and Business version which costs $105! OUTRAGEOUS! I know they are offering refunds for desktop users, but us online people are screwed apparently. This really angers me. I don't even have that many expenses to report and am not a business that is making tons of money, so this really cuts. The online filing was convenient, but after this, I probably won't be using TurboTax anymore. Since the online customers are left out of the free upgrade/refund offer, I don't believe that TurboTax is truly sorry for their behavior, and are still nickel and diming customers where they can. Very, very sad.

title: Charging more for less
content: I am in agreement with many of the posters on Amazon. I have a small business and have used Turbotax for almost 20 years but now they have forced me to reconsider. I have purchased the H&R Block software and it works great for half the price. I guess they think they are a cable company and can continue to charge more for less but forget we have other options. I finally made the switch and feel better for it. I think more should and send a message to TT.

title: Not Happy With Turbo Tax
content: I'm Not happy with this years addition of Turbo Tax. Forms are missing and they offer FREE state but you pay 19.99 to efile. Also I'm not sure why this was the lowest return I've received in a very long time since my deductions are the same. I'm just not convinced I received every discount I was entitled to. The program is harder to maneuver within it.

title: This software will not do schedule D
content: This software will not do schedule D. This makes it useless for most people. I refuse to pay more for a feature I use to get for less. I am going to return and buy H&R Blocks software.

title: Amazon Gift Card option
content: Turbo Tax can be great but not always. So I filed my return and in the process selected the option for an Amazon Gift Card prior to filing. 3 months have come and gone with no redeemable code or card to use. Trying to make contact to resolve this is a nearly impossible task. I've spent more time trying to that end than the gift card is even worth. If you plan to use Turbo Tax DO NOT do the gift card option. Save yourself......... Turbo Tax earned this one star review.

title: Going to give H&R block software a try
content: I've been using Turbo Tax since 1994. I don't like being forced to purchase a more expensive (Premier) version after using the deluxe version for many years - very deceptive Intuit. Fortunately I read the reviews here before purchasing.

title: Like so many others
content: Like so many others, I got stung on the Schedule C issue. I have spent most of my Saturday morning trying to get it to download the upgrade, but no luck. I can't reach any human at Intuit, either. I can't even buy the upgrade online. What a waste of money and time. Never again, Turbo Tax. So long.

title: Loyal customer says no more!
content: The only investment I have to report is a loss carryover; certainly not worth the price to upgrade. I've been a loyal customer for at least fifteen years, but no more. I've switched to TAXACT; it does the job and is much less expensive.

title: just plain greedy
content: Ok, 2 stars. Normally I would say 1, but since I read the promise to return the product to what it was before (Deluxe handling K-1 and Sched C) I'll add a second star. That said, I used Turbotax for quite a while now and I already buy the business version (LLC) plus the Deluxe version for my individual returns. I'm kinda ... put off - or let's say - pissed - about the changes to the Deluxe version. It's not so much about money - I used to spend thousands a year on a CPA just to finally figure out he never got the numbers right and cost me a lot more in taxes than I should have paid, so even a price increase wouldn't have upset me. What upsets me is being greedy. I never bought a microsoft product (greedy company), I never bough an Apple product either (another greedy company) and now I'm torn between buying another version of TurboTax for 2015 or evaluating other options. I'll probably explore other options just out of principle. What's even worse is the lobbying of Intuit against simpler tax return filings. Taxes are already a PITA and life would be so much easier without government intervention, lobbying to make life harder for "usual people" just to increase shareholder value is something I will have a hard time to ignore on my future choices. So let me put it like this: if I find a desktop product that actually calculates CA state returns correctly - and more importantly in a transparent manner - without me having to spend hours figuring out how to get a from like R-1 filled out - I'm sold. I've filed the same CA return for years, same forms, same everything just different numbers and this year - ooops, some forms missing. Taxes are bad enough for all of us, having a greedy company capitalize on that is a double whammy.

title: Run Far Away From Turbo Tax
content: I have used Turbo Tax every year since the 1996 tax year. Every year I was more and more impressed. This year they let me down. Intuit got greedy. They decided to make customers buy more deluxe versions than they had to in years past. In previous years, I needed to file a schedule C but would not need to this year. I bought the Deluxe version based on reviews left by other disgruntled customers believing that the basic would not work for me. I had no schedule C income to report, but Turbo Tax tried to force me to file a C and would require an upgrade. I doubt I will ever buy another Intuit problem (program) even though I am happy with Quicken, which I have used for years. When I called to get help with the program, I had to wait an hour for technical support to call me back.I received an e-mail that said I would qualify for a $25 refund. I spent 45 minutes on hold, then was told by customer service that they could not process my refund because I did not buy Turbo Tax directly from them. Since I bought it from Amazon, evidently a mistake, I was placed on hold for another 50 minutes and finally I decided to hang up. DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT unless you possess a great deal of tax knowledge. I had to figure out for myself how to get rid of the schedule C it was trying to force me to purchase. I think I deserve a full refund and compensation for the two and a half hours I spent waiting for Turbo Tax to not help me.

title: Worked great in previous years
content: Worked great in previous years. This year it couldn't find any of our info so I had to enter everything over again as though I never used it before, even though last year's was in a turbo tax folder on my computer and I even had last years on a disc and it couldn't read that either. In short I wasted a lot more time this year than in previous years. Whatever you changed, please fix it.

title: I am not happy.
content: In the past years I had used the Deluxe edition. This year when I got to the point of using it for Form K-1, it told me that I could not use the Deluxe edition, and would have to get the Premium edition for a additional $30. Turbo Tax had made changes that I was not aware off. So in order to complete my return I had to spend more money. I am not happy.

title: Turbo Tax Goes the way of the old Norton Security Software
content: I will never use TurboTax again after years as a happy customer. The graphic designers and the company destroyed the program and the ease of use. Downloads for investments, et cetera, are impossible to find. The Powers that Be at Intuit and their workers destroyed a fine program in 2014. Reminds me of the old Norton Security Software which I adored for yeas until it was made unusable.

title: This affects home sellers too
content: The changes don't just effect business users. If you've sold a home, you'll also be forced to buy Premier. It starts out saying "If you have capital gains you need Premier" though one menu selection on this screen is "I don't have capital gains". Yet selecting that still has TT informing you that you have to pay $30 to upgrade to Premier. As for the $25 rebate TT is advertising, that only occurs after you file the return. So you'll be charged the full $30

title: I think it is bad that you would lie on the product
content: I think it is bad that you would lie on the product. As I was completing my first tax for my sister it ask if this would be the item I would use my free filing for state tax. I answered yes and never saw mit pop up again. Instead as I filed the state tax the pay by credit card poped up and I was forced to pay for filing the STATE TAX. Eugene Smith770-597-5375

title: It sucks!! I have been using turbo tax for ...
content: It sucks!! I have been using turbo tax for 15 years, This year I had to uninstall it and reinstall it twice, returned the cd for another one and install it and it still did not work properly I spent over 5 hours on the phone and still did not correct the problem. In addition it charged me 54.99 for what should have been a free state e file. Very dissapointedand will not use turbo tax next year

title: Broken product and worst customer service
content: I have been constantly facing an issue with Turbo tax software which none of the representative have been able to resolve. I have opened a knowledgebase ticket and havent got any resolution yet : https://ttlc.intuit.com/questions/2807876-getting-an-error-with-turbo-tax-premier-2014-when-transmitting-return-601errv-4-orderplacementhdr_12-210-s2014us1040per-invalid-productitemalias Scenario : I installed TT Premier and started filing and at the last screen when it asks to transmit the return I get an application error : "601ERRV:4 OrderPlacementHdr_12 - 210:S2014US1040PER - Invalid ProductItemAlias. Must be between 1 and 25 characters." Call # 1 to CS : spoke with CS and they had me screen share for 1 hour and tried different methods of resolving this issue, same problem still existed. After 1.5 hours on call the CS executive put me on hold for 20 more mins before I decided to hang up. Call # 2 to CS : Explained entire scenario again to CS and she to my surprise says you should go to NY online tax website and submit a return there instead of using TT - I asked for a refund for the product and she started giving me the same thing over and over again : "Its just NY state you will have to file manually" - sorry but I did not pay for the software if I had to do my taxes manually. Call # 3 to CS : I asked to speak to the manager this time however the CS wanted to hear the entire scenario again.I was told this time that since you have bought the product from Amazon we are not responsible for a return. I am going to dispute the charge on my CC since the product is not allowing me to file a return and I have tried my best to resolve the issue with CS. Never going to use TT again in my life.

title: After 15 years of using TurboTax, Adios.
content: I just got hit with the "You need the Business Upgrade" issue. It is costing me an additional $40 to finish my taxes. They are only going to refund $25? And I have to apply AFTER I file my taxes, and give them my social security number?? I've been using TurboTax for probably 15 years. This is the last year. I'm done with them.

title: Thanks for the warning about the forms not being in ...
content: Thanks for the warning about the forms not being in the Turbo Tax Deluxe version. I also am firing turbo tax and all Intuit products as of this tax year after decades of use. Hey vote with your feet, I am.

title: Almost a TurboTax customer
content: Unlike most other reviewers here, I have used H&R/TaxCut tax software for many years. I was considering switching to TT this time because so many people have raved about how great it is, but not anymore. So back to H&R!

title: This customer will jump ship, Intuit.
content: Shame on you, Intuit. I am dissatisfied...

title: Turbo Tax customer support was useless!! I had to call the IRS just ...
content: I have had to re-submit my taxes 6 times!! Turbo Tax customer support was useless!! I had to call the IRS just for a simple code that Turbo Tax SHOULD HAVE HAD IN THERE DATABASE!!! We're are VERY DISAPPOINTED IN THE PRODUCT!!

title: Did not calculate child tax credit properly, did not ...
content: Did not calculate child tax credit properly, did not handle phase out properly. 100% sure information was entered correctly, did it twice. Ended up using H&R Block's software, which properly calculated matters. Turbotax almost cost me nearly a grand, will never use again. $40 down the drain on the software...

title: Garbage. Has a bug where if you import data ...
content: Garbage. Has a bug where if you import data from turbotax online, the processing of your completed return results in an error, wasting all your time. Tried multiple fixes and consulted with their 'tech support'. Result: "mail in your taxes on paper". To hell with turbotax.

title: Siena Jane
content: TurboTax 2014 Form 8606 and individual tax-free percentage STINKS. Wordy crap that says nothing, leads you on a wild goose chase and then starts you all over again. Took me ages, also TYPE is TOO DAMN SMALL and too many words in a sentence of instruction. Keep it Pithy, PITHY!! In general the software was a unbridled failure this year. Fire all your Gurus.

title: Too late, Intuit
content: After several years using Turbo Tax, abandoned it for H&R Block Basic which imported my 2013 TTax file with no problem and does everything I need it to do, including property and investment sales. I see Intuit seems to be backing off its incredible blunder, but too late!

title: Unhappy customer
content: This states on the cover that it is "Deductions & Homeowners" version of TurboTax. But you want to take deductions on your taxes? You need the addition "Home & Business" edition for another $40. I feel thoroughly scammed here!

title: Not as good as it used to be
content: I have used Turbo Tax for a few years now and have liked it, that is why I have continued to use it. It installed easily. I appreciate how I am able to import information from my previous year return, saving me time by not needed to enter that information again. I also like the 5 Fed. e-filings that are included for no extra charge. But I do think the $19.95 charge for e-filing my state return is a little excessive, and I might give it a better rating if State E-file were also included or maybe even for a lesser cost. I understand, there are going to be updates periodically, but wish each update would be more complete and that they could come less often. I understood, this program could be installed on more than 1 PC. I wanted to have it on my laptop, along with my desktop. This comes with 1 State download of my choice, but when I installed it on my second machine, they wanted to charge me to install the State on my second machine. This is the first year this has happened I felt like the program passed over some of the things I required, and I needed to know what to do, so I could manually enter the information. I think I will look for a different product to use next year.

title: The 2014 Deluxe version of TurboTax does not have the ...
content: The 2014 Deluxe version of TurboTax does not have the same features as the 2013 Deluxe Version. The investment section is not included in the 2014 Deluxe Version and the software requires to upgrade to 2014 TurboTax Premier version ( additional $30) to have your investment transactions processed.

title: I was very disappointed. For the past several years I have been ...
content: So far 2114 Turbo Tax seems satisfactory. However after the initial missteps regarding Turbe Tax I wrote to the Turbo Tax CEOs but never heard back from him. He supposedly was answering inquiries himself. I was very disappointed. For the past several years I have been downloading Turbo Tax from Amazon. The 2013 state forms would not upload so I could file online with the free federal and state filing. I had to pay an additional fee to file. I wrote to you to ask from a refund on the state portion and didn't hear from you. Then wrote to the Ceo this year with the same complaint and again heard nothing. Next year I will probably look at a different filing form. Mary Jane Jerrett

title: Hidden costs.
content: Turbo Tax works but I am not happy about the hidden cost of using it. I paid about $40.00 for the program and then after filing with it they tell me that they are deducting $64.00 automatically as a charge for using it. That's B.S. as far as I'm concerned. Especially since I could have had my accountant file for me and only charge $50.00.

title: Intuit brings Quickbooks tactics to TurboTax
content: I've been a longterm user of Quickbooks and used Turbotax for my personal taxes for the last 5 years. Quickbooks also started out as a simple and clean program that gave you everything you needed for your small business - payroll, etc. was all included.
