Then they started taking features away and charging subscriptions for everything after you had already bought the "pro" version. It turned into an absolute piece of junk. TurboTax has been going down the same road for the last few years. The 2013 version was bulky and this year, they took away features that they used to have so if you have a choice (and you do), avoid at all cost. There are free options available too at the IRS site.

title: I don't appreciate being taken advantage of......
content: I too have used Turbo Tax for many years and will now look into using H&R Block software (it was always a less expensive option anyway).....

title: no longer loyal user
content: a 10+ year loyal user is now a newly minted hrblock software convert after reading and agreeing with all the reviews regarding this move to cripple deluxe and force upgrade to premiere.

title: Expensive for what you get!
content: I just downloaded and used this software. It was supposed to automatically upgrade to Premier. I hadn't noticed that that had failed until I was in the middle of my return and needed the upgrade due to a home sale in 2014. I was not given an option to upgrade for free, so wanting to get my taxes done purchased it from Turbo Tax @ $32.78 (including tax). After completing my tax return, I went to Turbo Tax to find a phone number to call them on it and get a refund. Well, they gave it to me, along with an Incident ID# and I was informed the wait time was at least 60 minutes! What a scam. You'd think when they ask for my phone#, they'd call ME back.

title: Terrible software
content: I have been a loyal TurboTax customer since sometime in the 90's (I threw away the floppy disks a long time ago, and I don't recall the earliest date, but it's been a long time.) I am angry about the deliberate disabling of critical features in TurboTax Deluxe. No Schedules C, D, or E. In the past, the product was functional, even though the "Premier" version provided more help and guidance. That was extra functionality and if you needed it you could buy it. But in Deluxe you got the forms, the basic help info, the IRS docs, the final review checking, printing, and e-filing. So if you knew what a schedule C or D was (it's not that hard) you could file your taxes. Now in the name of "consistency" this has been taken away, and if I want to file my taxes using TurboTax I need to buy something almost twice as expensive. I have read the words about how Intuit labored over the vital need to be "consistent" and yes indeed after their stressful labors they did indeed cripple the product and they will try to force people to buy the much more expensive version. Please be honest -- just step up and say you decided to charge a lot more money. Instead the official Intuit response sounds like we're supposed to feel sorry for how difficult it was for them to decide to raise the price. Raising the price is something I would object to but it's just a price increase. It's the disingenuous explanation that shows such contempt for the intelligence of customers which prompts me to give a one star rating, only because it's not possible to give zero stars. Intuit used to be known for making products that pleased customers and surprised them -- in a positive way. It's sad to see the company's current attitude. **UPDATE -- IT'S EVEN WORSE** OK, I'm angry but I need to do a draft of my taxes for planning purposes prior to year end. So I bit my lip and looked at ordering the Premier version. Even in the high-priced Premier version, Schedule C is crippled -- limited to $100 of deductions in a couple of expense categories. I.e. only good for a tiny hobby business, and maybe not even that. So now having forced me to Premier, even that high priced product is useless to me. Intuit, what is wrong with you people? Everyone who reads this: Maybe you will have to buy the product in order to avoid the trouble of converting to another product. But even if you decide to buy it, please take the time to register a negative review here or at other product review sties. You don't have to write as long a review as I did -- just a couple of sentences and click on 1-star. Even if you have a rational reason for giving in to Intuit's extortion, maybe the negative reviews will cause other customers to choose other products. Maybe someday Intuit will be forced to care about customers. Help other cus

title: I was totally disappointed, and lost interest in doing my own
content: After being burned by the schedules not included in my turbo, I gave up and took my taxes to H&R block. After doing my own taxes with Turbo for the past 4 or 5 years, I was totally disappointed, and lost interest in doing my own.

title: One Star
content: Screw getting nickle and dime'd for schedule C. Time to go use H&R.

title: Not so Turbo TurboTax
content: Having been a TurboTax user for years, I purchased the 2014 version expecting more of the same solid product I had experienced in the past. I was sorely disappointed! Apparently the makers violated the adage, "if it ain't broke, don't fix it," this year, because clearly, a number of changes were made that seriously impeded the software. Why they were made is a mystery, but most commonly these changes are made because someone sees the potential for more profit by changing or short-cutting certain areas. Some expense areas seemed to be incomplete while the income sections were extensive. Three major problems: (1) Software seemed clunky, not as easy to make sense of; (2) On completion I was unable to print a copy for my files, system simply refused to print; and (3) I was unable to forward the completed forms to the government, state or local. The only way this was resolved was a call to TurboTax. It took quite a while, but thanks to the Customer Service Personnel, I was able to compete the task. That said, it is no joy to pay $50 for a product only to find it isn't what one had been promised. Not certain if I will use their service again.

title: Good Bye Old Friend
content: Wow...I heard on the news that Turbotax was changing their longstanding support for rental properties in their Deluxe version. I thought the new story was mistaken until I came here to purchase and saw all the negative reviews. Did some more research and sure enough, it's true. I own one rental property I'd rather not own and lose money on it every year so I certainly am not going to pay more for the Premiere version just to do what the Deluxe version has done for me for 10 years or more. That's like rubbing salt in my wound. I always wondered about TaxCut by H.R. Block. I guess this is the year I get to try it out. It's so much cheaper than TurboTax but I've never had a good reason to change until now. I feel like TurboTax has left me behind. Good bye old friend.

title: TurboTax Deluxe 2014 Made me SOOOOO ANGRY.
content: TurboTax caused my great pain & frustration this year. I will NEVER use TurboTax again. It's dishonesty and outright SCAM of changing it's product without properly informing it's loyal customers in a marketing scheme to make more money is reprehensible. I needed a schedule C and D but this year using Deluxe as I always did, this year was absent. Then after upgrading and handling that major problem (1) I was confronted by the Second major problem the State Tax form option became unusable causing me to have to Pay for another state. I am soooo ANGRY. Never again.

title: I have aways used TurboTax deluxe But like many other faithful users
content: I have been a TurboTax user since the software first came out. I used to work as a tax professional and still work as a computer professional and assist several family members and friends in filing their taxes each year. I have aways used TurboTax deluxe But like many other faithful users, Intuit didn't care about customer loyalty or informing their customers about major changes related to deluxe. Talk about a total cluster on customer relations. I only fill out a tax return for my elderly Mother because she is required to attache it to her county property tax abatement form. She has no taxable income, so she is not required to file the return with IRS, but needs it for the county form. Now with the changes to TurboTax, if I need to put an amount on a schedule E for my Mom, I have to pay an additional $30 and upgrade. I only put the gross amount of rent on the Schedule E because it makes no difference in regards to taxable income, it is too low. So long story short, this was, and is the last year I will use TurboTax. Resides everything I cited above, your security is also lacking. You have become greedy, and your product has gone up in price while you take away functionality without being open, honest, and fair about it.

title: after using Turbo Tax for the third year - I ...
content: after using Turbo Tax for the third year - I say this because they have all of my demographics - it is the middle of July and I am still waiting for my returns. The Feds say 8-12 more weeks. Thanks a lot for paying attention, Intuit! NEVER AGAIN

title: Look out Deluxe users
content: When you need help you get put on hold, get transferred, get put on hold again.I have been waiting over 30 minutes and no real person ever came to the phone. I have always used Turbotax Deluxe with my K-1 form without issues. Now It is telling me I have to upgrade for 30 more dollars to premier. When I call I can a automated message, say as of Feb. 7th, I am entitled to the free upgrade automatically. There is no automatically. Whatever you do get upgraded before you start. I could of gone with H and R block, they sent me a free disc. Beware.

title: TurboTax used to be a good company. Now it is a joke
content: TurboTax used to be a good company. Now it is a joke. I spent $40 for a download that did not work and produced an obscure error message that none of the non-technical TurboTax help desk team could decipher. I spent a collective three hours on hold and was auto-hung-up on twice. I was told that a techie would get back to me, but they closed the ticket and sent me a customer service survey instead. The best part: After being told that they could not help me, I was given an email address (ereturn@intuit.com) to get a refund. And guess what happened? It bounced back. I will not be reaching to Amazon and/or my credit card company to report fraud. Memo to TurboTax: Fire your management team and get your act together. You're already lost me.

title: Good taxes, painful options
content: I wasn't allowed to use the amazon giftcard option and after the difficulties with Turbotax, they offered me $25 in a refund which then I wasn't eligible to receive. Fairly annoying overall with the extra stuff but the submitting of my taxes went very well.

title: Wow, you can get Turbo Tax for %50 off until Jan 26
content: But to me it is another "fleece" They will send you a coupon or something like that for 50% off to your email. Except, you have first have to join their "Advantage Program." The Advantage Program will ask four your credit card number and then you get an automatic renewal, of course they say they contact you first, but I wonder about that, tool I believe you would just continually be paying for an inferior product. It's too bad, because Turbo Tax was my golden child for over 15 years. Now I am definitely going to find something else. My concern is that if they did something like making you buy the upgrade, what else is Intuit planning for the unsuspecting consumer.

title: Another customer lost
content: Another former customer that switched to H&R this year. Need schedule C & D, can get a much better price w/ H&R block.

title: TurboTax Deluxe does NOT handle simple situations that it used to - requires upgrade to Premier
content: Don't believe what Bob Meighan, VP, TurboTax has commented here! 2015 tax year still requires Premier to do what Deluxe did for me for the years prior to tax year 2014. Specifically schedule E requires the purchase of TurboTax Premier, just for the couple of entries needed for income from a partnership. I purchased TurboTax Deluxe for TY 2014, then had to purchase TurboTax Premier for TY 2014 and was too late to get even the $25.00 refund from Intuit. This year (for TY 2015) I studied their site and found that what Bob Meighan, VP, TurboTax claimed here in Amazon is basic BS! I still need to purchase TurboTax Business and TurboTax Premier for a partnership that does less than $10,000 in business per year.

title: Best way to do taxes
content: Been using turbo tax since it first came out, and will never walk into a tax business again. Only one time we tried to go into a known tax service to see if we could get a better deal, and they did exactly the same thing that my wife did on Turbo, but they charged us double what turbo costs, so we never look back anymore, every year its turbo tax on amazon, the digital download makes it soo much nicer, if I wife has to go back a few years to check something we just log on to Amazon and download it again since its saved in our downloads of Amazon. Thank You Turbo Tax and Amazon!

title: Picked this up at a brick and mortar store since ...
content: Picked this up at a brick and mortar store since it was the same version I had used for years with no problems. Before I even opened it, I start seeing articles about how turbotax deliberately removed portions of the software that had been available in prior years. It's getting returned to store. Not interested in "upgrading" (ie paying more) in order to get the same functionality I had before (for very minor investment info that needs to be captured). I've been leery about turbotax anyway since it can't handle one oddity that we frequently have on our state tax return. In those years I have to do the state by hand anyway and this is one of those years. FYI, H&R Block is offering free software if you email them your receipt showing you purchased Turbotax. So buy Turbotax (just immediately return it.)

title: Bye,bye TURBOTAX
content: Liked TurboTax until this year. $55 for federal and then extra $39 for state--$95 total! Used to be able to get fed and state for $49.99 until now. Many CPA's doing the same thing for $100 to $125 in my area. Would rather support Humans than corporate gouging.

title: Disappointing product this year not well communicated change to the product.
content: Very disappointing product this year. No warning that the product had changed to not have schedule E forms from using it for the last 6 years! BIG SURPRISE and I cant get in touch with anyone at turbo tax customer service. Nightmare!

title: This is just stupid. I am done with this
content: Idiots. No schedule C. Wtf are they thinking. This is just stupid. I am done with this. I'll find another program to use in 2015 as I was not smart enough to figure this out before I bought the product. Buyer beware.

title: DISHONEST, DECEPTIVE, GOUGING INTUIT
content: I've been using Turbotax since the 1990s. I'm using Turbotax Deluxe, as I always do. I had entered all my income, dividends, and cap gains. I have a MINOR investment loss. I figure I'll just punch it in, LIKE I'VE DONE FOR YEARS, and I'll be done with my taxes in a matter of minutes. I go to enter it, and it says "You must UPGRADE to Turbotax Premier." AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAARGH! ARE YOU FREAKING KIDDING ME? What a low down, chicken squat, move. You folks are lower than a snake's belly. I'M DONE, Intuit. You have no idea how much this kind of gouging annoys me. It's not the cost, it's the DEVIOUS, DECEPTIVE, ANNOYING move. Yeah, I could pay for the upgrade, but I won't give you ba$tards the satisfaction. And I won't be back next year. Enjoy the NOTHING you get from me next year. Taxact, here I come. I assume they, at least, will be fair and honest. They can't be any worse than Intuit.

title: One Star
content: I'll NEVER waste my money on any product from Intuit

title: Goodbye TurboTax, after 20-plus years
content: When I saw that TurboTax 2014 had a review average of 2.5 stars, I knew something was up. Reading some of the 1-star reviews confirmed my suspicion: Intuit had sunk to new depths of greediness. Goodbye TurboTax, after 20-plus years, and hello H&R Block.

title: Turning a formerly goof product into CRAP!
content: I have been using TurboTax for nearly 20 years. I started out with the 2014 Deluxe version, only to find that I couldn't include a single stock sale. Not only that, it wouldn't import from my Quicken 2012 without an upgrade to Quicken! So I decided to manually input my information from Quicken and I upgraded to Premier, only to find that I need to upgrade to Home and Business to include a single Schedule C item! I'm not looking for any features from TurboTax, just a simple tax form! I'm switching to TaxAct, abandoning Quicken for Pwersonal Capital (I've been using Mint - but I'm now against using any Intuit product or service). Way to go Intuit - you've turned a 20 year customer and advocate into an ardent enemy of your products and company.

title: I love Turbo Tax but I don't like the business practices ...
content: IMO, the confusion is intended by Intuit. Leaving the everyday and common Form D off of the Deluxe version allows a customer to possibly purchase the product and then when the customer discovers the absence of the form the customer is forced to upgrade to the Premium version or attempt to get a refund that takes weeks to receive. I don't need to guess just what it is that I'm purchasing. I love Turbo Tax but I don't like the business practices of Intuit. I've used Quicken and Turbo Tax for many years but I just purchased HR Block 14 Deluxe for one-half the price of Turbo Tax Premium. I've bought my last upgrade for Quicken Deluxe also. I can use my bank's online software and save myself even more time by not having to duplicate entries and doing downloads. Intuit has lost my business. Again, in my opinion.

title: What happened to Turbo Tax this year?!
content: I have always used Turbo Tax to file my taxes, since we switched to e-file/computer programs (previous years, I would have rated them a 4/5 stars). But, this year was the worst program put out by intuit. I was very disappointed. We had a difficult time following through the steps and finding the forms, when previous years were a breeze. Deductions were far more difficult. We spent over an hour going back and forth just trying to figure out where we should put our taxes for cars. It wasn't clear. We had quite a large amount of donations. I always love the calculator, but when you can't find the items you donated... what do you do? It doesn't give you the option to do both the calculator and write in the items that they don't supply (which you could then estimate an amount. This would be helpful, as I had to just leave off quite a bit). The wording was confusing... and not just the state and federal guidelines. This was Turbo Tax! The help wasn't even helpful. It stated the obvious, or the definition, but nothing more. Intuit had already issued an apology for leaving out some necessary forms. Clearly there had been mistakes made this year. Those forms were not the only ones... It was a disorganized mess!

title: it seems so illogical for TurboTax to make business decisions that essentially guts and sabotages a formerly good product.
content: Yeah, I was a long-time user (since 1988) of TurboTax, too, but this year I bought H & R Block and TaxACT because of TurboTax's lies, greed, and, arrogance related to stripping-out features and functionality over the last several years or so. Furthermore, it seems so illogical for TurboTax to make business decisions that essentially guts and sabotages a formerly good product. Right now I am using TaxACT and I like it. So, bye-bye forever TurboTax.

title: One Star
content: Yup I'm done with TT also.... as posted bait and switch doesn't go over well with me.... bye-bye.......

title: One Star
content: Can't even input Schedule D by hand. Everything is an additional cost this year. This is a rip off.

title: Jipped
content: As a long time TurboTax user I eventually decided do buy the Deluxe version instead of going to H&R. I didn't realize since I have a Capital Loss carry-over I needed to upgraded to Premier. This was the only thing that triggered me needing an upgrade, fine. Through the program it solicits you to upgrade right away and charges you $30. Really? I ended up paying $50+$30 instead of $55 buying it outright. No other issues with the software but really feel ripped off.

title: So, so disappointed!
content: Yesterday I bought the same TurboTax Deluxe desktop product I have purchased for many years. Last night I read the bad news about Intuit's low key extraction of Schedule D. As a retiree, I am dependent upon my 401K and IRA accounts for income. MRD's can force reinvestment into taxable brokerage accounts pushing me away from Deluxe. Enter the need for Schedule D. This is not uncommon for many in my situation and for many, many more in the years to come. Think about that Intuit. I must now decide whether I want to pay way too much to upgrade for a single need, take the time to return the software, or take H&R up on their offer to receive their product [that meets my needs] at no cost. While I may be a "minority" in Intuit's eyes, I have, for many years, been an avid supporter of TurboTax and promoted it among my friends and acquaintances. I now have something else to discuss.

title: Close to unacceptable.
content: Sure, it eventually can be massaged to get what I hope is a satisfactory result, but the Nicole and dime approach of wanting more money for a state return and yet more to edible at the state level is obnoxious. Then too I had to buy the software for preparing the federal and state 1041 s (most people do not have this problem) for another $150-200. The help on the sites was minimal. On the whole, I found the product close to unacceptable, but it is non-returnable. Shame on Intuit; they could and should do better.

title: Does okay for really tough tax situations
content: Probably will use this software for the last time this year and just go on turbotax's website and do my taxes for free, which I used to do. I always get thrown off when it says state included and when I get to the end of the state return it still says I have to pay $20 to file it. I had some issues opening the software which really became a nuisance after a while, but I really like how it brings up my last year's info from my last year's turbotax file.

title: No More TurboTax for me!
content: I don't know what has happened to this software. It used to be great and I have been using it since 2006. This year, after I filed my 2014 tax returns, I realized I had forgotten to include an income item. I logged into TurboTax and generated an Amended Return. However, despite the fact that the program indicated that it would print only the forms required for filing, it printed every single tax form. I sent numerous emails to TurboTax asking for help and received only canned responses that were not helpful. I then tried deleting the Amended Return. I followed the instructions provided by TurboTax and now my originally filed 2014 tax returns are incorrect AND I am unable to generated a new Amended Return. I cannot even see the forms for previous tax years in the "vault" as TurboTax won't let me access the vault. I have sent yet another message to TurboTax but I am expecting to receive yet another canned, unhelpful response. I will be researching other tax preparation software options for 2015. Very disappointing since this used to be a great software.

title: Fine Product Terrible Support
content: I have been a Turbo Tax user for 21 years, this will be my last purchase from Intuit. The product is easy to use it is acurate, basically there is nothing wrong with the software. Intuit on the other hand has made me mad for the last time. My issue started with Intuit taking the 1040A form out of its basic package and not clearly communicating this fact. I have always used Basic for my personal taxes and the small bussiness version for my company taxes. So this year I purchased Basic, like I have for the last 21 years, and started my taxes after about an hour into it a message comes up saying that I need to purchase the Deluxe version, traditionally Deluxe just gave you advice on how to create better deductons for the next year something I am not intrested in. So I decide to email Intuit to see if there is some kind of upgrade option since I have already spent $30 on a package that has always previously met my needs. Intuit does not have email or chat contact available they only have phone support. I have used phone support in the past and spent over 3 hours waiting on the phone so I do not consider that as an option. In my opionion Turbo Tax is a fine product but Intuit is a crapy company to deal with I personally am done with them.

title: Pay 50$ then have to pay 20 e-file fee for state return.
content: Can't believe I paid 50$ for software that wants to charge me to e-file my state taxes. What a joke. Never again and I am making sure everyone I know and do business with knows why. For Shame!

title: One Star
content: Last minute price hikes are not cool.

title: It was a rip off in that there is no ...
content: It was a rip off in that there is no schedule C in the Deluxe issue as there was last year.

title: Long time user of TT - Deluxe. After reading ...
content: Long time user of TT - Deluxe. After reading of the changes made this year decided it was time to try out other software. HR Block was available for less, essentially did everything TT has ever done for me...doubt I will go back to TT.

title: What was TurboTax thinking this year?
content: I'm not sure what has changed internally this year at TurboTax but the software was lousy. I state this as a customer of Quicken's TurboTax for the past 11 years.The "walk through" was more like "stumble through". Two things specifically; my medical costs were well above 10% of my gross income but TT would not use the deduction whereas last year it did? The second point of annoyance was entering gross dividends for my DRIP stocks. After entering in the fields for gross dividends and doing a "check" on the return, I had to go back and re-enter the gross dividends on the IRS form which for some reason didn't transfer from the GUI walk through. There were a number of other annoyances mainly due to the miserable instructions accompanying the entry screens. There are more software companies entering the home tax preparers market and I think I need to try a new one this next year.

title: Disappointed in reduced features!
content: I am a long time customer of Turbo Tax; I started using it in the 90's. I just found out about the changes to the Deluxe version. I am very disappointed in the "sneaky" way Intuit increased their prices. I too just grabbed the Deluxe version (from Costco, not Amazon) as it has always met our needs. I never expected the features to be changed. This is quite a hefty price increase. I've always given positive views of Turbo Tax to those around me. I've been extremely happy with it. I've already opened the 2014 and downloaded it to my computer. But for next year, I just don't know what I'll do.

title: Software not allowing payment for state return
content: Extremely disappointed with this years software. I have been unable to efile my state because the software will not provide the page to pay the $19.99 fee. I have called 4 different times and have had no resolution. I will have to mail it. So frustrated

title: ... year after the past few years of being very satisfied -- their genius
content: Will NOT buy next year after the past few years of being very satisfied -- their genius? Let's fix it because it isn't broke. Nothing but frustration for 2014 version. Thanks -- idiots.

title: This is the worst edition of TurboTax in 20 years
content: This is the worst edition of TurboTax in 20 years. Setting aside the very poor business practice of charging extra for features that have been native to the software for as long as I can recall and not making the change clear. This the most difficult install I ever experienced. I invested 4 hours on 3 computers, then gave the softwre away only to have it retuned to me by an irate friend who wasted 2 hours trying to install it. I tried at least 10 fixes from on line sources (quite a few had similar failures to install) with no luck. While on tech support hold I drove to the store bought H&R deluxe, installed it and started to complete my taxes while still never hearing a live voice from Intuit. Hopefully someone is looking for a new job at TurboTax. Driving off a customer of 20+ years, should have ramifications. All intuit products are now on my blackball list and I will spead the word at each opportunity.

title: Been diligently using Turbotax for over 15 years - love the program
content: Been diligently using Turbotax for over 15 years - love the program. But that will change this year as they have taken away the main functionality and doubled the price - and rather sneakily too. H&R Block - here I come - or some other software :(. Hope Intuit wakes up before their stock tanks.

title: TurboTax was able to figure out how badly they messed ...
content: TurboTax was able to figure out how badly they messed up and get me the right version for the right price. If they don't get this fixed next year as they promise I will be changing this rating to a 1-star rating. I should not have had to deal with this. When I buy the same version of a product and it lacks the features that EVERY previous version has contained, I have a problem.

title: Death by Inconvenience
content: As with every other year for the last decade, I bought the Deluxe version and Business version and started to file for my family and my wife's business. The business edition generally worked as in past years, although the software cost has risen so much I may move back to using an accountant (!!!). The Deluxe version has been a disaster. I won't repeat many of the issues outlined in other reviews. What I will emphasize is two main things. First, this year's bait and switch with Deluxe and Premier is inexcusable, despite the last minute upgrade to Premier offer. De-featuring a software product that has been in market for years is a silly tactic bound to backfire. More annoying, when I had to purchase add-ons, the ecommerce functionality didn't work forcing a call to customer service. It took me 60 minutes to simply pay $24.99 for the state e-file fee (which should be included in any case). While the service reps were very customer friendly, they didn't really seem to know how to help me very quickly. Intuit needs to get back to basics, get their software working, and stop the nickel and diming of their long loyal, but rapidly deteriorating customer base.

title: One Star
content: It is no longer a good tool to have for tax return. Will look for other software now.

title: Congratulations Intuit - you blew it!
content: Like others, we have used TT since their first product release in the late 80's. As always, I was all set to go ahead and order the H/B version, but after learning of the TT cutback, I am really disappointed in a failed business decision at Intuit. My wife has done cosmetic sales, and I independent contractor, and even though it's small - that feature is needed. Someone who wants small business return capability, doesn't need a shell game by calling something one thing when it isn't. Like others, I guess Intuit has lost another longtime customer and I now look to alternatives. Congratulations Intuit. Great move on a once good product.

title: Bye Bye Turbo Tax!!
content: Thanks everyone for your reviews. You saved me the trouble. TurboTax, you just lost a very long term user. Going to try H&R Block! Update: I bought H&R Block Premier for half the cost of Turbo Tax Premier and all data imported fine. Adios TurboTax!!

title: No Good. Don't use.
content: this is no good. no customer support. three years now, and no e-file has ever worked. the feds AND state rejected every claim. 2012 return never even got filed. I had to re-file by paper. Money wasted.

title: Thanks for everyone's reviews--and for Bob's flimsy responses that further validated our choice to switch to H&R Block
content: Just checked NYSE and Intuit stock is dropping (quickly, I'm sure) and H & R Block is going up. Do tell. 'Wish we had H & R Block stock. We're taking everyone else's advice in the reviews and switching to H & R Block. We're sick of being gouged every year (a little more each time) by Intuit.

title: Don't like that you still have to pay to file after ...
content: Don't like that you still have to pay to file after you already paid for this program!! Next year going to a tax person where I pay less.. Ended up paying over 50 for program and still had to pay to efile for state and for tax !

title: Thank you Intuit
content: Like many others have said here I resent being gouged by Intuit. I have used their products for over 20 years but the debacle this year over Turbo Tax has pushed me over the edge. I purchased H& R Block Tax Software at half the price of Turbo Tax and am happy to report it works quite well. It is at least as good as Turbo Tax and maybe even slightly better in some areas. Even if Intuit puts schedule C back in the deluxe version next year I will be staying with H&R Block Tax Software. Thank you Intuit for opening my eyes to this bargain.

title: Do not trust Intuit
content: There are only two pertinent considerations for purchasing a product like this: that it be as functional as possible, and that it be priced fairly. After training millions of taxpayers to sigh over the high price and then stick with what they were used to, Intuit decided to violate both of those considerations. Imagine the chutzpah it would take to simultaneously cripple your product's functionality and jack its price dramatically higher. Intuit decided to see if they could get away with this, customers revolted, and only then did the company decide they want to "get our trust back." Can you think of a single reason to trust Intuit again? Neither can I. We should all place our trust, in the form of our purchasing, in the hands of a more trustworthy competitor. If that drives Intuit out of business, fine. That's the way the free market is supposed to work.

title: Intuit has reached into my wallet for the last time.
content: I have been using TurboTax since the mid 90s. No more, I returned my copy today when I found out I would not be able to e-file the very simple schedule E I have e-filed for the past few years using the deluxe version. What a pitiful lame excuse was given by the VP. More truth may be found in the fact that most of the TurboTax users choose the online version so therefor the desktop users don't matter any more. Bye Bye Intuit I'm off to get my copy of H&R Block Deluxe. They still think I am a customer worth serving.

title: Intuit lost yet another long time customer
content: I was a Turbotax customer for many many years. This "bait and switch " by intuit has made me switch to H&R block! H&R block software reads Turbotax returns from last year so there was not issue at all!

title: You lose a Customer
content: Very disappointed I have used TuboTax forever. The deluxe version no longer supports the forms I need. My wife has a small rental fee she gets from here dads ranch all $600 of it. Obviously some idiot with a MBA figured out he can make the company more money by cutting features. Guess what you lost a long time customer. I'm going to explore another product looking at these reviews I will look at HR Block software. Dude were not stupid! I'm sure HR Block and the other vendors thank you for the opportunity to take your customers.

title: Sayonara Intuit
content: Wow -- big thank you to all of the reviewers! I have used TT for as long as I can remember (probably 15+ years if that's possible). I almost bought it at Costco as I typically do, but noticed the box said no software included...download only. That jogged something that I remembered reading about big reductions in functionality, so I didn't buy the box and came here instead. Sorry that you early 2015 adopters had to go through the Intuit pain, and thanks fort the warnings. Since I will now be switching to something else for this year (probably H&R I guess), I guess I will reconsider all of my Intuit purchases as they 'obsolete' my current versions of Quicken and Quick Books. Sayonara Intuit.

title: Bait and Switch
content: After many years of TT for my taxes, I am amazed to find that my simple carryover of losses from 2 years ago requires Premiere, rather than Deluxe. I di not buy or sell stocks over the last 2 years, just had a loss carryover. There are no calculations required. One entry. Now I have to spend additional dollars for this "feature". Even though I bought Deluxe, Time to go to H&R and limit my current costs and future costs. See ya TT! How can I give this "marketing decision" a 0 star?

title: Just say no to greedy Turbo Tax... try H&R Block software instead, a better alternative.
content: Don't waste your time. They raised the price and reduced the content. I don't need Schedule C or D. I have been using Turbo Tax for over 10 years. So, mostly out of habit, I bought it anyway. Bad decision. I spent over four hours trying to get it to download. I shut off my firewall/virus software, tried three different browsers, and then a different computer. I kept getting the same error message about being unable to connect to Amazon. Amazon was no help. I asked for my money back. Amazon sent me to Intuit. Intuit has a 60 day money back guarantee. You have to write to them. Then it takes them a month to snail mail you a check. After that fiasco I went to H&R Block's web site and found, purchased $25, downloaded, and installed their deluxe software in 15 minutes. An hour later my taxes were done. If you insist on buying TurboTax don't buy it from Amazon. But you really should try H&R Block software, cheaper and better.

title: Major unannounced change in Deluxe.
content: Intuit has removed four major tax forms from Turbo Tax Deluxe in an effort to upgrade current users to their Premium product and of course increase their bottom line by increasing our out of pocket by $30.00. If there had been some indication on this years box that Intuit had removed these forms there may not have been as much customer blowback. But you donât find out about these changes until you have already purchased the product. Because of negative customer response Intuit is allowing a free upgrade to Premium this year only. Itâs and easy download with assistance from Intuit customer service and with a conformation of your Deluxe purchase. Intuits official reason for the deception is that most Deluxe users do not use these forms and they are helping their customer base by eliminating the confusionâ¦â¦Really???? I am giving Intuit one star for deception and one star for the customer service I received when I called them regarding an upgrade. Next year I will be looking into other software tax options.

title: Whats wrong with the dopes at Turbo Tax.
content: I"m disappointed with turbo tax having used it for over 20 years with no problems. Bought Deluxe version thinking it was the same as last year, Not true had to upgrade twice to get all forms needed. Ended up with Home and Business with an additional upcharge of $ 40.00 from Deluxe version. These guys have really disappointed me with the upgrades and difficult point of sale information I will look at other software next year. What"s wrong with these dopes? Oh Yea if you want the $ 25.00 for the mess they created go fill out another form!!!

title: Fraught with problems
content: State e-filing was delayed due to fraud concerns. Want to file a schedule C? This year you have to upgrade to home & business. They got so much negative PR they finally allowed the upgrade for free. I keyed a 6th tax return, spending hours on it only to find out you can only e-file 5 returns. I had to do the 6th all over again with free ware. Frustrating!

title: Mistakes on The MA state return makes the program unusable. No reply from TurboTax!
content: I am a MA state school employee and we do not pay into social security but have a pension plan. When preparing my MA return with TurboTax, the program automatically deducted $2,000 from my MA income for payments into Social Security, this is incorrect and I only caught this error because I am a tax preparer. I called and e-mailed TurboTax but no one replied. I am furious because I can't use the MA return and I had to pay $40 to get to see it. I want a refund of the amount paid to TurboTax and they should correct their program. I am irate.

title: I've been buying turbo tax for at least 5 years ...
content: I've been buying turbo tax for at least 5 years but this is the last time since I had to buy the deluxe and I didn't need the state return that actually was wrong compared to the online state return I did file

title: One Star
content: Lost all my information I saved

title: onto better things.
content: I have been a TurboTax user for 15 years but, as with many things and companies, TurboTax has become an also ran. New management, lax development or greed seem to be some of the factors pulling the company down. This years treatment of its customers and massive security issues aside (charging for Schedule D upgrade, bundling next years TurboTax into the online preparation fee and hacked filed returns), the cost and facility of the software is out of balance. Goodby, TurboTax (and Intuit), onto better things.

title: And forget about an intelligent discussion with Inuit TurboTax Help/Support Desk
content: 04.05.2015 - Junk! Junk! Junk! if you have stock and/or investments forget about the media saying Intuit allows free upgrade. BULL! You CANNOT upgrade to Premier through Deluxe nor online. Deluxe times out in a matter of seconds no matter what you do. Online is further of a joke. And forget about an intelligent discussion with Inuit TurboTax Help/Support Desk. These fools are clowns and know about as much with how to do the upgrade than my dead grandmother. Even the Premier version is joke. It continues to complain that an investment address "is to long", then refuses to file online. F.U. Intuit TurboTax. I've used you for years, not anymore. Nothing could suk as much as your software and business practice does.

title: Beware hidden fees.
content: So much price gouging. Apparently you have to pay to not only prepare state tax returns (though 1 preparation is free with deluxe turbotax) but also to efile them as well. All in all, I spent about $120 to prepare and file two states' 1040ez this year. I'll likely be jumping to a competitor's product next year.

title: Time to switch tax products
content: Used Turbo Tax Deluxe this year (2014), my 4th year of using it. After filing I received an underpayment tax notice from my state demanding a penalty that Turbo Tax did NOT calculate! Tried to find information on their "guarantee" and finally found it buried in some random area. And of course they make you jump through all kinds of hoops to file a complaint. For example it requires registration of the product - and there is no link to registration in the installed software. How about making it easier to collect on that bragged-about "guarantee" if you're so sure about your product? Definitely not happy with Turbo Tax.

title: After nearly 20 years, it's it's good bye to turbo tax
content: Each year this product degrades a little more. This year it was a lot more, so my search for an alternate product begins. It's a shame Apple doesn't enter the tax return market :-)

title: What a ripoff! I have used TurboTax Deluxe for ...
content: What a ripoff! I have used TurboTax Deluxe for years to do my taxes, paying about $40 to do my federal and state tax returns, and to itemize various things for my home business. What a surprise to discover (after I was well into preparing my taxes) that had to pay an additional $40 to prepare my state taxes (no, state taxes are NOT included as advertised), as well as yet another $40 to itemize deductions for my home business. Intuit is sticking it to their customers this year. Try another product instead of this ripoff. I know I'll never use it again.

title: For shame.
content: 2014 Deluxe package is nothing short of extortion by segmentation of product; a deceptive sales practice. You've lost my business after 10+ years of use.

title: hidden fees
content: I do my taxes w/ turbo tax for the last time. why you ask, because of what it cost me over all to do it with turbo tax,not only do you get charged to buy the disc but you have got to pay extra to do the state taxes, plus pay to efile but we had to pay a fee to get them to pay the state tax that we owned out of the $ 61.00 dollars we got back from the feds turbo tax took a total of 56.00 dollars from that for their hiden fees!!! never again will I use turbo tax, I would be money head going to wally world and having it done plus a $50.00 dollar gift card!!!!

title: Not Great but Better Than the Alternatives
content: I have used TurboTax on and off for the last 7 years and although it is not perfect, it is better than the other two tax prep packages (H&R Block, TaxCut) that I have used. The user interface is easy to use and displays well as compared to the other two I have tried. The ability to switch to a Forms View is extremely helpful. This is what I use to override the data placement, transposition and calculation errors encountered in the Step by Step View. Do not assume that all calculations are accurate or that the data entered/calculated on one form is transferred accurately to another form. The 2014 tax software performed the worst of any of the TT packages I have used in addition to intuits unpopular decision to reduce the functionality of the Deluxe package. Numbers calculated on one line of a form were transposed incorrectly to another line on the same form and also to a second form that used the number. The bottom line is that you should use TT as a data entry tool that needs to be double checked for accuracy. This requires that you need to read and understand the instructions and purpose of the forms you use. I have also found TT support to be inadequate and minimal. I submitted a number of operational questions on the website, many which never got a response and others that took so long to be answered, that I was able to come up with a solution on my own. On the other hand, their support is not much different than the other Tax software companies. They don't make it easy to make a personal contact if you have a question. When I was able to finally make phone contact with a real person regarding a problem with TT requesting that I pay twice for a second state, the support tech was very good at resolving the problem.

title: Intuit, you have wasted my time.
content: What a horrible software that it asks me to upgrade to Premium for correcting cost basis that I just entered few key strokes back. I have now come to know about the free Premium upgrade plan and such, but since I don't use their horrible E-file service ( I just print and mail ), I am at a loss. They don't have my SSN is their "system" to validate me as having been their customer from the past.

title: Run from this software - it reeks!!!
content: The last time I ever use turbo tax. I wss messng around with the "FREE" online turbotax and ended up paying $75 for the mess - jsut to use the delux, they waiting until I was ust about to send in the fed tax to hit me up for the cash. Now I can't find a way ti print and send my state tax, if you want to print it they won't to knwo why, like it is any of their business. I just bet it is all going to come back on me and I won't be ablel to get a copy of my tax return. Last year I had bu buy it twice because the fisrt copy didn't have the state tax, it has a bunch of junk software that I would never use and I couldn't return it. this is he last time I will even look at this software, next year there will be another hidden trick for them to get something for nothing!

title: Terrible customer service
content: I can't believe this lousy company does not offer email support. I have an install problem, and the only way to get help is to sit on the phone for 20-30 minutes. This is terrible customer service.

title: Summary: Comprehensive and polished, but frustratingly buggy.
content: Pros: A fairly polished and comprehensive tax software Web-based means it has all the obvious advantages of a Cloud service Cons: - Surprisingly buggy. Several instances where I got stuck in loops... like telling me to fix the same thing no matter how many times I fixed it. In the end I was unable to file my taxes because of very small entry problems that it simply would not let me fix. It ignored me every time I tried... yet dutifully looped me back to fix it again. - I was surprised that about half of the import options failed including the import from Mint. (Intuit owns Mint) - You cannot edit forms directly if you need to fix something. You have to go back through the interview from the beginning. Summary: Comprehensive and polished, but frustratingly buggy.

title: Shame on you TurboTax
content: I have used TurboTax over 20 years. 2014 tax season was my last. TT basically changed their products to necessitate customers to upgrade with out ANY benefit. TT just increased its profits. TT is no longer user friendly, the questions are very miss leading and almost requires you to now have training in tax preparation. you only got the one star because it's required to leave a rating.

title: RipOff
content: This was really only about a one star product, but I gave it a second star because it is still easy to use. This product claims to give you one state return, and efile. It did not give me a free state, I was charged to e-file my state. I also did not expect to pay and extra $35 processing fee. I have never had these fees in the past(10 years using TT). I will not be using Turbo Tax next year. I hate the feeling of being ripped off..

title: Overpriced Tax software, this is coming from a tax ...
content: Overpriced Tax software, this is coming from a tax professional. Unless you itemized your deduction, I suggest the many free options available.

title: TurboTax didn't transmit my e-file
content: We e-filed 2014 federal taxes using TurboTax on April 13. Then, we received a letter from IRS this week; it looks like someone stole our SSN and filed a fraudulent tax return for a refund. When I contacted IRS, they didn't even have the real tax return we filed. It turns out TurboTax transmitted the fraudulent one earlier on April 9 (I think they provide free 1040EZ returns), and that is the e-file confirmation we were receiving. As to how this could happen, TurboTax could not answer. So the software apparently does not alert the user if one tries to file another return using the same SSN. Now we have to file the paper return, and try to straighten out this mess. It isn't TurboTax's fault that someone stole our identity, but I hold them responsible for dropping our tax return into cyberspace somewhere and not alerting us.

title: Intuit, you crooks!!
content: My husband is a partner in a small S-corp so we get a K-1 each year. For 10 years now we've used TT Deluxe to file taxes. We bought the 2014 version back in January and finished all our personal data entry in April, but then had to wait until end of May to get the K-1 from the company accountant. When I went to enter it tonight, I discovered that I was unable to continue without forking over $30 to upgrade to Premier! Having already purchased the wrong version and invested so much time with it, it was too late to even consider other options. It seems that I even missed out on the rebate Intuit offered to its rightfully outraged client base. If I'd know up front I would have complained but probably gone ahead with the purchase, but the way this played out I feel like I've just been shaken down by the mob.

title: Next Year I Will Be Looking for Another Tax Software...
content: I am annoyed that TurboTax advertise state taxes for 19.99 but in small print they can raise their price at any time. Which they(TurboTax) did! TurboTax also partners with a sleazy bank who sells your information if you opt for payment with a refund while charging an added almost 40 dollars. (read the fine print and decline. Even though I used Turbo Tax last year they could not import my information. Oy! TurboTax software then asked me to write a review but wouldn't post it, they said my name had already been taken. Liz I could understand... then I tried aLiz-taken, zippo-taken, lizzygoat-taken, piglips-taken...seriously?? piglips was taken? Good Riddance!

title: They just keep finding ways to squeeze us for more $
content: I never cease to be amazed at the endless schemes invented to force users to pay fees and/or upgrade. I used to buy the basic version ...this year I bought the deluxe version because I had capital gains ...then I found out that wasn't good enough because I had a long term capital gain ...what a joke. I love TurboTax but the endless ratcheting up of cost is infuriating to say the least.

title: Biggest phony return ever
content: I will never use Turbo Tax again. The 2014 version was nothing more than a "bait and switch" to get you to purchase an upgrade to a product you were told by the cover that you already had: State Filings. But you didn't get it. And when you tried to respond to their "email rectification" you were shut out immediately. When you tried to call their 800 #, no one is there to answer the phone. Thanks, but never again. And there are thousands more like me on line saying the same thing. PS Don't buy into the phony, "We'll give you back your $25.00..." Bunk! I hand to pay twice to get my state of Iowa taxes filed with this "Deluxe edition." When I submitted a return for the $25.00 extra I paid, three times their web site returned the message: "you do not qualify" OK, I'LL DIDN'T GO BROKE OVER THE $25.00. BUT I'LL REMEMBER THIS IN 2016!

title: Don't believe the Turbo Tax checker!!!!!
content: Used Turbo Tax last year...great! This year put in same deductions and Turbo Tax computed way different, didn't see the mistake it made until I hit the file button...I know my mistake but a whopping error that Turbo Tax made and even though it repeatedly checked it claimed all was right!!! So after I filed and printed I caught the error and tried to go back and recompute. It wouldn't let me, stuck with the mistake and now hoping IRS won't find it! Had to consult a real live tax accountant for a fee. He said let it go and IRS computer might not find it...if they do he'll ammend and I'll pay his fee, more tax plus intrest maybe not a penalty. Living with a cloud over my head....

title: terrible plan by Intuit software.
content: Dropping schedule D? Why?

title: Not easy to contact TurboTax for answers to questions
content: Not easy to contact TurboTax for answers to questions. I'm still employed even though Iâm past normal retirement age and have several small pensions that are paid monthly, a couple of which were from my late husbandâs employment. 1099R does not retain answers that I give, examples: Where is Distribution from: four choices, will not let me change to ânone of the aboveâ When Person was born: three choices, âbefore 1941â was correct answer but my tax program keeps defaulting to leaving all blank â will not let me change. Any periodic payments? Correct answer is âyesâ but program keeps defaulting back to âNoâ There are a couple more as well that will not accept the answer that I give. 1099R assumes that all my pension payments have Required Minimum Distribution, but a monthly Pension is not a âqualified accountâ and RMDâs are not required. It asks the RMD question on all! Help! Contact: cbush92470@gmail.com

title: Fortunately there are alternatives
content: The end conclusion from the Turbotax fiasco is rightly that those who would otherwise not have tried H & R Block would do so now, and when given the opportunity to compare value, one product may offer a much better value. This year H & R Block Deluxe + State cost me $22.50 (when on sale). And H & R Block has features that are comparable to Turbotax Premier, which costs something like what $75. Plus with TT Premier you need to buy State for another $40. The total cost for TT would then be $115. That would be like 5X the price of H & R Block+State? And if you include the $40, TT up sells for audit protection, which is free with H & R Block (which Dog Dude rightly pointed out), that differential goes to 7X. In the past, I wouldn't have thought of an alternative since I was used to TT. But now, TT, inadvertently let opportunity knock at my door, and helped open my eyes! I know it will likely be the case for others. TT killed the chicken that laid the golden eggs! But things this year will likely get worse for TT for the following reasons: 1) Online users will now specifically check whether their Deluxe version has schedules C, D, E etc., and will be pis*ed that TT did nothing to fix it for online users. Worse, they will be furious that the ball was dropped on them (crippled software) since last year, and that the CEO has not apologized to THEM nor rectified the adverse situation. b) TT will lose all those customers who automatically thought they were entitled to the rebate, but for whatever reason, do not receive it. When was the last time you bought something again from a company when you didn't get a rebate you thought you were entitled to???? c) TT not disclosing their customer service number on their web site will add to customer aggravation especially the older folk. d) Negative reviews on Amazon will pile on since those reading all the existing negative reviews, will already form an opinion, and it certainly won't be positive. e) Turbotax said it needed to make the changes for "innovation." Since they are restoring the product, undoing the changes, does this mean they will for future years be releasing a sub standard "non-innovative" product, or will they be exposed and laughed at for the "innovation" ruse. f) In a Harvard Business School Case, the CEO stated that their motto is "Delight, don't dilute." Now by crippling the product, first with the Online version last year, and now with the desktop version this year, didn't they just not dilute by also cripple Turbotax Basic and Deluxe versions. If TT can't even follow its own motto, people will discern that its statements are all shallow or worse, hollow. g) Now that Turbotax is in the spotlight, all its shortcomings will be exposed such as being possibly the only company in the world that uses social security numbers to validate a rebate (and that too for a measly amount that doesn't even compensate for the additional cost of an upgrade). How does a company which should place the maximum focus on security, do something that jeopardizes just that? h) Why did it take 3 long months to offer an auto upgrade? Rumblings about the crippled product began to appear in Nov 2013? i) Why was the apology letter by Sasan G and the initial apology from the CEO (something along the lines of "we need love" or whatever) so insincere and with an explanation that insulted the intelligence of MOST? j) Calling a product "Deluxe" when it is anything but. Is this what one calls a paradox, or irony? This can go on and on but I think everyone understands why this could end up being a text book business case study.

title: If you have stock transactions, you cannot use Deluxe
content: I have been using TurboTax Deluxe + State for at least 10 years. This year, they have moved some features to the more expensive Premier version. One of these features is the Schedule 'D'. Anyone one with Investment income will need now have to upgrade. There is no way around this. So if you have stocks sales, you must buy the Premier edition. They have just lost me as a customer forever.

title: Big business is greedy....period!
content: I certainly agree with all the negative posts about Intuit limiting the Deluxe version. That's not the problem,however. If you've watched the stock market, seen Intuit's press releases, been exposed to their advertising and recognize the record drop in consumer confidence across the US, it's easy to figure out that this entire fiasco means only one thing. Intuit and many other consumer product companies know that depending on us for the long haul is simply short sighted. They must move us to items with higher profitability so as to go after more lucrative markets. Look at Intuit's attempts to push their mortgage and other consumer loan products. We are only the contributors to their enormous demographic database. There's not enough profit in us to justify ongoing support. There you have it. Loyalty to the buying public has long since disappeared. Btw, Microsoft has had a published end-of-life cycle for product support on every product they offer from their inception. Arguing or pleading with greedy corporate buffoons is a waste of time. If you don't like what you've been buying, get it somewhere else. Trust me. Not one of these pompous clowns could care less!!

title: DO NOT PURCHASE THIS PRODUCT! I, too, ...
content: DO NOT PURCHASE THIS PRODUCT! I, too, have been a year-after-year user of TurboTax for more than 20 years. No more. TurboTax's top management have a large disregard for their customer base as evident by their response to the chiselling issue that they created. The VP knows that by telling purchasers that they should call the company to presumably get upgraded gratis to a more expensive product (he never actually said that) with the features that TurboTax Deluxe USED TO HAVE-- most will not do it, probably way less than 10% of purchasers. The New York Times ran an article on 1/9/15 by Ann Carrns, "Users Say TurboTax Deluxe Is Less Deluxe Than It Used To Be" which provides more information and a way to get a competitors product that can do the job, gratis. Here's the link: [...] TurboTax is not the only player in tax preparation software. Put a stop to their greedy practices by using ANY of their competitors' product instead. Vote with your wallet so that top management gets the message about their greedy, knucklehead decision to de-deluxe TurboTax Deluxe.

title: I wish there was a "zero star" rating. Every ...
content: I wish there was a "zero star" rating. Every year I have issues with Turbo Tax and swear to never use it again. Lesson finally learned. Here was this year's problem: When I downloaded the application, I clicked to begin. After four hours of entering in all my information, payment was asked for at the end. This didn't make sense since I had already paid through Amazon. I clicked to continue and thought maybe it just went to that page as a default. Apparently not, and I paid an ADDITIONAL $65 (to come out of my return). I contacted Amazon and they confirmed I never used the one I ordered from them. Somehow when I downloaded TurboTax, it did not connect with the program I had already purchased. I am not sure how this happened since I only downloaded the one from Amazon, not from their website. I have been using TurboTax since 2008 and have never had this issue. I spent $39.99 on the download, never used it, and then spent ANOTHER $39.99 on the new download and then another $65 to file!!! Ever year the price goes up and the quality down. Their customer service department was on no help in resolving the issue and each time I emailed I get a response from someone different. Their solution- a code for a free download next year.... no thanks.

title: Wanna Do Your Taxes? Then pay more.
content: Another step in Turbo-Tax's march to greed. Various versions lost features compared to prior years, what was once good enough for my situation inexplicably required an "upgrade" to a higher version to accomplish this. In the past Schedule C (home business) was included in "Deluxe" but when trying to put my taxes together this year I got a cryptic message that needed forms required an upgrade to "Premier" but did not even indicate what those needed forms were! Sort of surprising AFTER the purchase! I guess I was not the only one to notice since I got an e-mail suggesting a bit of an uproar in the community of Turbo-Tax users. Turbo-Tax did recognize this step and offered some "compensation" but this should never have gotten this far! I think I'm going to be looking for other alternatives (H&R Block comes to mind) next year.

title: PROBLEM SOLVED IMMEDIATELY
content: Ordered TurboTax Deluxe and found that I could not input my rental property - TurboTax gave a telephone number if I had problems, so when called and advised them of this problem, they immediately upgraded my TurboTax to Premiere and was able to complete my taxes. Because there were problems with TurboTax, I was not charged for this upgrade! I always use TurboTax to do my taxes and have done so for several years. This was the first problem I ever had with TurboTax and it was solved immediately - Go TURBO TAX -- Will continue to used this software. Thanks for your assistance! Betty M. Patek

title: One Star
content: No Schedules C, D, or E

title: Get the media! Download problematic this year and no help from Amazon.
content: To be gouged you must at least have the software. I've tried downloading to three different PCs, running two different OS/versions, and 3 browsers (Chrome, IE11, IE8, Firefox, all ending with a download error. I've sent downloader logs to Amazon almost a week ago and haven't heard anything. All this while I can successfully download prior years TurboTax from my Amazon software library. This has been a completely unacceptable experience that I attribute to Amazon more than Intuit. I'd either like my money back, or the media. Then I can at least complain about being gouged. To that point, I did seen an email offer for $25 from Intuit if This year's version isn't adequate compared to last year. Yicht!

title: What a Joke
content: I have used Turbo Tax Deluxe for more than 10 years and have had no problems until this year. First there was the whole fiasco with having to upgrade to Premier in order to get the same schedules that I have always used. After 2 lengthy phone calls, I did finally get my free upgrade to Premier. So, I move forward with my return feeling somewhat better until I get to my free State download and now that doesn't load. What a screwed up mess. Signed, new H&R Block Customer for 2015.

title: Not So Great An Exprience This Year
content: I have used TurboTax for so long I lost count. But, I must confess this year's version was the worst. I found it harder to go from section to section and was not quite caught up in the fiasco with the people who owned stocks and used Deluxe without knowing about the policy change. My big gripe is that due to a death in the family my e-submission was rejected. I followed the misleading direction as to what to do (no real hints from TurboTax), tried to find something I had done wrong, but ended up with the same data and re-submitted it only to have it reject again immediately. Both submissions were free. I tried to use their Frequently Asked Questions and the Contact Us but it was fruitless. All I could find is I had to use a paper submission. The combination of problems will see me considering H&R Block or something else next year.

title: One Star
content: TT's action for 2014 filers to separate Investments out of the Deluxe package and charge customers extra was excessive.

title: Crippled compared to previous years versions due to missing schedules ...
content: Crippled compared to previous years versions due to missing schedules. Send a message and look elsewhere this year for your tax software.

title: Avoid, avoid, avoid!
content: Avoid this product, and most of all, avoid Intuit products! After deceptively changing Turbo Tax to omit tax forms and capabilities included in previous years' versions, Intuit changed their mind and claimed to offer free upgrades. Well, my copy doesn't get an upgrade to cover the forms I need, so it's either pay them another $40, or change to H&R Block software. The reality is, you never really know what you're buying when you purchase Turbo Tax. And if Intuit feels free to give their customers the shaft in 2015, they will clearly have no hesitance to do it again. You might as well just take your cash and throw it in the garbage if you purchase Turbo Tax. Let the buyer beware!

title: You can't just select "Gee, no thanks I don't want to write a review" anywhere on Amazon.
content: You can't just select "Gee, no thanks I don't want to write a review" anywhere on Amazon. And the e-mail and the pop-ups and the list of reviews get longer and longer. Since I have to write a review... here it is. This purchase was the worst I ever made on Amazon.

title: Without Schedule D, I'm out after 20+ years! ...
content: Without Schedule D, I'm out after 20+ years !!! Big mistake TurboTax.

title: Extremely Disappointed in Turbotax
content: Extremely disappointed in Turbotax for removing all the investment forms from the Delux version and trying to force me mid way through my taxes to upgrade. I've used the delux version of TT for 8 years, but will change to another product for 2015. Shame on you Intuit. These deceptive and greedy business practices will be your undoing. You treat your customers with no respect. We have options and I will make a change next tax year.

title: You may face frustrations with the claimed upgrade and efiling
content: After some headaches (repeated calls) regarding the upgrade that was supposed to be seamless (but actually encountered an error message repeatedly), I finally got the upgrade. But now, as I am finishing, Turbotax has yet another surprise. I want to efile my federal (which is included) but mail my state return (which is $20 extra).. but they are not giving me that option! They are basically forcing me to efile both (and pay an extra $20) or mail both tax returns. Terrible business practice! Awful Turbotax!

title: Irritated by extra charges.
content: I've used TurboTax Deluxe for several years with few problems. It had ALL the forms I needed to do my taxes AND included state taxes. This year I feel they were a bit deceptive with their changes and added charges. $39.99 for the main program. When you get to the end of your Federal taxes and go to start your state, you are hit with an additional fee of $39.99 for your state taxes. Oh by the way, there is another $19.99 to file online! I expected the later fee. But another $40 just to do your state?? I figured something was amiss when they kept your state's running tally at the top of the screen hidden -unlike previous years. Next year I'll be looking for an alternative or just go back to HR Block.

title: Turbo Tax user for fifteen years. I have suggested ...
content: Turbo Tax user for fifteen years. I have suggested it use to all of my friends but....not any more. I have one rental property and need Schedule E for that. Now you are charging almost double!! Oh, by the way Deluxe version no longer has schedule D ..... really....that eliminates a lot of people. It is time to look at the alternatives. Jim D --- Denver, Co

title: Never again!
content: Stay away! Used this software for many years and discovered a couple of days ago that I need to pay extra $40 for the feature which always was included. Now they're offering me $25 rebate instead of $40 I spent! Go HR block. Farewell Turbotax.

title: Turbo Tax No More
content: After 18 years with Turbo Tax, I officially will switch and do my taxes on TaxACT. Last year, I paid $39.99 for Turbo Tax Deluxe and then another $19.98 to efile my state taxes. This year, Turbo Tax wants me to upgrade to Premier so I can file my schedule K. They want $79.98 for Turbo Tax Deluxe and now want $39.98 to file my state. Talk about greed. They can spin it any way they want, but going from $59.98 last year to $119.98 this year is inexcusable for someone who has used their product for 18 years. Nothing changed from my current income status. The only change was Turbo Tax thinking I would just pay it. STAY AWAY FROM TURBO TAX. There are other providers at less than half the cost and are just as good.

title: I am disappointed that Intuit is doing this
content: Wow! I am disappointed that Intuit is doing this. I've been a customer of Turbotax for as long as I can remember(15+ years) and always trusted the Deluxe version. Every year I get this without researching or reading customer reviews. All in a sudden I found out that I can not get my Schedule D which I need the most unless I upgrade. I've never consider another tax software like HR Block, that's how loyal I have been. I am glad that Intuit is changing their mind on this marketing decision. However that does leave me a bad taste in my mouth. Next year I'll be a bit more careful and make sure they don't pull one like this again. You can fool me once but not twice.

title: One Star
content: Garbage, over-priced software just got worse.

title: too many software issues
content: let me start by giving the support 5stars if hold online long enough. cons 1 would not load from Amazon 2. had to upgrade to Premier(free but had to wait for support 3. could not run California state tax .hold on line for support This years Turbo Tax is filled with software problems. I could have manually completed my return in 4 hours less time i

title: Ripped off again by Intuit - had to go buy ...
content: Ripped off again by Intuit - had to go buy Premier - now Intuit is giving free upgrades. ZERO STARS

title: So bad, waste a lot of time
content: I hope I did not choose it. The next year I of cause will choose some other software. It keep frozen when try to open a new page and finally can not print the preview page. Really bad!!!! So expensive and use it only one time, why they can do more testing of it?????

title: Don't waste your money
content: Don't waste your money. Last year I used it and I like it. This year I bought Deluxe version thinking that I could easily upgrade to premium version, upgrade within the program doesn't allow me to upgrade without entering credit card. Tried calling customer service, on hold for 2 1/2 hours without any luck.

title: receive a cryptic and totally non useful error message SO I call the number provided
content: Last year I was overcharged for being given the worng information form a rep at Intuit as to what package to buy. This year I m unable to efile my state taxes, receive a cryptic and totally non useful error message SO I call the number provided, and receive help form a tax adviser, not a tech oh no. I am told when the ttech lines over flow they route calls to the tax advisers. I do tech support for a living, you can give someone a script, which is great if the issue follows a script. To bad it never does So we go through the same steps i've tried a dozen times on my own, I finally get a code so intuit can process my efile, and pay more than the $19.95 i should have been charged. Hello H&R Block. Let's see how you do

title: Turbo AXed !!! It's Tax Act from now on.
content: After putting up with Intuit's customer be damned attitude all the way back to Quickbooks in the 80's, I've FINALLY rid myself of this money grubbing company. Sure, having to deal with a new software package was a pain, but not that bad once I got going. Now that it's done, I'M SOOOOOOO GLAD Intuit ticked me off enough to switch to Tax Act. And, forget about paying for California State eFiling. Good ol' Uncle Jerry gave us free online filing.... and my refund arrived the week after I filed.

title: One Star
content: Deluxe is missing features from previous years. Very unethical way of dealing with customers.

title: No longer a big fan
content: Have used TurboTax for many years without incident but this years version (2014) had so many glitches it was unreal. The program was a nightmare when I went to amend an already filed federal return. I had to recheck every line several times to be certain of the correctness. Also when I did the state return the TurboTax program automatically did an amended state return even though it was the initial time I had attempted to do it. I will have to think long and hard about putting my faith in next years product as I was completely disgusted with this one.

title: Greedy Underhanded Company
content: After using Turbo Tax for many years I was amazed and angered by the recent changes. Not including schedule D is tantamount to crippling the software. I will most likely change over to H and R Block's software in future years.

title: With the new pricing structure, I can no longer afford this software.
content: I have used TurboTax Deluxe for years, and been very happy with it. I'm a Homeowner with some investments and found the (old) versions ability to pull in data from investment brokers and mutual funds very helpful. This functionality is no longer present in the 2014 Deluxe version, and I would be required to pay much more, and purchase the Premier version to have the same functionality. Considering that H&R Block offers software that meets my needs, at a far lower price, I'm going with H&R Block.

title: Somebody at Intuit made a really bad decision that most likely will cost them their entire ...
content: I have been a TurboTax user for about 20 years. Based on changes made to the Deluxe version for the 2014 tax year, I will be changing to H & R's Deluxe version. Bye.... Bye turobtax... Somebody at Intuit made a really bad decision that most likely will cost them their entire market share of this product need.

title: A shockinglly short sighted decision to cripple the product
content: After decades of happily filing my returns with TurboTax, I am sad to say the party is over. My wife is self-employed, so having Schedule C is not optional. Such a short-sighted take away, Intuit! Why make a change to the suite of features at this point? Every software company in history that thought that they could gouge their customers with impunity has learned that customers have a way of fighting back. Remember Lotus 123? What about WordPerfect? They held dominant positions in their category until they forgot their customers. Where are they now? There is no explanation for this decision beyond unbridled greed. Good luck with that. Now, I'm off to research competitive products. I'll let you know where I land.

title: The Rip off is back!!
content: I was filing my 2014 return and when I got to schedule C I was forced to update to Home and Business. This after Intuit apologized for sneaking the Schedule C feature out of the program and after I accepted their upgrade to home and Business back in April. Before I started my return (I took and extension) they updated me again and took away schedule C. Obviously they learned customer care from Volkswagen.

title: TurboTax let me down
content: This year I am very unhappy with deluxe TurboTax. In the past I have used this deluxe program and it included state sales tax. Reading the CD cover, it did not mention that it DID NOT include the state sales tax program. The back could have easily included it where it checked what it did include. Since I had used the Deluxe program many times, I assumed that it did. Now I'll need to pay $20 to get the program. No where on the information I've received from TurboTax and Costco does it say they will update the state sales tax.
