Updating won't help me and many others who counted on the program to be like it was originally.

title: I have used TurboTax for many years with no problems ...
content: I have used TurboTax for many years with no problems, until this year. After finally being able to get the product to work, I have decided that I will find another product, or go to a real person, for next years tax. What they did with the program I don't know, I got a letter from Amozon stating that there was some kind of rebate available, but even though I met all the requirements (at least as I read the instructions) I didn't qualify, another reason for finding another type of tax service. TurboTax worked well for years, but never again for me. Recommendation: Find another service.

title: Another user gone
content: Add another ten year user to the lost pile. I flat out refuse to pay to upgrade to what I previously had just so I can report one stock sale. The form responses have taken it to a whole new level for me as well. I have to make sure that my friends and family know to switch this year. Goodbye Turbo Tax.

title: Once users find out it's easy to switch I think
content: Bugs everywhere you look. I couldn't efile because it flagged two minor items and then refused any entry to correct them. Okay, raise the price this year with the underhanded redefinition of products, but to do that in the very year you turn out such a sub-par product seems to me to be a recipe to drive your loyal customers to TaxCut. And for me next year, that's what I'll do. Once users find out it's easy to switch I think, more will be inclined to do it.

title: this is the worst and a rip off
content: no it did not . this software does not let you file schedule E royalties you have to upgrade for a cost of $30.none of the software this year gave you exactly what it contained.I have b een using turbotax for 6 years. this is the worst and a rip off.

title: Switch to H&R Deluxe instead
content: After years of providing Schedule D and able to import broker transactions and after I purchased the Deluxe version, I found out later that you have to upgrade it to the Premier version to get this functionality. Poor communication to the loyal Turbotax customers. H&R will allow to switch to their Deluxe version for free if you had bought Turbotax Deluxe. The H&R Deluxe version now offers the same functionality regarding broker transactions like Turbotax Deluxe used to.

title: I hated this year's change in Deluxe
content: I have been a loyal TurboTax user for years. I hated this year's change in Deluxe, especially removing schedule D, which is very confusing to a loyal customer who have used the same product for years. If TurboTax what to get more money, I would rather they raise the price than changing the product features.

title: Bad experience with Turbotax
content: It never worked. Following their advice I tried to delete and download again but that was not possible. So I bought H&R Block's program (on a disk!) and that solved my problem. My advice, don't download software. If it doesn't work you are out of luck. I don't see any option for getting a refund either.

title: Not So Hot...
content: This version is terrible - I was using TurboTax (Deluxe) since 2009 and this year (2014) it did not import ANY information from my previous returns. Additionally, I understand there is no support for many forms/schedules without upgrading to Premier (for an additional $30). Be aware of these issues if you plan on using the Deluxe version this year - they are well-documented in other reviews here on Amazon and elsewhere.

title: Forced to pay $30
content: Being forced to pay $30 more to get TurboTax Premier because I've sold an investment (stock, bond or mutual fund) during the year? Crazy. I'll be giving the competition a try next year for sure.

title: Wouldn't work
content: This version would not properly install on my computer. The download kept freezing up and after it finally did download it would not install. I have a 64 bit operating system with Windows 7 installed. I have 100 mg RAM with a 1 terabyte hard drive. I have used TurboTax in the past and not sure why the download on Amazon would not work on my computer.

title: I won't be using Turbo Tax next year because ...
content: You gotta know exactly which version of Turbo Tax you need before you buy it. If you buy one that doesn't support all you tax needs, you pay through the nose to upgrade online. Last year I bought Turbo Tax deluxe and it was the right product for my situation. This year the price went up. My tax situation was the same this year versus last year. But I had to upgrade to Turbo Tax premier to get the same capability. The online upgrade cost is a lot more than the difference in price if I had bought the right product at the store. Yuck!

title: Price Gouging, scammers
content: What a bunch of price-gouging low life's..... No change in my situation, but they **decide** to automatically upgrade, because they took out features that were included previously. Pathetic..... I really appreciate all of the copy-and-paste replies stating their repeated sorrow..... They were greedy - and the people were angry. Off to H and R Block I go now..... Also - why does the rebate/price cut not count whilst doing the ONLINE verion of Turbotax?

title: Not happy with Turbo Tax this year.
content: I have used Turbo Tax for many years and never had any problems until this year. I e-filed my Federal Return without incident, but when I tried to e-file my State Return it was rejected 3 times. I reviewed my Return each time it was rejected and confirmed it was OK, but when I refiled it, the State rejected it again. After paying Turbo Tax $20.00 to e-file it, I finally gave up and snail-mailed it. Thanks alot Turbo Tax.

title: See a good company become a predator over night!
content: I have using Turbo Tax since the 90s. When I found out they did not include my normal schedules I called them and came away pissed at their geed. They have lost a long term customer. I will tell every what a really greedy company Turbo tax is!

title: Intuit abuses customers during 2014 filing season, then cries mea culpa
content: previously, had been a loyal turbo tax user for years. This issue for the 2014 tax filing season of this company eliminating forms that have been in the Home & Business edition and the Deluxe edition every year is ridiculous. Then they try and appease everyone with a partial refund to get us onto the "right" version of their software and then finally cave in after consumer outrage and do what they should have done in the first place. Thank goodness for the power of the internet to force companies into treating their customers correctly. Too bad your rating on Amazon has now tanked to a measly 1 star, Intuit.

title: Disappointed this year.
content: I bought the deluxe version like I have for years only to discover it would not e-file my return as it always has in the past. I then got an e-mail from Turbotax saying a lot of customers were upset by this and offered me a $25 refund only to find out when I went to the site on the link that it would not permit me to claim the refund. I was very disappointed with this program this year. It did however work. I just had to mail my return.

title: Disappointed with the changes and price increase
content: Wow, glad I read the reviews before buying. I've used Deluxe for several years now. It will no longer work for me with the changes, so I'll look at other options other than TurboTax.

title: Warning for Mac users
content: If you want to use on a Mac be warned. You cannot print or establish a password unless you are connected to the internet and go through the Intuit servers. This is only with a Mac, Windows is OK. I find this unacceptable. Why can't I print off a copy unless my internet is up and running? What happens if I lose the internet? This is also security issue. Next year I will but a different product for sure.

title: Ripoff
content: Outrageous. After being a loyal TurboTax user, I was outraged by the price increase and the loss of features (schedule C). I finally made the switch to H&R block. It took a little getting used to, but its a lot cheaper and I am not looking back. Tired of being screwed.

title: One Star
content: Turbo Tax cannot import the H&R file from last year, which I find unacceptable.

title: Another 20 year user leaving....
content: I am a 20 year user, but the reduced functionality in Deluxe just caused me to buy H&R Block premium for this year's taxes. Hate to leave TT but they made a choice and so did I.

title: Buy another program! Audit magnet.
content: Terrible this year! I will be looking for other tax software in 2016. So many errors that I had to go back and fix manually -- errors such as using the same vehicle for two different people for two different jobs!

title: Dubious. Read the fine print.
content: Have used this product for many years, but this will likely be the last. Their have broken out and changed (for the worse) the coverage of each level (Deluxe, Premium, etc.). Re: read the fine print on the box. I grabbed the Deluxe version off of the shelf that was priced similar to last years' product. Only to find out (while in the process of filing) that it did not include a State return, which all previous years had included. Add $40 to the purchase price.

title: Less functional than previous years
content: Like many others I was disappointed to find that I was unable to complete my return with the same edition of TurboTax I used in prior years. The money for the software is already gone but next year I'll use an alternative.

title: Bye bye - Loose all your clients with this idiotic rip off techniques
content: Last year I buy TurboTax. Unfortunately I missed the April 20 cut to upgrade for free, and had to pay the $30 extortion fee to pay a minimum gas income (that was less than 30). Will never ever pay a cent to Turbotax after using it for more than a decade. Bye bye - Loose all your clients with this idiotic rip off techniques.

title: I also have been a faithful TurboTax user. It's ...
content: I also have been a faithful TurboTax user. It's very simple and doesn't need a lot of mumbo-jumbo. If you take something away, then why hasn't the price been reduced? You're still charging the same price as if nothing has changed.

title: 00 more which it doesn't make it easy to do
content: hidden charges! $35.00 for processing fees and I would have mailed my state instead of paying $25.00 more which it doesn't make it easy to do. I didn't want to put my bank information on there and it also made you do that. I will go a different way next year and I have used Turbo Tax for over 10 years. It basically cost $100.00 to file this way.

title: 20+ years! I've tried the rest over the years ...
content: 20+ years! I've tried the rest over the years and always come back. But now you've pulled this stunt and I'm done. Crippling the program was a huge mistake.

title: There should be a zero star option--this is no longer a serious tax software option!!
content: For the last 8 YEARS, TurboTax had been a great solution for me to enter in our family's financial details and it 'magically' knew which forms (especially Schedules C & E) applied to me and filled them out. I trusted this software to get it right. But their decision to suddenly and quietly REMOVE key parts of this 'magical ability' effectively REMOVED my TRUST that they are a solution to my tax software needs! I will NOT buy this newer, 'dumbed down' version, and will instead migrate to the H&R Block software. Perhaps H&RB will get my NEXT 8 YEARS of business...or more!!

title: I am very disappointed for the first time with Turbo Tax
content: I am very disappointed for the first time with Turbo Tax , my return was rejected twice due to problems with the program of Turbo Tax. I tried to get answers and could not talk to anyone at Turbo Tax. My husband called Geek Squad at Best Buy and they gave us the 800 number for customer service at Turbo Tax. The two ladies I talked with was able to help me and I was with their help able to resubmit my tax return and got an acceptance from IRS. I think I should at the least get a credit of the 2015 TurboTax cd. Linda Sattler

title: Not Happy.
content: Doing the taxes went very well, no problems. Then it came time to electronically send my returns in, that is when I had nothing but problems. TurboTaxt said I needed a new pin so I tried, the IRS said I didn't. then when I tried putting my old pins in, I could not get back to where I could put my wife 's pin in, I couldn't get back to where I needed to go. I had to mail them in. Not Happy.

title: It's Not Good Enough to Pay Extra For Schedules C and D.
content: The prime reason for using TT is that your taxes are complex enough to warrant using the software. That Intuit has decided to go the dirt-bag route is disappointing. I will be reviewing HR Block's offering. Addendum: HR Block is apparently TaxCut....the package I first used prior to going to TT. Addendum2: A brief websearch indicates HR Block will import turbotax files. TT files have a "tax2013" extension for 2013..."tax2012" for 2012, and so on.

title: Turbo Gousing
content: I am doing the extended tax return. I was aware of schedule D issue. Because the card sent to me, I assumed I could upgrade anytime. I can't. Their free upgrade to Premier version was over 4/20, another cheap trick they played. Then I thought I could fill out schedule D manually because I do not have many transactions. I found out that I cannot fill out schedule D even manually. This is a bad company. They always look for a way to gauging customers. Quicken used to let users download transactions from financial instituition. Around 2007, they blocked downloading without purchasing new version. I download my data to the software I own. Why do they ask me to buy another version. Since then, I switched to the free GNUCASH. I will pay for the premier gouging version since I have to finish my tax but this will be the last money Intuit see from me. I will switch to TaxCut or other product next year no matter what they claim to do in 2015.

title: Be careful with this one. Intuit lost my business this year!
content: I purchased this from a retail outlet and didn't realize that it was missing all of my stock deductions! I've been using turbotax for over 7 years. Very disappointed. I had to switch over to H&R block this year.

title: It been said that "you are good as long as you deliver
content: Of all the years that I had used Turbo Tax to file my taxes, you want my opinion this year. It been said that "you are good as long as you deliver, but when you failed to do so the 100th time, then you are not that good anymore". That is what is happened to me this year with my copy of "TurboTax Deluxe". There fore, to be as polite as possible, I just going to say that this year you failed big time. It so, that I would have to consider using another tax software for the years to come.

title: One Star
content: I wasn't able to use it I needed the next higher version for my taxes.

title: Former 15 year user of Deluxe Turbo Tax
content: I discovered that I needed a new version this year called Premier. I am awaiting a credit for the Deluxe purchase as it is not suitable for my purposes, and found the technical representative from Amazon helpful in instructing me how to cancel out my order. Although I found that the credit procedure is very poor from turbo tax- They wanted funds for the replacement well before returning a credit which I understand will take six weeks. My understanding is that Deluxe is substandard to prior years, and the President of turbo tax agrees as he will help off set the added cost of the Premier program up to $ 30 dollars. However, can not even request the $30 credit until I can file my return, which has hit a major glitch that customer service at intuit has yet to resolve. Turns out my free state will not download for free. The additional state I ordered and paid $39.99 for looks like it worked fine.

title: Horrible & costly
content: This is awful. Made me pay for filing which I didn't have to do last year. And when one of my state's return was rejected I was told to make the fix and I wouldn't be charged again to efile. Lo and behold I couldn't get around the payment portion to efile the second time. So I mailed it instead. Called Turbo for help and the guy could not help and said he would figure it out & call back. No call. I will not ever use Turbo again. It cost too much.

title: Extremely dissapointed in your deceision to remove Schedules C and ...
content: Extremely dissapointed in your decision to remove Schedules C and D from the software. I already bought and installed the Deluxe software without realizing it did not have the same functionality I had come to expect in the past. I might be able to understand removing schedule C but I would certainly think that many of your customers would have capital gains and need Schedule D. Since I need both of those schedules I'm not sure if I will buy your upgraded product or buy something else and start anew with that software.

title: Felt cheated
content: Have used Turbo Tax for about 10 years now. I have always got the version with the Federal included and paid for the state. This year I could not get my computer to connect with the filing. It forced me to pay an extra $35 over the purchase of the state by taking the money out of the refund. Probably will try Tax Cut next year. Like cheating your loyal customers out of extra money for their bottom line.

title: Thanks to all those who've reviewed the product. Been ...
content: Thanks to all those who've reviewed the product. Been a loyal user for several years but I have switched to H&R based on the experiences of others.

title: One Star
content: trash

title: I bought this package specifically because it advertised it would ...
content: I bought this package specifically because it advertised it would import HRBlock .t13 format returns from 2013. Since that is the app I used last year, I wanted continuity w/o having to reenter last years return. The tax code is complicated, and getting more so - having access to ALL the worksheets and data from the previous year is essential when completing anything but a 1040EZ tax return. This feature did not work for my return, and from comments I've seen from other users of the app with similar problems, I am not alone. Very disappointing, as this is heavily promoted as a key feature.

title: Program regressed, be careful on buying versions
content: After using TurboTax for 20 years, this is my last. They changed the program without announcing the change to customers and more than doubling the price for similar version as prior years. The incorporated changes are backward changes making it nearly useless for me. If I had not done taxes for 30 years (manually), I would not have been able to use program.

title: Unreadable "mailable" copies.
content: I like the ease of using Turbo Tax. I've been using this product for years. This year my son purchased the program and would use the free federal filing. I also used his Turbo Tax program and I intended on mailing my returns. After I had completed and printed the mailable returns, I noticed that they were garbled and unreadable. Is this something the company does so we will each purchase the program? I think I'll try another tax program next year.

title: Turbotax 2014 inferior product
content: Don't buy it. Go to H & R block software instead. Turbotax has virtually no customer service. The 2014 tax year software is critically flawed. Forces you to purchase a more expensive upgrade than needed and some of the pages don't work. You are not allowed to que instead you leave your number & they call you back hours later. Then they spend hours on the phone but don't fix the problem. I used it for 15 years. I won't now. I'd give it a minus rating but 1 star is required.

title: I am no longer a Fan of Turbo Tax and will not use it again!
content: I just did my taxes for 2014 yesterday but I purchased the software 6 weeks ago at a local store on sale. I have used Turbo Tax for over 20 years but now I am done with them. Unlike many reviewers that post in December or January I donât review software that I havenât used. I used this software and in the end I wish that I had purchased something else. My review is based on actual experience and not just a review to garner votes by posting early. I had numerous problems and it took me twice as long to do my taxes as it should have. It kept asking the same questions over and over and I filled out the boxes and when that section was completed none of the dollar figures or answered questions showed up as correct. The most glaring was when it asked me if I had prepaid estimated taxes and I answered yes. It then asked me what amounts and I filled in the quarterly payments. When done it did not include those payments in the refund calculation and I had to manually override the data and fix it. This one mistake alone would have cost me $1200. If I had not been watching the refund amount at the top of the screen I might have missed this error. I used the walk me through format as I normally do and this year it was just garbage. It would ask me if a set of circumstances would apply to my return and I would answer no and then it would proceed to ask me 20 to 30 questions to which I have already answered that they did not apply. When I answered yes to a section and answered every question and filled in numbers, when appropriate, it would not use the data or the numbers and I had to go back and fill out the data and numbers again. Very time consuming and frustrating. Ultimately I had no trust in the way this software worked and I rechecked every number and calculation before I filed. Like I said before, one error alone would have cost me $1200. When I was completed it did a scan and it found a mistake, or so it claimed. It told me a number for my 2013 taxes was not entered correctly and I checked it and it was correct. I even looked at the actual printout of my 2013 taxes to verify the number. To make matters worse it truncated the code for the local tax authorities for the county that I live in making it almost impossible to determine what it was even questioning. It stated the taxes paid to INC were wrong when the code is IN C-41. I had to manually go back to the forms and fix the error that really was not a problem and it had no bearing on my 2014 return. A simple waste of time for what it called a data collection form. Doing taxes is not really fun and wasting twice as much time as required makes it really a hassle. Turbo tax has lost a customer that has been loyal for over 20 year back to the days of Turbo Tax coming to you on floppy disks. On top of that, go look at the recent 5 star reviews. Many of them are first time reviewers posting 2 words to one sentence reviews. They use no punctuation and no capital letters. They are fake reviews. How can you trust a company that does that because they are in trouble?

title: I was very disappointed with TurboTax
content: I have been using TurboTax for years and this year was the first time I experienced any problems. My federal kept getting rejected stating that my social was in error. I checked - rechecked and - rechecked. I even called your help line and did exactly what your people told me to do. Still no results. I took my taxes to H & R Block and they did. I got back $75.00 more and they had no problem submitting electronically. I was very disappointed with TurboTax.

title: Forms are Free at IRS.gov - no need for TurboTax
content: The forms are Free at IRS.gov so no need for TurboTax. I've stopped using TurboTax. It is simpler to just do the paper forms. I download them from the IRS.gov web site for ___FREE___ and fill them out as PDF files (use your favorite program such as Preview on the Mac, Adobe Acrobat, etc) and then submit them. Easy peasy. No fees.

title: Be Careful what Intuit is selling you Online before you check out!!!!
content: I Tried to purchase TT Deluxe today for Tax Year 2014 and what was charged against my credit card was the 2013 Version of the Deluxe for Windows download. I have been a customer of online efiling of both Federal and State forms with TT since the 90's. I am very disgusted to find even when I get the Deluxe 2014 version I can't file Schedule C which I do every year selling Stocks. I can't believe that Intuit has slipped so far. I am done and won't be back.

title: TurboTax tries to dupe us!
content: Terrible! Deluxe version stripped of many of the essentials!

title: Hidden fees and poor support. I was charged to e-file my state ...
content: They blew it this year. Hidden fees and poor support. I was charged to e-file my state return and then later was told I couldn't e-file because of my tax situation. The process I went through to try to get refunded was long, complicated, and it took FOREVER to finally get a live person to assist me. Turbotax used to be pretty straightforward - now it's deceptive and far from being worth the price. This will be the last year for me.

title: Not user friendly.
content: For me Turbo Tax is poorly written and unnecessarily cumbersome. You should be able to highlight any figure on a Turbo Page or on the final IRS form and be taken to a page which shows how this figure was arrived at. I created a duplicate entry on my return (my fault). The software failed to pick it up and I owed the IRS an additional $1500. The FAQ section leaves a lot to be desired.

title: Was not very happy with Turbo Tax this year
content: Was not very happy with Turbo Tax this year. I had to pay to download the state form this year. I have never had to do this before. I paid for the Deluxe and I always got one state download for free. Not only did it cost me to download my state form after I paid for Turbo Tax Deluxe, but they wanted me to pay 19.99 to file electronically. More investment that I expected to pay. I will have to rethink how I will be doing my taxes for next year.

title: good program but if you have state taxes to do ...
content: the program was okay, but I had to pay so much extra for the state taxes, it would have been cheaper to use an accountant. I had 3 state taxes to do. the program asked if I wanted the first one to be my free one and even though I said yes I had to pay $20. Again, good program but if you have state taxes to do it's cheaper to use someone. The $49 I paid but an additional over $100 was not worth it

title: Not what it used to be
content: There was a time when Turbo Tax included everything you needed. Now they break it up to charge you as many fees as they can while also trying to sideline you into deals with third parties to make extra money off the side. I like to just pay for a product and be done, not be nickel and dimed afterwards.

title: Saved me a bunch of money!
content: I bought this after doing my taxes with H&R Block software. I was uncomfortable with the amount of taxes I owed and after thinking about it for a couple of weeks, and a discount offer from Amazon, I decided to download TurboTax Deluxe - glad I did. I have used TurboTax for many, many years but was upset with Intuit's removal of forms that have been included in the past so I gave H&R Block a try - never again! The difference in the amount of taxes I owed was amazing and I wonder if I didn't miss something when I was entering information or if there was a problem with the software. Regardless I will stay with TurboTax as long as it does what I need it to do.

title: as other reviews say, Intuit has removed the investment ...
content: as other reviews say, Intuit has removed the investment support, offered a "free upgrade" to fix it. Obtaining the upgrade meant i had to call Customer Support, who had me on hold for an hour with no response. Bottom line: unusable software, with no way to fix it. I'll try another brand.

title: Done with Intuit
content: After more than a decade as a loyal Turbotax customer, this screw job on functionality has ended that. Don't get buy this.

title: Way too expensive!!!
content: I've used turbotax the last few years, but will no longer be a customer. I recently went in to Officemax and my jaw just about hit the floor when I saw the price. I gave it back to the cashier and walked out. They've gotten too expensive, and must think they're the cat's meow. There are many cheaper alternatives out there. GOODBYE INTUIT. TOO BAD FOR YOU. YOUR GREED BACKFIRED!!!

title: Serious quality control issues with Turbo Tax 2014
content: Long time user and the new product didn't meet the standards established with prior products. 2014 didn't even pick-up my wife's information from 2013 and it all had to be input again. Secondly, the filing process for State would not connect and I had to call for a special account number to use. Haven't even filed Federal yet, so I don't know if connection problems have been resolved. I will probably use another product next year.

title: Their horrible decision to remove functionality from the Deluxe version to ...
content: I have been a loyal TurboTax user for the past 13 years, but I will never use their tax preparation software again. Their horrible decision to remove functionality from the Deluxe version to Premier has been well documented. I too was suckered into needing to the Premier upgrade at a cost of $30.00. I did receive a rebate of $25.00, however I feel deceived by their actions which makes me say - "Hello H&R Block".

title: Disappointed longtime customer
content: I've used TurboTax for 15 years. Now I am reconsidering what I will get next year. The "Deductions and Homeowners" package did not have all the features I needed. Also, the state tax download worked poorly -- it would not allow me to e-file. I'm puzzled why Intuit decided to make such ill-advised and poorly executed changes to their formerly good product. I am very disappointed with this product.

title: Expensive Upgrade
content: I just found out TT Deluxe does not support schedule D anymore. You have to upgrade to Premier for $30 more. That's going to make me think long and hard about buying it next year.

title: One Star
content: Used this program, all my information got hacked. Scammers got my bank information and SSN. 0 stars.

title: One Star
content: Not worth the endless emails. Will never use it again!

title: This change broke the back!
content: So long TT been a customer since the beginning. Once I switch I doubt that I will be back going with h&r or tax cut.

title: Watch Out!
content: I have always thought turbotax was a good program....but this year they were hacked and users most confidential personal information stolen. Until that is absolutely resolved, I would stay away. No assistance has been offered by Turbotax for this lax in security. I am unlikely to use Turbotax again.

title: RIP OFF! DO NOT BUY!!
content: RIP OFF!! Don't buy this. Have been using turbo tax for years and this year after getting half way through my return it requires a $30 upgrade to complete it!!! Keep in mind this is AFTER purchasing this program for $40!!! They should be ashamed of themselves. Never again will I use this program!!

title: Another lost TurboTax customer
content: Yeah forget using deluxe or even premier for a simple tax return. At least last year you could use deluxe for a simple few forms in schedule C, they so limited the ability to use schedule C in t his year that I'm sending it back and going to different software after 12 years of TT. Even if you go to Premier you can't deduct more than $100 in schedule C, and you can still forget about using a home office deduction unless you buy the much more expensive home and small business edition. That a bunch of bull Intuit. Forget using my $39.99 (@ Sam's) in your profit statements ever again,

title: Was here to download but not now.
content: I'm a long, long, long time Turbo Tax user. I'm waiting to the last minute to do taxes and am on here to down Turbo Tax.....or I was. After reading the reviews, I too will look at H & R Block. I'm not taking the chance because I don't have much time left to deal with the "issues".

title: I have been using Turbo Tax for more than ten years and am not happy with changes you made this year
content: This years Turbo Tax Deluxe did not have the same forms as last years. We were not prompted to upgrade to Turbo tax Premier as we were doing our return. It checked the return and we e-filed it. Then we found out Deluxe need to be upgraded. After the upgrade we had to send in a amended return. .I have been using Turbo Tax for more than ten years and am not happy with changes you made this year.

title: Cannot get it to install must go through hell with ...
content: Cannot get it to install must go through hell with amazon to donwload it again to try and install it. I will never buy this software or any software for download and install from Amazon. I expected to download and have the product fully on my system not in a library on Amazon. I am fed up with this process.

title: "Deluxe" is no longer Deluxe...
content: I have used TurboTax / TurboTax Deluxe since the early 1990s (MS DOS-based, I believe) and I have been very happy with the product and consider it a high quality application from Intuit along with Quicken, which I have also used for 20 years. I downloaded the Deluxe version from Amazon last year but picked up the CD version this year from Costco. After I got home I noticed that the Deluxe version no longer supports schedule D; the Deluxe version always supported schedule D since I started using it. I planned to return it for a refund and try another application this year. However I found a helpful article at Forbes analyzing this very issue: www.forbes.com/sites/janetnovack/2015/01/09/irate-turbotax-users-can-get-free-upgrades-or-block-substitute/ I want Intuit to succeed and continue to offer great products, so I thought that Iâd call them (800-445-1875) and they did offer to mail me or provide me a download of their Premiere version that does support schedule D at no additional cost. The process took longer than I expected (20 minutes) since I opted for the downloaded version that required me to create an account on TurboTax.com, etc. Although I was initially very annoyed at what appears to be a marketing trick, I am now able to use the same product that Iâve used for decades to prepare my taxes. Hopefully Intuit learns from this mistake... I'll look more carefully next tax season.

title: Bait and Switch - beware of thievery - avoid this product at all costs
content: WARNING! after I paid for the software, including my State return, this would not print my return until I agreed to pay $360 in fees. I will not EFile for me claiming that someone else has already claimed all 5 of my children. I tried 4 times to file electronically but it rejected over and over. SO now time is running out and these thieves are holding my tax returns hostage. I have to pay $360 so that I can use my printer, my paper, and my ink to print a form that I completed myself then I will pay postage to mail it. What am I getting for the $360? Angry. That's the only thing I'm getting.

title: Turbo trouble
content: I have used Turbo Tax for several years with great satisfaction. This year using 2014 deluxe was a total disappointment. My first try did not save but deleted my previous years information. I started over and reached state. It asked me what state which is Virginia and would not show the forms asking me to pay 39 dollars before starting. The box says state is free. I will use a different provider.

title: I'll not be buying TT this year.
content: Boy, am I glad I decided to read the TT Deluxe reviews for this year! I too have been a long time satisfied customer (about 14 years) but having seen the product downgrades, I'll also be saying, GOODBYE! Thanks to all of the helpful Amazon users out there who just saved me money!!

title: I feel like I have been robbed by the people in charge ...
content: Turbo Tax should fire the 'nut' that took away the forms that were included in ALL the past years BUT not in the 2014 "Deluxe". I feel like I have been robbed by the people in charge of Turbo Tax. H & R Block will give you the missing forms for free if you prove to them that you bought this INFERIOR tax program. Watch for Turbo Tax to lose a lot of people next year and for H & R Block to get rich.

title: Thanks to those who fought. I'm switching!
content: To all those who found themselves with a now inadequate version of TurboTax thanks to Intuit's apparent bait-n-switch, and who took the time to write reviews here, I thank you. I too have used TurboTax almost exclusively for 20-25 years. This year, I again came to Amazon to make my purchase and was enlightened by the reviews, resolving to end my relationship with Intuit. Then, in an apparent major change of heart, Intuit offered a $25 refund to all those who had been slighted. So, a major screw-up, followed by a significant 'act of atonement'. Forgive and move on? Well wait a minute! It turns out that to get the refund, you have to provide your social security number to prove you made that purchase. Sounds fair, but ... how does Intuit know my social security number? I certainly never gave it to them. From what I understand, Intuit appears to have been been keeping private information about us. I always buy a desk version. How much of my private information is Intuit keeping without my knowledge and how did they get it? How secure is it? Oh, and that refund? Though more than one version of the program has been crippled, the refund is not for all versions, it seems. I guess purchasers of those other versions didn't make enough of a fuss for Intuit to be sorry. And, about that $25 refund apology .. Did they actually say they wouldn't try the same thing next year? I don't recall that. Anyone else? Competition, I'm in your corner now. If anything above is incorrect and brought to my attention, I will gladly edit this review accordingly, but at this point in time, this is my understanding and without question I'm switching to the competition.

title: TurboTax 2014 was a great disappointment
content: I have been a Turbo Tax customer for upwards of 15 years. This year for some unknown reason Intuit decided to redesign the software and it was difficult to use, hard to figure out, clumsy, and generally far below the quality I have always expected from TurboTax. Next year I expect I will try a competing product. And then this... On Tuesday, April 14 I received an email from Intuit telling me that my refund did not cover my Intuit fees and informing me that $59.98 would be deducted from my checking account to cover the California state filing fee of $19.99 and an additional $39.99 for âTURBOTAX PREMIUM SERVICE: PAY W/REFUND & ANNUAL AUDIT DEFENSE DELUXE.â This is a fee for a service which I did not order and do not want. So I called the number on the email and was told someone would call me back in a few minutes. Three hours later I received a call back and was told that the gentleman that called me couldnât help me. He transferred me to another department where I was left on hold for 97 minutes. When the representative finally came on line, she politely informed me that California state law required them to charge this audit defense fee and that Intuit was simply following the law. I am an executive with an international mergers and acquisition firm and a former CEO of several start ups. I spend a lot of time with lawyers and I immediately suspected that this was nonsense. When I told her this, she put me on hold while she spoke with a supervisor, and when she returned sometime later she told me that I had been informed of the charge after I had completed my transaction. I assume this was meant to be in the fine print. But it was not a matter of California law. Then she offered to refund this fee to me after I paid the $59.99. I agreed to do this on the website and then I advised her that telling a lie about California law to justify Intuitâs actions was probably not a good policy. She then apologized, acknowledged that she had lied, and then she said that she had been instructed to use this line when someone called and questioned the fee. Making this official Intuit policy.

title: I have used TT for over 10 yrs. Used ...
content: I have used TT for over 10 yrs. Used to get free state return with delux package. With The delux package I purchased it was now going to cost me another $34 to purchase state. I was able to purchase HR Block premium that included state, for less than this. Even though I had already purchased Turbotax I feel I still came out ahead, particularly with all the problems with turbotax that u read here.

title: More Taxing Crapware Looking to Get You With Undisclosed Extra Charges. DON'T DRINK THIS COOLAID!!!
content: Typical Tax Software as usual. Beware of the hidden undisclosed extra fee just for e-filing your state. When I pay for the deluxe paackge, I expect it to include e-filing for the federal AND STATE, not SURPRISE! WE WANT TO STEEL $20 OR MORE JUST SO YOU CAN E-FILE YOUR STATE FORMS. DON'T BUY THEIR CRAPWARE until they actually include everything up front.

title: Formerly happy 10 year user will NEVER use this product again. Horrible!
content: I hardly ever write reviews, but Turbotax made me so angry this year I have to tell everyone what a horrible, horrible program this is. I've used Turbotax for the last 10 years, maybe longer. Every year I go out and buy a CD and do my family taxes and my daughter's and mother's. The program would give me the option to do up to 5 family members. This year I had to go through the website because of the advertised CD problems and because they weren't updated properly and I had to buy a separate license for each person. That really, really ticked me off. Then when I actually started the taxes I had to wade through a very slow, cumbersome program with a lot of faux-friendly, but useless, chatter. Half the time the input fields wouldn't work and if went back to change something, the program crashed. Unlike the CD you can't go look at the actual page on your federal form and make changes, all you can do is go through the interface. If the interface was messed up there was no way to correct it (for instance, it put in a wrong data entry onto the wrong line of a multi line field, making it look like I entered a travel expense twice)It took me days to finish my taxes. Then, I saved the forms. Mine went out fine, but my mother's didn't. So I saved and went in later, hoping to make a change that would allow me to electronically refile, but NOOOOO. Once you log out you lose all access to your forms and you can't change anything, even though it hasn't been filed yet. The online forums were blazing with frustrated people who wanted to go back in before they hit the send button but weren't allowed back in to edit their returns. It was a horrible experience. Next year I'll be overseas and will need to file electronically and it will be HR Block for me.

title: Used both TurboTax AND H&R Block for 2014
content: This year I had the opportunity to use both H&R Block software and TurboTax. First I purchased H&R block because I wanted to send a message to Intuit that they should not take their customer base for granted. For years I have wanted an alternative solution to TurboTax because of their nickel and dime strategy and their arrogance. I ended buying TurboTax after struggling with the H&R block 2014 software. With the H&R block software my son (filing as a non-dependent) did not qualify for the American Opportunity Credit but with TurboTax he did. A savings of $1000 using TurboTax!!! On the flip side, TurboTax wanted to use Schedule C for my 1099-MISC even though it was sporadic work. H&R block categorized it "other income". A savings of $250 using H&R block. I never was able to get TurboTax to categorize it as "other income". Also TurboTax was less flexible with miscellaneous charitable expenses always wanting me to enter mileage when I wanted to just list an charitable expense. Maybe these things could have been worked out with TurboTax but their support is lacking. It was definitely worthwhile for me to purchase both products and compare. Our taxes are not complicated so it was a small inconvenience entering the information separately for both packages. The upside was significant savings by using both and comparing the two results. I give TurboTax two stars because the product is easy to use and has a better interface than H&R Block. They don't get any more than that because they still have a looooong way to go with their pricing strategy, support, customer relations, etc.

title: Had to pay extra to file my taxes.
content: This Turbo Tax product did not allow me to file my taxes without first paying $30 extra to bump up to Turbo Tax Premium. This is a company which should be avoided. Very poor treatment of repeat customers. Discontinuation of this product would be a benefit to the American tax society.

title: AVOID TURBO TAX AT ALL COSTS!
content: Bought this because FREE State tax. Was not free. Trouble section says that it was a promotion until February 16. Did not notice that on my download. Won't EVER buy turbo tax again and am pretty upset with amazon for propagating this confusion. Go to H& R block in your neighborhood instead!

title: 2014 TurboTax not so easy.
content: This has been the worst year TurboTax has come out with. Would not allow you to e-file unless you paid several hidden fees. Would not allow you to use your pre-existing account. The so called HELP DESK was of no use., they had no idea what to do. .Have used TurboTax for years, with no problems, quick, easy, e- file and your done. This year I give it a thumbs down.

title: It really stunk! I have never had to pay ...
content: It really stunk! I have never had to pay taxes owed because of a mistake before....I paid the money for Michigan state tax program and it did the property tax credit incorrectly. I have bought your program for years... and trusted you.. with you trying to increase the price of your programs and doing the tax incorrectly I doubt if I can trust your programs again.

title: If you are a Mac user do not buy this product.
content: I have used TurboTax for many years and have considered it to be a good product. There have been changes made this year that have made me change my mind. First, if you are a Mac user you will not be able to print without using Intuit's Print Service, which means that if you use it offline you cannot print. Second, their customer service people are incompetent.

title: removed stock transactions from product; want $30 for upgrade ...
content: removed stock transactions from product; want $30 for upgrade; will rebate 25 if you file through them; whole process feels greedy, they could have upgraded the software and made it available for free. The cost seems to go up each year for the software to the point that it is no longer valuable enough for the money one pays

title: Disappointed!
content: Used TurboTax for many years now so I purchased the same product I used last year, which covered all my needs including reporting investment income. This year in the middle of doing my taxes, it made me upgrade to a more expensive package in order to complete my return. Pretty sneaking way to do a price increase.

title: bad text color
content: bad text color. radio buttons did not stay set. You never knew what answer Turbo Tax was taking. Also, TT should check for tax liens on your spouse's income before accepting the choice of married filing jointly. As a multi-year purchaser of Turbo Tax, I should have been given a discount on purchasing TT without being within certain dates.

title: loyal turbo tax user that will never use it again
content: Worst Turbo Tax version they could have ever come out with. I am a CPA and usually this is a breeze and this u ear they have done everything they can to screw this up and charge me more money. I can't even file right now because they can't take my payment to pay for the efile. I hope someone at Intuit loses their job over this.

title: Cute. Sasan Goodarzi, GM of Intuit TurboTax offering $25 rebate this year....
content: Changing my 1 star to 4 stars. Kudos to Intuit for finally responding, and reversing their mistake. Definite proof thst taking the time to inform others and spread the word can have an impact. Now, time for everyone else who rated this a 1 star for the Intuit blunder to likewise reward them for reversing course with a higher rating. Here is the letter Intuit sent out, if you haven't seen it: *********************** We recently tried to explain the changes made to our TurboTax desktop software and apologized for the impact it had on you. Many responded and let us know our apology and rationale were not acceptable. You want the TurboTax desktop product (CD or download) you've used in the past to do what it has always done--handle your tax situation. We heard you. It's time we make it right. Beginning February 7, 2015, you can buy the same product you'd normally buy, and if you need to upgrade for your tax situation, we'll help you do that at no additional cost. This means you'll get all the forms you need, including Schedules C, D E, and F, without paying anything extra. Learn more. If you're a returning TurboTax Deluxe CD or download customer and you've already filed using TurboTax Premier or TurboTax Home & Business, we're offering you $25 cash back. Simply visit TurboTax.com/25back to claim your money. Next, we are committed to bringing back the product you know and love. By the time you are ready to prepare and file your taxes next year, the TurboTax desktop product you trusted in the past will include the forms you've counted on for years. I understand our actions have caused anger and frustration, and our response has been far too slow. TurboTax is committed to regaining your trust and providing you with the level of excellence you have come to expect. Thank you for your feedback and continued loyalty, Sasan Goodarzi and the TurboTax Team General Manager, Intuit TurboTax ***** orig review follows **** For all of us "confused"customers who didn't understand the change because of their "poorly executed" communication of the changes this year, Intuit is offering a $25 rebate. It is hilarious they are blaming the change on needing to align the desktop functionality with the online and mobile versions of TurboTax. Bottom line is Intuit removed functionality from the Deluxe product that has been there for double digit years. Same price for less functionality is an unusual software model... Intuit, you have damaged your relationship with your long term customers, face it. Saying that it only impacts a small percentage of your customers, just 10 million or so, is lame. I'm betting this will have long term ripple effects with current customers and future potential customers that will now avoid you. By taking the steps you did, you have lost the trust of customers. Good luck earning that trust back.

title: This is despicable but not uncommon. I canât even ...
content: This is despicable but not uncommon. I canât even buy Â½ gallon of OJ anymore; now it is 59 oz.

title: Their customer support is abismal and I still can't file my New Mexico state tax like many others have posted even though Inuit
content: I have used TurboTax for years. But the company has clearly changed. Their customer support is abismal and I still can't file my New Mexico state tax like many others have posted even though Inuit claims they have fixed it. Get your act together Intuit while you still can.

title: Giving H&R Block Deluxe a try...
content: I have been a TurboTax customer for many years. Not totally satisfied with the software but for ~$40 the Deluxe version was reasonably priced and met my needs (I have both W-2 and 1099-MISC income and need to file a Sched C, etc.). I was about to purchase Deluxe again for this year before reading the reviews. Bob Meighan's offer for a free upgrade to Premier was tempting, but just for kicks I checked out H&R Block Deluxe to see how it compared. Interestingly it seems like the H&R Block software might even be better than TurboTax for half the cost. So I just went ahead and bought it. I figure I'll give it a try this year, and see if Intuit can get their act together by next year...

title: No more turbo tax for me
content: First I had to pay for the product then additional state forms than pay to e file and if I wanted my cash quickly there was an additional charge. By the time I was done I payed around 150 dollars. I would have been better off letting an accountant do it. No more turbo tax for me

title: before I'd wasted so much time I don't have
content: I started in with TurboTax online, thinking that I would purchase it. Had almost completed my taxes when I found out they weren't offering all the forms for e-filing. Was so angry at their greedhead approach I had to switch to H&R Block. If they'd made it clear that they'd changed their pricing structure from the outset, before I'd wasted so much time I don't have, I would not have been so angry. I've been using TT for as long as I can remember, but this leaves such a bad taste that I'm never doing business with Intuit again. Too bad: had planned to use QuickBooks for my business. Will have to find something else. Too bad I can't give out negative stars.

title: One Star
content: Too bad... Very disappointing. Like charging extra for brakes in a car...

title: I was very disappointed that Turbo Tax Deluxe did not include the Schedule ...
content: I was very disappointed that Turbo Tax Deluxe did not include the Schedule C for business income this year. Now I have to download the Turbo Tax for Small Business and pay an additional $40. Turbo Tax did offer a $25 rebate for not informing it's customer of the change, but they should have picked up the entire amount. I'm undecided if I will use Turbo Tax next year.

title: Last Time I Buy TurboTax
content: Just bought the expensive package due to forcing my hand...can't wait to see how hard it is to get the $25 back. This will be the last year I use TurboTax me thinks because competitors are LOWERING their prices over time as they get more users, not RAISING them...just did not want to spend time learning a new software this year...too much to do.

title: Intuit Software....
content: I can't believe Intuit would remove, in my opinion, basic and necessary forms from their product. Last year I used Turbo Tax however this year I will use another product. Oh - and by the way - when I efiled federal last year I found my spouses return was already filed. Someone had stolen her identity and filed a bogus return. I had purchased the state efile and couldn't use it. Intuit never did refund the cost of the state efile. Furthermore - Intuit could recite to me all previous tax years information, since I have used Turbo tax for several years, which I find concerning. Intuit is holding all your information regardless of which production is purchased, on-line, software, etc. Do yourself a favor and run a quick search on Intuit systems being compromised and you'll find a several complaints. After doing research last year I found an interesting Intuit email test. A person ran an email test in an attempt to determine if their email servers were compromised. His tests resulted in a great likelihood they were. Iâm not overly thrilled that Intuit hold all our information and "tryâs" to protect it via the use of firewalls and other security techniques because it simply isn't effective. I assumed efiling was just a clearing house for the simple process of efiling and the information was not being held in any vendorâs core network. Iâve worked in Cryptology and the old saying states, âwhat man secures can eventually be unsecuredâ. Do a quick general search on security breaches and youâll find several hundred. I can't determine where the "leak" occurred and my spouses information was compromised however there are very few places where all this particular information (full name, SSN, employer, etc) would have been available. Intuit, since they hold all our information, may be the source however I donât have enough proof and/or facts to make a case. What I would suggest is to purchase tax software. Load it to a clean machine and update it with the most current forms. Disconnect it from the net and start your taxes normally, putting your personal information within the software. Do not reconnect it to the net until youâve removed the software and your personal information. Print your returns and snail mail them to the taxing authority. This way the vendor of the tax software cannot possibly keep your information within their core network servers/databases and helps prevent your information from being compromised.

title: Look for another Tax program in 2015.
content: Have been using TurboTax for years. In prior years the Basic version was able to meet my complete needs. For 2014 I ended up needing three different programs and over $90 to do what the 2013 Basic did. I would give it a 0 star rating.

title: Loved it but left it
content: Loved it but left it! I have purchased TurboTax for many, many years [although not from Amazon]. and have recommended it to quite a few friends and associates. For most of that time, the product has been very solid and easy and efficient to use. Although my tax situation has not changed substantially, the price of the TurboTax product that I now need to buy to complete my taxes has nearly doubled, because Intuit has emasculated the functionality of their product that I have used for years. You can read any number of other reviews here to learn what product functionality has been removed. Can I afford the new price? That's not the point. The point is that - unlike a few years ago - there are now other very robust software alternatives at much more reasonable prices from companies that do not price gouge, as it appears that Intuit is doing. I have previewed TaxAct which is PC Magazine's Editor's Choice. I am convinced that it is as capable and intuitive as TurboTax and I plan to purchase and use it in the future. So although I have loved TurboTax, I will join what appears to be a fairly sizable market share that is leaving the Intuit ranks.

title: Horrible, Deceptive Rip-off
content: One star is generous. I've been purchasing the same Turbo Tax Deluxe software for years. I purchased the same thing this year. When I was trying to enter my K-1 income, a tab popped up advising me that I needed to pay an additional $30 to upgrade the software since "Deluxe" no longer includes business income. There was no warning from Turbo Tax that they were going to extract more dollars for the same software. I feel deceived and cheated. I am done with Turbo Tax. I am flipping the bird in your direction, Turbo Tax.

title: Terrible. Does not support non-resident aliens.
content: Terrible. I am a non resident alien. Baught and downloaded the software, started filling out forms until the questions become irrelevant. Started Googling and found out that Turbotax does not support NRs! What a scam! It should be stated bold!

title: many years and would definitely recommend it to others
content: I have used Turbo Tax for many, many years and would definitely recommend it to others. It is simple and easy to follow the directions and saves money for a mandatory expense of filing taxes. Last year I took our taxes, as completed by myself on Turbo Tax, to H & R Block for a free review wherein H & R advertised they would be able to "save us money'. They were shocked and I was totally satisfied, when I walked out of there after being told that they couldn't find a thing that I had missed. I can always count on Turbo Tax to keep the most up-to-date, current information in their release. Filing for free to IRS is a wonderful plus as well!

title: Have used TurboTax for several years and have NO problems ...
content: Have used TurboTax for several years and have NO problems. This year it has figured my Indiana state form wrong causing a stern letter from Indiana State stating I owe an additional $150. Tried to contact TurboTax and as of this writing, I have received no response. This may be the last year I will use this software for taxes.

title: Corrupt installation file = money & time wasted
content: I have downloaded TurboTax from Amazon for the last 3 years. This year I kept receiving an error message that the download was corrupt and that I needed to redownload the installation program. 5 downloads and 1 re-start later I still cannot load the program.

title: Betrayal of long time users!
content: I paid for and downloaded TurbTax2014 from the website at the first of the year. It installed but would not run. I have NOT been able to speak to a customer service representative though I've waited for 30 minutes to their aggravating messages and trite music. It's a lot like their excuses; lame.

title: WARNING !!! ****** ESPP, stock option REMOVED from deluxe version ****** What a revolution !!!
content: I been a customer for 5 years and bought a deluxe version from their site today for $20, was so excited and surprised for the good price until I read the coverage. ESPP, stock option are gone which I been using for years and take for granted! I can't believe what they are doing. Definitely stupid move for the company! I don't mind paying more to get what I m used to, but don't trick me like this and hard sell your 'premium' version! I am gonna call them up to do an upgrade for $10 next week, or we part ways FOR GOOD!!!

title: Intuit has been a pain with various Quicken/Quickbooks version issues (I HATED being forced to upgrade in the 90s)
content: WOW. Thanks to the community for this heads-up. I was on automatic and so close to doing our annual no-brain renewal when the TWO (2) stars of the product reviews this year caught the corner of my eye. It didn't take long for me to read that it was time to finally change brands. Over the years, Intuit has been a pain with various Quicken/Quickbooks version issues (I HATED being forced to upgrade in the 90s), but I'd almost forgot about those wars when this came up. We've been both TurboTax personal and corporate users since the Chipsoft days. Hello, H&R Block.

title: Tired of Corporations downsizing and charging more for products.
content: Will not even consider purchasing. Thank you to the honest reviewers whom posted their comments. Had purchased Turbo Tax previously and was going to again but not for the price or lack of functionality they offer in this years product.

title: FIND ANOTHER TAX SOFTWARE
content: This whole upgrading the deluxe for free because TURBOTAX wanted to try to rip off the consumers is ridiculous. And they make it very difficult to even get the update. Will never use them again. Hopefully the board will fire the CEO and whoever else decided that trying to trick consumers is a good way to go.

title: Beware if your OsamaCare is not of the "cookie cutter" variety ...
content: The software is probably okay for most people -- but it is WAAAAY short of useful if you have *any* type of OsamaCare problem ... this software is especially befuddling if you didn't have Full Year compliance with the marxist regime's insurance coverage demands -- even if the non-compliance was due to bureaucratic inefficiencies at the Federal AND State levels. This software does NOT give you the opportunity to declare anything outside of the Big Six "allowable" reasons (or the 14 or so secondary situations) -- and NO, even the "had health insurance plan issues" doesn't give you a place to input "federal and state foot-dragging" ... so, you're kind of stuck, there. Also, if you really NEED the refund, and are willing to pay the ridiculous non-compliance fees (which is pretty galling, but definitely a temptation when you're un-employed), it appears that you need to file WITHOUT any of the Hardship forms. This, however, is not possible, even if you click AWAY from attempting to have any Hardship applied -- the Hardship forms *still* get created (and, no, the people at the 800# were NO HELP.) Oh, yes -- before I forget: the Tax Specialists that you supposedly are paying for with the DELUXE (and above) iterations seem to NOT exist. I've called to try to get one on the phone, but am *always* kicked into the "we'll call you back" queue. Each time I have done this, I got my "call back" many hours later -- and AFTER the Tax Specialists had already gone home for the day! Nice touch, to have a general employee call me, read aloud from my account the note that I need a Tax Specialist, look at her watch, realize that she just wasted a call (because it was after-hours), and apologize all over herself. This has happened twice. On my third attempt, the "call back" never came. So, no, I can't say that I would recommend this for anybody who doesn't fit the "cookie cutter" Osama-Care mold.

title: Costs more with less functionality
content: The price went up. The State forms were not included and I had to pay extra for them. The software no longer handled investment income, without another download that cost money. I really loved the software until this year. Now, I am not so sure this is the best value. I will check other options for next year.

title: Big mistake by Intuit and they are probably paying the price now...
content: I'd give perhaps the lesser rating but actually I avoided TurboTax this year after using it for several years and otherwise entirely happy with their product...until I read of their changes this year and trying to step back and try to make amends. I wrote them with their form letter response to say, "Too little, too late. I've opted to H&R instead this year". Whoever made the poor decisions at Intuit ought to be fired. A fine product and they got piggy. The alternate I mentioned, well, has some good things about it, but I still preferred the format old TurboTax used to have. The only thing I can state otherwise is that this alternate product brought attention to me of a real estate tax credit for seniors in MO I was never made aware of with TurboTax in the past...and this literally saved my 86 year old mother on a fixed income with a $1100 real estate tax rebate off her state taxes. Not that I love this other product, I just wish TurboTax kept up with what was a winning product, improved upon it to justify additional cost, rather than fall flat on their face with such inept decisions at whatever level that deserves the criticism.

title: Product could not solve my problems and it was useless.
content: Bought this product to complete my taxes which were complex because I moved states and than out of the country. Upon buying the product for $40 USD, I realized that I need to complete taxes for two states and an additional non-residence form. With this software, I could only complete the taxes for one state. To complete it for another state, I need to pay another $25. However, with the $25, I would still not be able to submit the non-residence form. Instead I had to go figure where the form is and than complete it myself. To complete the form myself and e-file, I had to redo my federal and states taxes online via efile and than pay $25 to efile. Hence, I decided to just complete my taxes via efile (which was only slightly more complex than turbo tax anyways) and just pay $25 to efile. In the end, I did not use turbo tax to file my taxes. The $40 did not make my taxes easier and could not help me solve the complex issues of my taxes anyways. In the end I did it myself and the $40 was wasted. A refund in this scenario would be much appreciated.

title: One Star
content: Lost functions

title: Turbotax is a disappointment.
content: This was the worst release to date for turbotax. From excluded forms to 7 days to fix the importing problem with its deductible. I also bought home and business version, same poor results. I will look at tax cut for next year. Been using turbos since 1995, this is a real disappointment.

title: Go back to the old format
content: Would like to have the old format again. feel that I paid for many features I didn't need especially the state return, Washington has none. Been using the program since the intuit days, and I have used the Basic version all that time. Not having that available was disappointing,

title: I was forced to buy a program that I did ...
content: I was forced to buy a program that I did not needed incase I get reviewed if this happens again I will stop buying turbo tax. The cost of the disk and to file electronically and the program they force to buy from them incase we get reviwed might as well pay some one to do it for you it is cheaper.

title: Glad I read the reviews
content: Glad I read the reviews. I have been buying turbo tax for over 12 years, but because of this change I will go with another tax program.

title: One more lost customer
content: I'll add my displeasure of Intuit's changes to it TurboTax Deluxe software. I have used and recommended this product for ages due to it's simplicity and ability to cover all aspects of completing taxes. I was unaware of any "announced" changes until I came to Amazon to buy my 2014 copy. Tax software should do just that, Taxes. The schedules removed are not uncommon or for "special" circumstances. They are standard forms that should be available in something called a "Deluxe" version of software. This is a bad business decision and I plan to find other products that will allow me to fully complete my taxes for less than an arm and a leg.

title: Too Bad Zero Stars Isn't An Option
content: I'll chime in with support for all the negative reviews. First, thanks to everyone who took the time to write a review. As in the past 10 years or so, I was ready to hit the buy button for the Deluxe version when I noticed the 1.5 star rating. The reviews saved me from a big mistake. I need both Schedules C and D, so I'm off to HR Block with the many others who are taking this course.

title: Another loyal customer gone
content: Thanks for the heads up from other reviewers. I've been receiving emails from Intuit for weeks enticing me to order this year's Turbo Tax with no mention of the fact that it would cost me almost double simply to get Form C. Time to look elsewhere.

title: Ive been using turbotax since they bought out the better back then "Personal Tax Edge" and forced us to ...
content: Ive been using turbotax since they bought out the better back then "Personal Tax Edge" and forced us to buy TT. But I too am angry they are gouging people. Is $60 a year not enough Intuit? Im going to buy H & R block this year.

title: 2014 Turbo Tax Deluxe - too many frustrating issues.
content: I have been using Turbo Tax for 9 years and I love it. But 2014 Deluxe was very difficult to use. First, my state wouldn't open. This was after Turbo Tax supposedly fixed the state issue. I kept trying every day, and about 3 weeks later, it finally opened. Same thing with Its Deductible. I wanted to use it for the estimate feature. It wouldn't open, so again I kept trying and about a month later it finally worked. Each time I tried to open State of Its Deductible, Turbo Tax would freeze, so I would have to shut down, and to reopen, Turbo Tax would have to restore my file. Also, I had to forego a small credit, because I would have had to upgrade to the next level of Turbo Tax A(formerly part of Deluxe). Even though Deluxe said I could upgrade for free, the software would not allow me to do it. My tax situation is relatively simple, and it should have allowed me to complete my taxes in an hour or two. I had to start over many times. I had no problem e-fling the Federal return. When I tried to e-file the State return, I got a message stating that my tax situation would not allow me to e-file, and I would have to print the return and file manually. Turbo Tax did not explain the reason. So for the first time in 9 years, I was forced to file the state return manually. This was very frustrating. I never previously had issues like this with Turbo Tax. If I don't feel reassured that 2015 has been fixed, I might look at other programs next year.

title: ***ZERO STARS*** Shame on you Turbo tax!!!!!
content: ***ZERO STARS*** Shame on you Turbo tax. You create a loyal following based on level of functionality then change it???? I have been buying Turbo tax Deluxe for YEARS and now I need Turbo Tax Premier because of your greedy tactic to screw paying, loyal customers??? SHAME ON YOU! Time to find a new Tax Software!

title: Purposeful Deception
content: Like others who purchased the 2014 edition of of TT Deluxe, I was deceived by the product changes. Since I have used the Deluxe edition yearly since 2001, I never imagined they would remove Deluxe features from the Deluxe edition. If they wish to remove features, then change the name or it smacks of purposeful deception. Tell me upfront if you make changes and then let me make the decision on what to purchase to fit my needs. Don't try to trick me! As a business and marketing professional, this type of behavior goes against everything I believe in. When you have lifetime customers, don't do stupid things to run them away.

title: NOTHING BUT PROBLEMS
content: i had nothing but problems this year. Turbo Tax screwed up my return first and I didnt get notified for over a week. I began trying to file on January 28th and finally received my refund on Feb 24th. The second problem was with the ACA. I dont know if I will use your program again.

title: The 3 star rating is generous...... there are much better options!
content: I used Turbotax years ago but for several years prior to 2014 I used another product and was happy with it overall. However, since I also use Quicken I decided last year to try Turbotax again..... big mistake. I now can't open Turbotax 2014 because my PC was upgraded to Windows 10. Every other program I have works without issue but Turbotax won't open at all. With my other tax programs for previous years I can still open them in Windows 10.... going back several years. Yes, I understand that Turbotax 2014 was released before Windows 10 but surely Intuit knew of Windows 10 and regardless they should have released an update to support Windows 10. I could understand if we were talking about several versions back but we aren't. Needless to say I won't be buying this product again..... ever.

title: NEW TURBO TAX DELUXE SUCKS - IT DOES NOT ALLOW ENTRY OF BASIC STOCK TRANSACTIONS !!!!
content: AS OF 10/8/15 TURBO TAX DELUXE STILL DOES NOT HAVE SCHEDULES C,D,E OR F INCLUDED FOR 2015 NEW TURBO TAX DELUXE SUCKS - IT DOES NOT ALLOW ENTRY OF BASIC STOCK TRANSACTIONS !!!! I have been using Turbo Tax for 20 years and have always found it to be a good product. Unfortunately this year they are forcing you to buy the Premier version in order to enter basic stock transactions. I WILL NOT BE BUYING IT AGAIN!!!

title: I did not like Intuit did in changing what was included
content: I have used the product for a significant number of years. I though it was much easier to use this year. I did not like Intuit did in changing what was included. If it happens a second time I will never use the product again.

title: Turbo Tac changed Delux so that you can no longer ...
content: Turbo Tac changed Delux so that you can no longer use it if you have investments that you bought or sold. You have to upgrade to Premier. Once upgrading to Premier, it would no longer allow me to download and install my free State. After 3 hours on the phone with them, they couldn't resolve the problem, so they gave me a link to download State. Once downloaded it too wouldn't install. After another call to them, while I was on hold, I discovered the workaround. You have to install Premier to the sae Delux folder that was created during the first install, then everything worked.

title: Not happy with Turbo Tax this year - it missed normal deductions.
content: As a long time Turbo Tax user, I was not happy with Turbo Tax this year. Somehow Turbo Tax missed my deduction for State and Local Taxes. I may have skipped over this section, but Turbo Tax should have caught this. This is a basic deduction anybody itemizing should get. This resulted in me paying hundreds of dollars more than necessary to the IRS. The 1040X (amended tax return) form was painful and ultimately just wrong using Turbo Tax. On-line instructions how to file the 1040X using Turbo Tax were poor saying in general to do different steps, but not telling how to do that using Turbo Tax. I eventually figured it out, but the 1040X form Turbo Tax printed out was filled out incorrectly, sections of the form directed not to be filled out for my case were filled out. I had to manually fill out the forms from IRS.gov. I specifically buy Turbo Tax so I don't have to do that. I called the Turbo Tax help line in mid February. The recording said there was a 45 minute wait. I waited on hold for well over two hours for a agent. Now I have to wait 16+ weeks to get my 1040X refund from the IRS.

title: Easy to use
content: Easy to use, explains everything, I only use it for my sons because they have no deductions. However, every time I purchase turbo tax it states that one free filing of state taxes is included but I always end up paying for all of them. They should not make this false advertising.

title: If I hadn't used Turbo Tax in the past with good results I would be bad mouthing. Unsure, if I will use next year.
content: State tax would not e-file. After being on the phone with two different persons (different numbers) was told update would be available on 02/13/2015 tried the update daily for 22 days after the date. It still would not work! Finally ended up printing off and mailing.

title: One Star
content: I will not buy again. Ihad to buy an up grade to do my taxes. 32.00

title: Misleading and Extortionary
content: This is the worst product I've ever had the misfortune of buying on Amazon.com. Pros: 1. It's not that hard to use. Cons: 1. TurboTax lies about what capabilities it has. 2. TurboTax will charge you oodles of money to do the things it claimed it could do for free. 3. TurboTax support will not help you even when you point out the misleading information on their website. I bought this software because, according to TurboTax's own website, it can e-file in up to three states. Just do a Google search for "How many state returns can I prepare in the TurboTax CD/Download software?" and you'll find an answer on their AnswerXchange which clearly states that TurboTax can prepare as many state returns as you want. However, in reality, they want $20 bucks per additional state. They have since updated the description on Amazon to say that only one state download is included, but their support had no sympathy for the fact that I was misled by an answer from THEIR staff on THEIR website. I am so thoroughly displeased with their misleading information and their customer no-service support that I will literally use *any* other tax product next year.

title: Disappointed by TurboTax Deluxe this year
content: Disappointed by TurboTax Deluxe this year. They changed the levels so that many of the benefits from Deluxe had to be bought in the higher versions. I switched to HRB. TurboTax (Intuit) just lost a customer...and i'd been using them since I graduated from college! Ouch!

title: but this year was the first year that I was disappointed in its content
