content: I have used TurboTax Deluxe for years, but this year was the first year that I was disappointed in its content. To complete my tax process I had to purchase another TurboTax product. Good bye TurboTax. This year, you TurboTax, are my deduction. I will not use you again.

title: So long, Intuit.
content: I came here with the intention of purchasing this version of TurboTax, as I had in previous years, but after reading about the crippling of features which I require, I have decided to switch to TaxAct. Bye Intuit.

title: One Star
content: This year the Schedule D has been removed. Time to look elsewhere.

title: Cost More, Get Less.......... Shame on you!
content: Too expensive this year. This version did not have what was provided in past years. I have been your customer for years now. If we are paying for Federal and State programs, why did I have to pay to file state online? Not getting my money's worth....... Cost more, get less...shame on you! Another year? Shame on me! I will be using Tax Cut (H&R) next year.

title: TurboSux
content: This years edition kind of sucked. It recognized my 1099R for my military retirement as investment income which it is not. In the past TurboTax was flawless. This year, not so much.

title: Very diappointed
content: Overall, it was a very frustrating experience using TurboTax this year. It no longer contained all the forms I needed. Did they give me a free upgrade to premier when I called? Yes Did they push out the state download when it didn't automatically work? Yes. At that point I was still willing to continue using Turbo Tax. The final straw was when I found out that the extra $20 I spent to get the state version DOES NOT include e-file of your state taxes. That will cost you an extra $19.95 PER RETURN. I feel that this is very misleading and should be made clear in the description of the product. I can file at the state website for FREE. If I'd known that the extra cost to include state didn't include e-file, I wouldn't have purchased it. I've been a loyal Turbo Tax user for the last 20 years, but will go with a different product next year.

title: No State Tax included!! Disappointed in 2014 Software!!!
content: Expect to pay an additional $39.99 to file your state taxes if you purchase this product. I've used TurboTax for 10 years but next year unless the product is restored to it's former features I will find another online tax service to do my taxes. Very disappointing.

title: I'm done.
content: After being a long time customer of Intuit (almost 20 years), I'm tossing in the towel. I'm tired of their screwy schemes to jack up their prices. I'm done. I'm going with TaxACT. If that doesn't work, I'll do them by hand before I'll go back to Intuit.

title: Last mistake of the year - purchasing Turbo Tax
content: I always ask for Turbo Tax for Christmas and this past year was no exception. I normally ask for Basic which is $29.99 and after a month of looking my daughter purchased the pictured one for $59.99. After Christmas I noticed that they had changed the Basic to not include the Homeowners forms and such and this is why she got the more expensive one. Its seems Turbo Tax decided to change thing and charge twice the price!! I received email form Turbo Tax stating that they had allot of complaints and were making it right by refunding the difference if you were forced to upgrade to the more expensive one which I did. After countless trying to go on line and request my refund, and calling and being on hold for an hour I decided to forget about the refund and went ahead and did my tax's. After completing my tax's I was really upset in finding out that I now had to pay $34.95 to file! You never had to pay before - it was included. I also did my State refund and the program included state only to find out that was $19.99! I could of filed on the state web site for FREE. I went ahead and filled and paid but I wont be using Turbo Tax again in the future. From the $65.00 for the program, $34.95 and the $19.99 I could of had HR Block do for less. Such a shame I have used Turbo Tax for many years.

title: Nickel and Dimed
content: TurboTax has not upgraded anything noticeable in their software but has bait and switched customers taking out schedule D functionality for the deluxe version to force you to upgrade to Premier version. They did it last year to online customers with the same bait and switch and are now doing the same to desktop. TurboTax is at best unreliable and at worst, deceptive and trying to nickel and dime their customers. H&R Block or TaxAct will have my business this year.

title: I was disappointed with this purchase
content: I was disappointed with this purchase. We were supposed to get 1 free state file with the purchase and I was not about to get it to work. Every time I tried, it wanted to charge $19.99 to file state. I ended up just using the state website to file so I didn't have to pay.

title: Rip Off
content: I have used Turbotax for many years. But, I'm moving on to alternative tax preparation software because of the elimination of Schedule D in the Deluxe version. What a rip off of its once loyal customers.

title: Turbo Deluxe Basic
content: While I need not repeat the already mentioned, I do want B the VP to know that he needs to bring in to the fold a customer relations rep to write his responds to the uproar... Bob, looking at what you wrote and your rep's response to Fortune it leaves the 20% your targeting wondering why us??? I'm quite satisfied with your quick response to the situation by giving the Bus. version as a freebee but looking forward, I'm hoping, to see some other method to boost profits next year. And...yes this bonehead marketing scheme will be in the annuals of someone's book on marketing concepts 101.

title: If I had researched it better I would have bought a different product
content: I have been a TurboTax customer for over a decade and have had no issues. This year Turbo Tax changed the functionality of the product without a lot of notice. i.e. things that the deluxe version did last year (like schedules C and D) do not work this year. This required me to purchas an expensive upgrade to Premier. If I had researched it better I would have bought a different product, (such as H&R Block.

title: INTUIT DOES NOT STAND BEHIND ITS PRODUCT - NO GUARANTEES
content: I have used Turbo Tax for years, back when it came on floppy disks. I enjoyed the ease of use and never had an issue. HOWEVER...last year (2013 tax year) I used it for taxes, just like normal. I took money out of my retirement fund when moving from a job, and entered it in when TT asked me. Everything looked good, submitted the return and got a check a few weeks later. In December 2014 I got a letter from Maine Revenue Services. Scared, I opened the letter to see that I had been audited, and my return had a mathematical error! I thought "no way, I used TT and it always has all types of advertisement that math errors are double checked..ect.." I pulled the 1040 from my cabinet and sure enough, the program MADE A MATH ERROR, to the tune of $900ish. I thought I must be doing something wrong so I took my return to HR Block and they went through it. Yes, TT had made a math error. The program skipped over line 19 (or whatever line it was) and did not add it to the total for taxable income. ARGH. Maine gave me 30 days to pay out the error, with interest and penalties. I had to cough up $572 on the spot...due to a math error from Turbo Tax. HERE IS THE WORST PART - and the reason I felt compelled to write the review. I contacted Intuit and asked for help before I paid the IRS. They did not respond. I waited until the deadline for payment and ended up paying the IRS to prevent further issues. I re-contacted Intuit and sent me an email a month later saying "Dear Mr. xxxxx, We do apologize for the delay in processing your claim. We are moving as quickly as possible to process all claims but are a little behind. We cannot provide a specific date by which your determination will be made but we will complete our analysis and provide your resolution just as soon as we can." Wow, thanks. This was January 31. Sent a third email...STILL NO RESPONSE. NEVER again will I use this program. I went to TaxAct online and did it for free. NO ISSUES. NO $$$. So much for the "accuracy guarantee"

title: Turbo Tax Deluxe 2014 price gouging
content: We have been using Turbo Tax ("TT") since 1998. We do have a small business requiring Sch C and investment in stocks. In the past the TT Deluxe version had always been adequate to handle our return. In 2014, we had very few stock transactions and the small business was winding down. However, when we did our return (using TT Deluxe), it forced us to upgrade to Premier when we tried to input the sale of 3 stocks; as we were half-way done with the return plus our long history with TT, we obliged and paid an additional $30 to upgrade. We then proceeded to enter information for our small business, TT lets you enter some of the information, but half way in the process, it prompts you to upgrade to "Home & Business" for another $10! If anything, our 2014 return is much simpler than prior yearsâ. In prior years we had pages upon pages of stock sales; we had home-office deduction, depreciation, ... for the small business; and we were able to do the return on the Deluxe version! But this year we are forced to upgrade upon another upgrade to complete the return. Businesses succeed in improving their products to reward existing customers and to attract new customers. Whoever at TT thought of this tactic to increase revenue should be fired! We would not use TT again!! Turbo Tax you have lost a 17 year loyal customer!

title: You suck this year
content: What the hell! The state e-filing is $19.99 and additional $34.00 to process, I'll mail mine in. You suck this year Turbotax

title: DO NOT USE IF YOU NEED A CLEAN PRINTED COPY BEFORE MID FEB.
content: The software works well, and seems to find all the major deductions with no issues, but I have one main reason for giving two stars. There is no way to print a clean copy of the return until after the final version of the tax forms are released in Ohio, that means Mid to end of Feb. If you are using the program to do your taxes and to get a nice clean print out for any legal reason such as Bankruptcy or divorce proceedings - You are in trouble, as it will print with several watermarks all over it, proclaiming it is not a valid form. EVEN IF THE SUB-FORM IT IS WAITING ON, IS NOT ONE YOU ARE USING. AArrgghhh! Yelling at Customer Service does no good. THIS IS A MAJOR DESIGN FLAW. I took it to the VP in charge of the program at Intuit with no satisfaction. There needs to be a way to over-ride when you need that clean copy for some reason. I know someone who got in trouble with a court due to this program. They missed a deadline because the court would not accept the watermarked version.

title: I had to print, complete and MAIL my tax forms. In error loop so cannot revise for new information. Never Using Again.
content: After using Turbo Tax forever this is my last year. TT used to have a worksheet function where I listed all my deductions in each category, the total was calculated and the worksheet saved. This appears to no longer be available - at least I couldn't find it. So for the first time in at least 15 years I had to use Excel to create my detail sheets and then copy the number into TT. But the REAL problem came when I got to the part where I needed to claim my tax credit for a solar array. TT does not have the state forms for those, which I can understand. You can't have every form for every state. So I followed the instructions, found the form on the state website, printed it, printed the entire NC State tax return, mailed it, everything OK. I even got my refund. But Turbo Tax still has my return flagged as having an error. Now I have received a corrected 1099-DIV and need to refile an amended return but I am locked out the return I filed. And don't even think about trying to talk to an actual person at Intuit.

title: free upgrade doesn't exist.
content: free upgrade within turbotax doesn't exist. i have tried to upgrade within deluxe and they want a credit card # for the upgrade. Don't believe the turbo tax response to the the complaints of other customers.

title: Not in Wisconsin
content: As a loyal user of turbo tax I was generally pleased with this year's product...until it was time to file my state (wi) return. I was forced to submit via snail mail because of the private school tax deduction. Seriously? 7 weeks and still no refund.

title: Another TT duplicate filing victim
content: I've been a loyal TT fan for years and just found out that I too am a victim of someone else filing my taxes. This is far too common with previous TT users and the security of our login information should have been top priority. TT has dropped the ball in a major way this year, which is sad because I've always been such a big fan. update - It's been since early March that I filed the IRS fraud forms and still, have yet to hear back. Who knows when this will finally get resolved.

title: I experienced several times TT would "freeze up" when tried ...
content: I experienced several times TT would "freeze up" when tried to work on state return and when I tried to pay by credit card....scary- I had shut down computer and reboot- serious problem with software....

title: TurboTax Not Very Good This Year
content: TurboTax worked well for me in past years but, this year when I started using it they kept asking for another $30 every five minutes to upgrade. Not a satisfactory situation at all. I will consider using other tax software next year.

title: Intuit clearly doesn't care about customer feedback
content: Intuit's VP clearly doesn't get it. When you have this many negative comments and irate customers just a few weeks into the tax season you have really screwed up. This will be the source of great business school case studies on how customer loyalty earned over many years can be lost overnight by poor corporate response when they clearly make a mistake.

title: After being a very satisfied customer of over 20 years
content: Received my e-mail from TurboTax explaining their position on what I call "GREED-Gate 2014".... My reply to them is as follows: Thanks for the explanation however weak it was. This change (in my opinion) is nothing more that a money grab by TurboTax by moving a population to more expensive software packages. After being a very satisfied customer of over 20 years, I will be looking elsewhere for the 2015 tax years to see what other software is available. A 25 dollar rebate this year only means that you will calm the masses this year and move them to more costly software in future years, Thus you achieve your goal of making more money anyway. Sad state of affairs when money grabbing meets customer satisfaction and consistent software packages head on and money wins. Shame on TurboTax. Three Stars only because it is good software... 0 Stars for corporate decisions of 2014 software changes....

title: Been using turbotax for years, read about what basic ...
content: Been using turbotax for years, read about what basic forms are no longer included and purchased H&R Block. They just lost a very longtime previously loyal user.

title: At least they give you all costs up front instead of trying to trick you in to joining at $40 and then charging you another $40
content: I've used Turbo Tax for my tax preparation for years, but this year I will be switching to HR Block. At least they give you all costs up front instead of trying to trick you in to joining at $40 and then charging you another $40 like TurboTax.

title: Turbo Tax Delux no longer support Schedue C/D filing without an upgrade
content: If it is true that Turbotax Deluxe no longer supports Schedule D and Schedule C filing without an upgrade, maybe it is time to switch? Intuit web site currently says this is indeed true. It mentioned something about being a special remember of some kind (not sure if I am) they are giving one time free upgrade? I have been using TurboTax for about 15 years now.

title: This year it suks big time. Could not print ...
content: This year it suks big time. Could not print my state returns so I had to E file, which cost an additional $20.00. No customer support unless you want to stay on hold for hours. after 1 hour on hold I gave up. Will not use this again

title: I tried to do it again but it was past the 4/20 deadline they snuck into the fine print. I explained to their customer service r
content: If you value customer service, stay away from TT. You've probably seen all the other reviews about how they got greedy and forced long-time Deluxe users to buy the more expensive Premiere version. They back-tracked and offered to refund $25 but they even found a way to weasel out of that. I had to paper-file my federal return because the e-file didn't work. I tried to do their online submission to get the $25 refund and it didn't work. I tried to do it again but it was past the 4/20 deadline they snuck into the fine print. I explained to their customer service representative that I had done everything I was required to do in order to get the refund and that they should honor their offer. I was told that it was past the deadline and they would not give me the refund. I was told by this representative that he had the authority to give me the refund but that he wasn't going to. When I asked to talk to a supervisor he said he would have one call me. I never heard back from them. I have used TT and other Intuit products for years and this lack of customer service has driven me away from them.

title: software is simple but state issues have been troublesome.
content: So it works well and I get good returns but bent from MN this is the second year I have had issues with my state return really could do without these issues

title: Find A NEW TAX PROGRAM - TurboTax Deluxe 2o14 IS CRIPPLED ! ! !
content: They changed the product ! - It is CRIPPLED THIS YEAR - after using the product for what 16 years and they DID NOT INCLUE Schedule C ! Going to try and turn it back for a refund. A fellow worker said that H & R Block is offering a free copy of their product which does include Schedule C ! Going to check that out - if true - guess what - I''ll be a loyal H & R support. DON'T BUY TT Deluxe for 2o14 ! ! ! ! ! It is seriously CRIPPLED for 2o214 ! ! ! ! ! ! It will short change you ! BD

title: Tweet your unhappiness..
content: ..if you are unhappy with this change Tweet about it as well. Sometimes social media can change corporate decisions in a way that Amazon reviews may not.

title: Good-bye TurboTax
content: Bob Meighan,I don't think you get it, though I appreciate your efforts to try and rectify the situation. I have gotten all of your emails, as a customer for years, but at some point it seem disingenuous. You "assumed" that most of your customers would not need thee functions and you could therefore jack up the price on a less functional product. As the reviews on this, and many other sites indicate you were wrong; and Intuit should look into a different business mode for their LRP. Now you want me to make an extra effort to purchase and receive discounts on the product you thought was what your customer base wanted and just forget about this snafu;well that's not how most consumers work. To think that seems to just indicate that this could happen again, and if I can find a better solution that won't screw me over (pardon the language) I may as well try them out now.

title: I just do not like the way they throw so many hidden charges without ...
content: Stay Away from TurboTax...So many hidden fee on top of the price you pay for the software...e-file fee for state tax, processing fee and bank processing fee... I just do not like the way they throw so many hidden charges without telling you up front. It is a shame and it will go out of the business very soon!

title: Watch out! No support for sch c k-1 and who knows what else!
content: No support for schedule C and.K-1!!!! As done in previous years. They did not tell us that! Not even in the small print! So you end up buying a product that is useless! The person who wrote a scathing review is absolutely correct.

title: Bye Bye Inuit - another 10+ year customer gone...
content: I am quite disappointed, bought deluxe from Costco - going along doing my taxes with Turbo Tax like i have done for the past 10+ years. Getting ready to input my income from stocks and bonds - BAM. Upgrade for 30$. What a disrespectful way to gouge a customer. I am so upset that i am going to switch permanently to a competitor. Bye Bye Intuit. Such poor business practices must not be rewarded.

title: TurboTax "free upgrade" is only for DESKTOP users, NOT online users.
content: I have been a loyal TurboTax customer for over 15 years. The last 12, maybe, I've been using TurboTax online (not the desktop version). As far as I can tell, the "offer" to upgrade for free from the Deluxe version, AND the rebate for the requirement to upgrade, is ONLY valid on the "Desktop" version. I just logged into my account, and the upgrade from Deluxe, to get the schedules I had under Deluxe last year, will cost me $24.99 extra. (Yes, it's post Feb 7th). I did call the customer service number, but after holding 20 minutes, called the alternate number where I was told they'd call me back - no hold option. They also said they'd make ONE attempt - and didn't advise the timeframe, so I'm apparently glued to the phone to double check this. I'll give them 12 hours, in the hope that maybe they'll upgrade the online version as well. If not . . . . off to H&R Block for me.

title: I WAS a 20+ year Intuit customer. Not anymore for being mis-led.
content: Be careful which Turbotax product you choose. Intuit has revamped of their products for FY 2014 without revamping the product names. The DELUXE version is more like what their BASIC version is. It no longer does capital gains/losses. In short, where Deluxe was the perfect for most people in prior years, it is unsuitable now. Of course, after you spent all that time capturing your financial info, you can shell out more $$$ to submit your taxes. Drop Intuit and Turbotax from for misleading the consumer.

title: Delux versuin charges $20 to file the state return
content: I think it is unbelievable that they display this product as Federal and State forms included and then want to charge you $20 to file the state form. Isn't that why I paid extra for the version with state included?

title: I could not download this product kept getting lost connection ...
content: I could not download this product kept getting lost connection. Finally had to go directly to intuit site and rebuy. Need refund of this product.

title: What were they thinking?
content: Classic bait and switch. This would have been my 20th season of using Turbo Tax. Why in the world would anyone buy the "Deluxe" version? I am so disappointed. I'm just glad I caught the changes before buying. I will take my business elsewhere.

title: I would recommend to look elsewhere
content: Have used this software for 7 yrs. Changing this year due to Intuit's repackaging and the company's lack of customer loyalty. There are too many other alternatives in the tax software business to put up with this disregard for consistencies and misguided changes to improve profits. I would recommend to look elsewhere.

title: Not Impressed
content: I have not started entering data for 2014 yet, but I have imported the 2013 data. I went to download the updates and the program hung up. I tried to cancel the update and restart--- files were corrupted. I have to uninstall, install, and download updates again. I'm not impressed to say the least. I have been a TurboTax user for about 15 years (MacInTax first). My loyalty is ... well strained.

title: Head aches
content: Turbo Tax 2014 had the most problems of any of the of all the last 6-8 Turbo tax I have used and the most confusing. I ended up not knowing if I was getting any thing back or owing. Thanks for making 2014 my last Turbo Tax.

title: this year I was not happy with turbotax deluxe
content: this year I was not happy with turbotax deluxe. it took a long time to get updates, and could not print my state return to mail for over a week.

title: Not anymore, no thanks. Time to look for a more reliable tool.
content: Filing for "free" ended up costing me about $110 for filing for state and federal. Additionally, the returns that were "accepted" ended up being inaccurate. Both federal and state returns were less than was TurboTax promised. The tax returns did come with letters explaining why there was a monetary discrepancies, so thankfully the state and federal actually took the time to make sure everything was corrected, unlike TurboTax. I will NOT be using TurboTax next year. Thanks for screwing me over Intuit!

title: Find Another Program!
content: Very, very disappointed! Everything was moving along OK until I tried to do my Massachusetts state tax. Turbo insisted on me providing a Federal ID number for my Medicare health plan. I couldn't believe they didn't know that a number is not required. After checking with Medicare, Social Security and Massachusetts DOR and getting the same answer each time, I moved on (after several tries) but when it came to e-filing, I was again held back because I hadn't provided a number that is not required! Only after several attempts to make contact with Turbo Tax and finally sending a message, was I able to e-file my state tax return. Not only that but this was my first year filing my Massachusetts state return with Turbo Tax. They don't bother mentioning that you not only have to pay $39.99 + tax to fill out the form (which, when they transfer all the info. from your Federal return amounts to very little) but then they charge you $24.99 to e-file!! What should have taken perhaps a half-hour ended becoming a 3 hour project! Live and learn as they say. Never again!

title: Another nail in the greed coffin
content: Intuit has made a corporate policy of gouging their customers in any way they can. The only thing they have going for them is inertia, but at some point that will not be enough. I look forward to the day this company goes out of business.

title: Sad Face
content: Next year not sure I will buy from Amazon--found I had to "order" more components that I thought were already included! Disappointed!

title: First time...Last time...
content: The Federal portion was just fine but the Michigan state part had glitches in it that couldn't be addressed. [a] It was supposed to copy my insurance premiums from the federal to the state, but only transferred the premiums for my secondary insurance. [b] It insisted that I had to complete the section of the MI form that dealt with taxpayers who reside elsewhere part of the time - I'm a permanent resident. The Use Tax (Online/Catalog Purchases not showing the MI sales tax) computation had an error that would have not paid the entire amount that I owed but the state form didn't permit doing an edit of individual sections as does the TurboTax Federal. To get my MI taxes done properly I had to download the individual forms from the state Dept. of Treasury and fill them out manually - altogether it took more time than doing the Federal long form. I'll buy TurboTax next year, but not the Deluxe edition.

title: Extremely disappointed.
content: Double charge!!! I bought TurboTax at BJ club for $49 when I filed my tax returns, I was charged another $39. I don' appreciate the double charge. I feel I was "rpped off". Extremely disappointed.

title: Turbo Tax makes it easier
content: Tax time is never fun for anyone, but Turbo Tax makes it easier. This year it was nice to be able to get an upgrade to the business version and we were able to get online help for the few places where we had questions not answered in Turbo Tax itself. I'm sure one day we'll have to take the taxes to a CPA, but until then Turbo Tax works for helping us wade through the tax code on our own.

title: Raised price and dropped schedule D - after 20 years ...
content: Raised price and dropped schedule D - after 20 years as a customer I will be going else where this year.

title: State return issues
content: I have used turbo the past 8 yrs no problems this year my state was refused twice and now i have to submit my mail. Not happy at all. Dont know what the problem was but could not get it to go through.

title: I guess they think we are stupid, but in my opinion
content: I was reviewing this product when I found out they are trying to price gouge me by eliminating the needed functions in the Deluxe edition. I was going to buy a copy as I have used Turbo Tax for many years. Also, I have been a Quicken customer for years and was going to upgrade from my current old version. However, due to their changes and attempted price gouging by trying to force us to buy a more expensive version, I will not be buying TurboTax for 2014 taxes and will not be updating my Quicken. I guess they think we are stupid, but in my opinion, they are the stupid ones. They will probably lose a lot of business.

title: Bye Turbo Tax
content: Based on what I've read this is the year I switch to another product. I have used TurboTax since the mid 90s, but no more.

title: Better Named: The "NOT SO DELUXE"
content: Really!? - You're still calling this a "DELUXE" Version??? Well, I'm certainly not happy to see that the ability to efile with a K-1 (for Estates and Trust) has ALSO been removed from this year's Deluxe software. So after many years of using and supporting TT, I too am now debating if I will end up just forking over the additional $30 they are now demanding so I can efile a K-1, or has the time finally come to move on to some better featured, lower priced software.

title: Use in conjunction with a fully licensed CPA.
content: I decided to switch to TurboTax because my CPA can import my files work with the data I enter to review my taxes and suggest changes. Initially I didn't mind making the switch from my previous product because at this point the prices were about the same. However, after I read several reviews and was reminded of the fact that I had to make the annoying choice to upgrade to a more expensive version of Turbotax to fill out schedules D (dividends and capital gains) and schedule C (business expenses). Many reviewers are very harsh about this years version and the required upgrades because they claim Intuit's primary motivation is to raise the price of the fully featured product they actually need. I'm not super happy about it either, I think it cost me an extra $30 or $40 on top of the price of the Deluxe version. I can certainly feel some displeasure for this unanticipated expense. However, I don't think the price changes constitute usury. Ultimately the question is, does TurboTax offer enough to me for the extra price? Given the ease of use for myself to communicate my taxes with my CPA I feel I can justify it. I'm not saying I like it, nor is that the correct choice for everyone; I'm only saying that I'm willing to tolerate it. but just barely. While deprecating schedule C & D from the Deluxe product, may be a bit shady. I would strongly recommend using a CPA for anyone filing a schedule C anyway, which could eliminate the need for this software in the first place. In my case, my CPA reviews my TurboTax files as a basis to suggests various changes and to save money. Using this product saved me from using a more expensive CPA who would have entered all the data himself.

title: I've used this product for 10 years, and am ...
content: I've used this product for 10 years, and am encouraging others to switch from TurboTax now due to them selling a product under the same name as the past, but with less features.

title: This is a total waste of time for me as I know up front ...
content: THE POSTED NAME IS NOT CAROL & SHOULD BE JERRY. I use the deluxe version to file my sisters 1040 return with significant deductions. I file joint return using the deluxe version and have minimal deductions requiring standard deductions form 1949A.. Turbo tax should have an option at the start to file the 1040A w/ standard deductions and not have to go thru all the details of a long form w/ deductions only to be informed we have insufficient deduction and therefore standard deductions are used. This is a total waste of time for me as I know up front that we had to use standard deductions. Also, the print command should be automatic in selecting the software on my computer. I chose the wrong input and cannot change the print software selection. As a result I get computer language [hieroglyphics] and cannot print the return forms. This is the only time ever that I have had a problem in printing form installed software. Why doesn't Turbo Tax talk directly to my printer as is done with all my other software usages on my PC? I DID NOT HAVE THIS PROBLEM WITH 2013 TURBO TAX PRINTING!!

title: State tax filing too costly to use
content: federal was good as always but was unpleasantly surprised to find the extra cost of $40 to do my state forms. I will read the box more carefully next year and if Turbo is too costly I will go some other direction.

title: You invest time before you find out how much money you must pay
content: If Turbotax simply asked what tax forms you have in the beginning, and let you know what service you're required to purchase based on those forms, I'd be giving them five stars. Unfortunately, I spent about 45 minutes putting in personal information and W2 information, only to discover that I was required to purchase something. Having a 1099-OID form requires me to purchase a $35 Deluxe Service. I didn't think that was too bad, and I'd already invested the time, so I agreed and continued. Once I got to filling out form 1099-B, they informed me that I would have to purchase the $55 Premier Service. By this time I was frustrated, gave up and decided to take it to H&R block, which ended up being cheaper. Again, the service would be much more honest if they would just let you know how much you're required to pay from the get-go. I'm sure it's nice if you have very simple tax information, such as W-2's only, but anything more requires you to spend money; and you're only notified about this after you've completed 75% of the other forms.

title: Too Expensive :(
content: I used to be a loyal TurboTax customer, but it became too expensive. Today there are so many other software choices out there for 1/2 the price (or less). Why would anyone buy this software anymore??? I tried taxact a couple of years ago and never looked back. There are plenty of other programs out there as well. Just read the reviews.

title: What a piece of crap their new software is
content: They have changed the way it works completely, I did my taxes and played the extra money to Email my state, They charged my discover card and said The Fed and the state was done. When I went back to print a copy its gone? Called and they cannot find it, They verified the discover charge but for no reason. Did my return really disappear? and I have to start all over again. What a piece of crap their new software is.

title: ... it to carry over my information from last year like it has in the past ( used Turbo Tax ...
content: Downloaded Turb Tax and expected it to carry over my information from last year like it has in the past ( used Turbo Tax for the last 10 years). I was very irritated when I read that if a disk was previously used it would not automatically pull up previous information. Would have been nice to have this disclosed before I purchased it online. Turn tax is very user friendly so I was able to complete my taxes with no problems. However what am I not getting? I always have the impression that I will be able to file my taxes for free and have any refund go direct deposit...I thought I read that state was free, I did read it someplace. í ½í¸í¸

title: disable features and content but keep prices the same (or better yet force users to pay more)
content: TurboTax imitates Time Warner Cable...disable features and content but keep prices the same (or better yet force users to pay more). Switched to TaxAct last year, much cheaper, full capabilities for all levels of returns... maybe not as high end on the interface, but the customer support was fanatastic. They respond to emails, inquiries and both tax and software questions promptly, something sadly lacking in TT.

title: THE EPITOME OF GREED
content: I have used TurboTax software for years but after this years fiasco where they removed features from the Deluxe package I always bought and then charged an additional $30 or more dollars for a Premium version without any notice, I jumped ship to H&R Block software. The interface is slightly different from TT but in less than a couple of minutes I understood it and was able to being my return. The software is straightforward and does everything TT does without exception. It has the same error and issue checking capabilities and does make recommendations throughout the process. I was able to easily import my 2013 information from my TT file without any manual editing required. That was a big plus. It easily auto-imported our W-2 data and saved a lot of manual entry. I had all my other data ready to go and it was super easy to add all my other financial data. The whole process was very seamless and I'm not going back to TT. Besides the ease-of-use, I saved 50% on what I had been paying for the same features and capabilities of TT. Thanks H&R Block. I like the fact that I have phone or chat support if I need it. Everything went so smooth. Filing your taxes is not fun, but I can unequivocally say that using H&R Block software made this process the most hassle free tax preparation experience I've ever had. Furthermore, I did not feel like I was getting ripped off buying this software.

title: Goodbye TurboTax!
content: I've been using TurboTax since its DOS days. Based on these year's changes to the product and the reviews it has received on Amazon, I'll be exploring other alternatives. Update - January 14, 2015: After making a request a few days earlier, I received a code from H & R Block for a free download of their software. It downloaded and installed without a hitch and imported my TurboTax data without any problems. I'll be writing a review of that software once I have had an opportunity to check it out. I was not eager to use another product after using TurboTax for more years than I can remember, but I just don't feel that Intuit values its long-term customers. I've had a similar experience with Quicken which I have used for many years and it has bugs that I have never been able resolve. Despite that, they demand a new purchase upgrade every three years. Very frustrating!

title: Nickel and dimed me practically every step of the way ...
content: Nickel and dimed me practically every step of the way. Pay $50 for three software. Have multiple 1099's?$40 more. With "convenience charges," for state and federal each, the cost is just obnoxious.

title: TurboTax: STEP IT UP!!!
content: Software SUCKED compared to the website version. I purchased it for the Mac. I had everything filled in on their website for this years return, but wasn't going to pay their ridiculous price, so I downloaded the software and saved money. The software won't import what you enter online either, just the itsDeductable and last years return, not anything you enter for the current year, so I had to redo everything. Of course somehow they found a way to screw me in the end when it clearly says, "+ State" in the title, yet wanted $20 to eFile it!!!!! Worst experience with TurboTax so far; last year was so much easier sticking to their website. I'll probably just use the software again next year because it's cheaper to buy through Amazon though...

title: Not the same as previous
content: I am not very pleased with this version as before I was able to at least download the state version and work with my daughters forms or my parents and print them out. This version only allows me to work with one, which is terrible!!!

title: No more turbotax!
content: Used turbotax for years.whatever happened to them,I don't know.In state taxes,never asked me if I had a pay voucher for 2014.I had to manually put in the $500 pay voucher.After I put it in,they offered no review.Wanted me to pay nearly double in next step without a review.I went to H&R Block deluxe.This year they started importing financial info from your large banks such as Vanguard,T.D.Waterhouse,Fidelity.etc.I had no problem with H&R.there prices float though,I payed $25 for fed e-file and state download yesterday,today it is $30.Two weeks ago it was $35.

title: Have become difficult to use.
content: I've been using Turbo Tax for close to 30 years. The past 3 years I have lived in one state but worked in another. I have prepared both state returns on Turbo Tax but each year, it shows that the refund I get from the non-resident state is taxable income. The first time this came up, I spoke with an accountant about this and was told this was not considered income as it is paid to the resident state. Turbo Tax should pick this up each year but does not. There are other areas that are no clear also. I also don't like the fact that I cannot change the adddress of the charitable contribution. It still shows the address to Good Will in the state where I lived 5 years ago and I'm not able to change just the address. Even though I've used this program for many years, I think I will go another route for 2015 taxes.

title: Why offend loyal users?
content: I have used Turbo Tax for many years and find it a very satisfactory program in general. The reason I only gave it 4 stars is that it seems the company has deliberately made it difficult to file state taxes by mail. Last year I couldn't figure out how to get around paying their $19.99 fee for state tax, so I paid to file online. This year I went to a discussion group on Turbo Tax and found out how to print and file by mail. My other complaint is the well discussed change to the lower priced versions that eliminated some options and forced users into a higher priced version. Turbo Tax realized its PR blunder and made amends. However, wanna bet that next year's revised version won't come at a higher basic price? I thought not. A pox upon thee, Turbo Tax! Why offend loyal users?

title: Way to go, rip off your loyal customer base
content: Wow, What a way to drive away loyal customers. Remove everything they are used to having unless the buy something for triple the price. Not possible to e-file a return with a schedule D in the Deluxe

title: Dear Bob Meighan, VP, TurboTax, On the ...
content: Dear Bob Meighan, VP, TurboTax, On the free upgrade to Premier that I had to have to do my taxes exactly as done last year, e.g. same forms, etc. Seamless it wasn't. It didn't work, the support link provided didn't work. I spent several minutes feeding info to the VRS, then listened to awful music for seven minutes, got a person, after 30 minutes and sharing my computer with the rep we got it working. To add insult to injury I had to restart my computer to get the sharing session to go away. I've also been using your product for decades. You guys really dropped the ball this year..

title: Intuit did a lousy job with TurboTax this year.
content: I had so many problems with it, that I will not buy it again next year. So much problems that it wouldn't let me and my son use it. We both had the same name, however, I was Sr. and my son was Jr. yet, it would not let me use it. That is a total no no for me. Further, the information we had last year it would not download it either. I had to write everything all over again. This years Turbo Tax was a total mistake in me buying it. I should have asked for my money back period. All I know is that Intuit lost a repeat customer for next year. If they had problem with the software, they should have corrected the problems before putting TurboTax out in the market for people to buy. A former customer. Inntuit needs to get their act together.

title: Fancy language to support their changes
content: Buy the most expensive software available from TurboTax because otherwise, it will not have the forms your need. After reading reviews, I must admit the have some pretty fancy language to support their changes. The company seriously stated that they do not have a large enough consumer base to worry about CD buyers or downloading clients. According to them, most of the costumers are ONLINE user. Good for you and good luck with your CHANGE, as I will NO LONGER contribute as a costumer you don't find important.

title: Deceptive Business Practices
content: Software works fine, but intuit has really screwed their customer base with this by changing the features between different versions this year. I have always been a deluxe user, and was able to continue using deluxe this year, but only after a few hours of trying to figure out exactly which version I could get away with. Many have not been so lucky, and have been forced to upgrade to premium even though their financial situation hasn't changed. If not for the fact that you get a 10% bonus when electing to receive your refund in the form of an Amazon gift card, I would have gone with a competitor.

title: I was very disappointed that the state e-file now costs (basically $20/each)
content: I was very disappointed that the state e-file now costs (basically $20/each). I will look for something else next year.

title: Switching to H&R Block
content: Switching to H&R Block next year. Forced me to pay $35 extra dollars to complete my return. Long term TurboTax customer.

title: Another customer lost by TurboTax
content: Glad I looked at the reviews. TurboTax has lost another loyal customer this year. Will be trying H&R software this year.

title: 20 year Turbotax customer walks away...
content: I have used Turbotax since 1994 (and still have the .tax files to prove it) and this will be the last time EVER. I've been singing the praises of Turbotax every year (for 20yrs) to anyone who asks and will listen to me extoll its virtues, but this year was so horrendous I will look elsewhere next year, no exceptions! First, the software denied my FREE upgrade to Home and Business after that whole debacle about taking business expenses out of the Deluxe version (nice try you jokers). This was on April 14th mind you...I don't pay Uncle Sam until the last minute as the gov't aren't getting more of an interest free loan of my hard earned money unitl the 15th. An hour later and that was finally resolved by phone support (phone, really!! this isn't the 90's anymore, how about a sotware app that actually works and has online or chat support, even crappy Comcast support can use chat). If that wasn't bad enough, then on the 15th (tonight!!) at 6pm EST the program refused to load the payment page for the state return and forced me to yet gain call support. (In their defense I did actually get a call back w/in an hour and considering its April 15th that's rather amazing, kudos to their phone reps for having to support this junk). After nearly having a coronary at the thought of having to paper file my state return my blood pressure has returned to normal, but I WILL NEVER EVER USE TURBOTAX again, final chapter. Oh, and I WILL tell everyone I know about this experience...good luck fixing your reputation.

title: Add me to the customers upset over Schedule D
content: I have been a satisfied TurboTax Deluxe user since 1998, and just learned here that Deluxe will not handle Schedule D for 2014. I had not expected this at all and am relieved to learn about it before reordering Deluxe. Please add me to the many tax filers who will reconsider tax software this year. I am very disappointed in Intuit. Usually companies try to improve their products.

title: I don't like the hidden costs like the State Return fee
content: I don't like the hidden costs like the State Return fee. Would rather buy a version up front where this is paid for.

title: Turbotax State - Buyer Beware, I lost $1,200
content: After 5 years of living in New Jersey, and filing my taxes through Turbotax, I found at least one major error in the program (how many haven't I found?). Turbotax state NJ does not deduct 18% of your rent (if you rent your home) as a property tax payment, as allowed by NJ tax code. So, at 4.2% overall income tax rate, the loss over 5 years, for me, is over $1200. Nice job turbotax. I've tried to contact them about this to no avail. Honestly, I have long suspected that their state products were fundamentally subpar. Now I have the proof. Yes, I could refile, but doing so would take hours and require me to reassemble every single form required for paper submission.

title: Extra Charges
content: As usual, the tax portion of program is excellent. That said, I was rather disappointed to discover that in order to file electron I was required to pay an additional $59.98 or use a more expensive addition. Now the deluxe version meets all of my needs, and a more advance program has far to many bells & whistles for my needs. I always thought using the electronic was the preferred way to go. I to add insult to injury Citizens Bank charged me $20 for issuing the check. Consequently, my $99 dollar was converted to $19.02. All these extra charges were due to my not filling using the mail service. I've use TurboTax for the last 6 years. Next year I will look at other options. Charles Cooper

title: What an amazing company!
content: Thanks to everyone for sharing Intuit's weasel move in removing Schedule D from Turbo Tax. I've used TurboTax since the 1980's. I'm not giving them extra money to do a Schedule D. Switched to iBank when Intuit killed Quicken on the Mac. Now it isTime to switch to H&R Block's solution for taxes. What an amazing company!

title: You'll have to pay more with this one
content: Don't buy it! I just payed 39.99 for this program and at the end the program is asking me again for another 39.99 for e-filing. And on top of that 24.99 to e-file State taxes. I feel so rip off!

title: unethical
content: intuit (maker of turbo tax) lobbies against much much easier taxes so they can then charge you to use their tax software, keeping a problem around to "resolve it" in the most inefficient manner possible is not an honest business model

title: I can't give it a good rating however due to the nickel and diming
content: The software itself is helpful and straightforward. I can't give it a good rating however due to the nickel and diming. Efiling with each state you submit a tax form to is a fee.. Each state's refund software (beyond the one free one you get) is another fee....

title: Turbo Tax was a big headache this year
content: I some special filing I had to do. Took me several hours to figure out what to do for those. I had account issues. This is an account that will only be used once a year and I did not remember that password. Was on the phone for 2 hours and that did not help. I just wanted to pay them to file the state return the only way I seemed to be able to proceed was having them take the money out of my federal return which they charged a service fee for. They really need to find a way to pay for a state return filling easier. I guess I could of mailed it but this is supposed to be the electronic age.

title: HORRIBLE! WTF Did they do to Turbo Tax
content: HORRIBLE! WTF Did they do to Turbo Tax! I have used this for the past several years and never had the problems experienced this year. After spending more time than I can ever remember putting this together, I seem to only have the option to file my state returns after paying another 24.99 e-file fee for just the state! Fine, whatever, but after attempting to do so it won't recognize my payment info after multiple attempts and only gives an error "try again later". I am at a total loss. I can't seem to figure out how to print just the state to file manually and it won't accept my payment info. This is supposed to be intuitive. Now I need to scramble just to figure my state taxes and file separately from Turbo Tax. NEVER AGAIN. YOU JUST LOST A LOYAL CUSTOMER YOU A$$ CLOWNS! Complete freaking garbage and the insincere apologies from the VP king a$$ clown "Bob Meighan, VP, TurboTax" are just a joke and indicative of a broken product. I have never been so upset with an inferior broken product.

title: Do Not Trust Turbo Tax
content: Turbo Tax should be fined for deleted functionality from the Deluxe version of TT. This move was obviously intended to increase revenue without concern for a loyal customer base. They removed investment and rental property from Deluxe to force customer to up grade to the more expensive Premier version. This is blatant self interest.

title: After years of dodging aggressive attempts to force you to ...
content: After years of dodging aggressive attempts to force you to upgrade, Turbo Tax finally made ir mandatory if you have complex taxes. Sleasy business practices. They don't really clearly identify it but you need Premier at $70+to file cap gains and rental properties. Time to bite the bullet and convert to H and R Block.

title: Glad I waited to purchase this year
content: Glad I waited to purchase this year, specifically because I knew Intuit would try a deceptive price increase again. I mean, how can they remove something as basic as schedule D...crazy. I've been using Turbo Tax since I left public accounting 9 years ago, no more. I will be downloading H&R in a few minutes.

title: Intuit you ruin everything
content: you keep the title of deluxe but you change that is included. I have been using turbotax for at least 10 years and I think this is the last year. This year if you sold a stock you cannot e-file with turbo tax deluxe. you have been every other year but intuit feels you are too stupid to notice the changes features while keeping the name the same. if you want change the features at least change the name. unlike the past you have plenty of competition and its time for everyone to choose anyone of them that isnt turbotax.

title: A gouge.
content: I was not happy about paying an additional fee to file or print the form. This seemed like a real gouge.

title: Bait and Switch?
content: I am very dissatisfied with the fact that I now have to purchase a more expensive product to do what I've been doing with Turbo Tax Deluxe for many years. I understand you sent me an offer for a $25 refund if I "upgrade", but I have NO IDEA how to "upgrade" other than to pay for the much more expensive program

title: Very disappointed with the 2014 program. Have used TT for decades and have never had this type of trouble.
content: Very disappointed. Have never had so much trouble downloading updates. Constant error messages. Even when I used a manual update link, each time I would try and finish a return, it would say I had errors in the return. Sure hope they get their bugs out before 2015. This year was really bad.

title: they suck every penny they can after you pay for the ...
content: they suck every penny they can after you pay for the fed they charge you to file the state on line. BS

title: MFS vs. MFJ Is Too Difficult/Support Staff is Ignorant
content: This was my first year filing married. I'd used Tubotax for almost 20 years filing single. Problem: the MFS vs. MFJ calculation should be a lot easier and more intuitive than it is. For a lot of couples this is a must-do comparison to make sure you are getting the best refund, any tax accountant was trained from day one to do this. I had to call Tubotax, which was a nightmare, and their employees did not even know what MFS vs. MFJ even means! I found myself talking to a few ignorant and poorly trained employees who knew very little about the product, they thought I was asking for tax advice when I was actually just asking how to use the product. Finally got a supervisor who knew something, but I'm still not sure the MFS vs. MFJ comparison was done properly even with her guidance. Will probably use something different next time.

title: It was fine the whole way filing
content: It was fine the whole way filing. Then I ended up having to amend and add a 1099-misc. Turbotax kept shutting off saying it encountered an error everytime I got to the point where the 1099 would pop up for me to fill in. I spent almost 2 hrs on the phone with tech to get it to work. Hung up the call. Got it to work. Then at the end of that when it was time to file, it showed I had some errors that needed to be addressed. So when I clicked the button to see the errors, it shut off again saying it encountered an error and has to close. So I call again. l was on the phone for 2 hours this time. Finally got it to work....by installing on a different computer. ugh. We still dont know why my computer encountered errors and my sons did not. Too frustrating! I usually use the Free edition but I now have a form I need that I have to pay for and it was what I thought easier to just buy the deluxe. Not sure what I will do next year.

title: Adios Turbotax
content: I was a practicing CPA for 25 years and have been using TurboTax Delux for 15 or 20 years as well as the Business software. I purchased Delux for 2014 only to find out they eliminiated certain schedules so I had to upgrade to the Home & Business. Then I got an email stating they would refund $25 after the 2014 returns had been filed. I looked at the email on April 19 to find out the "offer" expired on April 20. This leaves out those who filed for an extension. The email also stated one could get a free upgrade but it was not listed in the heading of the message. I tried to fill out the form to get the refund but I got a message to call a number, which I did today, Arpil 20. I called the number and got a case number and a transfer to another department which said due to a long wait, leave a number and they would call back one time. I held for over 30 minutes to get a person on the line linstning repeatedly how to go to the web site to obtain the refune or get the free upgrade. I was unable to obtain the refund online because I did not e-file. I did not e-file becuase I had to attach a disclosure document which Turbotax does not support.. This wait time and that for 2 of their people to get a $25 refund is absolutely ridiculous and uncalled for. Consequently I'm throughtwith Trubotax.

title: I'd give no stars if I could
content: What a mess. And despite what the VP said, there is currently no free upgrade for past Deluxe users who failed to read the reviews before posting. After probably 2 decades of using TurboTax Deluxe, it never occurred to me I wouldn't be able to file basic forms with this. Seriously, no Schedule D?? Terrible. Hoping I can still switch to H&R Block free. Really don't want to give Intuit another dime.

title: ttax said it updated after completing fed tax and downloading ...
content: ttax said it updated after completing fed tax and downloading state keeps on getting message to download never installing. It clearly states this copy of ttax has a state included. PLEASE FIX

title: I have been using TTax for 15 years and have ...
content: I have been using TTax for 15 years and have been suggesting it to others. NEVER AGAIN! I got caught up in the need to upgrade midway through the process. TTax, you have lost a customer.

title: Software is OK but the pricing scam wasn't
content: I almost went with another tax software this year, but at the last minute Intuit seemed to get the message loud and clear from consumers that we indeed were not pleased with the new pricing scheme (read scam) and they agreed to rebate the cost. If they try to jack the price again next year I will definitely be going to one of the other software products out there. The irony here is that I did not even need the additional forms. My disgust was purely based on Intuit's greed and lack of transparency. TurboTax is good but not really any better than any other tax software and if they try a stunt like this next year...I'm gone.

title: Bait and Switch
content: I bought my annual copy of Turbo Tax Deluxe at my local Big Box shopping club store without knowing about the changes. Looks like I'll be checking out H&R Block's offer for a free copy of H&R Block Deluxe + State for those of us who were hornswaggled.

title: Sorry TurboTax, never again....
content: Very disatisfied with TurboTax. After being a loyal customer for many years I'll be switching. Reasons: *Lax to no security features - not once in the days using the software did it ask me to sign in using a password! *It would not transfer my prior years' basic data such as name, address, etc. *When we filed our fed and state returns we were informed that they had been previously submitted - not by us! Poor security features probably led to the hacking. Next year we'll skip Tuboo Lax......

title: Less Functionality Than Prior Years, at Greater Cost
content: I've been using Turbo Tax for 20 years or more and always liked it until this year. They changed how they package the forms/components and how they price the product. Historically I could use the Basic version and accomplish everything I needed to. It cost me double what it cost last year (because I needed the Deluxe package to get the same functions previously in the Basic package), and even though the price was doubled, the software was missing key components that I needed to purchase for an additional cost (since I knew what was needed I went straight to the forms and input my data). Also, when I did my daughter's return, the software made a mistake with respect to an educational credit. I am very disappointed int the product, and after 20 plus years of Turbo Tax usage, I'll be looking for a different tax software vendor next year.

title: Intuit Greed
content: And we're done here. You won't be gouging me this year. Been a long time Turbo Tax user, no more after this.

title: I'm just glad that I don't let Turbo Tax file my state ...
content: Turbo tax is the same as always. It is confusing in that it will not let you review your 1040 until finished. And this year it was especially confusing because there was no place to put pre-paid school tax. I and two others I know put it under State Tax because it gave us no alternative. One of my friends finally contacted Turbo-Tax and it took the helper 1 1/2 to figure out how to do it. I'm just glad that I don't let Turbo Tax file my state tax. I hope they accept my Federal Tax since the deductions are total deductions are right, it's just not in the right place -- wherever the heck that is. I will file my state and school tax by hand and hope everything pans out. Really bad!

title: are you kidding me so disappointed In the middle of doing my taxes I was ...
content: by the time i was finished with the FREE? edition I was paying over 106.00 DOLLARS!!! WHAT??? are you kidding me so disappointed In the middle of doing my taxes I was given a choice either pay nothing and receive about half of the return you would get if you paid them 36 bucks. OK 36 dollars isn't bad them at the end while paying the price goes up another 34 dollars OK then a the VERY END the price is OVER 106 WHAT??? so sneaky. will never use again.

title: Adios
content: Adios Turbotax, thanks for forcing me to your competition

title: Although I have been using TT for only a few ...
content: Although I have been using TT for only a few years, I believe I will have to switch to others this year.

title: Bye bye Turbotax
content: Turbotax has been my mainstay for 15 years. No more. If Intuit disrespects its customers so badly that they force them to upgrade (for me $60) in order to have a viable tax form, then they certainly don't need me as a customer. I switched to HR Block and it works as well as Turbotax.

title: Be Careful buying software online!!
content: The write up on this was not correct when I did my taxes and started my state portion of my return it automatic send me to quicken to purchase the state portion of the software. I was not happy I had to spend another $50 when the description clearly states Federal and State. I tried to contact the seller with not reply.

title: I wonder what makes it Deluxe...
content: I've used it > 20 years. This year they yanked schedule D out and forced an upgrade. It took 30 minutes with customer service to get the upgrade for free... and ... I guess I should be glad I got it at all. But I won't buy again. Ever.

title: This company isn't satisfied with billions in revenue
content: This company isn't satisfied with billions in revenue. This year they raised the price and gave us less. I selected direct deposit and received a check from the state and haven't received anything from the Fed yet. What is far worse is they programed a trap into the software that leads you into purchasing audit protection. Like a fool, I mistakenly added the protection at $49.00. I tried to remove it but could not and went on line to see if others were duped also. Sure enough, they were and were also not able to remove the charge. That is the last penny intuit will ever get from me and my family. Bad enough they are gouging, worse they are trying to trick us into an added purchase. Who runs this company?

title: While I did my regular return fine, I could not do a simple 1041 for ...
content: I bought the Home and Business version, one shy of the Business version. While I did my regular return fine, I could not do a simple 1041 for a Simple Trust that I became the fiduciary for. Had to buy "Business" version; only trouble is, it is only PC capable, not for Mac. (Same for H&R Block BTW). Why they don't allow the 1041 for small items in the Premier or Home & Business is beyond me!! Here I am near the deadline and can not do it. (An estate lawyer did it last year). They should allow small 1041 in the expensive version I bought.

title: Turbo Tax deluxe - PROBLEM
content: I'm sorry but this years Turbo Tax SUCKED big time. It would not connect to allow me to purchase audit protection, the customer service the program lead me to did not know what to do, even after 45 minutes of trying to figure it out. On top of that i had to go back to customer service to pay for my state filing, again due to a glitch in your program. and your email that said you apologize and won't charge us for the forms you tried to take out of Turbo Tax, do you think having a complete package might just be why people buy your product. Your getting ready to lose me as a Turbo Tax customer after 10 years, and if that is what you want, go ahead and change it for the greed of the money, because that is what I truly see it is all about. one very disappointed customer.

title: Very very difficult to review for corrections and make changes ...
content: Very very difficult to review for corrections and make changes accordingly.The program tends to lock up and wont accept corrections ! I have used TT for years, this is the first time this problem has showed up, other years there have been complications and difficulties but eventually been worked through. Needed to have a CPA review who also had problems, but needed to make pencil corrections.

title: this one is really bad for all the sited reasons
content: have used deluxe for years.......this one is really bad for all the sited reasons. phoned turbo and they are sending premier for free. however found their reason for deleting the schedules CDEF was that the IRS requested it . REALLY !!! I think they are desperate for an excuse

title: Send a message - Don't buy from Intuit any more. What was once a great company with value-add products is no longer the same.
content: I've been a quicken/turbotax user since the mid-'90s. I've always liked the products, enough to put up with a relatively high-level of irritation over previous corporate money grabbing decisions and poor customer service. For example, several years ago Intuit started forcing everyone to upgrade Quicken on a regular basis or lose downloading functionality. I came to Amazon today to purchase TurboTax Deluxe (as I do every year), but will likely go ahead and buy H&R Block's product. I don't have the time to deal with these sorts of repeated stunts. It is also the only way I can send a message to Intuit, ie through my pocketbook. And when I hit the forced roll-over of Quicken in a few months, I'm going to be looking at the alternatives for that as well. Goodbye Intuit.

title: Turbo Tax disappoints for 2014!
content: Have used TurboTax for years and have always been very happy--until this year. I do taxes for several family members and have always used the Deluxe version. This year, after purchasing Deluxe and installing it, I learned that I would need Premier in order to do my mother-in-law's taxes. I have not had to do her taxes before. I was told I could get a $25 refund if I had used Deluxe version last year, but needed Premier this year. I paid $20 more just to get a couple of schdules that have always been included on Deluxe. I didn't qualify for the $25 refund because I didn't file our own taxes, even though I still purchased and used both versions. Our personal taxes involved special circumstances I didn't feel qualified to tackle. Very unhappy with TurboTax this year!!!

title: Unannounced change: no longer includes schedule c
content: Just learned from NY Times [...] that TurboTax Deluxe NO LONGER INCLUDES Schedule C. How come I got learn from someone else? This used to be my standby. Is TurboTax gonna stick to its guns or make it up to a loyal customer like me?

title: buggy software
content: I have been using TurboTax for the past 8 years. The product has been great and easy to use in previous years but this year for some reason TurboTax has been frustrating for me. After entering all my tax information and triple checking everything I went to efile. I hit Transmit and after a few seconds it pops up with "Duplicate Social Security number has already been submitted". No error codes just that error. I am thinking I'm victim of identity theft and it has me worried. So I called Intuit customer support in regards to this thinking maybe it may be a software error. Got a hold of a customer support representative who was polite but told me this is an IRS issue and that I need to check with them. He sent me the number to the IRS identity theft. I spent the past 2 hours trying to get a hold of the IRS. Of course every time I called I was promptly disconnected after a few minutes telling me due to the high volume they cannot connect me. Finally after about a dozen tries I was able to get on hold and got an IRS agent after waiting for about 15 minutes. The IRS agent checked all the social security numbers including myself, my wife's, and child to see if anyone had use the number to file. So to my relief someone had not used my SSN to file. So it was back to TurboTax. After getting hold of an Intuit customer representative and spending about 40 minutes on the phone with them they said they cannot do anything for me and to try filing using their online site or just mailing it in. Not only was I out the 40 bucks I spent on this software and another 25 bucks attempting to file my state also. My state efile did not go through since I was unable to file my federal. I'm highly disappointed in this software and I doubt I will be using them again next year. Guess its time to try H&R Block.

title: Sucked
content: I had to buy the business version this year so I was disappointed that the deluxe version did not offer those with 1099s the ability to use this version. I had to spend 30 dollars more for the business version at which included tons of worksheets I did not even need. Next year I'm going back to my tax man after over 10 years of using turbo tax. I don't know why it was changed this year. I even feel like I was cheated out of my refund this year. I should have listened to the other reviewers and just went to an accountant.

title: Very disappointed with 2014 Turbo Tax Deluxe
content: I have used Turbo Tax Deluxe for the past 10 years and have always been very happy with it until now. The 2014 Turbo Tax Deluxe quite honestly was terrible. The software would "freeze up" whenever it felt like it leaving you with no choice but to use control, alt and delete to get out of software. Also, the Deluxe version always included a Schedule C, however this year they decided to omit it. So when I got to the home business part of my taxes it told me I needed to upgrade and pay an additional $40 to get the forms I needed. I refused to give this company anymore money so I didn't even end up using Turbo Tax to do our taxes this year. I will never use Turbo Tax again.

title: COST ME $600! During the 2013 year TurboTax had ...
content: COST ME $600! During the 2013 year TurboTax had me pay $600 to my city. TurboTax took my 2013 file and applied it to the 2014 taxes. After my 2014 taxes were filed, I received a letter from my city stating the tax was incorrect (done on TurboTax!), and that I did not owe taxes. Had the city not reviewed it, I WOULD BE OUT $600 AGAIN! Nothing has changed with my income or tax info. It seems TurboTax cost me $600 by wrongfully having me pay city tax!

title: Intuit does not like return customers very much.
content: Was a more than a little surprised to learn that I could no longer use the same product I have used for years to file my taxes. Not unless I paid more... That's right, our very small home business won't get filed by this version...

title: This is the worst year by far
content: Used for 15 years. This is the worst year by far. Deceptive ad regarding free state e-file. Whoever was responsible for this years's edition needs to go.

title: More honesty next time.
content: I wish they had been more honest about the changes being made. I feel ripped off.

title: With the sad things Intuit has done as everyone else has mentioned
content: With the sad things Intuit has done as everyone else has mentioned, I literally think its cheaper for me to have an accountant do my taxes this year.

title: Be wary!! Worst Turbotax yet, and very questionable business practices by Intuit
content: After ten years, this is the last year I use Turbotax. This software package has had a steady decline in usability over the last ten years. Clearly, Inuit is not investing capital into upgrading the software. Instead, they have removed the ability to enter in stock trade info and K-1 info in Deluxe so that it is unusable to me. On top of it all, they want me to pay another $30 to "upgrade" to Premier? I am a returning Deluxe customer but do NOT qualify for the upgrade. Do NOT believe that you will get a free upgrade - you have to read the small print buried in Intuit's website. The tact they have taken in extorting their customers by "tricking" them into paying extra for an upgrade to software they have already purchased is inexcusable. I refuse to support this business practice, and I am cutting bait and using a different software package. Good bye, Turbotax.

title: BEWARE! This program has been gutted in order to gouge us.
content: BEWARE! This program has been significantly gutted in order to gouge us. What will they charge extra for next year - Form 1040? We've used it for literally over 30 years and now we're gone - permanently. Why can't we give the appropriate Zero Stars?

title: Security issue with TurboTax
content: Wow, where to start??? The surprise change in the forms available in the deluxe edition was unfortunate, but I was happy with what Intuit did to rectify the situation. I even considered continuing to use TurboTax in subsequent years as we have for 16+ years. Then I e-filed my federal return and found out that through a security breach in the software someone had already filed a tax refund using my social security number. Fortunately, my credit appears otherwise unharmed, as does my partner's, but this will likely be the last year that I use TurboTax to complete my returns. http://www.washingtonpost.com/news/get-there/wp/2015/03/04/unprecedented-surge-in-online-tax-scams-raises-questions-about-turbotax/

title: Disappointed in TT
content: Disappointed with the limited deductions allowed for use with 1099-misc. The features panel on the box is not really accurate in this regard. Also disappointed that even though I did not use TT to file my state return, when my spouse tried to file hers using TT, the program insisted that the "free" state return had been used and insisted on a $25 filing fee. It seems that because I started my state return in TT it canceled our "no-charge" so called free state return feature. Not happy! For the first time in the many years of using TT for my taxes, I think that there may be better options on the market.

title: $79.95 for TurboTax, $108 in"fees" from their partner bank, and 2 months later I still am missing my over $7k refund. Thank you
content: Horrible, horrible horrible. Not even worth one star. "Free Fed E-File" - then, when you submit your taxes, it asks "do you want your filing fees taken out of your refund?" FEES? So you hit "yes." The software changes the refund bank routing and account FROM your account info (which you filed with) to deposit straight from the IRS into the Santa Barbara Tax Products Group account. They are supposed to deduct the fee, then forward it to your account listed on the return. I filed 2/5/15, the IRS accepted it 2/6/15. and forward my over $7000.00 to Santa Barbara Tax Products Group on 2/13/15. They claim they tried to "forward the funds to your bank twice, but it was rejected." This is absolute bulls*** - my account numbers were accurate. Result, they "deducted refusal fees" (total of fees was $108.00), sat on my $7k until March 25, then returned MY money to the IRS (by the way, I haven't been able to confirm with the IRS that they have.) Result? $79.95 for TurboTax, $108.00 for fees, and I still don't have my $7000 and I don't know who does. HOW TO RUIN A BRAND. I used TurboTax since 2004, but will never again.

title: Not pleased. I have used TT for years this year ...
content: Not pleased. I have used TT for years this year there were extra efile charges than in prior years additionally maybe its the tax changes I dont know but TT calculated my state return incorrectly. I may try something else for taxes next year

title: Turbo Tax 2014
content: I have been using Turbo Tax since it came out, this year was no different. This year was a little difficult as opposed to previous years with the new ACA laws. I put in my families information in and right away leveled a penalty for not having insurance on myself and my college age child whom I was claiming. It gave the option to input a waiver # provided by the IRS. At this point I decided to go no further and investigated the internet and the Turbo Tax forums to see how to go about applying for a waiver. After much research I found on the forum that there is an option for asking for a waiver due to insurance costing too much through my husbands job. I filled out that part of the program and it took the penalty off my taxes. I have no idea how Turbo Tax will verify my information via the IRS because it didn't explain how that part of the process works. After I finished my taxes but before submitting them to the IRS, I always go through them one last time looking for any mistakes I might have made or if I forgot anything.
