This year every single time I did that the above healthcare waiver was deleted and I had to do it all over again. Thank goodness I was paying attention or I would have submitted without the waiver that I researched so much. Since I utilize Turbo Tax to the fullest by doing the whole families taxes I ran into another problem doing my dad's taxes. This was the first year that it did not find last years taxes from my computer. I deleted it and started over again. The second go around it found his last years taxes but only transferred his name and address. Everything else was working from a blank slate. When I finally finished his taxes it deleted everything I had just worked on. After all of this, I will probably buy this product again next tax season because I am so used to using it and I love the Its Deductible program. I really hope that the developer reads all of its customers complaints and improves upon its product next year.

title: UNSATISFIED LONG TIME TURBOTAX CUSTOMER
content: I have been using Turbo Tax since the 1900's and always used TT Basic. This year I noticed That Basic program was reduced to something less than what it used to be so I invested in TT Deluxe 2014. I used it to do two simple returns, one did not go as simple as before but then I had my own return and one for a grandchild,, WHOW. I find even deluxe was not the right program but need to upgrade to TT Premier. The last year Basic 2013 is now what Premier 2014 is. I didn't see any difference except that the price went up from 29.95 to a whooper 79.95 for 2014 Premier not counting the cost of Deluxe 2014 that now is of no use. Excuses TT makes for the program changes do not justify in my opinion a $50 to $60 increase in price.

title: And then they thought it'd be good enough to offer those Schedules only to customers who ...
content: So intuit decided (and without telling anybody in advance) that they'd be pulling Schedules C, D and E out of their Deluxe offering that's had those schedules for years? And then they thought it'd be good enough to offer those Schedules only to customers who had used their product last year? Finally they bow to pressure and give those schedules to us and "promise" that they'll be included in the future. Thanks but no thanks intuit. After being a loyal user for 10 years I can't and won't trust you any longer. There are plenty of other options out there and those companies didn't try yo pull the fast one you did. They deserve my business. You don't

title: Add up all the pieces before you purchase. Don't get
content: Cost is too high and cost is deceptive. I bought the $10 costco simple version. After entering all my information and getting ready to file, I suddenly discovered I had to pay $40 to get the state version, then got charged another $20 to file online. So, my total cost was $80. I have used Turbotax many times on the past and never paid more than $40 for Federal + State. Why all the deception? I will use a different program next year. I was very comfortable using TTax in the past, but this has left a bad taste in my mouth, and there are other products out there which I am sure are just as capable. Not a very smooth move TTax. You just lost a regular customer.

title: Married filing separate not really easy to use on this
content: I was told this would have a better calculator than H+R Block that I've been using for years for married filing separately. I have to do that for loan payment amounts, so calculating it out in a community property state where I live is about as complicated as simple tax calculations can get. I managed to do it with H+R Block manually, and had researched turbo tax to see if it did these calculations for me. It says it does, but it does not. Had to figure out amounts manually and enter myself, if I had known that, I would stick with H+R Block, which is cheaper and does the same stuff.

title: Intuit What where you thinking? Is the the way to treat loyal customers?
content: Turbo Tax Deluxe - from the Intuit Website: â¢Most Popular: TurboTax Deluxe is our most popular product among TurboTax users with more complex tax situations. Intuit, after using your software since the first year you sold it, and using the Deluxe version for more than a decade, why would you dumb down the product and still call it Deluxe? You still have time to change your decision to remove the automatic handling of D & full support for schedule C. Maybe then keep a long time customer.

title: Better than dealing with a tax person but not much.
content: I was required to do an upgrade which I did not need to continue filing my taxes. I knew it was unnecessary in my case but turbo need more money so they got it. The required upgrade did not put a dime in my pockets but did in turbo's pocket. Good for turbo. I was in no way compensated for the previous remarks.

title: Not Real Happy This Year
content: After purchasing revived e-mail that it was, contrary to previous advertising, not necessary to order more than Basic for my needs. Then received message that it was not recommended to file California State electronically but Federal should be o.k. Had so little coming back from State filed both electronically. Got State back in a week. Has been over two weeks and Federal is listed as received and being reviewed/processed.

title: My experience with turbotax when filing my 2013 forms was ...
content: My experience with turbotax when filing my 2013 forms was maddening to say the least. I tried every way I could to get some response from the so-called experts, all to no avail. After a month of trying to get some answers I finally sent it in incorrect and let the feds do the correction. I was really discouraged with the total lack of back up from turbotax and this year I went ahead and used turbotax but I backed it up with a visit to the zombies (IRS) and was advised on the proper way to process the numbers so I had the right answer at the end. Now I am hoping they (IRS) get their stuff together and send my return a little faster.

title: poor upgrade
content: I was very unhappy with the version of the software this year. The supposed upgrade caused numerous problems, and the additional fee I had to pay when filing (state download charged and additional fee on top of the e-file) didn't make me happy. TurboTax sent an email apologizing saying that I would qualify for a $25- refund, but when I applied it was denied. Tried calling to find out why and it was a 2hr wait to talk to someone. Time to look elsewhere if this is what I have to deal with!

title: Must pay a ransom to get schedule D and E
content: On Intuit's web site they say " Intuit believes in the power of the people". Show them the power by boycotting their product.

title: Dissatisfied with online purchases of Extras needed to do taxes
content: I have used Turbo tax for 3 or 4 years with out a problem since my Accountant retired. This years Turbo tax was a nightmare for me. Usually I buy the CD. This year I downloaded it from Amazon. I was inputting my data into Turbo tax. Then it came to Buy additional States and it would not let me buy it online. It was a software glitch. I waited hours to get a hold of a person to fix this. She was nice and comped the cost of the state. Then when I went to E-File my state again It had a glitch and would not let me pay online to E-file it. Once again I had to wait on hold and then get a call back late at night to finally finish the taxes. I paid for this one. With all the time that I spent waiting on the phone I could have went to a paid tax preparer and would have only spent $20 more. It was not worth the aggravation this year.

title: GOODBYE TurboTax
content: I have been a loyal TT user since the 90's. However, due to them no longer supporting small business forms in Deluxe, I will find another tax preparation source, even if it means doing them myself like I used to. It is not worth the added expense to pay for the upgraded version for a side business which barely made any money in 2014. Good bye TT. I won't be the only loyal customer you lose this year.

title: While the previous years were easy to use
content: After using Turbo Tax for the last few years, I was frustrated with this years edition. While the previous years were easy to use, this one was confusing to follow' especially when doing a combined income. We closed 2 individual IRA's and put them into the designated slot. It kept dropping one off (which was found when I reviewed the form). Getting back to the area to change it back was trying and finally accomplished on the 4th go round! Hopefully, these issues will be corrected for next years product.

title: It would have been nice to be able to E-file Oregon returns this year
content: It would have been nice to be able to E-file Oregon returns this year. One of the returns I prepared, I got a Earned Income Credit (EIC) on the Federal Form 1040, but the Oregon Form 40 didn't generate the EIC. When looking through the menus, I was unable to find an option to generate the EIC for Oregon. Several times while keying in information the program kept repeating the same screens over and over. I had to close out of the program, and sign back in to get beyond that point. One of the times that this happened, I lost all of the information that I had already input, and had to rekey it all. This was the first year I have had any trouble using Turbo Tax since 1996.

title: Gets worse every year
content: The bad reviews contrast with Intuit sales record. The short answer is that people do not have many options (one of those options was for the IRS to provide software and simplified filing, but Intuit lobbied heavily against it). Back to my review: this year it got more expensive, equally confusing at times, AND they introduced a bait and switch with the Amazon gift card refund offer. So, don't count on it. I don't know how Amazon accepts to being a part of this.

title: There are too many other tax software companies out there to put up with this crap!
content: I will never buy Turbo Tax again! I have used it for the last 10 years without any issues. This year, I could not file a single return for myself and my family. I kept getting a message about not having an internet connection and the transmission would not go through. I did everything suggested to resolve the issue and still could not transmit any returns. Based on the feedback on the turbo tax site, I was not the only customer with this problem. I am so done with turbo tax. There are too many other tax software companies out there to put up with this crap!

title: I will never buyTurbo Tax again. I purchased Turbo ...
content: I will never buyTurbo Tax again. I purchased Turbo Tax 2013 last year but could not complete my 1040 Federal Return because it kept telling the appropriate forms were not available. I got tired of waiting so I went to H&R Block to get my 2013 Taxes completed.($59.00 down the drain) I purchased Turbo Tax 2014 this year. Federal 1040was completed OK, however I found out that Tubo Tax had shut down the ability for me to complete my NY State return because the many fraudulent state returns filed using Turbo Tax. I believe in the future I will make My life easier by going to H&R block in the first place. Thank you for the chance to comment on My experience.

title: I've been using TurboTax for 15 years and will switch ...
content: I've been using TurboTax for 15 years and will switch to H&R Block this year due to increased product cost, deleted features and having to purchase a more expensive version. So much for customer loyalty....

title: Turbo tax nightmare
content: I will never use turbo tax again. It was filed wrong and when I needed to amend it was all but impossible . Can't re e-file so you loose your money there too.Had to take it to an accountant file extensions amendments it was a costly nightmare! Further more there is No One you can talk to about anything. Online help is a joke. Do yourself a favor and don't jump over a dollar to save a dime. Turbo tax is not worth the losses you will incur, and most times you don't even know it till the IRS contacts you.

title: I have been a faithful turbotax purchaser for about 10 ...
content: I have been a faithful turbotax purchaser for about 10 years, but this may be my last. I've been buying the deluxe version each year, and did this year again, only to find that they've made it impossible for me to use the product without spending another $40, for "home and business." Had I known this, I might have gone elsewhere. I feel gouged, and that's not going to inspire further loyalty.

title: say like with your insurance company will just keep going up ...
content: I won't be purchasing TT deluxe. I've been a long time customer for years. For Intuit to raise the price to get less is not justified. You know sometimes a longtime company, say like with your insurance company will just keep going up over time through out the years. You get tired of that and well its time to depart and find a cheaper alternative with the same coverage if not more, for less. Same goes here. Intuit, its time we part as old friends. You're wanting to charge me more for less. Its about saving money for me, I don't feel I am receiving any value to your increase. So with that good luck. There are plenty of other choices in regards to tax software.

title: Avoid. Buy something else
content: This is absolutely horrible. 1) They have stripped out features that used to exist, at all levels, in order to force you into buying a higher level 2) The software makes frequent and gross errors in dealing with MLPs 3) There are bugs in the software, resulting in incorrect calculations 4) It crashes 5) There is no support. 6) Just to repeat - THERE IS NO SUPPORT - other than groupies who may / may not know what they are talking about

title: I suppose it's better than doing them by hand.
content: Every year TurboTax gets less and less user friendly. They used to do a better job with the questions they asked to collect the information needed to fill out the forms. These days it's all very vague and it seems that they're relying on the user to know a lot of tax jargon. I am especially disappointed with the section on tuition and college expenses. And seriously, when I say I don't use a vehicle for my business, don't ask me for the make and mileage. And don't tell me it's an error that I don't have that info filled in.

title: Had Enough
content: OK, so they had to eat crow and give us a free upgrade to get the Schedule D forms back in. How they can think this is not something that is normally done by a household is beyond me. My real problem is the lack of explanation, despite the help screen, of certain entry screens. I had to guess as to what I was supposed to enter in some fields. And the price for this product is double the competitions. Tax-Act next year.

title: Up until last year we had a business and it was great to use
content: I've used t/tax for more than 10 years. Up until last year we had a business and it was great to use. This year the loading was flawed, it was NOT as easy to use (inspite of the fact we didn't have to file for the business). It farted around carrying over last year's info. It lost the CT state filing TWICE. (Thank GOD I saved to a flash drive during each phase of the process) All in all, IT SUCKED. Whatever/whomever you changed this year's program, go back to what you did before!

title: Don't fix things that ain't broken
content: Have been using Turbo deluxe for years with total satisfaction. This year I was unable to deduct expenses from one little part time tutor job because deluxe no longer will allow expense deductions without moving to a more expensive TurboTax and the deductions weren't worth upgrading. Why they changed that one part is beyond me. Probably a new MBA with an "idea" without thinking it out. Will see what is offered next year. If they don't go back to the original Deluxe, there are too many other options out there

title: Turbo tax alone is fine. But I've bought the cd's the last two ...
content: If I could give it no stars I would. Turbo tax alone is fine. But I've bought the cd's the last two years and have had nothing but problems. Between this year and last, I've spent almost 5hrs on the phone with applications trying to solve various problems. Never again will I try to save money by purchasing the cd's. Which then next year I'll have to start from scratch bc you can't import data that was saved onto your computer from the cd and vice versa. They're different 'dot' files that aren't compatible.

title: I need a new tax program.....
content: Everyone knows the issue now this year. I'm yet another former faithful user that will find another program this year.

title: What did TurboTax do this year?!
content: I have used TurboTax for many years - this year was far and away the worst year ever! The "links" from the Federal return were incomplete! I filed (and have filed for years) electronic returns with automatic deposit to a bank account - both Federal and State. This year, TurboTax decided to "default" to a paper check refund for the state; why, I have NO idea - but I was frankly VERY annoyed! I will certainly have to reconsider what software I use to prepare my taxes in the future!

title: I was very disappointed that the State section had been removed from Deluxe
content: I was very disappointed that the State section had been removed from Deluxe. Although TurboTax eventually gave me State for "free" it cost me 3 extra hours of time on the phone waiting for and speaking to 3 separate parties. I was on the phone 20 minutes more today trying to get the refund of 19.99 that was supposed to post to my credit card yesterday, a week after I filed. I now have to wait 2-3 weeks to see if it posts. If State is not included in TurboTax products in 2016, I will use another service.

title: Stupid people. I have been using TurboTax for years ...
content: I should have read the reviews. Don't buy this product if you need a Schedule C or K-1. Actually don't buy this product at all given the mess intutit has made of their product. They deserve to disappear off the face of the earth for being greedy, stupid people. I have been using TurboTax for years but due to a computer crash I lost the 2013 version. Now I have to download 2013 again from Amazon and reload it so that I can get the upgrade that shouldn't be needed in the first place. This is after spending time trying to figure out what was going wrong and then dealing with Turbotax not being able to connect to the Internet though I was able to get on to everyone else's site without a problem. Thanks to the people at Intuit that have wasted an awful lot of my time, a terrible review is the least I can do to return the favor. BTW... Intuit is offering a $25 rebate to try to correct for their sins. Problem is the needed upgrade cost $30 (assuming you can get the stupid program to recognize your Internet connection) so it still costs you more. They should be paying us and firing everyone responsible for this stupid move. Update: Got Intuit to upgrade to Premier with the help of an Amazon (Thanks Amazon!) so I could enter a Sch K-1. Got to the very next section and found that you can no longer enter a Sch C with either the Deluxe or the Premier Editions and that there is another $10 charge to "upgrade" to do so. Well Intuit, I think as little of you as you think of your customers - of which I will never be one again.

title: Bait and Switch
content: I have used Turbo Tax Deluxe for about 10 years and have been very happy with it. After purchasing it this year, I was very unhappy to see the removal some key features that I use, and the forcing of customers to purchase Premier.

title: Again? Really?
content: Again - Learn nothing from the past issues?? I suggest hrblock

title: TTennessee State Return Required, Yes or No ?
content: Turbo Tax this year caused me follow the state tax road although I had always assumed I was not required to file a state return in Tennessee because all our investment income comes through IRA distributions. At the end of the process I was informed I could not E-file because of the TN state return ( for an unknown reason ), that I should "delete" the state return because I was not required to file one ( just as I originally assumed ). There was no way for me to "delete" the state data ; I had to tell the system I would file the TN return later before I could E-file federal form.

title: Turbotax stuck it to me! Not using it next year or ever again.
content: Purchased Homeowner Deluxe Edition for $53.00. Installed it OK on Laptop w/ Win XP Pro. Started application. Upon entering name, address, etc, program got a fatal error. Removed application. Reinstalled it. Crashed again with an error code. Ran Windows repair & reinstalled application. Restarted program & clicked on "have tech support call you within 45 minutes". Never received a call. Unable to process tax return with this Turbotax disc. Took disc back to Staples where I bought it. Was refused a refund. Best they offered was an exchange for another disc. I'm out $53.00.

title: Changed for the worse - check out competitor's products
content: Dated interface, makes mistakes with prorating changes based on the date of the change (move from New York City to the suburbs), and now does not do half of what the last year's version did for the same price.

title: paying for Turbo Tax is itself a tax
content: I've used Turbo Tax for more than 10 years. I was dismayed this year when Intuit announced that Turbo Tax Deluxe would no longer allow deductions for investment income (Schedule D) and that we'd have to upgrade to Home & Business for an extra $25. Intuit quickly back peddled to allow investment income in Deluxe. But what will happen next year? The price of Turbo Tax has risen nearly every year I've used it. I already pay the government enough in taxes. The $54.99 for Turbo Tax Deluxe is basically just another tax, except that I'm paying it to Intuit rather than to the IRS.

title: Wish they would fix the issue with Georgia Form 500 pg 4
content: I have been using TurboTax Deluxe for the past 5 years and am overall satisfied with the software. The only issue I have is with the State portion, page 4 of Georgia Form 500 does not show up when you Save or Print, and the only way you can get it to appear is by going into Form Mode. It has been this way since I started using it and continues even this year. I speak with TurboTax each year and they Dont fix it, they just tell me to go into Form Mode and I can see it there. I would hope at some point they would fix this issue as its a pain to deal with, year after year.

title: And inaccurate rip off.
content: Turbo Tax ruined my tax process. It did not include a major W - 2 form. On my state tax it clearly stated that it could not tell me if my deduction were allowable under the income allowance for deducting all my federally declared deductions.Also, it did not ask about estimated tax payments made at the state level. I was supposed to get one state filing free according to the advertisement, but that did not (surprise!) include the electronic filing of the forms. $20 more dollars to me. I trusted the program. Dumb me. I had to file two amended returns.

title: Turbotax is back to the old way and it works just fine,
content: My earlier review is below. Since that time Turbotax repented and brought Deluxe back to the way it was last year. In the meantime I bought H&R Block Deluxe. It was OK but as soon as Turbotax straightened out Deluxe I bought it and used it. I hope they learned a lesson and don't try to nickel and dime long time customers again. Save your money and buy another program. They dropped Schedule D from the Deluxe version which many unsuspecting buyers will not discover until they have made a mistake and bought it assuming it is just an update of the 2013 program. Turbotax's brilliant idea of making buyers pay for the Premier version to get Schedule D is one of the more stupid decisions they have made.

title: VERY DISAPPOINTED!
content: Very disappointed. There is a problem with the VT Form IN-111 (use tax). According to your website it was fixed with the 3/30 download. I have updated my program a couple of times, and it still isn't fixed. It tells me line 27 should be zero, but it doesn't let me change it to zero. I usually file my taxes in February, but I still don't have my state taxes filed because of this error, and I'm running out of time. I have used Turbo Tax for several years, but with the stolen refunds and this problem I will probably switch to something else next year.

title: I deserve a refund alright..the cost of the "Deluxe" edition of Turbo Tax. What were they thinking...?
content: Not as user friendly as all the earlier years, would not import information from previous years and only saved in .pdf format so I doubt that it will import this info next year if I was given over to buying it again. Too bad I've used TT for the last 10 years and this "deluxe". edition was so much less than advertised and deserved. I would rather learn to use another product that go with another edition of TT. I deserve a refund alright...of my purchase price of TT.

title: One Star
content: I need Schedule D and it is not included as it was last year.

title: I have encountered a problem where I cannot open a ...
content: I have encountered a problem where I cannot open a file. After being on the phone for over an hour, there is still no resolution, the error message remains and I cannot access and it's been almost a week. I had to pay for the downloading of a state form which I cannot use.No refund has been given for the program or state tax form either. Maybe they think I will just forget about it all. Incompetent!!!!!! at customer service.Very Frustrating to say the least. Kathy M

title: Found some quirks this year, but still love it!
content: I've used TurboTax for many years and find it so easy to follow. It guides you through step-by-step, and checks everything for you so there's no mistakes. I was a little disappointed in the 2014 section for charitable contributions. I remember last year it helped you value items donate charities like Good Will. I found I had to come up with my own values this year and probably under valued many things, as I remember being surprised in previous years how much was recommended for some items. I was also disappointed that when listing these items, you could not use "various" dates when you have donated to the same organization several times throughout the year. That was a choice as you are entering, but when you did your final review, it came up as an error and told you "various" was no longer allowed, so I had to go back and separated out each group of things donated on a specific date. Good thing I keep good records! All that said, I still love Turbo Tax and wouldn't dream of using any other method.

title: You bad!
content: Very disappointed. I have been using Turbo Tax for almost 15 years. Until this year I have always been able to enter my "rental income." This year the program gave me an instruction that in order to do so I would have to upgrade to a different Turbo Tax edition. Listen folks, one size does not fit all. Every year I have been able to enter a small amount ($4,500) of rental income. I have no expenses associated with this income, no management participation, no fees, no nothing. All there is is the $4,500. There's no reason I should have been forced to upgrade.

title: Returning TurboTax Deluxe back.
content: Good Bye TurboTax. Will try out H&R Block Deluxe version.

title: I had already purchased the Deluxe model like every year
content: I came close to quitting TurboTax when you tried to swindle us with a bait and switch maneuver in trying to force us to buy the more expensive Turbo. I had already purchased the Deluxe model like every year. If you insist on charging more next year I will go to someone else! How can we trust you with our returns if you pull these shenanigans on us. This sounds more like something the IRS would do. I'm sure I am not alone in waiting to see if you change it back to the way it used to be. If you don't, ADIOS!

title: big change very disappointing. Lost my trust and business
content: Very surprised and disappointed to discover Deluxe no longer covers contractng expenses...pay $40 more to file income and minimal expenses...no way. Goodby TurboTax, you got my last $50.

title: I still enjoyed using Turbo Tax but hope you can clear up ...
content: I found this year's Turbo Tax the most difficult to work with. My most serious problem was trying to find my way back to a form that I had completed but needed to correct. The program did not give me immediate access to my forms. My state form was returned with minor math problems that I was not aware of nor was I concerned at this point. I still got my refund. I am afraid my federal form had mistakes that I just could not get to. I still enjoyed using Turbo Tax but hope you can clear up these glitches. Thank you for this opportunity.

title: Very disappointed with the increase in price over last year for ...
content: Very disappointed with the increase in price over last year for less functionality- no schedule D?! Will be looking elsewhere after being a loyal TurboTax customer for many, many years!

title: Errors when E-filing.
content: I made two typo errors on my 1040 and when I E-filed it, of course the IRS rejected it. TurboTax told me about the one error which I corrected. I then E-filed again and for the second the form was rejected.. TurboTax did not tell me where the second error was located so I refiled it and once again was rejected. TurboTax only allows two chances to E-file so I had to mail the forms. Why not give unlimited times to re-file until the IRS accepts the file?

title: It sucks. Yes
content: I have been using turbotax since 2000. I have a desktop version this year and did not have time to use it until the last week or so before the deadline. I filed for extension immediately. But soon found out the investment section cannot be used unless I pay $30 more for an upgrade. I only had $20 stock gain last year, totally not worth the upgrade. Since I also used the desktop version last year and did E-filing, I was hoping I can get free upgrade but it didn't work. I cannot download the free upgrade. Waited for 2 hours on the phone to talk to customer service, 5 min before 11pm, before I could talk to anyone, the connection was lost. So I decided to call when the deadline has past. Guess what? they only work 9-5 when I am working as well and do not have my laptop with me at work. It sucks. Yes, time to move on.

title: TurboTax a Rip-Off
content: I will never use TurboTax again after being a confirmed user for 30 years. This year TurboTax Deluxe did not include one State filing. No where did it indicate that that State was no longer included and I did not read the fine print expecting it to be the same as it has been for the last 10 years. One state filing was included with the Deluxe version. I had to pay and additional $59.98 over the $59.99 I had already spent in order to submit my state filing. I'll go to H & R Block, even if they cost more because I don't trust TurboTax anymore

title: Do not use Amazon card bonus option.
content: I used the option the get my refund in the form of a bonus card to use on Amazon; and cash to my bank account. IRS paid the Turbo partner (TPG) . Intuit and TPG have been unable to tell me what happened to my bonus card and cash refund. I'm out over $527 refund this year.

title: Mac download
content: Terrible interface and it did not come with State section as promised. I had to call TurboTax and wait on hold for an extraordinarily long time to get it. The person I talked to clearly had not used the product before and it took a while before he understood the problem - he kept telling my my issue was that I couldn't file my state taxes for free, when I clearly told him (repeatedly) that I wasn't even to that point - I couldn't enter in my state data. In the end, I am not convinced that I got back more money than with TaxAct.com (which costs much less).

title: Crappy program
content: I initially put a Misc Income for my wife as some type of Business Income. Turbo Tax would not let me edit or delete it. The program kept on asking me to choose one of four forms that I received or sent to the IRS for it. No matter what I did, I could not change the entry. I spent over 1 and 1/2 hours trying to edit it but could not. I finally gave up and chose one of the four choices of "forms" that I had no idea what they were just to get out and submit my return. Never again with Turbo Tax.

title: TurboTax costly for 2014
content: I've used TurboTax for years with confidence & satisfaction but 2014 was a nightmare. All went well until I had difficulty filing and couldn't it get to print so I could mail it in. I could not reach help at Turbo Tax. I finally got some help to file from someone on the Internet who had the same problem. I had to call in a computer guru to get a print copy. This all resulted in it costing me over $200 to use TurboTax.

title: Not satisfied at all!
content: I was not as pleased with TurboTax this year as I have been in the past. There was a lot of problems where I was required to go into the document and enter items that I had entered earlier in the question part of the process. For some reason it did not save the answers or numbers that were input and during the re-check portion of the return I was asked to put the information again. I was not pleased at all this year. I have been using TurboTax for over 8 years now and this was the worst version yet.

title: Rip Off
content: 50% Price Increase, they are ripping you off. No Schedule E or Schedule C without paying their ransom. I buy Deluxe in good faith for many years and then this underhanded ploy.

title: The Turbo Tax people messed up a good thing this year
content: The Turbo Tax people messed up a good thing this year. When I went down the wrong path, while preparing my tax return, I was unable to back out as before. And at the conclusion when using error check I had to repeatedly correct errors before it would take. Once I completed everything it wouldn't let me file my normal way of just paying for the state on my credit card. I tried this for one hour. In frustration I decided to try Intuit's method and it went immediately so instead of paying the normal 19.99 I paid 19.99 plus 34.99, a complete rip off.

title: Bait and Switch?
content: I've used Turbo tax for years. Always been satisfied. This year, however, my tax situation changed, and when I bought the same version I always had bought, it didn't cover the tax situations I needed. These forms had always been included in prior years, but this year, they decided to make them an "upgrade" option. Eventually, Turbo Tax realized their foo-paah, and gave me a free upgrade to cover my needs. Next year, I think I'll use a professional tax preparer. Lot less aggravation, and a lot less work for me.

title: Do not buy TurboTax ever.
content: I've been using TT Deluxe since 2008 and this time they silently dropped the Schedule D - Capital Gain & Loss without any notice. If there's an explanation with price increase notice, I should've bought it no matter what because of TT's product quality. I ended up upgrading to Premium during the tax prep which is very annoying and I feel deceived & ripped off. Will go back to TaxCut next year which is more reliable, trust-worthy and have honest business mind-set. I am not going to recommend TT to anyone around me.

title: What a mess!
content: Worried that my information from last year will not transfer to 2014 properly due to the cuts in functionality. This will require extra scrutiny on my part thus taking more of my time. Thanks for the heartburn Intuit! Hopeful that I can get the forms/upgrade I need without any hassle.

title: Software not as adverstised!
content: The stars in this review are all to do with the changes that Intuit Turbo Tax has put in place for 2014 tax software. 1- Advertise that it is free and then add a charge to file... 2- force your loyal customers to find out why this is not the same product for the past years. My advice to intuit is take your feedback seriously. If, you are going to surprise your customer this is what you should NOT be doing. If, you want customer loyalty this is NOT the type of experience that will keep customers returning.

title: An additional angle to this debacle. The IRS naturally ...
content: An additional angle to this debacle. The IRS naturally wants people to e-file -- it saves the IRS from having to use OCR to scan paper forms, a labor-intensive and error-prone process. Now, some filers will soldier on using Deluxe, manually completing forms for Schedule C, D, and/or E. They will be forced to file by postal mail and will be a major pain to IRS offices that have to input all this data. The IRS will have to devote more resources just to handle the same amount of information. Mistakes will be made, returns garbled, correspondence triggered, refunds delayed. Your taxes and mine pay for that. This situation adds another layer of irony to the TT saga, the company that lobbied the government to not (I repeat, not) simplify the tax filing process. I've been using Turbo Tax since there was a Turbo Tax. Never thought it would happen, but I'm jumping ship.

title: Two Stars
content: Ripoff- Have to buy 'Premium' to E-file Schedule D. (Goodbye Turbotax hello HR Block or TaxAct)

title: Going, going....
content: ...GONE!!! Like many, I've been using TurboTax for as long as I can remember (20 years, give or take). Now that they've decided to raise their price by 60% I'm using H&R Block's software for the first time (moving from the Deluxe version to a version that will properly do a Schedule C would have cost me 60% more). Not sure what they expected, but if I raised my prices by that amount in my business I'd have no clients left...my hunch is that TurboTax has lost a slew of loyal customers. They'll likely come to their senses for next year, but if I like H&R Block's product enough, I'll just stick with it. The old saying is that it's much easier to keep your existing customers than to get new ones...good luck with that one Intuit.

title: Be Your Own Accountant
content: Turbo Tax is a program that assists the tax payer so thoroughly that it is a pleasure to do taxes. It not only take the information you have on hand, but also asks you about many items and situations that might be extra income or deductions. I feel 100% confident doing my taxes with Turbo Tax. I have been doing so for the past 8 years and have never had a problem.

title: There was an error in my order. I wanted ...
content: There was an error in my order. I wanted to order the 2012 edition of the Turbo Tax Deluxe and downloaded it. It was exactly what I wanted and provided the information that I needed. The problem was with the billing that I received for both the 2102 version and the 2014 version. I did not download the 2014 as I purchased that version locally from COSCO when I filled out my 2104 tax return. If the 2014 was ordered it was an error on my part and was not downloaded and therefore not used. I would appreciate your removal of the billing for the 2014 version and bill me only for the 2012 version. Thank You Very Much, Monte Allred mallred@sbcglobal.net

title: Waste of money and time. Go to the pros
content: Too expensive and too many problems. Spent just as much money to file a state and federal tax return as it would cost an accountant to do it for me. On top of that, they allowed themselves to be hacked, and so my state decided not to accept any more returns filed with Turbo Tax software. Thanks for nothing Turbo Tax. You have been a huge disappointment. Next year I'll hire an accountant.

title: I'm frustrated and disappointed that a company I've trusted for years made changes ...
content: I'm frustrated and disappointed that a company I've trusted for years made changes to their product that required me to buy a more expensive version of a program that I've used for years. I was able to get the "free" upgrade to premier version, but I ended up on the phone for over 90 minutes just to get a code for that change. I had to call a second time so that I could e-file and use my credit card. That took another hour of my time. A great product in past years is a complete wreck this year.

title: NO FREE UPGRADE INCLUDED!!
content: I purchased this because even with the bad reviews it said there would be a free upgrade to premier if we used the desktop version last year. NOT TRUE!!! I'm pissed I waited until tonight, but don't be fooled- there is NO FREE UPGRADE in it!!

title: In the past your programs had been great. However
content: In the past your programs had been great. However, the deluxe this year 2014, compared to deluxe 2013, would not allow me to file K-1, form 1065, When attempting to record the info. for the 1065, I was advised to buy the premier in order to file the form 1065. I feel this was a rip off by TurboTax in order to get me to buy an additional program. Why can you not be upfront and and advise that the Deluxe will not allow you to file K-1, form 1065. Next year I will not buy your program.

title: Easy, Functional, and Mostly Harmless
content: Ehhh, its Turbo Tax. Hard to get excited about anything pertaining to my #$%^2& Federal Taxes. Works well, does what it should, I guess. Our tax returns are VERY simple. No tricky deductions, expenses, investments, etc. If I were a tad less lazy I'd just do our taxes with a pencil and printed forms. Did it for many many years. Could probably do with the Basic Version next time. Still a bit POed that my 2012 Turbo Tax return later got hammered with an additional demand from Uncle Sam for another $1700+ that Turbo Tax failed to detect, and the IRS letter so totally obscured with gibberish explanations that I just gave up and sent them a check.

title: I was aware of the TurboTax change and I read ...
content: I was aware of the TurboTax change and I read something that said after February 7, you would not be charged if you were forced to upgrade to Premier. I was doing my taxes last night (March 4) and loaded all the updates to TurboTax Deluxe. I have rental income so I need Schedule E. When I came to that part of the return I had to spend $31.65 to upgrade to Premier. Apparently I can get a $25 rebate on this? My past experiences with Intuit is it is a large company that doesn't listen to their customers!

title: Cost not transparent
content: I downloaded this for 39.99. Very disappointed and surprised when to efile the first state was 24.99. Free doesn't include efile. And then when I went to finish my second state it cost another 39.99 plus another 24.99 to efile it. Meanwhile I had done a free federal for my mother at H&R block and to process her state and efile it cost ONLY 10! I wil be rethinking my choices next year.

title: Bye bye TurboTax
content: I have been using TurboTax since it was Chip Soft software. Over the years, there have been times that they have made changes that I did not like, but this year clenched it. I am finished, management did a very poor job of deciding to screw their loyal customers. Their attempt to make it right is too little too late. Hope it was worth it guys, there are other good options at an affordable price.

title: Lost confidence
content: I have used turbo tax for several years and have been satisfied until this year. News that you had been hacked and info maybe comprommized was received in the middle of my return, I emailed you with my concern, no response. I never received confirmation that the fed return was accepted. The program shows that both fed and state were accepted. I have assumed that program is correct but I have lost confidence in your program. I will not be using you in the future!

title: Forced to efile state return and send $$ to Intuit
content: Filing state (MA) version only available is E-File. There are no options to file by Mail if you select E-File for Federal. So no matter what Intuit get your $24.99. I understand I can print forms manually, google where to send it etc.. but I can do âeverythingâ by hand. I use TurboTax for years to save time. I guess itâs time to try competitors.

title: So Long Turbotax
content: Good Bye Turbotax! I too have been a loyal customer for many years, and are shocked about the change in their software to no longer support Schedule D in the deluxe version. Time to switch to H&R Block since they support what I need in tax software at a much lower price.

title: but they have lost my business for good.
content: TurboTax may have finally corrected the problem, but the fact that it took months of angry customer complaints and lost business for TurboTax to act led me to change to H&R BLOCK's deluxe tax software, at a much lower price. I used TurboTax software since at least a s far back as 1997, but they have lost my business for good.

title: Software glitch
content: I usually love using turbo tax every year since it makes tax preparation so easy. This year I got stuck in a computer glitch or loop when I needed to amend my taxes after I had filed them and they were accepted. After looking on their FAQ pages I noticed that others had the same problem. it said I had 1 error but then I could never get information about what the error was. I am giving Turbo Tax some time to debug their program before I try again.

title: Careful, this is not the same product that was ...
content: Careful, this is not the same product that was offered in the Turbo Tax Deluxe 2013 edition. Intuit has removed the forms to report self-employment income and expenses from the Deluxe edition. My daughter made only a couple thousand dollars this year in a freelance job for a non-profit, but Intuit now wants her to buy the business edition for $99. Not worth the cost. She filed on paper.

title: I have used TurboTax since 1994. I have been ...
content: I have used TurboTax since 1994. I have been purchasing TT Basic forever. This year TT Basic could not do the simple stuff, therefore I bought the Deluxe. Well, I started to enter my capital gains and Deluxe would not allow me to do it. I just sold a few shares of stock and it would not let me enter it. It said I had to purchase Premier!!! In one year I had to go from Basic to Premier! You are kidding me! Intuit has goofed again!

title: Don't bother
content: So, WTF? I buy it for $59, and spend money to process my return electronically. and the TV comes on advertising $0 to file. F that, don't buy turbo tax, go with HR block, buy something else. Too bad I have to give it a full star. You suck turbo tax.

title: Same cost as 2013 but without the ability to prepare ...
content: Same cost as 2013 but without the ability to prepare Sch D and E. I will use Tax Cut for 2014

title: No More!!
content: I have been a happy Turbotax customer since 1998. I was about to download it this year and noticed the low star rating. After reading many comments I will NOT be purchasing this product. If Intuit wants to play games with its customers they will LOOSE! I was expecting to have the SAME product as I had last year!! A product that would handle our tax situation relatively painlessly. If the product was changed it should have been called something else. The stupidity of Intuits leadership is amazing! The have shot themselves in the foot with a very poor decision. If they had wanted more money they should have raised the price and been forthright. H&R Block here I come...

title: Did not perform as advertised
content: The state portion of the package I purchased did not allow me to file my state return. I contacted Turbo Tax and they felt the file I received was not a complete or official copy, but were unable to verify that. I ended up having to file my state return using state forms and their filing system.

title: It is easy and always accurate
content: I have used Turbo Tax for years. First the business and professional version since we had a business, and this year the deluxe version since we have retired and no longer have a business. It is easy and always accurate. I would appreciate it if it included state electronic filing as well as federal but you can't have everything you want. I like the fact that if something is not usual, it asks you to double check during the final phase of the check up.

title: I have used turbo tax for several years however the ...
content: I have used turbo tax for several years however the changes this year made me a future user of a different tax cd. I don't know what you were thinking changing everything, when I purchased this I already knew there were problems but I figured it was t worth the hassle changing to HR Block but I was wrong next year they get my business!

title: an if you are are like us and one person works in another state
content: I have used Turbo Tax for many Many years, but I think it is absurd to pay $50 for the disk, then you have to pay $19.99 to file your taxes on top of that, an if you are are like us and one person works in another state, then you have to pay an additional $39.95 to get a second state!!! I will no longer be using Turbo tax... I might as well pay a professional to do ours or go to the FREE Sites....

title: Turbo Tax is Turning into a SCAM!!! I mean IT!!!
content: Turbo tax really upset me this year. I'll probably go with H&R BLOCK next year. True they got the form thing right but only because they were put under pressure. Then I went and tried to e-file the State return for $24 bucks and it kept rejecting it (with a "error message") unless I paid an added $34 to have the $24 cost taken out of my refund, This is A CLEAR TURBO TAX SCAM!!!! I bet they would lose in court on this one. So I just mailed it for free. Turbo Tax I hope you feel it next year with customers leaving.

title: Turbo Tax is beginning to take advantage of their customers ...
content: Turbo Tax is beginning to take advantage of their customers. They no longer provide a free state efile; the verbiage on the package attempts to make customers think that the efile is still free. Also, they now charge $39.95 for a second state. This eliminates any savings whatsoever, as one could purchase the federal/state for the same price. To me not being deceptive is huge. I am ready to switch to another company after 10 plus years of using Turbo Tax.

title: Loved it. This year however was a nightmare for ...
content: I've used TurboTax for the past 3 years without a hitch. Loved it. This year however was a nightmare for me. I finally got the issue resolved, but that was after 5 hours (no kidding) on the phone with customer service. All the representatives were very helpful and friendly, but could not figure out the problem. It took a family member! Not sure if I will be using Turbo next year. For sure not unless I hear they have their problems resolved.

title: Charges to file State
content: I purchased on Amazon and my order states I can file up to 5 federal and 1 state free but in the end it tries to charge me for my state.

title: Netflix 2.0 do we never learn..
content: I ordered TT Deluxe just like I have for the past 10 years. Then I found out they took away features to force people to buy Premier, now I have to return it!!! This change is just plain wrong so I'm switching to H&R and taking advantage of their FREE down load to all of us who purchased deluxe and are upset with the change. It will even import you TT info from last year. I'm also replacing Quicken which I've used for 20 years. Just raise the price of deluxe a few bucks don't make me buy a higher trim...Look how that worked out for GM. I expect there is an intuit decision maker on the way out the door. Hey I have this great idea that will make us lots of money.

title: Doubled Price. Then wanted to charge $35. 00 ...
content: Doubled Price. Then wanted to charge $35.00 to file State Taxes, which they advertise as "free" This is how they justified doubling the price. I called for a tax question and I got a recording to call back after April 15th. What a joke! I will never purchase this again!

title: Disappointed and angry
content: Dear Intuit, As I have done for years, I purchased this software to complete my taxes. Much to my surprise, as I was entering my information, I needed to purchase two upgrades. I am a CPA. This change in software was never communicated prior to the software release. I read your VP's responses. Yes, after taking additional time to download and pay for the upgrades, I could take more time and call Intuit and talk to one of your support people. However, if you have any chance of retaining me as a customer (I also purchase Quicken and QuickBooks every year), you may want to consider just automatically crediting my account for the amount I paid for the upgrades. Please do the same for any other customer who has paid for the upgrades. You have created a publicity nightmare for yourselves and a gesture of goodwill would be appreciated.

title: Big problems this year.
content: No more! I filed and had to pay extra for all three state filings adding up to about $84.00 extra $$$. Then the federal and state would not accept my returns, so I had to mail them in. Something very wrong with this. Never had any trouble before. For all the cash I spent buying the software and paying to file I will just try different or an accountant next year.

title: You suck. Already signed up with H&R Block for next ...
content: You suck. Already signed up with H&R Block for next year, will not ever buy another TurdboTax product again. You don't change your software that dramatically and jack up the price without telling us before we buy your product, you jerked me around and ripped me off! I spent $40 for the deluxe that had everything I have ever needed in the past and then make me buy the $80 software just to file my taxes, that's $120.00, that is dishonest.

title: wHAT
content: The 2014 Turbo Tax program is the worse ever. Loaded it on my desktop and it would not work at all. Loaded it on lap top and it finally worked for one filing but on the other filing it would not go through as it required I buy the State filing program for $ 39.99. Tried returning it to Wal Mart where I purchased it and they would not take it back. Tell me why program does not update and why I should continue with Turbo Tax!!!!!!!!!!!

title: Turbo Tax Failure
content: I have used Turbo Tax successfully for years, but i was very displeased this year when I had to make an additional purchase of Turbo Tax Premier merely to prepare and file Schedule D. That was a sneaky trick to change the product without notification, and I did not appreciate having to spend the extra money. P.S. I was a professional employee of IRS for 30 years, so I am far from a tax novice.

title: It Did Not Work For Me This Year
content: I have utilized Turbo Tax for the past several years without complaint. This year the child dependent care credit was not working so I spent a large amount of time with them on the phone and they did not resolve the issue. They then continued to send me multiple emails saying the "Case is Closed" and wanting me to fill out surveys about my experience. After about a couple of weeks with no resolve, I went to Best Buy and bought H & R Block's Premium software. They price-matched Amazon and I was able to finish my returns swiftly. My only complaint with H & R Block was they could not import my E*Trade account easily, so I had to figure that out myself - but it is probably better for me to learn that in the long run anyway. I would recommend H & R Block this year over Turbo Tax, maybe next year Turbo Tax will be better. I am disappointed in their customer service since I have bought their product many times before.

title: Watch Out!
content: Paid for and downloaded the software. Price included a Federal and a State. At the last minute they tried to hoodwink me into paying (again) for some service. Called and they told me what to do to avoid the charge, but it seemed like a scam!

title: this was not an easy download. I have what I want
content: I read the reviews before I downloaded this product. I was reassured that the TurboTax Deluxe would be upgraded to Premier, so I purchased it. When it downloaded, I saw that it was Deluxe. I called Amazon and they assured my that Intuit would automatically upgrade it within the program. I tried the upgrade option but it didn't work. I called Intuit. Later, Intuit returned my call and my software was "unlocked" when I entered the code he gave me. Folks, this was not an easy download. I have what I want, but it took hours.

title: Very disappointed...
content: I am very disappointed that Turbo Tax raised its prices on this software this year. I under stand that prices do go up a few dollars from year to year but this increase was more than just a few dollars and to top it off many of the Schedules needed to file were no longer available on the Basic version. Really? Pay more to get less. Not happy at all. I will be looking at different software options next year.

title: This year "basic" covered only 1040EZ which is useless. I had to buy Turbo tax deluxe for ...
content: Company has gotten very greedy. I used Turbo tax basic for years. Always paid about 20 dollars. This year "basic" covered only 1040EZ which is useless. I had to buy Turbo tax deluxe for about triple what I usually pay. To add insult to injury, I had a capital gain for the 2014 year and your worthless program would not complete the return unless I "upgraded" the software. I'm looking at other tax software for next year.

title: OK at first, then I had to upgrade for ...
content: OK at first, then I had to upgrade for another feature. Then I had to go to a whole new version to do investment tax reporting. I ended up spending about $80. for turboTax and a lot more complexity. I hope I'm not audited. I think there are hidden errors in my return.

title: Unnecessary Cost Involved
content: This software requires too much time to create the tax return and costs too much to get state returns and too much for filing fees. There are several other sites where you can do it for free or for a much lower fee. Very unimpressed and will not use it again after using it for years. After paying for software in the $50's and then paying other costs, it costed about $148 to file returns. Ridiculous!

title: Look else where if your E-filing Wisconsin State return
content: I have used Turbotax for about 5 years but after using this year 2014 return it will be my last. When filing my State return it would not support a simple form CS 529 contributions, there software say's I have to file with a paper return. Are you kidding me!!! for the money I paid for this product now I can't even e-file. Buy something else.

title: I am very very disappointed with TurboTax 2014
content: I am very very disappointed with TurboTax 2014. I have been a loyal customer for many years, so when they pulled some of the Schedules that I needed, I was furious. What good does it do to be loyal to them? I called their customer service and complained bitterly, and was offered to upgrade for $30.00 with a $25.00 rebate. That's all fine and dandy, but what is to stop them from doing the same thing in the future? I'll really have to watch it and read the specs carefully in the future to make sure they don't do this again.

title: You don't do things like this to long term satisfied customers
content: I've used Turbo Tax for at least 20 years to prepare my personal tax return, but after this year's bait and switch with not being able to prepare my return with the version I've been buying for years, I will try another software next year. I've heard after the uproar they've changed they ended up changing this, but too little, too late for me. You don't do things like this to long term satisfied customers.

title: this year was the worst tax times in using turbotax
content: this year was the worst tax times in using turbotax, the fact that not knowig about the changing to the cd and to hear about them on tv was bad my cd was defected no state but yes there is a but , i was able to call and get help from Sara and was able to download and finnish my taxes. thanks Sara and TurboTax for a job well done!!!!!!!!!!!!

title: it's just fine. After paying $30 for the program itself
content: The program is what is is: a do-it-yourself tax program. For that, it's just fine. After paying $30 for the program itself, I resented having to pay an additional $20 to e-file my state return. To add insult to injury, they offered to deduct that fee from my refund...for an ADDITIONAL fee of $35! I'm trying H&R Block software next year.

title: 2014 year fu#% up
content: I used the SAME computer last (5) years with Turbo. Worked perfect last (4). But for 2014 return, my $60 Deluxe could NOT recognize any PAST RETURNS. (Fu@* Obamma's idiotic health plan) and, after having to enter ALL INFO MANUALLY, it forgot to ask me "Estimated Payments" and I had to amend my return. I sent a question to Turbo, which was NEVER ANSWERED (from India, I suppose) Next year?? I go somewhere else.

title: I think that is poor business behavior
content: You buy the program. Then after you have filled out everything, you find out that to FILE the tax return electronically (which costs them NOTHING to do), they charge you $24.99 to actually file the return. I think that is poor business behavior. Lousy business practice. I am repulsed!

title: Return as not usable.
content: Based on store clerk information, I purchased the Elite product. However in attempting to use It, I found that it could not address my house sale in fy 2014. Other aspects of the product seem to be usable however the product purchased is not what is required.

title: ... have used this product for yrs and have always loved it for its ease
content: I have used this product for yrs and have always loved it for its ease. However when I heard you were going to do away with the forms for capital gains and dividens I was highly upset; I had already purchased the deluxe edition, then recevied a email saying the forms were not available. Thank you for adding them in the updates. However if next yr I have to buy the updated ver. for 89.00 I may have to reconsider.

title: beware
content: I bought home deluxe just as I have for the last couple of years.my income is the same but because turbo tax changed what they put in home deluxe it told me I needed to upgade online and it would only cost me $40 more.i threw it in the trash and went and got h&r block sofeware.They offered me a $25 rebate but wanted $40 to upgrade for the same thing the software had in in for the last few years.

title: Sneaky!
content: I have used Deluxe for years and was shocked that I no longer have schedules C & D and have to pay for an upgrade. This will end up costing me more. There was no warning. Looks like different software next year!

title: TurboTax has been great over the years
content: TurboTax has been great over the years. But this year's edition has missing components. Have to be on the phone with TurboTax for a long time to get the component installed without having to pay extra. TurboTax knew there were missing components but they want you to pay extra for it, which makes no sense.

title: Last year it took an amended tax form and 3 ...
content: Last year it took an amended tax form and 3 hours on the phone to correct an application problem with Turbo Tax and this year it took a call to service to correct a simple Sign in error to correct a Turbo Tax problem. They are going in the wrong direction even with their insincere apology to many of their customers earlier this year. Makes you think it might be time to look at a different vendor ?

title: Not so rosey with TaxAct either
content: I had used Turbotax ever since I switched from paper forms, at least 10 years. I'm done. This company had been implementing price increases far above inflation for years, and that wasn't good enough. I was forced from standard to deluxe several years ago, which I could understand. Now they have made a greed play far beyond the pale that is beyond comprehension. Even with the capitulating this year, they are making no bones about sticking it to us next year and beyond. That is not why I'm writing. I'm writing to warn about Tax Act. They are turning out to be just as devious. The very first step in TaxAct is to import a previous PDF to fill in your basic info. This does not even try to import before stating: The TaxAct pdf import function is down for maintenance. It has been like this for the entire ten days since I wasted $25 on their software. A nice windfall for them, but I have learned to stay far away from them now too. Who can trust a software that has broken server connections at the first step? Next up: H&R block.

title: Need help with refund?
content: Program will load. How do I get a refund?

title: I am amazed that Intuit executives made this forced upgrade decision
content: The corporate greed decision to gouge customers by removing schedule D is astonishing. I will move on to H&RB just as a matter of principle. I am amazed that Intuit executives made this forced upgrade decision. Wow!

title: Watch out. Intuit forces you to upgrade to use ...
content: Watch out. Intuit forces you to upgrade to use Schedule B or E. Nondiscounted upgrade. If your stuck with TurboTax check what you need first. After decades of Intuit products, no more for me.

title: I used Turbo Tax Premere last year and it didn't help with investment tax information any better than Delux
content: In the past, Turbo Tax allowed a person to do investment taxes with Delux. I used Turbo Tax Premere last year and it didn't help with investment tax information any better than Delux. This year I bought Turbo Tax Delux and it would not allow mw to enter 1099 B information at all. I had to upgrade to Premere for $32. I have been using Turbo Tax for 13 years now. It is time to find another tax preperation program!

title: I hate the additional charge for a state return
content: TurboTax does what I expect it to do, but every year I feel screwed. Why do I have to pay additional for a state return? Charge me when I do the initial purchase and I'm happy. This may be the last year I use it, just because of the state tax charge.

title: Be Warned!!! Deluxe won't allow rental income/expenses ...
content: Be Warned!!! Deluxe won't allow rental income/expenses to be entered!! K-1's aren't supported either. You'll need to upgrade to Premier. ;( Can't wait until a decent cloud based services gets in this game.

title: Complete Rip Off
content: No Schedules C, D, or E? Turbotax suddenly stopped including these. I only have $14 of investment income, and now I have to pay $30 to get this included in my taxes? It's H&R Block for me from now on.

title: I'm really upset-- They do standard taxes- but when I run into a small problem like a kid and I both filing for her deduction- .
content: First time I had problems with Turbotax-- they never led me to the bailey settlement even though they knew I was a previous Federal employee- the W-2 is very obvious--.. This is for NC only-- but I had to revise 4 years worth of filings and then saved about $8000..I could not go back further and save more.. Then- last week --a foster child we have decided she would claim herself on taxes- (in High School) and for the $33 she got back-- - she messed up my deduction- so I thought turbotax could handle this-- they sure did- they said since it rejected-- I would have to file by mail .. AND I had just paid them the $25 or so to file online... I'm really upset-- They do standard taxes- but when I run into a small problem like a kid and I both filing for her deduction- (me paying 99.5% of her costs) --and me being rejected-- because she filed first-- they kick me to the curb. I have used them maybe 10 years- I am always amazed by what they don't do for their millions of dollars.. Sure it is hard difficult -- but they are being paid to do everything we need for taxes-- She still would get her $33 back - we both used Turbotax but she used the EZ-- and now I am mailing- and hoping to get money back someday-- even my $25 from Turbotax...

title: but the reason why I feel this product deserves 1 star is because of the amount of time I wasted before discovering TurboTax's r
content: I made it two-thirds of the way through my return before realizing that I was out of luck and would have to pay extortionate prices to file the same return I did last year. The tax preparation software market does not support TurboTax's new pricing scheme at all, but the reason why I feel this product deserves 1 star is because of the amount of time I wasted before discovering TurboTax's reduced functionality. How about a pop-up, guys? Oh, and bearish on INTU, lol.

title: I opted to receive part of my refund in the ...
content: I opted to receive part of my refund in the form of an Amazon gift card. On Feb 24 I received an email stating that I should receive an email with the code from Amazon in 1-2 business days. It is now Mar 7 and I have still not received it. The first phone call I made with the number that was provided got forwarded to a dead end . . .

title: Missing features from Deluxe.
content: Dropping basic features that were in previous version of Deluxe over the years and moving features to Premier is very poor form. Long time Turbo Tax user but will consider other options for the future.

title: disappointed
content: I thought it was kinda easy to use. Some of it was confusing and frustrated me a bit. I ended up owing money. I thought I had used turbo tax correctly and my husband said go h and r block just to get a second look. I ended up getting money back. It frustrated me a lot that I owed money with turbo tax. next time I will just stick with h and r block.

title: I do not believe this product gives consumers the maximum ...
content: I do not believe this product gives consumers the maximum refund. I had to really search through the program to find certain credits, for example, church contributions. I have yet to find the employment search credit I should have received. I have been using this product for years; however, I am certain I will be seeking the help of a professional next year.

title: NO ONE WILL ANSWER THE PHONE AT TURBO TAX!
content: I also got caught in this mess with purchasing Turbo Tax for years and finding this version does not include investments. I was offered a free upgrade through the program, but it does not work! It offers a phone number that I have called on four separate occasions only to get put in a loop and being forced to listed to worn out horrible music. HORRIBLE customer service- you would think about all this customer backlash, they would answer the phone. I have used Turbo Tax the last 10 years, but would not recommend to anyone that needs to get in touch with customer service, because that does not exist. What a public relations nightmare. Goodbye Turbo Tax!

title: Totally hated! Used TurboTax many many years
content: Totally hated! Used TurboTax many many years. Recognized it that Intuit needs to make money and so I pay $5 dollars more each year. 2015 the price went up $10 and a whole bunch of essential forms were take away: feature reduction and price increase at the same time! And being sneaky about it. The "free upgrade"? Forget it! Tried to twice following step-by-step instruction on Intuit web site with no mention of the word free and $30 upgrade fee messages all over. I doubt I will the $25 dollar back as Intuit also promise if you do not the free upgrade. Goodbye Intuit!

title: No state tax needs to be stated plainly on the cover. Reduced price is deceptive!
content: The version I purchased did not include the State return. I did not realize this. I then had to purchase the add on which was 40 some odd dollars. I was very unhappy about this as they still wanted another 10 bucks to electronically file the state. I will be looking at other options next year even though I have used Turbo tax for years. I thought it was a rip. You asked, so I told you.

title: Strongly disappointed with Intuit TurboTax offerings!
content: As a long-time user of Turbo-Tax (this would have been 21 years!), I find it appalling that Intuit has crippled the current versions of the sofware, and even an upgrade to the higher-priced version won't restore all the functionality that existed in each version from last year. Mr. Meighan, VP, TurboTax, has stated (on 01/31/2015 - as a response to other highly dissatisfied (ex-) customers) that for next year, they promise to restore the software (versions) to their previous functionality. The proof, as they say, will be in the pudding. If they do restore TT Deluxe, for example, but decide to charge more that $50US, then I highly doubt I will be returning as a customer. I will be looking at other software this year. Other reviewers are giving glowing reviews for H&R, and I will be using them this year. Good luck, Intuit, on rebuilding the trust that you broke for tax year 2014. Regards

title: I used turbo tax to try to file my taxes ...
content: I used turbo tax to try to file my taxes. I started them, when I went back to finish them the program updated and I was never able to get back into the program again. I called TurboTax support three times, and after spending hours on the phone they never resolved the problem, and would not give me my money back. I have used Turbo Tax for years, but will never again.

title: The program works fine, but what TurboTax did was make it worthless ...
content: The program works fine, but what TurboTax did was make it worthless for any investments that you might have sold. Consequently, what worked fine last year no longer works and they force you to upgrade to TurboTax Premier online to finish your taxes at a non-reducible cost, so you end up spending more than ever before. This will be the last time I ever buy TurboTax. H&R Block get ready.

title: Have been using TurboTax for 5 years now and I'm ...
content: Have been using TurboTax for 5 years now and I'm absolutely thrilled with the ease in completing my return. Each year, TurboTax scans my computer for last years return and automatically fills in all the necessary personal information so that I don't have to repeat it.

title: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY
content: I wish I could give this a ZERO. I'm halfway through and they already have required me to purchase TWO additional upgrades... then I come back to finish 4 days later and ALL the info is GONE. They want me to start over! What a pile of BS. Try to call the company and you spend HOURS on hold. I will never buy this product again. They should ashamed! DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY

title: Greedy Intuit
content: Intuit deserves every bit of the negative publicity and consumer outrage that it's been getting. Removing features from Deluxe and forcing consumers to upgrade is unconscionable greed. Flat out gouging. And I don't believe for one instant that they've learned any lessons about respecting their customers; they grossly over-reached and got caught, that's all. They're already looking for other, more devious methods of getting into our pockets. I'm another long-time user of TT that will never give them another penny.

title: I think it is the best thing I have used my computer for to date
content: I think it is the best thing I have used my computer for to date..The improvments that have come out since II started using TurboTax are great and every year it gets better.........Keep up the good work......... PS I have been telling all my friends about how easy it is to do taxes with TurboTax..

title: It wasn't broke but they had to fix it
content: i have been using this program for seven or eight years with no issues. This year they managed to screw up everything. I got through my tax forms but had a problem filing my state return online so I called the customer service number. I was on the phone for more than two hours and the issue wasn't resolved - i ended up having to mail the state return.

title: TURBOTAX CAN'T PRINT THUS i GIVE IT A ** STAR RATING OF A POSSIBLE 5.
content: I have used TurboTax for the past many years and have been quite satisfied with its performance--even this year, up to a point--and that is I have yet to get a printed copy of my 2014 tax return--I tried and tried with TurboTax's program to get one. All I got was "programming" language and from I figured I needed Adobe to accomplish publishing by tax return--so I bough it at a cost to me of approx $168.00. Still nothing and except for this printing problem I am very satisfied with TurboTax. Will I go with you folks again next year--probably not! IT COST ME TOO MUCH TO NOT EVEN GET A PRINTOUT

title: had to back to hard copy mailing
content: It didnot work for me this year because of an error in your system. I had to use the mail in to make sure my tax was sent now. Also because of the error, i had to pay for mail in which cost me 25.95. I would be happier if got a rebate on that cost. I still gave you a 2 rating because the rest of TTAX I love.

title: Amended forms are a problem
content: I received a 1099DIV after I had filed electronically. Worked on the amended return, then received a 1099B on Feb 20th and entered it on the amended return. This messed up the 1040V for Federal Taxes and made my Oregon State Forms incorrect. I tried to email a question and never received a reply. I have used Turbo Tax for many years, but now I question future accuracy.

title: Easy and very informative
content: Easy and very informative. Great feeling of confidence that taxes are filed correctly. Love the e-file and that tax return is directly deposited into account. Tried H&R block this as it was new to me. After doing my taxes once with H&R and then with Turbo Tax, I received a higher return with Turbo. I am sold, again for the 7th year in a row.

title: I used turbo tax for the first time without the ...
content: I used turbo tax for the first time without the assistance of my father. I hope I did my taxes correctly. But turbo tax found no errors on the federal or state. And they were accepted so with that said I must have done them correctly. There were questions I had trouble understandng with out my father here to ask for help. But I will use the program again.

title: Never Again!
content: I will never use this software again. I had to upgrade because the basic program would not download the updates. It claims free e-file until you use a credit card. Then they charge you an extra 50 bucks! Never again!

title: Disappointed !
content: I have been used Deluxe for over 10 years HOWEVER I am very disappointed with Turbo Tax this year.

title: Turbo Tax made a large mistake on my Federal Form ...
content: Turbo Tax made a large mistake on my Federal Form that raised my actual return by over 2 thousand dollars! The IRS corrected it, and direct deposited the adjusted amount to my checking account. Line 14A showed almost all of my SS amount as being "non-taxable"! The amount entered as "taxable", was the amount deducted by the IRS for Fed Witholding!

title: for the federal return it was great. I had to file my state on paper ...
