content: for the federal return it was great.I had to file my state on paper because I have federal pensions which some of my pension is not taxed and turbo tax would not allow me to use the correct percentage amounts since I have splits in my service. It would take off more percentages than I was entitled too and I tried to get help with it but it was useless.

title: Cant recommend TT anymore.
content: Cant recommend TT anymore. Gonna give Taxact a try, [...]

title: The software worked OK but when I e-filed the federal ...
content: The software worked OK but when I e-filed the federal form, it was rejected. TurboTax knew they were having a problem but they don't give any help to rectify the problem. It is left to you to figure out what forms you need to mail into the IRS. I have been a TurboTax customer for several years but they really dropped the ball this year!!!!

title: Turbo Tax goes down the drain
content: I have been using Turbo Tax for about 20 years or more and this is the worse product they have ever produced. I had problems with using the program and tried all day long for two days and could not get in touch with anyone. I finally gave up and sent my taxes without answers to my questions. Next year I will use a different program.

title: Mediocre at best--may have to go back to manual
content: flaw on the program for SS withholding as it won't accept the amount in full with cents, have to round down to the dollar.........also, they charge extra to file states and hidden fees. I wouldn't use a program, but for it saving the info from the year before. There's got to be a cheaper and less bug ridden program than Turbo Tax. Sigh

title: Used to be 4 star
content: Very good tax program in past years, except that this year they eliminated several important features that I rely on and can't complete my tax return(dividends, schedule C for consulting etc). They say that next year I will have to pay 50% more for a premium version. Think I will try H&R Block next year. Pretty shoddy treatment for a long time customer.

title: could not amend return
content: I have used turbo tax for a number of years but this year I needed to amend my return and although the taxes had been accepted by the IRS turbo tax would not let me amend the return, It stated that the tax had to be accepted by IRS before I could amend. There was no way I could override this therefore I have been unable to amend the return.

title: I think it was \just unbelievable that TurboTax took out ...
content: I think it was \just unbelievable that TurboTax took out Sch D,F.C,etc from this program without any warning. I didn't see any decent offer to loyal Turbotax users to make up for this..Oh the mighty buck rules again requiring us to purcahse the more expensive " Home and Business". Shame on you. I will be using a new tax software next year

title: Thanks for the reviews!
content: I've been using TurboTax Deluxe forever, so when I was at Sams Club yesterday and saw it for $39, I wanted to buy it. They were out-of-stock, so I couldn't. Today I'm reading all the reviews on Amazon -- and now I am GLAD that I didn't buy this yesterday. This version, since it will no support submitting Schedule D electronically, will no longer meet my needs. I'll be trying H&R Block software this year, for the first time ever.

title: The new TurboTax was inferior to previous editions.
content: The new TurboTax was inferior to previous editions. It was difficult to use and a simple 1040 and schedules were not available before printing. After many years of using TurboTax I will consider using another product next year.

title: What's the deal! ?:; $#
content: I've used turbo tax for years with nothing but 5 stars. This year however has been a joke! I've been trying for more than 2 weeks to simply print my return. I'm relatively sure I'm not the 1st to rant about the problem, but honestly, get it fixed. I need to print and snail mail my state return before the 15th of April! !

title: One Star
content: Still had to pay for State Filing.

title: TurboTax screwed up this year.
content: TurboTax screwed up with this year's revision. I had to download three different versions to get what I used to get with TurboTax Deluxe. If next year's revision isn't similar to previous years, I will stop using it, after being a satisfied customer for over 20 years.

title: Deceitful Product Representation
content: Deluxe had always provided information for the Schedule C for small business. That was not provided this year. They should have done a better job of providing this information. I think I will switch to H & R Block next year since Turbo Tax is now scamming customers to get them to pay extra for upgrades that were originally a part of the package.

title: Did not automatically previously entered information
content: I was disappointed that Turbo tax did not automatically enter my military retirement in the (Ohio) state return and asked how much military retirement I received from the military. Ohio does not tax military retirement and it should have caught my error of not entering that amount at that point. Now I have to send in an amended State return.

title: The product is crippleware.
content: I have been a Turbotax customer for 15 years I have been frustrated with Intuit many times in the past for their indiscretions, but now they have complicated the purchase to a point that nobody knows what product to purchase and you don't find out until you have invested hours into inputting data that you have the wrong product at which point they ask you to pay them. My advice if you are not willing to buy the most expensive version they sell plus the state and maybe the business versions which could cost $300+ then just buy Tax Act or H&R Block for $15-$30.

title: Thank you for the warning. I, also, ...
content: Thank you for the warning. I, also, have been an 18 year user and will now change to H&R.

title: Good program not so good hidden costs
content: I was disappointed that I had spent $50 on the program just to have to spend another $20 just file my state taxes and another $40 to get my refund direct deposited. Like the program but it is costing too money just to file my taxes with turbo tax. This will be the last year I use turbo tax

title: I found it pretty simple and straight forward
content: When I was first introduced to this product more than 15 years ago, I found it pretty simple and straight forward. After years of investment, my tax return got complicated but it still covered all my need. Every year, as usual, I picked up one from Costco without paying attention to what was not included, because I believe it should look after the need of most of the tax payers. I did the same a week ago. This morning I happened to come across a few negative reviews on Best buy. Further research on Amazon confirms it is true. There are 393 negative reviews (1 star). Only 55 reviews have 5 stars. People are complaining the exclusion of all the schedules which are commonly needed by those who invest in fund and stock through IRA, 401K etc. This reminds me the similiar thing happened a few years back when Turbo-tax prevented people from installing the software in more than one computer. Even though, they may change their mind next year because of the drop in sale, there is no guarantee they will not think of something more outrageous in future. One thing I can think of is to prevent other software to access the data you created last year. By that time, it will be too late to quit. Since there are other choices in the market so It is about time to look elsewhere. BYE.

title: Turbo Taxed To The Max
content: The version I got did not include the State. I had to purchase the State separately. Yes, only one State. I ended up paying close to $90. for what I paid $54 for last year. That's a 66% raise for Turbo Tax. Well, they won't see me next year. You can fool me once....ONCE!

title: Horrible customer support at the time when you are ready ...
content: Very unhappy this year and I was not able to file my state electronically. Paid for the software CD version could not get support or help. Horrible customer support at the time when you are ready to file taxes. The issue with security will have me use a different software next year, even though I have been a loyal customer for many years.

title: Seriously?
content: I'm done with Turbotax. It's not the dollars it's the deceit. What will they remove next year? Google "switchtoblock@hrblock.com" and you'll find an offer to switch. Smart move on their part.

title: Pay for Software and then again to e:file
content: After paying for the software, you also have to pay to efile it and then later discover that they have been puttin out offers just to minimize their screw up in changing the product.....definitely will consider going with another software for next year.

title: Awful changes this year
content: I don't like that this year I can't efile my state return without my efiling my federal return. Also, the fact that I had to purchase "business" because I had securities that required to be entered is not acceptable. After purchasing it for many years, these new changes will ensure that I will not purchase it again.

title: I did not like the separation out of the Small Business forms
content: I did not like the separation out of the Small Business forms. It was to much of a hassle to get the upgrade after the taxes were already started and not cost efficient for the smallness of the business. Next year I will use something different to fit my needs if TurboTax has not put the forms back in the Deluxe software.

title: Piece of Crap
content: Each year I feel as if you strive to make turbo tax more and more user UNFRIENDLY!! This year it is with this B.S. of attempting to get us to accept an update, and your questioner won't go forth without accepting it. I finally just did my taxes straight onto forms. I think this is the LAST year I will purchase turbo tax products.

title: Worst instructions yet
content: Worst instructions yet, convoluted and often hidden. If I hadn't used Turbo for the past five years, I would have left a lot not filled. Uses last year's Turbo input, but very unclear about how to add and change. Just so much is ambiguous, which is dangerous. Looking for another program next year.

title: 2 thumbs down
content: TurboTax missed the boat this year. I've used the software for several years & multiple returns each year, but this is the last year I will use TurboTax. The program is much more awkward than previous years. Anyone suggest an alternative for next year?

title: Turbo Tax 2014
content: Disappointed. Have used Turbo-Tax since 2010, but they couldn't find my 2013 files, so I had to re-load everything. Plus, this year, I had to pay TT additionally for my rental properties listings. This NEVER happened before. And, of course electronic state filing was extra.

title: I am very disappointed with this product
content: I purchased the Marketplace Remanufactures Replacement HP 20 in the (3) packet. The cartridges didn't work very long. I ordered this product March 8, 2016. I'm now on the 3rd. cartridge and the others (2) only gave out a couple of prints. I am very disappointed with this product. I will not order from your establishment ever again and will let my friends know not to order. I started using the 3rd cartridge today, May 16. I will give you an update of the usage.

title: This year I had to pay for e-filing for a ...
content: This year I had to pay for e-filing for a third party bank to have funds transferred. In years past it's been typically direct without the third party. I will most likely use another software program next year that is again free.

title: Charges for state e-filing. First and LAST time user ...
content: Charges for state e-filing. First and LAST time user. I will spent time at INTUIT displays in the stores my wife shops at and make it my mission to let anybody and everybody looking at these products KNOWS. I should have returned this to the store as soon as I read about the identify theft and stolen refunds.

title: To bad they have to cause people all this grief over ...
content: The changes made to this product without telling people what was being done is nothing more than pure greed. Next year I will find another product and will not use Turbo Tax. They do the same thing Quicken. To bad they have to cause people all this grief over a few bucks.

title: No support
content: This year 2014 has been the worst year for me with TurboTax I have sent numerous E-Mails asking for help with no reply. I have used TurboTax for meany years. I will not use them again.

title: Cutting features is reprehensible.
content: I've been an Intuit customer since the early versions of Quicken DOS and Turbotax DOS and cutting out features for 2014 is reprehensible. You have now alienated tens of thousands of users and I will be recommending other products now and in the future.

title: Rip off
content: What a rip off. For what I paid, I could have gone to a tax preparer. I paid $60.00 for product and I was suppose to get 1 free state and I was charged. I was also charged to process the EFT. All in all about $120.00 to do my taxes. I was a returning customer. Next year, I will use my online tax.

title: Shamey Shamey
content: They tried to make some extra money by having users have to go up to the next level purchase but customer backlash caused them to reconsider. I hope they have learned their lesson and won't be so greedy next year.

title: DON'T BUY IT
content: I am giving this 2 stars because it won't get read if I give it 1 star--there are just too many people dumping on TT Deluxe and Turbotax the company. And their reviews are well justified. The company pulled a fast one by not including functionality for Schedules C and D in the "Deluxe" version we have been buying all these years. Like many, I got my copy and found this out. So my choice was to incur expense to return it or upgrade. Here is what I did--I called the company and got (amazingly) an English speaking human. I was just looking for the most convenient way to return what I had purchased and go to H&R Block. He was very nice and properly apologetic for what had happened. He said when they rolled out the 2014 software, they got over 13,000 complaints almost instantly from customers. In the ensuing conversation, he saw that I have been a Turbotax customer for over 15 years and upgraded me at no cost. I give him 5 stars as a representative, but I still give Turbotax the company only 2 (again, I would give them one star but my review would not be read). Two additional points, fellow complainers: 1. The representative said that it you want full Schedule C AND D functionality, you can't just buy the "Premier" version--you have to go up to the next level ("Home and Business"?) 2. Reading the reviews for H&R Block, I found that their lower cost version still does include Schedules C and D, BUT they have a problem getting the program to load under Windows XP, even though the box says it is XP compatible. They have known about it for several months but have not yet fixed the problem (as of January 25).

title: Nothing Deluxe about this stripped down program.
content: This so called "Deluxe" version is nothing but a stripped down version of the program that I have been using for the past 14 years. It no longer includes a simple schedule C or schedule E. If you want a simple schedule E they charge you an extra 25.00.. If you then want schedule C they charge you an additional 10.00. The Deluxe version in anything but deluxe... it looks like it was designed by a former airline employee. " your deluxe seat only allows you on the airplane ...it you want to sit down that's 20.00 extra..if you want a seat cushion ..another 10.00..on and on.. " I noticed that they now offer a 20.00 rebate if you used one of the formerly free schedules...that came about only after they received tons of bad publicity on the internet..

title: This year was more confusing than in the past. ...
content: This year was more confusing than in the past. I saw lots of things about free state returns but never saw anything about it on as I filed my taxes. I have still not seen my refunds and worry about if they went through correctly. I know I updated every time I logged in but no updates about their program.

title: Not A Happy Customer
content: It is very hard for me to rate this product because key functionality did not work at the time I needed it. The import of my W2 was not possible and I, like many others reported the error. The support site I was given seemed indifferent at best and by the time the problem was fixed I had manually entered my data and e-filed. Now some might believe that importing a W2 is not critical or important but I believe it is key to having a correct return and an important feature. It is after all part of what I paid for and didn't get. To me, no matter how wonderfully a car drives it doesn't matter if you can't get it started. I am particularly sensitive when a company has worked out how to collect my money but not how to deliver what I've paid for and after getting my money, seems disinterested in my report that their product is broken. After the manual entry of my W2, the product performed well. However I waited about a week and a half for a fix and finally just entered my own data. Only afterward, when I had already filed my taxes, did they report this problem was fixed. Not soon enough in my estimation. Every day I opened the product I was notified of updates but never a fix. As a customer that paid for certain advertised functionality, I had to wonder how this bug was not important enough to warrant a immediate solution patch? If I wanted to do my taxes manually I would not need to buy the software. I'm sorry if this seems harsh but I was not happy with the process and telling me its fixed weeks later when I've already done my taxes does not help me as a customer.

title: Very disappointed in TurboTax 2014
content: Very disappointed this year. Have been using TurboTax over ten years. Much functionality has disappeared over time. I am all for simplicity but not at the cost of functionality. Next year I will be looking into other products.

title: I could not even use the program it is not ...
content: I could not even use the program it is not compatible with chrome the only system I had at the time. I ended up paying a service as I was short on time. Never use turbotax again and this is after 10 years of using it. I want my money back.

title: i will never use turbo tax again. i got ...
content: i will never use turbo tax again.i got an assessment from the state of calif for 304.07 when my return was 268.00...i called tt for help and was on hold for 1hr 10min and was told it was to old to help me...turbo tax does not do what it pretends to offer...hello h&r block...thanks again for nothing.

title: I don't like being ripped off.
content: the 2014 TurboTax did not include a free state return. I had to pay an additional $49 for it then I had to pay to file it electronically. I've been using TurboTax for many years, but I'll be checking out H&R Block Tax return software next year.

title: Disturbing
content: This year's version of Turbotax was disturbing. When Sasan Goodarzi, General Manager of Intuit Turbo Tax, had sent out an email describing a fix and apology due to a wholesale revamp of Turbotax software that apparently forced many to upgrade in order to utilize forms that had previously always been included I was astounded! I hadn't even ordered the software yet so I was rather reluctant to do so. I waited until after the promised fix date of February 7th so hopefully I wouldn't run into problems. Then, it didn't help that in latter weeks many states were refusing to accept tax returns transmitted by TurboTax because of fraud didn't exactly give any encouragement that my return was not going to be affected. Not what I had expected from a company I had trusted for nearly two decades. I was alarmed at the reviews I saw here on Amazon regarding this years TurboTax release. We, as customers, thrive on continuity, and rely upon a company's integrity to deliver a consistent product. To make wholesale changes in software solely to increase profit after so many years of reliable consistency was deplorable. It is one thing to improve upon and build functionality into a product for the benefit of users and another to take away functionality in hopes the faithful will expend more funds so as to enjoy what had been previously provided. I hope that next year I don't receive another email from TurboTax stating they're fixing something that shouldn't have needed to be fixed.

title: BUY AT YOUR OWN RISK. WOULD NOT SUPPLY THE STATE TAX I ORDERED AND PAID FOR!
content: A MAJOR DISAPPOINTMENT - WOULD NOT DOWN LOAD MISSOURI STATE, SO I HAD TO MAKE MANUAL ARRANGEMENTS. I DO NOT ACCEPT THE "NO COMMENT" STANCE. I WILL LOOK FOR ANOTHER TAX SOFTWARE NEXT YEAR. OF COURSE I STILL HAD TO PAY FOR BOTH FEDERAL AND STATE.

title: Turbotax Deluxe was a Ripoff
content: I had to use Deluxe this year when I've been able to use Basic in prior years costing me $20 more. The state portion of Turbotax did not work at all. My Turbotax experience this year totally sucked. I'll probably switch to some one else's software next year.

title: Pretty shady. Not sure if I would buy them ...
content: I found TurboTax to be intentionally misleading when it comes to "State". They allow you to fill in your information but charge upwards of $20 to submit for you. Pretty shady. Not sure if I would buy them again.

title: I received less this year for more money. I ...
content: I received less this year for more money. I have to pay for an upgrade to do the same thing I received in the deluxe package last year. This will be my last year with turbo tax.

title: although I have used it in the past and was satisfied. First bought basic but had to upgrade to ...
content: Will never purchase Turbotax again, although I have used it in the past and was satisfied. First bought basic but had to upgrade to deluxe. I can not get the state to open, can not get any assistance on the help line.

title: not loving turbo tax
content: Too many problems over the years with turbo tax over all the years I have used it but I am too lazy to switch. Also, don't think you can ever contact anyone at turbotax if you have a problem--customer service is nonexistent.

title: Very deceptive... at happened to my free ...
content: Very deceptive...at happened to my free state filing? If you're not careful theres a "gotcha" about the way you pay for your transmission...your Credit Card, vice up front money from TurboTax...I'll probaly use it again, but I proudly everyone I know how deceptive you are

title: Not happyí ½í¸³!!!!
content: I have used turbo tax for a few years and this year has been the worst. I purchased the deluxe version because I have to do a state return and they are demanding $39.99 in order for me to do the state return. I will not be using this software next year.

title: 2 years in a row it says I have free ...
content: 2 years in a row it says I have free state return to file and when I get to the end I have to pay 19.98 to file the state. I will try to find another program that will let me do the state free. I could have had this done for just a few more dollars then it cost to buy and file

title: This is a good product, but it is too expensive and the ...
content: This is a good product, but it is too expensive and the cost to file the state is ridiculous. I will be looking for new software for my taxes next year. Intuit has forgotten its customer base and is pricing itself out of the market. I stopped using Quicken and will now stop using Turbo Tax.

title: I did not like this years Turbo Tax
content: I did not like this years Turbo Tax. I am considering switching to some one else next year. I've been using Turbo Tax for several years and found that the software this year was not as user friendly and had hidden fees which I did not appreciate.

title: High price, bugs, and poor customer & technical support
content: Typical Intuit, trying to up-sell you at every click of the program. Tech Support is non existent and program had a lot of bugs this year, despite an increase in price.

title: no Sch D = epic fail
content: What? No e-filing with Schedule D (investments) this year? Epic fail. I've bought TurboTax for 15 years, but I'll be trying out H&R Block or TaxAct this year.

title: Then an offshore company will offer a better product for a reasonable price and more american jobs ...
content: Now they charge twice as much because they can. The company will make a killing for a couple of years scrueing their customers and the exec's will get huge bonuses. Then an offshore company will offer a better product for a reasonable price and more american jobs will go to Bangalore where underclass "untouchable" slaves write software code for 5$ a day. What a shame........

title: I've been using TurboTax for at least 15 years, I won't use it again!
content: Extremely disappointed. After submitting my tax return it did not save the file. Called customer service and they were no help. Had to redo the entire return. TurboTax has gone to the dogs! Will never use again!

title: I've used it for several years & I've come to dislike it very much
content: I cant wait to use someone else's. Turbo has gotten more & more confusing and frustrating. I've used it for several years & I've come to dislike it very much. As soon as another one that can be transferred hits the market I'll be in line to buy it. I'm not alone.

title: there is a flaw in the dependent section for student ...
content: there is a flaw in the dependent section for student it asks if someone can claim you as a dependent if you answer YES you get a drop down that says Will someone claim you as a dependent and I answered no and was suppose to get $1026 back but the IRS sent a letter revising the amount to $26

title: I have been using Turbo Tax for several years but ...
content: I have been using Turbo Tax for several years but no more. This year Schedule D s not included in the homeowners package. I think that is awful. We had two items to put on a schedule D and need to pay $40 to upgrade so we can get the schedule? Next year I will check out other programs.

title: Disappointed With Intuit
content: I am very unhappy that Intuit has removed tax forms from TurboTax Deluxe, to force people to buy the more expensive version. Next year I will review all options before purchasing my tax software. I have used Turbo tax Deluxe for at least 10 years and this may have been my last.

title: I purchased H&R block instead...
content: I bought H&R Block instead based on the reviews. My wife needs Sch C. We've used Turbo Tax for the last 7 years. Hopefully the bean counters will get the message.

title: Forget about using TurboTax Deluxe to file electronically a return that includes capital gains and losses.
content: As others, I was a faithful and long-term TurboTax customer who was purchasing this product for over a decade. TurboTax saved me time thanks to features such as import of the investment data directly from financial institutions. This year's version of the TurboTax Deluxe does not allow to file electronically a tax return with the Schedule D. Removing features from a product just to force customers to buy an upgrade, what an extreme arrogance. It is time to look for alternatives.

title: product did the job, customer care lousy
content: 2014 TurboTax deluxe, did the job for me mechanically, however the payment system for filing e-file was very complicated.I received my federal tax return in two weeks but I still have not received my state return although I paid over $50 to file them both electronically. I expected much quicker for paying that amount. When calling TurboTax customer care, with all due respect, it was a fiasco. Their customer service program stinks!

title: So now Deluxe will only do a basic return??
content: So I have been using TurboTax since 1991. I purchase it on Amazon in December without even thinking about it, only to find out that the Deluxe package won't do schedule D - to do that I need to upgrade to the "Home & Business" version. Earth to Intuit, Earth to Intuit: What exactly does "Deluxe" mean, please explain? Why do I need to purchase a business tax package just because I had a capital gain that requires schedule D? That is such a blatant middle finger to your customers that it leaves me wondering how a company could be so stupid. Anybody remember the copy protection debacle several years ago when Intuit tried to keep people from installing TurboTax on multiple computers? They made such a mess with that bone-head decision that they eventually reversed course and removed the copy protection the following year so people could actually use the software they had legally purchased. But not before they lost a lot of customers. Apparently Intuit does not learn from their past mistakes - or maybe they have such a huge piece of the tax software market that they figure they can do whatever they want. Which is why I won't even bother calling their 800 number to get the "free" upgrade to Home & Business this year - I just got my free copy of H&R Block Deluxe.

title: Bye, bye Intuit.
content: I have bought my last copy of Turbotax. I have had enough with the shrinking features and need to upgrade. I'll find new software next year. Bye, bye Intuit.

title: I was very disappointed and may be trying another product next year
content: This product lacks so many of the features from last year. The most important being the ability to file my state taxes without additional fees. I was very disappointed and may be trying another product next year.

title: Turbo Tax Screwees.....there is salvation in HR Block software
content: This is an update to my review of a couple of months ago. I ran into a problem with Turbo Tax for 2014 even before I found out about the missing forms. Intuit upped the system requirements for Mac users such that the software was no longer compatible with OS 10.6.8, which happens to be the last version of the Mac OS that older software designed for the power pc chips can be used with. I was not about to upgrade to a later OS and then have to buy hundreds of $$ of other software. So, TT 2014 would not even load onto my computer. And if I had been able to load it, I would had the same issues about missing Sched D. After receiving the Intuit gobble-de-gook emails that went from 'we miss communicated' to 'oh oh, we got caught,' I found out that I could download the HR Block software that did everything that I needed and worked on OS 10.6.8 FOR FREE that was being offered to Turbo Tax purchasers that had been screwed. HR Block was smart to jump on Intuit's monumental screw up - sure to become a Harvard Biz School case study. I am here to say that the HR Block software worked just fine. It imported all of my TT data and actually was a little more detailed in its treatment of a broader range of tax issues & forms (which took a little time to get understand). And to buy the HR Block software would have cost much less than TT. So, guess what? I will be buying HR Block software for 2015. Many of the features and design are quite similar to TT. A TT user will have no problems using the HR Block software. A kudo to Costco. I bought my TT 2014 there in Dec and then took it with me to CA for the winter without having tried to load it onto any computer. I returned TT 2014 to Costco in CA and got a full refund without the original receipt. Apparently, they were able to tell from the bar code. The gal at the returns desk said that they were being deluged with returned TT 2014. By the way, I filed electronically a couple of weeks ago and the Fed refund is already in my bank account.

title: poor customer service/default settings
content: if you select Federal efile, there is no option to mail state. It automatically defaults to efile state for the additional $25. When requesting help with the address to mail the state forms, I was more or less told to look it up online through my state's website.

title: One Star
content: Add me to the nearly 1000 dissatisfied prior Intuit EX-customers.

title: Just called 800-445-1875 to ask for free upgrade to Premier ...
content: Updated 1-27-15 The $25 rebate and no plan to change the product for the future is very insulting to all. I did take advantage of the H&R Block free copy and I will be sticking with them next year. You can add another goodbye TT.... Just called 800-445-1875 to ask for free upgrade to Premier. It took a while, not sure why their system was so slow. I had to install Deluxe on the spot so that I could get to the screen where it asks you to upgrade to continue adding investment info. They need the serial number shown there. They will then give you over the phone, an upgrade code to enter that immediately upgrades your version to Premier. They acknowledged that they screwed up are trying to make things right. I'll double check next year's version to see if I stay with TT.

title: Changed for the worse
content: Think it sucks compared to the old program. Why is it that you think you have to change something that already worked so well????????? I DON'T GET IT

title: At least on the App Store they tell you when there are in-app purchases
content: Under the pond scum, under the water, under the mud & under the rocks live organisms that exist on the effluence of life. This organisms hold a low place in the chain of life. But, at least, they can look down on the people controlling the TurboTax product. I've been a customer for many years but in the future I'll etch my returns into rock before I'll use TurboTax. Once you buy their product it's only the beginning of the money grab. Everything you want to do is an additional charge. I suspect that next year there'll be a additional charge for going on to the each page of your return.

title: The Product Cycle is on the Decline Due to their Management,
content: When a company can no longer innovate, they raise prices and make their features more expensive. Intuit is a sad example. I have used Turbo Tax since 1997. I will no longer support a company that produces inferior and more costly products than their competitors (HR Block). They have become arrogant with their products. The life cycle is hard work produces success. Success brings forth arrogance. And, arrogance brings forth failure. Sorry to see intuit going down hill. If they were smart, they would correct this schedule C and D bad decision. Once a customer goes to HR Block, they will never come back.

title: No more turbo tax
content: I have been a turbo tax user for about 5 years now. I was so disappointed when I had to pay to file my state tax. I don't think I will be purchasing turbo tax next year. That was insult enough when it clearly says there is no charge for filing a state return.

title: With all the cost associated with the program next year ...
content: With all the cost associated with the program next year I will just go to H&R Block and let someones else do it and pay 1 fee ... after the purchase of the program and the other cost that they hit you with to efile just as expensive to let someone else do it for you !

title: Many thumbs down for taking State tax software off of package.
content: Turbo tax went to the bottom of my list this year. They have always had the State tax software as part of their Deluxe package. This year it was not included and they wanted another $40 dollars for it. This will be my last year using this software.

title: All went smoothly. It did remember what it should ...
content: All went smoothly . It did remember what it should although it should ask me if I had more income sources than last year so I go straight to my retirement income. I am not sure why intuit keeps asking me to update my Quicken package when I did that last year .

title: new selling item without state tax return made using tt ...
content: new selling item without state tax return made using tt less than desirable, I plan on looking at other software next year or just go to H & R, cost isn't going to be that different with having the hassle of returning and repurchasing correct tt.

title: I had no idea that I wasn't buying the same ...
content: I had no idea that I wasn't buying the same software as in prior years. the extra trips to the store and reading all the news releases made me angry.

title: Not satisfied.
content: Not nearly as easy to use as past editions. Plus I got charged for my one state return. Got refunded after a phone call but should not have had to be bothered. Go back to old format and old price! Next year will look for something else.

title: I guess I'm one of the lucky ones...
content: I guess I'm one of the lucky ones in that the removal of Schedule D from TT Deluxe won't affect me this year. However, next year, if Inuit hasn't seen the error of its ways, I'll be buying an alternative product from another vendor.

title: When I finished my taxes I was supposed to receive ...
content: When I finished my taxes I was supposed to receive 2,088.00 in a refund. As it turned out I only received 2,078.02 . I guess that somebody decided that turbo tax was entitled to an extra 10.00 dollars. I may look for another source for my tax preparation service next year !!!

title: The product was fine but it cost me $59 when I purchased it ...
content: The product was fine but it cost me $59 when I purchased it in December.. Had I waited until January I could have purchased it for considerably less. I did apply for the TurboTax $25 rebate, but was denied. Next year I will use a product from a competitor

title: I am very disappointed that this version didn't include ONE STATE as in ...
content: I am very disappointed that this version didn't include ONE STATE as in prior years. I will be looking for another software next year for preparing my taxes. 2/28/14 UPDATE: I called Turbotax & complained. They provided a FREE State download.

title: Less for your money in 2014!
content: Changes are not welcome!

title: Junk software
content: This is the worst software I have used in years. The updates would not work and I was forced to download them separately and then install them manually three times before it worked. Junk compared to previous years. I will not be using this software again

title: Blinded by greed, Intuit shoots itself in the foot.
content: Purposefully crippling the venerable TurboTax Deluxe program to force users to upgrade to much more expensive versions is going to go down in history as Intuit's "New Coke" moment. Lots of people are jumping ship. I wonder if retail stores such as Costco will be among them next year.

title: The answer is simply a pre-interview!
content: For a better customer experience, Why not create the platform so that the interview is the first thing a customer does, outlining all items they will be including in their tax returns. From that interview and disclosure of needs from the client, the proper version of Turbo Tax would be recommended. This allows the client to choose the correct item UPFRONT instead of getting most or all of the way through the return prep and then learning an upgrade is necessary at an additional charge? Taxes are very complex, and relying on a generalized outline of functionality in the product description page is quite a gamble for the consumer. Personally I don't want to be required to have a level of tax knowledge in order to know exactly what I need before I even start! Just food for thought Intuit as you strategize how to win back or continue to earn your loyal customers.

title: TurboTax makes doing taxes bearable.
content: TurboTax saves me a lot of money in tax preparation fees. I itemize and was afraid of trying to do taxes myself, but TurboTax makes it very easy. I don't get money back because of dividend income, but I do feel confident that TurboTax helps me to enter all the deductions possible. This is my fourth year using TurboTax, and I recommend it.

title: Very frustrating
content: This is probably the last year I will be using TurboTax. Every year it screws up my local tax returns. I need to do a city resident tax return and also a city non-resident return for the city that I work in. Support is virtually non-existent.

title: Not Intuit, Out Of It. Goodbye TurboTax, hello H&R Block
content: If I buy the same named product, I expect the same consistent features. I shouldn't need to check the feature list to see if it has been crippled to gouge more money. I don't expect to be charged 80% more for an upgrade to fill out basic forms. I have been a loyal customer since the first release of TurboTax. Last year was the first time I had to use an accountant for my taxes to handle complexities, but I came right back to TurboTax this year. With nothing to import, I had to start the program fresh, and this was not a good experience. It was constantly trying to sell me add-on services. TurboTax did not even request basic critical information from my previous return - I had to enter last year's tax manually on the appropriate form to prevent an underpayment penalty. All the while it was trumpeting how it was doing such a great job of finding every deduction and error. A hollow promise lined with greed. Then the last straw, it refused to allow me to file Schedules D and required an upgrade. I couldn't even access the forms manually. In all of their products Intuit seems to be concentrating on how to charge you more rather than improving products and performance. Not only that, they actively lobby against taxpayers at the federal level (opposing free filing for example) and have been accused of willfully allowing fraudulent returns to boost their revenue. See the Wikipedia article about TurboTax for more details. I have no desire to support this kind of activity. After researching alternatives and reviews, H&R Block Deluxe + State is less expensive than TurboTax and gets excellent reviews. It also directly imports your TurboTax file, so there is little pain to switch. I wish I had known this and switched before starting my return this year.

title: The package now charges you an additional fee of 40 ...
content: The package now charges you an additional fee of 40.00 to download the state edition. I found this to be quite irritating and the cost of this program is no longer a value and I will re-consider using this program in the future.

title: I am returning my TT Deluxe after learning it no longer has schedules C & D
content: I have recently purchased TurborTax Deluxe (not from Amazon). Box has not been opened yet. When I heard from friends and read that schedule C and schedule D have been stripped from this year's version, I am not too happy. I have been a loyal users of TT for 20 years. I am taking this box of TT back to the store for return. I am ordering H & R Block's Deluxe version.from Amazon. I am very disappointed with TurborTax's decision.

title: I find it very annoying when i see the commercials touting free tax filing ...
content: I find it very annoying when i see the commercials touting free tax filing when i get hit for the price of the system itself and then $ 20 for each state filing. If it didn't interface w/my investment company, i would go somewhere else.

title: Thinking about switching next year
content: Disappointing when you already pay for "free federal and 1 state" but then have to fork out a bunch more money for TurboTax fees.

title: I THINK IT WAS DISGRACEFULL HOW YOU MARKETED TURBO-TAX THIS ...
content: I THINK IT WAS DISGRACEFULL HOW YOU MARKETED TURBO-TAX THIS YEAR. BY CUTTING OUT THE CRITICAL FORMS FOR ITEMIZING DEDUCTIONS AND THEN ADDING THEM BACK IN WHEN YOU WERE PRESSURED BY THE PUBLIC AND PRESS. I WILL NOT BUT TURBO-TAX NEXT YEAR.

title: So long, Turbotax!
content: Ridiculous, since my last yearâs turbo tax was not from Turbotax directly, I was told I have to file and claim the $25 Turbotax Deluxe refund later. And the in Turbotax upgrade is $30! Bad business practice! I am going to try the HR block software for this year. No More Turbotax for me!

title: hate it
content: Hate it. Water Mark on printed state return saying "form not complete", "do not file" when in fact it is complete.

title: Polish up the resume Bob!
content: 813, 1 star reviews out of 940+? Really? Based on reviews I won't be using turbo tax for either personal or my S corporation. I've been using TurboTax for 30. Very unfortunate. Sounds like Bob Meighan might need to start polishing up the old resume.....

title: Hate it when I need to upgrade to get the ...
content: Hate it when I need to upgrade to get the same product as last year and need to log on to upgrade, add my credit card and paper works.

title: so switching did me no good.
content: I was using H&R Block but their state tax did not automatically exclude me from paying state tax on my retirement pension, which I am entitled to, so I purchased TurboTax. Guess what, yours does the same thing, so switching did me no good.

title: Unsatisfied
content: They changed the product this year so you have to pay to e-file your state taxes. I assumed it was the same as last year where you got one free state e-file. I will not purchase this product again. I feel like I got the bait and switch.

title: ... an extra 30 bucks for them no thanks looks like H&R block is getting my business this
content: Ripping out functions I need then charge an extra 30 bucks for them no thanks looks like H&R block is getting my business this year

title: a real ZERO!!!!!!!!!
content: the worst tax s/w experience ever I won't be buying turbotax ever again time waster -- needlessly checking for updates already installed, no way to edit specifics after check. Got a refund from Costco!

title: New TurboTax just like New Coke!
content: This debacle appears to be nearly as bad as Coke changing their recipe way back when, I hope it costs them as much money. Will companies ever understand that we the consumer will only put up with just so much crap? H&R Block, here I come.

title: Intuit has once again shown complete disregard for it's customers ...
content: Intuit has once again shown complete disregard for it's customers. After using TT Deluxe for many years, Intuit decided to no longer support features that were always part of Deluxe, forcing customers to spend more to upgrade to Premier. This is outrageous to me and I will now begin looking for alternative software for my tax preparation. I understand that H&R Block Deluxe not only will import my prior year TT return, but is less money and provides all of the necessary functionality. Intuit has once again called it wrong and hopefully will lose many customers as a result.

title: What a disappointment!
content: Heard all about the issues with TurboTax and the upgrade fiasco, but saw that they were offering a free upgrade that would occur automatically within the software. Well, they screwed that up too. After downloading the software and preparing my taxes, I got to the point where it said I needed the Home & Business vrs. Deluxe. Well, I said to myself, it should just upgrade automatically as stated. Well, it didn't and there is no support over the weekend, so another wasted day trying to do taxes. I should have joined the millions that switched to H&R Block. I will next tax year.

title: Past versions were great, this years however not as user friendly
content: Past versions were great , this years however not as user friendly , forms at times not available , and not easy to go back and forth to review and change deductions . Hopefully next year will be better !

title: This years version is not as good as the rest
content: This years version is not as good as the rest. They have cut corners and at every turn of forms I previously used I am being told to upgrade. I will definitely second guess this purchase next year.

title: My return was rejected several times. Turbo tax not ...
content: My return was rejected several times. Turbo tax not able to clean up the mistake. Some social security transfer item. Needless to same could not e file my return. Finally manually took care of problem on my own. Bummer!!

title: Not as good as the older versions.
content: Have used TurboTax for 7 years, no problems. This year's version was a challenge, kept getting 'TurboTax has encountered a problem and needs to close' and would not allow me to E-File. It took 5 attempts to finish and file.

title: Unknown Changes and Upgrade REQUIRED.
content: While the program worked flawlessly as usual, we were not at all happy with the changes to Deluxe as pertains to Royalty payments. We purchased the Deluxe edition as we always have throughout the years of doing our taxes with TurboTax. We were forced to "Upgrade" to the next product level due a royalty payment that was very negligible. Granted Inuit did offer a compensatory rebate, which we received in short haste, for the change. Yes, we are complaining about "Change". I just don't like supprises that cost me anything!

title: In the past I purchased the disc form. This ...
content: In the past I purchased the disc form. This year I downloaded Turbo tax and was surprised to find that the downloaded version could not locate my previous year's information although I followed the instructions.

title: I didn't like the fact that the Deluxe version didn't have the ...
content: I didn't like the fact that the Deluxe version didn't have the same forms/attachments, e.g., to report capital gains, as it has in prior years. Will not buy this software next year, but plan to do it online for free.

title: REJECTION BY THE IRS ERASED THE ENTIRE RETURN
content: When my return was rejected by the IRS because of a missing Fed. ID number I went to the program to correct it. EVERYTHING WAS GONE. I had to start all over. I will be looking for a different program next year.

title: Forgive, forget (until next year!)
content: Like everyone else, I was going to drop Turbo Tax this year because of the elimination of Schedule C, etc forms, but glad Intuit finally owned up to this mistake, so I went ahead and got it. I've been a user since 2000 so it would've been a bummer to switch but I would have done it if they hadn't made 'amends'. Hope they remember this in 2016!

title: Rip off Continues
content: The rip off continues. I got an email from the CEO offering a rebate if I had to upgrade to premier and of course I had to upgrade. Unfortunately, I was filing late because of a family situation and neglected to read the fine print on the bottom of the CEO's email which cut off the rebate last week! Jeez! Based on TurboTax instructions, anyone who sells any stock has to upgrade. Ridiculous!

title: Read purchase carefully
content: Had to buy twice. Be careful when purchasing because the turbo with and with out the state looks similar. Then, what do you know? They do not sell the state software alone. You have to buy again - federal + State

title: Intuit You Can Do Better
content: They did not have their act together this year! That had to stop processing State returns for a couple days and then they mislabeled the software this year so you had to buy two packages.

title: More dollars for less
content: Have been using Turbo Tax for a lot of years, am disappointed with the direction it has gne in. The deluxe is a bit on the expensive side and heas eliminated items I use. Guess I will have to look elsewhere.

title: Their customer service sucks!
content: I would have given them 4 stars but given the data breach that happened and my daughters social security number was used I am very dissasatisfied. I tried to get ahold of customer service at turbo tax and was put on hold for 2 1/2 hours, transferred to 3 different departments and was disconnected. So frustrated! Their customer service sucks!

title: Turbotax is a pain in the you know where
content: I've used Turbotax for MANY years but this year may be my last. I inadvertently hit the wrong checkbox and TurboTax told me I needed Home & Business and could upgrade for free. I upgraded but then after starting with the new software realized I did not need Home & Business and it was far more complicated to use so I decided to downgrade back to deluxe. I thought this would be a simple matter of uninstalling and reinstalling the software. Each time I attempted this the reinstall reverted back to Home & Business. Finally after searching on TurboTax's website I found a solution that involved manually uninstalling the software and deleting directories. I started my return and made it all the way to the state portion and attempted to download my state. This was a big headache as each time I tried to download it the software would tell me I was up to date but would not download my state software. Again I turned to TurboTax's website and found this is a known bug when you upgrade your software from one version to another. They created a tool to fix this issue and after running it I was able to download my state and finish my return. Intuit & TurboTax - for as many people as you have that use your software, you NEED to make sure it works, and works well. It's slipshod design when your uninstall doesn't really uninstall but basically leaves all the files on my hard-drive and just deletes the shortcut. Based on the poor design of your program this year and all the other headaches of moving features from one version to another I believe next year I'll turn to another tax software to file my returns. You'll have to win my business back by being the outstanding tax software on the market, not the lackluster, "we take our market base for granted" product you have created this year.

title: Not great if you have a problem
content: There really is no help if you run into a problem-the comments section is useless-there should be a phone person to contact. I kept having something pop up that I had not input and did not know how to get rid of it.

title: Using H & R Block this year, will probably never go back to Turbo Tax
content: I changed this year to H&R Block. I did this a few years ago when intuit pulled something else and now will not buy any intuit software. Find H & R is fine and maybe better. I also did not upgrade Quicken this year. Have used both of these programs for many years but Quicken seems to always have issues so only use it now as a register. Works fine for that and they finally stopped sending me messages to update. Would give it the least stars since that is what it is worth. I have never down loaded as never trusted Quicken or Turbo Tax, although this just might be me but so many have said things had been downloaded incorrectly so why take the chance.

title: Help not so much help.
content: My state was rejected due to some sort of electronic signature issue and Turbo Tax notified me and said it would walk me through fixing it but it never did. I had to print and file by snail mail. If a return is rejected I would expect the program to open and pin point exactly where and how to fix the issue. A bit disappointing.

title: I have used turbo for some time now paid 39-49 ...
content: I have used turbo for some time now paid 39-49.00 for it and then felt I was robbed at the end had to pay another 49.00

title: Works reliably, but removing Schedule D from Deluxe was a shocker.
content: I've been a long-time TurboTax and Quicken user. I've used TurboTax since 2000 to file my taxes. I'm in general pleased with the product. I find the web version and the PC version offer similar capabilities. The biggest things I like about TurboTax is how well it loads data from Quicken, and how it integrates with itsDeductible.com. I remember when TurboTax didn't play nice with Quicken a few years ago, and I'm pleased to say those problems no longer occur. The biggest thing I don't like is that TurboTax Deluxe dropped all support for Schedule D this year. It moved to Premium, which costs more. There was a very large brew-ha-ha over it, and Intuit finally gave away Schedule D support this year. I don't have a lot of stock transactions, but it is silly to spend double the cost for just a few transactions. That would have sent me to a new tax software this year. I don't expect Intuit to give Schedule D away next year, but it would be very nice if they included a limited number of transactions, say 5, in the Deluxe product before forcing you to the Premium product in 2016.

title: Usually I would give 5 stars but its been over ...
content: Usually I would give 5 stars but its been over 9 weeks and I did efille, and still I don't have my fefund. I filled early and I feel that if I would have gone to an actual tax agent I would already have my returns.

title: So many bugs this time around
content: I've been using this software for more than 10 years now and this year I had the hardest time trying to e-file. I encountered so many bugs in this program trying to pay by credit card that I finally had to accept the "deduct fees from return" option which cost me $34.00. I also had to keep restarting the program because for some reason when I tried to transmit the return it kept giving me an error message. I restarted the system 4 times before it finally let me transmit the return. Last thing, during the process of trying to pay by credit card the price of the state filing fee changed from $24.00 to $19.99 and back to $24.00 so I know there must be major problems with the software system. Sadly this may be the last time I use this software unless they can assure me the bugs will be fixed next year. I'm also hoping the bugs weren't on purpose to make me pay that $34.00 for the "deduct from return" option.

title: BEWARE: Bait & Switch
content: Count me in as another LONG time user / supporter of TT who is very angry and upset at the decision to remove the interview option for Schedule D. Cleary this change will impact a large % of Deluxe users. What were you guys thinking? Pull a bait and switch and force us to pay for a Premier version of the software? If you were looking to generate extra revenue for Intuit this may have totally backfired. Wait until word gets out you will see a mass exodus of long time loyal customers. Penny wise - pound foolish... Just canceled my order!

title: used to be good
content: Federal Taxes went well however state taxes were rejected twice. Both times the program told me it was error free. I paid 19.95 to electronic file but since it was rejected twice I had to use regular mail.

title: Two Stars
content: required software upgrade, then another call to tech support for another fix. Turbotax is losing its edge big time

title: Outstanding all except the up-sell they used to stick it to you
content: Better than last year but I did not like the the up-sell to use the investments at full cost as I would have saved 30 percent buying the version on Amazon! I will use it again but watch out for the small print and buy the more advanced product avoiding the up-sell

title: I'd give 0 stars if I could
content: It's still charging for state, even though it claims you get one. Worst representation. I'm finally done with TT.

title: This was my first and last use of TurboTax. ...
content: This was my first and last use of TurboTax. One big omission and one error forced me to have my accountant amend.

title: Being 59 and having a pretty simple financial life - divorced
content: Being 59 and having a pretty simple financial life - divorced, rent an apartment, no mortgage, no kids at home, good, but basic investments and still working - I opted for this tool 3 years ago and have been very satisfied. Much cheaper than hiring a preparer, which was much more with a joint return and included my ex-wife's small business. I kept the preparer at $400/year till we sold the house and I moved to another state. Now I've moved back to first state and decided I didn't need a $400 prep for my lifestyle.The $50-ish for Turbo Tax Deluxe makes it easy. You pay extra for a 2nd state's return (at about $50 more as I recall), but it's reasonable and practical. Initially, I was skeptical of using technology to file, but it's very practical and sensible and I've never had a problem. It's even fun and the walk-thru online steps make it stress-free. I plan to continue to use this product in future years.

title: Don't waste your money.
content: Miserable piece of work. Doesn't transfer spouses information to State. Didn't calculate accurate. I have used TurboTax for several years but this is going to be the last. Paid more for it and no free e-file. Extremely disappointed..

title: Change for the Worse!
content: Turbo Tax changed for the worse, not for the customer. Charges for state forms, hidden charges to file. I paid over $70 for state form and to fill. You have joined the greedy. Next year I will use H&R Block.

title: This was the FIRST time I had two Help Desk people give me unbelievably good service,
content: Having used Turbo Tax at least ten years in a row,....I must say their were several firsts in my experience. This was the First time I have ever had a problem using T.T. This was the FIRST TIME I had to call in to resolve a problem. This was the FIRST time I HAD to upgrade. This was the first time I could not download the State program to finish my taxes. This was the FIRST time a program failed to work for me, prompting another call to the HELP line. This was the FIRST time I had two Help Desk people give me unbelievably good service,...and I could understand them FIRST time. The second lady was in the Atlanta center,....she is the reason I will be using turbo tax again next year. If it had not been for her outstanding help and her ability to listen to a customer, I was ready to write off Turbo Tax FOREVER,...hey that would have been another FIRST! I can NOT give a five star rating due to the problems I have encountered this year, in fact if I had not had such GOOD SERVICE from the two people who helped me,.....(the second one I had to wait on line for 40 minutes for) like I say,....I would have never come back to Turbo Tax again. Mike Scobey lake Odessa,MI

title: out 40 bucks plus produ coost
content: Two failed attempts at. filing, yet charged 19.95 e each for those attempts led . me to File with H and R block

title: Still Useful After All These Years... (apologies to Paul Simon)
content: Been using TurboTax for years and it still makes a very difficult time of year more manageable. Good interview sequences, although help could be more robust on some of the more esoteric options. A little disappointed in Intuit for changing the feature mix, especially without much warning. Their public contrition was nice, but the rationale for the change was pretty weak.

title: Well I am glad I looked at the reviews before purchasing the TT ...
content: Well I am glad I looked at the reviews before purchasing the TT deluxe. I do not actually need the D form but as a matter of principal I will be switching providers

title: New Turbo Tax stinks!!!
content: It was awful, the state didn't print out correctly and with a 4 hour wait time I submitted a question to see if there was a patch as I had updated twice. Still waiting for an answer 2 weeks later.....

title: One more year of smooth tax help
content: Turbo Tax responded to the outcry against their revamped tax programs by offering returning users of the Deluxe version to upgrade without additional charge to the Premier version. We were able to complete our tax return without difficulty on the upgraded version. Still an easy-to-use and accurate way to prepare and file our tax return.

title: Disappointment from a former Turbo Tax Fan
content: Was unable to file my state taxes due to an issue with the software. Now I here that my data may have been compromised due to a security issue with the Turbo Tax product. Definitely will think twice before using this product in the future. Didn't think HR Block had a chance in this arena? Think again.

title: dont buy it - bait and swich tactics
content: Been a user for 20+ years. Not any more. Dropping key forms because they got greedy ? No thinks smucks.

title: This worked for our family, but we aren't accountants & need help with Tax Code...thanks Turbo Tax!
content: I am noticing a lot of people complaining about Turbo Tax....While I can't give it a five star review because it wouldn't find my taxes from last year (we did not use Turbo Tax). I feel they did a good job simplifying it for people who don't run a small business of some type. The questions they asked got me through my taxes in one evening because I had everything together to check in paper to be sure I wasn't missing anything. They asked appropriate questions that I didn't even think about & even our tax accountant last year missed to increase our refund a small amount more than we expected this year. We paid over $120 for an accountant through our homeowners/car insurance company & it took much longer & I felt like she didn't grasp everything or ask enough questions to be sure she or we weren't missing anything...which is why we got Turbo Tax this year & did it ourselves. This program, especially the Deluxe one for Deductions & Homeowners, isn't for accountants or people who run a business of any kind ( even if its part time)....If you are an accountant, there are professional software programs meant for you to get into detail without asking questions because you know the tax codes & wording better than people who need the help. If I want running a small business, I think I would shell out the money to pay an accountant because any mess up can cause an audit & lose you more money than its worth to do it yourself. Overall, this was a good experience for our family & we will be using it again next year!

title: disappointing
content: I paid $60, then had to pay again to file and file state so next year I wont purchase turbo tax. I've used turbo tax for years. It's costing to much

title: One Star
content: It can NOT be downloaded

title: Thank goodness for the other reviews!
content: So I came to check out deals to get my TurboTax software like I do every year only to discover that to file my basic taxes with a simple Sch C, I would need to upgrade, not to Premier, but to the $100 Home and Business software. That is outrageous considering I've never paid over $20 to $30 for tax software. TurboTax, I would pay a CPA a few hundred bucks before I would ever pay $100 to file my taxes. I managed to get H&R Block Deluxe for five dollars this year which is more than capable of handling my return. Good riddance, TT!

title: ... since the mid-nineties and find it to be very easy and thorough
content: I have been using Turbotax since the mid-nineties and find it to be very easy and thorough. However, I was disappointed that this year the software did not give me an opportunity to input information to calculate estimated taxes for 2015 as was the case in the past.

title: I cant get any customer support. It is an ...
content: I cant get any customer support. It is an amazon issue... Not Turbotax.. Cant get it to run and can not talk to anyone. Go figure... Give me your money and get out of my hair. I only want your cash. I could care less if you get what you are paying for. I do believe that is called unfair and deceptive trade practice. Guess I will be seeing you in court. Mater of principal... Just saying.

title: Very disappointed that home business forms were removed from deluxe version
content: Very disappointed that home business forms were removed from deluxe version. Now have to pay twice as much to get the one extra form I need.

title: Does not install
content: Would not install onto my computer because it was missing components. Not refundable either.

title: Worse Turbo Tax apple a penalty that I wished to ...
content: I had used TurboTax for many years. Lately it has been plagued with errors and balkyness. Worse Turbo Tax apple a penalty that I wished to override. It seems like they have become an agent of IRS.

title: Intuit should be ashamed of themselves...
content: VERY disappointed - long time Turbo Tax customer - taking away needed forms is a rip off!

title: BUY ANOTHER SOFT WEAR
content: A big rip off. I went to file and after all the information was put in I was told that I had to upgrade the soft wear, it cost me an additional $40.00. I know better next year. NO MORE TUBRO TAX

title: Farewell, TurboTax
content: For fifteen years, TurboTax met my needs at a competitive price. Unfortunately, that's no longer the case. I'm moving to H&R Block.

title: Do not expect the Refund Bonus if you don't Direct Deposit
content: I've used TurboTax as my sole tax prep device ever since I've had a "real" job. Last year, I bought TurboTax via Amazon specifically for the Refund Bonus. I feel compelled to point out that both Amazon and Turbo Tax won't take any ownership if you're denied a refund bonus. I had a huge ($500) bonus headed my way last year. Because the return was over $10,000 (due to medical stuff), the US Gov mailed me a check and wouldn't do a direct deposit. Because they didn't do a direct deposit, Turbo Tax refused to add the 10% Amazon Bonus. They said to take it up with Amazon. And, of course, Amazon said to take it up with TurboTax. I spend hours on the phone with support trying to get to the bottom of it. I spoke to multiple representatives. No one could help the situation. I never received the bonus. Just be warned... Turbo Tax will try their best to not give you the extra 10%. Don't rely on it.

title: Fortunately I didn't need the schedules they deleted this year ...
content: Fortunately I didn't need the schedules they deleted this year so would rate it a 3, Still a pretty sleazy marketing approach. Why would you screw up the equity of a market leader with a boneheaded money grab instead of an honest price increase if that was what you wanted. If your customers are smart enough to be doing their own taxes with your product then they're smart enough to see through your tactics. And the the lame excuse that you were leveling the features across online and download versions of the program made sense to absolutely no one. Even if this were true , presenting it as if it was a benefit to consumers is quite a load even for a marketing weasel in damage control mode.

title: Good bye TurboTax
content: Good bye TurboTax. Thanks to all those who reviewed previously regarding the crippling of deluxe version. Moving on to H&R Block.

title: Flaunting frivolity in my face
content: The program worked all right, but the experience was overshadowed by Intuit's antics. This is not the firs time shenanigans like this happened. A good few years ago they wanted the program to call back to home to register, as if it was a program hundreds or thousands of dollars. Well, that didn't go down well either. You would think the company would stop doing things frivolously after that experience. At least it is clear where we stand with intuit. This year I was squeezed for time so I went with what I knew, but did look into other options, and found them better. Next year I leave more time and see what other market there is out there earlier. I know they are all mostly interested in your money, all of them companies, but I don't like them flaunting that fact in my face.

title: I don't know what everyone is complaining about...
content: I get the majority of complaints are several months old due to feature changes, but things are obviously cleared up and resolved now, so I don't understand the most recent complaints. Been using TT for well over 15 years. I started out with TaxAct the other day based on all the negative reviews (2001 all over again?). TaxAct for whatever reason would not prompt for a value for box 7 in the 1099-Misc field so now I'm stuck, plus the calculated tax owed seemed too high. Anyhow, frustrated I decided to pull the trigger and buy TurboTax. If nothing else, to do some check and balance. TT came through for me as it always has done plus saved me a few thousand dollars where TaxAct fell short. Also I find the TT UI is much easier to use and navigate compared to TaxAct. I bought this from Amazon as an instant download: -Download and install was flawless. -Download of the State portion was flawless. -As soon as I hit the Schedule C area the program instantly prompted me for a free upgrade to Home and Business edition. In place upgrade went flawless. (There was no having to call CS and wait on hold or anything) -The UI is virtually identical to previous years. I'm glad I decided to take my chances with this.

title: easy to use product
content: I used TT until last year and went to TaxSlayer. Can file both Federal and State for about $27.00 Dollars. It's a solid, easy to use product. And NO I do not work for Taxslayer.

title: It's TurboTax
content: TurboTax Deluxe 2014 Federal & State was simple to install. It made preparing and e-filing my taxes easy. I've used the Turbo Tax for many years and have never had an issue. I'll use TurboTax again for the 2015 tax year. The only debate I have is whether to use the download, CD, or the online version. The online version seems to have it's advantage, but also is a bit more expensive.

title: First of all my 2014 desktop version of TT Deluxe ...
content: First of all my 2014 desktop version of TT Deluxe did have those missing schedules - unlike most of what has been experienced by many other long time users. Is Bob Meighan VP of TT truthful or not. I don't think so!. He said 8 mos ago that they were returning all those missing schs C, D, E, F, etc to the Deluxe desktop version for 2015. Well it seems their website is still showing that only the Home & Business (for more $$$) will do a sch C. Just follow this link and see for yourself: https://turbotax.intuit.com/personal-taxes/cd-download/ - DOES anyone have any additional information about what to expect for 2015? If TT does not come thru on their "promise" then I am also looking elsewhere

title: I've used Turbotax for 10 years, but no more ...
content: I've used Turbotax for 10 years, but no more. The price increase and reduced features in the Deluxe version are too much for me. And who knows what will happen next year. That's it, I quit - Turbotax/Intuit, you lost this customer. I'm downloading H&R Block software this year.

title: I just found out that I can't use Sch C ...
content: I just found out that I can't use Sch C with the TT Deluxe. I feel so ripped off and will never use this product again.

title: I ended up purchasing three different editions of this terrible software because Intuit has scaled back their features
content: Don't make the mistake I did - after years of using Turbo Tax for simple, cost-effective tax filing, I ended up purchasing three different editions of this terrible software because Intuit has scaled back their features. Paying extra for Schedule C? Really? Hope you enjoyed the short term gains, Intuit, because this is the absolute last time you get my money. It would have been cheaper to get a tax professional, and easier to boot.

title: I like the product BUT I don't like the fact that ...
content: I like the product BUT I don't like the fact that as of the 2014 tax year I am forced to upgrade to the more expensive premier version in order to e-file schedules D and E.

title: One Star
content: price to file state and federal efile is getting to hi. Big jump from last year

title: if you are gonna be mad at Intuit, do it for the right reason
content: Turbotax is getting a bad wrap this year because Intuit changed up which products perform what function and slightly changed the price. Big deal. Corporations are allowed to change their price for a product ... That's capitalism. If you are gonna be mad at Intuit, do it because they waste HOURS of your time each year filing taxes in the first place. The government wants to simplify (or for some people- completely eliminate) tax filings... And guess who is lobbying against that. Yep- Intuit. See here: http://www.propublica.org/article/how-the-maker-of-turbotax-fought-free-simple-tax-filing Focus on the big picture.

title: Disappointed in crippled "Deluxe" version
content: Not happy that they decided to cripple the "Deluxe" version by removing ability to E-file with schedules C,D. I will be buying H&R block software instead.

title: One Star
content: Worst thing I have bought.

title: Lousy Product. Lousy Treatment of Users.
content: I'm a loyal TurboTax customer. Or was, anyway. This year I fell victim to the "gouge" when they removed schedule C from TurboTax Deluxe and forced those of us who needed that schedule to upgrade to TurboTax Premier. To add insult to injury, when they announced that they were giving a $25 refund back to those of us who got hosed by this, they NEVER BOTHERED to state that the deadline to get your refund was midnight of April 20. Clearly they wanted to dodge as many refund requests as possible. To top it all off, this year's product was absolutely inferior to every other edition I have used. Repeated file saving error messages which the support blog insisted were the user's fault, but continued to appear intermittently and be resolved (or not) inconsistently using the same work-around, after multiple updates. At this point I plan to switch to another product next year. Just wish I had posted earlier so that I could have warned others off this product this tax season.

title: Nickle and dime
content: Absolutely ridiculous. I've filed with turbo tax deluxe every single year but after using this software I will never do it again. It's a waste of $50. Don't be fouled with title of the product "TurboTax Deluxe Fed+State" because filing the state cost an extra $20. It used to be that with the purchase of the deluxe software one free state e-file was included, this is no longer the case. TurboTax has taken nickle and diming to a new level.

title: I like it.
content: I like it...once you get it installed, which was a problem for me, I spent hours trying to figure out if I had anti virus programs blocking it. Each time I got the same message box I would go through the process to no avail. Finally it loaded and I'm not even sure why. I think it had a default compatibility setting for Windows XP and I'm running 7. Some time after changing compatibility setting to 7, it loaded but I was still getting the same message box related to anti-virus programs blocking it. The second time I logged on, I had a similar problem, it took me over an hour to get on. Once you're on and running, it's great, but if I have the same trouble getting the program loaded next year I'm going to shop for something else.

title: Doesn't work on iPad
content: Unable to review but need to give it a star in order to write the review. My computer was on the fritz so I tried to download the program to my iPad. No luck. Turbo Tax doesn't work on the iPad platform.

title: Just go to an Accountant
content: Two changes happened over the past year, and Turbo Tax did a terrible job helping me with either. First, I moved from NY to DC. Turbo Tax did such a bad job splitting my income, and my return doesn't make sense. I don't think this is even correct. New York wouldn't even let me submit electronically because Turbo couldn't get the formatting right, I had to mail it. Second, my wife got a greencard. We got rejected twice because the IRS couldn't make the connection. I had to wait an hour on chat to ask someone what to do.
