The first time i missed the chat rep because there is no noise when the chat person messages you. Then, it took an hour for the rep to just tell me to print. So much wasted time! I really hate TurboTax and they don't really care about helping their customers. I wish I just used an accountant.

title: Bad product, lies about the guarantee, incoherent support.
content: Do not believe the 'accuracy guarantee' seal - it is not worth the paint it is painted with on the box. The calculations on my return were incorrect, causing a serious underpayment on my state taxes. I contacted Intuit and filed a claim, and they refused to take responsibility for their errors at all. Various 'tax analysts' claimed that the forms were incorrect (IRS liked the forms just fine), input was wrong (all the fields were entered exactly right), and finally that "TurboTax does not handle that situation" - except that the situation was described right there on the box as something TurboTax is designed to deal with. Bad product, lies about the guarantee, incoherent support.

title: Intuit has downgraded 2014 turbo tax deluxe
content: Product has less features vs. 2013.

title: Rip off
content: Don't waste your time on this rip off software , if you get a refund and you choose a direct deposit you will not get the same amount as your refund , guaranteed your refund will be short around 400.00 . Unless your don't care about getting rip off then go ahead and make a purchase . Use H &R Block instead much better , easy to understand and no rip off bug . Good luck .

title: One Star
content: BEWARE!! You will be charged an extra $25 to Efile when you are all done.

title: You're whack TT. Never Again!!!
content: You're whack TT... And then you allow the free upgrade to expire as if there is a limit to your sorry attempts at fixing the issue. " Oh we're sorry that we messed up a good thing and stuck it to you small business owners/contractors/consultants, but after April 20th at 11:59 PM, our apology is being withdrawn. So SORRY!" NEVER again. After 7 years of using TurboTax, I'm done and looking elsewhere like most other Delux users.

title: Unhappy Customer
content: I have used Turbo Tax Deluxe for many years so my expectation was that this product would meet my needs for 2014. After purchasing the item I was notified by e-mail that the Deluxe version had been modified and no longer covered brokerage transactions and that a product that served me well in the past at about $50 would need to be replaced by the more expensive Professional version at a cost of $90. In addition the fact that the state filing is an additional charge even though the package suggests it is included is irritating. I have enjoyed the Amazon gift card bonus option and made use of it 2 years in a row. I will be switching to H&R Block for 2015.

title: Intuit caves in
content: Intuit just announced that they were reverting the changes they made to the TurboTax software with an update in February. While it was unfortunate for Intuit to have tried to squeeze more revenue out of their loyal client base using such a method, it's nice to see that they were willing to see and act upon the outcry from their users by undoing these changes in the 2014 version. Let's hope that they've learned their lesson.

title: 1) Is is fairly easy to use
content: I will give it a 1 star for 2 reasons: 1) Is is fairly easy to use. 2) I cannot give it a zero! I did my daughters taxes using turbotax. It is a simple tax return with w-2's only. I chose the "cheap" $30 option. I finished answering all of the questions, had all the info in the correct boxes and had the bank account setup to pay turbotax and receive the refund. I see the final screen and it says it is charging me for the upgraded version even though I did not ok it(or atleast I thought). But I was giving it the benefit of the doubt. Maybe I did click the wrong turbotax package. But the only way to find out was to ERASE ALL THE INFO I just entered. Everything. So I did it all again, this time with my wife watching me. Got to the end and the same charge appears. Total scam! They know it will do it. They are just banking on the idea that you will go ahead and submit it so you wont have to go thru all the trouble of entering all the info another time. WRONG!! I went to TAXACT and had NO problems. And it cost $20 instead of $60 for turbocrap!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

title: This year, TurboTax got greedy. They lost my business forever.
content: Seriously, now they want me to upgrade to the $99 version to file a Schedule D? Since Turbo Tax now wants to nickel and dime me, they have perminantly lost my business. Sincerely, a new H&R Block customer

title: TurboTax has failed us!!
content: I have used this software for several years. This year is the absolute worst experience I have ever had. My Iowa State return still cannot be e-filed because of software issues requiring a mysterious state form that is not available. I have registered to be notified by e-mail when this mysterious form becomes available. Two times since registering I have received an email that the form is available. Twice I have learned that you have not yet fixed your software, but have promised a fix by March 6th. I read on the help page that this is a problem experienced by many users. Somebody at your company surely screwed-up this year, first with excluding items that had been included before, and now having a non-working piece of software. Knowing what I do now, I would not have purchased your buggy software!!

title: Walks thru ste by step
content: Turbo Tax is easy to use and walks you through the very unpleasant task of preparing federal and state taxes. As a side note the tax code needs serious revision so that we don't need turbo tax any longer

title: Disappointed
content: I am very disappointed in this years program. I could not get support. The on line chat would not respond. I sent several e-mails and no response. The program would not accept the information I was putting in. I have used Turbo Tax for as far back as I can remember and I am very loyal. When I buy a program I expect better customer support. I spoke to someone from Quicken support and she said that the programs are only set for the normal tax payer and if you do something out of the norm it won't accept and you have to talk to someone. That is nice, but how do you do that when no one will respond. I was only trying to do a married couple filing separate with one taking all the deductions. No matter what I did it kept saying you cannot do that. Really, if I was doing it manually I could.

title: Disappointed longtime user
content: I've used TurboTax Deluxe Fed + State to prepare and efile my family's income tax returns for years. It's expensive compared to the competition (ie. TaxACT), but I usually find it worth the premium to guide me through important life changes like a spouse passing away, purchasing a home, what to do about having some 1099-MISC income, and misc. investments. This year, the product costs the same as the 2013 version but cannot prepare Schedules D or E. This change wasn't exactly presented clearly by Intuit. Because I can't return opened software, I'm going to use TaxACT for a fraction of the price of TurboTax Premier or Home and Business. Thanks for driving me to your competitors, TurboTax.

title: Thank you TTax for NOTHING! (re: Expired Refund for Deluxe version)
content: Forced to but Deluxe version... then TTax offered $25 refund because of many complaints... Refund had to be applied for AFTER taxes filed - which I did on 4/13...so on 4/22 I attempt to apply for the refund but the site isn't there anymore...BUT in SMALL Print it said the offer expired 4/20. Customer service was NOT helpful. (Polite but NOT ABLE to satisfy the customer.) I have been a TTax user for almost 20 years - but if they continue to refuse to do the right thing... I will NEVER purchase this product again! Sincerely disappointed! Thank you TTax for NOTHING! (re: Expired Refund for Deluxe version)

title: Great. So I go to their website and create ...
content: I have been using Turbotax from almost the first year it came out. I am so upset over the changes to Turbo Tax 2014. I simply need to fill out my Sch C and I guess I was unaware of the missing forms and the changes effective this year until now Aug 2015. I always file an extension, buy turbo tax and now when I am trying to finish my Taxes I realize the changes. Great. So I go to their website and create a question and get an ID and Submit my question and offer my dislike and confusion for the changes and Melissa let me know there were no changes it has always been that way. She had no clue what I was talking about and acted like I was the only one with a problem. So I go to the internet and search and it turns out it was a change this year, there is a problem and many are upset about it. Great Customer Service right? Melissa did nothing to try to solve my problem I will definitely look at my other options before buying Turbotax again.... frustrated.....

title: One Star
content: Just read all the reviews here. Guess I'll give h&r a try this year.

title: Over the past several years, I have been an ...
content: Over the past several years, I have been an avid fan of Turbo Tax. However, this year it was a joke!!! Turbo tax failed me this year. Each update sent me in different directions completely. State Tax forms standard version, were either inaccessible, costly ($45 for access), or simply not there. Each time after an update, it was necessary to access every page as to what was still entered and what was not making it more laborous. A postcard from Costco advised of a free update/upgrade to the Deluxe version but that did not happen EVER. I finally hit a state of spending way too much time and Efiled simply to get done. However, I realized later that there was $0 refund from state -- each and every year I've received a a refund of $690+/- making this year's effort frustrating. Costco (where this year's was purchased) sent out postcards advising of a free update to the Deluxe version, but this update never came.

title: This year's program was terrible. You were unable to pull updates
content: This year's program was terrible. You were unable to pull updates. This is a known bug, because they have a manual work-a-round documented. You cannot get updated state forms, since there is no workaround for that bug. You can't file the return without getting the latest updates, but you can't get the updates. I spent more time on the phone with customer service (multiple times and multiple tickets opened) than I spent completing my taxes. And there customer service was terrible. They would not resolve my problem (after hours on the phone), they would tell me they were going to have the next level support contact me, then the next day I would get an email that the ticket was closed. This happened TWICE. I have used Turbo tax for years, but never again. If I could give 0 stars, I would.

title: From GREAT to GARBAGE in 1 year!
content: What once was great is now GARBAGE! Going to a car dealership and getting nothing but UPSELL from a scumbag car salesman would be a better experience that dealing with what Turbotax has become. I have used this product for over 20 years but NEVER AGAIN!

title: Turbo Tax was a disaster this year. After downloading ...
content: Turbo Tax was a disaster this year. After downloading Turbo Tax via Amazon, I had an "unexplained error" pop up every time I tried to update Turbo Tax. I was never able to get a single update. I did manage to file the Federal but could never file my State (Ca.). I tried numerous times to get help from Turbo Tax but was never able to get the problem resolved. I finally filed the state on paper!!!!!! I personally think Turbo Tax has become to successful to help their customer base. They should take some of their millions in profit and put it to work helping customers resolve problems. I will find another source for my 2015 tax year.!!!!!!!!!!!!!

title: Being a customer for 20 years its sad that they have alienated us
content: Seems Intuit has changed the product to require me to pay an additional $30 for functionality I used to get as part of Deluxe. Being a customer for 20 years its sad that they have alienated us. Guess I have to find a less greedy offering.

title: TurboTax lost a life-long customer
content: I've used TurboTax since 1994. This year they've clearly demonstrated their elitest attitude and how they really feel about their suckers, er customers. I only do a couple stock trades a year and for that I'm forced to buy the Premier version ?!?!? I decided to go with theÂ Deluxe package from H&R BlockÂ and it truly is Deluxe. All the federal forms, 5 fed efiles (lets you prepare unlimited returns for family and friends), and state return on CD all for $25. It imported last year's TurboTax file quickly and accurately and worked great. I'm switched for life.

title: Deluxe crippled this year
content: Deluxe crippled this year doesn't do stock trades Next version up does but way to expensive

title: Easy to use
content: Have used it for years and have been very satisfied . Very easy step by step instruction and very easy to go back and make changes if necessary. Don't know why they can't include a state e-file for the price which has went up every year that I have purchased.

title: unsatisfied
content: I was extremely disappointed that I had to upgrade in the middle of doing my taxes, and then the business edition wasn't exactly a good fit either. I ended up completing my taxes on Turbo tax, but then feeling unsatisfied, I took my returns to a professional for review and ended up amending my taxes! I had used Turbo tax for the last three years. Its too bad they felt the need to change. I don't intend on using Turbo tax in the future and no longer feel good about recommending.

title: One Star
content: I was hacked on my turbo tax this year and they wouldn't help.me

title: More money grubbing shenanigans.
content: It did the job. I've been using Turbotax for a while now, and I've been pretty happy with it. There were a few questions that I had to go to the internet to ask because the built in "help" isn't always that good. But I eventually got there. My biggest complaint was the efiling, specifically for state. My first efile for state was $19.99. About a week later, I did my mother's taxes. At the end, I tried to efile and the cost showed up as $19.99. While trying to pay for it, there were errors over and over, and it wouldn't let me purchase the state efile. I had to close Turbo Tax and open it again. Again, I walked through the efile section and I had to purchase the state efile right, yet again. This time the price had gone up to $24.99. I'd already paid for the software, did the taxes, and even purchased one efile at what I expected to pay! I'm not going to deal with the hassel of mailing documents, and I would have been ok with the $24.99 price had it not increased for who knows what reason in the middle of me trying to buy the right. After purchasing the right to efile for $24.99, everything went through without a hitch. I wasn't frustrated enough to complain, but another feature of turbotax is that they like to email you constantly and the last one I got was bugging me to post a review. Well, here it is. After all the shenanigans this year, I will probably look to one of their competitors next year. I just can't see shelling out $60 for the software, $20 to efile, and another $25 to efile again when their competitors will import my turbotax records and give me the same experience at much less cost. If you take anything away from my review -- watch the cost of your efile. Seems like the closer it gets to April 15th, the more expensive it is to user their software.

title: I like the software but TurboTax needs to quit gouging its ...
content: TurboTax blew it this year. They deleted the ability to download 1099 forms from Investment firms so I had to buy TurboTax premier to do that, but before I installed it, they restored the ability to download these forms. The cycling was a pain in the but and cost me several trips to the post office to buy and return CDs that I thought I needed or didn't need, all to do what I had been doing for years with the Deluxe version. I like the software but TurboTax needs to quit gouging its customers, both on cost and products. I suspect there will be quite a large number of ex-TurboTax customers either this year or next. I think the product works well now, but buyer beware. Alternatives are available and may be worth investigating this year.

title: It's the GO TO software for my taxes
content: I use TurboTax every year. It has always been easy to use and straight forward. The interview style can seem tedious, but it is needed to make sure you don't miss anything. The software is updated frequently and the import from the previous year data is seemless if the same software was used.

title: Quick and easy to follow as always
content: Quick and easy to follow as always. The *only* thing I don't like abour Turbotax is the poorly described differences between versions. I never know if it is worth paying a little more for the higher versions, etc...

title: NOT HAPPY
content: I am appalled at the deceit that Turbo Tax has show to us, their customers. In their Super Bowl add, the show the Boston Tea Party being settles with the Colonists accepting Turbo Tax's offer of having their taxes done "free". I bought the Turbo Tax Deluxe not expecting a $34.99 processing fee for processing my refund! I thought the IRS processed my refund? After my taxes were filed, What did Turbo Tax do for me that cost $34.99?? The IRS processed my return. the IRS sent my refund electronically to my bank. Turbo Tax did NOTHING!! Why am I being charged $34.99? I feel that Turbo Tax STOLE $34.99 from me for doing nothing! I WILL NEVER BUY A TURBO TAX PRODUCT AGAIN. AND I WILL URGE ALL MY FAMILY AND FRIENDS TO DO THE SAME!

title: Very good program except...
content: I like the step by step. I also very much like backing up. If I need to back up in the program, it instantly goes to the last page back. There is no hesitation or fear of not being able to step both directions through the program. My biggest complaint is itemizing non-monetary charity deductions. I complained about this in last year's review. When entering items, the list is very specific. I have donated lots of extraneous items that fit nowhere on the list. Either I have to skip them or enter them under a bogus name that fits the amount I think they are worth. Other than that, since my financial advisor (who used to do my taxes) retired, I now know how he did it so easily.

title: Great Job of Eroding Goodwill
content: Let me echo my dissatisfaction with TurboTax this year. I have used this product for probably 15 years, always with success. This year the price of the deluxe version was substantially higher than it was last year, but oh well that happens. Then I find out about having to upgrade--for $40--to the home and business version just to get a copy of the schedule C-EZ for my return. But, what the heck, I need to file and it is still cheaper than hiring an accountant. But what a way to erode goodwill. Now, the company rep replies below that I can go to a website and get at least $25 back. Well, I put in the required information (including my ssn--ouch!) and they cannot determine if I qualify. They give me a number to call so that I can wait on the phone until the cows come home. Thanks a lot. Next year I am going to check out the product of a competitor. This is the best thing ever for the folks at H&R Block. They should thank the geniuses at TurboTax.

title: Downgraded product for 2014
content: While it does a great job, it was a bit of a scam that they took Schedule D away from the Deluxe version. Being forced to buy a relatively expensive upgrade to get Schedule D is going to cause me to take a good look at TaxCut next year. I'm glad I'm not an Intuit stockholder, this is going to hurt their business.

title: but I am still a little disappointed that I had to complain to get the situation ...
content: Got half way through my return and when I tried to enter business income Turbo tax informed me that I had to purchase additional software for business income and expense. Since I have been using Turbo tax Deluxe since 2006 for my business, I called Intuit to register a complaint.. The party I spoke to at Intuit apologized for the inconvenience and upgraded my software immediately, and at no charge. I later received an email apology from Sasan Goodzari. At this point everything seems O.K., but I am still a little disappointed that I had to complain to get the situation resolved.

title: Unhappy with 2014 changes
content: Been a long time user of TurboTax and have really liked it. Have been using the basic edition as it perfectly suited my needs. This year they changed the editions and raised the prices. I purchased the Deductions and Homeowners edition. I recently moved and discovered that I needed to file a state return and the edition included one free state filing. Unfortunately, the free state filing expired on February 16 so I couldn't use it. Also, when I tried to report that I sold my house, it wanted me to purchase an additional edition for $30 to report this transactions, even though there were no capital gains. I hope they make improvements for next year.

title: Thanks for the heads up-time to switch
content: Thanks to everyone for posting these Schedule D problems. Been using Turbo forever. Guess it's time to switch...

title: pathetic customer service
content: I have been using TurboTax for at least 5 years and have always been happy with their products. This year I was very disappointed. I know that NC STATE was having some issues but I filed my taxes after that was corrected. My issue was that I was not able to electronically file my state taxes. I tried multiple times and called multiple times. Twice I was on hold for over 2 hours and never spoke with a rep. Next year I plan on using a different software and I will recommend that to anyone who asks. That is terrible customer service and beyond my tolerance level. The only reason I have 2 stars was because I was able to easily electroniclly fine my federal.

title: Could it get worse? Yes!
content: After going through all the bs that has been complained about endlessly on this and other forums, I finally got Premier to replace Deluxe, along with my state and e-file. Heading into my taxes I discovered that there was no state, it would not download, but TT said my software was up to date?? After spending a lot of time on TT website I learned that they had screwed this up too and I had to download a fix and start over. What would I have done if I had not discovered this innocuous fix? They knew who I was and that I would have this problem, but they never notified me. So I am into this thing about 3 hours before I can even start my taxes. At this point I have lost all faith in TT and have purchased HR Block on Amazon. I simply don't trust TT to handle my taxes anymore (for the first time since 1995, and I still have all the floppies). Hope that some of you other victims can recover from this debacle, but I would advise caution.

title: Dishonest
content: Without telling anyone they removed the schedule C from the package. I received an email apologizing and an offer for a $25.00 rebate. Unfortunately, by then I had purchased the Premier version. After I filed I went to the link to get the $25.00 and after filling in my info got a message that they had no information to issue the credit, but had a number to call if you were having problems. I called the number and got a message that if you were calling about the rebate you would have to call after April 20th. So after the 20th I tried again and got the message that the offier expired at midnight on April . Obviously they had no intention of issuing any rebates. I've used TurboTax for 15 years, but won't buy it again.

title: What an unbelievably dumb thing to do
content: Another TT user for more than 10 years here who will be switching to H&R Block software to file my 2014 taxes. What an unbelievably dumb thing to do..who the heck is going to willingly pay the premier price for functions that have always been available in the deluxe product? Considering tax season is just beginning, Intuit hasn't even started to see the worst of the backlash. This is going to get ugly. This has to be one of the biggest corporate product screw ups I've ever seen. You had the best product and a legion of folks willing to re up year after year. Now you are basically begging your long time loyal customers like me to leave by removing form D from TT Deluxe. Goodbye TurboTax. I will be making a point to let all of my friends and family to whom I have always recommended your products that they should look elsewhere now. Just wait until tax season really gets cooking. No one is going to buy the ridiculous excuses I've see from the VP and other spokespeople.

title: BEWARE OF NO CUSTOMER SERVICE AT TURBOTAX, NEVER AGAIN ...
content: BEWARE OF NO CUSTOMER SERVICE AT TURBOTAX, NEVER AGAIN!!! Have used TurboTax since it was introduced, many years ago! Filing my 2014 taxes was an absolute "DISASTER" and Intuit did NOTHING to assist me in any way. Had my state refunds (two states) not paid directly to my checking account due to the problems states had with TurboTax security issues. Paid over $85.00 for these services to Intuits third party partner, Santa Barbara Bank and Intuit, TurboTax did nothing to help me! Try and get someone on the phone and discuss a problem, WHAT PHONE NUMBER????????????? Will definitely use H & R Block or Tax Act next year. NO MORE TURBOTAX!!!!!!!!!!!

title: Schedule D missing from Deluxe
content: Schedule D has been bumped up to Premier Edition Only.

title: Not even with a 10 foot pole
content: Customer support is a joke, I spent 8 hours on hold and then was told that they had no idea why the product wouldn't work and that it wasn't their problem. Wouldn't even issue a refund! You'll get better customer service talking to the IRS and the software isn't much better.

title: Schedule c,d and e ?????
content: I am deeply disappointed that the product has changed without any warning. I have been a Turbotax customer as long as the Turbotax product has been offered. The change I am speaking of is the dropping of schedules C, D and E. I use them each year that I use Turbotax to file my taxes as well as my family members. I purchased your product assuming that the delux package was what it has been in the past. I have also been made aware that a free upgrade has been offered. I have not been offered the upgrade but would like to know how I can obtain it. If I am not offered the upgrade I will be forced to complete our returns through a different software.

title: State tax e-file
content: Everything went as planned. I have been using Turbo Tax for a number of years. I would prefer you include e-filing for the State as well as the Federal taxes. I had already paid $59.95 and then found I had to pay another $19.99 to e-file my Michigan taxes. I wanted to e-file because I was getting a refund and it is much quicker to e-file and you get your refund quicker as well. A few years ago I could buy the Federal tax program for something like $29.99. Adding the state to federal program of course costs more, but it seems to me that if you're going to charge $59.95, you could throw in the e-file for the State as well.

title: Not as good as before but won't stop me from buying next year
content: I didn't like it as much as past years versions. I tried to do a friends taxes that needed some extra work due to a spouse's disability and wasn't able to get it done with this version even though I should have been able to. Sometimes continually trying to improve something leads you down the wrong road. Pretty sure that's what happened with this year's version. Considering the apology emails from the CEO of Intuit/TurboTax, saying they messed up? Don't feel like I'm too far off on my opinion of it.

title: Slimy Intuit/TurboTax marketing tactics.
content: After many years of using the Intuit product, it's goodbye TurboTax for me! I'll probably go with the H&R Block software this year.

title: Free upgrade to Premier does not work!!! Don't buy!
content: OK, so I figured since Intuit promised a free upgrade to Premier for my Capital Gains/Losses, etc. I'd purchase the deluxe since I've been using turbotax for over 10 years. Unfortunately, I just got to the investment income section and it is time for the free upgrade to Premier, I kept receiving an error message. Turbotax gave me a message to call 800-268-8957 to get an upgrade code to enter which would enable me to upgrade. This is where it gets worse because after listening to a recorded message which covered both the free upgrade and the $25 refund for those who already purchased Premier, I have been on hold listening to some crappy Muzak for 30 minutes (so far!) with no other option. At this point I'm not sure if anyone will ever answer the phone to help me upgrade. So now I'm stuck in the middle of filing my taxes with no recourse but to sit on the phone hoping someone from Intuit picks up. So, all in all, a horrible experience that seems to very uncommon! It's a shame.

title: Works well.
content: Works as well as past editions. As everyone is aware of now there are some schedules, i.e. C and D that are no longer included in this version. However, for more simple filings it fills the requirement. This version included 1 state tax filing and once you have completed the federal filing it seamlessly fills out the state return. My only negative comment is; some questions are asked in a manner in which I don't find the answer is obvious.

title: Run Away from Intuit
content: Their timing is spot on, just two months after Intuit abandoned the users of "Bill Pay". After 21 years of using the Bill Pay, they just cut it off. The blame was on the Banks as a security issue???? The truth is that they have not upgraded the 2007 version and the customer service person in Pakistan, told me that he could not fix the issue, but there people that could, but their phone number had been disconnected. Suggested that I upgrade to Intuit 2015, which I did only to find out that It did not include Bill Pay. So I called Bill Pay service in the US only to be told "That is not my problem, I would have to contact the software customer service which he had no phone number that he could provide to me". I stopped the auto bank withdrawal. Then they tried to make me pay for the 2 months when I had no service. If they ever came back with a workable Bill pay, they just shove it!

title: I am thoroughly disgusted with Turbo Tax
content: I am thoroughly disgusted with Turbo Tax. First of all they tried to pull a fast one one and charge more for the same package. Oooops! they said, silly us, we made a typo. Lie! Last year, I got Kaspersky free with Turbo from Fry's; this year nothing. Then Turbo Tax says, file Electronically to speed your refund. Get it within 21 days. Wrong, They lied. They have screwed up so badly this year that they cannot tell the truth, del;iver their promises, and CANNOT BE REACHED to express your disappointment. I will never use Turbo Tax again.

title: I am very disappointed with Turbo Tax
content: For tax year 2014, I am very disappointed with Turbo Tax. I paid $59.95 for the Deluxe version at Staples and it did not have the necessary forms I needed to complete my return. I had to download additional forms at an additional cost of $30.00, making my total cost $89.95. Last year, for tax year 2013, I used the Basic version at a cost of $29.95 and it had everything I needed to file my return. I have used Turbo Tax for several years and have always been satisfied with the product. I most likely will not use it again.

title: I'm gone now, and I tend to hold a grudge when mistreated
content: Looking on my PC I see I've used Turbotax every year since 1999 and was happy with it. I really did not want to change but when you crippled the product this year in the name of consistency (please), I finally reached the tipping point and switched to H&R Block - and it was easy. A very similar experience. You'll find that when you lose customers, it's very hard to win them back - much, much harder than keeping them satisfied. You play a similar game with the quicken product when you disable network downloads after a few years to force customers to repurchase the same product to maintain existing functionality. I guess when you get to the point of doing that every year, I'll have to explore my options on that product as well.

title: Turbo tax 2014 was pretty easy to use
content: Turbo tax 2014 was pretty easy to use. It didn't take me long to do our taxes this year but then we don't have as much to deduct as we used to. Filing was also easy. But the state of Illinois took over a week to accept our filing. We got our federal refund pretty quickly. Still waiting for state but then we expected that this year. I have used TurboTax for several years and have always been satisfied. Much cheaper than using a tax service.

title: State tax preparation is an additional charge!
content: There is now a charge for the state tax return.

title: Overall OK, not happy with delay in State Refun this year and no communication about it
content: The software itself I love and it is easy to follow and user friendly. I love how it walks you through step by step so to hopefully catch other deductions that someone might not have known about. With that being said, I often wonder if an actual tax advisor would be able to catch more deductions but I'm not sure. The 1 thing I am NOT happy about this year is that there is some issue with the State Refund and I e-filed early this year and still in March 2015 have not received my refund so I'm not thrilled with that and noone has bothered emailing us to let us know when to expect it.

title: It wouldn't be so bad, but Turbotax did not tell anyone of this ...
content: Do not buy! Especially if you have used in the past. Turbotax has decided to alienate their loyal customers by changing their software so that what I have used for over 10 years is now THE WRONG VERSION. I now have to spend more money for the same product. It wouldn't be so bad, but Turbotax did not tell anyone of this change. So I get all the way through my taxes and happen to notice that two of the documents I need are not in there AND I HAVE TO BUY IT AGAIN! I will not buy this product again! Not only that, but my four children also use Turbotax... Correction...used to use Turbotax. Turbotax lost not one customer but a family of taxpayers that will be looking for another solution next year. I only gave it one star because my daughter likes the new commercials.

title: One Star
content: Additional fees of $58 to file . What rip-off!

title: One Star
content: switching to Block

title: Not pleased with it this year
content: Unfortunately I had to mail in my IL return. I could not get my tax return to print, without "RETURN NOT FINAL", "DO NOT FILE" printed across it, no matter what I did. The program kept telling me it was final and ok to print. Several attempts at TurboTax support did not help. I finally input the numbers my self manually on blank forms. Not pleased with it this year!!! Don't know if I'll use it again. For a little more than the price of this, I can have a professional prepare my taxes and not worry about needing "Technical Support"!

title: Too expensive
content: After many years I am switching to H&R Block.

title: e-filing will not work in Turbo Tax Deluxe if you have an IRS security PIN
content: If you got an e-filing pin (IP PIN) from the IRS for security, it is 6 digits, not 5 like the one you click to get in Turbo Tax. Turbo Tax will not accept the 6 digit code and the IRS will not accept the e-filing with any other PIN so you can not e-file At ALL! Your return will be rejected! Ridiculous!!

title: Disappointed in the new model
content: Disappointed in the new model. Will not be using Turbo Tax this year. I have used Turbo tax for 10 years.

title: I've returned from H & R Block
content: Downloaded H & R Block because of all the bad reviews for Turbo Tax. I had been using Turbo Tax for over 15 years. After completing my Federal returns I was told by Support that their product could not do my State Part-Time Resident return and I needed to complete it by hand. After efiling my Federal, I dumped H & R Block and purchased the tried and true Turbo Tax. Started from scratch and it was able to complete my Federal and State returns much more quickly AND gave me a better return on my Federal side. Needless to say, I amended my returns using Turbo Tax. I will be returning to using Turbo Tax once more as it proved faster and more thorough. I regret my decision to switch.

title: Found it a Great Program
content: I found TurboTax a good way to prepare my taxes. I ran into a problem when adding my 1090s for myself and husband but soon solved the problem and found I was not checking the new 1090 box and going to the other person option. It is easier than going to have your taxes done by a professional who would also just key in information that you provide. Since your info is the only source to prepare taxes, why would you just feed that info to a pro when you can get the same assistance from TurboTax. Good program and my taxes came back in 1 week.

title: TurboTax Mixed Bag
content: Used TurboTax for the past several years, pretty consistent but could not get the included one state tax to download free. It wanted another $19.95 so I just mailed my state tax for the cost of a stamp plus the inconvenience of manual entry. I'll reconsider TurboTax vs H.R. Block next year.

title: It is too bad that TurboTax made changes in the program originally designed ...
content: It is too bad that TurboTax made changes in the program originally designed for Deluxe User's WITHOUT proper prior notice to loyal users. That was a big mistake and speaks loads to a claim of greed by the company. That is the reason I gave them a four star rating. I like the product. I dislike the company's sneaky way of jacking the price for the SAME product. They realized the mistake in their move too late and offered apologies and refunds. You can't unring a bell!

title: I have been using TurboTax for 7+ years and with ...
content: I have been using TurboTax for 7+ years and with the recent changes to gouge customers it has caused me to look at switching for next year. I had to buy the Premium version due to having a rental property and this has always been included in the past in Deluxe. I just noticed there was a refund available but instead of doing the right thing Intuit has decided to put an expiration date on this refund. Why should there be an expiration date when they have gouged the consumer? Very frustrated...called support and when I asked the tough questions they ended up hanging up on me. Time to switch for next year!

title: Two Stars
content: Doesn't seem to work like Deluxe used to.

title: Using the help feature nol very easy.
content: I was given a special number by the IRS to file my taxes. Turbo Tax has a place for a special number but it isn't the one that has the extra digit the IRS sends you. It took me a long time to wade thru the goobly gook of Turbox tax help to finally find the place where you can enter that special number. Other wise, I found filing very easy. I have used Turbo Tax for 9 years.

title: Problem with 2014 Turbo Tax
content: I have used Turbo Tax for the past 10 years with no problems. I find it very easy to use as it walks you through each section. Now the program for 2014 had a major flaw, omission, that required you to upgrade to a higher version. This alert came after I had completed most of the return and resulted in time and money lost. Intuit should had been more pro active and put out the correct version to start. I realize there is a rush to market on these products, however it should not be done at the expense of the consumer.

title: Goodbye turbo tax.
content: Corporate greed or ineptness or just plain stupidity, it really does not matter but someone, somewhere within turbo tax made some really bad decisions concerning this years tax software. I have returned my software to the store and now must choose a different software after so many loyal years with turbo tax. Sad, very sad, but goodbye turbo tax. You do not even deserve a one star rating but that is the lowest.

title: I love TurboTax, BUT this will probably be the LAST TIME I USE IT!
content: I love TurboTax, BUT this will probably be the LAST TIME I USE IT! It's sad that TurboTax Deluxe don't cover stock or mutual fund transactions. It gets a little pricey to move up from TurboTax Deluxe. TurboTax always is very easy to use and is an outstanding way to do Income Tax. I get it only 3 stars because the price is getting out of control.

title: Software is not good I had to use my own tax knowledge to ...
content: Software is not good I had to use my own tax knowledge to properly file. Does not present all tax credits for instance it did not offer me the option to put my 401k withdrawal as a withdrawal for the purchase of my first home. If I did not have this knowledge on my own it could have cost me an extra 1000$

title: Tax Season
content: I have been using the TurboTax for many years. This program works for me. There has been some changes that not all people can use Deluxe so make sure you read the box what it includes before you buy. I have been able to do my state and federal taxes and also my daughters state and federal taxes with no problem. In my state it does cost a small addition amount to file on line. The price seems to go up every year, but small enough so you don't notice.

title: Easy to use and is pretty thorough with asking income/deduction ...
content: Easy to use and is pretty thorough with asking income/deduction questions. Giving it two stars because of the issue that others have already stated, you cannot use the deluxe version if you have to file capital gains tax. I also didn't know you get charged an additional $35 fee for state filing on top of the $24. I'm sure it's in the fine print but the way the product is marketed is a little deceitful. I hear it's cheaper to use HR Block for State filing I may try them next year.

title: The e-file wouldn't work.
content: TurboTax kind of let us down this year. We've been Turbo Tax users since 1999 and have always been satisfied in the past, but this year we couldn't "e-file" . So we paid for a "free" service that we couldn't use. Called tech people for a week and did exactly what we were told to do over and over.......at least 6 or 8 times and nothing worked. Finally decided to just mail it in. BTW, the IRS folks couldn't help either. The "signature pin" was never accepted. .

title: One Star
content: Cannot download, no response from Amazon

title: Unclear as to what is needed to buy
content: We bought what we thought we needed. It turned out that we had to buy an additional download for 30 more dollars. Turbo tax said that they would refund that amount but we have yet to see it. We don't expect it. They need to make it more clear as to the specifics of what each product contains and if more downloads are needed. We feel that they were dishonest.

title: Quick download / great price
content: I've been using Turbo for years now and usually bought it through my local warehouse. I think this was roughly the same price and it was so convenient to download and begin my taxes without having to make a trip out. I'm always happy with the walk through instructions from Turbo but you can easily skip sections that are not pertinent. If you've never used Tubo Tax, you will appreciate the fact that it profiles your personal and employment info from your prior year and will prompt questions such as "Did you pay ABC Child Care again this year?". Taxes are never fun, but Turbo Tax makes the process bearable.

title: Great Software!
content: Walked me through step by step which included a small home business and the rental and sell of a home. It offers opportunities to call professionals at Intuit, (owner of Turbo Tax) Really like the software.

title: Switching software
content: Switched to H&R Block software. Thanks Intuit, you've done me a favor!

title: it can easily compile the results for each separate section
content: This is a very well thought out and developed tax program. It will very efficiently guide you through all of the intricate complexities of filing all your taxes. It helps you gather your information by walking you through very specific questions, which you can answer in each very doable stage of the whole process. Later since it has kept all of the necessary details together for you, it can easily compile the results for each separate section, in order to give you the maximum benefit allowable by law. It definitely takes all of the mystery and alot of the stress, out of tax time. I would highly recommend it.

title: One Star
content: Very confusing

title: Turbo Tax Squeezing its Customers
content: I was very disappointed that Turbo Tax limited the product by requiring me to have to update from the Basic program that I have used for years. In fact, even the Deluxe was limited. I was pressured to upgrade for an additional $30 which I refused to do. I was able to finagle the forms so as to reproduce what I needed. My return is not that complicated. I will be looking for alternatives next year or I will go back and hand-complete the forms like we all used to do.

title: Last time for e-filing for me
content: This is the last time I'll be using this to file my taxes online. The fees are ridiculous. Not only do you purchase the software, they also charge a fee to transmit the state tax return ($24.99), PLUS another handling-type of fee of around $40. So, add on another $65 or so to the cost of the software if you're planning on filing electronically. Filing online is convenient, but I'd much rather have those extra fees in my own bank account, thanks. Otherwise, it's very easy to use and I do like how it pulls info from the previous year's Turbo Tax filing. It also asks about possible changes that may have occurred during the previous year - marriage, moving expenses for a new job, etc. - but it's easy to skip those if nothing has changed. Much faster than filling out the forms by hand, but, again, not pleased with the extra fees that aren't mentioned until the very end of going through the filing process.

title: Watch out for changes in Schedule C!!!
content: The virtual elimination of the business deductions (for anything over $100) portion of Schedule C in the so-called "Deluxe" edition is a complete scam, forcing you, if you have any kind of home or side business to spend another $40 to upgrade to the next level. Really? Was there an increased cost to Turbotax to produce this software which justifies this price increas? I have used TurboTax for the past twelve years, but next year I will be using another company's software.

title: Great program, easy to understand and use
content: Great program, easy to understand and use. I have used it for several years, but while it says free e- filing, at the of the program you are trapped, tricked into using their email and it costs an additional $50.00. Shame on TurboTax and Amazon for using such underhanded tactics to trick their buyers out of $50.00. It's be a cold day in Hell before I fall for this scam again.

title: Print version
content: I have been using Turbo Tax for many years, but this year's version was bad. My major complaint is that I could not print the final version from a different computer as I placed the final version on a zip drive and hoped when I got to the office I could print it. When I called your help desk I got a automated voice that did not answer my question. Then as per instructions, I emailed the IRS for a hard copy and so far have not received one. This was a little over a month ago.

title: Frustrating !
content: Last year (2013)was the first time using Turbo tax,always used a tax expert. It was wonderfully easy last year,and advocated using Turbo to friends.This year it took over 6 hours ,even using a phone representative to file very minimal deductions. The program froze and wouldn't efile . I was told to check with a computer expert to service my compuetr,which I did and was told nothing was wrong with the computer. Going back to the Turbo,on phone representative who advocated the help of her supervisor, we plowed through and finally was able to email the tax forms to Feds and state. No one seems to be able to indicate what the problem was ,other than that the some additional forms were new/different this year all which I didn't need to use ,i.e the one for stock revenue and the one for rentals. Since I didn't use these ,I am not sure how this affected my filing.

title: Still a good product, to bad their upper managment are such greedy SOB's.
content: I bit the bullet and purchased this after purchasing the H&R Block version and doing my taxes only to find what it calculated to be low in my opinion. Running the numbers through Turbo Tax, it asked more questions over the area I figured the other should have. In the end, Turbo Tax said I was owed more than twice what H&R Block had calculated. H&R does offer a return policy, but it's not worth my time for the amount I purchased it for. I will be sticking with Turbo Tax for next years taxes as well. Hopefully they don't pull any stupid stuff like the last time.

title: Product worked great AFTER they finally provided a free upgrade to include ...
content: Product worked great AFTER they finally provided a free upgrade to include the features that TT Deluxe had in previous releases. I felt they were sneaky in the re-done product release and that caused me to lose respect for intuit. I have used Turbo Tax for the past 10 years and was always just grabbed the new version each year but will shop around next year before making a decision to use this product.

title: Excellent, Easy To Use Tax Prepartion Software
content: I've used Turbo Tax for several years and have always found it makes income tax preparation much, much easier than trying to work my way through the forms without its guidance. Being retired, my wife and I have had to pay little and our returns have been pretty simple for the last several years. I've never had a problem with any of my Turbo Tax returns, and a couple of years ago was able to save a friend much work and expense in using my software to spot a very large error made by one of the well known tax preparation companies. I like the program and will continue to use it.

title: Good Product but still know the tax laws
content: I have been using TurboTax for years and it still is the easiest way to do my taxes, even when I worked overseas with complicated returns. This year, however, I discovered an large error in the Pennsylvania State return which I had to override. I withdrew large sums from my retirement account at work (401K) for rollover and other investments. TurboTax treated these withdraws as state income leaving me with a large tax bill. PA does not tax retirement income from qualified plans if you are over 59.5 years and retired.

title: It's not the Turbotax that it once was
content: It's not the Turbotax that it once was. The question-and-answer walk-through is relatively simple, the program also checks to see if you would do better itemizing or taking the standard deduction another plus. Although I may have overlooked it I would like to see a feature for a married couple to show you the difference between filing married joint versus married individual. On the negative side - once you get down to printing your return either to file or for review Intuit gets so busy trying to sell you their other products that it makes finalizing your tax return aggravating. Up until this year I have been very pleased with Turbotax and felt that it was worth a slightly higher price, next year when I'm ready to do my 2015 tax return I may have to rethink this.

title: Slowly Declining Service
content: I was an extremely loyal customer for years... I loved the easy-to-use software and the awesome customer service. They have raised prices and gouged their customers the last few years. Slowly they seem to be getting worse and I will look to other services next year.

title: good product and easy to use
content: We purchased the same version of Turbo Tax as in other years. It is so easy because you do not have to input all your personal information each year. We discovered that in order to do investments, we should have purchased the next version up, but Turbo Tax gave it to us this year for free. They double check everything and tell you if there are any errors to be fixed. They also give you an idea of how likely your form will be audited.We will continue to use the product in future years. You can efile both federal and state, but have to pay extra for state. That would be the only negative for me.

title: Support Issues
content: I've been a loyal TurboTax user for at least 15 years. The program is very easy to use, and very detailed. This year however, I'm getting extremely upset at the runaround I'm getting trying to get an answer to a question. I've gone to [...] and input all the requested information. I receive a phone number and Incident ID#. I call the phone number given and it states that this number is for Federal refund status only, and if I have any other questions, please go to [...] I don't know how can I reach a real live person. Next year I will probably try HR Block software!

title: Disappointed
content: I use this every year but I'm asking myself, "why"? There are a number of "disconnects" regarding the logic. the print function is a joke. Moving back and forth between Federal and state is goofy. Charging $29.95 to file state electronically is a rip-off!. You guys have been publishing this software for years ... have you ever tried to use it? You need a systems analyst to make this "user4 usable' ... oh, I forgot that's not necessary ... software geeks can figure it out ... not!!!

title: I like TurboTax. I've used it for the past several ...
content: I like TurboTax. I've used it for the past several years. Relative to the change which was made making folks to have to purchase a more advanced version with Schedule D for example to simply report the sale of stock, etc., and had I been one of those people, that would have had me commenting a little differently here . But it didn't and I'm pleased with the product as it was intended for my use. Thank you.

title: I was ordering Turbo tax for a gift. I ...
content: I was ordering Turbo tax for a gift. I find out that you want me to download it. I must cancel order

title: TurboTax offers no help
content: I am less than satisfied. Filling out the tax forms was made easy. BUT.... I had a problem later on, did not know what to do, and had no way to contact TurboTax by phone to talk to a LIVE person to help me solve the problem. TurboTax needs to have a way to talk to someone when a loyal customer like myself needs immediate help. Howard

title: Turbo tax is great for normal returns but they shut down e-file on ...
content: Turbo tax is great for normal returns but they shut down e-file on all state returns this year, I could see them having to do the same on fed returns if fraud reached the same point. Weather its Intuit or IRS or both togeather need to address this growing problem. After all e filing and security are big concerns when your sharing this level of info.

title: One Star
content: Need schedule D

title: When I tried to file my taxes, I discovered ...
content: When I tried to file my taxes, I discovered that someone else had already filed for a refund and it had been paid out. Now I have to go through all the red tape and wait 6 months for my refund. The bogus person used turbo tax to file their refund. Turbo tax needs to protect the information on their site and I will NO longer use Turbo tax after using it for years. It appears that Turbo tax is the only prepared product to have this problem.

title: 2015 "Deluxe" version has reduced coverage, forcing more people to buy Premiere
content: Great product, but Deluxe no longer works if you sell any stock or mutual funds during the year. Same BS again in 2015 version, you have to pay for Premiere version if you had any stock/investment sales, which was previously included in Deluxe version. Intuit's explanation is total hogwash, they want to force most users to pay $90 instead of $50-60.

title: You can try it, but Don't blame me if it crashes your computer.
content: Last year I had to use my wife's computer to do our taxes. Installing TT Deluxe on my computer caused it to crash the internet and I had to reinstall the OS. Now I find that TT deluxe has done the same thing to a friend of mine's computer. I am switching to H&R Block after 20+ years of Turbo Tax Deluxe. What awful business practices Intuit. I hope you read this Bob. CF Mike McLallen Shreveport, Louisiana

title: Overall it's pretty good. There are errors in the program
content: Overall it's pretty good. There are errors in the program, and it's impossible to get a hold of Turbo Tax to inform them of the problem. The problem I encountered was in the college tuition portion. I am paying off loans, not attending college. I answered the question "NO" not attending college, but the program continued as if I had answered yes. I just deleted the entire tuition credit so that I could file my taxes

title: Not the same as last year. Plus I sold ...
content: Not the same as last year. Plus I sold and bought a new home so this wasn't the software that I needed and found it hard to get the help to determine which product I did need. Plus I wanted to move it to a different computer and found it very hard even when following Intuit's instructions. I would only use turbotax again if all I needed to do was deductions.

title: Its reliable
content: I have used TurboTax for several years. It is a very complete and efficient program for doing taxes. The company is very prompt in notifying its customers of any known problems and is responsive to its users. I also use the ItsDeductible program that easily transmits its data to my tax form when needed. It also is very easy to use. Thanks for a great and reliable product.

title: It SUCKs that I can't print out state form
content: It SUCKs that I can't print out state form. Use to be with Turbo Tax free federal you didn't have to pay for the state form, just print it out (all filled in, that was nice). Then address an envelope to the state, add a stamp you state taxes files. FOR THE COST OF A STAMP. NOT NOW, I say CORPORATE GREED is the problem. I don't think I will purchase turbo tax next year.

title: and was just as easy to use and navigate
content: I gave up on Turbo Tax this year after using them for 21 years, and bought H&R Block. It was cheaper, imported last years info and all prior years depreciation seamlessly, and was just as easy to use and navigate. It is different than TT but just as easy to use. My Federal Return is 50-60 pages so you can imagine it is quite extensive and H&R Block handled it without any issues.

title: Last year I use Turbo Tax
content: I'll be using H&R Block next year. The deluxe version this year was a big disappointment. The California forms couldn't be printed out without a do not use watermark. Certain forms are missing this year. The deluxe package came off as a scam, to get you to purchase an upgrade. I'm not thrilled at all that this software is being used by identity thieves to steal fake returns in your name. If you're a Turbo Tax user, I've heard the H&R Block software can correctly import your returns from last year. Might be worth taking a look.

title: It was easy to use and easy to look up answers if ...
content: I had used an accountant for the past few years but this time I decided to try it on my own since there is a money back guarantee. I have used Turbo Tax in the past. I have never used any other brand of tax software. I can only speak to my experience. It was easy to use and easy to look up answers if anything was confusing. The fact that it asks every little question under the sun helped me think of deductions I wouldn't have otherwise remembered. I was pleased with the refund compared to the accountant and will use TurboTax again.

title: TT worked great. I've used it for about 7 years now
content: TT worked great. I've used it for about 7 years now. The only problem I've had was all the Emails saying that something wasn't right with the 2014 product. It worked fine for me. Also, the cost of what it really cost to to E-file your taxes. When you buy the product you'd think thats all you'd need to spend. Oh no, figure on another $40 or $50 in hidden cost.

title: Turbotax Deluxe no longer supports Schedules D or E
content: Turbotax Deluxe no longer includes Schedule E (rental property) or Schedule D (capital gains), unless you want to manually fill in the forms with no transfer of data to the rest of your return. You get a message saying that if you need these forms, you have to "upgrade" to Turbotax Premier for an additional $30. Bait and switch. Time to try competing tax software, return this one to Amazon.

title: ... using this for a few years and its been easy to follow and easy to understand
content: I been using this for a few years and its been easy to follow and easy to understand. This year wasn't good. It had told me it would give 1 member a free state e-file and instead I got charged for all 3. I am disappointed that I had to pay for it but after all the work I put into it, I wasn't about to just change and use something else. I have tried to contact customer service and received no response.

title: I do the tax returns for most of my family ...
content: I do the tax returns for most of my family members. This software is getting way too expensive. After paying $50 for the software I then have to pay $40 for each additional state then I have to pay another $20 to file the state. That's $110 just for one person to file their taxes. I think I will look into something else for next year.

title: One Star
content: Beware...... Hidden costs.... Will never use again

title: Printing Reams
content: I want to print copies of my taxes for my records. Even the Tax Return Only option prints pages of instructions, vouchers and other stuff. This means I have to go print the pages I want one at a time. Some of the pages I do want have big black codes on them. It's a big waste of ink. Makes me think about going back to paper and pen. I tried to send this feedback to TurboTax on their site, but their Contact page is only a search of their knowledge base.

title: very easy to navigate and use
content: Overall, very easy to navigate and use. Did not like, in the middle of the application, having to purchase in order to complete State filing and then AGAIN another purchase in order to electronically submit my State filing! Total cost, software and separate filing charges, for individual taxes was about $100. Did I save money? On the fence.

title: Goodbye Turbo Tax...
content: I will not be using Turbo Tax again. After several years of use, Turbo Tax's recent software changes and questions around security and accuracy have turned me off the product. Time for a switch.

title: What good is the program if the end result isn't what ...
content: I efiled from Afghanistan, and my return was supposed to be direct deposited. The IRS still is mailing it to my home address. What good is the program if the end result isn't what you requested!

title: State calculations would not total correctly.
content: Federal tax computations were okay. I purchased an additional State income tax package for a total of two State fillings software and the calculations would not calculate correctly. I ended up doing them by hand on forms I requested from the States. I've used TurboTax in previous years and never had a problem but this year was extremely frustrating.

title: After buying it and trying to do the free upgrade ...
content: After buying it and trying to do the free upgrade and failing, I went to TaxAct for free and came up with the exact same refund. For Free! Next year I will be smarter and do it all for free!

title: Completely satisfied customer.
content: I really appreciate TurboTax coming out and reverting their Deluxe to its original version (and not the updated one which removed some features). While this didn't affect me directly, it did affect my opinion of the company. I enjoy using this program. It's easy, and as I hate all things math, I am all the more grateful for it. I feel as though it checks and double-checks everything, and I feel safe sending my tax information with it, knowing that it's backed by some very powerful software.

title: TurboTax Easy, Quick and accurate.
content: I have been using TurboTax since its inception. I have used it prepare and submit both mine and others Federal and State Taxes. There has never been and instant of errors or having to resubmit. Electronic submittals result in quick receipt of refunds. One benefit of continuous use is that prior submittals are used to initialize the next years tax preparation.

title: I've used TurboTax in the past and it did the ...
content: I've used TurboTax in the past and it did the job. But this year, they changed the program and I was charged an additional $19.99 to file my state return. One state return used to be included in the purchase price. Their packaging mislead me to believe it was the same this year. The package stated "State Return Included." Next year I will use Tax Act!

title: New turbo tax made me nervous as it did not ...
content: New turbo tax made me nervous as it did not cover what deluxe covered and I had to pay fee to file state tax. It took over 30 minutes to get help. Also it did not have audit risk profile.

title: Still a Fan of Turbo Tax
content: I'm still a fan of Turbo Tax, although they caught a lot of bad publicity for making in my opinion some bad marketing decisions this year. But for my needs, it still works well. If you have a complex tax issue, I'm not sure why you would try to do your own taxes unless you are educated and trained in tax prep. But if, like me, your tax issues are pretty standard and common, I think you will find Turbo Tax still easy to use and sufficient.

title: The software was easy to use as always
content: The software was easy to use as always; however, I was under the impression they were waiving or reducing the state tax filing fee due to numerous consumer complaints about the increase in rates this year. That did not happen. When I was ready to file electronically, I still had to pay the entire fee. I sent feedback to intuit but have not received any further communications.

title: Read All the product details to make sure this is the best product for you, for me so far so good :-)
content: So far, so good. I've read a lot of negative reviews and because I'm a long time customer, I did and recommend reading the product details, bottom line, If you were a customer who used T.Tax, the upgrades are free, that is thus far as I'm still working on, however I'm optimistic for 2014 that what I've used for years at a great price, I will still receive everything that's been available for years. I'll update this review once I complete, or if I have to purchase I'm not expecting. We'll see......

title: One Star
content: Goodbye Turbotax as have been a loyal user for 20+ years...

title: It is very user friendly and easy to follow
content: I've been using TurboTax for years and have never had a problem. It is very user friendly and easy to follow. This year was the first year we had to address health insurance (Affordable Health Care) and I had a question about it. I contacted one of their tax consultants, who quickly answered my question and even took the time to show me how to verify his answer. He was amazing. I recommend TurboTax to all my family and friends, actually to anyone who will listen.

title: It was the old bait and switch routine and I hate that and this product
content: They had me buy an upgrade in the middle of the tax return. It was the old bait and switch routine and I hate that and this product. I don't trust them anymore and won't buy it again.

title: I have been told the download version runs better.
content: I have done my taxes the last two years with Turbo Tax discs, both have failed and had to have customer service complete the filing. I have been told the download version runs better.

title: One Star
content: Misleading and manipulative.

title: Beware
content: Wasted my money on this one- missing necessary functions from previous years unless paying for an upgrade. Turbotax just lost 20+ years of loyalty - now going with their competitor.

title: Was happy to pay extra for this because it said it ...
content: Was happy to pay extra for this because it said it could do state... Was upset when it cost me 20 to file the state form!!!! Probably use H+R block next year!!!

title: comfortable as old jeans
content: TruboTax just works....comfortable as old jeans. The one thing I don't like about it is only 5 e-filings per year even if I purchase more than one copy. Other than that it is just a great solid tax prep program. Sure there are companies selling tax prep software and usually at a lower cost, but I find none easier and more trusted to use.

title: I probably won't use TurboTax next year. There is ...
content: I won't use TurboTax next year. There is no reason for the program to be divided the way it is except greed. I'm aware that you were in business to make profit but you lost sight of the balance between service, trust and the bottom line. I bet your competitors are laughing their asses off. Somebody needs to be fired. Probably a lot of somebodies. Bye bye Bob.

title: Good Program. Just watch for those "Hidden charges".
content: The program works fine. I just thought it was a little too much to have to pay extra for the version of Turbo Tax that included the sate forms, and then having to pay extra again to file the state tax using Turbo Tax. It's a lot like being taxed twice for the same item.

title: Expext to pay almost 3 times more
content: The product is great...But the price is a scam, you end up having to pay extra and the charges occur when you are tired and have entered all info and just pay to get it over with.

title: It looks like I will be finding another program
content: I did not appreciate the changes that were made to the Deluxe version. While Intuit used the excuse to make it more customer friendly, I truly feel it was just to get the public to have to buy a more expensive version. Also, after spending $49, you charge another $39.99 to file with the state, ridiculous. It looks like I will be finding another program.

title: They screwed over their customers by taking features out of the product and forcing people like me, to pay to upgrade after alre
content: TurboTax is a company that has not had enough competition. They screwed over their customers by taking features out of the product and forcing people like me, to pay to upgrade after already buying the deluxe. They got such backlash, they offered a partial refund, but with a deadline. There are other tax software products out there. After many years of using turbotax, it's time to go elsewhere. Stay away from Intuit.

title: See ya TurboRipOff ...
content: I've been using TurboTax for 15 years but this recent change is forcing me to switch. I don't have many investments but now I have to pay $89 for Premier? H&R Block is only $29.99 for PC download with capital gains (in my case loss) support. Goodbye TurboTax!

title: I think it's a complete scam that you have to ...
content: I think it's a complete scam that you have to upgrade to the premier edition to do forms that you.ve always been able to do in the past (capital gains/losses, and partnerships).

title: Can't be beat.
content: Have been a user of TT for 15+ years. was very unhappy the way they handled to initial rollout of the Deluxe version. Glad they saw the light and fixed it with free upgrade. Hopefully next year they'll do it right. Unfortunately for me I went and bought H&R's tax software because I needed Schedules C & D now!.. No comparison to TT Deluxe (fixed) and once the free upgrade was available I went back to TT. Ended up costing about the same as if I had bought the Premier version initially. That has made me unhappy with Intuit for sure.

title: Updates
content: I had many problems downloading the updates- to the point I had to go to your Help People. I spent about 2 hours w/ Ramono, trying to fix the problem. He finally downloaded the 2014 program into my computer. I wasn't the only one having this problem- according to the many inquiries on you site. I have used Turbo Tax since 1998 and have never had problems like this. I sure hope next year proves much better, or you may loose me. Judy J Phillips

title: Safe, Accurate and Secure
content: It makes a dreaded task reasonably easy to do. Accurate and quick responses help get back a refund. There are a lot of questions that I feel are necessary to eliminate errors in reporting, but overall it is the best of the breed as far as I am concerned. I have been using Turbo Tax for some years now and I have never encountered a problem with the IRS or any security issues that would affect me financially. A good product for the hard working tax paying people.

title: I still like the interface and that you can easily go to ...
content: Having used it since the 80's, I still like the interface and that you can easily go to manual forms view. However, I don't like that you can't get direct support when you find program errors. For example, I use PA state and this year it incorrectly increased my interest income by 50% and when they finally corrected that, they still have the allocation between spouses incorrectly split and reported on forms they shouldn't have used. This is a small problem but makes you wonder what else is wrong and highlights the inability to reach them easily for support. H&R, which I tried for kicks, experienced NO such interest allocation issue, but I didn't like their interface as much.

title: I was never able to download and use my purchase ...
content: I was never able to download and use my purchase from Amazon. I had to go to Turbo Tax directly and purchase. I spent almost $50 at Amazon for a product that I could not use.

title: WARNING. NO SCHEDULE C
content: Which means for you that you cannot use this software if you are self employed. you need to buy a more expensive version. save yourself a lot of money on time and use taxact.

title: Intuit Finally Corrects Its Initial Fail for the 2014 Tax Year - the Corrected Product Works Fine
content: I've been using TurboTax for the past four or five years for my federal and state income taxes. This year I saw all the negative reviews and, after reading them, decided not to use TurboTax due to the new marketing approach taken by Intuit, which left some important forms out of the "Deluxe" version that I've always used. I bought a competing product online. When I tried to use the competing software early in April, it wouldn't function properly. I called their customer support and they tried to help me, but it looked like it would take quite a while to troubleshoot the issue. I therefore asked for a refund and took another look at TurboTax. I had received an email from Intuit stating that they (finally) realized that customers were not accepting their rationale for the changes in TurboTax, and that they would provide free upgrades as needed for full functionality. I decided to give them another chance, and bought the 2014 tax year TurboTax here on Amazon. I downloaded it, it updated itself, and I started my taxes. It imported my information from previous years, and I did the various entries needed for my particular situation. When I got to items requiring upgrades it automatically prompted me to do the upgrades, downloaded and installed them in minutes, and I was able to proceed without delay. Intuit initially made some big mistakes in their marketing for this tax year, but they eventually fixed things. Their fixes worked for me.

title: I have been a Turbo Tax user for at least ...
content: I have been a Turbo Tax user for at least ten years and I can not believe all the problems this software has this year. Will definitely consider another product next year.

title: Not Happy with the missing pieces.
content: I was very disappointed with the new version. It did not have all the schedules and I wanted the worksheet that was used to calculate my estimated taxes due for 2015. I've been a loyal customer and used TurboTax for several years. We'll see what happens next year.

title: I really like TurboTax and will use it again
content: I really likeTurboTax but wasn't thrilled that they took out a few things from the deluxe version this year. They said it was put back in but when I went to use the home sale part, it said I had to pay to upgrade. Otherwise, I really like TurboTax and will use it again.

title: Everything else worked out fine.
content: Where was the question dealing with prepaid taxes? I tried phoning two different times, was placed on 'hold' while the person trying to help me supposedly went to ask an advisor for the answer and both times had to wait so long that the phone finally returned to a dial tone. Most frustrating! Everything else worked out fine.

title: Senior Saver!!
content: This is now the third year that I have used Turbotax and each year it gets more user friendly. My taxes were done in an hour and a half as opposed to five hours the first year. I'm not a computer geek! As a senior I am able to do my taxes with confidence and Efile ! Next year will even be faster, love Turbo !! (truth, I'm probably getting better at the computer) I feel great when I hit send and my taxes are done.

title: if you had a good tax book at hand
content: It works. My first use of TurbTax was for 1996. Then, if you had a good tax book at hand, preparing was a much better experience. If one changed a number on a form, then TurboTax would change everything necessary in the tax return automatically. Now, one might look at a form out of curiosity. Answer the questions and TurboTax fills in the blanks for you.

title: Not pleased with the additional charges not told about when purchasing ...
content: Not pleased with the additional charges not told about when purchasing the product. In addition with all the problems turbo Tax has had, I Won't ever use them again.

title: Decade plus user and still happy!
content: I have been using TurboTax for my U.S. and California taxes for over a decade now and the product continues to keep me happy. I used it when I ran my own sole proprietorship and now back as an employee only and have been happy on all versions.

title: ... Turbo Tax for 9 years and find it very easy to use and most thorough
content: I have been using Turbo Tax for 9 years and find it very easy to use and most thorough. I tried H&R Block but found that it did not pick up some deductions that Turbo Tax did.
