content: Somehow, this thing calculated my state review as if I were not a state resident. I have no idea how that happened; I reside in the state where I earned my money. So, I got a letter from the state saying that my refund wasn't nearly as much as it should have been.

title: Tax Expert Software
content: Program walks you through your tax preparation. Asks lots of questions, which brings up topics that are important to your personal tax returns. Turbotax keeps up to date on tax changes, as some of us mortals don't have time for. Have been using program for over 5 years, and would recommend.

title: Bad Year.
content: You guys had a very bad year. I had no problems in the past e-filing both my Federal and State taxes. That was not the case this year. In addition, I couldn't use Turbo Tax to do my City taxes. Go back to the old version.

title: Fine program so don't try to jack up profits like this year.
content: Used to be 5 stars until they did the STUPID changes this year that they had to offer free upgrades to keep their customers. After the upgrade, life back to normal, the program does what it is supposed to do, even for ignorant people who have no clue. Needs more security with their logins.

title: switching to HR block software this year
content: no schedule D efiling.

title: Suggestions to the Developer
content: Bob, you've F'd the A on this one. Suggestion, customer service before party line, it'll keep you afloat.

title: I didn't catch this until AFTER I submitted by 1040 since Turbo Tax told me my 1014 was perfect and was ready for submission
content: I entered in all my information, but it completely ignored my 1099R info and showed me over-funding my 401k by $4000. Unfortunately, I didn't catch this until AFTER I submitted by 1040 since Turbo Tax told me my 1014 was perfect and was ready for submission.

title: It refuses to install on my Windows 8. 1 ...
content: It refuses to install on my Windows 8.1 pc. And TurboTax support has been no help in resolving the issue

title: Not happy this year
content: I really liked the product in previous years but I feel ripped off that I could not do my state returns.

title: Two Stars
content: got the free federal e-file, but got charged for the MA. state e-file which they claimed was free.$19.99

title: TurboTax's Advice Agents Are AMAZING!
content: Just finished my taxes last night using TT Deluxe! I've used TurboTax for the last few years and entering my info was always a breeze but this year I had a tricky situation that involved numerous 1099-R transactions from recharacterizations and conversions between retirement accounts. I called the support line and was informed to call the advice line, and then was finally able to connect with a tax expert who is IRS certified. Having waited until the last few days to file, I had to wait for 2 hours to speak to her, but it was completely worth the wait! I was and still am thoroughly impressed with her knowledge and professionalism. She suggested to screen share, even knew how to update my Java on Mac so the screen share would work, and then expertly guided me through all eight 1099-R transactions. She kept switching back and forth between the easy guide and forms mode to ensure that all entries were being incorporated properly. I literally wanted to hug her when we were done! I feel like I got an AMAZING deal on buying the download version and getting 1 hour with an expert to help navigate me through the more complicated entries. I paid $40 for TT Deluxe on Amazon and $25 to e-file my state return and am so happy that I only had to spend $65 total to take care of a relatively complicated tax year. THANK YOU TURBOTAX!!

title: Dissatisfied.
content: The program kept freezing. I had to keep saving changes on each page to avoid having to re-enter data again and again. I sent message but I only was answered on a blg. Not helpful at all. Dissatisfied customer.

title: I am pleased with the ease and simplicity of using Turbo Tax
content: I am pleased with the ease and simplicity of using Turbo Tax. I was disappointed that it now want's to charge me $10.00 to e-file my state return but other than that I believe it is well worth it. Todd P

title: The program is great but if you are buying it for family use ...
content: The program is great but if you are buying it for family use - be advised that you can only file and prepare only one state return for free. Last year, there was no prep. fee. I'll read the back more carefully next year.

title: One Star
content: Just greed. Nothing more

title: Great product but weary of price increase
content: Preparing your taxes with Turbo tax is 97 percent automated. More employer W2s and 1099s are available to import this year. Health Care Savings Account is also better handled. Data is transferred neatly from state to state and credits for taxes paid are applied. Your tax liability and refund is automatically adjusted as you go thru the interview process. I am a bit weary of the price increases coming up combined with a $25 cost for e-filing state tax I will have to consider if the minimal savings is worth the hassle of doing my own taxes.

title: Just one glitch...
content: I had read the negative reviews regarding the missing schedules but when TurboTax wised up and put them back in, I decided to give it a try. I have use TT since its introduction and have always liked it. It loaded last year's files with no problem and walked me through the process as usual. The only negative I have this year is that it was supposed to allow me to choose when the IRS would be paid, e.g. April 15th but when I entered my payment method and information clicked next, it gave my a confirmation code and showed that my payment would be made immediately, I had to quickly rearrange some assets to cover the payment not to mention the loss of a couple of months of interest.

title: TurboTax hidden feature: Peace of Mind!
content: I've been using TurboTax since 2001; a few years online, but for the past 10 years, I've purchased the CD (both in-store, and via download). I attempted to use "other" tax preparation software, but it always ends up bringing me back to TurboTax. When my daughters lived at home, I'd also prepare their (simple) returns as well. The addition of incorporating a State module was great! I've heard a few complaints about the price going up a few (a few) dollars over the years, but ask yourself this: would you rather use paper, or a lessor software, and run the risk of missing important information, or would you rather use TurboTax, and get a good nights sleep?

title: Good and bac of Turbo Tax
content: I thought the federal was a great piece of software. I did not like the fact that I paid another $42.00 to do the state and another $19.00 to e-file it using Turbo Tax. Next year I might have to find something else?

title: Taxable Social Security
content: In the past Turbo Tax deluxe has been great However, this year the program miss calculated my taxable Social Security.. This ended up a 100.00 error Turbo Tax did Not catch. If you have taxable Social Security do the calculation manually to verify accuracy.

title: TurboTax Prices Go Up. Product Value Goes Down
content: TurboTax changed what forms you get with the Deluxe version. They are making consumers spend an additional $30 dollars for some of the basic schedules. There is a jump from $39 to over $69 to get the Premier. If this continues, I will find another product.

title: cost too much
content: Cost too much.

title: One Star
content: doesnt upload!

title: One Star
content: What a scam!!!

title: The program is easy to use
content: I completed my taxes and did the taxes for my 3 adult children, all in one afternoon. The program is easy to use, simple to understand and makes the painful process of taxes easier to understand. I have used this for 3 years in a row now, and I will continue to do so.

title: I purchased the HR Block version and ended up buying ...
content: I purchased the HR Block version and ended up buying this Turbo Tax version. It's much easier to navigate and the tax due with Turbo was hundreds less than Block using the very same figures. Needless to say you know which version I used.

title: Left Intuit.
content: I'm disappointed Intuit. I was a long-time customer. I bought H&R Block instead.

title: Worth while
content: Was nice to pay a little less than off TurboTax's website. I still had to either pay $19.99 to e-file my state or mail it to the state, which I did to save money. It was also nice to just upload it directly instead of downloading from a disc.

title: One Star
content: I didn't like the fact that each time I needed something, it cost more for another option.

title: Will not use Turbo Tax again. It has twice ...
content: Will not use Turbo Tax again. It has twice in the last 3 years figured my state tax wrong.

title: I am not happy because they deleted the schedule c
content: I have been buying this program for years. I am not happy because they deleted the schedule c. I won't buy it next year.

title: Working through problems
content: This is the 5th year I have used Turbo Tax and the first year I had some troubles. The first part was my fault. I did not understand how to put my wife's Required Min Withdrawal from her retirement plan into the income section. I did find out after a phone conversation with one of the Turbo Tax consultants. The downside to the phone conversation is that it takes a long time to get a person on the phone and you have to listen to music for a long time. Then, when I got the income in the federal part of the form done and was doing the state form, the numbers all stayed in my column and nothing in my wife's. Another phone call, another long wait and another bout with the music. A different consultant but again was very helpful. We were going to unload the current program (from disc) and download from the internet to see if that would help. We got cut off from our phone conversation and I was faced with the phone routine again. I gave up for the time being and came back to it after a day or so to rest. I did the phone routine again and asked the consultant for a direct line so I would not have to go through the long wait time again if we got cut off. Turbo Tax does not allow this. Maybe you should work something out so customers would have quicker access. Maybe more consultants......?? Anyway, I reloaded the original program from the disc and went through the process again and it worked.

title: One Star
content: I was never able to update the software after days of trying and found no help anywhere.

title: ... concerns cause me to wonder if block might be better next year
content: Over Priced and security concerns cause me to wonder if block might be better next year.

title: One Star
content: worst service, untruthful explanations, broken promises, Will never use Turbo Tax again!

title: Great program
content: My taxes weren't overly complicated, I was able to do them quickly and fairly easily and get a refund. The software is straight forward and they walk you through each step. Its much cheaper than going to a tax prep office and just as effective if not more so.

title: Just a quick comment. I bought the stunted Deluxe ...
content: Just a quick comment. I bought the stunted Deluxe. It's time the Fed assimilate Intuit company. A TurboTax-like product should be provided free to all every tax season.. Cost me $110 to transfer $30k into the US Treasury.

title: Very dissappointed that Intuit decided to dummy down this version ...
content: Very dissappointed that Intuit decided to dummy down this version by excluding schedule D-- the only reason that I purchase the product. Fool me once, shame on me........ Time will tell if I return as a customer.

title: Not as good as in the past.
content: It is good and easy to follow. It also has good online and phone help. Some of the import tools did not seem to work very well 1099s and Quicken data. I spent a lot of time with Quicken ensuring that transactions had the correct Tax lines. Import to Turbo Tax did not work well. It may be more an issue with Quicken, and trying to sort out the proper tax line item.

title: Two Stars
content: I did not like extra cost for state forms and the the printing instructions are poor.

title: if in doubt- don't be!
content: First, I have been using Trubo Tax Delixe for the last 8 years. With all the bad press and reviews about the changes with the Deluxe version I was very skeptical... to the point of almost using HR Block software. However, I decided to use TT because Intuit offered to auto upgrade to Premier. I heard it was not working for some? I will say I am very pleased as much as I have been the last 8 years. the upgrade was flawless with no issues whatsoever.

title: Two Stars
content: It won't let me do my state taxes plus the IRS keeps rejecting my daughters taxes.

title: Last Year
content: Like many have said, this will my last year with them. Feel betrayed by an old friend. ...

title: ... for several years now and continue to be very pleased. When you fire it up it automatically updates ...
content: I have used TurboTax for several years now and continue to be very pleased. When you fire it up it automatically updates itself to be sure you are working with the latest information. It also automatically looks back at your previous returns and enters necessary info into your latest return. Then it talks you through the process step by step in very easy to understand instructions. It's like having a tax preparation person standing over your shoulder and guiding you every step of the way. My wife and I file jointly and our returns are fairly basic so the whole process, to sitting down in front of the computer to E-filing our returns took me about 90 minutes and I was by no means rushing. E-filing is simple, easy and fast and we had both State and Federal refunds in about 1 1/2 weeks. (It could have been even quicker but we opted to have checks mailed to our home instead of automatically placed into our bank account.) The only reason I did not give TurboTax 5 stars is because apparently they bumped some of the features usually found in TurboTax Deluxe into a higher-priced version without adequately informing buyers beforehand. I did get several E-mails from TurboTax regarding this before I bought the product so it did not affect me. I would definitely recommend TurboTax.

title: Hassle because of the changes, but it eventually worked.
content: I've used TTax for over 10 years, and like most others, was disappointed at the changes. I was glad I read the reviews before purchasing. After seeing they were doing free upgrades to people who had used it in previous years, I decided to go ahead with TTax anyway. When I got to the point in the Deluxe software that said I needed an upgrade, it kept wanting to charge me for it. As with others, I had to call and wait on the phone for 20-40 minutes, but the rep eventually got me the free upgrade. I was a bit surprised though, as she sounded like this was an unknown thing. I said I figured they'd be used to it by now. Long story short... after the hassle, it eventually worked okay. I had some issues in the program this year that I'd never experienced before, but they all worked out. It said I was supposed to get a free state filing, but that didn't happen. And I had to rely on people on the forums when my state part wouldn't load. It ended up being because the software was upgraded from Deluxe to a higher version that it downloaded the state files in the OLD program folder for Deluxe, not the newer upgraded one. Thanks to the people on the forums for helping out with that! If they do what they said they'd do and put all the forms back in the original versions next year, I'll probably still use TTax again.

title: You'll need Premier now!
content: You'll need Premeir this year. Costco was selling Premier for 53.99 this month only 4 more than deluxe.

title: Still solid - hopefully they learned their lesson
content: Turbo Tax has been my go to for many years. Their stunt they pulled this year almost cost them my business, but they made good by allowing you to download the forms that were included in previous years.

title: bait-and-switch
content: Do not buy this. I have been buying Turbo tax for the last 10 years, never again. unlike other years, I could not do my stock sale without the $30 upgrade. this is bait-and-switch. I will buy H&R or Tax act.

title: There are always somethings in the tax language that the ...
content: There are always somethings in the tax language that the lay person will not understand. When you are in review portion you will always find something that is vague or nebulous. The refund tracker is a joke. It keeps saying on or around May 7 based past experience when I actually received it a week later. However, I will continue to use Turbo as it has always dealt with most issues that I was oblivious too.

title: Tax Done Satan Paid
content: Worked a little better than last years but they took out feature to make this more like basic so they can charge more for the removed features. Since my tax is simple I just end up paying more for less.

title: Solid, reliable tax program
content: Been using this product for a long time (since before Intuit bought it). Still my go-to solution at tax time. Maybe not the cheapest, but I've never had a problem with the program or the returns I've filed.

title: Two Stars
content: Have to pay extra to file stocks to the tune of $30.00 this is a rip off

title: Worked as advertised
content: Worked for my requirements without any issue. Would be a 5 star if it was cheaper. The general consensus is that TurboTax is gouging their user base and fortunately it did not affect me and my use case.

title: Very disappointed this year
content: Very disappointed this year. Filed Federal but state was rejected because turbo tax didn't have schedule CS supported in their system. They took my money to file state but state rejected it. Very unhappy

title: the irs redused my refund by almost 700. 00 ...
content: the irs redused my refund by almost 700.00 dollars. Gene Bolinger

title: Half the product for the same price as always -- or maybe not.
content: They really screwed it up by deleting Schedules C and E from Deluxe. Then with egg on their face they offered a very tangled "pay now for an upgrade" for $30 and said they'll refund the fee (or $25?) when I file, or something like that. I had to upgrade once to Premier (the $30 deal, maybe $25 back if I can figure out how to get it) and then again to the "Home and Business" version. The change just doesn't seem straightforward and walking it back has come out clumsy and amateurish. As it is, with the upgrades, the step-by-step interface is a little more infuriatingly repetitive every year. Still, it does what it's supposed to do.

title: Turbo Tax Deluxe is usually great - but it was a little confusing this year
content: Turbo Tax Deluxe is usually great - but it was a little confusing this year. After using Deluxe for several years, this year I had to upgrade to the next level in order to include my investment income. Fortunately, Turbo Tax did the upgrade at no additional charge, but I should not have had to upgrade to a different level program for something I had done and used for several years. Overall, I love using Turbo Tax; but if you change the product, you should not use the same name for the program. And, even though they did not charge for the upgrade (apparently they had a lot of complaints before mine); if I had just bought the premier level from the store it would have cost $40 extra. Seems like Turbo Tax was trying to trick people into spending more money for the "Premier" in order to get the same product they used to sell under the "Deluxe" label.

title: False advertising. Had to pay for state efiling!
content: False advertising. Had to pay for state efiling! Was not free

title: Easy to use
content: Easy to use, can pull data from previous filings if needed. Electronic state filing is extra, yet you can just print the return and mail it. I've used this and H&R Block, they are comparable, yet I would lean toward Turbotax.

title: forced upgrade
content: disappointed directed me to upgrade without other option.

title: Did my initial pass at the taxes with Turbo Tax ...
content: Did my initial pass at the taxes with Turbo Tax over three days. A week later tried to return to the program. Had problems initially flagged with an Amazon error message stating my ticket had expired and ending with Turbo Tax suggesting I complete my taxes on another computer. Spent 1.5 hours on the phone one day with Amazon and Turbo Tax, 4.5 hours on the phone with them the next day. Then, after I switched computers, Turbo Tax tried to hit me again for another set of forms. Other than that, it was a peachy keen experience.

title: Better than the others
content: I will only use Turbo Tax when doing our taxes. One year I bought and tried both Turbo Tax and H&R Block just to see which one would help give a bigger refund. Well....it turns out to have been Turbo Tax.

title: The love is gone
content: This year there were definitely more problems than in years before. When picking the efile option there is a "web page is not found" error. Since I was not on the internet I have no idea why the software was giving me that error. I had to enter the efile option 2 to 3 times before it would pass the error. Then when trying to put in a credit card for the state filing fee it failed so many times (and support was only available from M-F 8-5----and I don't know about you but I do my taxes on the weekend!) that I had to give up trying and just file the paper form. I have done three different sets of taxes, and the errors were on all of them. Let's not even talk about the fiasco of not putting certain forms in this version. All in all this year I believe was an epic fail. this is my first year in 15 that I am actually considering using another set of software next year. Usually I love your product, but that love disappeared this year.

title: My Tax season was REVOLUTIONIZED by Turbo Tax
content: Wow! Why did I not start using Turbo Tax years ago? As a 25 year stay-at-home mother of 4 I home-schooled, paid the bills, did the FAFSA's each year for all 4, tussled with insurance companies AND did the taxes by hand. I would go to the library, get all the forms and have at it. Due to negative circumstances I had to go to work and ended up at Sam's Club. They sold Turbo Tax and I bought it. My tax season was REVOLUTIONIZED!! My goodness, why had I waited so long to get Turbo Tax. Turbo Tax asks all the right questions, tells you what forms you need. It takes you step by step through the process. Each time you open it, it updates with new tax laws. You can do 5 different people's tax returns which works out well since i have 4 children. I will use Turbo Tax every year for the rest of my life!

title: One Star
content: disappointed in the elimination of the free state filing.

title: Thank goodness for Turbo at this time of the year.
content: Turbotax makes the tax return process much easier. I have used Turbo for many years and my return is complicated by a number of factors. I couldn't possible manage to complete the return myself without it. It saves me time and the cost of professional help.

title: Deceptive with limited software.
content: I downloaded the "free" software from the website of my investment broker. After my return was completed and ready to print I was required to pay $63. In other words, no printing or filing would occur. I then purchased H&R Block's 2014 software as a download from Amazon for less than half the price. As a former C.P.A., I found TurboTax to be quite limited in choices for input. The process of completing my Form 1040 using H&R Block was substantially easier and quicker than TurboTax. Downloads of investment transactions and income data was easy despite not using H&R Block the previous year. After 12 years of using TurboTax I will use only H&R Block in the future.

title: TurboTax and Fraud scary
content: TurboTax is great tax preparation software; however, I was not as satisfied with the product this year. It appears to have been hacked. There wre reports of fraud and Intuit temporarily suspended processing of some state returns. I learned this from the news and I did not receive any notice from TurboTax that something happened with the software. I feel uncomfortable using the software with so much personal and highly confidential information in the tool.

title: I've use TurboTax for many years. One year I ...
content: I've use TurboTax for many years. One year I did the E-file which TTax sent me government acceptance for and a year and a half or so later the Fed was harassing me because I still had to file the forms even though I'd already paid them the money. I had to reprint all the paperwork and manually file it again because the IRS said that would be more convenient for them. Still it usually works and I still use it.

title: Disappointed
content: Have used TurboTax for over 20 years ... but will not buy this year as I need both Sched D and E, and have no desire to pay for the Premier version.

title: One Star
content: I cannot use it for my small business taxes as before

title: Not happy.
content: Doesn't allow me to save on the desktop. Not happy.

title: It's easier and better, but not perfect.
content: It's better than anything else on the market, but not perfect. too Although the software attempts to cover all aspects of personal income tax return filing, the software platform is a "non-participative." The software asks simple questions, but does not explain why it needs that particular information. In other words, the software does not ask if you want to claim Head of Household; the software just assumes you are not qualified for the deduction claim. I personally took a step further and telephoned TurboTax and inquired about Head of Household claim and several other circumstances pertaining to deductions ... the TurboTax supervisor could not answer the questions I had challenged him.

title: TurboTax is a good program
content: TurboTax is a good program but you need to check it CAREFULLY before filing. Sometimes boxes checked, get unchecked and if you don't check everything you can get an incorrect tax return. The Intuit help is good once you get through to it and they even have tax advisors if you have questions. As for the Amazon offer of a 10% addition to your refund.....it only works if you actually get a refund.

title: The program is easy to use with good walk through steps and help ...
content: I've used TurboTax for many years now. The program is easy to use with good walk through steps and help topics. Excellent deduction walk through. Support is helpful and easy to reach. TurboTax is one of the premier tax services. Sounds like five stars so far but where it gets annoying is there are several other products on the market now at a lower price. Most aren't as good but that depends upon how complex your taxes are. Lastly, when you are finally done with the whole mess that is taxes you are asked to pay for electronic filing for anything beyond the federal filing. Further, while you can figure our how to print for snail mail filing, it's somewhat hidden away and cumbersome - haven't you already paid enough? Especially given this years fiasco with the reduced features in the package and the backpedaling.

title: cheaters of the people
content: as I was entering info for my tax return, two separate times I was told I would have to upgrade to a different version, that what I had purchased no longer supported the forms I needed. I thought that was sneaky and TurboTax is now on my list of "cheaters of the people". How much money do they need to make? grrr

title: Good But Should be Better
content: TurboTax worked good up to a point. Stock transactions should be included in Deluxe at no cost. The download of financial transactions was a disaster! I have multiple accounts and needed transactions from just one taxable account. The download drew from multiple accounts and doubled up on some items I had already entered. It needs to be set up to select an individual account to upload just transactions. I had to go back and redo the return to back out the download. 4 stars for the basic package, 1 star for the download and no stars for charging for an upgrade for stock transactions.

title: TurboTax
content: Nor near as good as in the past. More complicated.

title: SO-SO
content: 2014 was not as user friendly as previous issues.

title: I have made the very painful decision to no longer use your product because of ...
content: To whom it may concern at Turbotax. I have made the very painful decision to no longer use your product because of your recent changes to TT deluxe ( no sced D ) . This was not a easy decision but is being done in your best interest, to allow you to begin new creative and deceptive attempts to attract new customers, instead of keeping longtime customers as myself. This way you will be able to use your underhanded business practices on new unsuspecting customers in the hope of creating new revenue streams to replace lost ones . Do not think of the money I would have spent on your product as a loss , think of it as a attempt to help you develop some integrity as a company ! If you care to , you can reach me or my staff at 1-800-000-0000 and I will make you tap dance to see if you really want me back . But of course , I won't be back ever . Have a nice day !

title: The upgrade happened easily within the software
content: By the time I purchased this, TurboTax had decided to let previous Deluxe customers upgrade one level in order to overcome some of the deficiencies of the new Deluxe version which dropped some features it previously had. The upgrade happened easily within the software, and I hope TurboTax brings those features of Deluxe back again for next year and beyond. Deluxe had always met my needs in the past at a decent (but not industry-leading) pricepoint so I've stuck with it. If it ceases to do so, I'll have to evaluate options. I was happy with this year's experience, but will get the lay of the land earlier in 2016.

title: Turbo Tax -
content: They got caught this time and will try again!!!!!!!!!!!

title: USE H&R BLOCK INSTEAD OF turbo tax (the screw me software)
content: No stars. This is the second time Turbo Tax has screwed me. The first time the software dropped a digit off my wife's income when it transferred from federal to state. I notified turbo tax and they did nothing and it cost me over 2400 dollars. This year I bought turbo tax with free federal e-file. The only way I could e-file was to pay the fee. The software came with e-file but charged me anyways. Tried to contact some but no phone numbers, when I tried the online questionnaire It showed me a bunch of other questions instead of answering mine. NO CUSTOMER SERVICE. H&R BLOCK IS LOOKING BETTER AND BETTER TO ME. I had to put at least one star for the review but they don't deserve it!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

title: NOT FREE
content: Did not get a free state income tax as promised.

title: Buy It and Download It
content: Recommended. Great app. Easy to use and intuitive. This gang of software developers has their act together. Zero problems in electronic filings, Federal or State. Rapid returns from the Feds and the State. I am a repeat user of TurboTax and will likely be returning for 2015.

title: Not the quality product you purchased last year.
content: Very disappointed Turbo Tax elected to remove some very important forms from this package. Seems they were not satisfied that I have been using their product for over 25 years they decided to force users to the next level if you had a rental property or needed to use forms C, D, E of F you would need to purchase Turbo Tax Premier or Turbo Tax Home & Business at a higher cost just to complete what you did last year with Delux. So maybe Turbe Tax cn answer why this is called Delux because it does not do much mor then Turbo Tax Basic did three years ago.

title: Pay additional to use Schedule C
content: I have used Turbo Tax for many years. This program works well and up until this year have had no complaints. This year's edition had a change, if you need to use Schedule C, you will need to pay additional $$$ or do what I did, not pay the additional fee and complete the Schedule C by hand. Corporations have been doing very well for many years,yet they always want to make a little bit more!

title: I'm pretty mad at me first
content: I'm pretty mad at me first, and then Turbo Tax. I normally buy H&R Block but forgot that and bought Turbo Tax at Costco for an okay price. It never occurred to me that it wouldn't include all schedules, particularly Schedule C. When I got to that point my taxes were almost done so I bit the bullet and bought the version with Schedule C, basically buying the program I didn't want in the first place twice. Then, I got a notice from Costco that I would be automatically upgraded to the version I already bought. So, my bad for not paying attention to what I was buying. The program is fine. Just make sure it has the features you need.

title: Don't buy it..This is ridiculous !!!
content: Have been a regular buyer since 2002. Intuit can't do this. I will NOT buy it from 2014 on.

title: Three Stars
content: I do not find TurboTax as user friendly as it used to be! Your tech support people upgraded me because the deluxe no longer handles many relative ordinary situations TT Deluxe used to. So I must commend Amazon for staying on top of their suppliers.

title: you basically tried to sneak price raises in on me and then waste my time
content: After 10 years of using it, I will not be buying TurboTax ever again. I bought the State + Federal Deluxe as I always have, and find halfway through my return that they want to charge me for Premier to simply add one 1099-B form to my filing. This is the first time this wasn't supported under Deluxe. I've tried to utilize some added feature that promises a free upgrade to Premier, but that simply fails to install. Then when you call the support number they provide, it gives you another support number to get help. When you call that phone number it is no longer valid. So, you basically tried to sneak price raises in on me and then waste my time, adding insult to injury. I couldn't be more disappointed with the product.

title: One Star
content: THIS PRODUCT WILL NOT OPEN AFTER DOWNLOADING !@

title: Three Stars
content: Kind of a let down. After I started doing my return, I had to upgrade to a higher level, even-tho I have used the same Turbo for more than 10 years. The upgrade cost $44.00 more. But later, turbo tax apologized and offered to make it up by giving a $25. refund????

title: Mixed Feelings
content: I've been using TT for probably close to 20 years. I was about to switch to something else this year when I initially learned that the Deluxe version would no longer support information for stocks and bonds. TT backpedaled and prior year buyers of TT Deluxe received a free upgrade to the Premiere edition. However, I will jump ship next year if the Deluxe version does not include the above, as it has every year up to now. Anyway, I like the convenience of how TT automatically imports information from previous years without a lot of effort on my part. I do not like how it almost forces you to e-file your state return, even though it costs an additional $24.95 (only Fed e-file is free). Then, if you want to print out your state return and mail it in there's no easy way because you have to include certain fed tax return forms if you itemize, etc. The easy solution would be if TT offered a box to click on to e-file or another box to print out and mail in your state return right next to it. Just a small gripe. We will see what TT does with the Deluxe version next year.

title: Turbo Tax is worst than the toilet paper manufactures
content: Turbo Tax is worst than the toilet paper manufactures, they only cut back on the size of the toilet paper. Turbo Tax increases the price and moves items (Schedule D and others) that you used to get in the Deluxe version to the Premier version.

title: Two Stars
content: Doesn't address Investment gains and losses.

title: Bait and Switch on State e-file
content: Bait and Switch on State e-file. When I went to file, the software states that the cost is $19.99 (or $19.95 - can't bring it up any more now that I've filed). So, I get all the way through setting up Turbo Tax account and entering my credit card, and the price changes to $24.99. Looks like Turbo Tax cannot be trusted.

title: The Industry Standard, but....
content: I've used this software for years and the biggest plus is that it works and covers most situations that might be encountered for typical middle class users. Since it is The Standard, it might be useful to focus on the areas where it needs improvement. First and foremost, I object to having to purchase a new program every year. Why not have software that is update-able annually for a modest fee? Sure, the tax code changes but other software manages to function with updates. Secondly, why is Intuit stingy about State filings? You get one, if you pay for it but what if your family, like mine needs to file more than one State return? Third, if you have a lot of charitable contributions it is a real pain to get them all in there in a manner appropriate for the IRS. This is not strictly-speaking a problem with Intuit but as a company that promises ease-of-use I would expect them to come up with easier solutions to help out their loyal customers. I'm sure I will buy TurboTax next year, but these are ongoing grumbles from my perspective.

title: Lost All Credibility In TurboTax - Talk About An Underhanded Move!!
content: I have been using TurboTax for over 20 years - using both Basic and Deluxe - and they used to meet all my needs. While preparing my taxes for 2014 I all of a sudden find out that I cannot do my K-1's and Schedule D with the Deluxe and have to pay around $35.00 for the Premier upgrade in the middle of my tax preparations. Talk about an underhanded move that undermines their credibility - what trick will they play next to gouge the consumer? I've had it with TurboTax - time to try something else. Understand that H&R Bock has a good product, so will give them a try for 2015. Sorry to say good-by to TurboTax, but what they did to me was highly disturbing.

title: Loved it
content: I was terrified to do our taxes on my own, but Turbotax definitely made it easy. I will never pay hundreds of dollars for someone else to file for us! I also got a coupon code by email for a discount on Norton Anti-virus.

title: I cancelled the gift card and am thankful I thought to read the fine print (which I don't always do)
content: I have used Turbo Tax for years and will continue to use it. The only thing that really griped me about this years was the offer at the end. The offer is for an Amazon gift Card and you get and an extra $10 if you send part of your money towards the gift card. I agreed to the offer because I am always shopping on Amazon. I finished up the rest of my taxes and at the very end is the terms for the gift card. The small print says you agree to send your tax return to synchrony Bank and they will issue the gift card. You would think that is important enough to say up front. I thought it was underhanded and misleading. I cancelled the gift card and am thankful I thought to read the fine print (which I don't always do). I would probably give it 5 stars if they hadn't pulled that at the end.

title: One Star
content: Will not buy turbo tax again due to problems

title: Worked fine after free upgrades
content: Free upgrade to whatever edition you need. Upgrade process worked perfectly for me. Have used TT for many years and it works very well. If they could offer more tax strategy advice that would make it perfect. Hopefully they will not repeat this year's mistakes with the reduced functionality requiring a forced upgrade.

title: Some items need better explanation. You used to have a phone number ...
content: You keep going down hill. Last year the State Tax did not work. This year the return would not print and your advice just repeated the obvious which had not worked. Some items need better explanation. You used to have a phone number and it is gone or hidden. I saw complaints on line from those who found it that calls went to some place overseas and, to put it mildly, were not helpful. Bring it back to U.S and make the number easily available. Still, too difficult to back up from some places to earlier places. You are going downhilll. I have use it for about ten or more years, I think, it is not improving and is even deproving.

title: Still the standard; still tricky to file an extension
content: Still the standard in DIY tax preparation software, the same strengths and weakness continue from last year. Automatic linking to ADP and many securities firms is a time and accuracy saver. For some mysterious reason, you still cannot file the 4868 Extension electronically from the TurboTax program. Instead--after you find the URL via online help--you have to use the free web-based extension service. At the very least, there should be a link within TurboTax to the online extension. If you don't know to search online, the Turbotax program just leads you to print the form and mail it. Otherwise, the program is reasonably easy to use, provides e-filing at no additional charge, and even offers an extra-cost audit defense plan if you want some extra peace of mind.

title: This is still a good tool and it helps with procing charitable donations (non-monetary ...
content: This is still a good tool and it helps with procing charitable donations (non-monetary donations). I was surprised when I ad to pay $24.99 to file my state taxes. After I went back and looked at the ad I realized it is free to create ONE state tax return but it is not FREE to efile it. Could have been better explained in the sales pitch (i.e., "One free state tax form creation and only $24.99 more to efile the state tax return".

title: Switching from Deluxe to Elite in mid stream didn't work for me!
content: Well I'm sure that you realize by now that most of us who previously used Deluxe for Capitol gains got short changed. It seems that after you had us shift to Elite, I had trouble trying to get schedule D to work for my 1 stock sale. I finally had to get an "extension" as the 15th was slowly disappearing. I'm not sure I'll use TurboTax next year if I'm still alive. Peace be with you, Robert Goodell

title: It's easy to use as your walked through your entire tax ...
content: I have been using turbo tax for 5 years now. It's easy to use as your walked through your entire tax return. I'm always pleaed with the end results. The only complaint I have is the additional fees to e-file. They don't hide that so I know about it, just would be nice without them. After the cost of the disk and all fees to file. I'm about at the same coat as a tax accountant would charge for my simple tax return. Though I enjoy doing them myself. I would continue to be a loyal user if not for those fees. I'm going to be checking other so it yourself disks to see how much the total cost would be to file. Without the e-filling fees I would give a 5 star review.

title: Returned Reluctantly
content: After reading about Intuit's 2014 TurboTax Deluxe debacle, I hesitated to get this product. The cost of TurboTax products has done nothing but go up, up, up, and the early release of Deluxe 2014 was definitely a low blow. However, I've used TurboTax since floppy disc days and didn't want to start over again with another tax program this year, so I took the "easy" way out and stuck with what I've been using. After reading other comments by other long-time users of TurboTax about how easy it was to switch to a different software provider, I just need to make the switch next tax season. Sure Intuit "made right" on Deluxe 2014, but it was only after a massive hue-and-cry from users who felt cheated, and rightly so. I'm loyal but not stupid. I recognize a flim-flam when I see one.

title: The tax program is still easy to use but
content: The tax program is still easy to use but, I had to go to the IRS wed-site to get the forms to finish the deductions. Bouncing back and for from one tab to the next was annoying. TurboTax still got me a good refund. Receiving an e-mail from the president and all the low reviews on Amason.com I believe the problem will be resolved by next year program.

title: I was very happy that iNTUIT offered a FREE product upgrade if the ...
content: I was very happy that iNTUIT offered a FREE product upgrade if the deluxe version did not have everything we needed to complete our taxes this year. We did need to upgrade and my husband was very happy that INTUIT offered this option. This made a big difference with our belief in the product. Will be purchasing this product again next year! Thanks Intuit!!!

title: Not as good as H&R Block
content: Picked this year to try TurboTax instead of H&R Block, what a mistake. First it can't import the H&R Block t13 file even though it finds it. The file scan also never stops even after about 15 minutes. I don't know what it's scanning for. It found the t13 file the first 30 seconds. So since I paid the money I hand entered the information. Not as good as H&R Block. Lacks features, you have to spend big bucks for other version that has a few more forms.

title: Turbo Tax tried to charge me twice 2 years in a row after purchase at Staples. NOT VERY CUSTOMER FRIENDLY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
content: Software is great BUT after buying it at Staples the last 2 years everything went fine until I tried to e-file. I was asked to pay or have my refund reduced by the amount I owed. I paid for the software at Staples & had to call your customer service people to fix the problem. With the Turbo Tax 2013, the person did something on his end & it went through without any more problems. This year the 2014 Turbo Tax did the same thing BUT your service rep. couldn't put it through without me paying by credit card & when it cleared I was given a refund. I hope you fix this problem by next year and if you don't I will use someone else's software.

title: One Star
content: The cost is too high for what you get

title: it tells you that from looking at everything your choice is the best option for you
content: It is just so confusing. I does not matter whether you put married filing separately or married filing jointly, it tells you that from looking at everything your choice is the best option for you. What? That does not help at all. If you know what option is best for you and you don't need help i guess this product is okay. But also had to go into help for figure out where to put the Alaska PFD, which is irritating.

title: Ok overall but still some faults
content: The software worked ok but all the name changing from last year was very confusing. All I wanted to do was get the same as last year where it said deluxe but I could not find that at Sams club. Also it is very time consuming to download all the upgrades to the program when you first put it in the computer then when it does finish your left with not knowing for sure that all the updaes were added in?? I don't see why it cost 24 dollars to e-file a state return?? Whats the profit margin on that one? and why should'nt be included in the cost of the 50 dollar purchase??

title: Still works.
content: I have used Turbo Tax for many years. It's easy and intuitive to use. I was tempted to swtich to somehting else when Intuit messed around with features but I didn't have any stock sales this year so it didn't come into play. I hope this does not come up again. Deluxe is Deluxe.

title: I used it first time last year and it was ...
content: I used it first time last year and it was rejected because of birth date not agreeing between Soc. Sec. and the IRS. Thought it was straightened out after I mailed them my return. Guess what. Same thing this year. E filed, rejected again, same reason. Arizona automatically rejects when Feds at IRS do. Had to mail both again .E Filed Feb. 2nd . Mailed Feb. 20th. Lot of extra work without satisfaction.

title: Met My Needs Without Issues
content: The Turbo Tax Deluxe met the tax needs for my family this year. I did have a bit of concern with the hacking news but obtained this year's copy after action was reportedly taken to resolve the issues. Another issue I would like to see to go back to previous versions is the return of Schedule C to the deluxe version as folks nearing retirement could likely resort to some form of self-employment to supplement their retirement and should not have to purchase the Business version of Turbo Tax to file their taxes.

title: Does what its supposed to.
content: Worked just as intended. Negative reviews involve turbotaxs poorly planned change (which has since been rescinded) and ignoring the not-even-small print involving paying for the state tax form when e-filing.

title: "Deluxe" really does not mean anything any longer.
content: I was pretty disappointed that this did not have the State Tax option included with it. I had the option of paying around $40.00 more to have my state taxes done. I chose not pay for this extra. I have been a Turbo Tax user for many years. It appears the standards for the "Deluxe" title has changed. Shame on me for assuming these standards would be the same year to year. Even when I write this review, it states "TurboTax Deluxe 2014 Fed + State + Fed Efile..." This is not listed on the packaging it came in. I will not use Turbo Tax any longer.

title: Not as good as last years and prior years
content: I have been using turbo tax for at least 15 years. Never had a problem. Always used the desktop version. The only thing that I didn't like this year was that I had to call customer service to download the state tax and also had to contact them again to efile my returns. I don't know why this was but it was not convenient. They were very busy on the lines and had to call me back so I had to wait. I must say that the reps did a fine job in helping but it was just an inconvenience.

title: So Turbo Tax gets a low rating - I have used their software for about 6-7 years which makes my file keeping and records excellen
content: Although it probably is not Turbo Tax fault - they get collaterol damage! filed 2nd of February online and today is 7th of March and nothing! there is no way to check anything! The IRS are nasty employees who don't care because its not their money and Uncle Sam has the Law behind it! So Turbo Tax gets a low rating - I have used their software for about 6-7 years which makes my file keeping and records excellent - I wish the Feds were more organized

title: Concerns with 2014 version.
content: I've used TT in 9 previous years with few issues and good results. This year the forms related to the Affordable Health Care Act apparently did not get sent with my e-file submittal. I have been unable to get a good answer from TT direct, but the user forum suggests that there was (is) a bug that was not resolved. I received a notice from the IRS requesting the missing forms which I have mailed in. Now I wait and hope that resolves the issue. Depending upon the final outcome, I may be looking at other options for next year!

title: Choose with care!
content: I have been a long time user of TurboTax and was very surprised this year. Seems that they have decided to change their packages and charge for extra filing costs and state downloads also. I went on their website and pocked the product they suggested. After I purchased it, I discovered that they had dropped the free state download and were charging extra for this also. Be careful when you choose. I will need to think through more carefully next year. Their price is now getting close to having your return completed by one of the big tax preparers.

title: Annoying glitches
content: I've used Turbo Tax for years with absolutely no glitches - but this year, there were some annoying glitches. Once I got it up and running correctly, it was fine. I could not save and then lost everything and had to start over again. Called Turbo Tax and got help. I all seemed to work - I got it done. I was never able to properly save it to my Turbo Tax program. I operate a Mac and heard there were issues this year due to all the new security. Sure hope they get it fixed next year.

title: I was surprised when I did my taxes and found ...
content: I was surprised when I did my taxes and found that the package I bought did not come with the state tax without paying for it. In the past 8 years I've been using turbo tax, I've never had to pay extra for filing a state return. I not only had to pay $39.99 for one state but two, since I work and live in 2 different states. This costs me almost $80 more. In addition, I also had to purchase Form C which cost me another $30. I used the same form last year and it was included in the Turbo Tax software package I purchased.

title: A great product, but I miss Basic!
content: A great product, but I purchased it because the Basic version was no longer available. While it did everything that I needed, it offered much more than I actually needed. My home is paid for and my wife gets one 1099 and I get two, with some various interest statements, so our return is fairly easy. While the Deluxe model handled that with ease, I felt that it was overkill for our return. The Basic version would have been adequate for me. Just my thoughts....

title: not very good
content: Im glad to have a way to do my taxes early at home. the program would not recognize my internet connection and I spent over 3 hours on two occasions, with very nice staff , trying to fix the problem. It was never resolved. I had to have someone else's computer to file the return. The fact that I had to pay $49.99 for the disc and $39 for the state and another $19.99 for each return to state made the filing very expensive. I will consider H&R block next time and save myself the trouble of finding someone else's computer to f

title: Disappointed
content: Disappointed. What a disaster.

title: One Star
content: Schedule D removed from deluxe

title: I was amazed at the Speed of my Refund this year
content: As a Turbotax user for many years, I was amazed at the Speed of my Refund this year. The free "It's Deductable" feature in the program was a lifesaver this year, since we had many many loads of "stuff" taken to Goodwill and other Charities. We kept lists of what was included, and the program always provided a Price. You now only have a choice of either Good or Fair. It also cautions you if too many are shown as Good, as Risking being an "Audit Risk. Great Program!

title: I have used TT it seems like forever, yet year over year nothing gets better ...
content: Still takes way too long to load. todays computers has greater speed which Turbo tax does not take advantage of. This program need a complete rewrite. in addition every time you finish doing a category it sends you back to the beginning of that category, why not just continue where I left off. I have used TT it seems like forever, yet year over year nothing gets better or easier to use. It seems like all their updates to anything are just for changed to the highly complex tax laws.

title: Very pleased with Turbo Tax throughout the years
content: Very user friendly. I have been using this product for eleven years and every year it is smooth. Usually takes me two hours to knock out our tax return. Very pleased with Turbo Tax throughout the years.

title: test it before you issue it
content: seemed fine until I filed- kicked back 3 times- I changed nothing, finally accepted so it seems to me that TurboTax had too many glitches- TurboTax should refund the customers that it inconvenienced and no finally fixing the problems is not good enough-next year I will probably go with Block (after about 10 years of TT) because this year frustrated me so much

title: Terrible and misleading
content: Save yourselves some money.

title: Not happy with 2014 TurboTax
content: I did not feel TurboTax did a good job explaining the possible deductions in several categories. Investments, college expenses and some other areas were not easy to understand and sometimes vague, even confusing. I had to pay a large amount to the Federal Government for the first time ever. It may be that I just didn't have enough out of each paycheck deducted, however, I felt very uneasy submitting my return this year feeling as though something was left out or some deductions were missed.

title: I tried a practice run and that was great. I think for the price the of the ...
content: TurboTax 2014 Deluxe was a bit confusing at first. This was my first time using a income tax product. But after I got on to it, I felt more confident. I tried a practice run and that was great. I think for the price the of the software, the State tax efile should have been free, also. So I sent in a paper copy by mail. I know it will take longer for the refund, but I am willing to wait for it. I will try urboTax again next year.

title: Probably won't buy again
content: I hate that I am expected to upgrade to get the some of the same forms that were always included in years past. I've been using TurboTax for many years and will probably use something else next year.

title: Although I do not hate your product
content: Although I do not hate your product, I do not like the changes you have made and hope you will go back to the true Turbo tax product I and other have come to trust and buy year after year. I found this version not as user friendly and where did its deductible go. It would be a good idea to have customer tested and approved changes in the future before going to final product. That alone would save you a lot of embarrassment.

title: Not a good year
content: I have used TurboTax for over 20 years without any problems until this year. Apparently the Massachusetts non resident form has some bugs which caused my refund to be reduced. I challenged the reduction and am waiting for a response but I needed to go back and verify everything input into TurboTax and the resulting tax form. I pay extra to get the state return as I trusted TurboTax but this year I would've been better off doing my state taxes on my own.

title: Like many others
content: Like many others, I am disappointed that the Deluxe software no longer includes self employment forms. Though I did not need it this year, my teenage son did. His income was not really enough to warrant purchasing the more expensive Home & Business program, though. I was pleased with Intuit's humble response, but looking back, I'm not sure it was adequate since there is no real intention to fix the problem. Overall, I like the ease of use with Turbo Tax.

title: Was VERY disappointed that I had to do the forms on my ...
content: I never heard of Turbo Tax NOT including the forms for your state before and this year I learned the hard way that apparently some versions DO NOT include just the forms to complete your State returns. Was VERY disappointed that I had to do the forms on my own cause I didn't want to pay $39.99 just to get the forms to fill out! Lesson learned the hard way - BE CAREFUL what you are buying because apparently some versions of Turbo Tax no longer include the state form download. :(

title: Pleased with results, Dissapointed in price
content: As always I was pleased with the fluidity and opportunities to achieve all possible deductions, etc. with Turbo Tax. I was however very disappointed when I reached the end of the filing process and was zapped for another $54 since I had purchased the downloadable disc from Office Depot already for $54. I genuinely feel that I was charged TWICE! Otherwise pleased. I will not purchase the disc again but simply go to the website which is what the disc prompts you to do anyway.

title: It's the best!!
content: I have used TurboTax for the past 5 years, and it is simply the best way for one to do his taxes! Prior to using TurboTax, I had a tax accountant and I found that I had to answer so many questions and pull so much information together for him that, by using TurboTax, I'm pulling that info and answering questions and then TurboTax completes the job for me! So much easier and less costly. My only wish is that they would offer 2 states for free rather than one as I have to purchase a second state tax return each year.

title: I was very disappointed by Intuit's decision to remove basic forms (D
content: As a long-time TurboTax user, I was very disappointed by Intuit's decision to remove basic forms (D, E) from the "deluxe" package. I will most likely switch to a different product next year.

title: AS SOON AS I FIGURE OUT WHAT TURBO TAX DID ...
content: AS SOON AS I FIGURE OUT WHAT TURBO TAX DID TO MY RETURN I WILL START WORKING ON MY AMENDED RETURN TO SEE IF I CAN GET THINGS CORRECTED. I HAVE NO IDEA WHO SET UP AND DID THE MATH BUT IT IS A MESS.

title: Where's my FIVE (5) eFiles?
content: Programs works as good as it ever did, but there is no longer 5 eFiles per purchase. It used to be part of the sales pitch "Five 'free' eFiles". They weren't free, they're part of the purchase price! If that doesn't change I'll probably not buy the software again, I'll just do it online for free. I've been a TurboTax user since the DOS days. I was asked by the IRS to be part of the pilot group when they first started accepting eFilings. This is BS!

title: I wish I read these reviews before buying the Deluxe ...
content: I wish I read these reviews before buying the Deluxe version. I am going to switch this year (after more than 15 years of loyalty to TurboTax). I don't know to what yet but I am going to switch.

title: While the tax return process was fairly easy I will probably try a different product next year
content: I was extremely frustrated by not being able to contact a real person to answer a rather simple question. When I tried to submit my question online they asked me to login with my account info. I had no idea what my account info was. In addition , when I tried to pay for the state filing and use my credit card , it kept saying I already had an account but it would'nt let me access it. While the tax return process was fairly easy I will probably try a different product next year.

title: will not be buying turbo tax
content: I will not be buying turbo tax next year ,I have purchased turbo tax for at least 15 years. when you notify customers that you removed some content after they buy your product its time to move on.

title: Huge disappointment
content: Huge disappointment with this version. It has far less features and is less user friendly than previous years. After years of being loyal to Turbo Tax I think it is time to explore other options.

title: Being gouged by TurboTax
content: For tax year 2013, Deluxe TurboTax included one state return for less then $60. For tax year 2014, the Deluxe DID NOT include a state return. I had to pay an additional $40 for a state. Why? Your cost control program could not have gone that out of control in one year. I have to assume that you feel your old customers are now captured forever and you can now gouge us. Remember, you are not the only tax software company out there now.

title: Turbotax is a sham
content: They advertised to file your state return for free and then I was told it was restricted to just the basic types of returns. It also did not recommend the correct filing to give the maximum refund (which was guaranteed). I had to change one of their recommended options in order to increase my refund. If I hadn't known that I could have gotten a bigger refund with the option I chose, Turbotax would have calculated a refund about $200 less on my state return.

title: worth using
content: For years now I've been using TurboTax and been very happy with how it walks me through the whole process. Easy to use. Wishlist - I wish it included free e-file to at least one state as well.

title: Good product but be aware you need to pay extra ...
content: Good product but be aware you need to pay extra to send in the state tax. That is not at all clear in the info about the product. Adds another $25 to the cost. Going with TaxAct this time.

title: Turbotax is great but I am disgusted I had to pay for ...
content: Turbotax is great but I am disgusted I had to pay for features that were free in previous versions. I have used Turbotax for 10 yrs and this is the thanks I get for being a repeat customer?

title: Awesome
content: Loved it. It was so easy to use. Everything was explained and assistance was offered. TurboTax submitted my forms electronically and I had my refund in about 10 days. I have used TurboTax before and will continue to use it.

title: Disappointed
content: Very disappointed this year to find that the format had changed and forms usually included were missing. Seems like a lowball way to force customers into buying the more expensive product.

title: Kinda sucks.
content: I Would have given it 5 stars, however, I had to upgrade ( send them $40 extra ) just to do a simple schedule C. I will be looking for alternatives next year, or I will just do it by hand.

title: Why Use Anything Else!!
content: The best on the market! So thorough and easy to follow, saves me a lot of money not having to have my taxes done by a professional tax preparer. This is my only go to source at tax time.

title: Don't believe the free fed and State e-filing claim. ...
content: Don't believe the free fed and State e-filing claim. Not very upfront with what you need to purchase to get this. I have used Turbo Tax for many years and I believe this will be my last.

title: What happened?
content: Unless I see some positive reviews, I will be switching to a different software program. I use many of the schedules. I'll give it a few weeks so intuit can fix this.

title: Lack of Owner ID Verification with the IRS
content: My only complaint is the lack of ID verification with the IRS. My return was delayed several weeks while the IRS did an IDVERIFY by letter on my return to verify I was the actual owner of the Tax Return and Refund. You need a much better system of verifying Tax Returns so the IRS doesn't think people are committing Identity Theft on their own return.

title: Hidden Fees
content: I paid for the program that includes 1 free state. The second state cost me $40. Then the program charged me $20 for each state AGAIN! Then, to top it off, there was a $40 service fee!

title: It was more complicated to use than years past. ...
content: It was more complicated to use than years past. The state tax program did not show how it calculated anything. I have been using Turbo Tax for several years, I will not use it anymore.

title: Same great product.
content: I have been using Turbo Tax for the past several years. Never a problem. I read all the poor reviews and almost went with another product. Luckily bought Turbo Tax. Regarding some of the negative review, I purchased the Deluxe edition (I had forgotten about a stock sale I had made in early 2014). While completing my tax return, I found my 1099-MISC, and once I entered the information, Turbo Tax stated that I needed to upgrade to Premier - but the upgrade would be FREE!!! The download was quick and easy, kept all the data I had previously entered in Deluxe. Can't ask for better customer service.

title: ... 5 or 6 and it always goes smoothly and easily and never had a problem with errors or the ...

title: I have used TurboTax for years and have always liked it except for this year where I could not ...

Maybe it was simply a glitch that day but it was a pain. In future it would be nice to buy, via the program/web, everything I'll need in one shot, i.e. extra state/e-file package.

title: Time to Jump Ship.

title: I'm very disappointed in turbotax this year

I spent 4 hours just trying to resolve the conflict and was unable to do so. I had to file the NY state tax on my on using the tax forms off the web. I didn't have the conflict between the two states income taxes last year.

title: This is worst it has ever been
content: Ended up costing a lot more than I expected. This is worst it has ever been. $30 for a schedule B, $10 more because I received a k1, then to add a state another $40. Never again!

title: I was very disappointed to find that I had to purchase an upgrade ...
content: I was very disappointed to find that I had to purchase an upgrade to complete my taxes since several major sections (Sch C for personal business and D for investments) were no longer included in this version. A refund was later offered in response to complaints, but it fell substantially short of the cost of the upgrade. Although I have used TurboTax for years, I may investigate alternatives next year.

title: Use H&R Block
content: I doubt I'll be using Turbotax again next year. I was charged $34.99 to file which I still don't understand (something about a holding bank). This was after purchasing the software for $49.99 at Walmart. I thought you got one free e-file with your purchase? A friend of mine tried the online version of turbotax as well as H&R Block. She received $600 more back using H&R Block and it only cost her $10 to e-file both federal and state.

title: Unhappy that I was not made aware of a software ...
content: Unhappy that I was not made aware of a software change to the state return which had a significant impact on liability of a return already filed. Noticed change accidentally.

title: Easy to Use Even For Non-Standard Forms
content: Very easy to use and works wonderfully even for forms that are more obscure. I had to leave the easy set up, but it was easy to return and finish up my tax returns. We completed two Federal returns with e-file and just mailed in the State stuff.

content: This product was obviously not ready to go when delivered. IRS sent a lesser amount refund than TurboTax computed when I sent in my return (with all the latest updates). After I received my refund I checked and there were later updates to TurboTax. With these updates installed I ran my same data again and it agreed with the lesser amount I had received from the IRS.

title: Review of TurboTax by QualityJoe
content: I have used TurboTax for several years and it is very user-friendly. I do have some concerns on some items that come up from time to time. One of the issues is that, after I have completed MY taxes and go in to work on my son or daughter's taxes, the program wants me to install updates. What does that do with the taxes I've already submitted? Am I okay with what I submitted? Are there changes that may help or hinder me? These are all concerns that I have. I did have the system lock-up this year; an issue I did not experience in the past. The information I had submitted was lost and I had to re-enter the data. I now am careful to save the info quite frequently.

title: Current edition is lousy
content: the changes made in the current edition I found to be very difficult to use. I have used TurboTax for a number of years. I do not plan on using it again in the future.

title: Really like the look of the shifter and it fits with ...
content: Really like the look of the shifter and it fits with the theme of my Jeep (old school). I used it on a Hurst shifter base (the lever that it came with was leaned way over and it was hitting my console). The Lokar shifter was made to use m8 socket cap bolts, and the Hurst is threaded for 3/8-24 bolts. So, I had to drill out the shifter lever for the bigger bolt, and get some longer bolts and nuts to back them up. I'm very pleased with the way it turned out and like how much taller the shifter is compared to the original Hurst one.

title: EVERYONE should get the rebate!
content: I want the rebate too. Why should I pay more simply because I thought I had to pay more last year to get the forms for Schedule C?!!

title: Excellent program for past 7 years...but this year's glitch was a huge, maddening time-waster.
content: Giving this 3 stars because of the glitch with the program not importing data from itsdeductible.com. The glitch caused a waste of probably 2-3 hours and the re-inputting of deductions and searching, searching, searching for a solution so I didn't have to re-enter all my deductions. Seeing that hundreds of users were also in the same maddening boat was little comfort. When there was finally a workable solution that I understood and could implement, it was still evident that the solution was not user-friendly for hundreds of users who were less familiar with how to find the TT program and then find the files that needed to be replaced by the "solution" files provided by the TT techs. At some point, I believe the solution was simply to click on "update" in the TT program itself, which is what it should have been from the beginnings (given that there was, in fact, a glitch that should not have been there from the beginning). So, contrary to the 7 prior years of being very pleased with TT, this year I experienced a time-wasting kind of frustration, annoyance, etc. If TT posted a notice anywhere stating that users may / probably would experience a glitch with importing key financial data from itsdeductible.com, I didn't see it. It certainly didn't come as a warning pop-up during my usage of the program. So, I'm disappointed by the Intuit organization. They could have and should have done better. Perhaps a charge-back to Intuit for my time which is rather precious to me, but for "settlement" purposes, I would tolerate $50 / hour. Nonetheless, I expect that I'll return again next year with intense optimism that such a glitch won't occur. But, please!!!, Intuit, develop better communication and reparation procedures. Hundreds, probably thousands, of us depend on a flawless program. After all, we are filing legal documents with the fed. govt. I've heard that the govt. has a limited sense of humor about faulty filings. Likewise, so do users relative to faulty programs. One more chance for you.

title: Excellent product.
content: Easy to use. Allows a complete check for all possible deductions and evaluates possible IRS red flags to create an accurate return.

title: This is the worst tax return that I have ever had to do
content: This is the worst tax return that I have ever had to do. I have been using Turbo Tax for many years but this is probably the last.

title: I have used Turbo Tax for the last seven years ...
content: I have used Turbo Tax for the last seven years. It carries forward the information from my last return, which makes in so much easier and faster then having to look up last years information. What used to be a two day project has become a two hour job. Turbo Tax guides me through each deduction and reminds me of what I can do to reduce my taxes. The electronic filing is included and once again Turbo Tax walks me through each step. It verifies my numbers. It even lets me know that my chance of a audit is low. I will continue to use Turbo Tax each year. It certainly has made what was once a formidable task, a much easier chore to accomplish.

content: Fast and easy. We enter the information and TurboTax does the work. If you use TurboTax each year the information you enter is less because your personal information is already there. Best of all you get your money sent directly to your bank in about two weeks.

content: Worst customer service ever this year. Could not be more dissatisfied this year with TurboTax. Been loyal since 2002.

title: Works, but e-filing and downloading additional states and modules really add to the cost.
content: Seems like every year, more and more extra costs pop up with this software. If you have to file in multiple states, the costs really add up. Sure, you get free federal e-file, but downloading additional states and filing state returns can really add to the costs. Also, if you have any stock transactions, it asks you to upgrade to premier edition, for an additional charge. You don't really have an easy way to know what the final costs will be until you have bought the software, installed it and put in all of your information. Then, it wants $29.99 here and 19.99 there to download additional returns and modules and then more $ to e-file them.

content: No where near as easy to use as in prior years. Since I needed the higher level program, I found it very difficult to upgrade.

content: The software is user-friendly. I was able to easily itemize deductions. The e-submission process was seamless. We received immediate confirmation of submission of our e-documents. Our tax refunds were immediately received. THANK YOU!

content: I think turbo tax will eventually suffer the same fate as the cable companies. content: I had a lot of trouble with turbo tax this year. After what you guys did this year, I will never buy another Intuit product!

title: The tool is thorough and good at asking all the questions to maximize your refund ...
content: TurboTax Deluxe meets your basic needs, but is, in my view, still very expensive for what you get. It is still a series of questions that you have to answer. You still have to do all the research and find all the numbers for your deductions, income, etc. You still have to want to document how much your car registrations were. The tool is thorough and good at asking all the questions to maximize your refund or minimize your additional tax payment. It also provides fairly good explanations about the questions in case they are confusing. For entry of the basic tax information and moving through your return I give this tool high marks. However, when you go off script and want to jump around, it becomes more difficult to use. There seems to be a big push to file electronically. This is fine for the federal return since that cost is included, however, filing electronically for state is another $20 (ridiculous when you are making it easier for everyone involved in the tax process). For this reason I still mail my state return when I really do not want to. Every year, I have to spend extra time trying to figure out how to print my state return to send. Why they do not have a button right where you file electronically to allow you to print the return for mailing I find disturbing. You can spend $20 in time trying to figure out how to do this because TT refuses to make it easy. Overall, OK, good enough, but overpriced and always looking to increase company revenue rather than user experience.

title: Until last year TurboTax was excellent but this year in my efforts to amend my ...
