title: H&R Block wanted $50 more than Intuit to do & e-file fed & state returns; so we're back to Turbo Tax.
content: We downloaded H&R Block a few months ago instead of Turbo Tax Deluxe, which we've used for many years, du to Turbo Tax's price increase/feature decrease. H&R worked about as well as Turbo Tax for our needs (married filing jointly with itemized deductions but nothing really special). However, Intuit dropped its price gouge meanwhile. And when it came time to file, we found out that with state and federal e-filing, using H&R Block's software would have cost $110, while Turbo Tax would have cost $60. Plus tax in both cases. H&R imported our 2013 Turbo Tax 1040 just fine. But since we hadn't had to pay up front for H&R (I think that's true in both cases), when we discovered we'd have to pay $50 extra to use H&R Block, we canceled the filing, downloaded Turbo Tax Deluxe 2014 and used that. Funny thing is, when Turbo Tax went through its features & pricing gyrations, all H&R Block needed to do was match them when their price came back down. They didn't, and so missed a great opportunity to pick up new customers like us. Four stars because it wouldn't load our 2013 1040, which we'd prepared with Turbo Tax. Finally I wound up having to fire up last year's version of Turbo Tax, load the 2013 return, then save it to a different location--which worked. But our one star isn't relevant for those who don't itemize, however.

title: That's a great way to retain customers
content: I have been a loyal TurboTax customer since the early 90s. But evidently, that doesn't matter at all to Intuit. While I usually purchased the Home and Business edition, I didn't think I needed it this year, as I closed my business. But I purchase Deluxe, and find I need Sch D. No problem, says Intuit...we can upgrade you for a mere $30. (see pic) But then I go online to their site, and they offer the Premier Ed. for only $20 more than Deluxe. (see pic) Sooo....what's the deal Intuit? Do you PUNISH your loyal customers for $10 for picking the wrong version? That's a great way to retain customers! You really screwed the pooch this time. EDIT: After contacting Intuit (took 30 min on hold) they agreed to upgrade for free. That process was painless, at least. 2 more stars and they just might keep me as a customer.

title: The program was disappointing this year. I hd to ...
content: The program was disappointing this year. I hd to physically go in and change several things on the forms on my returns.

title: NEWEST CHANGES too MANY GLITCHES
content: Local taxes could not be filed and yet local authorities said they were not at fault. Forms were up to date. It was the fault of Turbo. My state taxes refund was not the amt. turbo showed would be my refund, so not sure why this happened. When done filing and told e-file was successful....it shows a mailbox and says to make a copy and mail to IRS! Hello! Isn't that the purposr of e-filing?! A definite glitch! Spent more than 3 hrs. When it kept coming up thAt I couldn't submit payment and finally got a security number so they could file it from there end. None of these glitches in the past!

title: I am disappointed with the changes in printing
content: As a long term TurboxTax user, I am disappointed with the changes in printing. Previous to 2014, I could print very simply. Now requires a conversion into Adobe, in which printing became a much more difficult process; enough that I may very likely try H&R Block next year.

title: I've used turbo tax several years. I did not ...
content: I've used turbo tax several years. I did not get a free state as promised and will go to tax act, next year.

content: I had to call customer service to get past the screen of paying for my state tax to be filed filed. I could NOT file my federal because of that! I will not be purchasing this product again and I will let my friends know how they try to rip you off and hold the federal tax hostage.

title: Worst version of TurboTax yet
content: Worst version of TurboTax yet. Help features are useless. You might as well be trying to get information from the IRS

title: "Takes the headache out of filing your taxes!"
content: I would give this a 5 star rating if the product gave you 5 free state returns (instead of one) along with the 5 allowed federal returns. Other than that TurboTax "takes the headache out of filing your taxes"....that would make a good slogan and would be so true. Just answer a few multiple choice or yes/no questions and TurboTax does the rest...easy. I love it.

title: It worked great for our needs
content: It worked great for our needs. We have a fairly simple itemized return. The one complaint I have is that when I would leave the file and return to resume working on it, it did not "bookmark" me where I had left off. Either my memory fails me or that is not the way that previous editions have functioned. When you resume the file, you should be able to choose whether to start where you left off or go through it all again. It's possible that this problem is on my end, but I sure couldn't figure it out or find how to resume where I left off.

title: Disappointed in Intuit

title: Turbo didn't live up to its previous expectations,
content: Turbo didn't live up to its previous expectations, I found it was ambiguous with its answers and difficult to use

title: Does the Trick
content: Do you do taxes? Of course you do. Do you like to do taxes. Of course you don't. Enter an easy program which will automate the rather dull process, all while asking you tons of inane and un-thought of questions in order to maximize your refund.

title: Don't like Turbo Tax Management, but their basic "Deluxe" program works better for me than H&R'
content: Well, this year, after reading all the negative comments (well deserved, in my opinion) about the Turbo Tax managment's handling of their "upgrades", I decided to forget about Turbo Tax, and I bought the H&R Block program instead. Now my return is fairly simple, retirement income--Social Security and income from our IRA accounts--no rental propteties, nothing special. The "Deluxe" Turbo Tax that was offered this year would have handled my needs, just as it had since 2007. But I tought Turbo Tax needed to lose some skin. Didn't turn out that way. Was a glitch in the H&R Block program that double counted my withheld tax, and no matter how I tried, could not get it corrected. So, I wrote off my sunk cost of some $40 in H&R Block, and bought the Turbo Tax Deluxe. Worked just as it always had, no problems, logical queries, all the things I was used to in past years. Filed my Federal Taxes electronically, mailed in the state return as always, and got my small refund from IRS in less than ten days. I think that Turbo Tax management might have listened to some dummy MBA who convinced them to further segment their market, and capitalize on upselling. From what I read, they have incurred a lot of pain from it, and hopefully the people involved in the changes, and the poor communications of the changes have been given the opportunity to place their next employer in deep jeopardy. I intend to stay with Turbo Tax in 2016 unless they screw things up again.

title: Be aware of additional efiling charges you'll be as unhappy ...
content: Be aware of additional efiling charges you'll be as unhappy as I was. I've used turbo tax for years...

title: 4 Star
content: I was disappointed that I had to upgrade to the premium version to enter my K-1 info. If that is the case next year, I will look for another product, unless you allow the upgrade for free like this year. I have Turbo Tax for several years and like its functionality.

title: Saves Time, Reduces Headaches, State Filing Software Needs Improvement
content: I find it interesting that TurboTax promotes getting the biggest refund as why you should get TurboTax. Honestly...in three years of using it I have not seen any extra refund because of TurboTax. My taxes aren't simple --- itemized deducations, interest income, stock dividends or capital --- so there is room to find a hidden nugget. It's just that those nuggets are pretty obvious. WHY I GET TurboTax is for three other reasons: 1) speed of completing my taxes, 2) catching the new laws and rules seamlessly (like health insurance this year), and 3) easily filing state taxes. What used to take me several hours (at least), aw well as considerable grief from reading and re-reading the complex tax instructions, now only takes an hour if I have all my reference paperwork ready. MY BIGGEST COMPLAINT about TurboTax is the high cost for State taxes. In my situation I worked in one state and lived in another. So I would buy the TurboTax with one State filing included, but getting that second state costs nearly as much as my original TurboTax software. I am already a loyal customer year after year...wouldn't it be better to encourage me to use all your services by making it more cost-effective. This year I decided to do the second state on my own because of the high cost. MY OTHER COMPLAINT is the quality of the State versions of TurboTax. I know they have 50 states to deal with, but it feels like their Level 2 team works on the state versions. Instructions aren't as clear. Flow is clunky at times. I have less confidence in my State returns through TurboTax than the Federal. It still simplifies my tax filing life, so I live with it.

title: It was quick and easy. Before you spend the extra money for state ...
content: After buying the software, I realized that I'd have to spend additional money towards e-filing my state taxes. Instead of spending the money, I looked at the Nebraska e-file website and filed my taxes using the website's program. It was quick and easy. Before you spend the extra money for state tax return, verify your state will do it online for free and you don't have any convoluted tax stuff to deal with. Other than that, TurboTax is easy to use, it imports your old tax returns and helps guide you along to see if there any new changes. I'd give the program 5 stars, but not worth it when you can file your state taxes online for free.

title: Disappointed
content: I like the ease of TurboTax but we have always had to pay for the state, it has never been free as advertised.

title: WTF TurboTax. W-T-F.
content: This felt like a bait and switch scheme and my refund was dismal. Total crap compared to last year's version.

title: only get burnt once
content: turbo dropped sch and raised the price. will have to think twice in order to buy the program next year.

title: Good product, but...
content: Overall, I liked it a lot. It was easy to navigate, no problem doing a small part at a time & coming back to it. I really only have 2 issues with it. 1.) TurboTax does not have a way to properly handle the annual reporting of US Savings Bonds Interest on Form 1040. While most people report savings bonds interest when they redeem the bonds, IRS does allow you to annually report the accrual of bond interest, so that you do not need to report multiple years interest when the bonds are redeemed. While I was able to manually identify the bond interest on Form 1040 as being annually reported, TurboTax was not able to automatically transfer this amount to my State tax form (WI), which subtracts US interest from income. I had to manually enter the amount on my State tax form during a final review before e-filing the form. This has the potential of paying more state tax than you should. 2.) When I purchased this product I thought that it not only included the State Forms, but also the e-filing of the State Form. It does not. You can print a paper copy of the State form and mail it in. But if you wish to e-file the State form, who must pay an additional $20 to do so. I think that the price of the product should include e-filing of both the Federal and State forms.

title: it doesn't work as well as it did ten years ...
content: it doesn't work as well as it did ten years ago, but I did get my taxes done. This years (2015) is horrible

title: Only use this if you have before, otherwise try something better.
content: Most companies try to improve their products every year, but apparently Intuit is trying just the opposite.

title: Bad Year for TurboTax.
content: TurboTax is having a bad year. On top of the filing issues, they messed up calculations on my state taxes.

title: Using this year's Turbo Tax seemed to be somewhat more ...
content: Using this year's Turbo Tax seemed to be somewhat more user friendly. However, I think Turbo Tax Deluxe State and Fed E file should also include dividend/interest information (non real estate related investment income/loss).

title: state tax
content: Why must I pay for state tax when, it is the same info? What is it with EZ tax, with no info for state tax? I Know some states do not have income tax, But most do. If this is not fixed, I may have to go another way.

title: No complaints
content: Bought the Deluxe version to file for my wife, myself and my dependent son. I finished filing my return in less than half an hour, and received my refund in about 10 days. I couldn't be happier. I know that people were upset because they had to buy the Premium version to account for rental property or investments, but I personally think the slightly higher price is a drop in the bucket for anyone who really knows what they are doing when it comes to rental property or investment savings. Some people will complain about anything it seems. For us TurboTax is great and we should be using it for years to come.

title: Good product
content: I kept having to download a more expensive Turbo Tax to get all of the forms I needed. Also I had inadvertently checked a box on schedule D incorrectly. There was no way to uncheck it, and I couldn't e file with it checked. I had to delete that form and do it all over again. I was able to complete my taxes.

title: One Star
content: Never did e-mail the federal or State returns. Stopped at last point and never corrected an oversight

title: Two Stars
content: Probably the last year I use it. It was ratherly costly compared to some other programs and web sites.

title: Nasty surprise this year in having to upgrade and pay ...
content: Nasty surprise this year in having to upgrade and pay for it. Turbo Tax pulled a quick one to enhance what it costs consumers to get the same product they have previously used. I'm shopping for another product next year.

title: Mid tax season price increase on State E-Filings
content: The reviews here on Amazon have thoroughly discussed the "switcheroo" that Intuit made of its Turbo Tax Deluxe product this year from prior years. Intuit responded after numerous complaints and corrected its marketing fiasco. Now here we go again. On the software box, it notes that a state e-filing fee is $19.99--but in a footnote to that pricing, in fine print, it notes that the price may increase. Well guess what? On March 20, 2015, in the middle of tax filing season, Intuit increased the state e-filing fee from $19.99 to $24.99 and the only way you know that is immediately before you hit "click" to file your tax return. Surprise, surprise, surprise. Our friends at Intuit continue to "nickel and dime" the customer. Apparently, this mid-tax season price increase is normal--it happened to me last year too, I just did not realize it! Intuit has such a good product but they are trying everything possible to make customers angry at them. The morale of the story is to file early--I just wish Intuit would disclose this business practice on its packaging. The product is 5 stars--the marketing and "truth in pricing" is one star--hence my 3 star review.

title: Poor Business Case!!
content: I have used TurboTax in the past, which is why I tried it this year. I had the information needed and input all; everything was as expected. But I was pretty appalled at the obvious DECEITFUL approach to efiling the state tax; thereby increasing the cost of the Software by 50%!!!! The tactic closely equalled that used by Columbia records years ago: "You can buy a fabulous _____(fill in) for only $15.00!!" and if you don't respond they send it AND Bill you anyway--because you did not tell them explicitly that you were NOT interested. In Turbo Tax' strategy, you have everything you need to efile the Fed and state tax. The Fed tax can be easily submitted....but wait, in order to efile the state tax, you have to pay them an additional $25. AND your state tax is in efile format; AND you do NOT have the information as to how to send it via snail mail, FOUL!

title: I wasted the money on TurboTax and it cost me $150 ...
content: It did not work very well and made some mistakes. I have used it for many years and did not have a problem. I had to have a CPA and tax expert to do the taxes over. I wasted the money on TurboTax and it cost me $150 to have it done over.

title: TurboTax is GREAT.
content: I love turbo tax I have used it for many years. Turbo Tax has made it easy to do my taxes. It walks me through every item so I don't miss anything. I also love It's Deductable. It helps me with my charitable donations

title: ... using turbotax deluxe for years and I am very pleased with the software
content: I've been using turbotax deluxe for years and I am very pleased with the software. Very easy to use.

title: Beware of hidden cost
content: The deluxe version cost is more because of the state income tax calculation but what they DON'T tell you is that you have to pay another $19.99 plus tax to e-file a state return. That fact should be stated somewhere on the product. Deceitful. Besides that, the product is easy to use.

title: One Star
content: I think it sucks how you treat your repeat customers Next year I will probably use another product.

title: Great Tax Prep Product for the non-tax experts
content: As someone who does their own taxes, TurboTax makes it simple and easy to file both Federal and State taxes. The only issue I have is that if you go back to review your taxes, you will have to go thru the "Completion" process, which will display advertisements and ask the use for optional safeguards for a cost, of course.

title: Did not think that this version adequately explained problems and ...
content: Did not think that this version adequately explained problems and questions that arose because of the Unaffordable Care Act. Also very difficult to print the returns. Wound up having to go to an accountant.

title: but still not as good as the older versions
content: A major improvement over the last few editions, but still not as good as the older versions pre2012

title: I found a huge mistake missed on one of the ...
content: I found a huge mistake missed on one of the forms that would have cost me several hundreds of $$$$.

title: Not what it used to be.
content: I have used TurboTax for many years now. The past few it seems to be getting worse. Help is very helpful. Some of the more complex aspects with Stocks and HSAs are a bit confusing but I do have to say, sucking in your tax information for investment does work fairly well. While ItsDeductible is pretty easy to use, the search engine is not very good. If you type if you type in "Picture frame" you want get anything but if you type in "Picture frames" you might get numerous "Picture Frame" responses. Plurals give you what you are looking for even though the description is singular. Searching with singulars like "bag" yield almost not response even though there are lots of "bag" items. The killer was the state tax part. The simple interest forms kept leaving blank lines in between entries it found on the Fed forms and then it would duplicate the interest twice! I finally had to manually override several forms before it would stop giving errors. For some reason it did not pull from the Fed forms correctly. All in all, I already ordered software from a different company for next year.

title: Very buggy.
content: Terrible very buggy. Been using for 10 years and this was terrible. Will reconsider for next year.

title: Good but....
content: Turbo Tax was very easy to use and I got my refund very quickly. The issue I have is since I received my return I have been getting phone calls from a "person" saying they were from the IRS and we are facing a lawsuit.

title: Very disappointed in you taking forms out of the program and ...
content: Very disappointed in you taking forms out of the program and putting them in a higher purchase version. You have managed to cut your own customer base extremely. Think before you pull stunts like that again!

title: Wrong software... Deluxe was upgraded to the ...
content: Wrong software...Deluxe was upgraded to the Premier Edition. Could NOT get a refund!!

title: Easy To Use
content: We have used TurboTax for many years now, it is so easy to use and at the same time leaves us confident that our taxes are accurate and done right! See no reason to change, very pleased with the product.

title: They ended up splitting what software versions were best used for and greatly increased the price of those ...
content: Software-wise, it's functional and it does its purpose. However, they messed up this year with reorganizing the categories of their software as the Deluxe version used to be for both Small Business owners as well as Deductions and Homeowners. They ended up splitting what software versions were best used for and greatly increased the price of those versions past what it used to cost a few years ago. This faux pas as well as the ever increasing price of the software has soured the experience for many longtime users (especially if you've seen the news about TurboTax this tax season). If you don't mind paying the increase (used to hover around $30-$40 years ago, is more like $50-$60 now), then this software will be fine for you. But I'm considering trying another software next year, mainly because of the price but because the other software brands now are able to recognize and extract TurboTax files, so I can just transfer an information from my previous return into the new software. Long term, for the price and features, probably look elsewhere. Not recommended.

title: MEH
content: this version, for some reason, is riddled with errors. I hope I did it right. Support was poor.

title: Two Stars
content: Would not let me remit payment online, kept giving same error message with no solution offered

title: Becareful what TurboTax you get for what is needed, they changed
content: Disappointed because they made changes and to do what was done previous I had to purchase more

title: Not worth it
content: Totally overpriced and not worth it. Go with TaxAct if you have any tax knowledge whatsoever.

title: Not bad, but it does not include basic investment sales
content: Not bad, but it does not include basic investment sales. The deluxe edition should include sales of mutual funds. I had to pay the increase for the premier version just for the sale of some mutual funds...

title: not buying it again
content: With all the negative issues reported after buying turbotax I took my taxes to an accountant

title: Regressing
content: This year's version is inferior to last year's. Stripping out features was not a good idea.

title: A little disappointed that Intuit scaled down the features included in the ...
content: A little disappointed that Intuit scaled down the features included in the Deluxe version, but TurboTax is still the best tax filing product on the market. You get what you pay for, and TurboTax works great!

title: Declining confidence in a once reliable product
content: The software takes you through endless steps if you let it. You can also choose to do things 'manually' but there aren't really any other choices, such as take me through the most common things only. I had earned interest on my Escrow account, so I decided to use Turbo Taxes electronic import feature rather than enter the 1099 manually. I found it very worrisome when the program reported my mortgage interest as income and ignored my escrow interest. I was able to delete everything and enter it manually. I tried to contact Intuit to report the error, but found it nearly impossible. I searched their website and blog, only to find others who unsuccessfully tried to report errors. The absence of a mechanism to report errors greatly reduces my confidence in this software. I have used this software in the past, but I am not sure I will continue to do so. My taxes are fairly simple so I could just do them completely manually. If I had complex tax issues I am not sure I would trust this software since errors might not be obvious to me.

title: Try a competitor!
content: Awful customer service. Product is average. Too expensive. Will go elsewhere next year.

title: NO Schedule D! Again! I'm done with turbotax ...
content: 2015 NO Schedule D ! Again! I'm done with turbotax! going back to paper filing for me!

title: Used to love this program
content: Why only one state tax is available this year? Very limited. Used to love this program.

title: My Initial Experiences with TurboTax
content: I used to do my own State and Federal income tax without outside assistance up until about 1989. After that I tried H&R Block for about maybe five years. But the last year I had a bad experience. I was told I had to pay quite a bit more than I was expecting. The next year I was fortunate to find a CPA, who I really liked. He even got me everything back from the last time I had filed through H&R Block. Unfortunately, he moved out of the area sometime in 2012, so I was really worried how I was going to file for 2013. I have friends that have always sworn by TurboTax, but I had never tried it. So, to file for the year 2013, I bought my first copy of TurboTax. It was surprisingly easy. Even so, I was still worried up until I received both my Federal and State refunds. I filed again this year using TurboTax, and even e-filed my returns for the first time. TurboTax guided me through the whole process once again, and even allowed me to easily find reasonable prices to use for itemizing each of my many smaller donation items for 2013. Worked out great! Received both of my refunds direct deposited in record time. Will I continue using TurboTax? You bet!!

title: ... can depend on TurboTax to make filing my taxes easy. The questions are thorough and miss nothing
content: I can depend on TurboTax to make filing my taxes easy. The questions are thorough and miss nothing. I was a bit nervous after the scare in the news, but I tried a competitor and after using it I found I needed to go back to TurboTax to get the right result. TurboTax asked questions not on the other program and resulted in a $800.00 savings for me. I also appreciated how easy it was to buy TurboTax from Amazon and download it for immediate use!

title: One Star
content: This was a disappointing year. Numerous problems. Confusing direction from a Turbo Tax v

title: One Star
content: you put my income on the wrong line now I have to submit an amended form walter mcgarry

title: VERY SCREWED UP. I bought the deluxe and then ...
content: VERY SCREWED UP. I bought the deluxe and then had to purchase premier? What was this?

title: Two Stars
content: was not happy it would not import the info from last years file had to enter all again.

title: As usual Turbo Tax was easy to use and I had our simple taxes done ...
content: This is my 10th year using Turbo Tax. I was about to go to another software when the flap about Turbo Tax started but relented. As usual Turbo Tax was easy to use and I had our simple taxes done in less than an hour. It got me a better return that I expected.

title: Even better than last year's program!
content: Well, this is my second year with Turbo Tax Deluxe. Last year (2013 Turbo Tax Deluxe) was my first time doing my own taxes in over 20 years. Long story short, 'I' made a mistake that Turbo Tax Deluxe did not catch which allowed me to file a return with an inflated refund amount. I had checked and double checked manually and with the software but it said all was well. So..30 days later, I get a 'corrected' refund amount from the state with a printout of where I made my error. So I was a little leery of using Turbo Tax again this year, but my niece (who is a CPA and a tax professional) assured me all would be ok. Long story short, Turbo Tax 2014 took me through flawlessly this year, and even allowed me to 'correct' the mistake in my files of my 2013 return (which is something the 2013 software refused to allow me to do). All in all, a very positive experience this year and the software was even easier to use than last year. And no problems with the state this year!!

title: Mixed bag of value 3 1/2 stars for the extra work required!
content: I'm a bit split on this software with the new changes that have been implemented. Navigation between sections and within sections are not as easy or functional as previous years. I missed one section that resulted in a huge miss on refunds and I had to paper file an amended return. I'm also a bit disappointed in the split between the online version and this version. Having college aged children who work part time out of state this software is not $$ friendly. After compiling one child's federal taxes I did not want to pay two state filings (which would cost as much as the whole software. It was frustrating to file only the federal and print out the state. But the online software will only let you e-file state if you also e-file the federal so switching over was not an option for my first child. (lesson learned prior to filing the other returns!) It would be great to have a hybrid option for family filings that have mixed users at varied income levels.

title: false advertizing
content: I see ll of the ads saying you file for free why was I charged 35.00 to file my taxes?

title: New format is horrible.
content: Overpriced! Plus cost me $70 to file. I won't use it again. New format is horrible.

title: Two Stars
content: Very disappointed at the new pricing, etc....will be looking elsewhere next January.

title: Marginal
content: Sucks worse yet. Unfortunately there seems no other options, tried h&r block, it not only sucked but did calculations wrong. It's still better then filling all the forms out by hand but not much, it hides forms and makes it difficult to take deductions. It's so bad this year and so many complaints, h&r block is giving free program out hoping to get turbo tax customers to switch.

title: Cheater, no more honest.
content: Turbo tax is cheating, I have to upgrade to premier so that I could do my tax work.

title: Good, but I had to switch to the Premium ...
content: Good, but I had to switch to the Premium Edition at an increased cost half way thru the return. I had bought the Deluxe thinking it would cover selling my house. It didn't. This should have been spelled out on the box and I would have bought the more costly edition on sale. I also don't like how the Turbo people obfuscate the extra cost for the State filing and filing charges. Put it on the box; I don't like surprises.

title: Seniors Concerns and Tool to Minimize Second Guessing
content: We have used TURBOTAX for several years and we have found it to be very effective and user friendly. I have recommended it to several individuals. I live in a Sun City community. A significant concern of several of my neighbors is: (1) The lost of a "parent" and addressing of the deceased tax return in the year of death and the valuing of assets and the recognition of income to them as beneficiaries in the year of the parent's death. (2) They have several retirement plans. They want to know is there away to consolidate the plans before they are 70 so the plans can be spread out and not have a large tax issue with each plan playing them at the same time. If TURBO TAX can address these issues and others in this growing market say you have a significant populations having to deal with these concerns. You can call it "tax concerns of 65 plus". The automation aspects of this market will make seniors wish to address it. They use their CPA and Attorneys but they would like to have hands on before they make these decisions.

title: One Star
content: I could not believe all of the extra charges for filing at the end of the returns.

title: Five Stars
content: Always easy to use. Guidance is easy to follow. Have used TurboTax for many years.

title: Very disappointed with the product this year
content: I will never buy your product again. Very disappointed with the product this year.

title: TurboxTax customer service is useless.
content: The software interface was easy to use and I liked that there were prompts/messages that kept me engaged. However, I didn't like how there wasn't a navigation/menu page for me to easily go through the different sections. IE I had to go through the whole filling process to just edit a portion of the section... And near the end, I was prompted to pay extra money to get my state e-filed even though I thought it was included. The first 2x I contacted TurboTax, they had no idea what to do... useless! It was only when I called Amazon that I discovered that the Amazon deal only paid for state paper filling, not the e-file. I finally contacted TurboTax again and had to really test my patience to get the right code to help me efile state taxes. At the end, taxes were filed. Returns were received within 2 weeks which is pretty fast. Not sure if I'll use this again...

title: One Star
content: not consistent - online version gave a different refund than the download version

title: If not I leave for better grounds somewhere else
content: go back to the old Turbo Tax, If not I leave for better grounds somewhere else.

title: Two Stars
content: I did not get a refund, i had to pay tax in addition to what i have already paid.

title: The Honeymoon is Over
content: Answering so many questions, mostly non-relevant, but many requiring research into my records and receipts was just "mental masturbation". The standard deduction was all I needed from the get-go. Wish I had known before I started. Also, I'm a writer. I sell my books and I have a few marketing expenses. Profit and loss is a matter of basic subtraction. Imagine my surprise when I couldn't go further with my business information unless I invested another $40 to buy the Business TurboTax edition. Of course I didn't do that, but the program was pretty insistent about not going further until I did. Eventually, I was able to input my income and expenses. I understand that because my husband died in January, this presents a little snag when it comes to filing. I received a filing number from TurboTax of my own, tried to e-file and was rejected. The problem no doubt was related to filer identity, but I didn't want to get into a back and forth with the IRS about the correct e-filing number. I simply mailed in a physical return and hope for the best. This is the first year that TurboTax has disappointed me.

title: Unable to download the program
content: I was unable to download the program so I purchased program containing the disc.

title: Two Stars
content: If you can offer two federal filings don't know why you couldn't have two state.

title: Two Stars
content: At the end I still had pay 19.99 to file after I had paid amazon to start with ?

title: Works for me...
content: My taxes are not complicated. I am retired. I have Social Security and a Company Pension, a portfolio of stocks and bonds and mutual funds. I have used Turbo Tax since its inception and have found no problem. Prior to that time I did my own taxes and was used to the forms. Turbo Tax kept up with the changes and entering information from one year to another was already done. The questions make it easy and if one takes the time to let Turbo ask the questions there is no problem, I hear that people with more complicated tax situations had trouble with Turbo Tax this year, even by Turbo Tax's own acknowledgment. But I still found it to be a helpful tool. Do the taxes, hit the button for electronic transmission, pay the $19 fee to file state electronically and you're done. I asked an accountant friend which program she used. She told me and when I asked the cost I was glad I was sitting down. $49-50 for Turbo or $3,000 for other. PS Have already received my tax refunds from 2014

title: Great for handling tax returns.
content: Have used Turbo Tax (TT) for several years now after some years using a competitor product which I found to be unsatisfactory. This year as in past years I had no problem with the system and the ease of use, primarily because I had inserted the information about basics that found itself on the new form. So plug in the new financial data, and then get a result suitable for filing. I didn't have to worry this time around about selling securities, so I didn't need the more advanced program that TT offers. TT's special deal with Amazon meant a 10% boost in the return amount from the feds (if you are eligible), which was and is appreciated. Note: I was worried a bit about the well publicized problems with infiltration by villains, who hijack money, but I had no problems since I filed relatively early. Still, hijacking on the wide open road of the Net is a concern, and I hope that the Powers That Be in charge of TT will address that matter in the future. Full marks, otherwise.

title: One Star
content: difficulty downloading product. will go to store in future to get disc format.

title: No Better Tax Software Available!
content: Never any problems with this software, these are the people I go to every year.

title: well the social security end of it was not well ...
content: well the social security end of it was not well explained especially the back pay part of it, If u get awarded your back pay then it does not explain your options U just get taxed on 85 % of your award, (If your spouse makes more than 44,000) no options or explanations. I had to research to find out my options and the turbo tax help was a joke. They did not even know what i was talking about

title: Not worth it.
content: You might as well just do it all online because it is easier to do it there.

title: 10 + years of using turbotax i'm done
content: Due to the forms changes i will give tax cut a chance this year.

title: The free upgrade worked for me, same as last year.
content: The free upgrade worked for me. When I got to that point in the software, "Upgrade to Premier for $0", click, download/install took less than 30 seconds, then I was moving on. I understand the frustration from all the previous reviews, I'm glad I waited until Intuit sorted all this out. It's the same as last year.

title: overpriced
content: overpriced

title: Two Stars
content: Totally missed the state sales tax deduction. I will not use it next year.

title: Good Product
content: Easy to use, seems to cover all bases, checks & rechecks answers, presents a running total amount of refund. Interested only in having refund deposited in my account, not in gift card, so that part is lost on me. Have used Turbo Tax for the last several years, and will again.

title: Time to move on. You lost your way, TT.
content: After last year's travesty, you lost me as a customer forever.

title: Consider learning to use a different program!
content: Have been a loyal customer for years. Was extremely disappointed to find that Intuit crippled the Deluxe version this year. It is totally worthless to even the modest investor. I gave it 2 stars because when I tried other software I was disappointed and came back and because they tried to correct the terribly misguided choice by offering Schedule C and D for free. THEN, when I tried to file, I was unable to because of a glitch with Form 2441. The help section promised an update to correct the known problem and has not happened by the date they promised. I am stuck in a frustrating circular pattern at the last step of filing. I cannot delete the form or enter information to make it happy....still waiting to file. If you can possibly use another program - do it.

title: Turbo-Tax has worked for us for over a Decade
content: We have used Turbo Tax Delux for eleven years (2004-2015) Each year it seems to get easier to do our own taxes as our situation has simplified as we have aged, and the software has improved over the years. We choose to E-file, but pay the remaining balance due via check and postal mail. That is a personal choice, not due to any issue with Turbo-Tax. One small detail needing improvement in the program though, both the Federal and our State require a voucher-form to accompany a payment check if your payment is not included in the E-file transmission. INTUIT needs to make it easier to print a copy (or 2) of that voucher for those of us who do the E-file then decide to pay by check rather than use a credit card or electronic transfer of funds. A Small correction would make Turbo-Tax a 5-Star Product for us.

title: One Star
content: awful; had to hire a tax consultant to undo what this very claimed to do

title: One Star
content: Turbo Tax rip me off on the "NEW" Deluxe What happen again!

title: Turbo Tax Headaches
content: I have used Turbo Tax for quite a few years and have always been completely satisfied with the results. However, this year I was less then pleased. The Federal return it did fine. I moved last year so had to file in two states. The first state it did completely wrong. It's the state I have lived in for over 20 years therefore had plenty of background from previous years. Luckily I reviewed the filing before submitting it and corrected the mistake. Interestingly, even when I corrected the mistake, Turbo Tax didn't raise a fuss. Apparently it liked the return the wrong as well as the correct way. I purchased the second state from Turbo Tax for $40, only then did it tell me that it couldn't totally complete my return for that state. I would need to go onto the state website and download some additional forms to complete, then file manually. Frankly, if I had known I'd need to do all that leg work I would have saved my $40 and done the entire state return myself. Not sure what's up with the software this year, but it needs an overhaul.

title: Turbo Tax for the Working Poor -Please
content: I have used TurboTax for years and it is easy to use and effective. I do have an issue with the price of Turbo Tax for someone who no longer earns much income and has no real deductions. When I had a small consulting business and earned enough, Turbo Tax was a good value. Now that I am working at a P/T recession era job, Turbo Tax is a bit pricey, but I have very little patience for wading through NJ income tax forms. For the few hundred dollars that NJ takes from a basically legally poor person, they compound the issue with a tax form that a CPA needs training to do. Turbo Tax needs to sell a stripped down version for the working poor, they would sell more product. Also, they need to reduce the efile charges. If you earn $80k then $80 is not a big deal, but if you earn $12k per year, that is half a paycheck.

title: Two Stars
content: I was unhappy that I had to upgrade to Premier to record sale of stock

title: My refund is $39.99
content: What?!?! No SCHEDULE D in Deluxe??? I want a refund ... from Intuit!

title: I love it, it's simple to use and has saved ...
content: Fourth year in a row to use TurboTax! I love it, it's simple to use and has saved us hundreds of dollars by not using our very expensive CPA. I almost really messed up this year because I purchased TurboTax Deluxe Federal Returns & E-File, plus State Returns. I purchased my copy from Fry's Electronics in Campbell, CA. I paid about $10 more for this version thinking that it included my state of California return and filing. Upon completion of both my Fed and State tax I became confused because the program kept wanting me to pay for my state tax filing portion when I believed that it was included in my version. Then on top of that, I believed that I had filed both taxes. I week later upon reviewing everything I discovered both taxes were not file and still sitting on my computer! The program did allow me to file both taxes after I paid them an additional $25! Amazingly the $25 made everything click right into place. Fry's Electronics did not have one person to explain this to me! 68 and still learning!

title: This year it was terrible, had to have up dates and was very
content: This year it was terrible,had to have up dates and was very confusing

title: of other things as you may say is elementary but to the first time user these issues can be a great headache. Especially if you
content: Well they told me that turbo tax could be done by a 6 yr. old and the truth is it probably can be. But as a first time user i will say that though instructions were simple to follow one will have to painstakingly work their way through the first time. You will have to suffer through things such as do not backward the page except unless you use the "back" button (that is if there is one) on the bottom of the page or you will lose everything. And also understand and remember to always save your work before exiting..I can list a no. of other things as you may say is elementary but to the first time user these issues can be a great headache. Especially if you have no one to ask. What may be an hours work can turn into a three day headache...but again...approach it with some common sense and you will have the satisfaction of doing your own taxes as well as saving yourself a few bucks...This year was my first time and i see no reason that i will ever use anything else....

title: One Star
content: I was very disappointed this year. It seems different, Hard to use.

title: Intuit is the worst!!!!
content: Changed it and I didn't find out until after I got half way through.

title: You'll have to pay one way or the other
content: TurboTax has been reliable, I've been using it 15-20 years now and have not had one problem yet. It's a lot less expensive than the CPA I use to go to prior but yet still costly for what it is, and there really isn't much to State tax yet the price increases significantly when added plus the additional charge for E-filing...which I avoid by printing and mailing instead. But although TurboTax selects the best methods and options for you, I still like to go backwards and input "what ifs" to see how different categories change obligations and bottom line returns giving me a sense of knowledge of how tax laws differ from bracket to bracket. Bottom line is, I feel like (and I think that's the most important issue with just about any negotiable purchase) its legally lowering my liability as much as possible while paying for itself at the same time.

title: Five Stars
content: so easy and fast. Been using it for at least 10 years. Great value.

title: Not up to par
content: Much less than what I have been used to from delux over the years.

title: I got a copy last year just like this years copy and I was told that it ...
content: I have used Turbo Tax for many years but this year Turbo Tax made charges to it program. I got a copy last year just like this years copy and I was told that it was a mistake and they downloaded a new copy. The copy last year was limited copy that Turbo was testing and they then released it this year. I have the most basic tax needs and I did my taxes and then when I went to file on line I was directed to upgrade my program at cost of $39..99 on top of the fee that I had already paid. I was told to wait until February 7th and Turbo was upgrading free. I will not be using Turbo Tax next year. Just up the cost of the program but do not sell it and then tell customers that they must pay more after they input tax information and want to file. I always file EZ so why do I have to upgrade my software.

title: Works well for me!
content: I've used Turbo Tax for years and like the system. My only problem with it is that I have deductions and don't have to pay State Tax. I'd love for them to come out with an edition that is a little cheaper where a person could just file with deductions, Federally. It's really easy if you follow the directions, and if you don't understand, there are usually links explaining what is necessary. I once tried a local accountant because I thought I'd have too many things going on - that bill was over $700.00. She was incredibly understanding when I complained and ended up charging me nothing - but, I filed an amended return using Turbo and ended up getting more money. A couple of years ago I had a major glitch - don't know what happened, but an incorrect return was filed . .. . had to jump through some hoops, but managed to get everything straightened out. I don't know if it was a problem with Turbo or something I did, but I decided to continue with Turbo and have not been disappointed.

title: I'm happy with TuboTax
content: I've filled my Federal and State taxes with TurboTax for many years. Every year Intuit makes improvements in functionality and in ease of use. But, this year was the best ever. This tax-filing program is pretty darn smooth. Filing taxes is never a joyous occasion for me. Gathering up the support, and verifying the information I've got is absolutely boresome. But, I have to say, getting it all into TurboTax is just about painless. I move back and forth between "guided mode" and the "I know what I'm doing mode" but, in the final analysis, I use all of the automatic checking features built into the program before filing. There are several slick features built into the program--comparing all entries to last year's filing as I enter information is one--but maybe the best one is showing what my tax saving would be if I added money to my IRA. This year I turned a Federal/State net "no refund, no payment" total into a net "$1,500 refund" by adding about twice amount that to my IRA. Good stuff! This year I'd made my new 2014 IRA contribution and filed both Federal and State taxes in mid-Feburary... I got the State refund in a week ago and the Federal refund just hit my bank account. I'm happy with TurboTax!

title: Caution!!!!!!!!!
content: Thanks to turbo tax, my identity was stolen!! Not a happy camper!

title: Two Stars
content: new and improved means they changed it so it doesn't work anymore

title: State tax program sucks
content: The state tax performe an error and now I am being questioned!!!!

title: Five Stars
content: I AM A FAN OF TURBO TAX AND I ALWAYS PURCHASE IT THROUGH AMAZON.

title: Turbo Tax - Thumbs Up
content: Turbo Tax is an excellent tax software package that is user friendly and walks you through the entire tax preparation process in a quick, easy manner, guiding you through from beginning to end, following the same logic as if you were attempting to do the 1040 by yourself. My return is moderately complicated and I was able to complete both Federal and State returns in about 2 hours. The printouts provide a great, easy to follow audit trail. The electronic submission was quick with immediate feedback. The software also finds you the maximum amount of money in the process. For example, there are different forms and choices one can make in terms of education credits. Turbo tax runs through the various options and chooses the best one for you. Most of your information is transferred over the following tax season. The price of $50 was very reasonable, considering the alternative of paying for a tax accounting service or a tax accountant. I would strongly recommend this software to everyone and am giving it a 5 star rating.

title: I like the software
content: I like the software, it works this year (tax year 2014) just as well as all years, and the steps for including my HSA were handled well. My biggest gripe is how critical features seemed to spread across to higher-level versions. Many people have heard of the feature moves that forced customers to upgrade from the middle-tier version up to premium. That same issue caused me to have to move from Basic to Deluxe (or whatever the middle one is called). It is only a small monetary difference, but if I hadn't been diligent about reading the literature I'd have bought the same version I've been using for years only to find it lacked 1099-MISC support and been screwed into having to drive back to my local store and go through an exchange process. Torpedoes some of the 'convenience' of doing your own taxes at home. At any rate, the thrust is this: It is still a great and easy-to-use package, but be SURE you know which version will cover your needs. I'm dingin' 'em a star for this change that seems to have no real basis other than to squeeze a few more dollars out of every customer.

title: Read the reviews before you buy!
content: Thanks to the reviewers who have flagged Intuit's cynical degrading of this product. I am switching to HR Block after over 15 years with TurboTax.

title: Awesome, easy to understand as usual. Changed somewhat, still perfect in understanding.
content: I have used turbo tax for 6 plus years? Not sure, it was different this year, many changes of course. This is first year of being retired for my husband and myself, so our return was different as well. I feel so secure with turbo tax, and the experience was easy. I always try to have my paperwork in order and ready, but with few changes in the filing, I had to reset my documents somewhat. I feel safe, secure, love it, easy to do, and what I pay for turbo tax is a far cry from what I would pay an accountant which I know use turbo tax. You have step by step and can correspondence with agent. Love it....Easy fast, print my return and refunds rapidly returned. Thank you Turbo, its taken a nightmare of getting taxes done, to a pleasant experience. Next year will be easier, as will mainly be social security & pension, more basic this one.

title: TurboTax Deluxe was perfect for my 2014 taxes
content: TurboTax Deluxe was perfect for my 2014 taxes. It had additional explanations that were not in last year's version that made it even easier to use. Too bad they messed up so badly with the publicity around upgrades.

title: Not happy at all
content: Had to pay for filing state. Not happy at all. Waist of money

title: One Star
content: A simple stock transaction requires an upgrade. What a rip off!

title: Messed up big time, offer to fix may backfire.
content: I bought TurboTax before I learned that they had moved some of the features that I had used for years to the next level of TurboTax. They claim that they had made the public aware of the changes but I had never heard about them. I wrote an email to TurboTax complaining about this and so must have a lot of other people because TurboTax replied with an apology stating they had messed up by making these changes and would make it good by letting everyone who had purchased the Deluxe edition upgrade to the premium level at no charge. This was really big of them. I did get the upgrade but I will seriously consider if I will ever purchase TurboTax in the future. As I said, earlier, I have used TurboTax for many previous years, but their decision to deceive the public first then try to make up by offering to fix the mistake will make me think long and hard before I will ever purchase TurboTax, again. Word to TurboTax: "You messed up big time, this time and it may cost you big time in the future".

title: dishonest advertising. I will never purchase Turbo Tax again ...
content: dishonest advertising. I will never purchase Turbo Tax again.

title: Five Stars
content: Quick, efficient, and accurate. Have used TurboTax for years.

title: 2014 Version is OK. It handled a simple, itemized, return easily. Make sure the version purchased can handle your needs.
content: 2014version of Turbo Tax worked well. If you have used it before it won't offer any surprises. I do not like the fact that some schedules are not included (Schedule D), though, because of complaints, Intuit added these -for this year. I also don't like the fact that they make it cumbersome to use eFile for federal tax, but to use paper to file one's state tax. $25 to electronically file state tax, or any tax, it too much. It isn't a great problem, but it is annoying what one must do to accomplish this. I also do not like that the option to apply a refund to one's next year's federal tax did not appear. Maybe it exists somewhere in the program, .but it wasn't apparent

title: Why work hard on miserable tax forms when this is available?
content: We have used this tax tool for several years, and we always find the experience to be worth the expense. Everything works smoothly, and the program imports so many things into our return that our effort is minimal. The forma are always filled out correctly, the proper calculations are made, and the arithmetic is always correct. The stae forms are een more effortless than the federal. Finally, the e-filing is quick and flawless.

title: What was Intuit thinking?
content: I have used Turbo Tax faithfully for over 20 years. This year I feel the company (Intuit) broke faith with their users. I have always bought the deluxe level of software and it met all my needs. This year Intuit decided to change the mix, and what was previously offered for deluxe users was no longer available. Why did they do this? Who knows. I feel that whomever came up with this marketing strategy should be shown the door, and the CEO/President of the company should make financial restitution to the many users that have been disappointed by this turn of events. Hopefully Intuit has learned a valuable lesson here and figured out it is not wise to mess with what was considered a very successful product.

title: Excellent But Still Needs Some Attention to Details
content: The overall flow through the required information and the step-by-step questions are excellent and don't take that much time. I'm familiar with another tax product and TurboTax is miles ahead of the other one. Easy to actually file and I got my Federal and State refunds in less than 10 days. But there are a couple of things that could use a little help. First, sometimes the questions to be answered are bold and sometimes they aren't. I much prefer the bold route because it is easy to read quickly and understand what you need to answer. When the questions are in plain text, it can be hard to make sure that you are answering the right thing. Second, the correctness of some of the state questions were in question as was the path taken as a result. In one case, I went through a section twice and still didn't get to where I should have been, so I had to go in and manually correct the state form. I realize that there are a lot of different states and state forms and that keeping up with them is difficult, so I'm not terribly upset about that.

title: Should let you know which form to file according to your AGI at beginning of program -
content: It would be nice if they had a feature that told you upfront, when entering your earnings, how much $$$ you would need in deductions for medical, donations, taxes paid, etc. to qualify for itemized filing. The bulk of my time doing taxes was spent on adding up all our medical bills (over 8k), several thousand in donations and taxes - and I was still better off taking the 'standard deduction'. A huge waste of my time. Other than that, the program walks you through step by step. And if you worked in a city that was listed in the program, it allows you to print that completed form, sign it, stuff it in an envelope and mail it to get your city refund. That is a fantastic feature!! We had purchased a home and sold property in the past three years, so we had a CPA do our taxes. Now that our situation has no complications, will definitely be using TurboTax from now on! All in all a very great product.

title: I worked in the IT profession for 35 years thus am very comfortable in the use of computer applications
content: Turbotax couldn't correctly tally multiple 1099-R (pension income) amounts. Last year I had a problem with Turbotax processing of multiple 1099-R inputs though the nature of the problem was different than this year. I believed I must have done something wrong but after multiple checking and re-entering data, today I know not what I did wrong. If the error was mine, perhaps Turbotax is a tad trickier to use than it should be. I was able to devise a work around so my taxes were submitted correctly. Perhaps Turbotax has a bug. I worked in the IT profession for 35 years thus am very comfortable in the use of computer applications.

title: The EASY way is the BEST way!
content: OK -- I'm not the smartest guy in the world and I don't understand the tax code. TurboTax makes it simple -- answer a few questions -- plug in some data -- and you're done! I went to a tax professional for years and I noticed that all they did was -- ask a few questions -- plug in my answers -- and charge me a few hundred dollars. I thought -- I could do that -- and guess what!?! -- I can -- and I did!! I love TurboTax -- and I won't be going back for anything else! I highly recommend it -- and I was amazed to discover how many people are using it -- and never told me! Now -- I don't have to be the master of the tax code -- I just have to load the software and leave the rest to TurboTax.

title: TurboTax is AMAZING!
content: TurboTax LITERALLY makes doing your taxes EASY! I've used it for 8 years now and TurboTAX does your taxes flawlessly while MAXIMIZING your deductions every single time. Even beginners can do it because the software won't let you mess up. ALL you have to do is answer the questions it asks you honestly. Let's say you go to college and you qualify for multiple tax credits, TurboTax will ALWAYS select the one that gives you the most money back and then explain why it chose it for you. Of course, as you become a tax expert, you can skip past going through EVERY single category and answering tons of questions but for the first few years you use it I have found it's better to go through EVERYTHING. You can easily do your taxes in a matter of hours, e-file them, and use an electronic pin that the IRS will give you online so you can sign them electronically. Give it a try!

title: Program Great (State Free File Come On)
content: Being a non computer person I find Turbo Tax easy for me and I have used it for about 5 years without any problems except getting the free state email filing. For some reason I don't get a free state file. Otherwise, I highly recommend the program for ease, understanding, thoroughness and through e-file gaining a quick refund.

title: Two Stars
content: The changes made from prior years were not user friendly.

title: Have used Turbo Tax for several years and have loved it from the start
content: Have used Turbo Tax for several years and have loved it from the start. This year I got cold feet as a result of the negative publicity about Turbo Tax and purchased the H&R Block program. I completed my return using the H&R block program only to discover that my return was missing certain key segments of the return. After going back thru my return several times trying to discover what I needed to sucessfully complete it I gave up. I decided I would take the risk and purchased a copy of Turbo Tax 2014. Two and one half hours later I had my return completed with all the forms that I required and was submitted electronically. Four hours later the return was accepted buy the IRS and I was done! I deleted the copy of the H&R block program from my computer and shredded the CD.

title: Two Stars
content: We paid more money for the product and go less coverage.

title: One Star
content: Can't download it and customer service does not respond.

title: I can understand why customers were upset by this and think TurboTax should address these issues maybe by communicating these ch
content: There was a lot of attention given to TurboTax this year. I have used their software to do my taxes for approximately ten years now and have consistently had no issues. Albeit I did not have capital gains/loses to declare this year which I understand wasn't included in the deluxe software as it was in the past. I can understand why customers were upset by this and think TurboTax should address these issues maybe by communicating these changes better so people buy the correct software or by offering a less expensive option to "add" certain forms on the first year these changes are made and then expecting the customer to purchase the correct software the next tax year. Overall however for the $45 I paid for the software I don't think there is a less expensive or effective way to do your taxes, I would highly recommend to anyone.

title: which itself is great and easy to use
content: I have been using TurboTax for years without any problems. This year was different. This year TurboTax Deluxe was trying to keep me from filing, or so it seemed. It took me four tries to get through the whole program, which itself is great and easy to use, but the insidious "Program Update' was always circling around in the background threatening to devour my work...which it managed to do three times without asking me or providing for a backup...at night under cover of darkness. I have no idea how many different updates came through since February, but if they were all the same, for God's sake recognize I have already received it. And if they're all different, what's up with that? Like I said, I got through to the end and will probably use TurboTax again next year, but this year it was just ok...and I was refused the refund for my troubles. Yay.

title: They are now charging an additional $30. if you ...
content: They are now charging an additional $30. if you need schedule "D". Time to cut the cord. Meighan get's paid by Intuit. He is there to put out fires. He does not have the consumers interests at all. Time to cut the TT cord. There are other options out there, that are just as user friendly. H&R Block is one, Tax Act another.

title: still the one
content: I know Turbo Tax took a lot of you-know-what this tax season but I've used it for several years, including this year. I still find it the best way for me to take care of the dreaded "filing of taxes." If I have any suggestion it would be to make the cost of filing State taxes much clearer. It's not a deal breaker for me but I think all costs should be known upfront. But the unbeatable part of this particular package is the added 10% Bonus added to your amazon.com credit. A $200 Federal Tax refund in the form of an amazon.com gift card suddenly turns into $220 - how sweet is that!!?? Not too many places you can make that kind of money on a small investment.

title: Frustrations of filing tax returns for my mother
content: I've used Turbo Tax for the past 7 or more years and did so again this year to file my husband's and my tax returns as well as my mother's return.. However, I ended up having to pay a CPA to help me with filing my mother's last tax returns due to having to use both 1040 as well as 1041. In addition, in years pass when I filed my mother's tax return I always filed it via efile but this year it was rejected. So I had to return to the CPA to file what should have been a simple procedure in hopes of bringing to an close my mother's returns. Each year, tax laws change and so does how the Turbo Tax program seems to be used. Frustrating to say the least.

title: Buy the Audit defense and forget about it!
content: Turbo tax makes it much easier but it is not 100% trust worthy in the calculations. Some questions are vague and others are never asked and therefore never answered. I am one of the more simple returns with no deductions and just a few income sources and take the standard deduction each year. I also pay for the audit support and am very glad I did last year when a mistake was pointed out on my state return. I might never know what the mistake was but audit support handled it and got it all straightened out with a couple phone calls and an amended return. Turbo tax is just like a computer, I don't want to know how it works. I just want it to work without the typical brain strain from microsoft and apple.

title: I began with the manual approach to the tax return ...
content: I began with the manual approach to the tax return. TurboTax solved that problem. It took a little longer but this time it was worth it. The only complaint I have is they should have a quick one button access to printing the results on the standard government forms to understand what I did.

title: TurboTax Deluxe Review 2014
content: I love using TurboTax. I have been using it since 2005. I will continue to use it in the future. I think it is the most in depth product for filing your federal & state tax returns. A few things that I really like are: 1) When using it year after year a lot of the information from the prior year is copied to the current so there is not a lot of re-entering. 2) The in depth categories in each section walk you through so you will not miss anything & hopefully maximize your refund. 3) The audit function that reviews all information entered before filing will catch any areas for possible mistakes. Overall I think Turbo Tax is a great way to able to do & file your own taxes.

title: USED TURBOTAX, GOT MY REFUND, ALL WITHIN A WEEK.
content: I have been using turbotax for several years, and I find it very easy to file my taxes. Getting all your information together then getting orignized, the gÃ¨tting the forms, the filling them out, by that time all you want is to have someone take you away. And I'm not going to talk about getting your refund, deposit it etc, etc. with turbotax, just get orignized and before you know it, your refund is in the bank. I did not know how much money you save using turbotax till my sister was told it would be over $200. For her refund. You should put that out there, the money you save to get your money back, it's almost a pleasure doing taxes using TURBOTAX. Also thanks for checking with "ME" about getting back cash, you felt you may owed "me", which you didn't, but thank you anyway. Guess you can tell I like TurboTax. Thanks. No comparison to any other services.

title: One Star
content: it would not boot up and had to do tax return by hand

title: Great If You are only going to do your own tax
content: It's great particularly if you have done your taxes with TurboTax in the past. I love the way it inhales your old data and let you change only what is different from the previous year. The walk-thrus are really helpful in asking questions in a manner that doesn't require you to understand tax speak. Be careful using your copy of TurboTax to do someone elses taxes. All though the program even encourages you to do it you will be charged $39.99 to complete a state tax for that other person plus the $19.99 filing fee. I completed the 2nd Federal tax fine but then you get hit with the $39.99 extra to do the state.

title: Satisfied customer
content: I've been using it for 8 years. My only problem this year was that the IRS would not accept my efile. The phone numbers for fixes to the problem just sent me in a loop and did not solve the problem. I could not find any more advice to help, so I filed by mail. TurboTax periodically reminds me to amend my efile so my tax form will not be late, and I have no way to explain to them that I mailed it in rather than waste any more time and energy on a fix. Still, it is an improvement over any and all professionals I have ever used. Some professional were exorbitantly expensive and others because I had to correct their mistakes for which they charged me a great deal more money to print the forms over again with the one error corrected that I had pointed out to them. I am way more comfortable with TurboTax. Norma Fox

title: ... computer I could not figure out Iam not very good at the computers this weekend my grandson will be ...
content: unfortunately I could not down load this program the massage on the computer I could not figure out Iam not very good at the computers this weekend my grandson will be home from collage and he will help me. I used Turbo tax for many years and never had problem downloding it is a wonderful program. but old grandma has problem with new computer.

title: Another tax year completed with Turbotax.
content: Another year of TurboTax and another tax year completed. I know a lot of users were upset with TurboTax this year and I agree that Intuit should not have done what they did, but I did NOT need those functions and it worked just fine for me. The only thing that upsets me is what it costs to file the state return electronically. It should not cost more than $5 to do so. It is a ripoff in my opinion to charge to much to file electronically which should save the state money from mailing it in. Just my two cents worth.

title: Two Stars
content: I still have problems running turbo tax on windows 8

title: Seems pretty thorough. Had a little glitch in it initially.
content: Seems pretty thorough. Had a little glitch in it initially. When using the wizard to walk you through, it forces you to purchasing the premium, stating you got the incorrect version (even though I inputted that I did not have any bonds/stocks to report). I researched and saw someone else was having a problem on this as well, and also heard on the news later about this issue, but the response from Intuit was not nice to this other customer, for they said it was the users fault. I was able to get around it by getting out of the walk through wizard and then going into edit mode and was able to file both Fed and State with no problem.

title: love the product
content: I always use Turbo Tax since 2008. love the product. My problem this year was too much updating. I would open it day after day waiting for update checks. Sometimes it would cause my laptops to freeze. With each year and more content added, I would urge that any registered TurboTax clients be updated in January about system upgrades they might need for running a stronger program. I had to upgrade memory only after kept trying to run TurboTax and my laptop would freeze up for a couple of hours. On the desktop no problem. I also had 2007 Macbook pros I had to upgrade the operating system just to run TurboTax again once I did, TurboTax ran flawlessly. I will definitely use again next year. Same routine. Feb Target TurboTax, xl ink and large package of paper and ready to go.

title: TurboTax Deluxe review
content: I was apprehensive about using Deluxe this year due to the deleted features even though the packaging noted features identical to those of prior years. Fortunately for me I did not need the deleted features. I find the product easy to use and have done so for many years 10 or more. I am not one to cheat so I am confident that my relatively simple return does not deny me any break to which I am entitled. I should probably do it all by hand but opt for the simplicity TTD affords. It looks professionally done and makes it easier for the Fed/State processors to do their job. I efile the Fed and mail the state regardless of whether or not a refund is due or additional tax owed. I shall continue to use TTD and hope there is no reduction of features in the future as I may need some of those that were deleted in 2014.

title: One Star
content: I think your charges for state filing are a rip-off

title: Four Stars
content: A necessary task made easier through a good product

title: Anyone can do their own return and feelgood about it.
content: Not a wealthy investor with a very diverse portfolio? If so than TurboTax is for you. An easy and very intuitive program that will lead you through all the twists and turns of our oh so "simple" tax system. I have been using TurboTax since it first came out, giving up immediately on my pencil and paper method. Have never regretted. I even tested it against professionally prepared returns by asking friends to let me do their return after professional return was completed. Not once did it come in worse, and on a couple occasion it actually resulted in a better return.

title: I have been very satisfied with Turbo Tax in prior years
content: I have been using Turbo Tax for several years. However, both last year and this year, when I went to pay for expenses associated with my state return with a credit card the program directed me only to the option of buying the extra cost audit services and deducting the cost from my Federal return. Since my return is all standard deduction and very simple, I have no need for the "just in case" audit services. After several futile attempts to locate the place where I could pay only the expenses dealing with my state return with a credit card I gave up and had the $48.00 plus dollars audit protection and associated state return costs deducted from my federal return. I may not use Turbo Tax next year. I have been very satisfied with Turbo Tax in prior years. Five stars in prior years, three stars currently.

title: One Star
content: it sucks, geedy, common cheating, never use again

title: Good software, but bad corporate decisions
content: In the past I would have given it higher, but this year they changed from Deluxe to Deductions & Homeowners in a greedy attempt to make most of us move to a more expensive package. It backfired, of course, and they did give a free upgrade. But I'll be paying close attention next year to what they package. I've used TurboTax for close to 20 years so I was very disappointed by that move. The software itself is relatively easy to use. I would say that, thanks to my investment firm, I'm having to figure out doing an Amended Return and TurboTax is not particularly straightforward or helpful about that.

title: Still the best tax form to work with if you are doing ...
content: Still the best tax form to work with if you are doing your own taxes. But it was a bit different this year and some of the questions I had to read a couple of times to make sure I was totally understanding them. I didn't like having to answer about healthcare even though I kow there was a reason for it. There were questions that weren't on there this year but have been in previous years, plus there were questions on there for the first time. All in all it is fairly easy to go through and get done with your taxes in a couple of hours if you have eveything else prepared and in front of you.

title: Thanks Intuit for listening to Schedule C users
content: Been using TT for years and years. We also use the schedule c and were happy that Intuit listened to the shock and anger over the change to the pricing structure and is providing the update to the Schedule C version for free.

title: TurboTax for 2014 Review
content: Worked OK for me this year! Did not like the fact that the Deluxe version was short changed this year until people started complaining about it! I will be paying attention next year. The Deluxe version also needs a FREE state tax efile. The extra charge for a state efile ($29.99) is a rip-off! Wish the cost could be deducted from my taxes but that will take an IRS ruling. Actually the Feds should provide a FREE electronic filing system but don't hold your breath for our crooked government to actually do something for our benefit. The software also needs to remember exactly where you left off instead of walking you through all of it again. When we save a file, take us back to where we were when we saved it! Is that too much to ask, TurboTax?

title: Not as good as it used to be
content: Previous versions at this price point could handle small business deductions and revenues, but this time they want double the price to do that.
