My wife and I each have tiny side businesses with a few hundred dollars in net profit for the year. I want to report all income properly but will be damned if I'll spend an extra $49 to correctly report $200-300 in net income. I showed it under other income rather than reporting it under small business income. Even though Florida has no state income tax, the stupid software keeps pushing me to buy state tax software as well.

title: I was very pleased with the software and the step by step inductions
content: I was very pleased with the software and the step by step inductions. My only compliant is with the use of the State filing of the software. Once the federal section was completed, and you selected the state for doing the state section a message popped up stating that you have one free subscription for e-filing the state return and would you like to use it now. I selected yes and continued doing the taxes. However, after the state was completed, and the e-file option was subjected. The software would not let you process the return without first paying for it. I first though that this was hardcoded into the software and that Turbo would later wave the charge. I was proven wrong by the charge showing up on my credit card. If I had known this would be the case I would have mailed my return.

title: Old Reliable!
content: After the first year, it's pretty easy to do your taxes! We have been using TurboTax since it was a DOS program called something else, and we wouldn't be without it. It's reliable, quite easy to use, and available early enough in the season to get a head start on planning. I generally use the "go to what I want to enter" mode and I'm glad it's still available. By chance, we avoided the brouhaha about the differences between Premier and Deluxe - I bought what we used the previous year and it worked fine. So I'm not even mad about that.

title: Two Stars
content: I was unable to e-file state tax return for free.

title: Sneaky downgrade
content: 2014 Deluxe worked as well as in the previous 8 years that I used TurboTax. However, I was very disappointed that Intuit reduced the content from previous years. Most people have stocks or mutual funds, so eliminating support for Federal Schedule D reduced the usefulness of Deluxe to barely above Basic.Even though they belatedly offered a "free" upgrade for customers who had used 2013 Deluxe, it was extra work for anyone who had purchased Deluxe believing it had the same capabilities as in previous years. Not a very smart way to treat repeat customers. I plan to check early for 2015 tax preparation. If Intuit repeats their mistake in 2015 I will probably try one of the competing software packages.

title: I love TurboTax. It makes filing taxes a breeze
content: I love TurboTax. It makes filing taxes a breeze. Just one thing troubled me. I was checking to see how things would come out if I filed Head of Household instead of single since my son was living with me. I keyed that in and proceeded to the health insurance section. At that time I decided to just claim Single as in the past. I went back and made the change. But as I moved through the subsequent pages, the program would not recognize this change. After many attempts, I poked around a bit in Tools and saw that forms were saved with Head of Household. I then realized I needed to back out completely from Turbo Tax without saving and start over completely. It would have been nice it the system were able to change the form or at least prompt me somehow to let me know what to do.

title: Two Stars
content: Could not get it to incorporate last year's info

title: Gets better every year.
content: We've been using Turbo Tax for at least 10 years. Each year it gets easier to use. Biggest problem with early editions was the difficulty in going back and correcting something before the program did a review. Now you just go back. Overall a very simple system, easy to use and quick. I would suggest a couple of "options" in the printing section: One option to simply printing the return itself without pages of support documentation. (For your files) Another option for those that like to file paper returns, is a selection to print a return for mailing. This option should also print an address label to the regional IRS Office. We like the auto fill feature when using for the next tax year.

title: What was I waiting for?
content: Incredibly awesome to join the masses who are independent and can do this on their own. Software is so easy to use, and walks you through every step. I was reluctant for years, wanted to feel safe with my accountant. Now, just as safe and spend a lot less. Use this without a doubt!

title: The Easiest and Least Expensive way to file your taxes!
content: I have never in my life filed my taxes because my husband did that or we took them to a professional tax preparer and spent quite a bundle in the process! Since my husband passed away, I had to file the taxes this time around. I ordered Intuit TurboTax and was almost scared to open the box! But, open it I did and I was pleasantly surprised how easy it was to do this! I was walked through step-by-step and was able to do the Federal Tax Return and my State Tax Return at the same time. Piece of Cake!!! I most definitely recommend this product. And take it from me...you don't have to know much about taxes to do it.

title: One Star
content: Costs too much and probably won't use it again.

title: you will be my partner every year for as long as the I suck air and the Gov't gets my taxes
content: Turbo, you will be my partner every year for as long as the I suck air and the Gov't gets my taxes. Moved from a state with no income tax to one that did. Went to a tax "professional" and they said my income was "non taxable". Told themI did not think they had it right. The owner of the business even gave me a letter saying if they were wrong they would pay any penalties and such. Eventually, I got it worked out $4000 sent to the IRS with a explanation, incredibly, they waived penalties and interest. My oldest son suggested Turbo Tax. You are worth every penny tho it would be nice to get a break as a repeat customer. Regardless, thank you Turbo Tax. Thank you. Steve t

title: Couldn't Live Without It!
content: Got off to a rocky start in 2014 as version features changed, apparently without notice. However, that all got straightened out at no expense to me. I have used TT for a long time and have used complex features without difficulty. I am a plain, ordinary person with no background in accounting. My only past experience has been grinding through those IRS and State paper forms and instruction documents, something I am very happy to have left behind me. I always have confidence in the accuracy and completeness in the returns I submit.

title: DON'T RAISE THE PRICE OR REQUIRE AN UPGRADE FROM DELUXE OR I'M GONE.
content: Turbo Tax used to get a 5 star rating from me. This year, without any clear warning, when I started my taxes I was told I needed an upgrade from the Deluxe to do my Schedule Cs. I was definitely put out. If Turbo Tax had not eventually provided the upgrade free of charge, I would definitely use a different product next year. I'm also going to check the Turbo Tax box very closely next year and if the Deluxe doesn't meet my needs as it has for the last 7 years, I'll give serious consideration to a competitor's product. The price seems to go up every year and, quite frankly, I'm tired of it. I gave 4 stars because once the free upgrade was loaded, I was happy with my returns.

title: I'm glad I did
content: I would have given a 5 since it made doing taxes a lot easier & quicker than when I used H&R. The first time I tried to transfer my info from last year from H&R to Turbo, it failed. After doing a search online, I discovered it was a known problem & that I would have to put in the info by hand. I wouldn't have bought the program if I knew it had a known problem. That being said, I'm glad I did. It's the first time I did not have to figure out the crazy calculations that Missouri uses. Turbotax handled it for me, which H&R Block did not do in previous years. And Turbotax had a better flow. Worth the extra money to me.

title: Poor notification service
content: The tax program works well and its very easy to use. Online support after filing, however, is not consistent. Notification of my filing was the only communication I received. In past years, notifications included (1) when the return was accepted by the feds / state; (2) when the return was processed. I had to check my bank account periodically to see if the refund had been posted. Nothing from Turbotax. Then, the Colorado fiasco! I understand that mistakes are made, but Turbo-tax has not communicated about this except in the news. No messaging. No notices. I've been a member for about 10 years, and I'm not happy. Still no CO refund as of this posting 3/6/2015

title: Ok, but not as good as previous versions.
content: This year's version wasn't as friendly as the past few years. Specifically, the information interface between the Fed's and the State's returns wasn't at all clear in what was required. This may have something to do with my State's nuances in terms of inputs...i.e., information that isn't directly carried over from the Federal return to the State return. BUT, if Intuit is going to continue to put out tax prep software, the programming should be completely flawless and State "nuances" should be fully explained to the user. Otherwise, all is well.

title: Intuit and Turbotax Deluxe: the controversy
content: After the 2014 turbotax deluxe debacle I almost didn't buy TurboTax this year. I have a small amount of 1099 income and the loss of this functionality in the "new" deluxe edition and the need to purchase the "preminum edition turned me off as a profit grab by Intuit. Since the backlash they re-incorporated the features lost to the deluxe edition for this year. Hopefully they learned their lesson that people do not like to lose functionality in a product or to be forced to pay more for a product to regain that functionality. We will see if next year TurboTax and Intuit restore deluxe to its former self.

title: Two Stars
content: You really messed up a good product this year!

title: Two Stars
content: Had difficulty, more confusing than years past

title: No problems. Have used Turbo Tax for the past ...
content: No problems. Have used Turbo Tax for the past 6 years. Paid a additional fee for E-File on state and fed gov. Received refunds within 2 weeks by E. transfer. Will you it again next year. Thank you Turbo Tax for making it easy

title: It is like having a tutor
content: I have done my own taxes since I had my first job and wasn't a dependent (a lot of years ago). Turbo Tax has cut days off my effort and is as accurate or more so than any returns I have ever done. The first year I used Turbo Tax, I also figured my taxes without Turbo Tax. I will never do that again. It walks you through every line and knows when to bring in more questions and fill out worksheets. It does all the math. It checks all the entries and looks for all the ways to save you money. It is like have a tutor or tax accountant helping you, but you don't have to pay extra for the help.

title: Despite negative reviews - this was easy again this year!
content: Although we used this product the last two years, I was nervous because of the negative reviews. However, I found doing my taxes was just as easy as it's been previous years. We are homeowners, have children and daycare expenses, and itemize expenses. Better yet, we got our refund in a week! Very happy.

title: Two Stars
content: TurboTax is becomming less useful every year.

title: ...So easy even "I" could do it1
content: Great program! I hate doing taxes almost as much as paying someone to do them for me, but I thought I would give Turbo Tax a try since it costs about a fifth of what I usually pay the Tax Guy. I was surprised at how easy it was to use the software and how thorough it was. There was a place to enter every form that I had, and I didn't have to scan anything. The "Likeliness of getting audited" indicator at the end of the program gave me confidence that I did it right. I compared my refund to last years and it was right in line with it - I got back a little more than last year, but not so much that it threw up a flag. I will definately use TurboTax again and I recommend it for anyone. ........... Maddmonk

title: Question about TurboTax Deluxe vs TurboTax premier--also failure to ask for the PIN (6 digit) number that had to be on a return.
content: I have been using TurboTax Deluxe for years. This year I used it and tried to transfer my stock/dividend information into it form by broker, and it made me upgrade to TurboTax premier. There was no additional cost--but is this a tone time thing, or in future years am I going to be forced to buy the more expensive TurboTax premier, because I want to transfer everything from my broker, rather than entering everything on my own? Second item--I did my daughter's taxes using TurboTax deluxe--because of what the IRS thought was a security problem last year, they issued her a 6 digit pin code to enter on the return. No where during the interview process did TurboTax ask if she had this item to enter. I had to go to the forms and enter it there myself.

title: CTEC a122457
content: Turbo tax is fast and thorough and gets a quick acceptance for the federal e-file. the format is clear and precise and the only thing convoluted about the program is the tax laws that underlie it. Key in your data, finalize it, program check and correct and then beam it to the IRS. 1-2-3. the only two things negative about the program that gives it four stars is that intuit raises the price of this offering every year, and the application will not let you save the file in PDF to be burned on cd-rom anymore. Still the only game in town.

title: I love Turbo Tax.
content: I have used Turbo Tax for over 15 years. Every year I find it updated with new tax law changes. It is easy to use and very thorough. If you are troubled by the time required to go through all the questions etc., particularly if it is your first use, remember it is significantly less expensive than paying some one else to ask the same questions. My 2 experiences with some one else asking the questions resulted in rejected returns and doing it again. I trust Turbo Tax and recommend it to anyone doing personal tax returns.

title: Not worth my money
content: I have used Turbo Tax for years but this year I wouldn't have bought it if I had known it wouldn't lend itself to the tax work I needed to do. I always used it for my business but this year it lacked the direction I always depended on. Much of the form I had do complete manually. I also do a local city tax and I had to manually complete the form because unlike last year TurboTax didn't plug in the numbers right. I am not sure but think I will use other software next year unless TurboTax makes some changes to its software.

title: Disappointed with this year's Turbo Tax
content: Turbo Tax is great. I've used it for many years. This year wasn't as good an experience. I was part way through and they wanted me to ante up an extra $39 for added software to report capital gains. I figured it wasn't worth it so I didn't report my capital gains this year. Didn't think it would make that much difference. I was interupted several times so I tried to continue where I'd left off. As a result, TT downloaded my bank interest twice, and I didn't notice it until after I e filed. Big mistake. I'll have to do the whole thing over and file an amended return. Will I use TT next year? Maybe not.

title: Good software - Check the items covered!!
content: Overall the software is very straightforward and idiot-proof. However, I'm disappointed as I realized after I bought my software that the tax return I was completing for a friend involved investments, so I had to pay an additional $30 in order to process his investments (not a whole lot. Very minor sales in 2014). However, I would recommend this to a friend. They just need to be VERY careful about which kind of software they purchase so they don't get screwed over in dishing out more money than if they bought the proper software the first time.

title: I like it very much - and have filed my taxes
content: I like it very much - and have filed my taxes. There is one thing I think should be improved - if it can be done. We should be able to go back and check different sections or items whenever we wish, without having to go though the whole section over again. Another important item - getting our copy printed. I t was not made clear to me or made easy for me to print my copies when I was finished and I wanted to do that. Maybe I missed it somehow, but it kept telling me we'd get to that. I think that should be easier. After all, by then all the hard work is done. Thank you.

title: Two Stars
content: had nothing but problems. did not do state.

title: used tp be better
content: couldnt download state after flling federal

title: Great TurboTax to for simple tax returns
content: I have been a user of TurboTax for 10 years and this was the easiest version to use yet. You have the option to walk through everything if you are a new user or you can skip right to the sections of your return that you know are pertinent to you. Very easy. It checked for every possible federal and state deduction to maximize my refund. Free federal e-file is very convenient. The software updates very easily and quickly so that you always have the latest program updates and tax forms I have nothing negative to say about it. I highly recommend it!

title: Deluxe 2014 Tax Program
content: The State of Ohio return portion of the Deluxe 2014 program is not user friendly and does not produce City tax returns that are accurate or user friendly to the user. Program questions and terminology is not clear and nothing is available in the program to clearly explain what is wanted. I have been a TurboTax user since 1983 and have come to expect more from the program. As with most instruction for the assembly of items purchase that come in pieces, the writer/developer understands their use of "in-house" terms used in assembly instructions. The end user is not clear as to what the instructions are trying to portray. The Federal and State returns are easy and very accurate.

title: TurboTax 2014 Disappointing
content: I have used TurboTax for years, but this is the first year in which I wasn't completely satisfied. First, you had to upgrade to get a lot of the same features. After a groundswell of negative reaction, they are now offering a $25 rebate. Too little too late. Then there was a problem with filing of OH state tax. I tried to call their toll free number but couldn't get through. Perhaps Intuit will put all these issues behind them for the 2015 taxes. If not, I'm looking for alternatives.

title: I usually have liked Turbo Tax but I was not happy that I ...
content: I usually have liked Turbo Tax but I was not happy that I spent the extra money to also do my State Taxes. I tried to send in my taxes and the state kept rejecting it. I found out after calling the State of Wisconsin that one of the answers was incorrect and that I ended up doing my return myself on the State's free filing website. They told me that Turbo Tax does not always update the State Taxes and that they do not have the current upgrades and that is why my form was incorrect. I will not spend the extra money and will only get the Federal Turbo Tax.

title: TurboTax Dropped the Ball
content: TurboTax changed the software so that Registered Domestic Partners had to mail in the California Return. You could not e-file because the software required you to send a federal return first. Yet, the federal return associated with the CA return was a "Mock Return", not to be filed. Last year, there was no problem e-filing the CA return for RDP couples. Combined with the fiasco about changing the software requiring some filers to have to pay more for TurboTax, they really dropped the ball this year. I may just have to go to another software next year.

title: Happy Seniors with Turbo Tax
content: Convenient, easy to use and understand. The best for us as seniors was the that we could walk away and come back to the process over a period of days and pick up right where we left off. That relieved us of the previous hassle of driving to some office with all our paper work, sitting there and having to come back if some receipt wasn't there. We had a problem...as some seniors are prone to do with a keyboard i hit the wrong key when it came time to choose the method of payment. Problem quickly solved, one call through the customer service number and a very nice and polite young lady named courtnie. We will continue to use Turbo Tax and recommend it to our family and friends.

title: State Electronic File Should be included in cost up front
content: I gave it only 3 of 5 stars because you still have to pay the $19.99 to file electronically for the state. In my case, I paid the $19.99 and tried to file electronically but it failed and I ended up having to file via snail mail. It was a complete waste to pay the additional fees to electronically file my taxes for the state. This should be part of the cost up front so you know how much your paying, not after you have already processed your return.

title: PA Section of TurboTax Out of Date.
content: As usual, TurboTax was easy to use for the federal return--except when I downloaded the 1099-DIV forms, it did not download them all so I had to type in two of them. The Pennsylvania tax section was badly out of date. My husband passed away mid-2014, and I was able to file a joint return for my Federal return. However, TurboTax said I would have to file two separate returns for the PA tax return, and suggested an absurd solution: create two "mock" fed returns and then do the state return using them. Not likely. I contacted the state and found out that I could file a joint return and even gave me--online--the correct section.

title: A very worthwhile product
content: I was very pleased with the product. It was quite easy if you have all your materials ready. I had not used a software program for taxes before and I was impressed with how well it addressed many issues. I'd recommend it. I used it for my federal return and then purchased the state version I needed when the federal portion was completed. The state was very easy. The software found my W2 and I didn't have to enter it. It was pretty clever with some of the things it did.

title: Very disappointed in TT
content: Been using TT for years but this year I had problems. TT would not let me efile my fed return. Called support and was on the phone for over an hour. Finally figured out the problem was with Internet Explorer. I tried it with Chrome and it worked OK. This after filing 2 other fed returns successfully using IE. Then when it came time to use state TT it was in a loop and I couldn't use it to fill out my state. This after having paid $42 extra to get the state version of TT. The final result was I should try to use it on-line because they could not get it to work. Was on the phone for over 2 hours. At least they refunded the $42 for the state version. Very disappointed in TT.

title: Figure out if you qualify to itemize before buying
content: I'm not so sure its the best deal out there....there are a lot of sites that will allow you to file your federal taxes for free and if you are using the standard deduction its a no brainer. plus they wanted 19.99 to file the state income tax. Interesting enough my state (PA.) allows you to e-file your state income tax for free and local is just a percentage and a form. So I guess what I am saying is that if you don't have enough deductions to beat the standard deduction its a waste of 49.99

title: This is a good p[product as long as you don't need to contact ...
content: The program itself works well, it is the same turbo tax I have always used. It seems however that they are having an issue with either Google chrome browsers or windows 8.1. Not sure which as I was never able to get a hold of there customer service for support. I spent all day waiting and they never called back since they don't seem to take calls just telling you that they will contact you back. I finally loaded it on my old computer that ran Firefox and windows 7 and had no issues. This is a good p[product as long as you don't need to contact Turbo Tax support.

title: No 5 stars for this reason: Unlike previous versions ...
content: No 5 stars for this reason: Unlike previous versions this edition does not allow you to go forward on pages with out filling in each section. I started a session and 3 days later had other items that I needed to fill in on a section that was ahead some pages, it would not allow me to go and fill in the forms there with out completing the previous section. In years previous I could jump around and fill in the sections as I saw fit. Other than this minor hitch (for me) It was just finr.

title: Two Stars
content: It did not include everything it stated.

title: TURBO TAX HAS MY VOTE!
content: Have used Turbo Tax for over 15 years and always thought it was great! This year when I found out they were not covering all the forms I needed (just 2 more) on the Deluxe version but now had to purchase the next higher version in order to get the forms - I decided NOT to buy it! But Turbo Tax sent out a notice they would still cover them without having to purchase the upgrade! I was really happy and returned the H&R Block version (that I had not opened yet) to the store and immediately ordered Turbo Tax from Amazon. Filed my taxes w/TurboTax and hopefully I can continue to use them in the future!

title: Turbotax asks you all the right step by step questions ...
content: Turbotax asks you all the right step by step questions to get your taxes filed correctly. It tells you if you need certain records and where to look for the information. It is a little confusing at the end when it makes you go back and do corrections on the tax forms before E-filing. If you make corrections to the tax forms that reduce your amount of return, it does not give an adjusted dollar amount before it E-files. Otherwise, it is very thorough on items to file. I used it for mine and my husband's taxes this year. It saves you hundreds of dollars doing it yourself.

title: I bought the Deluxe Turbo Tax. I found that ...
content: I bought the Deluxe Turbo Tax. I found that I needed a 1099B form for Broker Exchange, but it was not available on this edition. My edition told me I would be able to upgrade at no expense. I tried doing this by phone and through the steps on my edition. Neither worked. On the phone I was told I could get a quicker response through the internet. That was not true. Why would the Deluxe edition not accept a 1099B when it does accept my stocks accounts. These accounts naturally would have broker exchanges over the years as part of balancing my risk. Please help me to get this upgrade so I can complete my taxes. meyermaster@aol.com

title: Seems like you could have been more truthful to your customers ...
content: The most outstanding thing was having to pay to transmit my state taxes. Turbo tax has never before charged me to transmit my state taxes. I am not sure I would have bought it if I had known. I paid enough for the software to start out. And I saw nothing in your packaging that stated that I would be required to pay more expense to file my state tax. That was a hidden fee I had not anticipated. Seems like you could have been more truthful to your customers to let them know of this unprecedented cost. I will think long and hard before I buy again. And I am a many years customer

title: You ought to have a way to call someone to ask questions when somethingm like this happens.
content: The Turbo Tax that I bought and used this year would not allow me to file my Federal tax electronicly. There was no explanation of why it would not file. My son figured that I needed a newer version of explorer for my browser. When I downloaded a newer version I was able to file. Your Turbo Tax did not say you had to have a certain browser for it to work. You ought to have a way to call someone to ask questions when something like this happens. I looked everywhere for a phone number and there was none. I think I might try a different tax than Turbo Tax next year. I believe there was a number to call a couple of years ago.

title: For many years I have used TurboTax Basic with good results and satisfaction
content: For many years I have used TurboTax Basic with good results and satisfaction. This year product labeling led me to believe I required the Deluxe edition, despite no change in my tax situation. I bought and used the Deluxe edition and during the course of entering data was informed I needed another upgrade - for some $40 - for investment forms. After several attempts, I was able to proceed without purchasing additional products and completed and filed my taxes as usual. In short, the product worked fine as usual, but I felt taken advantage of by the initial labeling and subsequent efforts to again charge me for services I did not need.

title: In the Nebraska state tax, they referred to a ...
content: In the Nebraska state tax, they referred to a Nebraska form, but the form was not supplied by TurboTax, and I had to search for it and determine if it was relevant to the return I was preparing. Also, it would be helpful to have an "EXPRESS" finish preparing where after all the income items are covered one can then just finish by only taking the standard deduction instead of having to go through everything in the deductions section just to end up being told that the standard deduction is the way to go.

title: I have used TurboTax for years and it still is the best around but some of the changes this year was ...
content: It seemed a little more complicated than what I remember from last year's version. Also, all of the years in the past the State Tax Return was already included in the total or a part of the total pkg. I didn't have to pay an extra 19.95 to file the state return in the pas after I had already paid for the Deluxe version.. I have used TurboTax for years and it still is the best around but some of the changes this year was not as much of a bargain as in the past. I will stick with it until I can no longer understand it or get through the process of filing a return through TurboTax.

title: It has always made doing my taxes easy. However
content: I have used Turbo Tax for over 20 years. It has always made doing my taxes easy. However, this year the Deluxe Version cost the same but left out several tax forms that were available in 2013. I almost switched to H & R block because it was a lot cheaper and had those tax forms and it could also download my last year's Turbo Tax information. I received an email from Turbo Tax that apologized that the Deluxe Version had been changed and promised to change it back in 2015. I will wait and see what happens. If the price jumps or if the forms are not available and I have to purchase the Premier Version, then I will probably switch to H&R Block software.

title: Helped me get it done!!!
content: I've never done my own taxes before and found this was pretty easy to use. The part I didn't like, particularly with the state portion, was that some questions were way too complicated for me to understand. It seemed that if there were 10 questions, 9 of them were easy to understand, and 1 was impossible to understand. Overall though, it helped me get the job done and I'll use it again next year.

title: Old version was better
content: Although TT made things right by not charging for it this year, I did not like the surprise of having to "upgrade" to a business version in order to get Schedule C and other forms that were in the regular deluxe version before this year. Looks like going forward, will have to cough up the extra bucks. And the only reason I had to do this was because I get about $50 a year from a nearby natural gas fracking well as royalty $$. What a pain. And the net net is about $0.00 after taxes and paying for the extra TT version!!

title: I have never felt like I could get more for my money elsewhere and ...
content: Have been using this product for many, many years for... Itemized deductions, small second home, charitable donations, and home office. I have never felt like I could get more for my money elsewhere and have had better results than when I tried a CPA. Easy and intuitive. Will be using again next year. Thank you.

title: but due to the crap they suddenly decided to pull this year
content: I would have given it 5 stars, but due to the crap they suddenly decided to pull this year, I was forced to buy the deluxe version. In the past, I was always able to use the basic version. They got me for more money this year, maybe next year I go with HR Block's software and see how I make out with that. And yes, they offered to give back $25. for that, but of course I didn't qualify due to the fact that they had no record of my previous purchases. Thanks a lot guys!!

title: I find that editing entries and printing less than a ...
content: I find that editing entries and printing less than a full return to be quite frustrating. I made a mistake on my state return after I had initially finished it. When I changed the entry by clicking on the edit bar, the entry changed there but not on the finished tax form. Then, when I attempted to print just one form from the state return,the desired form was highlighted in blue but when I clicked on print review, I got a box telling me to select a form. I tried several times, with the same frustrating result. I finally changed the entry by hand on the return filed. Next year I intend to investigate other software tax vendors.

title: Still A Great Software
content: I've used TurboTax for years for the federal and state return. I used the Deluxe version for federal and e-file of state. I had no sales of stock of other out of the ordinary transactions, so I was not caught up with paying extra for additional forms. However, I noticed when I bought the software, all of the packaging was the same, and I had to look hard to determine that I had the right version. My neighbor was not so cautious and he ended up purchasing the wrong version.

title: Is it worth it
content: Every year I would go to HandR Block and pay over 200.00 to file my taxes. I would go prepared with all numbers for my business and personal deductions. I sat there the last year that I used HandR Block watching me giving him all of the information that I worked so hard to gather and the agent asking how much, putting it in the computer and letting the program tell me how much. I decided that I could type information into a computer just as easy as he did and that I could save myself over 200.00 a year for charges. I have been using Turbo Tax for over 12 years and I don't regret switching.

title: Staying with TurboTax
content: This product did what I needed. I am as frustrated with everyone else's comments on the product changing and followed the backlash closely. I however did not need to file a schedule C and/or E. I contacted HR Block and they provided a copy of their software, I prepared the taxes with both and was more pleased with the flow of TurboTax and filed using this software. In future years I will stay with TurboTax as I like the software more than competitors.

title: Too much, too little - some of both.
content: An over the top program that tries to do everything for anybody; that is, unless you want to do a simple capital gain on a stock. This simple feature present in the past is gone, meanwhile all sorts of other 'not common' options are dealt with. New this year, you have to enter all medical, even HSA paid items, and then the magnificent program deducts the HSA re-Imbursement. Why? It's method of dealing with HSA deposits keeps getting more convoluted; if I already checked no, why does it still run me through all the question instead of letting me move on to my spouse's yes? No is no.

title: Junk, I won't use Turbo Tax ever again.
content: Junk,I won't use Turbo Tax ever again.

title: Turbo tax has become like so many other entities today -product appears the same ...
content: Bought deluxe as it is the product I have been buying for the last several years - I didn't read the package prior to purchasing-my error! The deluxe no longer allows you to process 1099B transactions - to do this you must upgrade to the next level-another $25 bucks! Turbo tax has become like so many other entities today -product appears the same as the past - name is the same - price is the same but the product is lacking substance - some what like the cereal and cracker producers are doing - you think you are getting the same - but product in the box is much less than in the past. I felt deceived

title: I have been satisfied for the most part
content: I have used Turbo Tax for several years. I have been satisfied for the most part. I was not happy this year when at the end and I was ready to pay for my state taxes to be e-filed I also paid for the extra protection in case I would get audited. I did not want that service but was not allowed to not take some how. I just paid for it even though I didn't need it. My returns are very simple and needing any extra protection. I am pretty sure it was something I did by mistake but couldn't find a way to change it. Next year I will be more careful and read the end instructions better so to not get the protection that is not needed.

title: Frustrating Problem
content: I've used TurboTax several times before without any issues, but I had a frustrating problem this time. I wasn't able to submit my state tax return online. I didn't find anything applicable in the user community, and I waited on the phone for 45 minutes with no one picking up. I finally ended up mailing my state return, and I'm hoping that it doesn't go astray to a thief who steals my refund. I'm very frustrated. I may give TurboTax one more opportunity to keep my business, but if I have any issues with my 2015 returns, I'll be done with them.

title: TurboTax Deluxe==I got my refund!
content: For the most part it worked well, importing most information was done efficiently. I did have problems adding my state estimated taxes which I had paid. The program did not ask about that and I had to find the line item on my own (on the form at the bottom of the page. The program is expensive. It may not have changed since last year, but I didn't think I had to pay for filing my Federal taxes previously. I would say that $20.00 less might have "felt" better. When I finished I didn't feel confident with the amount of the refund for my Federal filing. I did get a refund, however, and felt good about that

title: I had a gift card from Costco and TurboTax was marked down and I decided just to try it and if I didn't like it I could still go
content: I was a little hesitant to do my own taxes after having them done by a CPA for several years. I had a gift card from Costco and TurboTax was marked down and I decided just to try it and if I didn't like it I could still go back and have my CPA do them again. I was blown away at how it took me through every step of the way and how easy it was to follow along. I got it done in under an hour and got a great refund. Also, my refund was in my bank account within 2 weeks.

title: It was not as easy to use as in the past and had more ...
content: It was not as easy to use as in the past and had more glitches. I started using Turbo Tax 9 years ago when my husband became ill and the tax filing duty fell upon me for the first time in many years. I quickly became a great fan of this program, but I felt disappointed with this year's version. Not as easy to use and more difficult to install correctly. Hopefully they will get their act together and next year they will go back to what they were previously doing, which was much better than this year's formatting. I will try again next year, and hopefully all will go well again.

title: Satisfied with TurboTax Download
content: This is the first time I downloaded TurboTax from the Amazon website. Initially I was concerned that something might go wrong and not havng the disk would cause a problem. After working with it several times, I was unable to open it. I saw a download icon on my desktop where I was able to download the software again and was back in business. I will do this again next year.

title: I love turbo tax and recommend it to everyone
content: I have been using Turbo Tax deluxe for many years. It is very simple to use. I use the guided feature and if you can read and answer questions you can use it. Several years ago I ended up owing because of an error made in my pension deductions by the retirement board. My taxes were complicated because I retired in June, started social security in August and began my pension in September. I thought I had made an error so I took it to H&R block for a second look. I took three year's worth of turbo tax prepared taxes. They told me that they had been done perfectly. I love turbo tax and recommend it to everyone.

title: File with confidence using Turbo Tax Deluxe
content: This program takes your personal information and combines it with all the information on the forms you receive and voila ... the nightmare known as filing taxes can be completed in a day. For years I did my own taxes and mulled over them for weeks to make sure I found every deduction. We've been using Turbo Tax Deluxe for 6 years now and I feel confidant that when I complete them, they are correct and safe to electronically file.

title: so easy to use
content: I have used Turbo Tax for 3 years now and it could not be simpler. Even the first time when you have to enter all your information, it walks you through it. If they can import your information like for your W2's, they will so you don't have to enter it. If you donate a lot, like for example I donate a lot of clothes, they make it easy for you to estimate that. Seriously, this could not be any easier to use and I know I will use it every year.

title: Still gets the job done
content: I've been using Turbo Tax for several years and have always been very satisfied with its performance. For some reason the 2014 version didn't seem to work as smoothly as in prior years and left me feeling less confident about the accuracy of my tax return. In fairness, this could have been caused by a few changes to my tax situation. Also, the $24.95 additional charge to e-file my Oregon return seems a little steep. I elected to print it and mailed it in.

title: Save Money With Turbo Tax
content: I have used Turbo Tax for 6 years and never had a problem. I filed and received my refund within 2 weeks which is unheard of. My spouse had little confidence in my filing ability with Turbo Tax, so 2 years ago, when I finished but prior to filing, I took our tax information to the brick and mortar competitor and they confirmed my results to the penny. Spouse is no longer a doubter. Turbo is the best way to go and so easy to do.

title: One Star
content: Sux------------Never again !

title: Other than that - all good.
content: Only issue I've found is that the State information has not been accurate for the past 2 years. I use Turbo Tax to enter everything and figure out refund or amount owed, but then go onto my State's website and re-enter because the filing is free. Last year TT said I owed a penalty but State website didn't (whew) and this year TT said I'm required to pay estimated taxes but not per my State (again - good). Other than that - all good.

title: E-file 24.99
content: I have been a turbo tax user for years. Today I found that although I got turbo federal and state when I downloaded Deluxe.I found I have to pay an additional 24.99 to e-file; I am furious and will end my intuit days. forever. all you wannt to do is be greedy like all of your ilk. I don't need you people. Dorothy B Lamberth

title: Changes without notifcation!
content: I have been using Turbo Tax for well over a decade now. This year they made changes that were not mentioned before purchasing. They removed form that were available on last years version. There is also a new $35 "processing" charge for e-filling. I understood the $20 for e-filling state, but I do not understand this new charge and there is no explanation for it. I do not know if I will use this in the future!

title: Great Product
content: Great product. Fairly simple to use. Line up your forms and papers and just follow the program step by step. There is one are that needs some emphasis; that is where you list the spouse earnings that needs to show a little more separation. Two years ago I forgot to add my spouses income. Almost overlooked it again this year. Other than that, I have been using Turbo Tax for years and recommend it all the time.

title: I liked it as usual until the end
content: I liked it as usual until the end. To print off a copy of the returns: It wanted to change things to a PDF Wizard file. You had to agree to the change to accomplish the task. This change has since messed with my entire computer setup I am upset with how it worked out. Changes were made that now I have to research on how to reset things prior to having had it to launched. I find it awful that to finish what was needed this different programming was basically forced upon me.

title: One Star
content: If it was free it would be to much!

title: Time for flat tax
content: finding proper forms to complicated

title: I can do my own taxes!
content: I never thought filing taxes could be this easy. I had been taking my taxes to a CPA for years; I was a co-owner of a small business so this was necessary. However, after the business folded I kept up the practice and was getting charged an arm and a leg. My boyfriend's father suggested turbotax as he had been using it for years without any problems. I was hesitant as my mathematical skills are sadly lacking, but as long as I went through all the steps I found I had nothing to worry about. I've used it the last two years and plan to continue to do so.

title: Turbo tax worked fine until I got to the end when it came ...
content: Turbo tax worked fine until I got to the end when it came time to E file. The Fed portion filed OK However the State portion caused me to go through a whole bunch of #&*%@. I bought my Turbo tax at Costco here in California. When I finally got to TT after at least a 15 minute wait The person had some difficulty ex planing to me what I should do. FINALLY! I got the instructions for E filing my state, AFTER having to pay another $19.95 to get a code number. This was my first year with TT and things should have been explained more fully.

title: I'll use again
content: I was not one of the people affected by the "Great Turbo Tax Switcheroo of 2015" so I'm coming at this from a bit of a different angle - no rental incomes, complicated stocks/bonds, etc - just a married homeowner with no dependents. So that said, I have used this version of Turbo Tax in the past, I used them this year and I'm happy to report I'll use them in the future. They still provide the best value and service for my needs. I had no issues, the software worked seamlessly and everything was successfully filed. I was very happy with the experience.

title: FederalReturnGood StateReturnFrustrating
content: The Deluxe provided the forms to file a State return (Kansas), however two things were confusing: Kansas assesses an additional $19.99 to efile which the taxpayer isn't privy to until getting through the entire state filing. When I tried to back out and file my State via paper return, I couldn't tell if I had really filed my state because evidently, Kansas doesn't accept a state return until the Federal return is approved. I had to keep going through it several times to get back to the place where I could file State via a paper return.

title: It's Deductible Glitch
content: We've used TurboTax for years and find it to be about the most user-friendly tax program on the market. However, this year we did find one annoying "glitch". TurboTax wouldn't link with our "It's Deductible" charitable contributions. As it turned out, we didn't qualify for Itemized Deductions. If we had, we would have had to reenter all our charitable contributions by hand. Bummer!

title: Try it! You'll like it.
content: Awesome product. Very easy to use. The only thing I had difficulty with had to do with mortgage refinance points as I had no idea whether or not my previous tax preparer had amortized this. I had to go look through the prior year's return to locate the info and figure it out (wish the program had stated what and where I should look). Overall it was real clear as to whether or not something was deductible and what information had to be entered and usually explained where you could locate that information. Anyone with a little bit of logic and common sense can use.

title: I did not like the fact that you could not utilize Turbo Tax ...
content: I did not like the fact that you could not utilize Turbo Tax Deluxe to figure investments this year...there was no mention of this on any of the advertising or labels on the packaging. It was nice of Turbo Tax to allow us to upgrade to the "Premier" edition for free this year. Still a lot like "bait and switch"...I have been using Turbo Tax since it first became available and the Premier edition was never required for investments. Still a great product, just not happy how they introduced a new product requirement for investments....

title: Best home tax software
content: I've been using Turbo Tax, albeit in different versions, since the mid 90's. One year we caved and tried another brand of Tax software. It messed us up so badly, we bought that year's Turbo Tax to redo our taxes and fix all the errors. Sure, there have been user and software issues from time to time, but Turbo Tax always sends out patches and updates. I'll be buying it and using it again next year, too. :)

title: Easy to use...
content: Turbo Tax always works well on my operating system. Sometimes I have a problem with the downloads for State, but can usually get it resolved. It's very, very easy to use, even if you don't really know what you're doing. Turbo Tax files from the previous year can be imported easily. Transmission and print outs are very easy to do as well. Overall, very easy to use - kinda of like Taxes for Dummies!

title: I love preparing my own taxes and I have been using ...
content: I love preparing my own taxes and I have been using TurboTax for going on 20 years. It's inexpensive and I have never had any problems with the preparation or submission of my taxes and others who I've done taxes for. Beats the pants off of paying H and R Block $300, that's for sure! I will continue to use this program for years to come. I just hope they don't try to up their prices. I've had to contact customer service a couple times with a few questions about the limit on federal filings and customer service has always been top notch.

title: Great for me
content: I have been using TurboTax for the last 7 years and think it's a winner. I have a very simple tax return to complete so it's a no brainer for me. There was a lot of controversy about this version this year about Turbo Tax leaving out a lot of forms that were included in past years. The company offered a rebate check to the buyers of this in case they had to upgrade to the next level to get those forms.

title: I have always been happy with TurboTax as it really saves me a lot ...
content: Just finished my taxes. I have been using Turbo Tax Deluxe for years but this year after purchasing the Deluxe, I found that I would need the Premier to finish my taxes. After contacting TurboTax, they were so kind and told me that when I got to the point in completing my taxes and needed the premier to finish, they upgraded what I had installed at no cost. I have always been happy with TurboTax as it really saves me a lot of time of duplicating the filling out of pages. It does all the adding and subtracting and so much work. A satisfied customer.

title: There were no directions when buying this product that told ...
content: There were no directions when buying this product that told me that I needed to download Amazon's Game and Software Downloader Setup. I spent an hour trying to figure out why I couldn't download this product on my computer. Some user friendly directions would be beneficial for those of us who don't game or buy software from Amazon this was all new to me. Don't forget your state will charge you at the end to file so add that to the 39.99 Turbo Tax purchase fee.

title: I had no problem with this year I am retired ...
content: I had no problem with this year I am retired and have very simple return each year. I am aware of the problems with Turbo tax for 2014 and was told if I return my copy to Costco I would be given a upgrade, (I have used Turbo Tax for the past nine (9) years.However I already did this years taxes and don't need a upgrade for 2014 year. Can you give me a 2015 version in order to keep me as a customer? Brian S. Burke

title: Turbo Tax is a user friendly product. I have ...
content: Turbo Tax is a user friendly product. I have used it over 5 years. BUT, this latest hacking and interface to the state tax organizations is a bummer. I filed electronically expecting to get my refund in 2-3 weeks. It took over 6 weeks to get a CHECK because the state did not trust Turbo Tax after the hacking. I'll probably switch to another product or do manually on paper. I fear Turbo Tax gave us only the tip of the hacking iceberg. If hackers have our tax information we are in trouble. This is negligence on Turbo Taxes part.

title: To many problems
content: Easy to use ,but had problems with filing both state and federal this year. Everything was the same as last year, but both federal and state wanted to see actual proof of W2.,so I was unable to efile

title: Turbo
content: I started using TurboTax three years ago, I agree that it made doing my taxes much easier and i do feel secure using it. This year i did receive a refund and was happy. I was not happy buying TurboTax this year it went up almost double at a cost of $49.00. If them go up again next year i will switch to H& R block they only cost $32.00. Turbo tax was simple and provided all of the forms that i needed and double check my return at the end. Other than the cost i was very satisfied with during my taxes with Turbo tax.

title: I was really disappointed to find it would not allow a very simple ...
content: I had been using Turbo Tax Basic (usually less than $20) for about 15 years. It did everything, including small business, capital gains, and installment sales. WalMart didn't have the Basic when I bought this year so I paid $45 for the Deluxe version. I was really disappointed to find it would not allow a very simple small business return. Turbo Tax offered to update the product if I called them, but I had already gotten a free download from H&R Block and was able to complete my return easily. Not sure which brand I'll be buying next year.

title: Another year with TurboTax
content: TurboTax has done the job for me for many years and this year is no exception. I didn't use any of the forms that all the hubub was about. Being used to the format I do very little of the guided interview but it's there if needed. I always think the state filing price is too high so I fill it out in TurboTax and then transfer the numbers to our state's free filing site. Another successful tax year.

title: Delighted at saving of time and work involved in filing 2014 TurboTax return.
content: Appreciated the complete forwarding from last year's TurboTax return. I did not have to type in all the addresses of charities to which I had contributed that had been required in previous years.

title: A little disappointed this year.
content: I have used Turbotax for many years and have never had any issues whatsoever. However, this year was the exception. I have had several issues with the software this year. A lot of navigation issues along with an occassional freeze and unwanted exiting. Also, the importing data from previous year return put data into incorrect screen fields. So this year, I'm a bit disappointed in the product.

title: TurboTax is quick, easy and secure. I definitely recommend this software for completing your taxes.
content: TurboTax not only helps to maximize my refund but also saves me significant time in the process. It accomplishes both by automatically retrieving information from last year's tax return that I completed using TurboTax, extracts the W2 information automatically, and allows me to verify the information for accuracy. It's easy to use and I no longer dread the mundane process of completing my tax return each year. Most importantly, it uses a secure PIN so I am assured to receive my refund without the risk of someone stealing my identity and stealing my refund.

title: OK, But Quirky
content: Meets the requirement. Had several odd issues come up during the quality check and again when I e-filed. Missing a zero, cited a weird deduction that did not apply to me, needed a check mark when none was required, etc. Overall, better than past years, but these small little discrepancies are becoming more common year-to-year. I am actively looking for another product.

title: Fully Satisfied
content: The 2014 TurboTax was changed slightly from prior years relative to input, but I was able to adapt quickly and input was quite simple. Since 2013 I had changed computers and was not able to carry forward some of the input such as charitable giving addresses, but this was not a factor in TurboTax performance. Overall I was again fully satisfied with the performance, speed and accuracy of TurboTax. I was very confident that my taxes had been accurately and carefully computed. I recommend it as an excellent product!

title: Turbo Tax is easily the best
content: Of all the tax prep software's out there, Turbo Tax is easily the best. I'm a CPA and while I could fairly easily do my returns using far less expensive and capable software, I choose Turbo Tax because of its easy navigation of step by step as well as forms based inputs. I've tried several other programs, including Tax Cut and the frustration factor is dramatically less for Turbo Tax. Its worth the extra money. I gave the program 4 stars only because of the cost, especially for online state filings.

title: Didn't process 1099-R correctly
content: The program would not let me enter an annuity1099-R without providing a RMD amount, for which there is none. It treated it as a IRA distribution and wouldn't allow me to continue. I found no way to directly call TT to get them to modify their app. The annuity company, AXA, informed me that many people have called them saying they were experiencing the same problem.

title: Turbo tax is even cheaper to purchase and there a great help.
content: Well, I did get my taxes done at an accounts office, but then I heard of turbo tax and wow, what a change. That other account I went to didn't do half of what turbo tax does me/us. I asked him about what I could write off on my taxes and he just sat there is his chair with a shitty smirk on his face, thank you turbo tax. Turbo tax is even cheaper to purchase and there a great help.

title: The internet connection worked just fine for Amazon to charge me for the download purchase ...
content: The internet connection worked just fine for Amazon to charge me for the download purchase but when I try to download suddenly I get an error message that I don't have an internet connection!

title: Intuit Turbo Tax Deluxe
content: I have used Turbo Tax Deluxe for many years now. I use it because I like it. For some years I got the download version, this year I got he disk version. For me the disk version worked much better for downloading. I would like it better if it were less time consuming to get through doing my taxes. Over all I think Intuit has a good product here in the Turbo Tax Deluxe.

title: Once again disappointed!
content: Once again it was ok but, once again when I said I only wanted to only e-file my Federal return and not both, the software did not ask if I wanted to enter my bank information for direct deposit. I had to look at the forms and enter the information manually. I noticed that it does ask if you have a refund on both Federal and State and are e-filing both returns. I am seriously considering going back to TaxCut, or whatever they are calling it this year, just on that issue alone!

title: Had to spend an hour online with the tech to ...
content: Had to spend an hour online with the tech to get it to load, but once loaded it was the right product for my needs. I have been using Turbo tax for 15 years... Was worried when I saw the reviews, but Turbotax offered the upgrade as promised.

title: highly recommend TurboTax
content: I have used TurboTax to do my taxes the last four years. I am very happy with the product. It makes it very easy to do taxes. And maximize refund or reduce taxes. The only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is I wish you could sort the contributions list. It is tedious enough to entire each charity (guess we give to too many). It would be a great help if the list could be sorted instead of in the order originally entered.

title: I was disappointed. I had used Turbo Tax for the previous ...
content: I was disappointed. I had used Turbo Tax for the previous 6 years and had no problem with it. This year they did not include the State Tax forms. They wanted and additional $39.99 for the State Forms. I was not happy. I really like Turbo Tax but felt like I was cheated this year. There were no notices sent out about it.

title: So Easy Even I can Do It
content: I haven't had to do my own taxes in over 40 years, I married my accountant. He was sick last year so I had to do them myself, I was scared to death. The last time I did mine I did it in pencil using the different charts and calculations - ugh! I asked my daughter to help me through it but I really didn't need much help. It was so easy even I could do it!! I'm extremely pleased with TurboTax and I don't see the need to use anything else. I LOVE IT! Thank you TurboTax!

title: Turbo Tax Deluxe is very good tax software
content: On the whole, Turbo Tax Deluxe is very good tax software, user friendly and quite accurate. There is one important exception in regard to one of the allocations in the Iowa state tax calculation. This allocation does not follow the clear instructions for the Iowa return, and the Turbo Tax calculation results in a major distortion of the resultant tax. Luckily, Turbo Tax permits the user to override and insert the correct allocation. I have provided the details twice in letters to Turbo Tax, without consequent correction of the software.

title: DO THE MAIN TAXES FIRST ALWAYS!
content: I like Turbo Tax, however I am finding that unless I do my taxes first, the dependents are given the exemption that I should be getting for them. We have two dependents on our taxes still who are over 18 years old. Turbo Tax should flag a "dependent" and not allow the return to be e-filed until the main taxes are filed. Now I have to do an amendment on one of the dependents and I cannot seem to do it on Turbo Tax software. I have to file a 1040X in order to get it fixed and my taxes are not done yet so everything is messed up.

title: Not what I expected
content: Although I did not have any Investment and or trading activity to report to the IRS, I was really discouraged when I found out this feature was not supported by the Deluxe product any longer. I read other reviews and found a large number of people upset about this change. Many had to pay additional fees on top of the cost of purchase for the TurboTax software. With all of the problems that have happened this tax season, I may think twice next year about continuing to use TurboTax.

title: No better tax software than Turbo Tax
content: I have been using Turbo Tax software since 1996 and found it was easy to use and actually helped you from making mistakes, When I was audited by the IRS Turbo Tax answered some of my questions on how to handle the audit request, Have used it for small business, real estate rentals and home use and am always satisfied.with the results. I recommend Turbo Tax to all my friends.

title: not too happy with the program this year
content: Well, not too happy with the program this year. When I got to the end, ready to file, the program asked me to pay AGAIN. I purchased the program at Office Max (depot). Anyway, I didn't find this year program as easy to use in previous years. Will think about buying a different Tax Program next year. PS: I don't think I should have to pay another $19.98 to file my State Return when I purchased the "State Return" with the Federal Delux program. Shouldn't indicate on the box you get a State return, but still have to pay e-file.

title: It created a good deal of confusion
content: I was put off by the changes TurboTax made to their product offerings this year. It created a good deal of confusion. However, once I sat down to prepare my taxes, I was able to navigate through the program easily. It's still a good product. My one complaint: the amounts charged for e-filing (after the one free federal return) seem very high to me. Just another profit source for Intuit, I suppose.

title: Easy to use, but not problem free.
content: Turbo tax 2014 Federal was easy to follow and walked me through all of my various deductions. However, when doing my donations the program gave me the option of using various instead of entering multiple dates for my donations. When the program was checking for accuracy it said various was not a valid date entry and made me enter a date, but did not give the option to enter more than one donation date. I hope that this does not raise a flag with the IRS and end up getting me audited.

title: A friend of minds recommended it. I only had a few problems
content: this was my second year using Turbo Tax. A friend of minds recommended it. I only had a few problems. I could not find how to back it up on my flash drive and after completing the form how to get back to the beginning. It would always start me at the end. I didn't want to go back through the whole thing. I will use it again next year it was easy except for those two problem, it could have been me not understanding . I always went to H&R Block . the first year my friend did it with me this year I did it on my own.

title: I enjoy the fact that I don't have to rely on ...
content: This is my second year doing Turbo Tax. I know it takes a long time to complete it, but that's because Turbo Tax goes through every item and if I don't understand something there are help clicks to read and even more information if I don't get it the first time. What is most helpful is the review for mistakes at the end and Turbo Tax has found a couple. I enjoy the fact that I don't have to rely on someone doing it for me. It's a workout on my head, but it stimulates my brain!!

title: No problem with Turbotax until I tried to electronically submit ...
content: No problem with Turbotax until I tried to electronically submit....then I had a problem to get your program to allow me to pay for the State filing and as a result I could not submit my Federak return. It took a call to your customer service to untangle this knot. However, Customer Service forgave the State charge for the inconvenience caused by the problem and for that I thank you and will use Turbotax again next year. C M Littleton

title: main tax form screen needs a little tweaking
content: One thing is of constant annoyance to me is the following: after completing one form or item, it returns to the main screen, but I have to page down in order to click the next item button. My suggestion is this: either position you at the bottom of the screen automatically (1st choice) or put a next item button at the top of the screen. I know this seems minor, but not many people do not love doing their taxes. Every little smoothing out is good.

title: Best TurboTax Version Yet
content: I have used turbo tax deluxe for many years..this year was no exception. For some reason the 2014 version seemed better than past versions..for the couple of instances I needed to go directly to the forms to make adjustments each processed clearly and simply. We had the largest federal refund in over ten years and received it in less than seven days after e-filing.

title: Not great, not bad
content: It works pretty well over all. They ding you for an extra $20 for state e-filing, which I don't particularly like, they could be more up front on this. Also, there was a question on how long your dependents lived with you through the year that didn't "require" answering, but when I overlooked it, it wouldn't let me file as head of household, so there are some user friendliness issues as well. I was just doing a simple no deductions return and it took me about an hour.

title: Worked fine for me.
content: Despite all the negative uproar regarding this year's version of Turbo Tax Deluxe, I had no issues. I'm assuming my personal tax situation allowed me to steer clear of any of the missing forms that others have complained about. Just lucky I guess. I've been doing my taxes with Turbo Tax Deluxe for about 10 years now and so far so good. No issues. Works for me. Easy and quick to use.

title: I would highly recommend Turbo Tax to anyone
content: This is the fifth year I have used Turbo Tax. It is very user friendly and I always feel confident about using this software in filing my taxes. I even downloaded the Freedom Edition for my daughter and walked her through filing her own taxes for the first time. Before Turbo Tax I did my own taxes by hand and mailed them in. Filing electronically and getting the emails that my taxes were accepted really gives you peace of mind. I would highly recommend Turbo Tax to anyone.

title: Easy to use
content: I highly recommend Turbo Tax Deluxe. The software guides the user through the tax filing process, making it easy to use. Each topic may be handled in order, or the user may choose to visit only those items that are applicable. An especially useful feature is the option to click and get additional information if there's a question about the topic presented. I have used Turbo Tax for years because it is simple and accurate.

title: Love TurboTax after doing my taxes by hand for years
content: Love TurboTax after doing my taxes by hand for years. Not at all impressed by the additional charges and lack of guidance (which I enjoyed for my own tax return) for my daughter's state(s) return which included out-of-state work study earnings (college work-study.,,,,this shouldn't be difficult), which led to 2 state returns, and in the end we abandoned turbotax and did it the old-fashioned way. By hand. Advice...do NOT spend the extra bucks for multi-state returns. Free forms are available on-line!

title: One Star
content: Want install!

title: Easy to Use
content: Very easy to use, I was pleased Turbo Tax lead me through at a very comfortable pace and I believe I received the best refund possible. I also thought the price was reasonable. The only complaint I would have was on the packaging, I purchased Turbo Tax Deluxe and the deluxe was in smaller print than the rest of the of the information on the box. I believe it would be better to enlarge this to avoid confusion.

title: Turbo Tax Deluxe worked pretty good for me on most items
content: Turbo Tax Deluxe worked pretty good for me on most items. However, I had to call tech support for assistance for "Job related Expenses" and for filing state tax returns for two separate states. I had called prior to filing and was given erroneous info. But during the filing process, tech support was able to guide me through both items over the phone!

title: Best Ever!
content: Best ever! Turbo Tax even calculated my wife's taxable portion of her federal annuity for the first time. Always before, I had to calculate it manually. Got my federal refund in 8 days. I had to answer several identity questions from my Ohio State submittal but then the refund came about two weeks after that. The one critique I have is, why ask me for all the taxable deductions (doctors, medicine, etc.) when it's clear that I'll be taking the standard deduction? Other than that, very pleased

title: So easy to use that a caveman can use it!
content: Pros: What more is there to say, that hasn't been said alread? I've been using Turbo Tax for the better part of more than 5 years and find the software very user friendly. Every year they make the software easy to use and I doubt very much if I would ever change. Cons: The security breach this year concerned me as you would expect. Hoping this does not affect me and that the guilty are found and prosecuted to the full extent of the law.

title: Standard deduction
content: We are retired and for the last 3 or 4 years a standard deduction has turned out to be to our advantage. TurboTax pulls up my last year return and has it as a reference. But I still have to wade through all the deductions and gifts only to be once again told to take a standard deduction. Seems like it should ask if there are any significant changes for last year and if not just take the standard deduction and go with it.

title: and I'm really disappointed. If I didn't like the ease of using ...
content: This is the first year that Turbo Tax cut the Business forms from their Deluxe edition, and I'm really disappointed. If I didn't like the ease of using Turbo Tax, I'd never buy it again. However, it is a good product, accurate, and easy to use. I'm just bummed that they jacked the price so much to be able to get the necessary forms I need. It's almost to a point where Turbo Tax is out pricing their market. Too BAD!

title: Turbo Tax is SUPERCHARGED
content: I have used turbo tax deluxe version for the last 7 years and would not switch to anything else. It is easy to use and provides a good guide to help me obtain the best possible return. Items from the prior year are always filled out for me as well as text items necessary for the state tax return. If I have a question, I can find an answer either within the Turbo Tax product or online with TurboTax. My taxes are filed quickly and correctly. I would recommend this product to everyone...and I do!

title: Should I be getting a bigger refund?
content: I've used TurboTax for the last 3 years. My tax filing is fairly simple so I thought I would save money and time by using the TurboTax program. From the beginning the program shows your refund. As you input your information the refund indication changes. My problem with this is when I put in my bigger write offs like my mortgage interest the refund indication didn't change. I never found out why. Next year I will have my taxes done elsewhere to see if there is a difference.

title: (Use to be Parson's) Did not like that I had to upgrade this year even though ...
content: Have used Turbo Tax Deluxe for years.(Use to be Parson's) Did not like that I had to upgrade this year even though it was free. I hope they learned that they need to let their clients know what is happening before they buy the program. I will buy again next year. I have always trusted Turbo Tax. Low grade is because of the problems this year.

title: I will keep using TurboTax but Intuit removed some standard ...
content: I will keep using TurboTax but Intuit removed some standard features from the Deluxe version this year that have been part of the software for many years. Their intent was for individuals to buy Premier vice Deluxe for those features. I suspect there was a lot of backlash, which resulted in ability to upgrade to Premier for free. Need to pay close attention when buying for 2015 taxes. There was one error in the input for the VA state form, but I worked around it using the tax worksheets.

title: A great product with a little annoince
content: The program did exactly what it promised. It was easy to use and very fast -- thanks. The only problem is removing the software. The normal process did not remove all directories nor all registry entries. I was forced to reload whole system from a backup image, not a real big deal since I routinely make images, but time consuming and unnecessary. I highly recommend it as long as you are willing to reload from your image backup in order to remove the program fully

title: This is an excellent program for people to do their own taxes if ...
content: This is an excellent program for people to do their own taxes if they don't have a lot of write offs and have a small business... I believe that Turbo Tax should go back to the Deluxe model from 2013 that contained the Federal, State, Homeowners and Small Business, since a lot of people have do side work where they are their own boss...

title: ... using Turbo Tax for over 5 years and I love it. It makes a former chore actually enjoyable
content: I have been using Turbo Tax for over 5 years and I love it. It makes a former chore actually enjoyable. Filing can be like unraveling a complex puzzle but Turbo Tax figures it all out for you. I have several income sources and am primarily on a fixed income. Turbo tax keeps all my information on the income sources, eliminating the need to enter the same info year after year. Anyone can do it although it helps to be organized before you start the process. Well worth the price.

title: Best of a bad tax system.
content: The income tax system is too complex. TurboTax gets me through the filing process without having to read volumes of instructions and tax law. I never feel that I understand what I see when I review the final forms. I have trusted TurboTax to get me through the process for many years. So far it has been as good as I could expect given the ridiculous tax system that we have.

title: Not completely Happy
content: I used Turbo Tax for the first time on my 2013 Returns and again for 2014. Like it very much ; however, could not complete an amended return for 2014 Fed Return to correct a mistake of a double deduction on my part. Could only get to the point of reviewing the amended return without success in so doing. Not able to print copy of amended form. Filed a paper mailed amended form instead. Am disappointed in not being able to complete the amended return with Turbo Tax. .

title: Good Returns
content: I have used Turbo Tax for over 10 years. I like how it copies over last year's return info to start a new return. I did my return, my son's who is overseas with the Navy and my sister in law's. I had no trouble as I always use the Deluxe version and don't derive income for exotic sources requiring the Premier Version. I will see you in a year unless someone dumps the IRS. HA!

title: I like the program vey much with one exception
content: I like the program vey much with one exception. There are problems with some of the program questions don't seem to be clear. My friends use my turbo and I prepare first one. Turbo tax program is supposed to give 5 free IRS on line free and it does.
