content: You took a good product and attempted to fiddle with, why. I have been using Turbo tax for a least 12 yr. and always found it to be reliable and easy to use. Remember if it is not broken - don't fix it.

title: TurboTax user since 2005
content: Been using it since 2005. Easy to understand & use, good value compared to using a tax prep service.

title: WARNING - NO LONGER HANDLES BUSINESS INCOME
content: WARNING! Unlike prior versions of TT Deluxe, this will NOT handle your home business. You'll need to purchase the more expensive HOME AND BUSINESS version.

title: easy-peasy!
content: Software is incredibly straightforward! Its very easy to use and getting five federal efiles makes it a greater value even still. We've used turbo tax for eight years now and would recommend for anyone

title: Didn't like the idea of buying the turbo tax program and ...
content: Didn't like the idea of buying the turbo tax program and then a month later hear on TV that I could do turbo tax on line for free. Should get a refund on my purchase but I don't think that is going to happen.

title: Glitchy but Customer Service is WONDERFUL
content: I have used Turbo Tax for years and was hesitant to re-purchase this year after the email I got from the company apologizing for the issues and all of the negative reviews. At the end of the day, I did simply because I know the program and because it was discounted. While I did have some issues with downloading added states and e-filing my state taxes, I was able to solve both of those with a simple call to customer service. They gave me the extra state for free and waived the e-file fee. Yes, this was not their best product and had this been my first experience with them I would probably not use them again but since I have had wonderful experiences with them in the past I will use them again next year.

title: Intuit got Greedy - Don't Buy
content: Intuit got greedy - removed forms in the Deluxe edition. Wont use again if forms are not re-added.

title: Are the forms that were removed last year in the ...
content: Are the forms that were removed last year in the Deluxe this year or do we have to go to H&R Block

title: if was easy for me to miss
content: Generally satisfactory, but it allowed me to make a significant mistake. If there was a cue to insert estimated tax paid, if was easy for me to miss; This resulted in an incorrect return, to my disadvantage.

title: I had to purchase the state version with the federal ...
content: I had to purchase the state version with the federal and when it was done Turbo Tax wanted another $20.00 to file. I will use this for federal use but feel I was misled in purchasing the state version.

title: Functionally, this version of TurboTax is as good as previous years' versions
content: I have used TurboTax for over ten years, and always been very happy with it. This year TurboTax moved some features from the Deluxe version to the higher priced Premier version. This move was not clear to many buyers, and the ratings for TurboTax Deluxe on Amazon plummeted. After some time, and in response, TurboTax offered to help defray the added cost to consumers. Hey, at least they eventually tried to fix things. Now, this change may roll over into next years Premier version, and if that happens, that will be an added cost for some users. I can understand the frustration of many users. I just wanted to add my review, to say that functionally, this years TurboTax appears to be just as good as previous years' versions. The user interface is clean, the instructions and help areas are indeed helpful. The TurboTax program is not as bad as the reviews on Amazon might lead many people to believe. Btw, I have absolutely no affiliation with TurboTax or Intuit. Just a happy customer for many years.

title: Easy to use
content: Easy to use. Easy to get answers to my questions. Do my taxes and all my kids' taxes. Feel like a real smartypants! Save BIG $$ over tax return chains, which I used to use. ALWAYS get a legitimate refund!

title: I was very upset that I had to upgrade to ...
content: I was very upset that I had to upgrade to enter stock sales and I wasn't eligible for the rebate.

title: Lost money on the Deluxe version.
content: Missed inputting my Capital Gains losses this year using the "Deluxe" version. It sucked.

title: Four Stars
content: It was cheap of Intuit to downgrade the Deluxe version so to make us buy the next higher version.

title: Easy to use
content: Easy to use, but did not get the state tax filed for free like the ads said. I was charged $19.99 to file the state tax through Turbo tax. I emailed Turbo tax about why this happened and got no response.

title: Satisfied no longer
content: I was disappointed after using TurbTax for many years to find the company secretly removing features from their products and then expecting their customers to pay extra for the previously included features.

title: Refund baby.... Turbo Tax Rocks.
content: No issues. Downloading was a little slow but once it was on my laptop everything worked great.

title: One Star
content: Ordered the wrong one by accident, couldn't return it. Be careful what you order by download.

content: I have used this product for years and I trust that they ask me all the pertinent questions to insure that I pay the right amount of taxes and can deduct the right amount of charities. Easy to follow.

title: Two Stars
content: worst ever!

title: Turned my plus to a minus
content: After 12 years I'm leaving Turbox Tax!

title: Poor customer service
content: Too many problems with Turbo tax soft ware. Unlikely to use again. Poor customer service.

title: NOT impresssed!
content: I have bee using Turbo Tax for over 6 years. This year... I am NOT impressed! I had more difficulty this year than ever before with Turbo Tax Deluxe 2014 Fed & State. Fed was not that bad... but State was a mess!!! I file non-resident NC & "SHOULD" have gotten a refund as I have for all past years. But I got so frustrated with the UNCLEAR instructions that I just went with what Turbo Tax did (which was break even... nothing owed & no refund) & just went ahead & sent it in so I would not be late in filing my return. I can only PRAY that NC Dept of Revenue catches the error & issues me my refund any way. I don't know what went wrong with your product OR if there have been some changes to NC 2014 Tax regulations (which I doubt) but "I know for certain" I should have gotten a refund from the state of NC. This is going to cause me to question using Turbo Tax in the future.

title: Five Stars
content: A great product that took all the stress. . . And procrastination out of doing my taxes.

title: Four Stars
content: Good as always but tripped me up on IRA contribution part

title: Always great product
content: Great product, very helpful for someone who doesn't like to do or know how to do taxes.

title: I did not get as much of a return as ...
content: I did not get as much of a return as I did last year but again I didn't have to pay...

title: I've used Turbo for four years and this one was terrible!.
content: Next year I'll use TaxAct. I've used Turbo for four years and this one was terrible!.

title: Three Stars

title: One Star
content: Try again next year junk this year

title: Five Stars
content: I liked this software. It guides you through the process and is very easy to use.

title: It appears that H&R Block is a better priced product from 2014 on
content: Starting in 2014, Deluxe no longer provides Schedule C or Schedule F, forcing users to spend and extra $40 for what was previously provided. It appears that H&R Block is a better priced product from 2014 on. H&R Block also claims advantages in user support and audit support at no additional cost to user. As a TurboTax user since 1995, I will probably switch in 2015. I found the TurboTax website to be inadequate to answering questions, using Chat, using Call, and even finding a phone number to call. I finally found a phone number while using Deluxe 2014 when I was unable to update online. The TurboTax phone automatic support was extremely frustrating, but when I finally got to speak to someone, the tech support person was oustanding.

title: Excellent product
content: Love it and will be ording it soon for taxes. thank you for a wonderful product.

title: Four Stars
content: No problems--My taxes were generally easy to do. The program worked flawless ly

title: I was able to navigate the various forms with ease
content: It worked as expected and I was able to navigate the various forms with ease.

title: Four Stars

title: Three Stars
content: Could not get the package open. HAD TO BREAK IT OPEN WITH A SCREWDRIVER !!!

title: Well done...
content: First time doing my taxes using software. TT was simple and yet sophisticated asking probing questions and looking around the corners at different scenarios for saving me money that even my CPA did notdiscover. Very satisfied with the product and results.

content: Bought the wrong year, no return policy, so stuck with a worthless program

title: Thanks for the warning
content: Thank you all for the warning. I was about to order Turbo Tax Deluxe as usual to start my returns and noticed the low ratings. Off to try H&R Block...

title: Easy to use
content: Easy to use! I wish there is an option to compare filing a joint return to a seperate return for married couples to maximize the return. Also it would be nice if it shows the tax brackets I need to stay in to prevent going into the next bracket up.

title: Three Stars
content: WE WERE SUPPOSED TO GET A REBATE BUT WE DIDN'T

title: While the Deluxe version handled most of the tax items ...
content: While the Deluxe version handled most of the tax items, it insisted I upgrade to the next level product when I needed to change my business deduction information from last year'sinformation, the program said I could download the upgrade for free, but when I tried to do that it asked for my credit card information in order to charge money for it. The program also indicated that I was allowed one state tax report for free, but when it was ready to file that one form, again I needed to incur another charge to complete the filing. Get your act together! Either charge for it and admit it, or in fact allow for one state report filing!

title: not so good
content: Does not do NC military retired pay correct

title: No free state return as promised
content: I did not get my free state return as the software did not waive it!

title: It's very good tool to use
content: I use every year. It's very good tool to use. It's user friendly.

title: Taxes made easy
content: Have used TT for years. Easy to use. With step by step instructions

title: Four Stars
content: Accurate, fast and reliable. I always buy this software every year.

title: Ten Year Customer but 2015 with Turbo Tax Uncertain.
content: I'm not sure I will use Turbo Tax for my 2015 taxes. I have used Turbo Tax since about 2005 but for tax year 2013 it was difficult to navigate. For tax year 2014 my state return was $442.00 less when issued by the state than the software said it would be and the state justified their adjustment. Also the 2014 city tax filing worked but would not let me print the form for filing as it showed a watermark that said it was not complete do not file. On investigation I learned that Turbo Tax didn't have approved forms from the city as if the date I tried to use it, which was February 2, 2014. Also for 2013 I gave my Turbo Tax to a relative because I had to buy a more expensive version to file as I always had with the deluxe version.

title: It is too bad TT had the controversy about the Premium Edition
content: I've been using Turbo Tax for several years. It works well and is simple to use. I will continue using TT in the future. Wish State forms could be e-filed for free. It is too bad TT had the controversy about the Premium Edition. It appears they did the right thing by giving their Premium Customers a rebate

title: So easy to use
content: Use this product every year to prepare my taxes. So easy to use.

title: Three Stars
content: Not as easy to use as TurboTax soft ware I have used in the past.

title: The software program is easy to use
content: Its taxes! The software program is easy to use. Will use again.

title: like
content: I am a part of a medical test and TurboTax placed this income as self employment income, thus I was taxed at a much higher rate than I should have been. A tax advisor stated that this income should have been tax exempt, but must be claimed. Also, the problems with the web site not recognizing the state return was annoying. But when we called the help line to advise of the problem in the beginning, we were treated like we were ignorant and unable to maneuver through an internet site. I have used TurboTax for many years now but it may be time to change tax programs next year.

title: Despite reading a lot of poor reviews of the 2014 version
content: Despite reading a lot of poor reviews of the 2014 version, I used TurboTax once again and had no troubles. The product was intuitive and I completed my taxes in record time. I experienced no hassles in receiving my state or federal refund.

title: One Star
content: NOTt able to contact.. NO notice that my e file was received.

title: Four Stars
content: We were very happy with the help you give will using Turbo Tax

title: Great product - keep the deluxe version as it was last year.
content: I am glad you all decided to allow upgrading for those of us who have used Turbo Tax for years. I appreciate this. Now the next question do I have to look for another tax program next year or will the needed forms that I have been used to having in my Turbo Tax be there for me? I have used Turbo Tax for approximately 20 years. I have much faith in it. I hate to think I'll be looking for another program. I am a senior citizen and have appreciated the cost of the program being such that I can afford it. Thank you for such a great product! Please keep it affordable and containing the program as it was for 2013.

title: Two Stars
content: Bought early and had to pay extra for state, a big surprise.

title: Turbo Price
content: I have been using Turbo Tax for five years or more. I enjoy the ease and accuracy of it. However, this year, I paid a "turbo price" for it. I purchased the Deluxe addition on Amazon.com only to find out that it was just the Federal version. In order to finish my taxes, I had to purchase the State version as well . In addition, I e-filed both of my returns, which warranted another charge. In the end, I paid nearly $100.00 in total. In past years, I have purchased the Federal and State programs together and spend about $50.00. I will not purchase Turbo Tax from Amazon.com again without ready the very fine print.

title: Got the job done in the end
content: It eventually did the job, but could have been a lot easier. The main problem I had was the disconnect between the claim that it would ensure the biggest savings, then not testing the other options when I went with their "recommended settings". It gave me a $5000 underpayment with their recommended setting. I then had to go back through and toggle settings one by one to find I didn't owe anything. It's certainly not as intuitive as they would have you believe.

title: Turbotax sucks unless you want to pay
content: Don't buy it. They don't tell you until you get to a form you need, that now you need to upgrade. Pissed off. Did not do that last year. Money hungry sneeky, you know whats.........

title: did as good job as my accountant for a fraction of the price.
content: I filled out a questionnaire for years and handed it to my accountant. A coworker saw it and commented that it looked like the questions turbo tax asked. She leant me her copy of 2013 and I got a bigger return than my accountant got me. It's prompts reminded me of discounts I hadn't thought to give my accountant. This year I purchased my own copy. My only wish is that it would explain certain deductions in a more simple manner. Example: mileage. There were a lot of changes this year and it was more confusing than last year.

title: H&R Block Also Has Limitations
content: I am one of the people who bought the H&R Block software because I needed both Schedule C and E functionality. One thing I am finding that the H&R software doesn't have, and this is very important to me, is the smart worksheet for entering interest and dividends. H&R's software makes you enter each 1099 individually and if you have a lot of dividend and interest 1099's to enter, it is truly a pain in the butt. I still don't like the attempt to gouge customers, but I do need that functionality.

title: TurboTax
content: Turbo Tax Deluxe: I've been using Turbo Tax for 5 years and I don't approve of the way you mislead customers by saying you get state. For years we got free state. I know it don't say free state. I think you should state that state is not free as it was. Thank you don't know if I will use Turbo Tax next year. Ron Orlando justchilling2@verizon.net

title: I LOVE IT
content: Easy to use. I use it every year. I get my refund in Feb.

title: Horrible.
content: Horrible problems trying to use the State portion. Multiple error codes and no access to help from intuit.

title: Great for non-mathematicians
content: The good news is this program helps people like me who are math challenged. There is no way you can make a mistake if you just follow this program. I was hesitant at first to try anything on a computer because I always had an accountant help me. No more. I count on Turbo Tax because it takes the stress out of an otherwise bothersome task. I filed on February 14 and got my refund in ten days. How efficient is that?

title: Easy and Reliable
content: I have used TurboTax for several years now and really like the way it imports your information from the previous year. If anything has changed in the last year, you are prompted to edit it. There is an easy to understand flow from beginning to end. Anything you are not sure of? You can always go back and address it later. The software will also give you values for any donations you have made throughout the year (clothing and household goods). I look for the new TurboTax every year.

title: Couldn't be easier!
content: Clear simple directions, easy to follow, saved me $250.

title: No issues. Previous purchasers can get the free upgrade from Deluxe to Premier ot H&Business.
content: ok, as previous user of TurboTax for over 15 years. just downloaded Deluxe, but needed the features I always had with Premier. Because I purchased 2013 TurboTax Deluxe, I was able to get a free and simple upgrade to Home & Business because I had a few simple expenses that required those forms which I always had access to before in Deluxe. So Intuit took care of the issue. A lot of negative complaints right now about the lack of the extra forms and the required upgrade expense, but no upgrade expense required if you have purchased last year. Thank you Intuit for taking care of this issue. I don't mind a yearly modest price increase if you want to keep my business, but I hope Intuit learned a lesson about how they rolled out this years new software packages. You have a loyal customer base and you just cant do what you did this year by taking away many functions in the previous Deluxe versions and then asking for an upgrade fee. Your marketing team really needs to learn how to conduct proper customer market research before making these types of changes. But you have fixed it, so hopefully we won't see this big issue again next year. thanks

title: H&R Block Deluxe vs Turbo Tax deluxe
content: I'll be posting this same review for both the TurboTax Deluxe and H&R Block Deluxe products. Like many people I was upset about the changes to the Turbo Tax software but I had already purchased it, then I found out that H&R Block was offering a free download of their sofware to Turbo Tax customers, so I wrote to them and sure enough they gave me a free download, figured I'd give it a shot. I completed my taxes in H&R Block and found that the software was clunky and was not user friendly, the questions were asked in a confusing manner that on multiple occasions left me less than confident of the answers. At this point I should clarify that I have often filled out my taxes long form by hand, majored in finance in college, and actually used to volunteer to do taxes for low income people...so I can say with confidence I generally know what I'm doing with taxes, and to be left dumbfounded on so many of these questions seemed odd to me. On one question I tried the H&R Block chat function, it took 45 minutes to get somebody on the chat, and once I got the guy he didn't actually know anything about the tax form, however I will note that they do TECHNICALLY have people available 24 hours a day unlike TurboTax which only runs until 9pm PST during tax season. So I wrapped up my taxes but I just couldn't shake the feeling that my form wasn't accurate. After thinking it over I decided to bite the bullet and open up TurboTax rather than returning it. The interview process was easy to use as I've come to expect over the years. Also, for some reason, TurboTax ended up getting me a couple hundred dollars more for my return, which I don't really understand since its all pretty simple math, so I went to the forms and it turns out TurboTax had asked about a few more deductions like car registration fees which H&R Block didn't ask about. In the end I continue to be very happy with TurboTax and when it really comes down to it I didn't even need the extra forms that had been removed, but I still think it was pretty crappy of them to remove them.

The problem appears to be that you no longer support my windows operating system, I will change it before next year. Other then that I am very happy with Turbo Tax and will continue to buy it.

title: Product: 5 Stars, Company: 0
content: A few things of note here - 1) I do not need schedules C, D, or E - and I think that it is terrible that Intuit has changed this product so drastically for those people who do. 2) I looked into using H&R Block Deluxe software this year because I didn't want to support such tactics made by a company. However, after reading the reviews of H&R Block Deluxe, I discovered that trying to file in two states (and I have to do that) creates difficulty after difficulty and that there is only support after a very long phone wait. So, I chose to stick with Turbo Tax. 3) I chose to give the product 5 stars because it did everything I needed it to do perfectly. However, I would give this company of rating of 0 stars for trying to make an extra buck by screwing over good people. I hope that H&R Block creates a better product that I can use next year.

title: Quick and Easy
content: Easy, self explanatory, very comprehensive with excellent documentation and support services. I was certainly suprised on how quick and easy this made doing my taxes, both Federal and State. When I had issues they were immediately addressed by the call in help desk. My Federal refund was direct deposited in to my bank account in two weeks. I'll be using Turbo Tax from now on!

title: Caveat Emptor!
content: Happens to be a great product, one I've used for many years. So why only 3 stars? Well, it's like this. You are confined to file the exact same profile year-to-year if you wish to import historical data (And who doesn't? Name/Address/SS ##/Employer, etc.) But what if circumstances dictate that we file separately? Oh sure, there's a 'what-if' option. BUT IT IS A LEDGER *ONLY* AND WILL NOT CREATE 2 DISCRETE RETURNS! So start new ones from scratch? And what if next year I've got to return to joint? Huh? What then? And this is why I can't give it a higher rating (probably being too kind as it is)...

title: Confusing to buy, but worked great
content: First off, i will be fair to say I did not purchase at Amazon, but got it from a membership store. The worst part for me was deciding which one to buy and I wanted the one with the free "State" included free with it but I saw nothing big on box to state this like in the past but I found it. Luckily, the store had it, but from what I read on Amazon, Amazon's was an added cost. Maybe I just didn't see the one that included "State" on Amazon as I went by similar pricing instead of searching each one. It was confusing and then once I bought it, I heard about forms that were missing on the Deluxe version and people had to upgrade and then Turbo Tax rectified it and well, it was a big mess for many. Again i got lucky and did not need the forms that were missing. This is why I gave it four stars as the Turbo Tax I purchased worked great for me but way too confusing buying it. Turbo Tax needs to simplify the buyers experience as it has been. I have been a Turbo Tax user since the early 90's and have relied on it. Yes, updates need to happen and that is understandable, but don't take away that was once included and don't confuse consumers with product name changes. if it ain't broke, don't fix it!

title: BAD BAD BAD. Run to another program!!
content: Turbotax cost me my return. For the first time ever, I waited last minute to file with the confidence TT would easily guide me through... As it has before. On Tuesday I was on the phone for several hours trying to get help from them just to "log in". Wed over 6 hours as I watched the clock ticking away. ( I resigned myself to rely upon the promise on their home page that an extension was easily a click away).. My TT helper tried to get the site to let me log in promising me she would stick with me.. Then about five min till midnite.. She gave up. I frantically opted to extend but then after two pages later saw where TT will PRINT you an extension and YOU have to mail it in..! BAD BAD BAD that "logging in" screwed up my taxes and now I have no idea what to do since I failed to send in an extension

title: Deluxe doesn't handle _any_ rental income anymore, even just a room in your house
content: Adding to the list of annoyed, 1-star reviews. In the past you could use Deluxe to calculate rental income for simple rental situations, such as renting out a room in your house. I'm not a real-estate professional, I don't own rental properties, and I don't want to. I just rent out a room in my house for a few bucks a month to a friend. Now TurboTax has decided I have to upgrade to all the bells and whistles to handle that situation. If you like being nickled and dimed, you'll like doing your taxes with Turbotax. **Update** I'm upgrading my review to 3 stars. I called TurboTax and explained the problem and they gave me an upgrade to TurboTax Premier for free so that I could handle the rental income this year. You can call them at 800-445-1875 to do the same thing.

title: Toomuch for 2nd state.
content: I DO NOT like how much extra Turbo Tax charges for a 2nd state. It's ridiculous! !!!!!!!

title: Three Stars
content: Good federal tax software, but the state software lacks the ability to e-file all forms.

title: Free e-filing ?????
content: Have used Turbo tax for at least 5 years now. I find it very easy to use and it does find the most deductions and get's the most refund back as it claims. I have one observation tho....this year it well advertised Turbo tax was free in all respects unless you had to have additional tax forms to fill out. I had already purchased my Turbo Tax Deluxe and found when I filed my taxes I had to pay to e-file the State return, $19.00. My return was pretty much simple due to not working but 1/2 of the year. I helped my son and daughter and a close friend to use the "FREE" version of Turbo Tax. None of them had to pay to e-file their Fed. or State returns. My friend had extra forms to fill out for income from a 401-K and also for his Social Security. He did not have to pay anything to file his State either. What is up with that? So let me get this straight, if I purchase my Deluxe program, $48.00, I will still need to pay to e-file my state. That's a total of $67.00. Then everyone else get's to e-file all for "FREE"! I think there is something wrong in this. Of course this is my lone opinion! Will look very hard at Tax programs available next year.

title: really easy
content: Very easy to use. I'll never pay a tax expert hundreds of dollars to do my taxes again!

I've been doing mine for about 12 years with turbo tax thought about changing with the price hike and the rumors of needing to buy a program that was free the year before. It didn't affect me so I was able to do my taxes like always. I will say that I know that this works for every tax situation that I've every had "believe me I have had some strange years and some unusual circumstances" so I was reluctant to change.

title: Good response to the consumers, Intuit.
content: I was surprised by the deletion of Schd D, and appalled by the flimsy excuse that this somehow had to be done to give online users a seamless experience. However, now that Intuit has fixed the issue, I can once again recommend TurboTax Deluxe as the comprehensive solution to the increasingly difficult tax season. For the "average Joe" with a job, kids, house, property taxes, mutual fund, etc., it works well. Not perfect...the help needs work...but good enough. Recommended.

title: One Star

title: Turbo Tax is IT
content: I won't use anything else. Simple, comprehensive, accurate, and complete.

title: Expensive
content: Too expensive to add multiple states as well as e-filing multiple states.

title: Easy to use.
content: I have been using TurboTax since it was first produced and it has worked well for my various life stages and tax scenarios. It is by far the easiest and most comprehensive tax program on the market. It works by interviewing you and as you answer questions and input facts, the program triggers the forms needed for your individual tax situation. The program can be used by 5 individual filers and you get one free eFile. This year the products have changed. There is still the basic program but the deluxe program only includes simple investment and no rental properties. There is now a third program for involved tax situations. It should be noted that the basic program does not include the state tax filing forms. Most people will use the deluxe program. Turbo tax works well for businesses as well as individuals. I highly recommend this product.

title: Boo taxes. Hooray for TurboTax!
content: Turbo Tax helped me get nearly 1500 to my state and federal government.

title: I chose TT over H&R
content: Turbo Tax worked fine for me this year. I only have a home deductions and charitable contributions, so my situation is pretty simple. It's worth the $49 to have my taxes done and filed in two hours from beginning to end. The upgrade I needed to Premier for a Sched C carryover was free. I don't think it will be next year. But after reading some reviews of H&R Block software, saying it wasn't as stellar as some people made it out to be, I stuck with what has worked for me for almost 20 years now. I may go back to doing my taxes manually on paper if the price goes much higher though.

title: I love Turbo Tax

title: Five Stars
content: Easy to use and had great results. Already received my state refund.

title: Meh.
content: I've been using Turbo Tax for 8 years now, and this is the first year where I felt like the software was not helpful. I had to look up a lot of stuff online. I got my taxes done, I guess that's the most important thing. I had to do the free upgrade because I worked as a contractor for one month last year, and apparently Turbo Tax Deluxe doesn't have schedule C. Not sure if I'm going to be using Turbo Tax next year, but we'll see...

title: As good a product as ever!
content: After reading the initial complaints about this product, I ordered the HRB software. After installing HRB and using it to enter my data, I knew I had made a mistake. I am not a tax accountant and rely on such software to guide me through my tax return. The product was not what I needed. I gave up and ordered Turbo Tax which I have used for years and found it as user friendly as it always had been.

title: highly recommend
content: we have been using turbo tax for probably about 15 years or so.... never had any problems with it.... we love it and it is cheaper than going to a tax person.... it ask you the same questions they ask.... heck, THEY probably are using turbo tax for your taxes.... the couple times we had a question about something we called on the phone and were able to talk to a real person and they answered our questions or concerns... even this year with the $^&(* obamacare "stuff". everything went smooth with turbo tax... I would highly recommend it.... only slight thing that could be better is that this year is was very hard to FIND a phone number for turbo tax if you had a problem you wanted to talk to someone about... years past I think there was a number right on the box... other than that "thumbs up". we even had a social security lump sum distribution that we were worried about how to do it and turbo tax just fixed it all up like it is supposed to be... no problem..

title: ... used Turbo Tax since 1995 and have never been disappointed.

title: Boo to TurboTax Deluxe
content: Horrible decision for Intuit to dummy down the 2014 Deluxe version of TurboTax. Yes, one can use the "Forms" mode to enter data for Schedule D, but if you had a simple sale of a mutual fund and then use the "Forms" mode, you will NOT be able to e-file your return. However, with the recent reduction in price for the Premier version I figure I'll just bite the bullet and purchase the upgrade (Premier) version. I have been using TurboTax for so long that I really don't want to go to another tax program.

title: Four Stars

title: Still a good product, but DON'T BE GREEDY!
content: TurboTax has always been my "go to" for taxes. I am disappointed that you bit the credibility bug this time with your "explanation" for removing some modules from the Deluxe package, such as small business income and expenses (e.g. Schedule C), in which you claimed it was, in some way, for the benefit of your customers. Anyone educated enough to prepare his/her taxes, with or without your application, sees that as hogwash - the change was to force more customers to "buy up" to the more expensive product. Be honest with us, which means "stop letting your marketing division write your script." Disingenuousness will lose me as a customer faster than any other transgression. Yours is still a good product, but next year I will be careful about your choices and may look elsewhere if you keep trying to force me into a more encompassing product I do not need. Use your 2013 product as a template and stay reasonable.

title: TurboTax Deluxe free upgrade to Premium.
content: The surprise change to TT Deluxe this year is not pleasant. However, with the many nasty reviews, TurboTax got the message. They will upgrade you to Premium free at this number 1-800-445-1875 - 8 AM to 8 PM EST. No hassle. You should be at your TT Return - select Federal taxes - Wages & Income - Choose Stocks, Mutual Funds, there will be a link to update to Premium - they will give you a code to enter. If all else fails, H&R Block offers their Deluxe program free if you e-mail them copy of your TurboTax receipt. switchtoblock@hrblock.com

title: Highly Recommended
content: I was concerned with filing taxes since I am an expat working in Afghanistan. I am pleased to report that theTurboTax program more than met my tax needs. This product is highly recommended.

title: Doing my own taxes!!! WOO HOO
content: Every Year Turbo Tax never lets me down. I remember when I was a teenager with my first real job and i had to do my taxes and my dad took me to his accountant and my return was $150 of which 50 the accountant took and I was so upset and vowed to never do that again. I always did my own taxes but as life went on and became more complicated I didn't know all the deductions and benefits to take so I needed an accountant again and would spend upwards of $150 in a good year!!! Thanks to Turbo Tax I have successfully done taxes myself and it is so easy they walk me through everything and when I need help I can poll a great community of other turbo tax users and their own turbo tax helpers (which are great) Thanks Amazon for the great price and Turbo Tax for the GREAT Product.

title: Have the material to backup and complete with confidence.
content: I have used Turbo Tax since...gosh has it been that long? I'll have to dig up my records; practically archeological. Use to do my own, methodically. Considered it a hobby. But then independent contracting, homeschooling, all those extra itemized details that took a great deal of time of which I had less and less to invest. The hobby needed assistance. Trust, but verify. They are your taxes and you in the end will need to stand on your own. As with any computer program remember--garbage in/garbage out. So don't blame the program if you get audited for a bogus claim. Have the material to backup the numbers provided and you'll be able to complete your own taxes with confidence.

title: Turbo Indeed .
content: AWESOME ! The first time I have ever prepared my own ax returns . I file itemized so I did have some reservations about attempting the job . At the recommendation of a family member , I purchased Turbo Tax . In one hour both federal and state returns were completed . Refunds estimated , and returns filed electronically . Nothing could be easier ( if you can read and write ) . There were no computations to perform , nothing more than plugging in required totals in the appropriate fields. Immediately afterwards I ordered another Turbo-Tax to complete my elderly mothers tax returns . Again nothing could have been easier .

title: It always works perfectly!
content: Have used TurboTax for Federal & PA state returns for many tears. Since most forms are for same payers and payees as previous year, most of the work is carried over from the past. And that's one of the best features - namely, the ability to to transfer data from last year's returns to the present year. Also appreciate the TurboTax ability to check for mistakes or misinterpretations, and flag things which are illogical or which could cause problems. I can't foresee anything that would tempt me to leave TurboTax for some competitor of theirs. It makes sense, and it works perfectly for me. And it remembers any carry-overs from previous years.

title: e-filing is no faster
content: I filed my state and federal on 1-22-15 and still do not have my direct deposit from the state of Arizona 2-11-15

title: Two Stars
content: I has to call 4 times to turbo tax to get it to work.

title: Tax returns made easy
content: Easy to use and easy to file. What more do you need?

title: Good Product
content: Good Product

title: Five Stars
content: As expected.

title: Four Stars
content: Easy to use.

title: Kind of confused.
content: Program itself worked fine but when tried to do efile on state it would not work with credit card. Did it last year with no problem. I then went ahead and did the deduction from fed to pay efile cost and was stunned to see the service fee they charged. Have been a turbo tax customer since they first went on line but may look for other option next year. Again, problem worked fine but not at all happy with efile. (Fed worked fine)

title: I still like Turbo Tax Deluxe
content: I still like Turbo Tax Deluxe; however, each year it seems to be harder to use. Quit trying to second guess our decisions and have answers more readily available for those of us who have them. There was a time when it was much more simple and easy to use. Any question I had, Turbo Tax would have the answer, or refer me to a site for help. Now, by trying to streamline the process, it's actually harder to use. Next year, I'll probably shop around to see what other program is available and do a bit of research on them. Other bad publicity hasn't helped the program this year. Good luck in restructuring and getting it right next year.

title: Turbo Tax makes my life so much easier!
content: This software is absolutely the best income tax preparation product available. It is 100% user-friendly, even to an old person such as myself. My CPA brother recommended that I discontinue using H&R Block (who screwed up my taxes two years in a row) and try this. I have been using it since 2005 and it has been great. Along the way, Intuit has made small improvements which have helped identify items for deduction which I hadn't picked up in piror years. They automatically pick up information from last year, so there's no time wasted in filling out social security numbers, addresses, etc. I love it. (I'm not sure of this, but I have a feeling that the IRS know that users of this software are less likely to have errors.)

title: Worked well
content: I have used TurboTax for over 20 years. I have always used the Delux version. Fortunately for me I have no Stocks or Bonds or any other investments. I think you have deleted investments in the Delux version and put them in the Premier version to sell more Premier version copies without raising the price on the Delux version, which is all right by me since I have no investments. The Delux version filled my needs adequately. Since I have never used any other tax program I am unable to compare. However, my brother uses TaxCut which is cheaper and he has extensive investments.

title: Five Stars
content: easy to do, got more back than last year with h&r

title: It's all about Choices!
content: This is a much better product than Taxcut. However, I doubt that it is worth the difference in price. This product is terribly expensive for a DIY tax product and there are also hidden costs involved in filing. Don't get me wrong, Taxcut has them also, but I guess Turbotax must believe since they have a superior product, you should have to pay more to file it which makes it even more expensive. The thing is, I don't have a terribly complicated tax situation; otherwise I wouldn't be using a DIY product because frankly, I'm not that bright and I find most tax stuff about as clear as peace in the Middle East. It's all about choices; paying through the nose to go with the more complete product or much less to schlepp through with the other.

title: One Star
content: Wrong software. Thanks for the advice Turbo Tax!

title: Five Stars

title: Five Stars

title: One Star
