title: When you want the best use Turbo Tax
content: I have used Turbo Tax for many years and it has given me greater returns that those that were prepared by major Tax preparer. Last year I was audited by the IRS and as I had fortunately paid for Turbo Tax representation and they took care of the problem with only a minimum request for a couple items and shortly there after I received a notice from the IRS that they had reviewed the submission and that I did not owe any money and they also thanked me for my information. As far as I am concerned I will never use any other tax preparation other than Turbo Tax and based upon how efficiently they handled the IRS inquiry I will never file my taxes without paying for Turbo Tax representation.

title: I personally HIGHLY recommend using TurboTax for filing your Federal and State Income Tax.
content: I have been using TurboTax since 2011 when the Federal mandated that all IRS Income Tax's be filed electronically. The first time was somewhat hard to use; however, the key to my success, was letting TurboTax walk you through from the beginning to the end. I have progressed to where I just go to the portions and enter the data as I get it. I have always filed my Taxes long hand; however, when I began using TurboTax Deluxe, I found that I had been missing several deductions. By utilizing TurboTax, my refunds have gone up dramitically. The key is to keep all receipts, charitable givings, medical costs, clothing costs, Milage to the doctor's offices, taxes paid on your property and the cost for your vehicle inspections. Last year I filed for my older brother where he use to have to wait for the senior citizens to give him a date to file his. I will also do them for him this year. My neighbors came down and I helped them with filing their taxes this year and got a good income back and they plan on doing the same next year. Up to five different parties can file their Income taxes on 1 years purchase of TurboTax. Also if you have any questions, you can call them. TurboTax even gives you at the end of entering Federal and State's information, the chance of being audited. It notifies you when the Federal gets your submission and when they accept it. You can't go wrong using TurboTax programs. I am very well pleased with their results. And while I'm at it......NO....I'm not being paid or compensated for typing up this review. I highly recommend TurboTax to use in filing your Federal and State returns. Charles in WV.

title: Such a drastic change in features! Edit: Call for resolution
content: I have been using Turbo Tax since the 90s. I have been self employed since '99. I've always counted on Turbo Tax for my preparation and actually made an early purchase this year in preparation for my 2014 return. Shame on me for assuming that the same product I have used for years (Deluxe) for my scenarios of K-1 and 1099s now has those capabilities LOCKED! I know there were other versions of the product (e.g. Home & Biz and Premier) that offered additional guidance, but I did not require those features; I just needed the forms. I can't believe such a drastic change has been made to force me into spending double on a product when history proved that the original product was fully capable of handling my needs. I feel cheated and blackmailed. I think it's time to explore other options! EDIT: I have revised my rating and review due to how Intuit resolved my issue. It seems they have heard our issues and concerns loud and clear and, after calling the number provided here by the Intuit VP 800-445-1875 (8am - 8pm EST M-F), they immediately upgraded me to the version that would best meet my needs. I understand that mistakes happen and, for me, it's all about how someone tries to resolve that mistake. I am very please with the resolution, but certainly hope that Intuit has learned from this mistake and makes sure they don't repeat it next year.

title: Depends on how easy my friend was able to do it on what ...
content: I called with a question. I was put on hold, again, and again. They called me back twice. Transferred me to a consultant and during a 23 minute wait I was disconnected. On my call back I was told my number 452376969 was resolved. NO! I was disconnected. This all started around 5 pm and at approx. 8/8:30 pm I contacted a Natasha J. E. A. who within four minutes or less gave me the answer!!!! Why did she have an immediate answer and the rest of the gentlemen didn't???? That's a LOT of TIME spent on the phone holding and waiting for a call back when the answer was less than a four minute conclusion!!!! Talk about Frustration!!! I actually fixed supper and ate it while trying to get this answer. Can you believe it!!!!! Will I use Turbo Tax again? Actually, I'm looking into using something else. Depends on how easy my friend was able to do it on what she used. I wish you would stop changing things from year to year! 73 year old people don't need this aggravation! And of course, at 73, you can probably trash can my problem...won't be dealing with me for many more years!

title: Don't Throw out the Baby with the Bathwater
content: Sorry I hate those sayings but that one seems to fit at this point. After all the hoopla about the error the company made, I think it is a good idea to take a breath and reflect on (1) the quality of the software and (2) Intuit as a company. After I did, I decided to stay and continue to use TurboTax. 1. The software's quality doesn't seem to be an issue here. Most believe it is an accurate and easy way to file taxes. I was tempted to switch but didn't see the competitor software as a realistic alternative. Given that I've used TurboTax since the first year it was offered, I'm not likely to jump into using a competitor's product out of anger. 2. Intuit did do something surprising and upsetting here, but it certainly appears that they have realized their mistake and completely fixed it. How many companies admit their error and then reverse their decisions? I don't remember any previous issues, so I'm not sure why this is their second strike. Sure, I'd like the pricing to stay the same, but as I expect salary increases each year, I also expect others to do so as well in the form of higher prices for some products. I see that isn't the issue, though. It's one of trusting the company after they tried to change the product names. I agree that they pulled a serious mistake and they have already admitted that and offered to reset everything for this year as well as future years. I don't know what else they can do to make people feel better. I'm guessing those who are responsible for this will be penalized, and the corporate world most often relieves them of duty. Who will remain? Those who had nothing to do with this decision, and who probably disagreed with the direction of things. There are lots of user-oriented people at Intuit, and their interface is quite polished. I'm not sure it's the best idea to jump ship to what others have said to be an inferior product (but I do not have experience with it). We have actually benefited from this problem, as the pricing has not increased. Intuit has already suffered greatly from this debacle, but I don't think it's necessary to take out our vitriol on every employee in the firm. It's also short-sighted if the competitor's product is not as good. Some manager or committee made a stupid decision, and I'm sure they are already either gone or marginalized. I don't feel the need to punish the entire company because of one bone-headed leader who is probably already gone (hopefully). So I'm sticking with TurboTax, as it has served me so well over the last few decades. Ok, Intuit, you're on notice to keep things (1) clear and straightforward and (2) working well.

title: Intuit's Official Position
content: Here's Intuit's official message to their former customers... Dear So and So, We messed up. We made a change this year to TurboTax desktop software and we didn't do enough to communicate this change to you as proactively and broadly as we could or should have. I am very sorry for the anger and frustration we may have caused you. Intuit has a long history of doing right by our customers, and in this instance, we did not live up to the standards of excellence you have come to expect from us. We did not handle this change in a manner that respected our loyal customers and we owe you an explanation of what we are doing to make it right. The change we made to our desktop products, both the download and CD versions, includes removing Schedules C, D, E and F from TurboTax Deluxe, which some long-time customers had relied on to report business income, investment sales and rental property income. As a result, you may now be required to upgrade the version of TurboTax you use even though your tax situation hasn't changed from last year. Here's why we made the change. Over the years, we have worked hard to make it easy for you to choose the TurboTax product that is right for you and your unique tax situation. We want that choice to be clear and confidence inspiring. However, as new online and mobile technologies emerged, our products, and the tax scope and features they included, began to differ, leading to customer confusion. These differences also impeded our ability to introduce new innovations across our entire product line. So this year, we made the product experience consistent across all TurboTax offerings. This change enables us to innovate faster and make improvements that benefit all customers at the same time, regardless of whether they use our online or desktop software. You can be sure that we've preserved what's unique to our desktop product: the ability to e-file up to five returns, switch to forms mode and install the software on multiple computers. Find the TurboTax product that's right for you. But good intent must be matched with great execution, and that is where we let you down. We have heard from many of you that you were surprised when you discovered the change. No one likes this kind of a surprise, so we are taking immediate action to make things right and help you through this transition year. We are giving $25 back if you purchased TurboTax Deluxe desktop software (CD or download) and filed your 2013 tax return and have to upgrade to TurboTax Premier or Home & Business to file your 2014 return. This will help you move to the right desktop product, while reducing the immediate and unexpected financial impact. After completing and filing your return this year, request your $25 here. I deeply regret the anger and distress we have caused those of you affected by this change. Our customers are the heartbeat of every TurboTax employee. Our hope is that we can regain your trust and demonstrate that our commitment to you has never been stronger. Sincerely, Sasan Goodarzi and the TurboTax Team General Manager, Intuit TurboTax

title: Easy Tax Returns
content: Turbo Tax is the easiest, most cost-effective means of filing taxes that I have tried. It transfers previous years' information (if you used Turbo Tax last year) and builds on it to complete the current return. The program walks you through, step by step, and helps you determine what deductions are applicable to your return, and lets you know when a standard deduction would be to your advantage. If you get interrupted, you can easily pick up where you left off or backtrack to make corrections. Electronic filing of federal taxes is included at no charge. Now, if someone could persuade California to stop gouging $20 to accept E-filing, (something that I'm sure saves the state as much time and money as it does the taxpayer) the process would be that much better.

title: We have been using TurboTax for several years and have ...
content: We have been using TurboTax for several years and have found it to be self explanatory and simple to use. The response time from TurboTax e-filing to the State and Feds is incredibly fast. We filed early this year (in January) and within 24 hours we received a message that our returns had been approved by the State and the Feds. Three weeks later we had our tax returns which is unheard of. Would advise any user to have all their information organized in categories which makes it easer to enter all the required information and much less frustrating. In another respect, TurboTax is especially helpful when it comes to providing acceptable deductible amounts for non-cash charitable donations, such as Goodwill, books donated to the library, etc. TurboTax also gives you some idea if your returns might result in auditing. Would definitely rate it in the 5 star category. What more can I say?

title: Satisfied user
content: I have been a TurboTax user since 2006 and have been very satisfied. I have used both the Deluxe and Premier editions. In recent years I have used the Premier edition so the changes will not have an impact on me. I have found it to very user friendly and accurate. I have found the on-line customer support page to be helpful when I am unsure about any issue. One of the features that I have found to be especially helpful is "ItsDeductible" software on the WEB. It allows me to put in all of my deductible contributions and then download the info to TurboTax. I have been very satisfied and will continue to use the TurboTax software.

title: Great way to get your taxes done
content: Great way to do your taxes. I purchased my copy on February 1st, did my taxes on February 2nd, and got my refund on February 11th. All I had to do was transfer my 2013 taxes from my saved 2013 turbo tax record, used the down load feature to get my w2 information, enter some additional information (mortgage, property taxes, etc.) and in about an hour I was finished. It costs 50 dollars for the software and an additional 20 dollars to e-file the state taxes (federal is free) but the time saved easily covers the cost. I have been using Turbo Tax for more than 10 years and have never been audited and with the exception of one error on my part never had any tax issues.

title: If you can read and use a computer using TurboTax allows you to do your income taxes in a simple easy to use format
content: Anyone paying a firm or individual to prepare their taxes is wasting their money, that is if the charge is greater than $65 - $75. If you can read and use a computer using TurboTax allows you to do your income taxes in a simple easy to use format. It allows you do do your taxes over a period of time and allows you to modify your return, as long as you do it before filing, if you locate additional deductions. I cannot more highly recommend TurboTax. The only negative I can think of is that TurboTax does not include free filing for state returns.

title: We have a great appreciation for the quality of TurboTax and have confidence ...

We believe TurboTax can certainly be used by inexperienced persons and others who have completed their personal taxes over the years. The product will guide you through the various elements of income, investment, rental properties, tax deductible elements and other miscellaneous required Income Tax items. We have a great appreciation for the quality of TurboTax and have confidence in submitting a properly completed Income Tax submission. Thank You! H. Frank Rayne

title: lack of clear help
content: I've used Turbo Tax for years and have never had any issues until this year. For me completing the returns was simple enough but i ran into problems when I tried to file my state return. I e-file the federal but mail my state return. Since I owe the state money and have to mail it in anyway i see no reason to pay $19.95 to e-file. When I tried to print out my state return the program wouldn't let me. My biggest issue with this years version was the help page and the lack of communication with customers on the part of Turbo Tax. The help page takes you to comments made by other customers and it was tedious at best to try to find an answer to my problem. Calling their toll free number wasn't any help either. Finally after several trips to the help page i found out the reason for my problems with the state returns is that the forms haven't been given final approval by the state(Ohio). This person posted that a list of states that had yet to approve the forms. This information could have and should have been provided when I downloaded the state program. Couple this with their changes in the Deluxe version that blind sided long time users i think they need to examine their communications with customers and revise their help procedures.

title: Turbo Tax still works for us!
content: Even though I have happily used TT for several years- I was taken in by all the hoopla surrounding the changes in their packages. It didn't make a hoot of difference to us- but I empathized with all those who felt cheated and duped. So- I bought the H&R Block software in support. The software was fairly easy- a user friendly approach like TT. But, a questionable result had me wondering if I should have stayed with TT. So- I bit the bullet and bought TT afterall. There must have been some tax changes- because I came up with a very similar outcome. All that to say- that I've used both and find TT the better of the two. It was more user friendly- the questions were worded better- and the index was helpful so that I could skip areas that I didn't need to input. We only needed the schedule A and all the deduction finders... but can still understand why so many were upset. However, for us- TT did the job well, with little fuss and will still be our tax software of choice.

We originally decided to give TurboTax a try after our tax prep person told me one day after having done my returns for nearly 10yrs that she had been preparing our returns using TurboTax for years. And let me add, we had paid her approx. $350.00 annually for her to prepare our taxes but had no idea she was using TurboTax which we bought the next year for around $48. Thanks TurboTax.

title: Internet Sale Tax 1099 G
content: The 1099 G section is a little misleading when it relates to state income tax refund. For the state of Virginia, my state refund was reduced for sales taxes associated with internet purchases above $100. Turbox tax made the adjustment in the state return . When I filed for tax year 2014, Turbox taxed asked what was my "actual state tax refund received". Turbox tax should not let the user enter any other amount for state tax refund other than that claimed on the federal return that generates a benefit that reduces federal taxes. Turbox tax let me change the amount, and when my 1099 G did finally arrive, it was for the gross amount and not the amount actually received. Now this requires an amended federal return since I got the benefit (on my federal return) of the gross amount as a deduction. Otherwise, everything was great.

So, I didn't need any of the special forms that are in the pricier upgrade. If one is just a plain, ordinary home-owning tax-payer with no special situations, then the product works. As an added bonus, I spent only $20 to e-file my state tax form; this cost me over $30 last year.

title: Choosing version of software is frustrating, but support is good
content: So, I saw all the warnings and I went to their website. I did their little quiz on what applies to you... they said buy deluxe. Bought deluxe, downloaded deluxe. Already paid $10 (25%) more than last year for the deluxe. Turns out selling a home is an investment (Sch. D). So now they want me to upgrade for $30, only it's not working. And that's significantly more than the price difference here (currently 52% more cost to upgrade via them than the price difference between premier and deluxe on here.) Update: Upon reflection and researching this issue: I don't need the now recommended upgrade for the sale of the home. I didn't make enough "profit" (250k single, 500k married) to make it taxable, but they wanted me to upgrade so that I could enter the information then not submit it anyway... which would have charged me extra to tell me that they didn't really need to charge me extra after all. 2nd Update: Due to extremely good customer service response, I'm upgrading my rating to 4*. I think there is a better way to do the upgrades, but since they are being proactive with support and follow-ups, it's not a completely bad situation. The product has flaws, but they are actively trying to handle the issues.

title: Intuit caved! Expect Free Upgrade To Premium or Free H&R Block. Amazon Gift Card Deal Gives TurboTax a Good Advantage.
content: EDIT: *** Intuit recently announced that they're caving and just offering every returning Deluxe customer a free upgrade, then reintroducing the old included features for next year. However, the deal isn't active as of the date of this edit. H&R Block has also offered to give you their competing software for FREE with proof of TurboTax Deluxe purchase. Google "SwitchToBlock" for detail. *** Many people are (understandably) upset that Intuit removed features from Deluxe for certain schedule C and D filers. I agree that was a bad move, but in Intuit's defense, they offer a $25 refund for a $30 upgrade to Premium for Deluxe buyers who used Deluxe last year if you call 800-445-1875 and explain your situation. Also, it's a better deal than people are giving it credit for, plus support is America-based and actually pretty helpful (I'll explain my experience with them below). At present, the Deluxe with Fed + State is $38, BUT you're eligible to receive a 10% bonus on every $100 you apply to an Amazon gift card (up to $10,000 of gift cards). That means that if you shop on Amazon a lot, or want to buy a TV with your refund or something, then all you have to do is use $400 of your refund on Amazon gift cards and this software pays for itself. Many are suggesting switching to H&R Block Tax Cut, but just be aware that they don't have the same deal with Amazon gift cards so there may be a financial trade-off with the decision if you're a frequent Amazon shopper. That said, H&R Block DOES have a 10% gift card bonus program for 40 vendors like Target and Best Buy, so they're still a good alternative to consider if you frequent H&R Block's participating stores. As far as TurboTax support goes, they were great to me! I accidentally bought the version of this without state (big mistake on my part because Intuit will normally charge you $40 to buy the a la carte state download). At first I was frustrated because I didn't realize what I was buying (or that they even made a version without state), but: 1. They apparently have a 60-day money back guarantee where they'll send you a refund if you send them your purchase confirmation. -and- 2. I thought that would be a pain because of all the bureaucracy, delay and snail-mail involved, so I called support and they were nice enough to let me buy my state for only $9, which was the price difference between what I mistakenly bought and what I meant to buy. In short, I understand many reviewers' frustration, but it seems like Intuit really is trying to take care of their customers, so I thought I'd try to give them a little love in light of all the negative reviews.

content: A few years back I took the forms I got from my CPA (who said she could not e-file them), used the forms to fill in a TurboTax return which I was able to e-file myself, and saved a couple of hundred dollars on tax preparation in the process. I've never looked back. I expect Deluxe will work for me this year. If not, I'll upgrade to Premier. Compared to the amount of money I was being 'gouged' for by a CPA, changing over to TurboTax was a dream come true. Getting charged an extra 20 bucks for an upgrade? It's nothing compared to the expense and inconvenience of dealing with a CPA. I purchase my Turbotax software from Amazon. I had to upgrade one time previously in the past. Amazon support worked with me and I easily upgraded the product. Disclaimer - I'm just an old retired guy who has no connection to either TurboTax or Amazon. I just like the products and services.

content: The changes to the products made this year did not effect me. So, I went ahead and stuck with Turbo Tax since it has always been easy to use and consistent (for me) from year to year. It worked. I got a good return and I am not worried about getting audited. All in all, I got what I expected. I will however have to re-evaluate my options in the future when my tax situation changes. I gave it 3 stars because I think the way they bill for states is exorbitant. I live in one state and work in another so this means I have to file in both states (not all states are this way but mine is). I paid more to add an additional state than I did for the whole tax suite in the first place. For me, it makes this product go from "5 stars, great deal" to "slightly more convenient than hiring a CPA".

title: Here it is ...
content: Here it is ... I'm giving 4 stars because I have not actually filed my return yet. I nearly purchased the Deluxe product. Then before I made the purchase, I read the reviews here, and I was extremely disappointed in the lack of support for Schedules C and D in TurboTax Deluxe this year, which by the way, I have used every year for the last 5 years without fanfare. This nearly caused me to purchase the H&R Block software. But I called Intuit and they gave me a nice discount on TurboTax Home & Business, which by the way, is the version you need if you are self-employed and you sell stocks from time to time. The Deluxe version was sufficient for that purpose in years past, but apparently not anymore. Yes, you can fill out the forms for Schedule C and D manually and then mail your return with Deluxe, but why would I need software to do that? Preposterous! The discount I received keeps me with TurboTax for another year, and I will wait and see what the fall-out is from this new pricing of their products, with fewer features in the Deluxe version. I am keeping my fingers crossed that Intuit does the right thing soon, and heeds the customer complaints.

content: Update 2/6/2015 - I was able to upgrade to Premier for free. Just click on the upgrade in the menu of the main program... instead of paying xxx$, it is free.... When I explained the issue to them, the just pushed me off to 'talk to a tax advisor' - sorry I will not pay a fee for Block's faulty software. The cs rep just ended the chat. So, I reentered my data into TurboTax. It was a breeze. And, not having issues with my returns just made me happy again. I will say the I liked the walk through of the questions much better on TTax than on HRB. Visually, the screens are also 'softer/cleaner".

title: Turbo Tax is the best!
content: I absolutely prefer Turbo Tax over H&R Block software. The software is much clearer to use and the prompts are very helpful. I was upset that Intuit decided to exclude schedules C and D this year and so had purchased H&R Block's software. H&R Block had more difficulty with my minister's housing allowance so I relented and purchased Turbo Tax 2014. It handled my housing allowance just fine as it has all the past years I've used it. I don't use schedules C or D so that feature removal didn't impact me. I definitely prefer and recommend Turbo Tax over H&R Block. I haven't used Taxcut so I can't speak to it. An Addendum: I've been a minister for some 30 years and have always done my taxes and have never been audited, knock on wood. Because of this I have tried to stay on top of tax filing requirements for ministers. As any minister knows filing taxes as a minister is pretty complex and requires a multitude of forms and actions that many ministers cannot follow, that a non-minister cannot understand, and that many tax professionals have difficulty with, if one is to satisfy IRS requirements which is a moving target. I offered a synopsis of my experience with H&R Block's software versus Turbo Tax. I did not list every detail for brevity and because I'm not going to put all "my business on the street". My opinion, subjective by definition, is that Turbo Tax does a better job of handling all the ins and outs of a minister's return and does it more smoothly with better explanations. Take it for what it's worth. It's but one man's opinion.

title: Turbo Tax Still Rules
content: Despite the negative reviews posted regarding the attempt by TT to get more $$ for the same services previously provided, I just purchased it again. And I have to say...So? What's your point? Every single company is in business to make $$...why disparage a company for doing what its goal is? Do you believe the company you work for doesn't want to increase its own revenues, and isn't trying every day to figure out a way to do that? I've used TT ever since I can remember, and OMG, it has made the chore of doing our taxes incredibly easy!! I am sure they have had some price increases in the past 10 years, but I can't remember any recently. The other point the critics use is that they tried to get people to buy their more expensive product. Again, no different than ANY OTHER business. When you're buying anything from replacement windows to landscaping to a trip to Disney World, all the good salesmen try to get you to upgrade (i.e., spend MORE money) from their lower-priced items. Hasn't anyone noticed the sneaky way food companies (I won't name any names, but if you shop for groceries you've noticed who they are) reduce the amount of product in their packages, but charge the same price they did for the previous-sized products? The fact that the VP of Turbo Tax has issued numerous apologies, AND is recompensing its customers if they purchased the more expensive version, is amazing to me. I could write a book the length of War and Peace on the number of companies who NEVER EVEN RESPONDED to an email or letter mailed I DIRECTLY to their Customer Service Departments, or, in some cases, their company President or VP. I commend Turbo Tax for admitting their mistakes, and rectifying them as best they can. TT is still the best tax-preparation software out there. (I can say that with firm conviction, because I work with several CPAs who prepare personal and corporate taxes for a living, and they all recommended TT to me years ago, and still use it themselves. I have never regretted their recommendation.)

title: Email from Intuit
content: I think Intuit did the right thing here. I'm glad they stepped up to the plate and are trying to appease customers! -------------------- We recently tried to explain the changes made to our TurboTax desktop software and apologized for the impact it had on you. Many responded and let us know our apology and rationale were not acceptable. You want the TurboTax desktop product (CD or download) you've used in the past to do what it has always doneâhandle your tax situation. We heard you. It's time we make it right. Beginning February 7, 2015, you can buy the same product you'd normally buy, and if you need to upgrade for your tax situation, we'll help you do that at no additional cost. This means you'll get all the forms you need, including Schedules C, D E, and F, without paying anything extra. Learn more. If you're a returning TurboTax Deluxe CD or download customer and you've already filed using TurboTax Premier or TurboTax Home & Business, we're offering you $25 cash back. Simply visit TurboTax.com/25back to claim your money. Next, we are committed to bringing back the product you know and love. By the time you are ready to prepare and file your taxes next year, the TurboTax desktop product you trusted in the past will include the forms you've counted on for years. I understand our actions have caused anger and frustration, and our response has been far too slow. TurboTax is committed to regaining your trust and providing you with the level of excellence you have come to expect. Thank you for your feedback and continued loyalty, Sasan Goodarzi and the TurboTax Team General Manager, Intuit TurboTax

title: ...forced to Premier, but still the best bang for the buck
content: To be honest I don't like the price hike by forcing you to buy higher level package to get same results. I have been using TT since the early 90s. TT Deluxe has been ~$45 dollars for at least 5 years on Amazon. What other software can you say has had no other increases in that time? Its just like a candy bar or coffee. Do you charge more for the same size or reduce the size. Have you purchased one of those 13 oz. pounds of coffee lately. I wish they had kept the features the same and added $5 dollars and most would understand. But to have to go to Premier for a $30 increase in one year is a lot. I knows the laws on Sch C, D, and E are getting more complicated every year and they got to pay for those greedy IT staffers (I was one for 40 years) but $30 at once is a bunch. Until TaxAct has a Mac version, this is the best thing going on a Mac.

title: Another excellent version of the benchmark for tax software.
content: Once again TurboTax has delivered a high quality, well engineered product. Menus and choices are well thought out. It doesn't matter if this is your first time doing your taxes or your 50th, it will make the process quick and easy. Once in the past I questioned the accuracy of the calculations and took my information to a competitor's office to double check - the process took longer, cost more, and, contrary to their popular claim, did not get me one penny more. That was a lesson learned. I have never had any problems with the software, and if I have had a question the help files answered all of my needs. It's like having a personal CPA at your disposal if you need it (which I have heard they supply at higher software levels, but my basic tax needs have never needed this support) This is the software everyone else strives to be (or use on their own systems)

title: I have used turbo tax forever and love it. My situation changes from year to year ...

Stock sales, dual states, royalties, moving, charities, education expenses are handled seamlessly with turbotax deluxe. I have never had a problem. It gets easier every year.

title: Intuit stood by its commitment after reaching out to them!
content: After having rendered an initial negative review on the loss of Schedule D functionality, I reached out as directed to the Customer Satisfaction Advocate VP Bob Meighan and as promised, he was able to satisfy my needs following my initial purchase. I have been a loyal customer since 1990. I understand that there may be corporate needs for change, but change can be hard to accept, especially when neither anticipated nor solicited. So my satisfaction continues on at least until next year. I hope that some adjustments could be made such as restoring the features of the original Deluxe product for perhaps a reasonable fee increase. For that matter, Deluxe and Premium could be merged into one and dropping some of the lesser utilized features of Premier, such as free phone consultation. Also, limitations of functionality for schedule C or miscellaneous business income previously available in Deluxe but not even available in Premier should also be restored as this seems generally more useful for income outside the usual employee relationship. I've always been extremely satisfied with the TurboTax product that I understood I was getting. In its zeal to appeal to some customers for a consistent product across multiple platforms, the basic consistency of its main product was potentially compromised. Mr Meighan quite satisfactorily handled that problem. I'm hopeful the larger problem will be resolved for next year. I'm willing to renew my commitment to Turbotax.

title: 2014 Turbotax Deluxe with State
content: Wow!!! I have been a very pleased Turbotax customer for 10 plus years... After reading a large number of the reviews rated as a "1," I called Turbotax to ask them if Turbotax Deluxe with State was "still" the right product for me. The Turbotax Representative was a delight to speak with. She spent nearly 30 to 40 mins explaining why they had made the change and reviewed my past use of this product. After reviewing my needs it's clear this is still the right product for my paticular tax requirements. I do not own or run a business from my home which appears to be the issue with those that are having an issue. I will buy the Turbotax Deluxe with State Product...and will report back with my findings. Paticulars, I'm retired military and now a Federal Government Employee, homeowner..and as I said before I have no business income to report. For now I will leave Turbotax a "5" rating for how their representative provided me with excellent service.

title: Beats filing by filling out by hand!
content: I know there are alot of unhappy customers out there, I am not one of them. I read product descriptions before I buy things, and this year for me was cheaper than last year. I do a simple MFJ filing for my wife and I. This edition worked better than last year's. Had no technical issues or hiccups. I chose the download copy, which worked without me having to struggle to get it to work. I was able to do our taxes in under an hour, state and federal. Although, you do have to pay to use the program to use it to file state taxes ($20). I compare this service to paying a "tax prep professional" to do my taxes in terms of value. When I look at it this way, I come out ahead. If you are looking for real value and savings, your best bet is to take a few courses on tax prep. Other option is to read the product description, which I found greatly helpful.

title: Some reasons to stay with TurboTax
content: Yes, TurboTax has made a big mistake deleting some important features from the Deluxe version. Fortunately I don't need those features so I am still very happy with TurboTax. Since H&R Block is offering a free download for those who are unhappy I decided to give it a try. In my opinion it is not as user friendly as TurboTax. If you just need to fill out a few forms it is a real mess essentially requiring you to go through the step by step process. Even with that process it is not friendly. Two examples: 1) if you have more than 3 real estate tax payments to include you either have to add them up manually or go to the full (not mini) form in order to list the items/amounts for a total. 2) If you have several sources of medical premiums to include its the same deal, add manually or go to the full form to list all items. Not a big deal but if you are used to TurboTax you will quickly be frustrated with H&R Block.

title: They've heard you and are taking meaningful action - They are motivated to make things right, at least this year!!!
content: Very long time user as well. Had not purchased this year as of yet. Have used Home and Business, Premier, and Deluxe in the past due to rental property, self-employment and cap. gains. Was able to use Deluxe in recent times and was alarmed by what many of you were experiencing. I did reach out to Bob Meighan, VP TurboTax, and he is offering a satisfactory solution for at least this tax year. I'll take it rather than take a shot with H & R. Don't want to cut off my nose to spite my face. I just hope that your reviews force TurboTax to rectify this problem for 2015 and beyond. If not, H & R Block, EA's, and CPA's will be smiling to the bank... By the way, I don't work for TurboTax nor have any interest other than to get my taxes done accurately this year at a reasonable cost. Don't kill the messenger!!!

title: Works for Me, Year After Year!
content: As a TurboTax and Quicken user since the days of floppy disks, I would like to offer my opinion of this year's TurboTax program, and all the negative comments. Over the years, my tax situation has varied widely, from paying BIG money for an accountant to be sure that I had filed everything correctly, to years where my situation was simple enough to be able to file the short form. The first year I tried TurboTax, I ran the program parallel to and in addition to having my taxes prepared by a certified tax CPA. That was very educational. This was before such a thing as E-File. The forms that each generated were equally professional, the figures functionally identical, but the tax preparation costs were wildly different. Since then, I have used TurboTax exclusively, and will use it again this year, assured that it will do the job efficiently and inexpensively, at around 20% of the cost of a CPA. Over the years I have, of course, seen the program evolve and change in a myriad of ways. I believe that the human interface has improved, the "interview" process become more inclusive, and the overall design has improved almost every year. I have also seen the cost of the program vary due to special offers, rebates, coupons, and plain price changes. No matter what, though, I have always considered it a bargain. This year's TT installed flawlessly, updated itself on the first boot, and, with my permission, found and imported last year's information to reduce the amount of repetitive form filling. I began the "interview" process to plug in some preliminary data to get some estimates, and was pleased to see that it would still allow me to create multiple returns to allow me to test various scenarios before the receipt of my EOY statements. I expect that the program will serve its purpose again this year with a minimum of fuss and trouble based on my past and present experience. I see that many people have chosen to post a negative review because of the decision to change that capability of the program regarding stock transactions. Apparently, they consider it an unfair reduction of functionality and choose to condemn the whole program because of this one change. They speak as if someone took something away from them that they somehow expected or deserved. But, by its nature, TurboTax is a single purpose, one time use program. It does your taxes for the current tax year, and then it is ostensibly useless. It's implied that if you want to use it next year, you have to buy the new model. This year, the manufacturer has chosen to re-align the features available in that new model. Car manufacturers change their list of "standard equipment" annually. MS Office drops and adds features constantly. This is not as if your copy of Office suddenly stopped opening spreadsheets without warning. Your car is worn out. You used it up. Now you have to go into the showroom and shop this year's offerings. If the fact that they dropped the "standard" back up camera and made it optional is a deal breaker, then you have other choices. They may or may not be better than the new model of the car you are already comfortably familiar with sans back up camera. You need to decide, but the change in this one feature doesn't make the whole car a pile of crap. In any event, TurboTax works perfectly for me, and has done year after year. I expect that it will do so again this year. It has saved me thousands of dollars in CPA fees and surely saved my sanity trying to decipher the obscure tax laws and annual changes. Do I WANT to spend more for a feature that used to be included and is now an option? Of course not; no one does. But, WOULD I? Without a doubt, because the functionality, accuracy, and familiarity are worth it to me.

title: I have been a satisfied TurboTax user for many years

It is a matter of learning. TurboTax has always been helpful whenever I have had a problem, especially Bob Meighan, their Turbotax VP. I will continue to be a TurboTax user, and if it costs a few more dollars than the previous year, it is still a bargain. Try doing your taxes without a tax program, and you will soon find out. The TurboTax program may not be perfect but nevertheless is a very good tax preparation program.

title: My Concerns Were Answered
content: Read the reviews on this site before purchasing. I have used TurboTax for over 15 years, and find it to be an excellent product every year. I buy and sell stocks each year, and was concerned about the change this year requiring TurboTax Premier instead of Deluxe to include stock sales as part of the interview process. Bob Meighan (VP, TurboTax), who posted an open review for this product, was extremely helpful and attentive in explaining Intuit's reasoning for their decision. He turned my doubts around. I am a recently retired software and systems engineer. While employed, I would often hold my perception of TurboTax software model up as an example for my aerospace employer to follow. I believe TurboTax continues to provide exemplary products.

title: easy to follow and complete forms
content: Item arrived in a timely manner, securely packaged. I have used this product since 2006. Very user-friendly, easy to follow and complete forms. Data can be brought forward from the prior year. Very nifty features such as error checking and estimating your risk of an audit. E-filing is included.

title: Completely Satisfied
content: Good value, perfect for routine use. I've used TurboTax for a dozen years, including for light business, rental property, and now just for homeowner use, so no disappointments for me... I knew what to expect and received it, with state return, downloaded for best value and fastest purchase. Completed first draft immediately and can now better strategize when to file and how to structure taxes for coming year. Would recommend, and I knew the changes were coming for this version - plenty of notice and warning was provided, so I planned to adjust accordingly, no drama.

title: Still a good deal
content: I have used Turbotax for decades. While I don't accept the stated reasons for the new 2014 packaging (such as transparency), the base price has been relatively stagnant, and it remains a good value, particularly considering the upgrades that have been made over the years. The market will decide, of course, but I haven't found that other platforms work as well for me, so I am sticking with it. I purchased my Turbotax directly from Intuit, and I complained bitterly about this year's change. The Turbotax Advocate worked with me on upgrading to Premier to cushion the price shock for this year. Next year I will purchase Premier.

title: He is super responsive and very understanding and demonstrates the fact that ...
content: I have been a Turbo Tax customer for about 10 years. I have always used Turbo Tax Deluxe with State. The main reason I have used the deluxe addition is because just about every year I had to file Schedule D. Over the years there have been several issues I have encountered, including the time when they were planning to limit the number of returns per software unit, or a few years ago when one of the fields on one of the forms would not allow an amount above a certain number, and of course this year with the schedule D issue. What I found was that Turbo Tax is very receptive to their customers and with a little bit of patience and conversation all my issue were resolved. The limit on e-filing went away, the field limitation was fixed in one of their updates and my personal issue with schedule D has been resolved. I encourage anyone with a specific issue to email Bob as he requests. He is super responsive and very understanding and demonstrates the fact that Turbo Tax does, indeed, give ear to their loyal customers.

title: Great Product and worth the Price
content: Ive used this software for at least 12 years and I am very happy with the product. All the information I need is imported from Quicken without a problem. I don't trade in stocks so I don't need a Schedule D and it does handle my Schedule C because I have less than $100 in expenses . I paid $39.99 for the product (with Amazon Prime) and have done so for the last 5 years. Even if I need to file Schedule D it would only cost $54.99 (also with Prime). For those of you who actually bought the program and are still not happy, H&R Block has a special offer: http://www.forbes.com/sites/kellyphillipserb/2015/01/08/tax-software-wars-heat-up-as-turbotax-makes-a-change/

title: Great for home owner with limited deductions

For e.g. the various tie ups they have with financial institutions & corporations and the automatic input of data is amazing. Another feature I like is that after I have submitted my info, I get indication right away whether or not the IRS has accepted my tax documents.

title: Still a great product!

Would recommend Turbo Tax, as always, but ask questions if you have concerns about what the software can and can't do before buying a particular version.

I don't know what I will do in the next tax season, but for this 2014 tax year I will be using TT. Why? Because I was given a FREE UPGRADE to Home and Business. I would encourage those who have purchased the Deluxe and need the missing schedules to call their hotline. The representative was very courteous and help full. In a matter of about 5 mins, everything was completed. The only thing they needed was proof that I purchased the product, and that was confirmed by my registration.

And as promised Bob sent me a link to download TurboTax Premier and excellent instructions for installing the new software. In less than 10 minutes I was up and running the Premier, I then quickly imported my prior year data. Definitely recommend contacting Bob -- he was most helpful.

Even my in-laws who both had careers in the financial world, have upped their game & stopped doing taxes by hand. Every time I've had a question, its been addressed in the forums or via the Chat feature. I was shocked, since one late evening I was able to get support the second I needed it. Folks should stop giving away a portion of their refund to people who are using the same kind of automated tools. Use the automated tool yourself. IT'S EASY!

TurboTax Deluxe is still the easiest to use program on the market and I always feel that my taxes are completed giving me the best possible return. Its simply not worth my time and rustration to change product platforms to another tax program. Also, my previous experience with strip mall tax providers has been less than effective. I will continue to use TurboTax as its the best option, and may even upgrade to premium just to keep the process simple and fast.

title: Staying with TurboTax 2014
content: I have been a TurboTax user for more than 15 years, and have always appreciated the ease with which I could complete my relatively complex return. As I went to pre-order the 2014 version, I quickly realized there were changes from last year, and the Basic version I had purchased for so many years would no longer meet my needs. I took up Bob Meighan's offer to respond to individual emails for clarification. Bob, the VP of TurboTax, went above and beyond to respond quickly to my questions, and recommend the appropriate version for my situation. I am now up and running with the Home and Business version in time for year end tax planning. The installation went smoothly, and the data transfer from last year works the same as it always has. The format is very similar to prior years, and I certainly don't want to learn another software package after so many years of familiarity with TurboTax. (And the cost is still a fraction of what it would cost for a tax preparer.)

I will always use TurboTax from now on. It is user friendly, fast, and I'm always sure that my taxes are done right.

Hopefully TurboTax will change their product features back into Deluxe for next year, but for this year I can confirm that TurboTax is not being a Grinch!

title: Please call 1-800-445-1875 for free upgrade to Turbo Tax Premier.
content: If you bought Turbo Tax Deluxe 2014 and found that it won't support IRS form D for investment income and get upset as I did. Please call Intuit 1-800-445-1875. Intuit will give you a free upgrade to Premier. If you already paid for the upgrade, Intuit will give you refund. After Intuit saw the revolt generated from thousands unhappy and angry customers, Intuit understands that they really taking advantage of their customers and trying to restore their name. I used Turbo Tax Deluxe since 2006 and was really upset about the sneaky way of gauging $30 from me. I just called and get the refund and feel better. I gave it a one-star at Costco review. I thought people bought the Turbo Tax Deluxe should call and get the free upgrade. I like Turbo Tax, but there are others like H&R Block Deluxe and TaxAct Deluxe to be considered next year.

title: Homeowner like me and don't own a business and require Schedule ...
content: I read the negative reviews on Amazon about this product. OK. If you're John Q. Homeowner like me and don't own a business and require Schedule C, this version may still work for you just fine. I have been a loyal TurboTax User for the last 10 years, and I loved the program. Because of the negative reviews, I bought the H & R Block Deluxe Version. From the reviews, it supposedly imports TurboTax Data. However, I did not find that to be true and each time I asked it to import, it came back with a message that it could not find it. I also did not like or feel comfortable with the interface.... maybe that's just me as a TB Tax user of 10 years. So, I bought the TurboTax 2014 Deluxe Version. No problem at all finding last year's Turbo Tax Data and I'm humming along seamlessly doing my taxes as always and don't need Schedule C. So yes. If you need schedule C, this version is not for you. And I gave the program 4 stars instead of 5 for this reason that Intuit took something away that was always there out of respect for all the dissatisfied loyal users. I think I would be mad if I needed C myself, but it doesn't apply to me.

title: Still my favorite tax program
content: I have been using Turbo Tax for many years. It helps me find all my income and deductions, and it is easy to work with. It offers either a fully guided format, but also allows you to enter the program at any point to review, make additions, or correct entries. IRS approved deductible values are provided for all your non-cash contributions, charitable and medical mileage. You are required to provide the official street address for all charities you donate to, and I would recommend that you have proof of every donation and any milage claimed.

content: too funny seeing all the one stars because of the new limitations on Deluxe. So they all arrived at 1 star because of this? If I want something reviewed I don't care about just one issue AND an issue that has nothing to do with how well it performs. You people are a joke and not 1 in 10 is going to H&R Blocks software next year. Now for the review. I've tried around 4 different tax prep softwares since the mid 90's. I settled on TT and have been using it for 15 years. It gets better and better. They allow you to create multiple returns and convert them to PDF's. The feature that lets you work on sections yourself instead of using the guide is great. It used to be if you resumed working on your return at a different time you had to click through pages and pages of interview. BTW in 15 years I've never had an error in a return that was caused by TT and I've prepared hundreds. Can't say enough great things about this product.

content: I have been using TurboTax software since 2011 (2010 Tax Return) and I could not be any happier. I will never return to H&R Block or any other tax preparation retailer again!! I am in control of how I do my taxes, not any atrocious tax preparing moron!! Let me say again, H&R Block NO MORE!! And hello TurboTax. A great thank you to the developers of this excellent software that even costs less than H&R Block (from my experience by the way). I wish I can give these guys a contribution or tip, or rather six or seven stars out of this review, because my added piece of mind is no longer with any tax preparation place, including stupid H&R Block which may be good for computer illiterate taxpayers, but no longer for me. Not that I want to put H&R Block out of business, but H&R Block, Jackson Hewitt, and other tax preparation places are simply dead in the water.

title: INTUIT HAS BACKED DOWN.
content: Intuit announced a few days ago that it is backing down, has made a free upgrade to add back the missing features from within the software and promises to include the missing features next year. Can anyone confirm? I haven't bought the software yet.

title: Turbo Tax still the best
content: I purchased Turbo Tax Deluxe yesterday, download from Amazon as I have for the past 10 years. The software is the best way to do your taxes, period, Intuit made a mistake removing schedule D from Deluxe, period. However, if your goal is to use the best product to complete your taxes buy Deluxe ,call the Intuit team number 800-445-1875. Takes less than 5 minutes for them to ensure that you are happy and able to do all the things you want Deluxe to do with no extra charge. Their staff is well trained and determined to satisfy. If you call ,I assure you will be happy. I am . Takes only a few minutes ,no extra charge ,no hassle. The only thing you have to lose is struggling through tax preparation with new software. Joe

title: Free, if you call...
content: My review isn't necessarily based on the software as I haven't used it yet, however, it is based on Intuit Support. In previous years, the Deluxe version had minimal functionality for Schedule C, D, and E use. I sell a little stock every year, so I need this functionality. For 2014, that functionality was removed from their Deductions & Homeowners/Deluxe version - the equivalent to Deluxe in years past. To verify that I would have to spend over twice as much on the Investments & Rental Property/Premier version, I called their customer support, 800-445-1875. I spoke with a wonderful representative named John, who confirmed I would need the Premier version. He then offered to send me a free version of the Premier software. For this, I can't be more satisfied. Thank you, Intuit.

title: Intuit was helpful because they recognized that they changed from ...
content: Intuit was helpful because they recognized that they changed from versions being optional to versions being required for specific situations by providing a free upgrade; however, I want to see how this similar situation is handled for next year i.e. 2015. They need to be more explicit concerning the necessity of specific versions i.e Deluxe versus Premier

title: Keep a perspective!
content: I am sure that all of this (see other posts) controversy has been instructive to Intuit. They have removed functionality before to improve profitability, but I do not remember this level of push back. Also, I am sure that Intuit's business decision will become a case study at the Northwestern Kellogg School of Management and other MBA programs around the country. Realistically the cost difference between the Deluxe and Premium versions is about $30. I am a long time Turbotax user, and I find the products to be excellent. I have not used H & R Block's software, but I cannot believe it, or any other software, is better than TT. All of my depreciation schedules are held in TT as well as my assets. I will not punish myself by changing software and, perhaps, needing to re-enter data. Intuit is working to accommodate its long time customers and so it is doing its best to remedy what was a bad marketing decision. I have purchased TT for Business as I do every year for my corporation and fiduciary tax returns. The 2014 versions of TT Premier and TT for Business have flawlessly transferred my data from last year and I will move ahead with my work.

title: Turbo Tax Software
content: Me and others in my family have been using Turbo tax for many many years and we are satisfied with their products. It is very user friendly and has several support features to make it even easier to use for complex tax situation like ours. I will recommend them to my friends.

title: Works great for simple and itemized filings
content: I ordered the Deluxe edition. I don't have super complicated filing, but I do own a house and have education / work expenses to deduct. TurboTax was quick and easy. If you don't have overly complex tax needs, this is a perfectly fine option.

title: Loyal Customer

If you read the description here, or on their website, you'll know exactly which forms are supported and which forms are not. My only issue (from last year and assuming it's the same this year) is that they charge you to file taxes in two or more states. So I'd really rate this a 4 out of 5 but wanted to make up for the reading comprehension skills of so many reviewers.

title: No better way to file taxes!
content: I have used Turbo Tax for 10 years or more and I love it. It transfers your information from year to year, saving a lot of time since you don't have to enter all your basic information over and over. So easy to use that if you can read, you can file taxes! I was thrilled this year that I got a discount with my Amazon Prime membership! Much to my surprise the disk works for both Mac and Windows without any additional cost.

title: I suspect this software will be an excellent choice.
content: I read the reviews. People are upset because intuit has decided to actually charge people for the services they are using. Make sure you buy the version appropriate for your needs. If you own a business, or need to file forms typical for a business, but the business version. if you buy and sell stocks, you will need the premier version. Apparently this was not the case in previous years. For those willing to pay for the services what they use it for, I suspect this software will be an excellent choice.

title: DON'T PANIC
content: DON'T PANIC!!!!!!! I bought TurboTax Deluxe Deductions & Homeowners today expecting to file Schedule C as a small business owner as in past years. However, because this year some of the functionality for Schedule C had been disabled, the software advised me that I had to upgrade to TurboTax Deluxe Personal and Small Business to complete Schedule C at an increased cost. Instead of clicking on the link for the upgrade, I telephoned Intuit customer service at the 800-445-1875 per VP Bob Meighan's advice on Amazon in response to many one star review comments. I advised that I had purchased the software as a returning customer from past years and was disappointed that this year's Deluxe version did not perform similar to the previous versions as expected. I also complained about Intuit's poor marketing of TurboTax Deluxe this year and the disabling of key functions which was totally unexpected. The agent agreed and said he would fix the problem for me. The agent walked me through the steps to upgrade to the TurboTax Deluxe Personal and Small Business software online at no extra charge. I was then able to enjoy the same functionality I always had in past years and completed Schedule C with no problems. I agree that it was an extra hassle for me to call customer service but because Intuit fixed the problem with no grief from them I gave them five stars. They would have received one star had they not fixed the problem for me. I'm just glad I didn't find this out on April 14th.

title: ... been using this product for over 6 years and love it. Very easy to use

title: ... Turbo Tax for 20 years now and was initially disappointed to see that the support for schedule D has ...
content: I have been using Turbo Tax for 20 years now and was initially disappointed to see that the support for schedule D has been removed from Deluxe. However Intuit's willingness to provide an upgrade this year has made it right for me. Next year we'll see what the price is and how it compares to competitors but they kept me as a customer, and I think they have a premium product which I am willing to pay a premium for. My only lingering issue is the complexity of ordering. You may buy a CD or a download or do it online in one of five different version some of which include a state and some of which do not include a state depending on the retail channel you use. It's pretty confusing.

title: Great tax software.

However, if you have any unusual things like losses, farming, equipment depreciation and so forth, you might want to see a pro. Otherwise, TurboTax will do the job nicely.

Don't be scared of all the negative reviews, the people who posted them should probably have read the description of the item prior to purchasing it. title: Changes don't affect all Deluxe users...still a great homeowner option
content: Been using TurboTax for years now, and yes they did change some features this year. If you are a small business or independent contractor...you've been gifted years of functionality with this deluxe version that shouldn't have been available in my opinion. If you are running a business, you should have bought the business edition. Deluxe should be (and now is) for homeowners that are going to have more than just the standard 1040EZ filing. Boo hoo...you have to pay more to get your taxes done. $100 instead of $50, big increase. How about everyone try and see how much it would cost to have an accountant prepare your taxes for you...you'd be begging for a $100 option. Homeowners, do not be scared off by the bad reviews. This is still the same product you've been using. The changes don't affect the functionality you have been using for years now.
